Text

BOOK I. THE OLD ORDER . Prima che incontro alla festosa fronte I lugubri suoi lampi il ver baleni . 1.1 . It was very still in [the small neglected chapel]564-the small neglected chapel . The noises of [the farm]565-the farm came faintly through closed doors -- voices shouting at the oxen in [the lower fields]566-the lower fields , the querulous bark of [the old house]567-the old house - dog , and [Filomena]229-filomena 's angry calls to [the little white - faced foundling in [the kitchen]569-the kitchen]568-the little white - faced foundling in the kitchen . The February day was closing , and a ray of sunshine , slanting through a slit in the chapel wall , brought out the vision of a pale haloed head floating against the dusky background of [the chancel]570-the chancel like a water - lily on its leaf . The face was that of [the saint of [Assisi]1-assisi]571-the saint of assisi -- a sunken ravaged countenance , lit with an ecstasy of suffering that seemed not so much to reflect the anguish of [the Christ at whose feet]572-the christ at whose feet [the saint]573-the saint knelt , as the mute pain of [all poor down - trodden folk on [earth]575-earth]574-all poor down - trodden folk on earth . When [the small Odo Valsecca]576-the small odo valsecca -- [the only frequenter of [the chapel]578-the chapel]577-the only frequenter of the chapel -- had been taunted by [[the farmer]579-the farmer 's wife]580-the farmer 's wife for being [a beggar 's brat]581-a beggar 's brat , or when [his]576-the small odo valsecca ears were tingling from the heavy hand of [[the farmer]579-the farmer 's son]583-the farmer 's son , [he]576-the small odo valsecca found a melancholy kinship in that suffering face ; but since [he]576-the small odo valsecca had fighting blood in [him]576-the small odo valsecca too , coming on [the mother]584-the mother 's side of the rude Piedmontese stock of [the Marquesses di Donnaz]230-the marquesses di donnaz , there were other moods when [he]576-the small odo valsecca turned instead to [the stout Saint George in gold armour]585-the stout saint george in gold armour , just discernible through the grime and dust of the opposite wall . [The chapel of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]586-the chapel of pontesordo was indeed as wonderful a storybook as fate ever unrolled before the eyes of [a neglected and solitary child]587-a neglected and solitary child . For a hundred years or more [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo , [a fortified manor of [the Dukes of Pianura]589-the dukes of pianura]588-a fortified manor of the dukes of pianura , had been used as [a farmhouse]590-a farmhouse ; and [the chapel]578-the chapel was never opened save when , on Easter Sunday , [a priest]592-a priest came from [the town]593-the town to say mass . At other times [it]578-the chapel stood abandoned , cobwebs curtaining the narrow windows , farm tools leaning against the walls , and the dust deep on the sea - gods and acanthus volutes of the altar . [The manor of Pontesordo]594-the manor of pontesordo was very old . [The country people]595-the country people said that [the great warlock [Virgil]231-virgil , whose dwelling - place was at [Mantua]3-mantua]596-the great warlock virgil , whose dwelling - place was at mantua , had once shut [himself]231-virgil up for a year in [the topmost chamber of [the keep]598-the keep]597-the topmost chamber of the keep , engaged in unholy researches ; and another legend related that [Alda]232-alda , wife of [an early lord of [Pianura]4-pianura]599-an early lord of pianura , had thrown [herself]232-alda from [its]598-the keep battlements to escape the pursuit of [the terrible Ezzelino]233-the terrible ezzelino . [The chapel]578-the chapel adjoined [this keep]601-this keep , and [Filomena]229-filomena , [[the farmer]579-the farmer 's wife]580-the farmer 's wife , told [Odo]234-odo that [it]578-the chapel was even older than [the tower]604-the tower and that the walls had been painted by [early martyrs who had concealed [themselves]605-early martyrs who had concealed themselves there from the persecutions of the pagan emperors [there]606-there from the persecutions of [the pagan emperors]607-the pagan emperors]605-early martyrs who had concealed themselves there from the persecutions of the pagan emperors . On such questions [a child of]608-a child of [Odo]234-odo 's age could obviously have no pronounced opinion , the less so as [Filomena]229-filomena 's facts varied according to the seasons or [her]229-filomena mood , so that on a day of east wind or when the worms were not hatching well , [she]229-filomena had been known to affirm that [the pagans]609-the pagans had painted [the chapel]578-the chapel under [Virgil]231-virgil 's instruction , to commemorate [the Christians [they]609-the pagans had tortured]611-the christians they had tortured . In spite of the distance to which these conflicting statements seemed to relegate [them]612-them , [Odo]234-odo somehow felt as though [these pale strange people]613-these pale strange people -- youths with ardent faces under [their]613-these pale strange people small round caps , damsels with wheat - coloured hair and [boys no bigger than [himself]234-odo , holding spotted dogs in leash -- were younger and nearer to [him]234-odo than [the dwellers on [the farm]565-the farm]615-the dwellers on the farm]614-boys no bigger than himself , holding spotted dogs in leash -- were younger and nearer to him than the dwellers on the farm : [Jacopone]235-jacopone [the farmer]579-the farmer , [the shrill Filomena]229-filomena , who was [[Odo]234-odo 's foster - mother]618-odo 's foster - mother , [the hulking bully [[their]620-their son]621-their son and [the abate who once a week came out from [Pianura]4-pianura to give [Odo]234-odo religious instruction and who dismissed [his]234-odo questions with the invariable exhortation not to pry into matters that were beyond [his]234-odo years]622-the abate who once a week came out from pianura to give odo religious instruction and who dismissed his questions with the invariable exhortation not to pry into matters that were beyond his years . [Odo]234-odo had loved the pictures in [the chapel]578-the chapel all the better since [the abate]624-the abate , with a shrug , had told [him]234-odo they were nothing but old rubbish , the work of [the barbarians]625-the barbarians . Life at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]619-the hulking bully their son and the abate who once a week came out from pianura to give odo religious instruction and who dismissed his questions with the invariable exhortation not to pry into matters that were beyond his years . odo had loved the pictures in the chapel all the better since the abate , with a shrug , had told him they were nothing but old rubbish , the work of the barbarians . life at pontesordo was in truth not very pleasant for [an ardent and sensitive little boy of nine , whose remote connection with the reigning line of [Pianura]236-pianura]626-an ardent and sensitive little boy of nine , whose remote connection with the reigning line of pianura did not preserve [him]626-an ardent and sensitive little boy of nine , whose remote connection with the reigning line of pianura from wearing torn clothes and eating black bread and beans out of an earthen bowl on the [kitchen doorstep]627-kitchen doorstep . " Go ask [[your]234-odo mother]8087-your mother for new clothes ! "[229-filomena] [Filomena]229-filomena would snap at [him]234-odo , when [his]234-odo toes came through [his]234-odo shoes and the rents in [his]234-odo jacket - sleeves had spread beyond darning . " These [you]234-odo are wearing are [my]628-my [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo 's , as [you]234-odo well know , and every rag on [your]234-odo back is [mine]628-my , if there were any law for [poor folk]8088-poor folk , for not a copper of pay for [your]234-odo keep or a stitch of clothing for [your]234-odo body have [we]8089-we had these two years come [Assumption--]238-assumption-- . What 's that ? [You]234-odo ca n't ask [[your]234-odo mother]8087-your mother , [you]234-odo say , because [she]8087-your mother never comes [here]8091-here ? True enough -- [fine ladies]8092-fine ladies let [[their]8092-fine ladies brats]8093-their brats live in cow - dung , but [they]8092-fine ladies must have Indian carpets under [their]8092-fine ladies own feet . Well , ask [the abate]624-the abate , then -- [he]624-the abate has lace ruffles to [his]624-the abate coat and [a naked woman]8095-a naked woman painted on [his]624-the abate snuff box -- What ? [He]624-the abate only holds [his]624-the abate hands up when [you]234-odo ask ? Well , then , go ask [[your]234-odo friends]8096-your friends on [the chapel]578-the chapel - walls -- maybe [they]8096-your friends 'll give [you]234-odo a pair of shoes -- though [Saint Francis]239-saint francis , for that matter , was [the father of [the discalced]8099-the discalced]8098-the father of the discalced , and would doubtless tell [you]234-odo to go without ! "[628-my] And [she]628-my would add with a coarse laugh : " Do n't [you]234-odo know that [the discalced]8099-the discalced are shod with gold ? "[628-my] It was after such a scene that [the beggar - noble]629-the beggar - noble , as [they]630-they called [him]629-the beggar - noble at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo , would steal away to [the chapel]578-the chapel and , seating [himself]629-the beggar - noble on an upturned basket or a heap of pumpkins , gaze long into the face of [the mournful saint]632-the mournful saint . There was nothing unusual in [[Odo]234-odo 's lot]633-odo 's lot . It was that of [many children in the eighteenth century]634-many children in the eighteenth century , especially [those whose [parents]636-parents]635-those whose parents were [cadets of [noble houses]638-noble houses , with an appanage barely sufficient to keep [[their]636-parents wives]639-their wives and [themselves]636-parents in court finery , much less to pay [their]636-parents debts and clothe and educate [[their]636-parents children]640-their children]637-cadets of noble houses , with an appanage barely sufficient to keep their wives and themselves in court finery , much less to pay their debts and clothe and educate their children . All over [Italy]5-italy at that moment , had [Odo Valsecca]234-odo but known it , were [lads whose ancestors , like [his]234-odo own]641-lads whose ancestors , like his own , had been [dukes]642-dukes and [crusaders]643-crusaders , but who , none the less , were faring , as [he]234-odo fared , on black bread and hard blows , and the half - comprehended taunts of [unpaid foster - parents]644-unpaid foster - parents . Many , doubtless , there were who cared little enough , as long as [they]634-many children in the eighteenth century might play morro with [[the farmer]579-the farmer 's lads]646-the farmer 's lads and ride [the colt]647-the colt bare - back through [the pasture]648-the pasture and go bird - netting and frog - hunting with [the village children]649-the village children ; but [some perhaps]650-some perhaps , like [Odo]234-odo , suffered in a dumb animal way , without understanding why life was so hard on [little boys]651-little boys . [Odo]234-odo , for [his]234-odo part , had small taste for the sports in which [Gianozzo]240-gianozzo and [the village lads]652-the village lads took pleasure . [He]234-odo shrank from any amusement associated with the frightening or hurting of animals , and [his]234-odo bosom swelled with [the fine gentleman]653-the fine gentleman 's scorn of [the clowns who got [their]654-the clowns who got their fun in so coarse a way fun in so coarse a way]654-the clowns who got their fun in so coarse a way . Now and then [he]234-odo found a moment 's glee in a sharp tussle with one of [the younger children who had been tormenting a frog or a beetle]655-the younger children who had been tormenting a frog or a beetle ; but [he]234-odo was still too young for real fighting , and could only hang on the outskirts when [the bigger boys]656-the bigger boys closed , and think how some day [he]234-odo would be at [them]656-the bigger boys and break [their]656-the bigger boys lubberly heads . There were thus many hours when [he]234-odo turned to the silent consolations of [the chapel]578-the chapel . So familiar had [he]234-odo grown with the images on [its]578-the chapel walls that [he]234-odo had a name for every one : [the King]658-the king , [the Knight]659-the knight , [the Lady]660-the lady , [the children]661-the children with guinea - pigs , basilisks and leopards , and lastly [the Friend]662-the friend , as [he]234-odo called [Saint Francis]239-saint francis . [An almond - faced lady on a white palfrey with gold trappings]663-an almond - faced lady on a white palfrey with gold trappings represented [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother , whom [he]234-odo had seen too seldom for any distinct image to interfere with the illusion ; [a knight in damascened armour and scarlet cloak]665-a knight in damascened armour and scarlet cloak was [the valiant captain]666-the valiant captain , [[his]234-odo father]667-his father , who held a commission in [the ducal army]668-the ducal army ; and [a proud young man in diadem and ermine , attended by a retinue of pages]669-a proud young man in diadem and ermine , attended by a retinue of pages , stood for [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin , [the reigning Duke of [Pianura]4-pianura]671-the reigning duke of pianura . A mist , as usual at that hour , was rising from [the marshes between [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo and [Pianura]4-pianura]672-the marshes between pontesordo and pianura , and the light soon ebbed from [the saint]573-the saint 's face , leaving [the chapel]578-the chapel in obscurity . [Odo]234-odo had crept [there]606-there that afternoon with a keener sense than usual of the fact that life was hard on [little boys]651-little boys ; and though [he]234-odo was cold and hungry and half afraid , the solitude in which [he]234-odo cowered seemed more endurable than [the noisy kitchen]677-the noisy kitchen where , at that hour , [the farm hands]678-the farm hands were gathering for [their]678-the farm hands polenta , and [Filomena]229-filomena was screaming at [the frightened orphan who carried the dishes to the table]679-the frightened orphan who carried the dishes to the table . [He]234-odo knew , of course , that life at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo would not last for ever -- that in time [he]234-odo would grow up and be mysteriously transformed into [a young gentleman with a sword and laced coat]680-a young gentleman with a sword and laced coat , who would go to court and perhaps be [an officer in [[the Duke]682-the duke 's army]683-the duke 's army or in that of [some neighbouring prince]684-some neighbouring prince]681-an officer in the duke 's army or in that of some neighbouring prince ; but , viewed from the lowliness of [his]234-odo nine years , that dazzling prospect was too remote to yield much solace for the cuffs and sneers , the ragged shoes and sour bread of the present . The fog outside had thickened , and the face of [[Odo]234-odo 's friend]685-odo 's friend was now discernible only as a spot of pallor in the surrounding dimness . Even [he]685-odo 's friend seemed farther away than usual , withdrawn into the fog as into that mist of indifference which lay all about [Odo]234-odo 's hot and eager spirit . [The child]686-the child sat down among the gourds and medlars on the muddy floor and hid [his]686-the child face against [his]686-the child knees . [He]686-the child had sat there a long time when the noise of wheels and the crack of a postillion 's whip roused the dogs chained in [the stable]687-the stable . [Odo]234-odo 's heart began to beat . What could the sounds mean ? It was as though the flood - tide of the unknown were rising about [him]234-odo and bursting open the chapel door to pour in on [his]234-odo loneliness . It was , in fact , [Filomena]229-filomena who opened the door , crying out to [him]234-odo in an odd Easter Sunday voice , the voice [she]229-filomena used when [she]229-filomena had on [her]229-filomena silk neckerchief and gold chain or when [she]229-filomena was talking to [the bailiff]688-the bailiff . [Odo]234-odo sprang up and hid [his]234-odo face in [her]229-filomena lap . [She]229-filomena seemed , of a sudden , nearer to [him]234-odo than [any one else]689-any one else -- a last barrier between [himself]234-odo and the mystery that awaited [him]234-odo outside . " Come , [you]234-odo poor sparrow , "[229-filomena] [she]229-filomena said , dragging [him]234-odo across the threshold of [the chapel]578-the chapel , " [the abate]624-the abate is here asking for [you]234-odo ; "[229-filomena] and [she]229-filomena crossed [herself]229-filomena , as though [she]229-filomena had named [a saint]691-a saint . [Odo]234-odo pulled away from [her]229-filomena with a last wistful glance at [Saint Francis]239-saint francis , who looked back at [him]234-odo in an ecstasy of commiseration . " Come , come , "[229-filomena] [Filomena]229-filomena repeated , dropping to [her]229-filomena ordinary key as [she]229-filomena felt the resistance of [the little boy]692-the little boy 's hand . " Have [you]234-odo no heart , [[you]234-odo wicked child]8102-you wicked child ? But , to be sure , [the poor innocent]8103-the poor innocent does n't know ! Come cavaliere , [[your]234-odo illustrious mother]8104-your illustrious mother waits . "[229-filomena] " [[My]229-filomena mother]8105-my mother ? "[229-filomena] The blood rushed to [his]234-odo face ; and [she]229-filomena had called [him]234-odo " [cavaliere "]8106-cavaliere "[229-filomena] ! " Not here , [[my]229-filomena poor lamb]8107-my poor lamb ! [The abate]624-the abate is here ; do n't [you]234-odo see the lights of [the carriage]8109-the carriage ? There , there , go to [him]692-the little boy . [I]229-filomena have n't told [him]692-the little boy , [your]234-odo reverence ; it 's [my]229-filomena silly tender - heartedness that wo n't let [me]229-filomena . [He]692-the little boy 's always been like one of [[my]229-filomena own creatures]8110-my own creatures to [me--]229-filomena "[229-filomena] and [she]229-filomena confounded [Odo]234-odo by bursting into tears . [The abate]624-the abate stood on the doorstep . [He]624-the abate was [a tall stout man with a hooked nose and lace ruffles]694-a tall stout man with a hooked nose and lace ruffles . [His]624-the abate nostrils were stained with snuff and [he]624-the abate took a pinch from a tortoise - shell box set with the miniature of [a lady]695-a lady ; then [he]624-the abate looked down at [Odo]234-odo and shrugged [his]624-the abate shoulders . [Odo]234-odo was growing sick with apprehension . It was two days before the appointed time for [his]234-odo weekly instruction and [he]234-odo had not prepared [his]234-odo catechism . [He]234-odo had not even thought of it -- and [the abate]624-the abate could use the cane . [Odo]234-odo stood silent and envied [girls , who are not disgraced by crying]697-girls , who are not disgraced by crying . The tears were in [his]234-odo throat , but [he]234-odo had fixed principles about crying . It was [his]234-odo opinion that [a little boy who was a cavaliere]698-a little boy who was a cavaliere might weep when [he]698-a little boy who was a cavaliere was angry or sorry , but never when [he]698-a little boy who was a cavaliere was afraid ; so [he]234-odo held [his]234-odo head high and put [his]234-odo hand to [his]234-odo side , as though to rest it on [his]234-odo sword . [The abate]624-the abate sneezed and tapped [his]624-the abate snuff - box . " Come , come , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , [you]8111-cavaliere must be brave -- [you]8111-cavaliere must be [a man]8112-a man ; [you]8111-cavaliere have duties , [you]8111-cavaliere have responsibilities . It 's [your]8111-cavaliere duty to console [[your]8111-cavaliere mother]8087-your mother -- [the poor lady]8114-the poor lady is plunged in despair . Eh ? What 's that ? [You]8111-cavaliere have n't told [him]700-the father in damascened armour ? [Cavaliere]234-odo , [[your]8111-cavaliere illustrious father]8115-your illustrious father is no more . "[624-the abate] [Odo]234-odo stared a moment without understanding ; then [his]234-odo grief burst from [him]234-odo in a great sob , and [he]234-odo hid [himself]234-odo against [Filomena]229-filomena 's apron , weeping for [the father in damascened armour]700-the father in damascened armour and scarlet cloak . " Come , come , "[624-the abate] said [the abate]624-the abate impatiently . " Is supper laid ? for [we]8116-we must be gone as soon as the mist rises . "[624-the abate] [He]624-the abate took [the little boy]692-the little boy by the hand . " Would it not distract [your]692-the little boy mind to recite the catechism ? "[624-the abate] [he]624-the abate inquired . " No , no ! "[234-odo] cried [Odo]234-odo with redoubled sobs . " Well , then , as [you]229-filomena will . What [a madman]8117-a madman ! "[624-the abate] [he]624-the abate exclaimed to [Filomena]229-filomena . " [I]624-the abate warrant it has n't seen [[its]8117-a madman father]8118-its father three times in [its]8117-a madman life . Come in , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere ; come to supper . "[624-the abate] [Filomena]229-filomena had laid a table in [the stone chamber known as [[the bailiff]688-the bailiff 's parlour]705-the bailiff 's parlour]703-the stone chamber known as the bailiff 's parlour , and thither the abate dragged [his]624-the abate charge and set [him]692-the little boy down before the coarse tablecloth covered with earthen platters . A tallow dip threw its flare on [the abate]624-the abate 's big aquiline face as [he]624-the abate sat opposite [Odo]234-odo , gulping the hastily prepared frittura and the thick purple wine in its wicker flask . [Odo]234-odo could eat nothing . The tears still ran down [his]234-odo cheeks and [his]234-odo whole soul was possessed by the longing to steal back and see whether the figure of [the knight in the scarlet cloak]707-the knight in the scarlet cloak had vanished from the chapel wall . [The abate]624-the abate sat in silence , gobbling [his]624-the abate food like the old black pig in [the yard]709-the yard . When [he]624-the abate had finished [he]624-the abate stood up , exclaiming : " Death comes to [us]8120-us all , as [the hawk]8121-the hawk said to [the chicken]8122-the chicken . [You]234-odo must be [a man]8112-a man , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere . "[624-the abate] Then [he]624-the abate stepped into [the kitchen]569-the kitchen , and called out for the horses to be put to . [The farm hands]678-the farm hands had slunk away to [one of [the outhouses]713-the outhouses]712-one of the outhouses , and [Filomena]229-filomena and [Jacopone]235-jacopone stood bowing and curtseying as [the carriage]8109-the carriage drew up at the kitchen door . In a corner of [the big vaulted room]715-the big vaulted room [the little foundling]716-the little foundling was washing the dishes , heaping the scraps in a bowl for [herself]716-the little foundling and the fowls . [Odo]234-odo ran back and touched [her]716-the little foundling arm . [She]716-the little foundling gave a start and looked at [him]234-odo with frightened eyes . [He]234-odo had nothing to give [her]716-the little foundling , but [he]234-odo said : " Good - bye , [Momola]241-momola "[234-odo] ; and [he]234-odo thought to [himself]234-odo that when [he]234-odo was grown up and had a sword [he]234-odo would surely come back and bring [her]716-the little foundling a pair of shoes and a panettone . The abate was calling [him]234-odo , and the next moment [he]234-odo found [himself]234-odo lifted into [the carriage]8109-the carriage , amid the blessings and lamentations of [[his]234-odo foster - parents]718-his foster - parents ; and with a great baying of dogs and clacking of whipcord the horses clattered out of [the farmyard]719-the farmyard , and turned [their]720-their heads toward [Pianura]4-pianura . The mist had rolled back and [fields]721-fields and [vineyards]722-vineyards lay bare to the winter moon . [The way]723-the way was lonely , for [it]723-the way skirted [the marsh]724-the marsh , where [no one]725-no one lived ; and only here and there the tall black shadow of a crucifix ate into the whiteness of [the road]726-the road . Shreds of vapour still hung about [the hollows]727-the hollows , but beyond these fold on [fold of translucent hills]728-fold of translucent hills melted into a sky dewy with stars . [Odo]234-odo cowered in [his]234-odo corner , staring out awestruck at the unrolling of the strange white landscape . [He]234-odo had seldom been out at night , and never in [a carriage]729-a carriage ; and there was something terrifying to [him]234-odo in this flight through [the silent moon - washed fields]730-the silent moon - washed fields , where [no oxen]731-no oxen moved in the furrows , [no peasants]732-no peasants pruned the mulberries , and not a goat 's bell tinkled among the oaks . [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo alone in a ghostly world from which even the animals had vanished , and at last [he]234-odo averted [his]234-odo eyes from the dreadful scene and sat watching the abate , who had fixed a reading - lamp at [his]234-odo back , and whose hooked - nosed shadow , as the springs jolted [him]234-odo up and down , danced overhead like the huge Pulcinella at [the fair of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]733-the fair of pontesordo . 1.2 . The gleam of a lantern woke [Odo]234-odo . The horses had stopped at [the gates of [Pianura]4-pianura]734-the gates of pianura , and [the abate]624-the abate giving the pass - word , [the carriage]8109-the carriage rolled under [the gatehouse]737-the gatehouse and continued its way over the loud cobble - stones of [the ducal streets]738-the ducal streets . [These streets]739-these streets were so dark , being lit but by some lantern projecting here and there from the angle of a wall , or by the flare of an oil - lamp under a shrine , that [Odo]234-odo , leaning eagerly out , could only now and then catch [a sculptured palace]740-a sculptured palace - window , the grinning mask on the keystone of an archway , or the gleaming yellowish facade of [a church inlaid with marbles]741-a church inlaid with marbles . Once or twice an uncurtained window showed a group of [men drinking about a wineshop table]742-men drinking about a wineshop table , or [an artisan]743-an artisan bending over [his]743-an artisan work by the light of a tallow dip ; but for the most part doors and windows were barred and [the streets]744-the streets disturbed only by [the watchman]745-the watchman 's cry or by a flash of light and noise as [a sedan chair]746-a sedan chair passed with its escort of [linkmen]747-linkmen and [servants]748-servants . All this was amazing enough to the sleepy eyes of [the little boy]692-the little boy so unexpectedly translated from the solitude of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo ; but when [the carriage]8109-the carriage turned under another arch and drew up before the doorway of [a great building ablaze with lights]751-a great building ablaze with lights , the pressure of accumulated emotions made [him]692-the little boy fling [his]692-the little boy arms about [[his]692-the little boy preceptor]752-his preceptor 's neck . " Courage , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , courage ! [You]692-the little boy have duties , [you]692-the little boy have responsibilities , "[624-the abate] [the abate]624-the abate admonished [him]692-the little boy ; and [Odo]234-odo , choking back [his]234-odo fright , suffered [himself]234-odo to be lifted out by one of the lacqueys grouped about the door . [The abate , who carried a much lower crest than at]754-the abate , who carried a much lower crest than at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo , and seemed far more anxious to please [the servants]755-the servants than [they]755-the servants to oblige [him]754-the abate , who carried a much lower crest than at , led the way up a shining marble staircase where [beggars]756-beggars whined on [the landings]757-the landings and [powdered footmen in the ducal livery]758-powdered footmen in the ducal livery were running to and fro with trays of refreshments . [Odo]234-odo , who knew that [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother lived in [[the Duke]682-the duke 's palace]761-the duke 's palace , had vaguely imagined that [[his]234-odo father]667-his father 's death must have plunged [its]761-the duke 's palace huge precincts into silence and mourning ; but as [he]234-odo followed [the abate]624-the abate up [successive flights of stairs]764-successive flights of stairs and down [long corridors full of shadow]765-long corridors full of shadow [he]234-odo heard a sound of dance music below and caught the flash of girandoles through the antechamber doors . The thought that [[his]234-odo father]667-his father 's death had made no difference to [any one in [the palace]768-the palace]767-any one in the palace was to [the child]686-the child so much more astonishing than any of the other impressions crowding [his]234-odo brain , that these were scarcely felt , and [he]234-odo passed as in a dream through rooms where [servants]748-servants were quarrelling over cards and waiting - [women]771-women rummaged in wardrobes full of perfumed finery , to [a bedchamber in which [a lady dressed in weeds]773-a lady dressed in weeds sat disconsolately at supper]772-a bedchamber in which a lady dressed in weeds sat disconsolately at supper . " [Mamma]242-mamma ! [Mamma]242-mamma ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , springing forward in a passion of tears . [The lady]660-the lady , who was young , pale and handsome , pushed back [her]660-the lady chair with a warning hand . " [Child]8126-child , "[660-the lady] [she]660-the lady exclaimed , " [your]8126-child shoes are covered with mud ; and , good heavens , how [you]8126-child smell of [the stable]687-the stable ! "[660-the lady] " [Madam]8129-madam , [I]243-donna laura am abashed by [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere 's temerity . But in truth [I]243-donna laura believe excessive grief has clouded [his]692-the little boy wits--'tis inconceivable how [he]692-the little boy mourns [[his]692-the little boy father]667-his father ! "[243-donna laura] [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's eyebrows rose in a faint smile . " May [he]692-the little boy never have worse to grieve for ! "[243-donna laura] said [she]243-donna laura in French ; then , extending [her]243-donna laura scented hand to [the little boy]692-the little boy , [she]243-donna laura added solemnly : " [[My]243-donna laura son]8132-my son , [we]8133-we have suffered an irreparable loss . "[243-donna laura] [Odo]234-odo , abashed by [her]243-donna laura rebuke and the abate 's apology , had drawn [his]234-odo heels together in a rustic version of the low bow with which [the children of that day]776-the children of that day were taught to approach [[their]776-the children of that day parents]777-their parents . " [Holy Virgin]244-holy virgin ! "[664-his mother] said [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother with a laugh , " [I]664-his mother perceive [they]777-their parents have [no dancing - master at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]8134-no dancing - master at pontesordo . "[664-his mother] [She]664-his mother put [the child]686-the child aside and turned to [the preceptor]780-the preceptor . " [The Duke]682-the duke refuses to pay , "[664-his mother] [she]664-his mother said with a shrug of despair . " Good heavens ! "[624-the abate] lamented [the abate]624-the abate , raising [his]624-the abate hands . " And [Don Lelio]245-don lelio ? "[624-the abate] [he]624-the abate faltered . [She]664-his mother shrugged again , impatiently . " As great a gambler as [[my]664-his mother husband]8140-my husband . [They]8141-they 're all alike , [abate]8142-abate : six times since last [Easter]246-easter has the bill been sent to [me]664-his mother for that trifle of a turquoise buckle [he]682-the duke made such a to - do about giving [me]664-his mother . "[664-his mother] [She]664-his mother rose and began to pace [the room]782-the room in disorder . " [I]664-his mother 'm [a ruined woman]8143-a ruined woman , "[664-his mother] [she]664-his mother cried , " and it 's a disgrace for [the Duke]682-the duke to refuse [me]664-his mother . "[664-his mother] [The abate]624-the abate raised an admonishing finger . " Excellency ... excellency ... "[624-the abate] [She]664-his mother glanced over [her]664-his mother shoulder . " Eh ? [You]8142-abate 're right . Everything is heard here . But who 's to pay for [my]784-my mourning [the saints alone]8145-the saints alone know ! [I]784-my sent an express this morning to [[my]784-my father]8146-my father , but [you]8142-abate know [[my]784-my brothers]8147-my brothers bleed [him]8146-my father like leeches . [I]784-my could have got this easily enough from [the Duke]682-the duke a year ago -- it 's [his]682-the duke marriage has made [him]682-the duke so stiff . [That little white - faced fool]8149-that little white - faced fool -- [she]8149-that little white - faced fool hates [me]784-my because [Lelio]245-don lelio wo n't look at [her]8149-that little white - faced fool , and [she]8149-that little white - faced fool thinks it 's [my]784-my fault . As if [I]784-my cared whom [he]682-the duke looks at ! Sometimes [I]784-my think [he]682-the duke has money put away ... all [I]784-my want is two hundred ducats ... [a woman of [my]784-my rank]8150-a woman of my rank ! "[784-my] [She]784-my turned suddenly on [Odo]234-odo , who stood , very small and frightened , in the corner to which [she]784-my had pushed [him]234-odo . " What are [you]234-odo staring at , [child]8126-child ? Eh ! the monkey is dropping with sleep . Look at [his]682-the duke eyes , [abate]8142-abate ! Here , [Vanna]247-vanna , [Tonina]248-tonina , to bed with [him]682-the duke ; [he]682-the duke may sleep with [you]234-odo in [[my]785-my dressing - closet]8153-my dressing - closet , [Tonina]248-tonina . Go with [her]682-the duke , [child]8126-child , go ; but for [God]249-god 's sake wake [him]682-the duke if [he]682-the duke snores . [I]785-my 'm too ill to have [my]785-my rest disturbed . "[785-my] And [she]785-my lifted a pomander to [her]785-my nostrils . The next few days dwelt in [Odo]234-odo 's memory as a blur of strange sights and sounds . The super - acute state of [his]234-odo perceptions was succeeded after a night 's sleep by the natural passivity with which [children]786-children accept the improbable , so that [he]234-odo passed from one novel impression to another as easily and with the same exhilaration as if [he]234-odo had been listening to a fairy tale . Solitude and neglect had no surprises for [him]234-odo , and it seemed natural enough that [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother and [[her]664-his mother maids]788-her maids should be too busy to remember [his]234-odo presence . For the first day or two [he]234-odo sat unnoticed on [his]234-odo little stool in a corner of [[[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's room]790-his mother 's room , while packing - chests were dragged in , wardrobes emptied , [mantua - makers]791-mantua - makers and [milliners]792-milliners consulted , and [troublesome creditors dismissed with abuse , or even blows]793-troublesome creditors dismissed with abuse , or even blows , by [the servants lounging in the ante - chamber]794-the servants lounging in the ante - chamber . [Donna Laura]243-donna laura continued to show the liveliest symptoms of concern , but [the child]686-the child perceived [her]243-donna laura distress to be but indirectly connected with the loss [she]243-donna laura had suffered , and [he]234-odo had seen enough of poverty at [the farm]565-the farm to guess that the need of money was somehow at the bottom of [her]243-donna laura troubles . How [any one]797-any one could be in want , who slept between damask curtains and lived on sweet cakes and chocolate , it exceeded [his]234-odo fancy to conceive ; yet there were times when [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's voice had the same frightened angry sound as [Filomena]229-filomena 's on the days when [the bailiff]688-the bailiff went over the accounts at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . [[Her]664-his mother excellency 's rooms]800-her excellency 's rooms , during these days , were always crowded , for besides [the dressmakers]801-the dressmakers and [other merchants]802-other merchants there was [the hairdresser]803-the hairdresser , or [French Monsu]250-french monsu -- [a loud , important figure , with a bag full of cosmetics and curling - irons]804-a loud , important figure , with a bag full of cosmetics and curling - irons -- the abate , always running in and out with messages and letters , and taking no more notice of [Odo]234-odo than if [he]234-odo had never seen [him]234-odo , and a succession of [ladies brimming with condolences]805-ladies brimming with condolences , and each followed by [a servant who swelled the noisy crowd of card - playing lacqueys in [the ante - chamber]807-the ante - chamber]806-a servant who swelled the noisy crowd of card - playing lacqueys in the ante - chamber . Through [all these figures]808-all these figures came and went another , to [Odo]234-odo the most noticeable,--that of [a handsome young man with a high manner , dressed always in black , but with an excess of lace ruffles and jewels , a clouded amber head]809-a handsome young man with a high manner , dressed always in black , but with an excess of lace ruffles and jewels , a clouded amber head to [his]234-odo cane , and red heels to [his]234-odo shoes . [This young gentleman , whose age could not have been more than twenty , and who had the coldest insolent air]810-this young gentleman , whose age could not have been more than twenty , and who had the coldest insolent air , was treated with profound respect by all but [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , who was for ever quarrelling with [him]234-odo when [he]234-odo was present , yet could not support [his]234-odo absence without lamentations and alarm . [The abate]624-the abate appeared to act as messenger between [the two]812-the two , and when [he]234-odo came to say that [the Count]813-the count rode with [the court]814-the court , or was engaged to sup with [the Prime Minister]815-the prime minister , or had business on [[[his]234-odo father]667-his father 's estate in [the country]818-the country]817-his father 's estate in the country , [the lady]660-the lady would openly yield to [her]660-the lady distress , crying out that [she]660-the lady knew well enough what [his]234-odo excuses meant : that [she]660-the lady was the most cruelly outraged of [women]771-women , and that [he]234-odo treated [her]660-the lady no better than [a husband]821-a husband . For two days [Odo]234-odo languished in [[his]234-odo corner]822-his corner , whisked by [the women]823-the women 's skirts , smothered under the hoops and falbalas which [the dressmakers]801-the dressmakers unpacked from [their]801-the dressmakers cases , fed at irregular hours , and faring on the whole no better than at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . The third morning , [Vanna]247-vanna , who seemed [the most good - natured of [the women]823-the women]825-the most good - natured of the women , cried out on [his]234-odo pale looks when [she]247-vanna brought [him]234-odo [his]234-odo cup of chocolate . " [I]247-vanna declare , "[247-vanna] [she]247-vanna exclaimed , " [the child]686-the child has had no air since [he]686-the child came in from [the farm]565-the farm . What does [[your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency say ? Shall [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback take [him]686-the child for a walk in [the gardens]8159-the gardens ? "[247-vanna] To [this [[her]247-vanna excellency]828-her excellency , who sat at [her]247-vanna toilet under [the hair - dresser]829-the hair - dresser 's hands , irritably replied that [she]247-vanna had not slept all night and was in no state to be tormented about such trifles , but that [the child]686-the child might go where [he]686-the child pleased . [Odo]234-odo , who was very weary of [[his]234-odo corner]822-his corner]827-this her excellency , who sat at her toilet under the hair - dresser 's hands , irritably replied that she had not slept all night and was in no state to be tormented about such trifles , but that the child might go where he pleased . odo , who was very weary of his corner , sprang up readily enough when [Vanna]247-vanna , at this , beckoned [him]234-odo to [the inner ante - chamber]832-the inner ante - chamber . Here , where [persons of a certain condition]833-persons of a certain condition waited ( the outer being given over to [servants]748-servants and [tradesmen]835-tradesmen ) , [they]836-they found [a lean humpbacked boy]837-a lean humpbacked boy , shabbily dressed in darned stockings and a faded coat , but with an extraordinary keen pale face that at once attracted and frightened [the child]686-the child . " There , go with [him]837-a lean humpbacked boy ; [he]837-a lean humpbacked boy wo n't eat [you]234-odo , "[247-vanna] said [Vanna]247-vanna , giving [him]234-odo a push as [she]247-vanna hurried away ; and [Odo]234-odo , trembling a little , laid [his]234-odo hand in [the boy]839-the boy 's . " Where do [you]839-the boy come from ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo faltered , looking up into [[his]234-odo companion]840-his companion 's face . [The boy]839-the boy laughed and the blood rose to [his]839-the boy high cheekbones . " I?--From [the Innocenti]8160-the innocenti , if [[your]234-odo Excellency]8157-your excellency knows where that is , "[839-the boy] said [he]839-the boy . [Odo]234-odo 's face lit up . " Of course [I]234-odo do , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , reassured . " [I]234-odo know [a girl who comes from there]8162-a girl who comes from there -- [the Momola]241-momola at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . "[234-odo] " Ah , indeed ? "[839-the boy] said [the boy]839-the boy with a queer look . " Well , [she]8162-a girl who comes from there 's [[my]839-the boy sister]8163-my sister , then . Give [her]8162-a girl who comes from there [my]839-the boy compliments when [you]234-odo see [her]8162-a girl who comes from there , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere . Oh , [we]8165-we 're [a large family]8166-a large family , [we]8165-we are ! "[839-the boy] [Odo]234-odo 's perplexity was returning . " Are [you]839-the boy really [[Momola]241-momola 's brother]8167-momola 's brother ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo asked . " Eh , in a way -- we're [children of the same house]8168-children of the same house . "[234-odo] " But [you]839-the boy live in [the palace]768-the palace , do n't [you]839-the boy ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo persisted , [his]234-odo curiosity surmounting [his]234-odo fear . " Are [you]839-the boy [a servant of [[my]234-odo mother]8105-my mother 's]8170-a servant of my mother 's ? "[234-odo] " [I]839-the boy 'm [the servant of [[your]234-odo illustrious mother 's servants]8173-your illustrious mother 's servants]8172-the servant of your illustrious mother 's servants ; [the abatino of [the waiting - women]8175-the waiting - women]8174-the abatino of the waiting - women . [I]839-the boy write [their]8173-your illustrious mother 's servants love - letters , do [you]234-odo see , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , [I]839-the boy carry [their]8173-your illustrious mother 's servants rubbish to [the pawnbroker]8177-the pawnbroker 's when [[their]8173-your illustrious mother 's servants sweethearts]8178-their sweethearts have bled [them]8173-your illustrious mother 's servants of [their]8173-your illustrious mother 's servants savings ; [I]839-the boy clean the birdcages and feed the monkeys , and do [the steward]8179-the steward 's accounts when [he]8179-the steward 's drunk , and sleep on a bench in [the portico]8180-the portico and steal [my]839-the boy food from [the pantry]8181-the pantry ... and [[my]839-the boy father]8146-my father very likely goes in velvet and carries a sword at [his]8146-my father side . "[839-the boy] [The boy]839-the boy 's voice had grown shrill , and [his]839-the boy eyes blazed like an owl 's in the dark . [Odo]234-odo would have given [the world]844-the world to be back in [his]234-odo corner , but [he]234-odo was ashamed to betray [his]234-odo lack of heart ; and to give [himself]234-odo courage [he]234-odo asked haughtily : " And what is [your]839-the boy name , [boy]8183-boy ? "[234-odo] [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback gave [him]839-the boy a gleaming look . " Call [me]8158-the hunchback [Brutus]251-brutus , "[8158-the hunchback] [he]8158-the hunchback cried , " for [Brutus]251-brutus killed [a tyrant]8184-a tyrant . "[8158-the hunchback] [He]8158-the hunchback gave [Odo]234-odo 's hand a pull . " Come along , "[8158-the hunchback] said [he]8158-the hunchback , " and [I]8158-the hunchback 'll show [you]234-odo [his]251-brutus statue in [the garden]8185-the garden -- [Brutus]251-brutus 's statue in [[a prince]8186-a prince 's garden]8187-a prince 's garden , mind [you]234-odo ! "[8158-the hunchback] And as [the little boy]692-the little boy trotted at [his]8158-the hunchback side down [the long corridors]847-the long corridors [he]692-the little boy kept repeating under [his]692-the little boy breath in a kind of angry sing - song , " For [Brutus]251-brutus killed [a tyrant]8184-a tyrant . "[692-the little boy] The sense of strangeness inspired by [[his]692-the little boy odd companion]848-his odd companion soon gave way in [Odo]234-odo 's mind to emotions of delight and wonder . [He]234-odo was , even at that age , unusually sensitive to external impressions , and when [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback , after descending many stairs and winding through endless back - passages , at length led [him]234-odo out on [a terrace above [the gardens]8159-the gardens]850-a terrace above the gardens , the beauty of the sight swelled [his]234-odo little heart to bursting . [A Duke of [Pianura]4-pianura]852-a duke of pianura had , some hundred years earlier , caused a great wing to be added to [[his]852-a duke of pianura palace]853-his palace by [the eminent architect [Carlo Borromini]252-carlo borromini]854-the eminent architect carlo borromini , and [this accomplished designer]855-this accomplished designer had at the same time replanted and enlarged [the ducal gardens]856-the ducal gardens . To [Odo]234-odo , who had never seen plantations more artful than [the vineyards and mulberry orchards about [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]857-the vineyards and mulberry orchards about pontesordo , these perspectives of clipped beech and yew , these knots of box filled in with multi - coloured sand , appeared , with the fountains , colonnades and trellised arbours surmounted by globes of glass , to represent the very pattern and Paradise of [gardens]858-gardens . It seemed indeed too beautiful to be real , and [he]234-odo trembled , as [he]234-odo sometimes did at the music of the Easter mass , when [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback , laughing at [his]234-odo amazement , led [him]234-odo down [the terrace steps]860-the terrace steps . It was [[Odo]234-odo 's lot]633-odo 's lot in after years to walk [the alleys of [many a splendid garden]863-many a splendid garden]862-the alleys of many a splendid garden , and to pace , often wearily enough , [the paths along which [he]234-odo was now led]864-the paths along which he was now led ; but never after did [he]234-odo renew the first enchanted impression of mystery and brightness that remained with [him]234-odo as the most vivid emotion of [his]234-odo childhood . Though it was February the season was so soft that the orange and lemon trees had been put out in their earthen vases before [the lemon - house]865-the lemon - house , and the beds in [the parterres]866-the parterres were full of violets , daffodils and auriculas ; but the scent of the orange - blossoms and the bright colours of the flowers moved [Odo]234-odo less than the noble ordonnance of [the pleached alleys , each terminated by a statue or a marble seat]867-the pleached alleys , each terminated by a statue or a marble seat ; and when [he]234-odo came to [the grotto]868-the grotto where , amid rearing sea - horses and [Tritons]253-tritons , a cascade poured from [the grove above]869-the grove above , [his]234-odo wonder passed into such delicious awe as hung [him]234-odo speechless on the hunchback 's hand . " Eh , "[870-the latter] said [the latter]870-the latter with a sneer , " it 's [a finer garden]8189-a finer garden than [we]8190-we have at [[our]8190-we family palace]8191-our family palace . Do [you]234-odo know what 's planted [there]606-there ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo asked , turning suddenly on [the little boy]692-the little boy . " Dead bodies , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere ! Rows and rows of [them]8194-they ; the bodies of [[my]234-odo brothers]8147-my brothers and [sisters]8196-sisters , [the Innocents who die like flies every year of the cholera and the measles and the putrid fever]8197-the innocents who die like flies every year of the cholera and the measles and the putrid fever . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo saw the terror in [Odo]234-odo 's face and added in a gentler tone : " Eh , do n't cry , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere ; [they]8194-they sleep better in those beds than in any others [they]8194-they 're like to lie on . Come , come , and [I]234-odo 'll show [[your]8111-cavaliere excellency]8157-your excellency the aviaries . "[234-odo] From [the aviaries]872-the aviaries [they]873-they passed to [the Chinese pavilion]874-the chinese pavilion , where [the Duke]682-the duke supped on summer evenings , and thence to [the bowling - alley]876-the bowling - alley , the fish - stew and [the fruit - garden]877-the fruit - garden . At every step some fresh surprise arrested [Odo]234-odo ; but the terrible vision of [that other garden]878-that other garden planted with the dead bodies of [the Innocents]879-the innocents robbed the spectacle of its brightness , dulled the plumage of the birds behind [their]873-they gilt wires and cast a deeper shade over [the beech - grove]880-the beech - grove , where figures of [goat - faced men]881-goat - faced men lurked balefully in the twilight . [Odo]234-odo was glad when [they]873-they left the blackness of [this grove]882-this grove for the open walks , where [gardeners]883-gardeners were working and [he]234-odo had the reassurance of the sky . The hunchback , who seemed sorry that [he]234-odo had frightened [him]234-odo , told [him]234-odo many curious stories about the marble images that adorned [the walks]884-the walks ; and pausing suddenly before one of [a naked man with a knife]885-a naked man with a knife in [his]885-a naked man with a knife hand , cried out in a frenzy : " This is [[my]885-a naked man with a knife namesake]8200-my namesake , [Brutus]251-brutus ! "[885-a naked man with a knife] But when [Odo]234-odo would have asked if [the naked man]886-the naked man was [a kinsman]887-a kinsman , [the boy]839-the boy hurried [him]886-the naked man on , saying only : " [You]8158-the hunchback 'll read of [him]886-the naked man some day in [Plutarch]359-plutarch . "[839-the boy] 1.3 . [Odo]234-odo , next morning , under [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback 's guidance , continued [his]234-odo exploration of [the palace]768-the palace . [[His]234-odo mother]664-his mother seemed glad to be rid of [him]234-odo , and [Vanna]247-vanna packing [him]234-odo off early , with the warning that [he]234-odo was not to fall into the fishponds or get [himself]234-odo trampled by the horses , [he]234-odo guessed , with a thrill , that [he]234-odo had leave to visit [the stables]892-the stables . Here in fact [the two boys]893-the two boys were soon making [their]893-the two boys way among [the crowd of [grooms]895-grooms and strappers in [the yard]709-the yard]894-the crowd of grooms and strappers in the yard , seeing [[the Duke]682-the duke 's carriage - horses]898-the duke 's carriage - horses groomed , and [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's cream - coloured hackney saddled for [her]899-the duchess ride in the chase ; and at length , after much lingering and gazing , going on to [the harness - rooms]900-the harness - rooms and [coach - house]901-coach - house . [The state - carriages]902-the state - carriages , with [their]902-the state - carriages carved and gilt wheels , [their]902-the state - carriages panels gay with flushed divinities and [their]902-the state - carriages stupendous velvet hammer - cloths edged with bullion , held [Odo]234-odo spellbound . [He]234-odo had a born taste for splendour , and the thought that [he]234-odo might one day sit in one of [these glittering vehicles]903-these glittering vehicles puffed [his]234-odo breast with pride and made [him]234-odo address [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback with sudden condescension . " When [I]234-odo 'm [a man]8112-a man [I]234-odo shall ride in [these carriages]8202-these carriages , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said ; whereat [the other]905-the other laughed and returned good - humouredly : " Eh , that 's not so much to boast of , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere ; [I]905-the other shall ride in [a carriage]729-a carriage one of these days [myself]905-the other . "[905-the other] [Odo]234-odo stared , not over - pleased , and [the boy]839-the boy added : " When [I]839-the boy 'm carried to [the churchyard]8205-the churchyard , [I]839-the boy mean , "[839-the boy] with a chuckle of relish at the joke . From [the stables]892-the stables [they]908-they passed to [the riding - school]909-the riding - school , with [its]909-the riding - school open galleries supported on twisted columns , where [[the duke]682-the duke 's gentlemen]911-the duke 's gentlemen managed [their]911-the duke 's gentlemen horses and took [their]911-the duke 's gentlemen exercise in bad weather . [Several]912-several rode [there]606-there that morning ; and among [them]912-several , on [a fine Arab]914-a fine arab , [Odo]234-odo recognised [the young man in black velvet who was so often in [Donna [Laura]243-donna laura 's apartments]916-donna laura 's apartments]915-the young man in black velvet who was so often in donna laura 's apartments . " Who 's that ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo whispered , pulling [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback 's sleeve , as [the gentleman]918-the gentleman , just below [them]908-they , made [his]918-the gentleman horse execute a brilliant balotade . " That ? Bless [the innocent]8206-the innocent ! Why , [the Count Lelio Trescorre]254-trescorre , [[your]234-odo illustrious mother]8104-your illustrious mother 's cavaliere servente . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo was puzzled , but some instinct of reserve withheld [him]234-odo from further questions . [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback , however , had no such scruples . " [They]8208-they do say , though , "[8158-the hunchback] [he]8158-the hunchback went on , " that [[her]8104-your illustrious mother Highness]8209-her highness has [her]8209-her highness eye on [him]922-his mother 's friend , and in that case [I]8158-the hunchback 'll wager [[your]234-odo illustrious mamma]8210-your illustrious mamma has no more chance than a sparrow against a hawk . "[8158-the hunchback] [The boy]839-the boy 's words were incomprehensible , but the vague sense that some danger might be threatening [[[his]839-the boy mother]664-his mother 's friend]922-his mother 's friend made [Odo]234-odo whisper : " What would [[her]8104-your illustrious mother Highness]8209-her highness do to [him]922-his mother 's friend ? "[234-odo] " Make [him]922-his mother 's friend [a prime - minister]8212-a prime - minister , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[8158-the hunchback] [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback laughed . [[Odo]234-odo 's guide]924-odo 's guide , it appeared , was not privileged to conduct [him]839-the boy through [the state apartments of [the palace]768-the palace]925-the state apartments of the palace , and [the little boy]692-the little boy had now been four days under the ducal roof without catching so much as a glimpse of [[his]692-the little boy sovereign]928-his sovereign and [cousin]929-cousin . The very next morning , however , [Vanna]247-vanna swept [him]839-the boy from [his]839-the boy trundle - bed with the announcement that [he]839-the boy was to be received by [the Duke]682-the duke that day , and that [the tailor]931-the tailor was now waiting to try on [his]839-the boy court dress . [He]839-the boy found [[his]839-the boy mother]664-his mother propped against [her]664-his mother pillows , drinking chocolate , feeding [her]664-his mother pet monkey and giving agitated directions to [the maidservants]933-the maidservants on [their]933-the maidservants knees before [the open carriage]934-the open carriage - trunks . [[Her]247-vanna excellency]828-her excellency informed [Odo]234-odo that [she]247-vanna had that moment received an express from [[his]234-odo grandfather]936-his grandfather , [the old [Marquess di Donnaz]255-donnaz]937-the old marquess di donnaz ; that [they]938-they were to start next morning for [the castle of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]939-the castle of donnaz , and that [he]234-odo was to be presented to [the Duke]682-the duke as soon as [[his]234-odo Highness]941-his highness had risen from dinner . A plump purse lay on the coverlet , and [her]247-vanna countenance wore an air of kindness and animation which , together with the prospect of wearing a court dress and travelling to [[[his]234-odo grandfather]936-his grandfather 's castle in [the mountains]944-the mountains]943-his grandfather 's castle in the mountains , so worked on [Odo]234-odo 's spirits that , forgetting the abate 's instructions , [he]234-odo sprang to [her]247-vanna with an eager caress . " [Child]8126-child , [child]8126-child , "[247-vanna] was [her]247-vanna only rebuke ; and [she]247-vanna added , with a tap on [his]234-odo cheek : " It is lucky [I]247-vanna shall have a sword to protect [me]247-vanna . "[247-vanna] Long before the hour [Odo]234-odo was buttoned into [his]234-odo embroidered coat and waistcoat . [He]234-odo would have on the sword at once , and when [they]945-they sat down to dinner , though [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother pressed [him]234-odo to eat with more concern than [she]664-his mother had before shown , it went hard with [him]234-odo to put [his]234-odo weapon aside , and [he]234-odo cast longing eyes at the corner where it lay . At length [a chamberlain]947-a chamberlain summoned [them]945-they and [they]945-they set out down [the corridors]948-the corridors , attended by [two servants]949-two servants . [Odo]234-odo held [his]234-odo head high , with one hand leading [Donna Laura]243-donna laura ( for [he]234-odo would not appear to be led by [her]243-donna laura ) while the other fingered [his]234-odo sword . [The deformed beggars who always lurked about the great staircase]950-the deformed beggars who always lurked about the great staircase fawned on [them]945-they as [they]945-they passed , and on [a landing]951-a landing [they]945-they crossed [the humpbacked boy]952-the humpbacked boy , who grinned mockingly at [Odo]234-odo ; but [the latter]870-the latter , with [his]870-the latter chin up , would not so much as glance at [him]234-odo . [A master of ceremonies in short black cloak and gold chain]954-a master of ceremonies in short black cloak and gold chain received [them]945-they in [the antechamber of [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's apartments]957-the duchess 's apartments]955-the antechamber of the duchess 's apartments , where [the court]814-the court played lansquenet after dinner ; the doors of [[[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness 's closet]960-her highness 's closet were thrown open , and [Odo]234-odo , now glad enough to cling to [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's hand , found [himself]234-odo in [a tall room]962-a tall room , with gods and goddesses in the clouds overhead and [personages as supra - terrestrial seated in gilt armchairs about a smoking brazier]963-personages as supra - terrestrial seated in gilt armchairs about a smoking brazier . Before one of these , to whom [Donna Laura]243-donna laura swept successive curtsies in advancing , [the frightened cavaliere]964-the frightened cavaliere found [himself]964-the frightened cavaliere dragged with [his]964-the frightened cavaliere sword between [his]964-the frightened cavaliere legs . [He]964-the frightened cavaliere ducked [his]964-the frightened cavaliere head like [the old drake]965-the old drake diving for worms in the puddle at [the farm]565-the farm , and when at last [he]964-the frightened cavaliere dared look up , it was to see an odd sallow face , half - smothered in an immense wig , bowing back at [him]964-the frightened cavaliere with infinite ceremony -- and [Odo]234-odo 's heart sank to think that this was [[his]964-the frightened cavaliere sovereign]928-his sovereign . [The Duke]682-the duke was in fact [a sickly narrow - faced young man with thick obstinate lips]969-a sickly narrow - faced young man with thick obstinate lips and a slight lameness that made [his]682-the duke walk ungainly ; but though no way resembling [the ermine - cloaked king of [the chapel at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]971-the chapel at pontesordo]970-the ermine - cloaked king of the chapel at pontesordo , [he]682-the duke yet knew how to put on [a certain majesty with [his]682-the duke state wig and [his]682-the duke orders]972-a certain majesty with his state wig and his orders . As for [the newly married Duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel , [she]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel was scant fourteen and looked [a mere child]974-a mere child in [her]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel great hoop and jewelled stomacher . [Her]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel wonderful fair hair , drawn over a cushion and lightly powdered , was twisted with pearls and roses , and [her]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel cheeks excessively rouged , in the French fashion ; so that as [she]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel arose on the approach of [the visitors]975-the visitors [she]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel looked to [Odo]234-odo for all [the world]844-the world like the wooden Virgin hung with votive offerings in [the parish church at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]977-the parish church at pontesordo . Though [they]978-they were but three months married [the Duke]682-the duke , it was rumoured , was never with [her]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel , preferring the company of [the young Marquess of [Cerveno]394-cerveno]980-the young marquess of cerveno , [[his]682-the duke cousin and heir - presumptive]981-his cousin and heir - presumptive , [a pale boy scented with musk and painted like a comedian , whom [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness would never suffer away from [him]682-the duke and who now leaned with an impertinent air against the back of the ducal armchair]982-a pale boy scented with musk and painted like a comedian , whom his highness would never suffer away from him and who now leaned with an impertinent air against the back of the ducal armchair . On the other side of the brazier sat [the dowager Duchess]984-the dowager duchess , [[the Duke]682-the duke 's grandmother]986-the duke 's grandmother , [an old lady so high and forbidding of aspect that [Odo]234-odo]987-an old lady so high and forbidding of aspect that odo cast but one look at [her]973-the newly married duchess , who sat at the other end of the cabinet caressing a toy spaniel face , which was yellow and wrinkled as a medlar , and surmounted , in the Spanish style , with black veils and a high coif . What [these alarming personages]988-these alarming personages said and did , [the child]686-the child could never recall ; nor were [his]686-the child own actions clear to [him]686-the child , except for a furtive caress that [he]686-the child remembered giving the spaniel as [he]686-the child kissed [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's hand ; whereupon [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness snatched up the pampered animal and walked away with a pout of anger . [Odo]234-odo noticed that [her]899-the duchess angry look followed [him]234-odo as [he]234-odo and [Donna Laura]243-donna laura withdrew ; but the next moment [he]234-odo heard [the Duke]682-the duke 's voice and saw [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness limping after [them]994-their . " [You]899-the duchess must have a furred cloak for [your]899-the duchess journey , [cousin]929-cousin , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo awkwardly , pressing something in the hand of [[Odo]234-odo 's mother]995-odo 's mother , who broke into fresh compliments and curtsies , while [the Duke]682-the duke , with a finger on [his]682-the duke thick lip , withdrew hastily into [the closet]997-the closet . The next morning early [they]994-their set out on [their]994-their journey . There had been frost in the night and a cold sun sparkled on [the palace]768-the palace windows and on [the marble church]999-the marble church - fronts as [[their]994-their carriage]1000-their carriage lumbered through [the streets]744-the streets , now full of noise and animation . It was [Odo]234-odo 's first glimpse of [the town]593-the town by daylight , and [he]234-odo clapped [his]234-odo hands with delight at sight of [the people]1003-the people picking [their]1003-the people way across the reeking gutters , [the asses laden with milk and vegetables]1004-the asses laden with milk and vegetables , [the servant - girls]1005-the servant - girls bargaining at the provision - stalls , [[the shop - keepers]1006-the shop - keepers ' wives]1007-the shop - keepers ' wives going to mass in pattens and hoods , with scaldini in [their]1007-the shop - keepers ' wives muffs , the dark recessed openings in [the palace basements]1008-the palace basements , where [fruit sellers]1009-fruit sellers , [wine - merchants]1010-wine - merchants and [coppersmiths]1011-coppersmiths displayed [their]1007-the shop - keepers ' wives wares , [the pedlars hawking books and toys]1012-the pedlars hawking books and toys , and here and there [a gentleman in a sedan chair returning flushed and disordered from a night at bassett or [faro]9-faro]1013-a gentleman in a sedan chair returning flushed and disordered from a night at bassett or faro . [The travelling - carriage]1014-the travelling - carriage was escorted by half - a - dozen of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's troopers]1016-the duke 's troopers and [Don Lelio]245-don lelio rode at the door followed by [two grooms]1017-two grooms . [He]1013-a gentleman in a sedan chair returning flushed and disordered from a night at bassett or faro wore a furred coat and boots , and never , to [Odo]234-odo , had [he]1013-a gentleman in a sedan chair returning flushed and disordered from a night at bassett or faro appeared more proud and splendid ; but [Donna Laura]243-donna laura had hardly a word for [him]1013-a gentleman in a sedan chair returning flushed and disordered from a night at bassett or faro , and [he]1013-a gentleman in a sedan chair returning flushed and disordered from a night at bassett or faro rode with the set air of [a man who acquits [himself]1013-a gentleman in a sedan chair returning flushed and disordered from a night at bassett or faro of a troublesome duty]1018-a man who acquits himself of a troublesome duty . Outside the gates the spectacle seemed tame in comparison ; for [the road]726-the road bent toward [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo , and [Odo]234-odo was familiar enough with the look of [the bare fields]1020-the bare fields , set here and there with oak - copses to which the leaves still clung . As [the carriage]8109-the carriage skirted [the marsh]724-the marsh [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother raised the windows , exclaiming that they must not expose [themselves]1024-themselves to the pestilent air ; and though [Odo]234-odo was not yet addicted to general reflections , [he]234-odo could not but wonder that [she]664-his mother should display such dread of an atmosphere [she]664-his mother had let [him]234-odo breathe since [his]234-odo birth . [He]234-odo knew of course that the sunset vapours on [the marsh]724-the marsh were unhealthy : [everybody on [the farm]565-the farm]1026-everybody on the farm had a touch of the ague , and it was a saying in [the village]1028-the village that [no one]725-no one lived at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo who could buy an ass to carry [him]234-odo away ; but that [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , in skirting [the place]1030-the place on a clear morning of frost , should show such fear of infection , gave a sinister emphasis to the ill - repute of [the region]1031-the region . The thought , [he]234-odo knew not why , turned [his]234-odo mind to [Momola]241-momola , who often on damp evenings sat shaking and burning in the [kitchen corner]1032-kitchen corner . [He]234-odo reflected with a pang that [he]234-odo might never see [her]241-momola again , and leaning forward [he]234-odo strained [his]234-odo eyes for a glimpse of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . [They]1033-they were passing through a patch of oaks ; but where these ended [the country]818-the country opened , and beyond a belt of osiers and the mottled faded stretches of [the marsh]724-the marsh the keep stood up like a beckoning finger . [Odo]234-odo cried out as though in answer to its call ; but that moment [the road]726-the road turned a knoll and bent across rising ground toward [an unfamiliar region]1037-an unfamiliar region . " Thank [God]249-god ! "[664-his mother] cried [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother , lowering the window , " [we]1033-they 're rid of that poison and can breath the air . "[664-his mother] As [the keep]598-the keep vanished [Odo]234-odo reproached [himself]234-odo for not having begged a pair of shoes for [Momola]241-momola . [He]234-odo had felt very sorry for [her]664-his mother since [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback had spoken so strangely of life at [the foundling hospital]1041-the foundling hospital ; and [he]234-odo had a sudden vision of [her]664-his mother bare feet , pinched with cold and cut with the pebbles of [the yard]709-the yard , perpetually running across the damp stone floors , with [Filomena]229-filomena crying after [her]664-his mother : " Hasten then , [child of iniquity]8217-child of iniquity ! [You]8217-child of iniquity are slower than a day without bread ! "[234-odo] [He]234-odo had almost resolved to speak of [the foundling]1043-the foundling to [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother , who still seemed in a condescending humour ; but [his]234-odo attention was unexpectedly distracted by [a troop of Egyptians]1045-a troop of egyptians , who came along [the road]726-the road leading a dancing bear ; and hardly had these passed when the chariot of [an itinerant dentist]1047-an itinerant dentist engaged [him]234-odo . The whole way , indeed , was alive with such surprises ; and at [Valsecca]234-odo , where [they]1048-they dined , [they]1048-they found [the yard of [the inn]1050-the inn]1049-the yard of the inn crowded with [the sumpter - mules and servants of [a cardinal travelling to [Rome]11-rome , who was to lie [there that night]1053-there that night and whose bedstead and saucepans had preceded [him]234-odo]1052-a cardinal travelling to rome , who was to lie there that night and whose bedstead and saucepans had preceded him]1051-the sumpter - mules and servants of a cardinal travelling to rome , who was to lie there that night and whose bedstead and saucepans had preceded him . Here , after dinner , [Don Lelio]245-don lelio took leave of [[Odo]234-odo 's mother]995-odo 's mother , with small show of regret on either side ; [the lady high and sarcastic]1055-the lady high and sarcastic , [the gentleman]918-the gentleman sullen and polite ; and both , as it seemed , easier when the business was despatched and [the Count]813-the count 's foot in the stirrup . [He]234-odo had so far taken little notice of [Odo]234-odo , but [he]234-odo now bent from the saddle and tapped [the boy]839-the boy 's cheek , saying in [his]234-odo cold way : " In a few years [I]234-odo shall see [you]839-the boy at court ; "[234-odo] and with that rode away toward [Pianura]4-pianura . 1.4 . Lying that night at [Pavia]12-pavia , [the travellers]1059-the travellers set forward next morning for [the city of Vercelli]1060-the city of vercelli . [The road]726-the road , though [it]726-the road ran for the most part through [flat mulberry orchards]1062-flat mulberry orchards and [rice - fields]1063-rice - fields reflecting the pale blue sky in [their]1063-rice - fields sodden channels , would yet have appeared diverting enough to [Odo]234-odo , had [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother been in the mood to reply to [his]234-odo questions ; for whether [[their]1059-the travellers carriage]1000-their carriage overtook a party of [strolling jugglers]1066-strolling jugglers , travelling in a roofed - in waggon , with [the younger children of the company]1067-the younger children of the company running alongside in threadbare tights and trunkhose decked with tinsel ; or whether [they]1059-the travellers drove through [a village market - place]1068-a village market - place , where yellow earthen crocks and gaudy Indian cottons , brass pails and braziers and platters of bluish pewter , filled [the stalls]1069-the stalls with a medley of colour -- at every turn was something that excited [the boy]839-the boy 's wonder ; but [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , who had fallen into a depression of spirits , lamenting the cold , [her]243-donna laura misfortunes and the discomfort of the journey , was at no more pains than the abate to satisfy the promptings of [his]234-odo curiosity . [Odo]234-odo had indeed met but [one person who cared to listen to [him]234-odo]1071-one person who cared to listen to him , and that was [the strange hunchback who had called [himself]1072-the strange hunchback who had called himself brutus [Brutus]251-brutus]1072-the strange hunchback who had called himself brutus . Remembering how entertainingly [this odd guide]1073-this odd guide had explained all the wonders of [the ducal grounds]1074-the ducal grounds , [Odo]234-odo began to regret that [he]234-odo had not asked [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother to let [him]234-odo have [Brutus]251-brutus for [a body - servant]1076-a body - servant . Meanwhile [no one]725-no one attended to [his]234-odo questions and the hours were beginning to seem long when , on the third day , [they]1078-they set out from [Vercelli]13-vercelli toward [the hills]1079-the hills . The cold increased as [they]1078-they rose ; and [Odo]234-odo , though [he]234-odo had often wished to see [the mountains]944-the mountains , was yet dismayed at the gloomy and menacing aspect of [the region on which [they]1078-they were entering]1081-the region on which they were entering . [Leafless woods]1082-leafless woods , prodigious boulders and white torrents foaming and roaring seemed a poor exchange for [the pleasantly - ordered gardens of [Pianura]4-pianura]1083-the pleasantly - ordered gardens of pianura . Here were no violets and cowslips in bloom ; hardly a green blade pierced the sodden roadside , and snowdrifts lingered in [the shaded hollows]1084-the shaded hollows . [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's loudly expressed fear of [robbers]1085-robbers seemed to increase the loneliness of the way , which now traversed [tracts of naked moorland]1086-tracts of naked moorland , now plunged again into [forest]1087-forest , with no sign of habitation but here and there [a cowherd 's hut under the trees or [a chapel]1089-a chapel standing apart on some grassy eminence]1088-a cowherd 's hut under the trees or a chapel standing apart on some grassy eminence . When night fell the waters grew louder , a stinging wind swept [the woods]1090-the woods , and [the carriage]8109-the carriage , staggering from rut to rut , seemed every moment about to land [them]1078-they in [some invisible ravine]1092-some invisible ravine . Fear and cold at last benumbed [the little boy]692-the little boy , and when [he]692-the little boy woke [he]692-the little boy was being lifted from [his]692-the little boy seat and torches were flashing on a high escutcheoned doorway set in battlemented walls . [He]692-the little boy was carried into [a hall]1094-a hall lit with smoky oil - lamps and hung with armour and torn banners . Here , among [a group of [rough - looking servants]1096-rough - looking servants]1095-a group of rough - looking servants , [a tall old man in a nightcap and furred gown]1097-a tall old man in a nightcap and furred gown was giving orders in a loud passionate voice . [This personage , who was of a choleric complexion , with a face like mottled red marble]1098-this personage , who was of a choleric complexion , with a face like mottled red marble , seized [Odo]234-odo by the wrist and led [him]234-odo up a flight of stairs so worn and slippery that [he]234-odo tripped at every step ; thence down [a corridor]1099-a corridor and into [a gloomy apartment]1100-a gloomy apartment where [three ladies]1101-three ladies shivered about a table set with candles . Bidden by [the old gentleman]1102-the old gentleman to salute [[his]234-odo grandmother]1103-his grandmother and [great - aunts]1104-great - aunts , [Odo]234-odo bowed over three wrinkled hands , one fat and soft as a toad 's stomach , the others yellow and dry as lemon - skins . [[His]234-odo mother]664-his mother embraced [the ladies]1106-the ladies in the same humble manner , and [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , first furiously calling for supper , thrust [Odo]234-odo down on a stool in the ingle . From this point of observation [the child]686-the child , now vividly awake , noted the hangings of faded tapestry that heaved in the draught , the ceiling of beams and the stone floor strewn with rushes . The candle - light flickering on the faces of [[his]234-odo aged relatives]1109-his aged relatives showed [[his]234-odo grandmother]1103-his grandmother to be [a pale heavy - cheeked person with little watchful black eyes which [she]1103-his grandmother dropped at [[her]1103-his grandmother husband]1112-her husband 's approach]1111-a pale heavy - cheeked person with little watchful black eyes which she dropped at her husband 's approach ; while [the two great - aunts]1113-the two great - aunts , seated side by side in high - backed chairs with [their]1113-the two great - aunts feet on braziers , reminded [Odo]234-odo of the narrow elongated saints squeezed into the niches of [a church]1114-a church - door . [The old Marchioness]1115-the old marchioness wore the high coif and veil of the previous century ; [the aunts , who , as [Odo]234-odo afterwards learned , were [canonesses of a noble order]1117-canonesses of a noble order]1116-the aunts , who , as odo afterwards learned , were canonesses of a noble order , were habited in a semi - conventual dress , with crosses hanging on [their]1113-the two great - aunts bosoms ; and [none]1118-none spoke but when [the Marquess]1107-the marquess addressed [them]1113-the two great - aunts .
