[Their]1113-the two great - aunts timidity appeared to infect [[Odo]234-odo 's mother]995-odo 's mother , who , from [her]995-odo 's mother habitual volubility of temper , sank to a mood of like submissiveness . A supper of venison and goat 's cheese was not designed to restore [her]995-odo 's mother spirits , and when at length [she]995-odo 's mother and [Odo]234-odo had withdrawn to [[their]1113-the two great - aunts cavernous bedchamber]1121-their cavernous bedchamber , [she]995-odo 's mother flung [herself]995-odo 's mother weeping on the bed and declared [she]995-odo 's mother must die if [she]995-odo 's mother remained long in [this prison]1122-this prison . Falling asleep under such influences , it was the more wonderful to [Odo]234-odo to wake with the sun on [his]234-odo counterpane , a sweet noise of streams through the casement and the joyous barking of hounds in [the castle court]1123-the castle court . From the window - seat [he]234-odo looked out on a scene extraordinarily novel to [his]234-odo lowland eyes . [The chamber]1124-the chamber commanded [the wooded steep below [the castle]1126-the castle]1125-the wooded steep below the castle , with [a stream]1127-a stream looping [its]1125-the wooded steep below the castle base ; beyond , [the pastures]1128-the pastures sloped pleasantly under walnut trees , with here and there a clearing ploughed for the spring crops and [a sunny ledge or two planted with vines]1129-a sunny ledge or two planted with vines . Above [this pastoral landscape]1130-this pastoral landscape , bare crags upheld a snowpeak ; and , as if to lend a human interest to the scene , [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , [his]1131-the old marquess flintlock on [his]1131-the old marquess shoulder , [his]1131-the old marquess dogs and beaters at [his]1131-the old marquess heels , now rode across [the valley]1132-the valley . [Wonder]256-wonder succeeded to wonder that first morning ; for there was [the castle to be seen]1133-the castle to be seen , with the kennels and [stables]1134-stables roughly kept , but full of dogs and horses ; and [Odo]234-odo , in [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's absence , was left free to visit [every nook of [[his]234-odo new home]1137-his new home]1136-every nook of his new home . [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo , though perhaps as ancient as [Donnaz]7-donnaz , was but [a fortified manor in [the plain]1139-the plain]1138-a fortified manor in the plain ; but here was [the turreted border castle]1140-the turreted border castle , bristling at the head of [the gorge]1141-the gorge like the fangs in a boar 's throat : [its]1140-the turreted border castle walls overhung by machicolations , [its]1140-the turreted border castle portcullis still dropped at nightfall , and [the loud stream]1142-the loud stream forming a natural moat at [its]1140-the turreted border castle base . Through [the desert spaces of [this great structure]1144-this great structure]1143-the desert spaces of this great structure [Odo]234-odo wandered at will , losing [himself]234-odo in [[its]1140-the turreted border castle network of bare chambers]1145-its network of bare chambers , some now put to domestic uses , with smoked meats hanging from the rafters , cheeses ranged on shelves and [farmer]1146-farmer 's implements stacked on the floor ; others abandoned to bats and spiders , with slit - like openings choked by a growth of wild cherries , and little animals scurrying into [their]1147-their holes as [Odo]234-odo opened the unused doors . At the next turn [he]234-odo mounted by a winding stair to the platform behind the battlements , whence [he]234-odo could look down on [the inner court]1148-the inner court , where horses were being groomed , dogs fed , harnesses mended , and platters of smoking food carried from [the kitchen]569-the kitchen to [the pantry]8181-the pantry ; or , leaning another way , discovered , between [the cliff]1151-the cliff and [the rampart]1152-the rampart [a tiny walled garden with fruit - trees]1153-a tiny walled garden with fruit - trees and a sundial . [The ladies]1106-the ladies kept to [themselves]1106-the ladies in [a corner of [the castle]1126-the castle]1155-a corner of the castle , where [the rooms]1157-the rooms were hung with tapestry and a few straight - backed chairs stood about the hearth ; but even here no fires were suffered till nightfall , nor was there so much as a carpet in [the castle]1126-the castle . [[Odo]234-odo 's grandmother]1159-odo 's grandmother , [the old Marchioness]1115-the old marchioness , [a heavy woman who would doubtless have enjoyed [her]1115-the old marchioness ease in a cushioned seat]1161-a heavy woman who would doubtless have enjoyed her ease in a cushioned seat , was afoot all day attending to [[her]1115-the old marchioness household]1162-her household ; for besides [the dairy]1163-the dairy and [the bakehouse]1164-the bakehouse and [the stillroom]1165-the stillroom where fruits were stewed and pastes prepared , there was [the great spinning - room full of distaffs and looms , where [the women]823-the women spun and wove all the linen used in [the castle]1126-the castle and the coarse stuffs worn by [[its]1126-the castle inmates]1169-its inmates]1166-the great spinning - room full of distaffs and looms , where the women spun and wove all the linen used in the castle and the coarse stuffs worn by its inmates ; with [workshops for [the cobbler]1171-the cobbler and tailor who clothed and shod [the Marquess]1107-the marquess and [[his]1107-the marquess household]1173-his household]1170-workshops for the cobbler and tailor who clothed and shod the marquess and his household . All these [the Marchioness]1174-the marchioness must visit , and attend to [her]1174-the marchioness devotions between ; [the ladies]1106-the ladies being governed by [a dark - faced priest]1176-a dark - faced priest , [[their]1106-the ladies chaplain]1177-their chaplain and [director]1178-director , who kept [them]1106-the ladies perpetually running along [the cold stone corridors]1179-the cold stone corridors to [the chapel]578-the chapel in a distant wing , where [they]1106-the ladies knelt without so much as a brazier to warm [them]1106-the ladies or a cushion to [their]1106-the ladies knees . As to [the chapel]578-the chapel , though larger and loftier than that of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo , with a fine carved and painted tabernacle and many silver candlesticks , it seemed to [Odo]234-odo , by reason of [its]578-the chapel bare walls , much less beautiful than [that deserted oratory]1182-that deserted oratory ; nor did [he]234-odo , amid all the novelty of [his]234-odo surroundings , cease to regret the companionship of [his]234-odo familiar images . [His]234-odo delight was the greater , therefore , when , exploring a part of [the castle]1126-the castle now quite abandoned , [he]234-odo came one day on [a vaulted chamber used as [a kind of granary , where , under layers of dirt and cobwebs , lovely countenances]1185-a kind of granary , where , under layers of dirt and cobwebs , lovely countenances flowered from the walls]1184-a vaulted chamber used as a kind of granary , where , under layers of dirt and cobwebs , lovely countenances flowered from the walls . The scenes depicted differed indeed from those of [Pontesordo]241-momola , being less animated and homely and more difficult for [a child]1186-a child to interpret ; for here were [naked laurel - crowned knights on prancing horses]1187-naked laurel - crowned knights on prancing horses , nimble goat - faced creatures grouped in adoration round a smoking altar and [youths piping to saffron - haired damsels on grass - banks set with poplars]1188-youths piping to saffron - haired damsels on grass - banks set with poplars . The very strangeness of the fable set forth perhaps engaged [the child]686-the child 's fancy ; or the benignant mildness of the countenances , so unlike the eager individual faces of [the earlier artist]1190-the earlier artist ; for [he]234-odo returned again and again to gaze unweariedly on [the inhabitants of that tranquil grassy world]1191-the inhabitants of that tranquil grassy world , studying every inch of the walls and with much awe and fruitless speculation deciphering on the hem of a floating drapery the inscription : [Bernardinus Lovinus]257-bernardinus lovinus pinxit . [His]234-odo impatience to know more of the history of these paintings led [him]234-odo to question [an old man]1192-an old man , [half house - servant]1193-half house - servant , half huntsman , now too infirm for service and often to be found sunning [himself]234-odo in [the court]814-the court with an old hound 's chin on [his]234-odo knee . [The old man]1195-the old man , whose name was [Bruno]258-bruno , told [him]234-odo [the room in question]1196-the room in question had been painted for [the Marquess Gualberto di Donnaz]255-donnaz , who had fought under [the Duke of [Milan]14-milan]1197-the duke of milan hundreds of years before : [a splendid and hospitable noble , patron of learning and the arts]1198-a splendid and hospitable noble , patron of learning and the arts , who had brought [the great Milanese painter]1199-the great milanese painter to [Donnaz]7-donnaz and kept [him]1199-the great milanese painter [there]606-there a whole summer adorning [the banqueting - room]1201-the banqueting - room . " But [I]258-bruno advise [you]234-odo , [little master]8218-little master , "[258-bruno] [Bruno]258-bruno added , " not to talk too loudly of [your]234-odo discovery ; for [we]8219-we live in changed days , do [you]234-odo see , and it seems those are [pagan sorcerers]8220-pagan sorcerers and [witches painted on the wall]8221-witches painted on the wall , and because of that , and [their]1202-so many naked pagans , in colours and marble nakedness , [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain has forbidden [all [the young boys]8224-the young boys and wenches about [the place]1030-the place to set foot there]8223-all the young boys and wenches about the place to set foot there ; and [the Marchioness]1174-the marchioness [herself]1174-the marchioness , [I]258-bruno 'm told , does n't enter without leave . "[258-bruno] This was the more puzzling to [Odo]234-odo that [he]234-odo had seen [so many naked pagans , in colours and marble]1202-so many naked pagans , in colours and marble , at [[[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin 's palace of [Pianura]4-pianura]1204-his cousin 's palace of pianura , where [they]1202-so many naked pagans , in colours and marble were praised as the chief ornament of that sumptuous fabric ; but [he]234-odo kept [Bruno]258-bruno 's warning in mind and so timed [his]234-odo visits that they escaped [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain 's observation . Whether this touch of mystery added charm to the paintings ; or whether there was already forming in [him]234-odo what afterward became an instinctive resistance to many of the dictates of [his]234-odo age ; certain it is that , even after [he]234-odo had been privileged to admire the stupendous works of [the Caracci]259-the caracci at [Parma]15-parma and of the immortal [Giulio Romano]260-giulio romano at [Mantua]3-mantua , [Odo]234-odo 's fancy always turned with peculiar fondness to [the clear - limbed youths moving in that world of untroubled beauty]1206-the clear - limbed youths moving in that world of untroubled beauty . [Odo]234-odo , the day after [his]234-odo arrival at [Donnaz]7-donnaz , learned that [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain was to be [[his]234-odo governor]1208-his governor ; and [he]234-odo was not long in discovering that the system of that ecclesiastic bore no resemblance to the desultory methods of [[his]234-odo former pedagogue]1209-his former pedagogue . It was not that [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso was [a man of superior acquirements]1210-a man of superior acquirements : in writing , ciphering and the rudiments of Latin [he]261-don gervaso seemed little likely to carry [Odo]234-odo farther than the other ; but in religious instruction [he]261-don gervaso suffered no negligence or inattention . [His]261-don gervaso piety was of a stamp so different from the abate 's that it vivified the theological abstractions over which [Odo]234-odo had formerly languished , infusing a passionate meaning into the formulas of the textbooks . [His]261-don gervaso discourse breathed the same spirit , and had [his]261-don gervaso religion been warmed by imagination or tempered by charity [the child]686-the child had been a ductile substance in [his]261-don gervaso hands ; but the shadow of the Council of [Trent]262-trent still hung over [the Church]1212-the church in [Savoy]16-savoy , making its approach almost as sombre and forbidding as that of the Calvinist heresy . As it was , the fascination that drew [Odo]234-odo to the divine teachings was counteracted by a depressing awe : [he]261-don gervaso trembled in [God]249-god 's presence almost as much as in [[his]261-don gervaso grandfather]936-his grandfather 's , and with the same despair of discovering what course of action was most likely to call down the impending wrath . The beauty of [[the Church]1212-the church 's offices]1215-the church 's offices , now for the first time revealed to [him]261-don gervaso in the well - ordered services of [the chapel]578-the chapel , was doubly moving in contrast with the rude life at [Donnaz]7-donnaz ; but [his]261-don gervaso confessions tortured [him]261-don gervaso and the penances which [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain inflicted abased without reforming [his]261-don gervaso spirit . Next to the mass , the books [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso lent [him]261-don gervaso were [his]261-don gervaso chief pleasure : the Lives of [the Saints]1218-the saints , [Cardinal Bellarmine]263-cardinal bellarmine 's Fables and The Mirror of true Penitence . The Lives of [the Saints]1218-the saints fed at once [his]261-don gervaso imagination and [his]261-don gervaso heart , and over the story of [Saint Francis]239-saint francis , now first made known to [him]261-don gervaso , [he]261-don gervaso trembled with delicious sympathy . The longing to found [a hermitage like the Portiuncula among [the savage rocks of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1221-the savage rocks of donnaz]1220-a hermitage like the portiuncula among the savage rocks of donnaz , and live there in gentle communion with plants and animals , alternated in [him]261-don gervaso with the martial ambition to ride forth against [[the Church]1212-the church 's enemies]1223-the church 's enemies , as [[his]261-don gervaso ancestors]1224-his ancestors had ridden against [the bloody and pestilent Waldenses]1225-the bloody and pestilent waldenses ; but whether [his]261-don gervaso piety took the passive or the aggressive form , it always shrank from the subtleties of doctrine . To live like [the saints]1218-the saints , rather than to reason like [the fathers]1227-the fathers , was [his]261-don gervaso ideal of Christian conduct ; if indeed a vague pity for suffering creatures and animals was not the source of [his]261-don gervaso monastic yearnings , and a desire to see strange countries the secret of [his]261-don gervaso zeal against [the infidel]1228-the infidel . [The chaplain]8222-the chaplain , though reproving [his]261-don gervaso lukewarmness in matters of dogma , could not but commend [his]261-don gervaso devotion to [the saints]1218-the saints ; and one day [[his]261-don gervaso grandmother]1103-his grandmother , to reward [him]261-don gervaso for some act of piety , informed [him]261-don gervaso with tears of joy that [he]261-don gervaso was destined for holy orders , and that [she]1103-his grandmother had good hopes of living to see [him]261-don gervaso [a bishop]1232-a bishop . This news had hardly the intended effect ; for [Odo]234-odo 's dream was of [the saint]573-the saint 's halo rather than [the bishop]1234-the bishop 's mitre ; and throwing [himself]261-don gervaso on [his]261-don gervaso knees before [the old Marquess , who was present]1235-the old marquess , who was present , [he]261-don gervaso besought that [he]261-don gervaso might be allowed to join [the Franciscan order]1236-the franciscan order . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess at this flew into so furious a rage , cursing the meddlesomeness of [women]771-women and [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain 's bigotry , that [the ladies]1106-the ladies burst into tears and [Odo]234-odo 's swelling zeal turned small . There was indeed but one person in [the castle]1126-the castle who seemed not to regard [its master]1242-its master 's violences , and that was [the dark - faced chaplain , who , when [the Marquess]1107-the marquess had paused out of breath]1243-the dark - faced chaplain , who , when the marquess had paused out of breath , tranquilly returned that nothing could make [him]1243-the dark - faced chaplain , who , when the marquess had paused out of breath repent of having brought a soul to [Christ]264-christ , and that , as to [the cavaliere Odo]1245-the cavaliere odo , if [[his]1245-the cavaliere odo maker]1246-his maker designed [him]1245-the cavaliere odo for [a religious]1247-a religious , [the Pope]1248-the pope [himself]1248-the pope could not cross [his]1245-the cavaliere odo vocation . " Ay , ay ! vocation , "[1107-the marquess] snarled [the Marquess]1107-the marquess . " [You]8227-you and [the women]823-the women here shut [the child]686-the child up between [you]8227-you and stuff [his]686-the child ears full of monkish stories and miracles and [the Lord]8230-the lord knows what , and then talk of [the simpleton]8231-the simpleton 's vocation . [His]686-the child vocation , nom de Dieu , is to be [an abbot]8232-an abbot first , and then [a monsignore]8233-a monsignore , and then [a bishop]1232-a bishop , if [he]686-the child can -- and to the devil with [your]8227-you cowls and cloisters ! "[1107-the marquess] And [he]1107-the marquess gave orders that [Odo]234-odo should hunt with [him]1107-the marquess next morning . [The chaplain]8222-the chaplain smiled . " [Hubert]265-hubert was [a huntsman]8235-a huntsman , "[8222-the chaplain] said [he]8222-the chaplain , " and yet [he]265-hubert died [a saint]691-a saint . "[8222-the chaplain] From that time forth [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess kept [Odo]234-odo oftener at [his]1131-the old marquess side , making [[his]1131-the old marquess grandson]1252-his grandson ride with [him]1131-the old marquess about [[his]1131-the old marquess estates]1253-his estates and on such hunting - parties as were not beyond [the boy]839-the boy 's strength . [The domain of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1255-the domain of donnaz included [many a mile of vine and forest]1256-many a mile of vine and forest , over which , till the fifteenth century , [[its]1255-the domain of donnaz lords]1257-its lords had ruled as [sovereign Marquesses]1258-sovereign marquesses . [They]1257-its lords still retained a part of [their]1257-its lords feudal privileges , and [[Odo]234-odo 's grandfather]1259-odo 's grandfather , tenacious of these dwindling rights , was for ever engaged in vain contests with [[his]1259-odo 's grandfather peasantry]1260-his peasantry . To see [these poor creatures]1261-these poor creatures cursed and brow - beaten , [their]1261-these poor creatures least offences punished , [their]1261-these poor creatures few claims disputed , must have turned [Odo]234-odo 's fear of [[his]234-odo grandfather]936-his grandfather to hatred , had [he]234-odo not observed that [the old man]1195-the old man gave with one hand what [he]1195-the old man took with the other , so that , in [his]1195-the old man dealings with [[his]1195-the old man people]1264-his people , [he]1195-the old man resembled one of those torrents which now devastate and now enrich [their]1264-his people banks . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess , in fact , while [he]1107-the marquess held obstinately to [his]1107-the marquess fishing rights , prosecuted [poachers]1266-poachers , enforced the corvee and took toll at every ford , yet laboured to improve [[his]1107-the marquess lands]1267-his lands , exterminated the wild beasts that preyed on them , helped [[his]1107-the marquess peasants]1268-his peasants in sickness , nourished [them]1268-his peasants in old age and governed [them]1268-his peasants with a paternal tyranny doubtless less insufferable than the negligence of [the great land - owners who lived at court]1269-the great land - owners who lived at court . To [Odo]234-odo , however , these rides among [the tenantry]1270-the tenantry were less agreeable than the hunting - expeditions which carried [them]1270-the tenantry up [the mountain]1271-the mountain in the solitude of morning . Here the wild freshness of the scene and the exhilaration of pursuit roused the fighting strain in [the boy]839-the boy 's blood , and so stirred [his]234-odo memory with tales of prowess that sometimes , as [they]1273-they climbed the stony defiles in the clear shadow before sunrise , [he]234-odo fancied [himself]234-odo riding forth to exterminate [the Waldenses who , according to [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain , still lurked like basilisks and dragons in the recesses of [the mountains]944-the mountains]1274-the waldenses who , according to the chaplain , still lurked like basilisks and dragons in the recesses of the mountains . Certain it is that [his]234-odo rides with [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , if they inflamed [his]234-odo zeal against heresy , cooled the ardour of [his]234-odo monastic vocation ; and if [he]234-odo pondered on [his]234-odo future , it was to reflect that doubtless [he]234-odo would some day be [a bishop]1232-a bishop , and that [bishops]1279-bishops were [territorial lords]1280-territorial lords , [we]1281-we might hunt the wolf and boar in [[their]1279-bishops own domains]1282-their own domains . 1.5 . Reluctantly , every year about the Epiphany , [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess rode down from [Donnaz]7-donnaz to spend two months in [Turin]17-turin . It was a service exacted by [King Charles Emanuel , who viewed with a jealous eye those of [[his]1284-king charles emanuel , who viewed with a jealous eye those of his nobles inclined to absent themselves from court and rewarded their presence with privileges and preferments nobles]1285-his nobles inclined to absent [themselves]1285-his nobles from court and rewarded [their]1285-his nobles presence with privileges and preferments]1284-king charles emanuel , who viewed with a jealous eye those of his nobles inclined to absent themselves from court and rewarded their presence with privileges and preferments . At the same time [the two canonesses]1286-the two canonesses descended to [[their]1286-the two canonesses abbey in [the plain]1139-the plain]1287-their abbey in the plain , and thus with the closing in of winter [the old Marchioness]266-the marchioness , [Odo]234-odo and [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother were left alone in [the castle]1126-the castle . To [the Marchioness]266-the marchioness this was an agreeable period of spiritual compunction and bodily repose ; but to [Donna Laura]243-donna laura a season of despair . [The poor lady]8114-the poor lady , who had been early removed from the rough life at [Donnaz]7-donnaz to [the luxurious court of [Pianura]4-pianura]1292-the luxurious court of pianura , and was yet in the fulness of youth and vivacity , could not resign [herself]8114-the poor lady to an existence no better , as [she]8114-the poor lady declared , than that of [[any herdsman]1293-any herdsman 's wife]1294-any herdsman 's wife upon [the mountains]944-the mountains . Here was neither music nor cards , scandal nor love - making ; no news of the fashions , no visits from [silk - mercers]1296-silk - mercers or [jewellers]1297-jewellers , [no Monsu]1298-no monsu to curl [her]8114-the poor lady hair and tempt [her]8114-the poor lady with new lotions , or so much as [a strolling soothsayer]1299-a strolling soothsayer or [juggler]1300-juggler to lighten the dullness of the long afternoons . [The only visitors to [the castle]1126-the castle]1301-the only visitors to the castle were [the mendicant friars drawn thither by [the Marchioness]266-the marchioness 's pious repute]1303-the mendicant friars drawn thither by the marchioness 's pious repute ; and though [Donna Laura]243-donna laura disdained not to call these to [[her]243-donna laura chamber]1304-her chamber and question [them]1301-the only visitors to the castle for news , yet [their]1301-the only visitors to the castle country - side scandals were no more to [her]243-donna laura fancy than the two - penny wares of [the chapmen who unpacked [their]1305-the chapmen who unpacked their baubles on the kitchen hearth baubles on the kitchen hearth]1305-the chapmen who unpacked their baubles on the kitchen hearth . [She]243-donna laura pined for some word of [Pianura]4-pianura ; but when [a young abate]1306-a young abate , who had touched [there]606-there on [his]1306-a young abate way from [Tuscany]18-tuscany , called for a night at [the castle]1126-the castle to pay [his]1306-a young abate duty to [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso , the word [he]1306-a young abate brought with [him]1306-a young abate of the birth of [an heir to [the duchy]1310-the duchy]1309-an heir to the duchy was so little to [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's humour that [she]243-donna laura sprang up from the supper - table , and crying out to the astonished [Odo]234-odo , " Ah , now [you]243-donna laura are for [the Church]1212-the church indeed , "[243-donna laura] withdrew in disorder to [[her]243-donna laura chamber]1304-her chamber . [The abate]624-the abate , who ascribed [her]624-the abate commotion to a sudden seizure , continued to retail the news of [Pianura]236-pianura , and [Odo]234-odo , listening with [[his]234-odo elders]1313-his elders , learned that [Count Lelio Trescorre]254-trescorre had been appointed [Master of the Horse]1314-master of the horse , to the indignation of [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , who desired the place for [[his]1234-the bishop nephew]1316-his nephew , [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto ; that [the Duke]682-the duke and [Duchess]236-pianura were never together ; that [the Duchess]899-the duchess was suspected of being in secret correspondence with [the Austrians]1319-the austrians , and that [the young Marquess of Cerveno]980-the young marquess of cerveno was gone to [the baths of [Lucca]19-lucca]1321-the baths of lucca to recover from an attack of tertian fever contracted the previous autumn at [[the Duke]682-the duke 's hunting - lodge near [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]1323-the duke 's hunting - lodge near pontesordo . [Odo]234-odo listened for some mention of [[his]234-odo humpbacked friend]1324-his humpbacked friend , or of [Momola the foundling]241-momola ; but [the abate]624-the abate 's talk kept a higher level and [no one less than a cavaliere]1326-no one less than a cavaliere figured on [his]234-odo lips . [He]234-odo was [the only visitor of quality who came that winter to [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1327-the only visitor of quality who came that winter to donnaz , and after [his]234-odo departure a fixed gloom settled on [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's spirits . Dusk at that season fell early in [the gorge]1141-the gorge , fierce winds blew off the glaciers , and [Donna Laura]243-donna laura sat shivering and lamenting on one side of the hearth , while [the old Marchioness]1115-the old marchioness , on the other , strained [her]1115-the old marchioness eyes over an embroidery in which the pattern repeated itself like the invocations of a litany , and [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso , near the smoking oil - lamp , read aloud from the Glories of [Mary]268-sister mary or the Way of [Perfection of [Saint Theresa]269-saint theresa]1330-perfection of saint theresa . On such evenings [Odo]234-odo , stealing from the tapestry parlour , would seek out [Bruno]258-bruno , who sat by the kitchen hearth with the old hound 's nose at [his]258-bruno feet . [The kitchen]569-the kitchen , indeed , on winter nights , was [the pleasantest place in [the castle]1126-the castle]1332-the pleasantest place in the castle . The fire - light from [its]569-the kitchen great stone chimney shone on the strings of maize and bunches of dried vegetables that hung from the roof and on the copper kettles and saucepans ranged along the wall . The wind raged against the shutters of the unglazed windows , and [the maid - servants]1334-the maid - servants , distaff in hand , crowded closer to the blaze , listening to the songs of [some wandering fiddler]1335-some wandering fiddler or to the stories of [a ruddy - nosed Capuchin monk who was being regaled , by the steward]1336-a ruddy - nosed capuchin monk who was being regaled , by the steward 's orders , on a supper of tripe and mulled wine . [The Capuchin]270-the capuchin 's tales , told in the Piedmontese jargon , and seasoned with strange allusions and boisterous laughter , were of little interest to [Odo]234-odo , who would creep into the ingle beside [Bruno]258-bruno and beg for some story of [[his]234-odo ancestors]1224-his ancestors . [The old man]1195-the old man was never weary of rehearsing the feats and gestures of [the lords of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1339-the lords of donnaz , and [Odo]234-odo heard again and again how [they]1339-the lords of donnaz had fought [the savage Switzers north of [the Alps]20-the alps and [[the Dauphin]271-the dauphin 's men in [the west]1342-the west]1341-the dauphin 's men in the west]1340-the savage switzers north of the alps and the dauphin 's men in the west ; how [they]1339-the lords of donnaz had marched with [Savoy]16-savoy against [Montferrat]21-montferrat and with [France]22-france against [the Republic of [Genoa]23-genoa]1343-the republic of genoa . Better still [he]234-odo liked to hear of [the Marquess Gualberto , who had been [the Duke of [Milan]14-milan 's ally]1345-the duke of milan 's ally and had brought [home]1346-home [the great Milanese painter]1199-the great milanese painter to adorn [[his]1199-the great milanese painter banqueting - room at [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1348-his banqueting - room at donnaz]1344-the marquess gualberto , who had been the duke of milan 's ally and had brought home the great milanese painter to adorn his banqueting - room at donnaz . [The lords of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1339-the lords of donnaz had never been noted for learning , and [[Odo]234-odo 's grandfather]1259-odo 's grandfather was fond of declaring that [a nobleman]1351-a nobleman need not be [a scholar]1352-a scholar ; but [the great Marquess Gualberto]255-donnaz , if [himself]255-donnaz unlettered , had been the patron of [poets and painters]1353-poets and painters and had kept [learned clerks]1354-learned clerks to write down the annals of [[his]255-donnaz house]1355-his house on parchment painted by [the monks]1356-the monks . These annals were locked in the archives , under [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso 's care ; but [Odo]234-odo learned from [the old servant]1357-the old servant that some of [the great Marquess]1358-the great marquess 's books had lain for years on an upper shelf in [the vestry off [the chapel]578-the chapel]1359-the vestry off the chapel ; and here one day , with [Bruno]258-bruno 's aid , [the little boy]692-the little boy dislodged from a corner behind the missals and altar - books certain sheepskin volumes clasped in blackened silver . The comeliest of these , which bore on [their]1362-their title - page a dolphin curled about an anchor , were printed in unknown characters ; but on opening the smaller volumes [Odo]234-odo felt the same joyous catching of the breath as when [he]234-odo had stepped out on [the garden - terrace at [Pianura]4-pianura]1363-the garden - terrace at pianura . For here indeed were gates leading to [a land of delectation]1364-a land of delectation : [the country of [the giant Morgante]1366-the giant morgante]1365-the country of the giant morgante , [the enchanted island of [Avillion]24-avillion]1367-the enchanted island of avillion , [the court of [the Soldan]272-the soldan]1368-the court of the soldan and [[the King]658-the king 's palace at [Camelot]25-camelot]1370-the king 's palace at camelot . In [this region]1371-this region [Odo]234-odo spent many blissful hours . [His]234-odo fancy ranged in the wake of [heroes]1372-heroes and [adventurers who , for all [he]234-odo knew , might still be feasting and fighting north of [the Alps]20-the alps]1373-adventurers who , for all he knew , might still be feasting and fighting north of the alps , or might any day with a blast of [their]1373-adventurers who , for all he knew , might still be feasting and fighting north of the alps magic horns summon [the porter]1374-the porter to [the gates of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1375-the gates of donnaz . Foremost among [them]1373-adventurers who , for all he knew , might still be feasting and fighting north of the alps , a figure towering above even [Rinaldo]273-rinaldo , [Arthur]274-arthur and [the Emperor Frederic]1376-the emperor frederic , was that [Conrad]275-conrad , [father of [Conradin]276-conradin]1377-father of conradin , whose sayings are set down in the old story - book of the Cento Novelle , " the flower of gentle speech . "[275-conrad] There was one tale of [King Conrad]275-conrad that [the boy]839-the boy never forgot : how [the King]658-the king , in [his]658-the king youth , had always about [him]658-the king [a company of [twelve lads of [his]658-the king own age]1381-twelve lads of his own age]1380-a company of twelve lads of his own age ; how when [Conrad]275-conrad did wrong , [[his]275-conrad governors]1382-his governors , instead of punishing [him]275-conrad , beat [[his]275-conrad twelve companions]1383-his twelve companions ; and how , on [the young King]1384-the young king 's asking what [the lads]1385-the lads were being punished for , [the pedagogues]1386-the pedagogues replied : " For [[your]1384-the young king Majesty]8238-your majesty 's offences . "[1386-the pedagogues] " And why do [you]658-the king punish [[my]1386-the pedagogues companions]8239-my companions instead of [me]1386-the pedagogues ? "[1386-the pedagogues] " Because [you]658-the king are [[our]8240-our lord]8241-our lord and [master]8242-master , "[1384-the young king] [he]1384-the young king was told . At this [the King]658-the king fell to thinking , and thereafter , it is said , in pity for those who must suffer in [his]658-the king stead [he]658-the king set close watch on [himself]658-the king , lest [his]658-the king sinning should work harm to [others]1388-others . This was the story of [King Conrad]275-conrad ; and much as [Odo]234-odo loved the clash of arms and joyous feats of [paladins]1389-paladins rescuing [fair maids]1390-fair maids in battle , yet [Conrad]275-conrad 's seemed to [him]234-odo , even then , a braver deed than these . In March of the second year [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , returning from [Turin]17-turin , was accompanied , to the surprise of all , by the fantastical figure of [an elderly gentleman in the richest travelling dress]1392-an elderly gentleman in the richest travelling dress , with one of [the new French toupets , a thin wrinkled painted face , and emitting with every movement a prodigious odour of millefleurs]1393-the new french toupets , a thin wrinkled painted face , and emitting with every movement a prodigious odour of millefleurs . [This visitor]1394-this visitor , who was attended by [[his]1131-the old marquess French barber]1395-his french barber and [two or three liveried servants]1396-two or three liveried servants , [the Marquess]1107-the marquess introduced as [the lord of [Valdu]26-valdu]1398-the lord of valdu , [a neighbouring seigneurie of no great account]1399-a neighbouring seigneurie of no great account . Though [[his]1131-the old marquess lands]1267-his lands marched with [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's , it was years since [the Count]813-the count had visited [Donnaz]255-donnaz , being [one of [[the King]658-the king 's chamberlains]1405-the king 's chamberlains and always in attendance on [[his]813-the count Majesty]1406-his majesty]1403-one of the king 's chamberlains and always in attendance on his majesty ; and it was amazing to see with what smirks and grimaces , and ejaculations in Piedmontese French , [he]813-the count complimented [the Marchioness]1174-the marchioness on [her]1174-the marchioness appearance , and exclaimed at the magnificence of [the castle]1126-the castle , which must doubtless have appeared to [him]813-the count little better than [a cattle - grange]1409-a cattle - grange . [His]813-the count talk was unintelligible to [Odo]234-odo , but there was no mistaking the nature of the glances [he]813-the count fixed on [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , who , having fled to [[her]243-donna laura room]1410-her room on [his]813-the count approach , presently descended in a ravishing new sacque , with an air of extreme surprise , and [her]243-donna laura hair curled ( as [Odo]234-odo afterward learned ) by [[the Count]813-the count 's own barber]1412-the count 's own barber . [Odo]234-odo had never seen [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother look handsomer . [She]664-his mother sparkled at [the Count]813-the count 's compliments , embraced [[her]664-his mother father]1415-her father , playfully readjusted [[her]664-his mother mother]1416-her mother 's coif , and in the prettiest way made [their]1417-their excuses to [the Count]813-the count for the cold draughts and bare floors of [the castle]1126-the castle . " For having lived at [court]8243-court [myself]664-his mother , "[664-his mother] said [she]664-his mother , " [I]664-his mother know to what [[your]813-the count excellency]8157-your excellency is accustomed , and can the better value [your]813-the count condescension in exposing [yourself]813-the count , at this rigorous season , to the hardships of [[our]1417-their mountain - top]8245-our mountain - top . "[664-his mother] [The Marquess]1107-the marquess at this began to look black , but seeing [the Count]813-the count 's pleasure in the compliment , contented [himself]1107-the marquess with calling out for dinner , which , said [he]1107-the marquess , with all respect to [[their]1417-their visitor]1422-their visitor , would stay [his]1107-the marquess stomach better than the French kick - shaws at [[his]813-the count Majesty]1406-his majesty 's table . Whether [the Count]813-the count was of the same mind , it was impossible to say , though [Odo]234-odo could not help observing that the stewed venison and spiced boar 's flesh seemed to present certain obstacles either to [his]813-the count jaws or [his]813-the count palate , and that [his]813-the count appetite lingered on the fried chicken - livers and tunny - fish in oil ; but [he]813-the count cast such looks at [Donna Laura]243-donna laura as seemed to declare that for [her]243-donna laura sake [he]813-the count would willingly have risked [his]813-the count teeth on the very cobblestones of [the court]814-the court . Knowing how [she]243-donna laura pined for company , [Odo]234-odo was not surprised at [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's complaisance ; yet wondered to see the smile with which [she]243-donna laura presently received [the Count]813-the count 's half - bantering disparagement of [Pianura]4-pianura . For [the duchy]1310-the duchy , by [his]813-the count showing , was a place of small consequence , [an asylum of superannuated fashions]1429-an asylum of superannuated fashions ; whereas [no Frenchman of quality]1430-no frenchman of quality ever visited [Turin]17-turin without exclaiming on [its]17-turin resemblance to [Paris]27-paris , and vowing that [none who had the entree of [Stupinigi]277-stupinigi]1431-none who had the entree of stupinigi need cross [the Alps]20-the alps to see [Versailles]28-versailles . As to [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's depriving [the court]814-the court of [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's presence , [[their]1107-the marquess guest]1434-their guest protested against it as an act of overt disloyalty to [the sovereign]1435-the sovereign ; and what most surprised [Odo]234-odo , who had often heard [[his]234-odo grandfather]936-his grandfather declaim against [the Count]813-the count as a cheap jackanapes that hung about [the court]814-the court for what [he]813-the count could make at play , was the indulgence with which [the Marquess]1107-the marquess received [[his]1107-the marquess visitor]1440-his visitor 's sallies . [Father]1441-father and [daughter]1442-daughter in fact vied in amenities to [the Count]813-the count . The fire was kept alight all day in [[his]813-the count rooms]1444-his rooms , [[his]813-the count Monsu]1445-his monsu waited on with singular civility by [the steward]8179-the steward , and [[Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's own woman]1447-donna laura 's own woman sent down by [[her]243-donna laura mistress]1448-her mistress to prepare [his]813-the count morning chocolate . Next day it was agreed [the gentlemen]1449-the gentlemen should ride to [Valdu]26-valdu ; but [its lord]1450-its lord being as stiff - jointed as [a marionette]1451-a marionette , [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , with charming tact , begged to be of [the party]1452-the party , and thus enabled [him]813-the count to attend [her]243-donna laura in [her]243-donna laura litter . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess thereupon called on [Odo]234-odo to ride with [him]813-the count ; and setting forth across [the mountain]1271-the mountain [they]1449-the gentlemen descended by [a long defile]1455-a long defile to [the half - ruined village of [Valdu]26-valdu]1456-the half - ruined village of valdu . Here , for the first time , [Odo]234-odo saw the spectacle of [a neglected estate]1457-a neglected estate , [its]1457-a neglected estate last penny wrung from [it]1457-a neglected estate for [the absent master]1458-the absent master 's pleasure by [a bailiff who was expected to extract [his]1459-a bailiff who was expected to extract his pay from the sale of clandestine concessions to the tenants pay from the sale of clandestine concessions to [the tenants]1460-the tenants]1459-a bailiff who was expected to extract his pay from the sale of clandestine concessions to the tenants . Riding beside [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , who swore under [his]1107-the marquess breath at the ravages of [the undyked stream]1462-the undyked stream and the sight of [good arable land run wild and choked with underbrush]1463-good arable land run wild and choked with underbrush , [the little boy]692-the little boy obtained a precocious insight into the evils of a system which had long outlived its purpose , and the idea of feudalism was ever afterward embodied for [him]234-odo in [his]234-odo glimpse of [the peasants of [Valdu]26-valdu]1465-the peasants of valdu looking up sullenly from [their]1465-the peasants of valdu work as [[their]1465-the peasants of valdu suzerain]1466-their suzerain and [protector]1467-protector thrust an unfamiliar painted smile between the curtains of [his]234-odo litter . What [[his]692-the little boy grandfather]936-his grandfather thought of [Valdu]26-valdu ( to which [the Count]813-the count on the way [home]1346-home referred with smirking apologies as [the mountain - lair of [[his]813-the count barbarous ancestors]1472-his barbarous ancestors]1471-the mountain - lair of his barbarous ancestors ) was patent enough even to [Odo]234-odo 's undeveloped perceptions ; but it would have required a more experienced understanding to detect the motive that led [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , scarce two days after [their]1474-their visit , to accord [[his]1107-the marquess daughter]1475-his daughter 's hand to [the Count]813-the count . [Odo]234-odo felt a shock of dismay on learning that [[his]692-the little boy beautiful mother]1477-his beautiful mother was to become the property of [an old gentleman whom [he]234-odo guessed to be of [[his]692-the little boy grandfather]936-his grandfather 's age , and whose enamoured grimaces recalled the antics of [her]1477-his beautiful mother favourite monkey]1478-an old gentleman whom he guessed to be of his grandfather 's age , and whose enamoured grimaces recalled the antics of her favourite monkey , and [the boy]839-the boy 's face reflected the blush of embarrassment with which [Donna Laura]243-donna laura imparted the news ; but [the children of that day]776-the children of that day were trained to a passive acquiescence , and had [she]243-donna laura informed [him]234-odo that [she]243-donna laura was to be chained in [the keep]598-the keep on bread and water , [Odo]234-odo would have accepted the fact with equal philosophy . Three weeks afterward [[his]692-the little boy mother]664-his mother and [the old Count]1484-the old count were married in [the chapel of Donnaz]1485-the chapel of donnaz , and [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , with many tears and embraces , set out for [Turin]17-turin , taking [her]243-donna laura monkey but leaving [[her]243-donna laura son]1486-her son behind . It was not till later that [Odo]234-odo learned of the social usage which compelled [young widows]1487-young widows to choose between remarriage and [the cloister]1488-the cloister ; and [his]234-odo subsequent views were unconsciously tinged by the remembrance of [[his]692-the little boy mother]664-his mother 's melancholy bridal . [Her]664-his mother departure left no traces but were speedily repaired by the coming of spring . The sun growing warmer , and the close season putting an end to [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's hunting , it was now [Odo]234-odo 's chief pleasure to carry [his]234-odo books to [the walled garden between [the castle]1126-the castle]1491-the walled garden between the castle and [the southern face of [the cliff]1151-the cliff]1493-the southern face of the cliff . [This small enclosure]1495-this small enclosure , probably a survival of medieval horticulture , had along the upper ledge of [its]1495-this small enclosure wall a grass walk commanding the flow of [the stream]1496-the stream , and an angle turret that turned one slit to [the valley]1132-the valley , the other to [the garden lying below]1498-the garden lying below like [a tranquil well of scent and brightness]1499-a tranquil well of scent and brightness : [its]1495-this small enclosure box trees clipped to the shape of peacocks and lions , its clove pinks and simples set in a border of thrift , and a pear tree basking on [its]1495-this small enclosure sunny wall . [These pleasant spaces]1500-these pleasant spaces , which [Odo]234-odo had to [himself]234-odo save when [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses walked [there]606-there to recite [their]1501-the canonesses rosary , [he]234-odo peopled with [the knights]1503-the knights and [ladies of the novelle]1504-ladies of the novelle , and the fantastic beings of [[Pulci]278-pulci 's epic]1505-pulci 's epic : there walked [the Fay Morgana]279-the fay morgana , [Regulus]280-regulus [the loyal knight]1506-the loyal knight , [the giant Morgante]1366-the giant morgante , [Trajan]281-trajan [the just Emperor]1508-the just emperor and [the proud figure of [King Conrad]275-conrad]1509-the proud figure of king conrad ; so that , escaping thither from the after - dinner dullness of the tapestry parlour , [the boy]839-the boy seemed to pass from the most oppressive solitude to a world of warmth and fellowship . 1.6 . [Odo]234-odo , who , like [all neglected children]1511-all neglected children , was quick to note in the demeanour of [[his]234-odo elders]1313-his elders any hint of a change in [his]234-odo own condition , had been keenly conscious of the effect produced at [Donnaz]7-donnaz by the news of [the Duchess of Pianura]236-pianura 's deliverance . Guided perhaps by [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's exclamation , [he]234-odo noticed an added zeal in [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso 's teachings and an unction in the manner of [[his]234-odo aunts]1514-his aunts and grandmother , who embraced [him]234-odo as though [they]1515-they were handling a relic ; while [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , though [he]1131-the old marquess took [[his]1131-the old marquess grandson]1252-his grandson seldomer on [his]1131-the old marquess rides , would sit staring at [him]234-odo with a frowning tenderness that once found vent in the growl--"Morbleu , but [he]234-odo 's too good for the tonsure ! "[1131-the old marquess] All this made it clear to [Odo]234-odo that [he]234-odo was indeed meant for [the Church]72-the church , and [he]234-odo learned without surprise that the following spring [he]234-odo was to be sent to [the seminary at [Asti]291-asti]1518-the seminary at asti . With a view to prepare [him]234-odo for this change , [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses suggested [his]234-odo attending [them]1501-the canonesses that year on [their]1501-the canonesses annual pilgrimage to [the sanctuary of [Oropa]31-oropa]1520-the sanctuary of oropa . Thither , for every feast of [the Assumption]1521-the assumption , [these pious ladies]1522-these pious ladies travelled in [their]1522-these pious ladies litter ; and [Odo]234-odo had heard from [them]1522-these pious ladies many tales of [the miraculous Black Virgin who drew thousands to [[her]1523-the miraculous black virgin who drew thousands to her shrine among the mountains shrine among [the mountains]944-the mountains]1524-her shrine among the mountains]1523-the miraculous black virgin who drew thousands to her shrine among the mountains . [They]1522-these pious ladies set forth in August , two days before the feast , ascending through [chestnut groves]1526-chestnut groves to [the region of bare rocks]1527-the region of bare rocks ; thence downward across torrents hung with white acacia and along park - like grassy levels deep in shade . The lively air , the murmur of verdure , the perfume of mown grass in [the meadows]1528-the meadows and the sweet call of the cuckoos from every thicket made an enchantment of the way ; but [Odo]234-odo 's pleasure redoubled when , gaining [the high - road to [Oropa]31-oropa]1529-the high - road to oropa , [they]1522-these pious ladies mingled with the long train of [devotees]1530-devotees ascending from [the plain]1139-the plain . Here were [pilgrims of every condition]1532-pilgrims of every condition , from [the noble lady of [Turin]17-turin]1533-the noble lady of turin or [Asti]291-asti ( for it was the favourite pilgrimage of [the Sardinian court]1534-the sardinian court ) , attended by [[her]1533-the noble lady of turin physician]1535-her physician and [[her]1533-the noble lady of turin cicisbeo]1536-her cicisbeo , to [the half - naked goatherd of [Val Sesia]32-val sesia or [Salluzzo]33-salluzzo]1537-the half - naked goatherd of val sesia or salluzzo ; [the cheerful farmers of [the Milanese]1539-the milanese]1538-the cheerful farmers of the milanese , with [[their]1538-the cheerful farmers of the milanese wives]639-their wives , in silver necklaces and hairpins , riding pillion on plump white asses ; [sick persons travelling in closed litters or carried on hand - stretchers]1541-sick persons travelling in closed litters or carried on hand - stretchers ; [crippled beggars]1542-crippled beggars obtruding [their]1542-crippled beggars deformities ; [confraternities of hooded penitents]1543-confraternities of hooded penitents , [Franciscans]1544-franciscans , [Capuchins]1545-capuchins and [Poor Clares]1546-poor clares in dusty companies ; [jugglers]1547-jugglers , [pedlars]1548-pedlars , [Egyptians]1549-egyptians and [sellers of drugs and amulets]1550-sellers of drugs and amulets . From among these , as [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses ' litter jogged along , [an odd figure]1552-an odd figure advanced toward [Odo]234-odo , who had obtained leave to do the last mile of the journey on foot . This was [a plump abate in tattered ecclesiastical dress]1553-a plump abate in tattered ecclesiastical dress , [his]234-odo shoes white as [a miller]1554-a miller 's and the perspiration streaking [his]234-odo face as [he]234-odo laboured along in the dust . [He]234-odo accosted [Odo]234-odo in a soft shrill voice , begging leave to walk beside [the young cavaliere]1555-the young cavaliere , whom [he]234-odo had more than once had the honour of seeing at [Pianura]4-pianura ; and , in reply to [the boy]839-the boy 's surprised glance , added , with a swelling of the chest and an absurd gesture of self - introduction , " But perhaps [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere is not too young to have heard of [the illustrious Cantapresto]8247-the illustrious cantapresto , [late primo soprano of [the ducal theatre of [Pianura]4-pianura]8249-the ducal theatre of pianura]8248-late primo soprano of the ducal theatre of pianura ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo being obliged to avow [his]234-odo ignorance , [the fat creature]1557-the fat creature mopped [his]234-odo brow and continued with a gasp--"Ah , [[your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency , what is fame ? From glory to obscurity is no farther than from one milestone to another ! Not eight years ago , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , [I]1557-the fat creature was followed through [the streets of [Pianura]4-pianura]8252-the streets of pianura by [a greater crowd than [the Duke]682-the duke ever drew after [him]234-odo]8253-a greater crowd than the duke ever drew after him ! But what then ? The voice goes -- it lasts no longer than the bloom of a flower -- and with it goes everything : fortune , credit , consideration , [friends]8255-friends and [parasites]8256-parasites ! Not eight years ago , [sir]8257-sir -- would [you]234-odo believe me?--I was supping nightly in private with [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , who had nearly quarrelled with [[his]1234-the bishop late Highness for carrying [me]1557-the fat creature off by force one evening to [[his]1234-the bishop casino]8260-his casino]8259-his late highness for carrying me off by force one evening to his casino ; [I]1557-the fat creature was heaped with dignities and favours ; [all the poets in [the town]593-the town]8261-all the poets in the town composed sonnets in [my]1557-the fat creature honour ; [the Marquess of [Trescorre]254-trescorre]8263-the marquess of trescorre fought a duel about [me]1557-the fat creature with [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's nephew]8265-the bishop 's nephew , [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto ; [I]1557-the fat creature attended [[his]1234-the bishop lordship]8266-his lordship to [Rome]11-rome ; [I]1557-the fat creature spent the villeggiatura at [[his]1234-the bishop villa]8267-his villa , where [I]1557-the fat creature sat at play with [the highest nobles in [the land]8269-the land]8268-the highest nobles in the land ; yet when [my]1557-the fat creature voice went , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , it was on [my]1557-the fat creature knees [I]1557-the fat creature had to beg of [[my]1557-the fat creature heartless patron]8271-my heartless patron the paltry favour of the minor orders ! "[1557-the fat creature] Tears were running down the abate 's cheeks , and [he]1558-he paused to wipe them with a corner of tattered bands . Though [Odo]234-odo had been bred in an abhorrence of [the theatre]1559-the theatre , [the strange creature]1560-the strange creature 's aspect so pricked [his]1558-he compassion that [he]1558-he asked [him]1558-he what [he]1558-he was now engaged in ; at which [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto piteously cried , " Alas , what am [I]267-cantapresto not engaged in , if the occasion offers ? For whatever [a man]8112-a man 's habit , [he]8112-a man will not wear it long if it cover an empty belly ; and [he]8112-a man that respects [his]8112-a man calling must find food enough to continue in it . But as for [me]267-cantapresto , [sir]8257-sir , [I]267-cantapresto have put a hand to every trade , from composing scenarios for [the ducal company of [Pianura]4-pianura]8274-the ducal company of pianura , to writing satirical sonnets for [noblemen that desire to pass for wits]8275-noblemen that desire to pass for wits . [I]267-cantapresto 've a pretty taste , too , in compiling almanacks , and when nothing else served [I]267-cantapresto have played [the public scrivener]8276-the public scrivener at [the street corner]8277-the street corner ; nay , [sir]8257-sir , necessity has even driven [me]267-cantapresto to hold the candle in one or two transactions [I]267-cantapresto would not more actively have mixed in ; and it was to efface the remembrance of one of these -- for [my]267-cantapresto conscience is still over - nice for [my]267-cantapresto condition -- that [I]267-cantapresto set out on this laborious pilgrimage . "[267-cantapresto] Much of this was unintelligible to [Odo]234-odo ; but [he]234-odo was moved by any mention of [Pianura]236-pianura , and in the abate 's first pause [he]234-odo risked the question--"Do [you]234-odo know [the hump - backed boy Brutus]8279-the hump - backed boy brutus ? "[234-odo] [[His]234-odo companion]840-his companion stared and pursed [his]840-his companion soft lips . " [Brutus]251-brutus ? "[234-odo] says [he]234-odo . " [Brutus]251-brutus ? Is [he]251-brutus about [[the Duke]682-the duke 's person]8281-the duke 's person ? "[234-odo] " [He]251-brutus lives in [the palace]768-the palace , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo doubtfully . [The fat ecclesiastic]1562-the fat ecclesiastic clapped a hand to [his]234-odo thigh . " Can it be [[your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency has in mind [the foundling boy]8284-the foundling boy [Carlo Gamba]282-gamba ? Does [the jackanapes]8285-the jackanapes call [himself]8285-the jackanapes [Brutus]251-brutus now ? [He]8285-the jackanapes was always full of [his]8285-the jackanapes classical allusions ! Why , [sir]8257-sir , [I]1562-the fat ecclesiastic think [I]1562-the fat ecclesiastic know [him]8285-the jackanapes very well ; [he]8285-the jackanapes is even rumoured to be a brother of [Don Lelio Trescorre]245-don lelio 's , and [I]1562-the fat ecclesiastic believe [the Duke]682-the duke has lately given [him]8285-the jackanapes to [the Marquess of [Cerveno]394-cerveno]8288-the marquess of cerveno , for [I]1562-the fat ecclesiastic saw [him]8285-the jackanapes not long since in [[the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's livery at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]8290-the marquess 's livery at pontesordo . "[1562-the fat ecclesiastic] " [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo ? "[234-odo] cried [Odo]234-odo . " It was [there]606-there [I]234-odo lived . "[234-odo] " Did [you]1562-the fat ecclesiastic indeed , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere ? But [I]1562-the fat ecclesiastic think [you]1562-the fat ecclesiastic will have been at [[the Duke]682-the duke 's manor]8294-the duke 's manor of that name ; and it was [the hunting - lodge on the edge of the chase]8295-the hunting - lodge on the edge of the chase that [I]1562-the fat ecclesiastic had in mind . [The Marquess]255-donnaz uses [it]8295-the hunting - lodge on the edge of the chase , [I]1562-the fat ecclesiastic believe , as a kind of casino ; though not without risk of [a distemper]8296-a distemper . Indeed , there is much wonder at [his]255-donnaz frequenting [it]8295-the hunting - lodge on the edge of the chase , and ' tis said [he]255-donnaz does so against [the Duke]682-the duke 's wishes . "[1562-the fat ecclesiastic] The name of [Pontesordo]241-momola had set [Odo]234-odo 's memories humming like a hive of bees , and without heeding [[his]234-odo companion]840-his companion 's allusions [he]234-odo asked--"And did [you]905-the other see [the Momola]241-momola ? "[905-the other] [The other]905-the other looked [his]234-odo perplexity . " [She]241-momola 's [an Innocent]8298-an innocent too , "[905-the other] [Odo]234-odo hastened to explain . " [She]241-momola is [[Filomena]229-filomena 's servant at [the farm]565-the farm]8299-filomena 's servant at the farm . "[234-odo] The abate at this , standing still in [the road]726-the road , screwed up [his]234-odo eyelids and protruded a relishing lip . " Eh , eh , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " [the girl from [the farm]565-the farm]8301-the girl from the farm , [you]8303-you say ? "[234-odo] And [he]234-odo gave a chuckle . " [You]8303-you 've an eye , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , [you]8303-you 've an eye , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , [his]234-odo soft body shaking with enjoyment ; but before [Odo]234-odo could make a guess at [his]234-odo meaning [their]1566-their conversation was interrupted by a sharp call from the litter . [The abate]624-the abate at once disappeared in [the crowd]1568-the crowd , and a moment later the litter had debouched on [the grassy quadrangle]1569-the grassy quadrangle before [the outer gates of [the monastery]1571-the monastery]1570-the outer gates of the monastery . [This space]1572-this space was set in beech - woods , amid which gleamed [the white - pillared chapels of the Way of the Cross]1573-the white - pillared chapels of the way of the cross ; and [the devouter pilgrims]1574-the devouter pilgrims , dispersed beneath the trees , were ascending from [one chapel]1575-one chapel to another , preparatory to entering [the church]1212-the church . [The quadrangle]1577-the quadrangle itself was crowded with [people]1578-people , and the sellers of votive offerings , in [[their]1579-their booths]1580-their booths roofed with acacia - boughs , were driving a noisy trade in scapulars and Agnus Deis , images of the Black Virgin of [Oropa]31-oropa , silver hearts and crosses , and phials of Jordan water warranted to effect the immediate conversion of [Jews]1581-jews and [heretics]1582-heretics . In one corner [a Carmelite missionary]1583-a carmelite missionary had set up [his]1583-a carmelite missionary portable pulpit , and , crucifix in hand , was exhorting [the crowd]1568-the crowd ; in another , an improvisatore intoned canticles to [the miraculous Virgin]1585-the miraculous virgin ; [a barefoot friar]1586-a barefoot friar sat selling indulgences at the monastery gate , and [pedlars with trays of rosaries and religious prints]1587-pedlars with trays of rosaries and religious prints pushed [their]1587-pedlars with trays of rosaries and religious prints way among [the pilgrims]1588-the pilgrims . [Young women of less pious aspect]1589-young women of less pious aspect solicited the attention of [the better - dressed travellers]1590-the better - dressed travellers , and [jugglers , mountebanks and quacks of every description]1591-jugglers , mountebanks and quacks of every description hung on the outskirts of [the square]1592-the square . The sight speedily turned [Odo]234-odo 's thought from [[his]234-odo late companion]1593-his late companion , and the litter coming to a halt [he]234-odo was leaning forward to observe the antics of [a tumbler who had spread [his]1594-a tumbler who had spread his carpet beneath the trees carpet beneath the trees]1594-a tumbler who had spread his carpet beneath the trees , when [the abate]624-the abate 's face suddenly rose to the surface of [the throng]1596-the throng and [his]1594-a tumbler who had spread his carpet beneath the trees hand thrust a crumpled paper between the curtains of the litter . [Odo]234-odo was quick - witted enough to capture this missive without attracting the notice of [[his]234-odo grand - aunts]1597-his grand - aunts , and stealing a glance at it , [he]234-odo read--"Cavaliere , [I]234-odo starve . When [the illustrious ladies]8305-the illustrious ladies descend , for [Christ]264-christ 's sake beg a scudo of [them]8305-the illustrious ladies for the unhappy Cantapresto . "[234-odo] By this the litter had disengaged itself and was moving toward the outer gates . [Odo]234-odo , aware of the disfavour with which [the theatre]1559-the theatre was viewed at [Donnaz]255-donnaz , and unable to guess how far [the soprano]1599-the soprano 's present habit would be held to palliate the scandal of [his]234-odo former connection , was perplexed how to communicate [his]234-odo petition to [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses . A moment later , however , the question solved itself ; for as [the aunts]1601-the aunts descended at the door of [[the rector]1602-the rector 's lodging]1603-the rector 's lodging , [the porter]1374-the porter , running to meet [them]1601-the aunts , stumbled on a black mass under the arcade , and raised the cry that here was [a man dropped dead]1605-a man dropped dead . [A crowd gathering]1606-a crowd gathering , [some one]1607-some one called out that it was [an ecclesiastic had fallen]1608-an ecclesiastic had fallen ; whereat [the great - aunts]1609-the great - aunts were hurrying forward when [Odo]234-odo whispered [the eldest]1610-the eldest , [Donna Livia]283-donna livia , that [the sick man]1611-the sick man was indeed an abate from [Pianura]4-pianura . [Donna Livia]283-donna livia immediately bid [[her]283-donna livia servants]1612-her servants lift [him]1611-the sick man into [[the porter]1374-the porter 's lodge]1614-the porter 's lodge , where , with the administering of spirits , [the poor soprano]1615-the poor soprano presently revived and cast a drowning glance about [the chamber]1124-the chamber . " Eight years ago , [illustrious ladies]8306-illustrious ladies , "[1611-the sick man] [he]1611-the sick man gurgled , " [I]1611-the sick man had nearly died one night of a surfeit of ortolans ; and now it is of a surfeit of emptiness that [I]1611-the sick man am perishing . "[1611-the sick man] [The ladies]1106-the ladies at this , with exclamations of pity , called on [the lay - brothers]1618-the lay - brothers for broth and cordials , and bidding [the porter]1374-the porter enquire more particularly into the history of [the unhappy ecclesiastic]1620-the unhappy ecclesiastic , hastened away with [Odo]234-odo to [[the rector]1602-the rector 's parlour]1622-the rector 's parlour . Next morning betimes all were afoot for the procession , which [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses were to witness from the monastery windows . [The apothecary]1624-the apothecary had brought word that [the abate , whose seizure was indeed the result of hunger]1625-the abate , whose seizure was indeed the result of hunger , was still too weak to rise ; and [Donna Livia]283-donna livia , eager to open [her]283-donna livia devotions with an act of pity , pressed a sequin in [the man]1626-the man 's hand , and bid [him]1626-the man spare no care for [the sufferer]1627-the sufferer 's comfort . This sent [Odo]234-odo in a cheerful mood to the red - hung windows , whence , peering between the folds of [[his]234-odo aunts]1514-his aunts ' gala habits , [he]234-odo admired the great court enclosed in nobly - ordered cloisters and strewn with fresh herbs and flowers . [Thence one of [[the rector]1602-the rector 's chaplains]1631-the rector 's chaplains]1629-thence one of the rector 's chaplains conducted [them]1632-them to [the church]1212-the church , placing [them]1632-them , in company with [[the monastery]1571-the monastery 's other noble guests]1635-the monastery 's other noble guests , in [a tribune constructed above [the choir]1637-the choir]1636-a tribune constructed above the choir . It was [Odo]234-odo 's first sight of a great religious ceremony , and as [he]234-odo looked down on [the church]1212-the church glimmering with votive offerings and gold - fringed draperies , and seen through rolling incense in which the altar - candles swam like stars reflected in [a river]1639-a river , [he]234-odo felt an almost sensual thrill of pleasure at the thought that [his]234-odo life was to be passed amid scenes of such mystic beauty . The sweet singing of [the choir]1637-the choir raised [his]234-odo spirit to a higher view of the scene ; and the sight of the huddled misery on the floor of [the church]1212-the church revived in [him]234-odo the old longing for the Franciscan cowl . From these raptures [he]234-odo was speedily diverted by the sight awaiting [him]234-odo at the conclusion of the mass . Hardly had [the spectators]1642-the spectators returned to [the rector]1602-the rector 's windows when , the doors of [the church]1212-the church swinging open , a procession headed by [the rector]1602-the rector [himself]1602-the rector descended the steps and began to make the circuit of [the court]814-the court . [Odo]234-odo 's eyes swam with the splendour of this burst of banners , images and jewelled reliquaries , surmounting the long train of tonsured heads and bathed in a light almost blinding after the mild penumbra of [the church]1212-the church . As [the monks]1356-the monks advanced , [the pilgrims]1588-the pilgrims , pouring after [them]1356-the monks , filled [the court]814-the court with a dark undulating mass through which the procession wound like a ray of sunlight down [the brown bosom of a torrent]1651-the brown bosom of a torrent . Branches of oleander swung in the air , devout cries hailed the approach of the Black Madonna 's canopy , and hoarse voices swelled to a roar the measured litanies of [the friars]1652-the friars . The ceremonies over , [Odo]234-odo , with [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses , set out to visit [the chapels studding [the beech - knoll]1655-the beech - knoll above [the monastic buildings]1656-the monastic buildings]1654-the chapels studding the beech - knoll above the monastic buildings . Passing out of [[Juvara]284-juvara 's great portico]1657-juvara 's great portico [they]1658-they stood a moment above [the grassy common]1659-the grassy common , which presented a scene in curious contrast to that [they]1658-they had just quitted . [Here refreshment - booths]1660-here refreshment - booths had been set up , [musicians]1661-musicians were fiddling , [jugglers]1547-jugglers unrolling [their]1547-jugglers carpets , [dentists]1663-dentists shouting out the merits of [their]1663-dentists panaceas , and light women drinking with [the liveried servants of [the nobility]1665-the nobility]1664-the liveried servants of the nobility . [The very cripples who had groaned the loudest in [church]1667-church]1666-the very cripples who had groaned the loudest in church now rollicked with [the mountebanks]1668-the mountebanks and [dancers]1669-dancers ; and no trace remained of the celebration just concluded but the medals and relics strung about the necks of those engaged in these gross diversions . It was strange to pass from this scene to the solitude of [the grove]1670-the grove , where , in a twilight rustling with streams , [the chapels]1671-the chapels lifted [their]1671-the chapels white porches . Peering through the grated door of [each little edifice]1672-each little edifice , [Odo]234-odo beheld within a group of terra - cotta figures representing some scene of the Passion -- here a Last Supper , with a tigerish [Judas]285-judas and [a Saint John]1673-a saint john resting [his]1673-a saint john yellow curls on [his]1673-a saint john Master 's bosom , there an Entombment or a group of stricken [Maries]286-maries . These figures , though rudely modelled and daubed with bright colours , yet , by a vivacity of attitude and gesture which the mystery of their setting enhanced , conveyed a thrilling impression of the sacred scenes set forth ; and [Odo]234-odo was yet at an age when the distinction between flesh - and - blood and its plastic counterfeits is not clearly defined , or when at least the sculptured image is still a mysterious half - sentient thing , denizen of some strange borderland between art and life . It seemed to [him]234-odo , as [he]234-odo gazed through the chapel gratings , that those long - distant episodes of the divine tragedy had been here preserved in some miraculous state of suspended animation , and as [he]234-odo climbed from [one shrine]1674-one shrine to another [he]234-odo had the sense of treading the actual stones of Gethsemane and [Calvary]287-calvary . As was usual with [him]234-odo , the impressions of the moment had effaced those preceding it , and it was almost with surprise that , at [the rector]1602-the rector 's door , [he]234-odo beheld [the primo soprano of [Pianura]236-pianura]1676-the primo soprano of pianura totter forth to the litter and offer [his]234-odo knee as a step for [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses . [The charitable ladies]1678-the charitable ladies cried out on [him]234-odo for this imprudence , and [his]234-odo pallor still giving evidence of distress , [he]234-odo was bidden to wait on [them]1678-the charitable ladies after supper with [his]234-odo story . [He]234-odo presented [himself]234-odo promptly in [the parlour]1679-the parlour , and being questioned as to [his]234-odo condition at once rashly proclaimed [his]234-odo former connection with [the ducal theatre of [Pianura]4-pianura]8249-the ducal theatre of pianura . No avowal could have been more disastrous to [his]234-odo cause . [The canonesses]1501-the canonesses crossed [themselves]1501-the canonesses with horror , and [the abate]624-the abate , seeing [his]234-odo mistake , hastened to repair it by exclaiming--"What , [ladies]8307-ladies , would [you]8307-ladies punish [me]624-the abate for following a vocation to which [[my]624-the abate frivolous parents]8308-my frivolous parents condemned [me]624-the abate when [I]624-the abate was too young to resist [their]8308-my frivolous parents purpose ? And have not [my]624-the abate subsequent sufferings , [my]624-the abate penances and pilgrimages , and the state to which [they]8308-my frivolous parents have reduced [me]624-the abate , sufficiently effaced the record of an involuntary error ? "[624-the abate] Seeing the effect of this appeal [the abate]624-the abate made haste to follow up [his]234-odo advantage . " Ah , [illustrious ladies]8306-illustrious ladies , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , " am [I]1684-i not a living example of the fate of [those who leave all to follow righteousness]8310-those who leave all to follow righteousness ? For while [I]1684-i remained on [the stage]8311-the stage , among the most dissolute surroundings , fortune showered [me]1684-i with every benefit [she]8306-illustrious ladies heaps on [her]8306-illustrious ladies favourites . [I]1684-i had [my]1684-i seat at every table in [Pianura]4-pianura ; [the Duke]682-the duke 's chair to carry [me]1684-i to [the theatre]1559-the theatre ; and more money than [I]1684-i could devise how to spend ; while now that [I]1684-i have resigned [my]1684-i calling to embrace the religious life , [you]8314-you see [me]1684-i reduced to begging a crust from [the very mendicants [I]1684-i formerly nourished]8315-the very mendicants i formerly nourished . For , "[1684-i] said [he]1684-i , moved to tears by [his]1684-i own recital , " [my]1684-i superfluity was always spent in buying the prayers of [the unfortunate]8316-the unfortunate , and to judge how [I]1684-i was esteemed by those acquainted with [my]1684-i private behaviour [you]8314-you need only learn that , on [my]1684-i renouncing [the stage]8311-the stage , ' twas [the Bishop of [Pianura]4-pianura]8318-the bishop of pianura who [himself]8318-the bishop of pianura accorded [me]1684-i the tonsure . "[1684-i] This discourse , which [Odo]234-odo admired for its adroitness , visibly excited the commiseration of [the ladies]1106-the ladies ; but at mention of [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , [Donna Livia]283-donna livia exchanged a glance with [[her]283-donna livia sister]1687-her sister , who enquired , with a quaint air of astuteness , " But how comes it , abate , that with so powerful a protector [you]1684-i have been exposed to such incredible reverses ? "[1687-her sister] [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto rolled a meaning eye . " Alas , [madam]8129-madam , it was through [[my]1688-me protector]8320-my protector that misfortune attacked [me]1688-me ; for [[his]8320-my protector lordship]8266-his lordship having appointed [me]1688-me secretary to [[his]8320-my protector favourite nephew]8322-his favourite nephew , [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto , that imprudent nobleman required of [me]1688-me services so incompatible with [my]1688-me cloth that disobedience became a duty ; whereupon , not satisfied with dismissing [me]1688-me in disgrace , [he]8320-my protector punished [me]1688-me by blackening [my]1688-me character to [[his]8320-my protector uncle]8323-his uncle . To defend [myself]1688-me was to traduce [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto ; and rather than reveal [his]267-cantapresto courses to [the Bishop]1234-the bishop [I]1688-me sank to the state in which [you]8325-you see [me]1688-me ; a state , "[1688-me] [he]1688-me added with emotion , " that [I]1688-me have travelled this long way to commend to the adorable pity of [[Her]8326-her whose Son]8327-her whose son had not where to lay [His]1688-me head . "[1688-me] This stroke visibly touched [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses , still soft from the macerations of the morning ; and [Donna Livia]283-donna livia compassionately asked how [he]1688-me had subsisted since [his]1688-me rupture with [the Bishop]1234-the bishop . " [Madam]8129-madam , by the sale of [my]283-donna livia talents in any service not at odds with [my]283-donna livia calling : as the compiling of pious almanacks , the inditing of rhymed litanies and canticles , and even the construction of theatrical [pieces"--the[283-donna livia] ladies]8329-pieces"--the ladies lifted hands of reprobation--"of theatrical pieces , "[267-cantapresto] [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto impressively repeated , " for the use of [the Carmelite nuns of [Pianura]4-pianura]8330-the carmelite nuns of pianura . But , "[1688-me] said [he]1688-me with a deprecating smile , " the wages of virtue are less liberal than those of sin , and spite of a versatility [I]1688-me think [I]1688-me may honestly claim , [I]1688-me have often had to subsist on the gifts of [the pious]8331-the pious , and sometimes , [madam]8129-madam , to starve on [their]1501-the canonesses compassion . "[1688-me] This ready discourse , and [the soprano]1599-the soprano 's evident distress , so worked on [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses that , having little money at [their]1501-the canonesses disposal , it was fixed , after some private consultation , that [he]1688-me should attend [them]1501-the canonesses to [Donnaz]255-donnaz , where [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso , in consideration of [his]261-don gervaso edifying conduct in renouncing the stage , might be interested in helping [him]261-don gervaso to a situation ; and when [the little party]1693-the little party set forth from [Oropa]31-oropa , [the abate Cantapresto]1694-the abate cantapresto closed the procession on one of the baggage - mules , with [Odo]234-odo riding pillion at [his]1688-me back . Good fortune loosened [the poor soprano]1615-the poor soprano 's tongue , and as soon as [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses ' litter was a safe distance ahead [he]1688-me began to beguile the way with fragments of reminiscence and adventure .
