Though few of [his]1688-me allusions were clear to [Odo]234-odo , the glimpse [they]1501-the canonesses gave of the motley theatrical life of [the north Italian cities]1697-the north italian cities -- the quarrels between [Goldoni]288-goldoni and [the supporters of the expiring commedia dell ' arte]1698-the supporters of the expiring commedia dell ' arte -- the rivalries of [the prime donne]1699-the prime donne and the arrogance of [the popular comedians]1700-the popular comedians -- all these peeps into a tinsel world of mirth , cabal and folly , enlivened by the recurring names of the Four Masks , [those lingering gods of the older dispensation]1701-those lingering gods of the older dispensation , so lured [the boy]839-the boy 's fancy and set free [his]839-the boy vagrant wonder , that [he]839-the boy was almost sorry to see [the keep of [Donnaz]255-donnaz]1703-the keep of donnaz reddening in the second evening 's sunset . Such regrets , however , [their]1501-the canonesses arrival at [the castle]1126-the castle soon effaced ; for in the doorway stood [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , a letter in hand , who springing forward caught [[his]1131-the old marquess grandson]1252-his grandson by the shoulders , and cried with [his]1131-the old marquess great boar - hunting shout , " [Cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , [you]8111-cavaliere are [heir - presumptive of [Pianura]4-pianura]8334-heir - presumptive of pianura ! "[1131-the old marquess] 1.7 . [The Marquess of [Cerveno]394-cerveno]8288-the marquess of cerveno had succumbed to the tertian ague contracted at [the hunting - lodge of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]1708-the hunting - lodge of pontesordo ; and this unforeseen calamity left but one life , that of [the sickly ducal infant]1709-the sickly ducal infant , between [Odo]234-odo and the succession to the throne of [Pianura]4-pianura . Such was the news conveyed post - haste from [Turin]17-turin by [Donna Laura]243-donna laura ; who added [the Duke]682-the duke 's express wish that [[his]682-the duke young kinsman]1711-his young kinsman should be fitted for the secular career , and the information that [Count Valdu]289-count valdu had already entered [[his]289-count valdu stepson]1712-his stepson 's name at [the Royal Academy of [Turin]17-turin]35-the royal academy of turin . [The Duke of [Pianura]290-pianura]290-pianura being young and in good health , and [[his]290-pianura wife]1713-his wife having already given [him]290-pianura an heir , [the most sanguine imagination]1714-the most sanguine imagination could hardly view [Odo]234-odo as being brought much nearer the succession ; yet the change in [his]234-odo condition was striking enough to excuse the fancy of those about [him]234-odo for shaping the future to [their]1715-their liking . [The priestling]1716-the priestling was to turn [courtier]1717-courtier and perhaps [soldier]1718-soldier ; [Asti]291-asti was to be exchanged for [Turin]17-turin , [the seminary for [the academy]1720-the academy]1719-the seminary for the academy ; and even [the old chief of [Donnaz]255-donnaz]1721-the old chief of donnaz betrayed in [his]1721-the old chief of donnaz grumbling counsels to [the boy]839-the boy a sense of the exalted future in which [they]1715-their might some day serve [him]234-odo . The preparations of departure and the wonder of [his]234-odo new state left [Odo]234-odo little space wherein to store [his]234-odo thought with impressions of what [he]234-odo was leaving ; and it was only in after years , when the accretion of superficial incident had dropped from [his]234-odo past , that those last days at [Donnaz]255-donnaz gained their full distinctness . [He]234-odo saw [them]1723-them then , heavy with the warmth of the long summer , from the topmost pine - belt to the bronzed vineyards turning their metallic clusters to the sun ; and in the midst [his]234-odo small bewildered figure , netted in a web of association , and seeming , as [he]234-odo broke away , to leave a shred of [himself]234-odo in every corner of [the castle]1126-the castle . Sharpest of all , there remained with [him]234-odo the vision of [his]234-odo last hour with [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso . The news of [Odo]234-odo 's changed condition had been received in silence by [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain . [He]234-odo was not [the man to waste words]1726-the man to waste words and [he]234-odo knew the futility of asserting [the Church]1212-the church 's claim to [the heir - presumptive of [a reigning house]1729-a reigning house]1728-the heir - presumptive of a reigning house . Therefore if [he]234-odo showed no enthusiasm [he]234-odo betrayed no resentment ; but , the evening before [the boy]839-the boy 's departure , led [him]234-odo , still in silence , to [the chapel]578-the chapel . Here [the priest]1732-the priest knelt with [Odo]234-odo ; then , raising [him]234-odo , sat on one of the benches facing the high altar , and spoke a few grave words . " [You]234-odo are setting out , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " on a way far different from that in which it has been [my]234-odo care to guide [you]234-odo ; yet [the high road]8335-the high road and [the mountain path]8336-the mountain path may , by diverse windings , lead to the same point ; and whatever walk [a man]8112-a man chooses , it will surely carry [him]8112-a man to the end that [God]249-god has appointed . If [you]234-odo are called to serve [Him]249-god in [the world]844-the world , the journey on which [you]234-odo are now starting may lead [you]234-odo to [the throne of [Pianura]4-pianura]8339-the throne of pianura ; but even so , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo went on , " there is this [I]234-odo would have [you]234-odo remember : that should this dignity come to [you]234-odo it may come as a calamity rather than a joy ; for when [God]249-god confers earthly honours on [a child of]608-a child of [His]249-god predilection , [He]249-god sometimes deigns to render them as innocuous as misfortune ; and [my]234-odo chief prayer for [you]234-odo is that [you]234-odo should be raised to this eminence , it may be at a moment when such advancement seems to thrust [you]234-odo in the dust . "[234-odo] The words burned themselves into [Odo]234-odo 's heart like [some mystic writing on the walls of memory , long afterward to start into fiery meaning]1733-some mystic writing on the walls of memory , long afterward to start into fiery meaning . At the time [he]234-odo felt only that [the priest]1732-the priest spoke with a power and dignity [no human authority]1735-no human authority could give ; and for a moment all the stored influences of [his]234-odo faith reached out to [him]234-odo from the dimly - gleaming altar . The next sun rose on [a new world]1736-a new world . [He]234-odo was to set out at daylight , and dawn found [him]234-odo at the casement , footing it in thought down [the road]726-the road as yet undistinguishable in a dying glimmer of stars . [Bruno]258-bruno was to attend [him]234-odo to [Turin]17-turin ; but [one of [the women]823-the women]1738-one of the women presently brought word that [the old huntsman]1740-the old huntsman 's rheumatism had caught [him]234-odo in the knee , and that [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , resolved not to delay [[his]1107-the marquess grandson]1252-his grandson 's departure , had chosen [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto as [[the boy]839-the boy 's companion]1744-the boy 's companion . [The courtyard]1745-the courtyard , when [Odo]234-odo descended , fairly bubbled with the voluble joy of the fat soprano , who was giving directions to [the servants]755-the servants , receiving commissions and instructions from [the aunts]1601-the aunts , assuring [everybody]1748-everybody of [his]234-odo undying devotion to [the heir - presumptive of [Pianura]290-pianura]1749-the heir - presumptive of pianura , and citing impressive instances of the responsibilities with which the great of [the earth]1750-the earth had formerly entrusted [him]234-odo . As a companion for [Odo]234-odo [the abate]624-the abate was clearly not to [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso 's taste ; but [he]261-don gervaso stood silent , turning the comment of a cool eye on [the soprano]1599-the soprano 's protestations , and saying only , as [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto swept [the company]1753-the company into the circle of an obsequious farewell:--"Remember , [signor abate]8341-signor abate , it is to [your]8341-signor abate cloth this business is entrusted . "[261-don gervaso] [The abate]624-the abate 's answer was a rush of purple to the forehead ; but [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso imperturbably added , " And [you]8341-signor abate lie but one night on [the road]726-the road . "[261-don gervaso] Meanwhile [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , visibly moved , was charging [Odo]234-odo to respect [[his]234-odo elders]1313-his elders and [superiors]1757-superiors , while in the same breath warning [him]234-odo not to take up with the Frenchified notions of [the court]814-the court , but to remember that for [a lad of]1759-a lad of [his]234-odo condition the chief virtues were a tight seat in the saddle , a quick hand on the sword and a slow tongue in counsel . " Mind [your]8341-signor abate own business , "[261-don gervaso] [he]261-don gervaso concluded , " and see that [others]1388-others mind [theirs]1388-others . "[261-don gervaso] [The Marchioness]1174-the marchioness thereupon , with many tears , hung a scapular about [Odo]234-odo 's neck , bidding [him]234-odo shun [the theatre]1559-the theatre and be regular at confession ; [one of [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses]1762-one of the canonesses reminded [him]234-odo not to omit a visit to [the chapel of the Holy Winding - sheet]1764-the chapel of the holy winding - sheet , while [the other]905-the other begged [him]234-odo to burn a candle for [her]1174-the marchioness at [the Consolata]36-the consolata ; and [the servants]755-the servants pressed forward to embrace and bless [[their]755-the servants little master]1767-their little master . Day was high by this , and as [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's travelling - chariot rumbled down [the valley]1132-the valley the shadows seemed to fly before it . [Odo]234-odo at first lay numb ; but presently [his]234-odo senses woke to the call of the brightening landscape . The scene was such as [Salvator]292-salvator might have painted : wild blocks of stone heaped under walnut - shade ; here the white plunge of water down a wall of granite , and there , in bluer depths , a charcoal burner 's hut sending up [its]1770-its spiral of smoke to the dark raftering of branches . Though it was but a few hours since [Odo]234-odo had travelled from [Oropa]31-oropa , years seemed to have passed over [him]234-odo , and [he]234-odo saw [the world]844-the world with a new eye . Each sound and scent plucked at [him]234-odo in passing : [the roadside]1772-the roadside started into detail like the foreground of [some minute Dutch painter]1773-some minute dutch painter ; every pendent mass of fern , dark dripping rock , late tuft of harebell called out to [him]234-odo : " Look well , for this is [your]234-odo last sight of [us]8344-us ! "[234-odo] [His]234-odo first sight too , it seemed : since [he]234-odo had lived through twelve Italian summers without sense of the sun - steeped quality of atmosphere that , even in shade , gives each object a golden salience . [He]234-odo was conscious of it now only as it suggested fingering a missal stiff with gold - leaf and edged with a swarming diversity of buds and insects . [The carriage]8109-the carriage moved so slowly that [he]234-odo was in no haste to turn the pages ; and each spike of yellow foxglove , each clouding of butterflies about a patch of speedwell , each quiver of grass over a hidden thread of moisture , became a marvel to be thumbed and treasured . From this mood [he]234-odo was detached by the next bend of [the road]726-the road . The way , hitherto winding through [narrow glens]1776-narrow glens , now swung to a ledge overhanging [the last escarpment of [the mountains]944-the mountains]1777-the last escarpment of the mountains ; and far below , [the Piedmontese plain]1779-the piedmontese plain unrolled to the southward [its]1779-the piedmontese plain interminable blue - green distances mottled with forest . A sight to lift the heart ; for on [those sunny reaches]1780-those sunny reaches [Ivrea]37-ivrea , [Novara]38-novara , [Vercelli]13-vercelli lay like sea - birds on [a summer sea]1781-a summer sea . It was the future unfolding itself to [the boy]839-the boy ; [dark forests]1783-dark forests , [wide rivers]1784-wide rivers , [strange cities]1785-strange cities and a new horizon : all the mystery of the coming years figured to [him]234-odo in [that great plain]1786-that great plain stretching away to the greater mystery of [heaven]1787-heaven . To all this [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto turned a snoring countenance . The lively air of [the hills]1079-the hills , the good fare of [Donnaz]7-donnaz , and the satisfaction , above all , of rolling on cushions over [a road]1789-a road [he]267-cantapresto had thought to trudge on foot , had lapped the abate in [Capuan]39-capuan slumber . The midday halt aroused [him]267-cantapresto . [The travellers]1059-the travellers rested at [an inn on]1791-an inn on [the edge of [the hills]1079-the hills]1792-the edge of the hills , and [here]8091-here [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto proved to [his]267-cantapresto charge that , as [he]267-cantapresto phrased it , [his]267-cantapresto belly had as short a memory for food as [his]267-cantapresto heart for injuries . A flask of [Asti]291-asti put [him]267-cantapresto in the talking mood , and as [they]1059-the travellers drove on [he]267-cantapresto regaled [Odo]234-odo with a lively picture of the life on which [he]267-cantapresto was about to enter . " [You]8345-you are going , "[267-cantapresto] said [he]267-cantapresto , " to [one of [the first cities of [Europe]40-europe]8347-the first cities of europe]8346-one of the first cities of europe ; [one that has all the beauty and elegance of [the French capital without [its]8349-the french capital without its]8349-the french capital without its follies and excesses]8348-one that has all the beauty and elegance of the french capital without its follies and excesses . [Turin]17-turin is blessed with [a court where good manners and a fine tone are more highly prized than the extravagances of genius]8350-a court where good manners and a fine tone are more highly prized than the extravagances of genius ; and [I]267-cantapresto have heard it said of [[his]267-cantapresto Majesty]1406-his majesty that [he]267-cantapresto was delighted to see [[his]267-cantapresto courtiers]8352-his courtiers wearing the French fashions outside [their]8352-his courtiers heads , provided [they]8352-his courtiers did n't carry the French ideas within . [You]8345-you are too young , doubtless , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , to have heard of the philosophers who are raising such [a pother north of [the Alps]20-the alps]8354-a pother north of the alps : [a set of madmen that , because [their]8355-a set of madmen that , because their birth does n't give them the entree of versailles birth does n't give [them]8355-a set of madmen that , because their birth does n't give them the entree of versailles the entree of [Versailles]28-versailles]8355-a set of madmen that , because their birth does n't give them the entree of versailles , are preaching that [men]8356-men should return to a state of nature , [great ladies]8357-great ladies suckle [their]8357-great ladies young like animals , and [the peasantry]8358-the peasantry own [[their]8358-the peasantry land]8359-their land like [nobles]8360-nobles . Luckily [you]8345-you 'll hear little of this infectious talk in [Turin]17-turin : [the King]658-the king stamps out [the philosophers]8362-the philosophers like vermin or packs [them]8362-the philosophers off to splutter [their]8362-the philosophers heresies in [Milan]14-milan or [Venice]41-venice . "[267-cantapresto] [The carriage]8109-the carriage , by this , was descending the last curves above [the valley]1132-the valley , and before [them]8109-the carriage , in [a hollow of [the hills]1079-the hills]1797-a hollow of the hills , blinked the warm shimmer of maize and vine , like some bright vintage brimming its cup . [The soprano]1599-the soprano waved a convivial hand . " Look , "[1599-the soprano] [he]1599-the soprano cried , " what Nature has done for [this happy region]8370-this happy region ! "[1599-the soprano] This mood held [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto till [his]267-cantapresto after - dinner sleep overtook [him]267-cantapresto ; and when [he]267-cantapresto woke again [the chariot]1800-the chariot was clattering across [the bridge of [Chivasso]42-chivasso]1801-the bridge of chivasso . In [the streets]744-the streets dusk had fallen and a lamp flared under the arch of [the inn]1050-the inn before which [the travellers]1059-the travellers halted . [Odo]234-odo 's head was heavy , and [he]234-odo hardly noticed [the figures thronging the caffe into which [they]1810-the figures thronging the caffe into which they were led were led]1810-the figures thronging the caffe into which they were led ; but presently there rose a shout of " Cantapresto ! [They]1829-they struck [him]839-the boy , it must be owned , as more pitiable than alarming , for [the duenna]293-the duenna 's toes were coming through [her]293-the duenna shoes , and [one or two of [the children who hung on the outskirts of the group]1831-the children who hung on the outskirts of the group]1830-one or two of the children who hung on the outskirts of the group looked as lean and hungry under [their]1830-one or two of the children who hung on the outskirts of the group spangles as [the foundling - girl of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]1832-the foundling - girl of pontesordo . [The singer]1835-the singer , however , hung back with protesting gestures . " Gently , then , gently , [dear friends]8381-dear friends -- [dear companions]8382-dear companions ! When was it [we]8383-we parted ? In the spring of the year -- and [we]8383-we meet now in the late summer . As the seasons change so do [our]8383-we conditions : if the spring is a season of folly , then is the harvest - time the period for reflection . When [we]8383-we last met [I]1835-the singer was [a strolling poet]8384-a strolling poet , glad to serve [your]8381-dear friends gifted company within the scope of [my]1835-the singer talents -- now , [ladies and gentlemen]8385-ladies and gentlemen , [now"--he]295-now"--he[1835-the singer] drew [himself]1835-the singer up with pride--"now [you]8381-dear friends behold in [me]1835-the singer [the governor and friend of [the heir - presumptive of [Pianura]4-pianura]1749-the heir - presumptive of pianura]8386-the governor and friend of the heir - presumptive of pianura . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo at this retreated hastily behind [the soprano]1599-the soprano ; but [a pretty girl]1841-a pretty girl catching sight of [him]234-odo , [he]234-odo found [himself]234-odo dragged into the centre of the company , who hailed [him]234-odo with fantastic obeisances . Supper meanwhile was being laid on the greasy table down the middle of [the room]782-the room . [The Matamor]296-the matamor , who seemed [the director of [the troupe]1844-the troupe]1843-the director of the troupe , thundered out [his]296-the matamor orders for maccaroni , fried eels and sausages ; [the inn - servants]1845-the inn - servants flanked the plates with wine - flasks and lumps of black bread , and in a moment [the hungry comedians , thrusting [Odo]234-odo into a high seat at the head of the table]1846-the hungry comedians , thrusting odo into a high seat at the head of the table , were falling on the repast with a prodigious clatter of cutlery . Of the subsequent incidents of the feast -- the banter of [the younger women]1847-the younger women , [the duenna]293-the duenna 's lachrymose confidences , the incessant interchange of theatrical jargon and coarse pleasantry -- there remained to [Odo]234-odo but a confused image , obscured by the smoke of guttering candles , the fumes of wine and the stifling air of [the low - ceilinged tavern]1848-the low - ceilinged tavern . Even the face of [the pretty girl who had dragged [him]234-odo from [his]234-odo concealment , and who now sat at [his]234-odo side , plying [him]234-odo with sweets from [her]1849-the pretty girl who had dragged him from his concealment , and who now sat at his side , plying him with sweets from her own plate own plate]1849-the pretty girl who had dragged him from his concealment , and who now sat at his side , plying him with sweets from her own plate , began to fade into the general blur ; and [his]234-odo last impression was of [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's figure dilating to immense proportions at the other end of the table , as [the soprano]1599-the soprano rose with shaking wine - glass to favour [the company]1753-the company with a song . The chorus , bursting forth in response , surged over [Odo]234-odo 's drowning senses , and [he]234-odo was barely aware , in the tumult of noise and lights , of an arm slipped about [him]234-odo , a softly - heaving pillow beneath [his]234-odo head , and the gradual subsidence into dark delicious peace . So , on the first night of [his]234-odo new life , [the heir - presumptive of [Pianura]290-pianura]1749-the heir - presumptive of pianura fell asleep with [his]1749-the heir - presumptive of pianura head in [a dancing - girl]1853-a dancing - girl 's breast . 1.8 . [The travellers]1059-the travellers were to journey by [Vettura]43-vettura from [Chivasso]42-chivasso to [Turin]17-turin ; and when [Odo]234-odo woke next morning [the carriage]8109-the carriage stood ready in [the courtyard]1745-the courtyard . [She]1857-the pretty girl who had pillowed odo 's slumbers was a slim brown morsel , not much above [his]234-odo age , with a glance that flitted like a bird , and round shoulders slipping out of [her]1857-the pretty girl who had pillowed odo 's slumbers kerchief . And all that day [he]234-odo scorched and froze with the thought that perhaps [she]1857-the pretty girl who had pillowed odo 's slumbers had been laughing at [him]234-odo . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto was torpid after the feast , and [Odo]234-odo detected in [him]267-cantapresto an air of guilty constraint . [The boy]839-the boy was glad enough to keep silence , and [they]1861-they rolled on without speaking through the wide glowing landscape . Already the nearness of [a great city]1862-a great city began to make itself felt . [The bright champaign]1863-the bright champaign was scattered over with [farm - houses]1864-farm - houses , [their]1864-farm - houses red - tiled pigeon - cots and [[their]1864-farm - houses granges]1865-their granges latticed with openwork terra - cotta pleasantly breaking [the expanse of maize and mulberry]1866-the expanse of maize and mulberry ; [villages]1867-villages lay along the banks of [the canals intersecting [the plain]1139-the plain]1868-the canals intersecting the plain ; and [the hills beyond [the Po]45-the po]1870-the hills beyond the po were planted with [villas]1871-villas and [monasteries]1872-monasteries . All the afternoon [they]1861-they drove between [umbrageous parks]1873-umbrageous parks and under the walls of [terraced vineyards]1874-terraced vineyards . It was a region of delectable shade , with glimpses here and there of [gardens flashing with fountains and villa]1875-gardens flashing with fountains and villa roofs decked with statues and vases ; and at length , toward sunset , a bend of [the road]726-the road brought [them]1861-they out on [a fair - spreading city]1877-a fair - spreading city , so flourishing in [buildings]1878-buildings , so beset with [smiling hills]1879-smiling hills , that [Odo]234-odo , springing from [his]234-odo seat , cried out in sheer joy of the spectacle . [They]1861-they had still [the suburbs to traverse]1880-the suburbs to traverse ; and darkness was falling when [they]1861-they entered the gates of [Turin]17-turin . This brought the fresh amazement of [wide lamplit streets]1881-wide lamplit streets , clean and bright as [a ball - room]1882-a ball - room , lined with [palaces]1883-palaces and filled with [well - dressed loungers]1884-well - dressed loungers : [officers in the brilliant Sardinian uniforms]1885-officers in the brilliant sardinian uniforms , [fine gentlemen]1886-fine gentlemen in French tie - wigs and narrow - sleeved coats , [merchants]1887-merchants hurrying [home]1346-home from business , ecclesiastics in high - swung carriages , and [young bloods]1889-young bloods dashing by in [their]1889-young bloods curricles . The tables before [the coffee - houses]1890-the coffee - houses were thronged with [idlers]1891-idlers taking [their]1891-idlers chocolate and reading the gazettes ; and here and there the arched doorway of [a palace]1892-a palace showed [some gay party]1893-some gay party supping al fresco in [a garden hung with lamps]1894-a garden hung with lamps . The flashing of lights and the noise of [the streets]744-the streets roused [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , who sat up with a sudden assumption of dignity . " Ah , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[267-cantapresto] said [he]267-cantapresto , " [you]8111-cavaliere now see [a great city]1862-a great city , [a famous city]8405-a famous city , [a city aptly called ' the Paris of [Italy]5-italy]8406-a city aptly called ' the paris of italy . ' Nowhere else shall [you]8111-cavaliere find [such well - lit streets]8407-such well - lit streets , [such fair pavements]8408-such fair pavements , [shops so full of Parisian wares]8409-shops so full of parisian wares , promenades so crowded with fine [carriages and horses]8410-carriages and horses . What a life [a young gentleman]8411-a young gentleman may lead [here]8091-here ! [The court]814-the court is hospitable , society amiable , [the theatres]8414-the theatres are the best - appointed in [Italy]5-italy . "[267-cantapresto] Here [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto paused with a deprecating cough . " Only one thing is necessary , "[267-cantapresto] [he]267-cantapresto went on , " to complete enjoyment of the fruits of [this garden of Eden]8415-this garden of eden ; and that is"--he[267-cantapresto] coughed again--"discretion . [[His]267-cantapresto Majesty]1406-his majesty , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , is [a father to [[his]267-cantapresto subjects]8419-his subjects]8418-a father to his subjects ; [the Church]1212-the church is [[their]8419-his subjects zealous mother]8421-their zealous mother ; and between [two such parents]8422-two such parents , and [the innumerable delegates of [their]8422-two such parents authority]8423-the innumerable delegates of their authority , why , [you]8424-you may fancy , [sir]8257-sir , that [a man]8112-a man has to wear [his]8112-a man eyes on all sides of [his]8112-a man head . Discretion is a virtue [the Church]1212-the church [herself]1212-the church commends ; it is natural , then , that [she]1212-the church should afford [[her]1212-the church children]8371-her children full opportunity to practise it . And look [you]8424-you , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , it is like gymnastics : the younger [you]8424-you acquire it , the less effort it costs . [[Our]8430-our Maker [Himself]8431-our maker himself]8431-our maker himself has taught [us]8430-our the value of silence by putting [us]8430-our speechless into [the world]844-the world : if [we]8430-our learn to talk later [we]8430-our do it at [our]8430-our own risk ! But for [your]8424-you own part , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere -- since the habit can not too early be exercised -- [I]267-cantapresto would humbly counsel [you]8424-you to say nothing to [[your]8424-you illustrious parents]8434-your illustrious parents of [our]8430-our little diversion of last evening . "[267-cantapresto] [The Countess Valdu]297-the countess valdu lived on [the upper floor of [a rococo palace]1897-a rococo palace near [the Piazza San Carlo]46-the piazza san carlo]1896-the upper floor of a rococo palace near the piazza san carlo ; and [here]8091-here [Odo]234-odo , led by [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , presently found [himself]234-odo shown into [an apartment where [several ladies]1900-several ladies and [gentlemen]1901-gentlemen sat at cards]1899-an apartment where several ladies and gentlemen sat at cards . [[His]234-odo mother]664-his mother , detaching [herself]664-his mother from [the group]1903-the group , embraced [him]234-odo with unusual warmth , and [the old Count]1484-the old count , more painted and perfumed than ever , hurried up with an obsequious greeting . [Odo]234-odo for the first time found [himself]234-odo of consequence in [the world]844-the world ; and as [he]234-odo was passed from [guest]1906-guest to [guest]1906-guest , questioned about [his]234-odo journey , praised for [his]234-odo good colour and stout looks , complimented on [his]234-odo high prospects , and laughingly entreated not to forget [[his]234-odo old friends]1908-his old friends when fortune should advance [him]234-odo to [the duchy]1310-the duchy , [he]234-odo began to feel [himself]234-odo [a reigning potentate]1910-a reigning potentate already . [[His]234-odo mother]664-his mother , as [he]234-odo soon learned , had sunk into a life almost as dull and restricted as that [she]664-his mother had left [Donnaz]255-donnaz to escape . [Count Valdu]289-count valdu 's position at [court]8243-court was more ornamental than remunerative , the income from [[his]289-count valdu estates]1253-his estates was growing annually smaller , and [he]289-count valdu was involved in costly litigation over the sale of [some entailed property]1914-some entailed property . Such conditions were little to [the Countess]1915-the countess 's humour , and the society to which [her]1915-the countess narrow means confined [her]1915-the countess offered few distractions to [her]1915-the countess vanity . [The frequenters of [the house]1917-the house]1916-the frequenters of the house were [chiefly poor relations and hangers - on of]1918-chiefly poor relations and hangers - on of [the Count]813-the count 's , [the parasites who in those days were glad to subsist on the crumbs of the slenderest larder]1920-the parasites who in those days were glad to subsist on the crumbs of the slenderest larder . [Half - a - dozen hungry Countesses]1921-half - a - dozen hungry countesses , [[their]1921-half - a - dozen hungry countesses lean admirers]1922-their lean admirers , a superannuated abate or two , and [a flock of threadbare ecclesiastics]1923-a flock of threadbare ecclesiastics , made up [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's circle ; and even [[her]243-donna laura cicisbeo , selected in family council under the direction of [[her]243-donna laura confessor]1925-her confessor]1924-her cicisbeo , selected in family council under the direction of her confessor , was [an austere gentleman of middle age , who collected ancient coins and was engaged in composing an essay on the Martellian verse]1926-an austere gentleman of middle age , who collected ancient coins and was engaged in composing an essay on the martellian verse . [This company]1927-this company , which devoted hours to the new French diversion of the parfilage , and spent the evenings in drinking lemonade and playing basset for small stakes , found its chief topic of conversation in the only two subjects safely discussed in [Turin]17-turin at that day -- the doings of [the aristocracy]1928-the aristocracy and of [the clergy]1929-the clergy . The fashion of [the Queen]1930-the queen 's headdress at the last circle , the marked manner in which [[his]813-the count Majesty]1406-his majesty had lately distinguished [the brilliant young cavalry officer]1932-the brilliant young cavalry officer , [Count Roberto di Tournanches]298-count roberto di tournanches , the third marriage of [the Countess Alfieri of Asti]291-asti , the incredibility of the rumour that [the court ladies of [Versailles]28-versailles]1933-the court ladies of versailles had taken to white muslin and Leghorn hats , the probable significance of [the Vicar - general]1934-the vicar - general 's visit to [Rome]11-rome , the subject of the next sacred representation to be given by [the nuns of [Santa Croce]47-santa croce]1935-the nuns of santa croce -- such were the questions that engaged [the noble frequenters of [Casa Valdu]48-casa valdu]1936-the noble frequenters of casa valdu . This was the only society that [Donna Laura]243-donna laura saw ; for [she]243-donna laura was too poor to dress to [her]243-donna laura taste and too proud to show [herself]243-donna laura in public without the appointments becoming [her]243-donna laura station . [Her]243-donna laura sole distraction consisted in visits to the various shrines -- [the Sudario]1937-the sudario , [the Consolata]1938-the consolata , the Corpus Domini -- at which [the feminine aristocracy]1939-the feminine aristocracy offered up [its]1939-the feminine aristocracy devotions and implored absolution for sins it had often no opportunity to commit : for though fashion accorded cicisbei to [the fine ladies of [Turin]17-turin]1940-the fine ladies of turin , [the Church]1212-the church usually restricted [their]1940-the fine ladies of turin intercourse to the exchange of the most harmless amenities . Meanwhile the antechamber was as full of duns as the approach to [[Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's apartment at [Pianura]4-pianura]1942-donna laura 's apartment at pianura ; and [Odo]234-odo guessed that the warmth of the maternal welcome sprang less from natural affection than from the hope of using [his]234-odo expectations as a sop to [[her]243-donna laura creditors]1943-her creditors . The pittance which the ducal treasury allowed for [his]234-odo education was scarce large enough to be worth diverting to other ends ; but [a potential prince]1944-a potential prince is a shield to the most vulnerable fortunes . In this character [Odo]234-odo for the first time found [himself]234-odo flattered , indulged , and made the centre of [the company]1753-the company . The contrast to [his]234-odo life of subjection at [Donnaz]7-donnaz ; the precocious initiation into motives that tainted the very fount of filial piety ; the taste of this mingled draught of adulation and disillusionment , might have perverted a nature more self - centred than [his]234-odo . From this perversion , and from many subsequent perils [he]234-odo was saved by a kind of imaginative sympathy , a wondering joy in the mere spectacle of life , that tinged [his]234-odo most personal impressions with a streak of the philosophic temper . If this trait did not save [him]234-odo from sorrow , it at least lifted [him]234-odo above pettiness ; if it could not solve the difficulties of life it could arm [him]234-odo to endure them . It was the best gift of the past from which [he]234-odo sprang ; but it was blent with another quality , a deep moral curiosity that ennobled [his]234-odo sensuous enjoyment of the outward show of life ; and these elements were already tending in [him]234-odo , as in [countless youths of [his]234-odo generation]1946-countless youths of his generation , to the formation of a new spirit , the spirit that was to destroy [one world]1947-one world without surviving to create another . Of all this none could have been less conscious than [the lad]1948-the lad just preparing to enter on [his]1948-the lad studies at [the Royal Academy of [Turin]17-turin]35-the royal academy of turin . [That institution]1949-that institution , adjoining [the royal palace]1950-the royal palace , was a kind of nursery or [forcing - house for [the budding nobility of [Savoy]16-savoy]1952-the budding nobility of savoy]1951-forcing - house for the budding nobility of savoy . In [one division of [the sumptuous building]1954-the sumptuous building]1953-one division of the sumptuous building were housed [[his]234-odo Majesty]1406-his majesty 's pages , [a corps of [luxurious indolent young fops]1957-luxurious indolent young fops]1956-a corps of luxurious indolent young fops ; [another wing]1958-another wing accommodated [the regular students of [the Academy]1720-the academy]1959-the regular students of the academy , [sons of [noblemen]1962-noblemen and [gentlemen destined for the secular life]1963-gentlemen destined for the secular life]1961-sons of noblemen and gentlemen destined for the secular life , while a third was set aside for [the " forestieri "[234-odo] or students from [foreign countries]1965-foreign countries and from [the other Italian states]1966-the other italian states]1964-the " forestieri " or students from foreign countries and from the other italian states . To [this quarter]1967-this quarter [Odo Valsecca]234-odo was allotted ; though it was understood that on leaving [the Academy]1720-the academy [he]234-odo was to enter the Sardinian service . It was customary for [[a young gentleman of Odo]1969-a young gentleman of odo 's rank]1970-a young gentleman of odo 's rank to be attended at [the Academy]1720-the academy not only by [a body - servant]1076-a body - servant but by [a private governor]1973-a private governor or pedant , whose business it was to overlook [his]234-odo studies , attend [him]234-odo abroad , and have an eye to [the society [he]234-odo frequented]1974-the society he frequented . [The old Marquess of Donnaz]1975-the old marquess of donnaz had sent [[his]1975-the old marquess of donnaz daughter]1475-his daughter , by [Odo]234-odo 's hand , a letter recommending [her]1475-his daughter to select [[[her]1475-his daughter son]1486-her son 's governor]1978-her son 's governor with particular care , choosing rather [a person of grave behaviour and assured morality]1979-a person of grave behaviour and assured morality than [one of [your]1981-your glib ink - spatterers who may know the inside of all the folios in [[the King]658-the king 's library]1983-the king 's library without being the better qualified for the direction of [a young gentleman]8411-a young gentleman 's conduct]1980-one of your glib ink - spatterers who may know the inside of all the folios in the king 's library without being the better qualified for the direction of a young gentleman 's conduct ; and to this letter [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso appended the terse postcript : " [[Your]1981-your excellency]8157-your excellency is especially warned against according this or any other position of trust to [the merry - andrew who calls [himself]8436-the merry - andrew who calls himself the abate cantapresto [the abate Cantapresto]1694-the abate cantapresto]8436-the merry - andrew who calls himself the abate cantapresto . "[261-don gervaso] [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , with a shrug , handed the letter to [[her]243-donna laura husband]1112-her husband ; [Count Valdu]289-count valdu , adjusting [his]289-count valdu glasses , observed it was notorious that [people living in [the depths of [the country]818-the country]1987-the depths of the country]1986-people living in the depths of the country thought [themselves]1986-people living in the depths of the country qualified to instruct [[their]1986-people living in the depths of the country city relatives]1989-their city relatives on all points connected with the social usages ; and [the cicisbeo]1990-the cicisbeo suggested that [he]289-count valdu could recommend [an abate who was proficient in the construction of the Martellian verse]1991-an abate who was proficient in the construction of the martellian verse , and who would made no extra charge for that accomplishment . " Charges ! "[1915-the countess] [the Countess]1915-the countess cried . " There 's a matter [[my]1915-the countess father]8146-my father does n't deign to consider . It 's not enough , nowadays , to give [the lads]1385-the lads [a governor]8440-a governor , but [they]1385-the lads must maintain [[their]1385-the lads servants]8441-their servants too , [an idle gluttonous crew that prey on [their]1385-the lads pockets and get a commission off [every tradesman]8443-every tradesman 's bill]8442-an idle gluttonous crew that prey on their pockets and get a commission off every tradesman 's bill . "[1915-the countess] [Count Valdu]289-count valdu lifted a deprecating hand . "[289-count valdu] " Of course , "[1915-the countess] [she]1915-the countess shrugged--"But who 's to pay ? [The Duke]682-the duke 's beggarly pittance hardly clothes [him]289-count valdu . "[289-count valdu] [The cicisbeo]1990-the cicisbeo suggested that [the cavaliere Odo]1245-the cavaliere odo had expectations ; at which [Donna Laura]243-donna laura flushed and turned uneasy ; while [the Count]813-the count , part of whose marital duty it was to intervene discreetly between [[his]813-the count lady]1996-his lady and [[her]1996-his lady knight]1997-her knight , now put forth the remark that [the abate Cantapresto]1694-the abate cantapresto seemed [a shrewd serviceable fellow]1999-a shrewd serviceable fellow . " Nor do [I]1915-the countess like to turn [him]289-count valdu adrift , "[1915-the countess] cried [the Countess]1915-the countess instantly , " after [he]289-count valdu has obliged [us]8449-us by attending [[my]1915-the countess son]8132-my son on [his]289-count valdu journey .
