"[1990-the cicisbeo] And the upshot of it was that when [Odo]234-odo , a few days later , entered on [his]234-odo first term at [the Academy]1720-the academy , [he]234-odo was accompanied by the abate Cantapresto , who had agreed , for a minimum of pay , to serve [him]234-odo faithfully in the double capacity of [pedagogue and lacquey]2004-pedagogue and lacquey . The considerable liberty accorded [the foreign students]2005-the foreign students made [Odo]234-odo 's first year at [the Academy]1720-the academy at once pleasanter and less profitable than had [he]234-odo been [one of [the regular pupils]2008-the regular pupils]2007-one of the regular pupils . [The companions among whom [he]234-odo found [himself]234-odo]2009-the companions among whom he found himself were [a set of lively undisciplined young gentlemen , chiefly from [England]49-england , [Russia]50-russia and the German principalities]2010-a set of lively undisciplined young gentlemen , chiefly from england , russia and the german principalities ; all in possession of more or less pocket - money and attended by governors either pedantic and self - engrossed or vulgarly subservient . [These young sprigs , whose ambition it was to ape the dress and manners of the royal pages]2011-these young sprigs , whose ambition it was to ape the dress and manners of the royal pages , led a life of dissipation barely interrupted by a few hours of attendance at the academic classes . From the ill - effects of such surroundings [Odo]234-odo was preserved by an intellectual curiosity that flung [him]234-odo ravening on [his]234-odo studies . It was not that [he]234-odo was of a bookish habit , or that the drudgery of the classes was less irksome to [him]234-odo than to [the other pupils]2012-the other pupils ; but not even the pedantic methods then prevailing , or the distractions of [his]234-odo new life , could dull the flush of [his]234-odo first encounter with the past . [His]234-odo imagination took fire over the dry pages of [Cornelius Nepos]299-cornelius nepos , glowed with the mild pastoral warmth of the Georgics and burst into flame at the first hexameters of the Aeneid . [He]234-odo caught but a fragment of meaning here and there , but the sumptuous imagery , the stirring names , the glimpses into a past where [Roman senators]2013-roman senators were mingled with the gods of [a gold - pillared Olympus]2014-a gold - pillared olympus , filled [his]234-odo mind with a misty pageant of immortals . These moments of high emotion were interspersed with hours of plodding over the Latin grammar and the textbooks of philosophy and logic . Books were unknown ground to Cantapresto , and among [masters]2015-masters and [pupils]2016-pupils there was [not one who could help [Odo]234-odo to the meaning of [his]234-odo task , or who seemed aware that it might have a meaning]2017-not one who could help odo to the meaning of his task , or who seemed aware that it might have a meaning . To [most of [the lads]1385-the lads about [him]234-odo]2018-most of the lads about him the purpose of [the Academy]1720-the academy was to fit [young gentlemen]2021-young gentlemen for [the army]2022-the army or the court ; to give [them]2021-young gentlemen the chance of sweating a shirt every morning with [the fencing - master]2023-the fencing - master and of learning to thread the intricacies of the court minuet . [They]2021-young gentlemen modelled [themselves]2021-young gentlemen on the dress and bearing of the pages , who were always ruffling it about the quadrangle in court dress and sword , or booted and spurred for a day 's hunting at [the King 's chase of [Stupinigi]277-stupinigi]2024-the king 's chase of stupinigi . To receive a nod or a word from one of [these young demigods]2025-these young demigods on [his]234-odo way to [the King]658-the king 's opera - box or just back from a pleasure - party at [[[her]2027-her Majesty]2028-her majesty 's villa]2029-her majesty 's villa above [the Po]45-the po -- to hear of [their]2021-young gentlemen tremendous exploits and thrilling escapades -- seemed to put [the whole school]2030-the whole school in touch with [the fine gentleman]653-the fine gentleman 's world of intrigue , cards and duelling : the world in which [ladies]8307-ladies were subjugated , fortunes lost , [adversaries]2033-adversaries run through and [tradesmen]835-tradesmen ruined with that imperturbable grace which distinguished [the man of quality]2035-the man of quality from [the plebeian]2036-the plebeian . Among the privileges of [the foreign pupils]2037-the foreign pupils were frequent visits to [the royal theatre]2038-the royal theatre ; and here was to [Odo]234-odo a source of unimagined joys . [His]234-odo superstitious dread of the stage ( a sentiment , [he]234-odo soon discovered , that not even [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's director shared ) made [his]234-odo heart beat oppressively as [he]234-odo first set foot in [the theatre]1559-the theatre . It was a gala night , boxes and [stalls]2041-stalls were thronged , and [the audience - hall]2042-the audience - hall unfolded [its]2042-the audience - hall glittering curves like some poisonous flower enveloping [him]234-odo in rich malignant fragrance . This impression was dispelled by the rising of the curtain on a scene of such Claude - like loveliness as it would have been impossible to associate with the bug - bear tales of [Donnaz]255-donnaz or with the coarse antics of [the comedians at [Chivasso]42-chivasso]2043-the comedians at chivasso . [A temple girt with mysterious shade]2044-a temple girt with mysterious shade , lifting [its]2044-a temple girt with mysterious shade colonnade above [a sunlit harbour]2045-a sunlit harbour ; and before [the temple]2046-the temple , vine - wreathed nymphs waving [their]2047-their thyrsi through the turns of a melodious dance -- such was the vision that caught up [Odo]234-odo and swept [him]234-odo leagues away from [the rouged and starred assemblage]2048-the rouged and starred assemblage gathered in the boxes to gossip , flirt , eat ices and chocolates , and incidentally , in the pauses of [their]2048-the rouged and starred assemblage talk , to listen for a moment to the ravishing airs of [Metastasio]300-metastasio 's Achilles in [Scyros]52-scyros . The distance between such performances -- magic evocations of light and colour and melody -- and the gross buffoonery of the popular stage , still tainted with the obscenities of the old commedia dell ' arte , in a measure explains the different points from which at that period the stage was viewed in [Italy]5-italy : a period when in [such cities as [Milan]14-milan]2049-such cities as milan , [Venice]41-venice , [Turin]17-turin , [actors]2050-actors and [singers]2051-singers were praised to the skies and loaded with wealth and favours , while [the tatterdemalion players who set up [their]2052-the tatterdemalion players who set up their boards in the small towns at market - time or on feast - days boards in [the small towns]2053-the small towns at market - time or on feast - days]2052-the tatterdemalion players who set up their boards in the small towns at market - time or on feast - days were despised by [the people]1003-the people and flung like carrion into unconsecrated graves . The impression [Odo]234-odo had gathered from [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso 's talk was of [the provincial stage in all [its]2055-the provincial stage in all its pothouse license pothouse license]2055-the provincial stage in all its pothouse license ; but here was a spectacle as lofty and harmonious as some great religious pageant . As the action developed and the beauty of the verse was borne to [Odo]234-odo on the light hurrying ripples of [Caldara]301-caldara 's music [he]234-odo turned instinctively to share [his]234-odo pleasure with [those about [him]234-odo]2056-those about him . Cantapresto , in a new black coat and ruffles , was conspicuously taking snuff from the tortoiseshell box which [the Countess]1915-the countess 's cicisbeo had given [him]234-odo ; but [Odo]234-odo saw that [he]234-odo took less pleasure in the spectacle than in the fact of accompanying [the heir - presumptive of [Pianura]290-pianura]1749-the heir - presumptive of pianura to a gala performance at [the royal theatre]2038-the royal theatre ; and [the lads about [them]2061-them]2060-the lads about them were for the most part engaged either with [their]2060-the lads about them own dress and appearance , or in exchanging greetings with [the royal pages]2062-the royal pages and [the older students]2063-the older students . [A few of [these]2065-these]2064-a few of these sat near [Odo]234-odo , disdainfully superior in [their]2064-a few of these fob - chains and queues ; and as [the boy]839-the boy glanced about [him]234-odo [he]839-the boy met the fixed stare of [one of [the number]2068-the number]2067-one of the number , [a tall youth seated at [his]2067-one of the number elbow , and conspicuous , even in that modish company , for the exaggerated elegance of [his]2067-one of the number dress]2069-a tall youth seated at his elbow , and conspicuous , even in that modish company , for the exaggerated elegance of his dress . [This young man]2070-this young man , whose awkward bearing and long lava - hued face crowned with flamboyant hair contrasted oddly with [his]2067-one of the number finical apparel , returned [Odo]234-odo 's look with a gaze of eager comprehension . [He]2070-this young man too , it was clear , felt the thrill and wonder , or at least re - lived them in [the younger lad]2071-the younger lad 's emotion ; and from that moment [Odo]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo in mute communion with [[his]234-odo neighbour]2072-his neighbour . The quick movement of the story -- the succession of devices by which [the wily Ulysses]2073-the wily ulysses lures [Achilles]300-metastasio to throw off [his]300-metastasio disguise , while [Deidamia]302-deidamia strives to conceal [his]300-metastasio identity ; the scenic beauties of the background , shifting from sculpture - gallery to pleasance , from pleasance to [banquet - hall]2074-banquet - hall ; the pomp and glitter of [the royal train]2075-the royal train , the melting graces of [Deidamia]302-deidamia and [[her]302-deidamia maidens]2076-her maidens ; seemed , in [their]2077-their multiple appeal , to develop in [Odo]234-odo new faculties of perception . It was [his]234-odo first initiation into Italian poetry , and the numbers , now broken , harsh and passionate , now flowing into liquid sweetness , were so blent with sound and colour that [he]234-odo scarce knew through which sense [they]2077-their reached [him]234-odo . [Deidamia]302-deidamia 's strophes thrilled [him]234-odo like [the singing - girl]2078-the singing - girl 's kiss , and at [the young hero]2079-the young hero 's cry-- Ma lo so ch ' io sono Achille , E [mi]2080-mi sento [Achille]303-achille in sen-- [his]234-odo fists tightened and the blood hummed in [his]234-odo ears . In the scene of [the banquet - hall]2081-the banquet - hall , where [the followers of [Ulysses]304-ulysses]2082-the followers of ulysses lay before [Lycomedes]305-lycomedes the offerings of [the Greek chieftains]2083-the greek chieftains , and , while [the King]658-the king and [Deidamia]302-deidamia are marvelling at the jewels and the Tyrian robes , [Achilles]300-metastasio , unmindful of [his]300-metastasio disguise , bursts out Ah , chi vide finora armi piu belle ? --at this supreme point [Odo]234-odo again turned to [[his]234-odo neighbour]2072-his neighbour . [They]2086-they exchanged another look , and at the close of the act [the youth]2087-the youth leaned forward to ask with an air of condescension : " Is this [your]2087-the youth first acquaintance with [the divine Metastasio]300-metastasio ? "[2087-the youth] " [I]234-odo have never been in [a play - house]8454-a play - house before , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo reddening . [The other]905-the other smiled . " [You]234-odo are fortunate in having so worthy an introduction to the stage . Many of [our]2086-they operas are merely vulgar and ridiculous ; but [Metastasio]300-metastasio is [a great poet]8455-a great poet . "[905-the other] [Odo]234-odo nodded a breathless assent . " [A great poet]8455-a great poet , "[2089-his new acquaintance] [[his]234-odo new acquaintance]2089-his new acquaintance resumed , " and handling a great theme . But do [you]234-odo not suffer from the silly songs that perpetually interrupt the flow of the verse ? To [me]2090-the speaker [they]8457-they are intolerable . [Metastasio]300-metastasio might have been [a great tragic dramatist]8458-a great tragic dramatist if [Italy]5-italy would have let [him]300-metastasio . But [Italy]5-italy does not want tragedies -- [she]5-italy wishes to be sung to , danced to , made eyes at , flattered and amused ! Give [her]5-italy anything , anything that shall help [her]5-italy to forget [her]5-italy own abasement . Panem et circenses ! that is always [her]5-italy cry . And who can wonder that [[her]5-italy sovereigns]8459-her sovereigns and [statesmen]8460-statesmen are willing to humour [her]5-italy , when even [[her]5-italy poets]8461-her poets stoop to play the mountebank for [her]5-italy diversion ? "[2090-the speaker] [The speaker]2090-the speaker , ruffling [his]2090-the speaker locks with a hand that scattered the powder , turned on [the brilliant audience]2091-the brilliant audience [his]2090-the speaker strange corrugated frown . " [Fools]8462-fools ! [simpletons]8463-simpletons ! "[2090-the speaker] [he]2090-the speaker cried , " not to see that in applauding [the Achilles of Metastasio]300-metastasio [they]2091-the brilliant audience are smiling at the allegory of [their]2091-the brilliant audience own abasement ! What are [the Italians of today]8464-the italians of today but [men]8356-men tricked out in [women]771-women 's finery , when [they]8356-men should be waiting full - armed to rally at the first signal of revolt ? Oh , for the day when [a poet]8467-a poet shall arise who dares tell [them]2091-the brilliant audience the truth , not disguised in sentimental frippery , not ending in a maudlin reconciliation of love and glory -- but the whole truth , naked , cold and fatal as [a patriot]8468-a patriot 's blade ; [a poet who dares show [these bedizened courtiers]8470-these bedizened courtiers [they]2091-the brilliant audience are no freer than [the peasants [they]2091-the brilliant audience oppress]8471-the peasants they oppress , and tell [the peasants]8472-the peasants [they]2091-the brilliant audience are entitled to the same privileges as [[their]2091-the brilliant audience masters]8473-their masters]8469-a poet who dares show these bedizened courtiers they are no freer than the peasants they oppress , and tell the peasants they are entitled to the same privileges as their masters ! "[2090-the speaker] [He]2090-the speaker paused and drew back with a supercilious smile . " But doubtless , [sir]8257-sir , "[2090-the speaker] said [he]2090-the speaker , " [I]2090-the speaker offend [you]8257-sir in thus arraigning [your]8257-sir sacred caste ; for unless [I]2090-the speaker mistake [you]8257-sir belong to the race of [demi - gods]8475-demi - gods -- [the Titans whose downfall is at hand]8476-the titans whose downfall is at hand ? "[2090-the speaker] [He]2090-the speaker swept the boxes with a contemptuous eye . Little of this tirade was clear to [Odo]234-odo ; but something in [the speaker]2090-the speaker 's tone moved [him]234-odo to answer , with a quick lifting of [his]234-odo head : " [My]234-odo name is [Odo Valsecca]234-odo , of [the Dukes of [Pianura]4-pianura]589-the dukes of pianura ; "[234-odo] when , fearing [he]234-odo had seemed to parade [his]234-odo birth before [one evidently of inferior station]2093-one evidently of inferior station , [he]2090-the speaker at once added with a touch of shyness : " And [you]8257-sir , [sir]8257-sir , are perhaps [a poet]8467-a poet , since [you]8257-sir speak so beautifully ? "[2090-the speaker] At which , with a stare and a straightening of [his]234-odo long awkward body , [the other]905-the other haughtily returned : " [A poet]8467-a poet , [sir]8257-sir ? [I]905-the other am [the Count Vittorio Alfieri of [Asti]291-asti]306-alfieri . "[905-the other] 1.9 . [The singular being with whom chance had thus brought [him]234-odo acquainted]2095-the singular being with whom chance had thus brought him acquainted was to have a lasting influence on the formation of [Odo]234-odo 's character . [Vittorio Alfieri]306-alfieri , then just concluding , at the age of sixteen , [his]306-alfieri desultory years of academic schooling , was probably [the most extraordinary youth in [[Charles Emmanuel]307-charles emmanuel 's dominion]2097-charles emmanuel 's dominion]2096-the most extraordinary youth in charles emmanuel 's dominion . Of [the future student]2098-the future student , of [the tragic poet who was to prepare the liberation of [Italy]5-italy]2099-the tragic poet who was to prepare the liberation of italy by raising the political ideals of [[his]306-alfieri generation]2100-his generation , [this moody boy with [his]306-alfieri craze for dress and horses , [his]306-alfieri pride of birth and contempt for [his]306-alfieri own class]2101-this moody boy with his craze for dress and horses , his pride of birth and contempt for his own class , [his]306-alfieri liberal theories and insolently aristocratic practice , must have given small promise to [the most discerning observer]2102-the most discerning observer . It seems indeed probable that [none]1118-none thought [him]306-alfieri worth observing and that [he]306-alfieri passed among [[his]306-alfieri townsmen]2104-his townsmen merely as [one of [the most idle and extravagant young noblemen in [a society where idleness and extravagance were held to be the natural attributes of the great]2107-a society where idleness and extravagance were held to be the natural attributes of the great . But in the growth of character the light on the road to [Damascus]53-damascus]2106-the most idle and extravagant young noblemen in a society where idleness and extravagance were held to be the natural attributes of the great . but in the growth of character the light on the road to damascus]2105-one of the most idle and extravagant young noblemen in a society where idleness and extravagance were held to be the natural attributes of the great . but in the growth of character the light on the road to damascus is apt to be preceded by faint premonitory gleams ; and even in [his]306-alfieri frivolous days at [the Academy]1720-the academy [Alfieri]306-alfieri carried a Virgil in [his]306-alfieri pocket and wept and trembled over [Ariosto]308-ariosto 's verse . It was the instant response of [Odo]234-odo 's imagination that drew [the two]812-the two together . [Odo]234-odo , as [one of [the foreign pupils]2037-the foreign pupils]2110-one of the foreign pupils , was quartered in the same wing of [the Academy]1720-the academy with [the students of [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's class]2113-the students of alfieri 's class , and enjoyed an almost equal freedom . Thus , despite the difference of age , [the lads]1385-the lads found [themselves]1385-the lads allied by taste and circumstances . Among [the youth of [[their]1385-the lads class]2116-their class]2115-the youth of their class [they]1385-the lads were perhaps the only two who already felt , however obscurely , the stirring of unborn ideals , the pressure of that tide of renovation that was to sweep [them]1385-the lads , on widely - sundered currents , to [the same uncharted deep]2117-the same uncharted deep . [Alfieri]306-alfieri , at any rate , represented to [the younger lad [the seer who held in [his]2119-the seer who held in his hands the keys of knowledge and beauty hands the keys of knowledge and beauty]2119-the seer who held in his hands the keys of knowledge and beauty . [Odo]234-odo could never forget [the youth who first leant [him]234-odo [Annibale Caro]309-annibale caro 's Aeneid and [Metastasio]300-metastasio 's opera libretti , [Voltaire]310-voltaire 's [Zaire]54-zaire and the comedies of [Goldoni]288-goldoni]2120-the youth who first leant him annibale caro 's aeneid and metastasio 's opera libretti , voltaire 's zaire and the comedies of goldoni]2118-the younger lad the seer who held in his hands the keys of knowledge and beauty . odo could never forget the youth who first leant him annibale caro 's aeneid and metastasio 's opera libretti , voltaire 's zaire and the comedies of goldoni ; while [Alfieri]306-alfieri perhaps found in [[his]306-alfieri companion]840-his companion 's sympathy with [his]306-alfieri own half - dormant tastes the first incentive to a nobler activity . Certain it is that , in the interchange of [their]2122-their daily comradeship , [the elder]2123-the elder gave [[his]2123-the elder friend]2124-his friend much that [he]2123-the elder was [himself]2123-the elder unconscious of possessing , and perhaps first saw reflected in [Odo]234-odo 's more vivid sensibility an outline of the formless ideals coiled in the depths of [his]2123-the elder own sluggish nature . The difference in age , and the possession of an independent fortune , which the laws of [Savoy]16-savoy had left [Alfieri]306-alfieri free to enjoy since [his]306-alfieri fifteenth year , gave [him]306-alfieri an obvious superiority over [Odo]234-odo ; but if [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's amusements separated [him]306-alfieri from [[his]306-alfieri young friend]2125-his young friend , [his]306-alfieri tastes were always drawing them together ; and [Odo]234-odo was happily of those who are more engaged in profiting by what comes [their]2126-their way than in pining for what escapes [them]2126-their . Much as [he]234-odo admired [Alfieri]306-alfieri , it was somehow impossible for [the latter]870-the latter to condescend to [him]306-alfieri ; and the equality of intercourse between the two was perhaps its chief attraction to [a youth surfeited with adulation]2128-a youth surfeited with adulation . Of the opportunities [his]306-alfieri new friendship brought [him]306-alfieri , none became in after years a pleasanter memory to [Odo]234-odo than [his]306-alfieri visits with [Vittorio]306-alfieri to [[the latter]870-the latter 's uncle]2130-the latter 's uncle , [the illustrious architect [Count Benedetto Alfieri]311-count benedetto]2131-the illustrious architect count benedetto alfieri . [This accomplished and amiable man , who had for many years devoted [his]2132-this accomplished and amiable man , who had for many years devoted his talents to the king 's service talents to [the King]658-the king 's service]2132-this accomplished and amiable man , who had for many years devoted his talents to the king 's service , was lodged in [a palace adjoining [the Academy]1720-the academy]2134-a palace adjoining the academy ; and thither , one holiday afternoon , [Vittorio]306-alfieri conducted [[his]306-alfieri young friend]2125-his young friend . Ignorant as [Odo]234-odo was of all the arts , [he]306-alfieri felt on the very threshold the new quality of [his]306-alfieri surroundings . [These tall bare rooms]2137-these tall bare rooms , where busts and sarcophagi were ranged as in the twilight of [a temple]2138-a temple , diffused an influence that lowered the voice and hushed the step . In [the semi - Parisian capital where [French architects]2140-french architects designed [the King 's pleasure - houses]2141-the king 's pleasure - houses]2139-the semi - parisian capital where french architects designed the king 's pleasure - houses and [the nobility]1665-the nobility imported [their]1665-the nobility boudoir - panellings from [Paris]27-paris and [their]1665-the nobility damask hangings from [Lyons]55-lyons , [Benedetto Alfieri]311-count benedetto represented the old classic tradition , the tradition of the " grand manner , "[312-winckelmann] which had held its own through all later variations of taste , running parallel with [the barocchismo of the seventeenth century]2143-the barocchismo of the seventeenth century and the effeminate caprices of the rococo period . [He]311-count benedetto had lived much in [Rome]11-rome , in the company of [men like [Winckelmann]312-winckelmann and [Maffei]313-maffei]2144-men like winckelmann and maffei , in that society where the revival of classical research was being forwarded by the liberality of [Princes]2145-princes and [Cardinals]314-cardinals and by the indefatigable zeal of [the scholars]2146-the scholars in [their]2146-the scholars pay . From this centre of aesthetic reaction [Alfieri]311-count benedetto had returned to the Gallicized [Turin]17-turin , with its preference for the graceful and ingenious rather than for the large , [the noble , the restrained]2147-the noble , the restrained ; bringing to bear on the taste of [[his]311-count benedetto native city]2148-his native city the influence of a view raised but perhaps narrowed by close study of the past : the view of [a generation of architects in whom archeological curiosity had stifled the artistic instinct , and who , instead of assimilating the spirit of the past like their great predecessors]2149-a generation of architects in whom archeological curiosity had stifled the artistic instinct , and who , instead of assimilating the spirit of the past like their great predecessors , were engrossed in a sterile restoration of the letter . It may be said of [this school of architects]2150-this school of architects that [they]2150-this school of architects were of more service to posterity than to [[their]2150-this school of architects contemporaries]2151-their contemporaries ; for while [they]2150-this school of architects opened the way to modern antiquarian research , [their]2150-this school of architects pedantry checked the natural development of a style which , if left to itself , might in time have found new and more vigorous forms of expression . To [Odo]234-odo , happily , [Count Benedetto]311-count benedetto 's surroundings spoke more forcibly than [his]234-odo theories . Every object in [the calm severe rooms]2152-the calm severe rooms appealed to [the boy]839-the boy with the pure eloquence of form . Casts of the Vatican busts stood against the walls and a niche at one end of [the library]2154-the library contained a marble copy of [the Apollo Belvedere]2155-the apollo belvedere . The sarcophagi with [their]2156-their winged genii , [their]2156-their garlands and bucranes , and porphyry tazzas , the fragments of Roman mosaic and Pompeian fresco - painting , roused [Odo]234-odo 's curiosity as if they had been the scattered letters of a new alphabet ; and [he]234-odo saw with astonishment [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend [Vittorio]306-alfieri 's indifference to these wonders . [Count Benedetto]311-count benedetto , it was clear , was resigned to [[his]311-count benedetto nephew]1316-his nephew 's lack of interest . [The old man]1195-the old man doubtless knew that [he]1195-the old man represented to [the youth]2087-the youth only [the rich uncle whose crotchets must be humoured for the sake of what [his]1195-the old man pocket]2161-the rich uncle whose crotchets must be humoured for the sake of what his pocket may procure ; and such kindly tolerance made [Odo]234-odo regret that [Vittorio]306-alfieri should not at least affect an interest in [[his]234-odo uncle]8323-his uncle 's pursuits . [Odo]234-odo 's eagerness to see and learn filled [Count Benedetto]311-count benedetto with a simple joy . [He]1195-the old man brought forth all [his]1195-the old man treasures for [the boy]839-the boy 's instruction and [the two]812-the two spent many an afternoon poring over [Piranesi]315-piranesi 's Roman etchings , [Maffei]313-maffei 's Verona Illustrata , and [Count Benedetto]311-count benedetto 's own elegant pencil - drawings of classical remains . Like [all students of]2165-all students of [his]1195-the old man day [he]1195-the old man had also [his]1195-the old man cabinet of antique gems and coins , from which [Odo]234-odo obtained more intimate glimpses of that buried life so marvellously exhumed before [him]234-odo : hints of traffic in [far - off market - places]2166-far - off market - places and familiar gestures of hands on which those very jewels might have sparkled . Nor did [the Count]813-the count restrict [the boy]839-the boy 's enquiries to that distant past ; and for the first time [Odo]234-odo heard of [the masters who had maintained the great classical tradition on [Latin soil]2170-latin soil]2169-the masters who had maintained the great classical tradition on latin soil : [Sanmichele]316-sanmichele , [Vignola]56-vignola , [Sansovino]317-sansovino , and the divine [Michael Angelo]318-michael angelo , whom [the old architect]2171-the old architect never named without baring [his]2171-the old architect head . From the works of [these architects]2172-these architects [Odo]234-odo formed [his]234-odo first conception of the earlier , more virile manner which the first contact with Graeco - Roman antiquity had produced . [The Count]813-the count told [him]234-odo , too , of [the great painters whose popularity had been lessened , if [their]2174-the great painters whose popularity had been lessened , if their fame had not been dimmed , by the more recent achievements of correggio , guido , guercino , and the bolognese school fame had not been dimmed , by the more recent achievements of [Correggio]319-correggio , [Guido]320-guido , [Guercino]321-guercino , and [the Bolognese school]2175-the bolognese school]2174-the great painters whose popularity had been lessened , if their fame had not been dimmed , by the more recent achievements of correggio , guido , guercino , and the bolognese school . The splendour of the stanze of [the Vatican]57-the vatican , the dreadful majesty of the Sistine ceiling , revealed to [Odo]234-odo the beauty of that unmatched moment before grandeur broke into bombast . [His]234-odo early association with the expressive homely art of [the chapel at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]971-the chapel at pontesordo and with the half - pagan beauty of [Luini]322-luini 's compositions had formed [his]234-odo taste on soberer lines than the fashion of the day affected ; and [his]234-odo imagination breathed freely on the heights of [the Latin Parnassus]58-the latin parnassus . Thus , while [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend [Vittorio]306-alfieri stormed up and down [the quiet rooms]2178-the quiet rooms , chattering about [his]306-alfieri horses , boasting of [his]306-alfieri escapades , or ranting against the tyranny of [the Sardinian government]2179-the sardinian government , [Odo]234-odo , at [the old Count]1484-the old count 's side , was entering on the great inheritance of the past . Such an initiation was the more precious to [him]234-odo from the indifference of those about [him]234-odo to all forms of liberal culture . Among [the greater Italian cities , [Turin]17-turin]2181-the greater italian cities , turin was at that period the least open to new influences , the most rigidly bound up in the formulas of the past . While [Milan]14-milan , under [the Austrian]2182-the austrian rule , was becoming a centre of philosophic thought ; while [Naples]59-naples was producing [a group of economists such as [Galiani]323-galiani , [Gravina]324-gravina and [Filangieri]325-filangieri]2183-a group of economists such as galiani , gravina and filangieri ; while ecclesiastical [Rome]11-rome was dedicating [herself]11-rome to the investigation of ancient art and polity , and even flighty [Venice]41-venice had [[her]11-rome little set of " [liberals]8482-liberals , "[11-rome] who read [Voltaire]310-voltaire and [Hume]326-hume and wept over the rights of [man]2185-man]2184-her little set of " liberals , " who read voltaire and hume and wept over the rights of man , [the old Piedmontese capital]2186-the old piedmontese capital lay in the grasp of [a bigoted clergy]2187-a bigoted clergy and of [a reigning house which was already preparing to superimpose Prussian militarism on the old feudal discipline of [the border]2189-the border]2188-a reigning house which was already preparing to superimpose prussian militarism on the old feudal discipline of the border . Generations of hard fighting and rigorous living had developed in [the nobles]2190-the nobles the qualities which were preparing [them]2190-the nobles for the great part [[their]2190-the nobles country]2191-their country was to play ; and contact with [the Waldensian and Calvinist heresies]2192-the waldensian and calvinist heresies had stiffened Piedmontese piety into a sombre hatred of schism and a minute observance of the mechanical rules of the faith . Such qualities could be produced only at the expense of intellectual freedom ; and if [Piedmont]60-piedmont could show [a few nobles like [[Massimo d'Azeglio]327-massimo d'azeglio 's father]2194-massimo d'azeglio 's father , who " made the education of [[his]2194-massimo d'azeglio 's father children]8483-his children [his]2194-massimo d'azeglio 's father first and gravest thought "[327-massimo d'azeglio] and supplemented the deficiencies of [[his]2194-massimo d'azeglio 's father wife]1713-his wife 's conventual training by " consecrating to [her]1713-his wife daily four hours of reading , translating and other suitable exercises , "[327-massimo d'azeglio] the commoner view was that of [[Alfieri]306-alfieri 's own parents]2196-alfieri 's own parents , who frequently repeated in [[their]2196-alfieri 's own parents son]621-their son 's hearing " the old maxim of [the Piedmontese nobility]8484-the piedmontese nobility "[2196-alfieri 's own parents] that there is no need for [a gentleman]2198-a gentleman to be [a scholar]1352-a scholar . Such at any rate was the opinion of [the old Marquess of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]1975-the old marquess of donnaz , and of [all the frequenters of [Casa Valdu]48-casa valdu]2201-all the frequenters of casa valdu]2193-a few nobles like massimo d'azeglio 's father , who " made the education of his children his first and gravest thought " and supplemented the deficiencies of his wife 's conventual training by " consecrating to her daily four hours of reading , translating and other suitable exercises , " the commoner view was that of alfieri 's own parents , who frequently repeated in their son 's hearing " the old maxim of the piedmontese nobility " that there is no need for a gentleman to be a scholar . such at any rate was the opinion of the old marquess of donnaz , and of all the frequenters of casa valdu . [[Odo]234-odo 's stepfather]2202-odo 's stepfather was engrossed in the fulfilment of [his]2194-massimo d'azeglio 's father duties about [the court]814-the court , and [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , under the influence of poverty and ennui , had sunk into a state of rigid pietism ; so that [the lad]1948-the lad , on [his]1948-the lad visits to [[his]1948-the lad mother]664-his mother , found [himself]1948-the lad in a world where art was represented by the latest pastel - portrait of [a court beauty]2206-a court beauty , literature by [Liguori]328-liguori 's Glories of [Mary]268-sister mary or [the blessed Battista]329-the blessed battista 's Mental Sorrows of [Christ]264-christ , and history by the conviction that [Piedmont]60-piedmont 's efforts to stamp out [the enemies of [the Church]1212-the church]2207-the enemies of the church had distinguished [her]243-donna laura above [every other country of [Europe]40-europe]2209-every other country of europe . [[Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's cicisbeo]2210-donna laura 's cicisbeo was indeed a member of [the local Arcadia]2211-the local arcadia , and given to celebrating in verse every incident in [the noble household of [Valdu]26-valdu]2212-the noble household of valdu , from [its lady]2213-its lady 's name - day to the death of [a pet canary]2214-a pet canary ; but [his]1948-the lad own tastes inclined to the elegant Bettinelli , whose Lettere Virgiliane had so conclusively shown [Dante]331-dante to be [a writer of barbarous doggerel]2215-a writer of barbarous doggerel ; and among [the dilettanti of the day]2216-the dilettanti of the day one heard less of [Raphael]332-raphael than of [Carlo Maratta]333-carlo maratta , less of [Ariosto]308-ariosto and [Petrarch]334-petrarch than of [the Jesuit poet [Padre Cevo]335-padre cevo]2217-the jesuit poet padre cevo , [author of the sublime " heroico - comic "[2218-author of the sublime " heroico - comic " poem on the infancy of jesus] poem on the infancy of Jesus]2218-author of the sublime " heroico - comic " poem on the infancy of jesus . It was in fact mainly to [the Jesuits]336-the jesuits that [Italy]5-italy , in the early part of the eighteenth century , owed [her]243-donna laura literature and [her]243-donna laura art , as well as the direction of [her]243-donna laura religious life . Though the reaction against the order was everywhere making itself felt , though [one Italian sovereign]2219-one italian sovereign after another had been constrained to purchase popularity or even security by banishing the Society from [[his]2219-one italian sovereign dominions]2220-his dominions , [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits maintained [their]2221-the jesuits hold on [the aristocracy]1928-the aristocracy , whose pretentions [they]2221-the jesuits flattered , whose tastes [they]2221-the jesuits affected , and to whom [they]2221-the jesuits represented the spirit of religious and political conservatism , against which [invisible forces were already felt to be moving]2223-invisible forces were already felt to be moving . For the use of [[their]2221-the jesuits noble supporters]2224-their noble supporters , [the Jesuits]336-the jesuits had devised a religion as elaborate and ceremonious as the social usages of [the aristocracy]1928-the aristocracy : [a religion which decked [its chapels]2227-its chapels in imitation of [great ladies]8357-great ladies ' boudoirs and prescribed observances in keeping with the vapid and gossiping existence of [[their]2221-the jesuits inmates]2229-their inmates]2226-a religion which decked its chapels in imitation of great ladies ' boudoirs and prescribed observances in keeping with the vapid and gossiping existence of their inmates . To [Odo]234-odo , fresh from the pure air of [Donnaz]7-donnaz , where the faith of [[his]234-odo kinsfolk]2230-his kinsfolk expressed itself in charity , self - denial and a noble decency of life , there was something stifling in the atmosphere of languishing pietism in which [[his]234-odo mother 's friends]2231-his mother 's friends veiled the emptiness of [their]2231-his mother 's friends days . Under the instruction of [the Countess]291-asti 's director [the boy]839-the boy 's conscience was enervated by the casuistries of Liguorianism and [his]234-odo devotion dulled by the imposition of interminable " pious practices . "[291-asti] It was in [his]234-odo nature to grudge no sacrifice to [his]234-odo ideals , and [he]234-odo might have accomplished without question the monotonous observances [[his]234-odo confessor]2233-his confessor exacted , but for the changed aspect of [the Deity in whose name they were imposed]2234-the deity in whose name they were imposed . As with most thoughtful natures , [Odo]234-odo 's first disillusionment was to come from discovering not what [[his]234-odo God]2235-his god condemned , but what [He]234-odo condoned . Between Cantapresto 's coarse philosophy of pleasure and the refined complaisances of [[his]234-odo new confessor]2236-his new confessor [he]234-odo felt the distinction to be one rather of taste than of principle ; and it seemed to [him]234-odo that the religion of [the aristocracy]1928-the aristocracy might not unfairly be summed up in [the ex - soprano]1834-the ex - soprano 's cynical aphorism : " As [respectful children of [[our]8486-our Heavenly Father]8487-our heavenly father]8485-respectful children of our heavenly father it behoves [us]8486-our not to speak till [we]8486-our are spoken to . "[1834-the ex - soprano] Even the religious ceremonies [he]234-odo witnessed did not console [him]234-odo for that chill hour of dawn , when , in [the chapel at [Donnaz]7-donnaz]2239-the chapel at donnaz , [he]234-odo had served the mass for [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso , with a heart trembling at its own unworthiness yet uplifted by the sense of the Divine Presence . In [the churches]2240-the churches adorned like [aristocratic drawing - rooms , of which [some Madonna]2242-some madonna , wreathed in artificial flowers]2241-aristocratic drawing - rooms , of which some madonna , wreathed in artificial flowers , seemed [the amiable and indulgent hostess]2243-the amiable and indulgent hostess , and where the florid passionate music of the mass was rendered by [[the King]658-the king 's opera singers]2245-the king 's opera singers before [a throng of chattering cavaliers]2246-a throng of chattering cavaliers and [ladies]8307-ladies , [Odo]234-odo prayed in vain for a reawakening of the old emotion . The sense of [sonship]2248-sonship was gone . [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo an alien in [the temple of this affable divinity]2249-the temple of this affable divinity , and [his]234-odo heart echoed no more than the cry which had once lifted [him]234-odo on wings of praise to the very threshold of the hidden glory-- Domine , dilexi decorem domus tuae et locum habitationis gloriae tuae ! It was in the first reaction from this dimly felt loss that [he]234-odo lit one day on a volume which [Alfieri]291-asti had smuggled into [the Academy]61-the academy -- the Lettres Philosophiques of [Francois Arouet de Voltaire]310-voltaire . BOOK II . THE NEW LIGHT . Zu neuen Ufern lockt ein neuer Tag . 2.1 . One afternoon of April in the year 1774 , [Odo Valsecca]234-odo , riding down [the hillside]2250-the hillside below [the church of the Superga]2251-the church of the superga , had reined in [his]234-odo horse at a point where a group of Spanish chestnuts overhung the way . The air was light and pure , the shady turf invited [him]234-odo , and dismounting [he]234-odo bid [[his]234-odo servant]2252-his servant lead the horses to [the wayside inn half way down [the slope]2254-the slope]2253-the wayside inn half way down the slope . [The spot [he]234-odo had chosen]2255-the spot he had chosen , though secluded as [some nook above [the gorge of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]2257-the gorge of donnaz]2256-some nook above the gorge of donnaz , commanded a view of [the Po]45-the po rolling at [his]234-odo feet like a flood of yellowish metal , and beyond , outspread in clear spring sunshine , [the great city in the bosom of [the plain]1139-the plain]2258-the great city in the bosom of the plain . The spectacle was fair enough to touch any fancy : brown domes and facades set in new - leaved gardens and surrounded by vineyards extending to the nearest acclivities ; [country - houses]2260-country - houses glancing through the fresh green of planes and willows ; monastery - walls cresting the higher ridges ; and westward [the Po]45-the po winding in sunlit curves toward [the Alps]20-the alps . [Odo]234-odo had lost none of [his]234-odo sensitiveness to such impressions ; but the sway of another mood turned [his]234-odo eye from the outstretched beauty of [the city]2261-the city to the vernal solitude about [him]234-odo . It was the season when old memories of [Donnaz]255-donnaz worked in [his]234-odo blood ; when [the banks and hedges of [the fresh hill - country about]2263-the fresh hill - country about [Turin]17-turin]2262-the banks and hedges of the fresh hill - country about turin cheated [him]234-odo with a breath of budding beech - groves and the fragrance of crushed fern in [the glens of [the high Pennine valleys]2265-the high pennine valleys]2264-the glens of the high pennine valleys . It was a mere waft , perhaps , from some clod of loosened earth , or the touch of cool elastic moss as [he]234-odo flung [himself]234-odo face downward under the trees ; but the savour , the contact filled [his]234-odo nostrils with mountain air and [his]234-odo eyes with dim - branched distances . At [Donnaz]255-donnaz the slow motions of the northern spring had endeared to [him]255-donnaz all those sweet incipiencies preceding the full choral burst of leaf and flower : the mauve mist over [bare woodlands]2266-bare woodlands , the wet black gleams in frost - bound hollows , the thrust of fronds through withered bracken , the primrose - patches spreading like pale sunshine along [wintry lanes]2267-wintry lanes . [He]255-donnaz had always felt a sympathy for these delicate unnoted changes ; but the feeling which had formerly been like the blind stir of sap in a plant was now a conscious sensation that groped for speech and understanding . [He]255-donnaz had grown up among [people to whom such emotions were unknown]2268-people to whom such emotions were unknown . [The old Marquess]1131-the old marquess 's passion for [[his]1131-the old marquess fields and [woods]2271-woods]2270-his fields and woods was the love of [the agriculturist]2272-the agriculturist and [the hunter]2273-the hunter , not that of [the naturalist]2274-the naturalist or [the poet]2275-the poet ; and [the aristocracy of [the cities]2277-the cities]2276-the aristocracy of the cities regarded [the country]818-the country merely as so much soil from which to draw [their]2276-the aristocracy of the cities maintenance . [The gentlefolk]2279-the gentlefolk never absented [themselves]2279-the gentlefolk from [town]2280-town but for a few weeks of autumn , when [they]2279-the gentlefolk went to [[their]2279-the gentlefolk villas]2281-their villas for the vintage , transporting thither all the diversions of [city]2282-city life and venturing no farther afield than [the pleasure - grounds that were but so many open - air card - rooms]2283-the pleasure - grounds that were but so many open - air card - rooms , [concert - halls]2284-concert - halls and [theatres]2285-theatres . [Odo]234-odo 's tenderness for every sylvan function of renewal and decay , every shifting of light and colour on the flying surface of the year , would have been met with the same stare with which [a certain enchanting Countess]2286-a certain enchanting countess had received the handful of wind - flowers that , fresh from a sunrise on [the hills]1079-the hills , [he]234-odo had laid one morning among [her]2286-a certain enchanting countess toilet - boxes . [The Countess Clarice]338-the countess clarice had stared and laughed , and [every one of [his]234-odo acquaintance]2288-every one of his acquaintance , [Alfieri]291-asti even , would have echoed [her]2286-a certain enchanting countess laugh ; but [one man]2289-one man at least had felt the divine commotion of nature 's touch , had felt and interpreted it , in words as fresh as spring verdure , in the pages of a volume that [Odo]234-odo now drew from [his]234-odo pocket . " [I]234-odo longed to dream , but some unexpected spectacle continually distracted [me]234-odo from [my]234-odo musings . Here immense rocks hung their ruinous masses above [my]234-odo head ; there the thick mist of roaring waterfalls enveloped [me]234-odo ; or some unceasing torrent tore open at [my]234-odo very feet an abyss into which the gaze feared to plunge . Sometimes [I]234-odo was lost in the twilight of a thick wood ; sometimes , on emerging from [a dark ravine]8488-a dark ravine , [my]234-odo eyes were charmed by the sight of [an open meadow]8489-an open meadow ... Nature seemed to revel in unwonted contrasts ; such varieties of aspect had [she]8490-she united in one spot . Here was [an eastern prospect bright with spring flowers]8491-an eastern prospect bright with spring flowers , while autumn fruits ripened to the south and the northern face of the scene was still locked in wintry frosts ... Add to this the different angles at which [the peaks]8492-the peaks took the light , the chiaroscuro of sun and shade , and the variations of light resulting from it at morning and evening ... sum up the impressions [I]234-odo have tried to describe and [you]8493-you will be able to form an idea of the enchanting situation in which [I]234-odo found [myself]234-odo ... The scene has indeed a magical , a supernatural quality , which so ravishes the spirit and senses that one seems to lose all exact notion of [one]8494-one 's surroundings and identity . "[234-odo] This was a new language to [eighteenth - century readers]2290-eighteenth - century readers . Already it had swept through the length and breadth of [France]22-france , like a spring storm - wind bursting open doors and windows , and filling close candle - lit rooms with wet gusts and the scent of beaten blossoms ; but [south of [the Alps]20-the alps]2291-south of the alps the new ideas travelled slowly , and [the Piedmontese]339-the piedmontese were as yet scarce aware of [the man who had written thus of [[their]339-the piedmontese own mountains]2293-their own mountains]2292-the man who had written thus of their own mountains . It was true that , some thirty years earlier , in one of [the very monasteries on which [Odo]234-odo now looked down]2294-the very monasteries on which odo now looked down , [a Swiss vagrant]2295-a swiss vagrant called [Rousseau]340-rousseau had embraced the true faith with the most moving signs of edification ; but the rescue of [Helvetian heretics]2296-helvetian heretics was a favourite occupation of [the Turinese nobility]2297-the turinese nobility and it is doubtful if any recalled the name of [the strange proselyte who had hastened to signalise [his]2298-the strange proselyte who had hastened to signalise his conversion by robbing his employers and slandering an innocent maid - servant conversion by robbing [[his]2298-the strange proselyte who had hastened to signalise his conversion by robbing his employers and slandering an innocent maid - servant employers]2299-his employers and slandering [an innocent maid - servant]2300-an innocent maid - servant]2298-the strange proselyte who had hastened to signalise his conversion by robbing his employers and slandering an innocent maid - servant . [Odo]234-odo in fact owed [his]234-odo first acquaintance with [the French writers]2301-the french writers to [Alfieri]291-asti , who , in the intervals of [his]291-asti wandering over [Europe]40-europe , now and then reappeared in [Turin]17-turin laden with the latest novelties in Transalpine literature and haberdashery . What [[his]234-odo eccentric friend]2302-his eccentric friend failed to provide , [Odo]234-odo had little difficulty in obtaining for [himself]234-odo ; for though most of [the new writers]2303-the new writers were on the Index , and the Sardinian censorship was notoriously severe , there was never yet a barrier that could keep out books , and [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto was [a skilled purveyor of contraband dainties]2304-a skilled purveyor of contraband dainties . [Odo]234-odo had thus acquainted [himself]234-odo with the lighter literature of [England]49-england and [France]22-france ; and though [he]234-odo had read but few philosophical treatises , was yet dimly aware of the new standpoint from which , north of [the Alps]20-the alps , [men]8356-men were beginning to test the accepted forms of thought . The first disturbance of [his]234-odo childish faith , and the coincident reading of the Lettres Philosophiques , had been followed by a period of moral perturbation , during which [he]234-odo suffered from that sense of bewilderment , of inability to classify the phenomena of life , that is one of the keenest trials of inexperience . [Youth]341-youth and nature had their way with [him]234-odo , however , and a wholesome reaction of indifference set in . The invisible world of thought and conduct had been the frequent subject of [his]234-odo musings ; but the other , tangible world was close to [him]234-odo too , spreading like a rich populous plain between [himself]234-odo and the distant heights of speculation . The old doubts , the old dissatisfactions , hung on the edge of consciousness ; but [he]234-odo was too profoundly Italian not to linger awhile in that atmosphere of careless acquiescence that is so pleasant a medium for the unhampered enjoyment of life . Some day , no doubt , the intellectual curiosity and the moral disquietude would revive ; but what [he]234-odo wanted now were books which appealed not to [his]234-odo reason but to [his]234-odo emotions , which reflected as in a mirror the rich and varied life of the senses : books that were warm to the touch , like the little volume in [his]234-odo hand . For it was not only of nature that the book spoke . Amid scenes of such rustic freshness were set human passions as fresh and natural : a great romantic love , subdued to duty , yet breaking forth again and again as young shoots spring from the root of a felled tree . To [eighteenth - century readers]2290-eighteenth - century readers such a picture of life was as new as its setting . Duty , in that day , to [people of quality]2307-people of quality , meant the observance of certain fixed conventions : the correct stepping of a moral minuet ; as an inner obligation , as a voluntary tribute to [Diderot]342-diderot 's " divinity on [earth]575-earth , "[342-diderot] it had hardly yet drawn breath . To depict a personal relation so much purer and more profound than any form of sentiment then in fashion , and then to subordinate it , unflinchingly , to the ideal of those larger relations that link [the individual]2308-the individual to [the group]1903-the group -- this was a stroke of originality for which it would be hard to find a parallel in modern fiction . Here at last was an answer to the blind impulses agrope in [Odo]234-odo 's breast -- the loosening of those springs of emotion that gushed forth in such fresh contrast to the stagnant rills of [the sentimental pleasure - garden]2310-the sentimental pleasure - garden . To renounce a [Julie]343-julie would be more thrilling than-- [Odo]234-odo , with a sigh , thrust the book in [his]234-odo pocket and rose to [his]234-odo feet . It was the hour of [the promenade at [the Valentino]62-the valentino]2311-the promenade at the valentino and [he]234-odo had promised [the Countess Clarice]338-the countess clarice to attend [her]338-the countess clarice . [The old high - roofed palace of [the French princess]2313-the french princess]2312-the old high - roofed palace of the french princess lay below [him]234-odo , in [[its]2312-the old high - roofed palace of the french princess gardens along [the river]2315-the river]2314-its gardens along the river : [he]234-odo could figure , as [he]234-odo looked down on [it]2312-the old high - roofed palace of the french princess , the throng of carriages and chairs , [the modishly dressed riders]2316-the modishly dressed riders , the pedestrians crowding the footpath to watch the quality go by . The vision of all that noise and glitter deepened the sweetness of the woodland hush . [He]234-odo sighed again . Suddenly voices sounded in [the road]726-the road below -- [a man]8112-a man 's speech flecked with girlish laughter . [Odo]234-odo hung back listening : [the girl]2319-the girl 's voice rang like a bird - call through [his]234-odo rustling fancies . Presently [she]2319-the girl came in sight : a slender black - mantled figure hung on the arm of [an elderly man in the sober dress of one of the learned professions]2320-an elderly man in the sober dress of one of the learned professions -- [a physician]2321-a physician or [a lawyer]2322-a lawyer , [Odo]234-odo guessed . [Their]2323-they being afoot , and the style of [the man]1626-the man 's dress , showed that [they]2323-they were of [the middle class]2325-the middle class ; [their]2323-they demeanour , that [they]2323-they were [father]1441-father and [daughter]1442-daughter . [The girl]2319-the girl moved with a light forward flowing of [her]2319-the girl whole body that seemed the pledge of grace in every limb : of [her]2319-the girl face [Odo]234-odo had but a bright glimpse in the eclipse of [her]2319-the girl flapping hat - brim . [She]2319-the girl stood under [his]234-odo tree unheeded ; but as [they]2323-they rose abreast of [him]234-odo [the girl]2319-the girl paused and dropped [[her]2319-the girl companion]2330-her companion 's arm . " Look ! The cherry flowers ! "[2319-the girl] [she]2319-the girl cried , and stretched [her]2319-the girl arms to a white gush of blossoms above the wall across [the road]726-the road . [Odo]234-odo had acquired , at twenty - two , a nobility of carriage not incompatible with the boyish candour of [his]234-odo gaze , and becomingly set off by the brilliant dress - uniform of [a lieutenant in one of [the provincial regiments]2353-the provincial regiments]2352-a lieutenant in one of the provincial regiments . [He]234-odo was tall and fair , and a certain languor of complexion , inherited from [[[his]234-odo father]667-his father 's house]2355-his father 's house , was corrected in [him]234-odo by the vivacity of [the Donnaz blood]2356-the donnaz blood . This now sparkled in [his]234-odo grey eye , and gave a glow to [his]234-odo cheek , as [he]234-odo stepped across the threshold , treading on a sprig of cherry - blossom that had dropped unnoticed to the floor . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , looking after [him]234-odo , caught sight of the flowers and kicked them aside with a contemptuous toe . " [I]267-cantapresto sometimes think [he]234-odo botanises , "[267-cantapresto] [he]267-cantapresto murmured with a shrug . " [The Lord]8230-the lord knows what queer notions [he]234-odo gets out of all these books ! "[267-cantapresto] 2.2 . As an infusion of fresh blood to [Odo]234-odo were [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's meteoric returns to [Turin]17-turin . Life moved languidly in [the strait - laced city]2357-the strait - laced city , even to [a young gentleman a - tiptoe for adventure and framed to elicit it as the hazel - wand draws water]2358-a young gentleman a - tiptoe for adventure and framed to elicit it as the hazel - wand draws water . Not that vulgar distractions were lacking . [The town]593-the town , as [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto had long since advised [him]234-odo , had [its]593-the town secret leniencies , [[its]593-the town posterns]2360-its posterns opening on clandestine pleasure ; but there was that in [Odo]234-odo which early turned [him]234-odo from such cheap counterfeits of living . [He]234-odo accepted the diversions of [his]234-odo age , but with a clear sense of their worth ; and [the youth who calls [his]234-odo pleasures by [their]2362-their true name]2361-the youth who calls his pleasures by their true name has learned the secret of resisting them . [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's coming set deeper springs in motion . [His]306-alfieri follies and extravagances were on a less provincial scale than those of [[Odo]234-odo 's daily associates]2363-odo 's daily associates . The breath of a freer life clung to [him]306-alfieri and [his]306-alfieri allusions were so many glimpses into [a larger world]2364-a larger world . [His]306-alfieri political theories were but the enlargement of [his]306-alfieri private grievances , but the mere play of criticism on accepted institutions was an exercise more novel and exhilirating than the wildest ride on one of [[his]306-alfieri half - tamed thorough - breds]2365-his half - tamed thorough - breds . Still chiefly [a man of pleasure]2366-a man of pleasure , and [the slave]2367-the slave , as always , of some rash infatuation , [Alfieri]306-alfieri was already shaking off the intellectual torpor of [his]306-alfieri youth ; and the first stirrings of [his]306-alfieri curiosity roused an answering passion in [Odo]234-odo . [Their]2368-their tastes were indeed divergent , for to that external beauty which was to Odo the very bloom of life , [Alfieri]306-alfieri remained insensible ; while of its imaginative counterpart , its prolongation in the realm of thought and emotion , [he]306-alfieri had but the most limited conception . But [his]306-alfieri love of ringing deeds woke the chivalrous strain in [Odo]234-odo , and [his]306-alfieri vague celebration of Liberty , [that unknown goddess to whom altars were everywhere building]2369-that unknown goddess to whom altars were everywhere building , chimed with the other 's scorn of oppression and injustice . So far , it is true , [their]2368-their companionship had been mainly one of pleasure ; but the temper of both gave [their]2368-their follies that provisional character which saves [them]2368-their from vulgarity . [Odo]234-odo , who had slept late on the morning after [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend 's return , was waked by the pompous mouthing of certain lines just then on every lip in [Italy:--]65-italy:-- Meet was it that , [its]65-italy:-- ancient seats forsaking , [An Empire]2371-an empire should set forth with dauntless sail , And braving tempests and the deep 's betrayal , Break down the barriers of inviolate worlds-- That [Cortez]346-cortez and [Pizarro]347-pizarro should esteem The blood of [man]2185-man a trivial sacrifice When , flinging down from [their]2368-their ancestral thrones [Incas and Mexicans of royal line]2373-incas and mexicans of royal line , [They]2368-their wrecked [two kingdoms]2374-two kingdoms to refresh [thy]2375-thy palate-- [They]2376-they were the verses in which the abate [Parini]348-parini , in [his]348-parini satire of The Morning , apostrophizes the cup of chocolate which the lacquey presents to [[his]348-parini master]2377-his master . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto had in fact just entered with a cup of this beverage , and [Alfieri]306-alfieri , who stood at [[his]306-alfieri friend]2124-his friend 's bedside with unpowdered locks and a fashionable undress of Parisian cut , snatching the tray from [the soprano]1599-the soprano 's hands presented it to [Odo]234-odo in an attitude of mock servility . [The young man]2380-the young man sprang up laughing . It was the fashion to applaud [Parini]348-parini 's verse in the circles at which [his]348-parini satire was aimed , and [none]1118-none recited [his]348-parini mock heroics with greater zest than [the young gentlemen whose fopperies [he]348-parini ridiculed]2382-the young gentlemen whose fopperies he ridiculed . [Odo]234-odo 's toilet was indeed a rite almost as elaborate as that of [[Parini]348-parini 's hero]2383-parini 's hero ; and this accomplished , [he]234-odo was on [his]234-odo way to fulfil the very duty [the poet]2275-the poet most unsparingly derides : the morning visit of [the cicisbeo]1990-the cicisbeo to [[his]234-odo lady]1996-his lady ; but meanwhile [he]234-odo liked to show [himself]234-odo above the follies of [[his]234-odo class]2387-his class by joining in the laugh against [them]2387-his class . When [he]234-odo issued from [the powder - room]2388-the powder - room in [his]234-odo gold - laced uniform , with scented gloves and carefully - adjusted queue , [he]234-odo presented the image of [a young gentleman so clearly equal to the most flattering emergencies]2389-a young gentleman so clearly equal to the most flattering emergencies that [Alfieri]306-alfieri broke into a smile of half - ironical approval . " [I]234-odo see , [[my]234-odo dear cavaliere]8518-my dear cavaliere , that it were idle to invite [you]8518-my dear cavaliere to try one of the new Arabs [I]234-odo have brought with [me]234-odo from [Spain]63-spain , since it is plain other duties engage [you]8518-my dear cavaliere ; but [I]234-odo come to lay claim to [your]8518-my dear cavaliere evening . [Odo Valsecca]234-odo represented [her]338-the countess clarice escape from this bondage -- the dash of romance and folly in a life of elegant formalities ; and [the Countess]1915-the countess , who would not have sacrificed to [him]234-odo one of [her]1915-the countess rights as [a court - lady]2421-a court - lady or [a nobil donna of the Golden Book]2422-a nobil donna of the golden book , regarded [him]234-odo as the reward which [Providence]352-providence accords to a well - regulated conduct . [[Her]1915-the countess room]1410-her room , when [Odo]234-odo entered [it]1410-her room on taking leave of [Alfieri]306-alfieri , was crowded , as usual at that hour , with the hangers - on of [the noble lady]2424-the noble lady 's lever : the abatino in lace ruffles , handing about [his]234-odo latest rhymed acrostic , [the jeweller]2425-the jeweller displaying a set of enamelled buckles newly imported from [Paris]27-paris , and [the black - breeched doctor with white bands who concocted remedies for [the Countess]1915-the countess 's vapours and megrims]2426-the black - breeched doctor with white bands who concocted remedies for the countess 's vapours and megrims . [These personages]2428-these personages , grouped about the toilet - table where [the Countess]1915-the countess sat under the hands of [a Parisian hairdresser]2430-a parisian hairdresser , were picturesquely relieved against the stucco panelling and narrow mirrors of [the apartment]2431-the apartment , with [its]2431-the apartment windows looking on a garden set with mossy statues . To [Odo]234-odo , however , the scene suggested the most tedious part of [his]234-odo day 's routine . The compliments to be exchanged , the silly verses to be praised , the gewgaws from [Paris]27-paris to be admired , were all contrasted in [his]234-odo mind with the vision of that other life which had come to [him]234-odo on [the hillside of [the Superga]67-the superga]2432-the hillside of the superga . On this mood [the Countess Clarice]338-the countess clarice 's sarcasms fell without effect . To be pouted at because [he]306-alfieri had failed to attend the promenade of [the Valentino]62-the valentino was to [Odo]234-odo but a convenient pretext for excusing [himself]234-odo from [the Queen]1930-the queen 's circle that evening . [He]234-odo had engaged with little ardour to join [Alfieri]306-alfieri in what [he]234-odo guessed to be a sufficiently commonplace adventure ; but as [he]234-odo listened to [the Countess]1915-the countess 's chatter about the last minuet - step , and the relative merits of sanspareil water and oil - of - lilies , of gloves from [Blois]68-blois and [Vendome]69-vendome , [his]234-odo impatience hailed any alternative as a release . Meanwhile , however , long hours of servitude intervened . [The lady]660-the lady 's toilet completed , to the adjusting of the last patch , [he]234-odo must attend [her]660-the lady to dinner , where , placed at [her]660-the lady side , [he]234-odo was awarded the honour of carving the roast ; must sit through two hours of biribi in company with [the abatino]2436-the abatino , [the doctor]2437-the doctor , and half - a - dozen parasites of the noble table ; and for two hours more must ride in [[her]660-the lady gilt coach]2438-her gilt coach up and down [the promenade of [the Valentino]62-the valentino]2439-the promenade of the valentino . Escaping from this ceremonial , with the consciousness that it must be repeated on the morrow , [Odo]234-odo was seized with that longing for freedom that makes the first street - corner an invitation to flight . How [he]234-odo envied [Alfieri]306-alfieri , whose travelling - carriage stood at the beck of such moods ! [Odo]234-odo 's scant means forbade evasion , even had [his]234-odo military duties not kept [him]234-odo in [Turin]17-turin . [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo no more than a puppet dancing to the tune of [Parini]348-parini 's satire , a puny doll condemned , as the strings of custom pulled , to feign the gestures of immortal passions . 2.3 . The night was moonless , with cold dashes of rain , and though [the streets of [Turin]17-turin]2440-the streets of turin were well - lit no lantern - ray reached the windings of [the lane behind [the Corpus Domini]66-the corpus domini]2441-the lane behind the corpus domini . As [Odo]234-odo , alone under the wall of [the church]1212-the church , awaited [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend 's arrival , [he]234-odo wondered what risk had constrained [the reckless Alfieri]306-alfieri to such unwonted caution . [Italy]5-italy was at that time a vast network of espionage , and [the Piedmontese capital]2444-the piedmontese capital passed for [one of the best - policed cities in [Europe]40-europe]2445-one of the best - policed cities in europe ; but even on a moonless night the law distinguished between [the noble pleasure - seeker]2446-the noble pleasure - seeker and [the obscure delinquent whose fate it was to pay the other]2447-the obscure delinquent whose fate it was to pay the other 's shot . [Odo]234-odo knew that [he]234-odo would probably be followed and [his]234-odo movements reported to [the authorities]2448-the authorities ; but [he]234-odo was almost equally certain that there would be no active interference in [his]234-odo affairs . What chiefly puzzled [him]234-odo was [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's insistence that [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto should not be privy to the adventure . [The soprano]1599-the soprano had long been the confidant of [[his]1599-the soprano pupil]2450-his pupil 's escapades , and [his]1599-the soprano adroitness had often been of service in intrigues such as that on which [Odo]234-odo now fancied [himself]234-odo engaged . [The place]1030-the place , again , perplexed [him]234-odo : [a sober quarter of [convents]2453-convents and [private dwellings]2454-private dwellings , in the very eye of [the royal palace]1950-the royal palace]2452-a sober quarter of convents and private dwellings , in the very eye of the royal palace , scarce seeming [the theatre]1559-the theatre for a light adventure . These incongruities revived [his]234-odo former wonder ; nor was this dispelled by [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's approach . [The poet , masked and unattended]2457-the poet , masked and unattended , rejoined [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend without a word ; and [Odo]234-odo guessed in [him]2124-his friend an eye and ear alert for pursuit . Guided by the pressure of [his]234-odo arm , [Odo]234-odo was hurried round the bend of [the lane]8522-the lane , up [a transverse alley]2460-a transverse alley and across [a little square lost between [high shuttered buildings]2462-high shuttered buildings]2461-a little square lost between high shuttered buildings . [Alfieri]306-alfieri , at [his]306-alfieri first word , gripped [his]234-odo arm with a backward glance ; then urged [him]234-odo on under the denser blackness of an arched passage - way , at the end of which an oil - light glimmered . Here a gate in a wall confronted [them]2463-them . It opened at [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's tap and [Odo]234-odo scented wet box - borders and felt the gravel of a path under foot . The gate was at once locked behind [them]2463-them and [they]2463-them entered [the ground - floor of [a house]2465-a house as dark as [the garden]8185-the garden]2464-the ground - floor of a house as dark as the garden . " [Count Alfieri]306-alfieri , [sir]8257-sir , "[306-alfieri] [he]306-alfieri said , " has doubtless explained to [you]8257-sir the necessity that obliges [me]234-odo to be so private in receiving [[my]234-odo friends]8538-my friends ; and now perhaps [you]8257-sir will join [these gentlemen]8539-these gentlemen in examining some rare fossil fish newly sent [me]234-odo from [the Monte Bolca]70-the monte bolca . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo murmured a civil rejoinder ; but the wonder into which the sight of [the young girl]2484-the young girl had thrown [him]234-odo was fast verging on stupefaction . What mystery was here ? What necessity compelled [an elderly professor]2485-an elderly professor to receive [[his]2485-an elderly professor scientific friends]2486-his scientific friends like a band of [political conspirators]2487-political conspirators ? How above all , in the light of [the girl]2319-the girl 's presence , was [Odo]234-odo to interpret [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's extravagant allusions to the nature of [their]2489-their visit ? The company having returned to the cabinet of fossils , none seemed to observe [his]306-alfieri disorder but [the young lady who was its cause]2490-the young lady who was its cause ; and seeing [him]306-alfieri stand apart [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause advanced with a smile , saying , " Perhaps [you]306-alfieri would rather look at some of [[my]2490-the young lady who was its cause father]8146-my father 's other curiosities . "[2490-the young lady who was its cause] Simple as the words were , they failed to restore [Odo]234-odo 's self - possession , and for a moment [he]306-alfieri made no answer . Perhaps [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause partly guessed the cause of [his]306-alfieri commotion ; yet it was not so much [her]2490-the young lady who was its cause beauty that silenced [him]306-alfieri , as the spirit that seemed to inhabit it . Nature , in general so chary of [her]2490-the young lady who was its cause gifts , so prone to use one good feature as the palliation of a dozen deficiencies , to [we]2491-we d the eloquent lip with the ineffectual eye , had indeed compounded [her]2490-the young lady who was its cause of all fine meanings , making each grace the complement of another and every outward charm expressive of some inward quality . Here was as little of [the convent - bred miss]2492-the convent - bred miss as of [the flippant and vapourish fine lady]2493-the flippant and vapourish fine lady ; and any suggestion of a less fair alternative vanished before such candid graces . [Odo]234-odo 's confusion had in truth sprung from [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's ambiguous hints ; and these shrivelling to nought in the gaze that encountered [his]306-alfieri , constraint gave way to a sense of wondering pleasure . " [I]306-alfieri should like to see whatever [you]2490-the young lady who was its cause will show [me]306-alfieri , "[306-alfieri] said [he]306-alfieri , as simply as [one child speaking to another]2494-one child speaking to another ; and [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause answered in the same tone , " Then [we]8541-we 'll glance at [[my]2490-the young lady who was its cause father]8146-my father 's collections before the serious business of the evening begins . "[2490-the young lady who was its cause] With these words [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause began to lead [him]306-alfieri about [the room]782-the room , pointing out and explaining the curiosities it contained . It was clear that , like [many scholars of [his]306-alfieri day]2496-many scholars of his day , [Professor Vivaldi]354-vivaldi was something of an eclectic in [his]306-alfieri studies , for while one table held a fine orrery , a cabinet of coins stood near , and the book - shelves were surmounted by specimens of coral and petrified wood . Of all these rarities [[his]306-alfieri daughter]1475-his daughter had a word to say , and though [her]2490-the young lady who was its cause explanations were brief and without affectation of pedantry , [they]2498-they put [[her]2490-the young lady who was its cause companion]2330-her companion 's ignorance to the blush . It must be owned , however , that had [his]306-alfieri learning been a match for [hers]2490-the young lady who was its cause it would have stood [him]306-alfieri in poor stead at the moment ; [his]306-alfieri faculties being lost in the wonder of hearing such discourse from such lips . To [his]306-alfieri compliments on [her]2490-the young lady who was its cause erudition [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause returned with a smile that what learning [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause had was no merit , since [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause had been bred in [a library]2500-a library ; to which [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause suddenly added:--"You are not unknown to [me]2490-the young lady who was its cause , [Cavaliere]234-odo ; but [I]2490-the young lady who was its cause never thought to see [you]306-alfieri [here]8091-here . "[2490-the young lady who was its cause] The words renewed [[her]2490-the young lady who was its cause hearer]2501-her hearer 's surprise ; but giving [him]306-alfieri no time to reply , [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause went on in a lower tone:--"You are young and [the world]844-the world is fair before [you]306-alfieri . Have [you]306-alfieri considered that before risking [yourself]306-alfieri among [us]2503-us ? "[2490-the young lady who was its cause] [She]2490-the young lady who was its cause coloured under [Odo]234-odo 's wondering gaze , and at [his]306-alfieri random rejoinder that it was a risk [any man]2502-any man would gladly take without considering , [she]2490-the young lady who was its cause turned from [him]306-alfieri with a gesture in which [he]306-alfieri fancied a shade of disappointment . By this [they]2503-us had reached the cabinet of fossils , about which the interest of [the other guests]2504-the other guests still seemed to centre . [Alfieri]306-alfieri , indeed , paced the farther end of [the room]782-the room with the air of awaiting the despatch of some tedious business ; but [the others]2506-the others were engaged in an animated discussion necessitating frequent reference to the folios [Vivaldi]354-vivaldi had brought from [[his]354-vivaldi study]8527-his study . [The latter]870-the latter turned to [Odo]234-odo as though to include [him]306-alfieri in [the group]1903-the group . " [I]306-alfieri do not know , [sir]8257-sir , "[306-alfieri] said [he]306-alfieri , " whether [you]8257-sir have found leisure to study these enigmas of that mysterious Sphinx , [the earth]1750-the earth ; for though [Count Alfieri]306-alfieri has spoken to [me]306-alfieri of [your]8257-sir unusual acquirements , [I]306-alfieri understand [your]8257-sir tastes have hitherto lain rather in the direction of philosophy and letters ; "[306-alfieri] and on [Odo]234-odo 's prompt admission of ignorance , [he]234-odo courteously continued : " The physical sciences seem , indeed , less likely to appeal to the imaginative and poetical faculty in [man]2185-man , and , on the other hand , religion has appeared to prohibit [their]8548-their too close investigation ; yet [I]234-odo question if any thoughtful mind can enter on the study of these curious phenomena without feeling , as it were , an affinity between such investigations and the most abstract forms of thought . For whether [we]8549-we regard these figured stones as of terriginous origin , either mere lusus naturae , or mineral formations produced by a plastic virtue latent in [the earth]1750-the earth , or whether as in fact organic substances lapidified by the action of water ; in either case , what speculations must their origin excite , leading [us]8549-we back into that dark and unexplored period of time when the breath of Creation was yet moving on the face of the waters ! "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo had listened but confusedly to the first words of this discourse ; but [his]234-odo intellectual curiosity was too great not to respond to such an appeal , and all [his]234-odo perplexities slipped from [him]234-odo in the pursuit of [the Professor]2482-the professor 's thought . [One of [the other guests]2504-the other guests]2511-one of the other guests seemed struck by [his]234-odo look of attention .
