" [[My]8523-this gentleman dear]8444-my dear [Vivaldi]354-vivaldi , "[8523-this gentleman] said [this gentleman]8523-this gentleman , laying down a fossil , and fixing [his]8523-this gentleman gaze on [Odo]234-odo while [he]234-odo addressed [the Professor]2482-the professor , " why use such superannuated formulas in introducing a neophyte to a study designed to subvert the very foundations of the Mosaic cosmogony ? [I]234-odo take it [the Cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere is one of [us]2517-the learned group , since [he]8130-the cavaliere is [here]8091-here this evening : why , then , permit [him]8130-the cavaliere to stray even for a moment in the labyrinth of theological error ? "[234-odo] [The Professor]2482-the professor 's deprecating murmur was cut short by an outburst from [another of [the learned group]2517-the learned group]2516-another of the learned group , [a red - faced spectacled personage in [a doctor]2519-a doctor 's gown]2518-a red - faced spectacled personage in a doctor 's gown . " Pardon [me]234-odo for suggesting , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo exclaimed , " that the conditional terms in which [[our]2517-the learned group host]8554-our host was careful to present [his]8554-our host hypotheses are better suited to the instruction of [the neophyte]8555-the neophyte than [[our]2517-the learned group learned friend]8556-our learned friend 's positive assertions . But if [the Vulcanists]8557-the vulcanists are to claim [the Cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo , may not [the Diluvials]355-the diluvials also have a hearing ? How often must it be repeated that theology as well as physical science is satisfied by the Diluvial explanation of the origin of petrified organisms , whereas inexorable logic compels [the Vulcanists]8557-the vulcanists to own that [their]8557-the vulcanists thesis is subversive of all dogmatic belief ? "[234-odo] [The first speaker]2520-the first speaker answered with a gesture of disdain . " [[My]2520-the first speaker dear doctor]8559-my dear doctor , [you]8559-my dear doctor occupy a chair in [[our]2517-the learned group venerated University]8560-our venerated university . From [that exalted cathedra]8561-that exalted cathedra the Mosaic theory of Creation must still be expounded ; but in the security of [these surroundings]8562-these surroundings -- [the catacombs of the new faith]8563-the catacombs of the new faith -- why keep up the forms of an obsolete creed ? As long ago as [Pythagoras]356-pythagoras , [man]2185-man was taught that all things were in a state of flux , without end as without beginning , and must [we]2517-the learned group still , after more than two thousand years , pretend to regard [the universe]2402-the universe as some gigantic toy manufactured in six days by [a Superhuman Artisan , who is presently to destroy it at [his]8566-a superhuman artisan , who is presently to destroy it at his pleasure pleasure]8566-a superhuman artisan , who is presently to destroy it at his pleasure ? "[2520-the first speaker] " [Sir]8257-sir , "[905-the other] cried [the other]905-the other , flushing from red to purple at this assault , " [I]905-the other know not on what ground [you]8257-sir insinuate that [my]905-the other private convictions differ from [my]905-the other public doctrine-- "[905-the other] But here , with a firmness tempered by the most scrupulous courtesy , [Professor Vivaldi]354-vivaldi intervened . " [Gentlemen]1901-gentlemen , "[354-vivaldi] said [he]354-vivaldi , " the discussion in which [you]1901-gentlemen are engaged , interesting as it is , must , [I]354-vivaldi fear , distract [us]2517-the learned group from the true purpose of [our]2517-the learned group meeting . [I]354-vivaldi am happy to offer [[my]354-vivaldi house]8535-my house as [the asylum of all free research]8570-the asylum of all free research ; but [you]1901-gentlemen must remember that the first object of these reunions is , not the special study of any one branch of modern science , but the application of physical investigation to the origin and destiny of [man]2185-man . In other words , [we]2517-the learned group ask the study of nature to lead [us]2517-the learned group to the knowledge of [ourselves]2517-the learned group ; and it is because [we]2517-the learned group approach this great problem from a point as yet unsanctioned by dogmatic authority , that [I]354-vivaldi am reluctantly obliged"--and[354-vivaldi] here [he]354-vivaldi turned to [Odo]234-odo with a smile--"to throw a veil of privacy over these inoffensive meetings . "[354-vivaldi] Here at last was the key to the enigma . [The gentlemen assembled in [[Professor Vivaldi]354-vivaldi 's rooms]2523-professor vivaldi 's rooms]2522-the gentlemen assembled in professor vivaldi 's rooms were met [there]606-there to discuss questions not safely aired in public . [They]2522-the gentlemen assembled in professor vivaldi 's rooms were [conspirators]2525-conspirators indeed , but the liberation [they]2522-the gentlemen assembled in professor vivaldi 's rooms planned was intellectual rather than political ; though [the acuter among [them]2522-the gentlemen assembled in professor vivaldi 's rooms]2526-the acuter among them doubtless saw whither such innovations tended . Meanwhile [they]2522-the gentlemen assembled in professor vivaldi 's rooms were content to linger in that wide field of speculation which the development of the physical sciences had recently opened to philosophic thought . As , at the Revival of Learning , [the thinker imprisoned in mediaeval dialectics]2527-the thinker imprisoned in mediaeval dialectics suddenly felt under [his]2527-the thinker imprisoned in mediaeval dialectics feet the firm ground of classic argument , so , in the eighteenth century , philosophy , long suspended in the void of metaphysic , touched [earth]575-earth again and , Antaeus - like , drew fresh life from the contact . It was clear that [Professor Vivaldi]354-vivaldi , whose very name had been unknown to [Odo]234-odo , was [an important figure in [the learned world]2530-the learned world , and one uniting the tact and firmness necessary to control those dissensions from which philosophy itself does not preserve [its disciples]2531-its disciples]2529-an important figure in the learned world , and one uniting the tact and firmness necessary to control those dissensions from which philosophy itself does not preserve its disciples . [His]354-vivaldi words calmed [the two disputants who were preparing to do battle over [Odo]234-odo 's unborn scientific creed]2532-the two disputants who were preparing to do battle over odo 's unborn scientific creed , and the talk growing more general , [the Professor]2482-the professor turned to [[his]2482-the professor daughter]1475-his daughter , saying , " [[My]2482-the professor Fulvia]8572-my fulvia , is the study prepared ? "[2482-the professor] [She]1475-his daughter signed [her]1475-his daughter assent , and [[her]1475-his daughter father]1415-her father led the way to an inner cabinet , where seats were drawn about a table scattered with pamphlets , gazettes and dictionaries , and set out with modest refreshments . Here began a conversation ranging from chemistry to taxation , and from the perfectibility of [man]2185-man to the secondary origin of [the earth]1750-the earth 's surface . It was evident to [Odo]234-odo that , though [[the Professor]2482-the professor 's guests]2539-the professor 's guests represented all shades of opinion , some being clearly loth to leave the safe anchorage of orthodoxy , while others already braved the seas of free enquiry , yet all were at one as to the need of unhampered action and discussion . [Odo]234-odo 's dormant curiosity woke with a start at the summons of fresh knowledge . Here were worlds to explore , or rather the actual world about [him]234-odo , [a region then stranger and more unfamiliar than [the lost Atlantis of fable]2541-the lost atlantis of fable]2540-a region then stranger and more unfamiliar than the lost atlantis of fable . Liberty was the word on every lip , and if to some it represented the right to doubt the Diluvial origin of fossils , to others that of reforming the penal code , to a third ( as to [Alfieri]306-alfieri ) merely personal independence and relief from civil restrictions ; yet these fragmentary conceptions seemed , to [Odo]234-odo 's excited fancy , to blend in the vision of a New Light encircling the whole horizon of thought . [He]234-odo understood at last [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's allusion to a face for the sight of which [men]8356-men were ready to lay down [their]8356-men lives ; and if , as [he]234-odo walked [home]1346-home before dawn , those heavenly lineaments were blent in memory with features of a mortal cast , yet these were pure and grave enough to stand for the image of [the goddess]2544-the goddess . 2.4 . [Professor Orazio Vivaldi]354-vivaldi , after filling with distinction the chair of Philosophy at [the University of [Turin]17-turin]71-the university of turin , had lately resigned [his]354-vivaldi office that [he]354-vivaldi might have leisure to complete a long - contemplated work on the Origin of Civilisation . [[His]354-vivaldi house]1355-his house was the meeting - place of a society calling itself of [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees and ostensibly devoted to the study of [the classical poets]2546-the classical poets , from whose pages [the members]2547-the members were supposed to cull mellifluous nourishment ; but under this guise [the so - called literati]2548-the so - called literati had for some time indulged in free discussion of religious and scientific questions . [The Academy of [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees]2549-the academy of the honey - bees comprised among [its]2549-the academy of the honey - bees members all [the independent thinkers of [Turin]17-turin]2550-the independent thinkers of turin : [doctors of law , of philosophy and medicine]2551-doctors of law , of philosophy and medicine , [chemists]2552-chemists , [philologists]2553-philologists and [naturalists]2554-naturalists , with [one or two members of [the nobility]1665-the nobility]2555-one or two members of the nobility , who , like [Alfieri]306-alfieri , felt , or affected , an interest in the graver problems of life , and could be trusted not to betray the true character of [the association]2557-the association . These details [Odo]234-odo learned the next day from [Alfieri]306-alfieri ; who went on to say that , owing to the increased vigilance of [the government]2558-the government , and to the banishment of [several distinguished men accused by [the Church]72-the church of heretical or seditious opinions]2559-several distinguished men accused by the church of heretical or seditious opinions , [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees had of late been obliged to hold [their]357-the honey - bees meetings secretly , it being even rumoured that [Vivaldi]354-vivaldi , who was [[their]357-the honey - bees president]2560-their president , had resigned [his]354-vivaldi professorship and withdrawn behind the shelter of literary employment in order to elude the observation of [the authorities]2448-the authorities . [Men]8356-men had not yet forgotten the fate of [the Neapolitan historian]2563-the neapolitan historian , [Pietro Giannone]358-pietro giannone , who for daring [to attack the censorship and the growth of the temporal power]2564-to attack the censorship and the growth of the temporal power had been driven from [Naples]59-naples to [Vienna]73-vienna , from [Vienna]73-vienna back to [Venice]41-venice , and at length , at the prompting of [the Holy See , lured across the Piedmontese frontier by [[Charles Emmanuel]307-charles emmanuel of [Savoy]16-savoy]2566-charles emmanuel of savoy , and imprisoned for life in [the citadel of [Turin]17-turin]2567-the citadel of turin]2565-the holy see , lured across the piedmontese frontier by charles emmanuel of savoy , and imprisoned for life in the citadel of turin . The memory of [his]354-vivaldi tragic history -- most of all , perhaps , of [his]354-vivaldi recantation and the " devout ending "[354-vivaldi] to which solitude and persecution had forced the freest spirit of [his]354-vivaldi day -- hovered like a warning on the horizon of thought and constrained political speculation to hide itself behind the study of fashionable trifles . [Alfieri]306-alfieri had lately joined [the association of [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees]2568-the association of the honey - bees , and [the Professor]2482-the professor , at [his]2482-the professor suggestion , had invited [Odo]234-odo , for whose discretion [[his]2482-the professor friend]2124-his friend declared [himself]2124-his friend ready to answer . [The Honey - Bees]2571-the honey - bees were in fact desirous of attracting [young men of rank who felt an interest in scientific or economic problems]2572-young men of rank who felt an interest in scientific or economic problems ; for it was hoped that in this manner the new ideas might imperceptibly permeate [the class whose privileges and traditions presented the chief obstacle to reform]2573-the class whose privileges and traditions presented the chief obstacle to reform . In [France]22-france , it was whispered , [free - thinkers]2574-free - thinkers and [political agitators]2575-political agitators were [the honoured guests of [the nobility]1665-the nobility , who eagerly embraced [their]2571-the honey - bees theories and applied [them]2571-the honey - bees to the remedy of social abuses]2576-the honoured guests of the nobility , who eagerly embraced their theories and applied them to the remedy of social abuses . Only by similar means could the ideals of [the Piedmontese reformers]2578-the piedmontese reformers be realised ; and in those early days of universal illusion none appeared to suspect the danger of arming [inexperienced]2579-inexperienced hands with untried weapons . [Utopia]74-utopia was already in sight ; and all [the world]844-the world was setting out for it as for some heavenly picnic ground . Of [Vivaldi]354-vivaldi [himself]354-vivaldi , [Alfieri]306-alfieri spoke with extravagant admiration . [His]306-alfieri affable exterior was said to conceal the moral courage of [one of [[Plutarch]359-plutarch 's heroes]2582-plutarch 's heroes]2581-one of plutarch 's heroes . [He]306-alfieri was [a man after the antique pattern , ready to lay down fortune]2583-a man after the antique pattern , ready to lay down fortune , credit and freedom in the defence of [his]306-alfieri convictions . " [An Agamemnon]8573-an agamemnon , "[306-alfieri] [Alfieri]306-alfieri exclaimed , " who would not hesitate to sacrifice [[his]306-alfieri daughter]1475-his daughter to obtain a favourable wind for [his]306-alfieri enterprise ! "[306-alfieri] The metaphor was perhaps scarcely to [Odo]234-odo 's taste ; but at least it gave [him]306-alfieri the chance for which [he]306-alfieri had waited . " And [the daughter]8575-the daughter ? "[306-alfieri] [he]306-alfieri asked . " [The lovely doctoress]8576-the lovely doctoress ? "[306-alfieri] said [Alfieri]306-alfieri carelessly . " Oh , [she]8575-the daughter 's [one of [your]234-odo prodigies of female learning , such as [[our]8578-our topsy - turvy land]8579-our topsy - turvy land]8577-one of your prodigies of female learning , such as our topsy - turvy land produces : an incipient [Laura Bassi]360-laura bassi or [Gaetana Agnesi]361-gaetana agnesi , to name [the most distinguished of [[their]8581-their tribe]8582-their tribe]8580-the most distinguished of their tribe ; though [I]306-alfieri believe that hitherto [[her]8575-the daughter father]1415-her father 's good sense or [her]8575-the daughter own has kept [her]8575-the daughter from aspiring to academic honours . [The beautiful Fulvia]362-fulvia is [a good daughter]8584-a good daughter , and devotes [herself]362-fulvia , [I]306-alfieri 'm told , to helping [Vivaldi]362-fulvia in [his]234-odo work ; a far more becoming employment for one of [her]362-fulvia age and sex than defending Latin theses before [a crew of ribald students]8585-a crew of ribald students . "[306-alfieri] In this [Odo]234-odo was of one mind with [him]234-odo ; for though [Italy]5-italy was used to the spectacle of the Improvisatrice and [the female doctor of philosophy]2584-the female doctor of philosophy , it is doubtful if the character was one in which [any admirer]2585-any admirer cared to see [his]234-odo divinity figure . [Odo]234-odo , at any rate , felt a distinct satisfaction in learning that [Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia had thus far made no public display of [her]362-fulvia learning . How much pleasanter to picture [her]362-fulvia as [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father 's aid , perhaps [a sharer in [his]234-odo dreams]2587-a sharer in his dreams : [a vestal cherishing the flame of Liberty in [the secret sanctuary of [the goddess]2544-the goddess]2589-the secret sanctuary of the goddess]2588-a vestal cherishing the flame of liberty in the secret sanctuary of the goddess ! [He]234-odo scarce knew as yet of what [his]234-odo feeling for [the girl]2319-the girl was compounded . The sentiment [she]2319-the girl had roused was one for which [his]234-odo experience had no name : an emotion in which awe mingled with an almost boyish sense of fellowship , sex as yet lurking out of sight as in some hidden ambush . It was perhaps [her]2319-the girl association with a world so unfamiliar and alluring that lent [her]2319-the girl for the moment [her]2319-the girl greatest charm . [Odo]234-odo 's imagination had been profoundly stirred by what [he]234-odo had heard and seen at the meeting of [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees . That impatience with the vanity of [his]234-odo own pursuits and with the injustice of existing conditions , which hovered like [a phantom at the feast of life]2592-a phantom at the feast of life , had at last found form and utterance . [Parini]348-parini 's satires and the bitter mockery of the " Frusta Letteraria "[348-parini] were but instruments of demolition ; but the arguments of [[the Professor]2482-the professor 's friends]2594-the professor 's friends had that constructive quality so appealing to the urgent temper of youth . Was [the world]844-the world in ruins ? Then here was a plan to rebuild [it]844-the world . Was humanity in chains ? Behold [the angel]2596-the angel on the threshold of [the prison]2597-the prison ! [Odo]234-odo , too impatient to await the next reunion of [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees , sought out and frequented those among [the members whose conversation had chiefly attracted [him]234-odo]2598-the members whose conversation had chiefly attracted him . [They]2599-they were [grave men , of studious and retiring habit]2600-grave men , of studious and retiring habit , leading the frugal life of [the Italian middle - class]2601-the italian middle - class , a life in dignified contrast to the wasteful and aimless existence of [the nobility]1665-the nobility . [Odo]234-odo 's sensitiveness to outward impressions made [him]234-odo peculiarly alive to this contrast . None was more open than [he]234-odo to the seducements of luxurious living , the polish of manners , the tacit exclusion of all that is ugly or distressing ; but it seemed to [him]234-odo that fine living should be but the flower of fine feeling , and that such external graces , when they adorned a dull and vapid society , were as incongruous as the royal purple on a clown . Among [certain of [[his]234-odo new friends]2604-his new friends]2603-certain of his new friends [he]234-odo found a clumsiness of manner somewhat absurdly allied with an attempt at Roman austerity ; but [he]234-odo was fair - minded enough to see that [the middle - class doctor or lawyer who tries to play the Cicero]2605-the middle - class doctor or lawyer who tries to play the cicero is , after all , [a more respectable figure than [the Marquess who apes [Caligula]363-caligula or [Commodus]364-commodus]2607-the marquess who apes caligula or commodus]2606-a more respectable figure than the marquess who apes caligula or commodus . Still , [his]234-odo lurking dilettantism made [him]234-odo doubly alive to the elegance of [the Palazzo Tournanches]75-the palazzo tournanches when [he]234-odo went thither from a coarse meal in the stuffy dining - parlour of [one of [[his]234-odo new acquaintances]2609-his new acquaintances]2608-one of his new acquaintances ; as [he]234-odo never relished the discourse of [the latter]870-the latter more than after an afternoon in [the society of [[the Countess]1915-the countess 's parasites]2613-the countess 's parasites]2611-the society of the countess 's parasites . [Alfieri]306-alfieri 's allusions to [the learned ladies for whom [Italy]5-italy was noted]2614-the learned ladies for whom italy was noted made [Odo]234-odo curious to meet [the wives and daughters of [[his]234-odo new friends]2604-his new friends]2615-the wives and daughters of his new friends ; for [he]234-odo knew it was only in [[their]2604-his new friends class]2116-their class that [women]771-women received something more than the ordinary conventual education ; and [he]234-odo felt a secret desire to compare [Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia with [other young girls of [her]362-fulvia kind]2619-other young girls of her kind . [Learned ladies]2620-learned ladies [he]234-odo met , indeed ; for though [the women - folk of [some of [the philosophers]8362-the philosophers]2622-some of the philosophers]2621-the women - folk of some of the philosophers were content to cook and darn for [them]2604-his new friends ( and perhaps secretly burn a candle in [their]2604-his new friends behalf to [Saint Thomas Aquinas]365-saint thomas aquinas or [Saint Dominick]366-saint dominick , refuters of heresy ) , there were [others who aspired to all the honours of scholarship]2624-others who aspired to all the honours of scholarship , and would order about [[their]2624-others who aspired to all the honours of scholarship servant - girls]2625-their servant - girls in [Tuscan]76-tuscan , and scold [[their]2624-others who aspired to all the honours of scholarship babies]2626-their babies in Ciceronian Latin . Among [these fair grammarians]2627-these fair grammarians , however , [he]234-odo met none that wore [her]362-fulvia learning lightly . [They]2627-these fair grammarians were forever tripping in the folds of [[their]2627-these fair grammarians doctors]2628-their doctors ' gowns , and delivering [their]2627-these fair grammarians most trivial views ex cathedra ; and too often [the poor philosophers]2629-the poor philosophers , [[their]2629-the poor philosophers lords]2630-their lords and [fathers]2631-fathers , cowered under [their]2629-the poor philosophers harangues like [frightened boys under the tongue of [a schoolmaster]2633-a schoolmaster]2632-frightened boys under the tongue of a schoolmaster . It was in fact only in [the household of [Orazio Vivaldi]354-vivaldi]2634-the household of orazio vivaldi that [Odo]234-odo found the simplicity and grace of living for which [he]234-odo longed . [Alfieri]306-alfieri had warned [him]234-odo not to visit [the Professor]2482-the professor too often , since [the latter]870-the latter , being under observation , might be compromised by the assiduity of [[his]234-odo friends]2637-his friends . [Odo]234-odo therefore waited for some days before presenting [himself]234-odo , and when [he]234-odo did so it was at [the angelus]2638-the angelus , when [the streets]744-the streets were crowded and [a man]8112-a man 's comings and goings the less likely to be marked . [He]234-odo found [Vivaldi]354-vivaldi reading with [[his]354-vivaldi daughter]1475-his daughter in [the long library where [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees held [their]357-the honey - bees meetings]2642-the long library where the honey - bees held their meetings ; but [Fulvia]362-fulvia at once withdrew , nor did [she]362-fulvia show [herself]362-fulvia again during [Odo]234-odo 's visit . It was clear that , proud of [her]362-fulvia as [Vivaldi]362-fulvia was , [he]234-odo had no wish to parade [her]362-fulvia attainments , and that in [her]362-fulvia daily life [she]362-fulvia maintained the Italian habit of seclusion ; but to [Odo]234-odo [she]362-fulvia was everywhere present in [the quiet room]2643-the quiet room with [its]2643-the quiet room well - ordered books and curiosities , and the scent of flowers rising through the shuttered windows . [He]234-odo was sensible of an influence permeating even the inanimate objects about [him]234-odo , so that they seemed to reflect the spirit of [those who dwelt [there]606-there]2644-those who dwelt there . [No room]2646-no room had given [him]234-odo this sense of companionship since [he]234-odo had spent [his]234-odo boyish holidays in [the old Count Benedetto 's apartments]2647-the old count benedetto 's apartments ; but it was of another , intangible world that [[his]234-odo present surroundings]2648-his present surroundings spoke . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia received [him]234-odo kindly and asked [him]234-odo to repeat [his]234-odo visit ; and [Odo]234-odo returned as often as [he]234-odo thought prudent . [The Professor]2482-the professor 's conversation engaged [him]234-odo deeply . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia 's familiarity with French speculative literature , and with its sources in the experiential philosophy of [the English school]2650-the english school , gave [Odo]234-odo [his]234-odo first clear conception of the origin and tendency of the new movement . This coordination of scattered ideas was aided by [his]234-odo readings in the Encyclopaedia , which , though placed on the Index in [Piedmont]60-piedmont , was to be found behind the concealed panels of more than [one private library]2651-one private library . From [his]234-odo talks with [Alfieri]306-alfieri , and from the pages of [Plutarch]359-plutarch , [he]234-odo had gained a certain insight into the Stoical view of reason as the measure of conduct , and of the inherent sufficiency of virtue as its own end . [He]234-odo now learned that all about [him]234-odo [men]8356-men were endeavouring to restore the human spirit to that lost conception of its dignity ; and [he]234-odo longed to join [the band of new crusaders who had set out to recover the tomb of truth from the forces of superstition]2653-the band of new crusaders who had set out to recover the tomb of truth from the forces of superstition . The distinguishing mark of eighteenth - century philosophy was its eagerness to convert its acquisitions in every branch of knowledge into instruments of practical beneficence ; and this quality appealed peculiarly to [Odo]234-odo , who had ever been moved by abstract theories only as [they]2654-they explained or modified the destiny of [man]2185-man . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , pleased by [[his]234-odo new pupil]2656-his new pupil 's eagerness to learn , took pains to set before [him]234-odo this aspect of the struggle . " [You]2656-his new pupil will now see , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , after one of [their]2657-we long talks about [the Encyclopaedists]367-the encyclopaedists , " why [[we]2657-we who have at heart the mental and social regeneration of [[our]2657-we countrymen]8587-our countrymen]8586-we who have at heart the mental and social regeneration of our countrymen are so desirous of making a concerted effort against the established system . It is only by united action that [we]2657-we can prevail . [The bravest mob of independent fighters]8588-the bravest mob of independent fighters has little chance against [a handful of [disciplined soldiers]8590-disciplined soldiers]8589-a handful of disciplined soldiers , and [the Church]72-the church is perfectly logical in seeing [her]2656-his new pupil chief danger in the Encyclopaedia 's systematised marshalling of scattered truths . As long as the attacks on [her]2656-his new pupil authority were isolated , and as it were sporadic , [she]2656-his new pupil had little to fear even from the assaults of genius ; but the most ordinary intellect may find a use and become a power in the ranks of [an organised opposition]8591-an organised opposition . [Seneca]368-seneca tells [us]2657-we [the slaves in ancient [Rome]11-rome]8592-the slaves in ancient rome were at one time so numerous that [the government]2558-the government prohibited [their]8592-the slaves in ancient rome wearing a distinctive dress lest [they]8592-the slaves in ancient rome should learn [their]8592-the slaves in ancient rome strength and discover that [the city]2261-the city was in [their]8592-the slaves in ancient rome power ; and [the Church]1212-the church knows that when [the countless spirits [she]2656-his new pupil has enslaved without subduing]8596-the countless spirits she has enslaved without subduing have once learned [their]8596-the countless spirits she has enslaved without subduing number and efficiency [they]8596-the countless spirits she has enslaved without subduing will hold [her]2656-his new pupil doctrines at [[their]8596-the countless spirits she has enslaved without subduing mercy.--The Church]8597-their mercy.--the church again , "[2658-he] [he]2658-he continued , " has proved [her]2656-his new pupil astuteness in making faith the gift of grace and not the result of reason . By so doing [she]2656-his new pupil placed [herself]2656-his new pupil in a position which was well - nigh impregnable till the school of [Newton]369-newton substituted observation for intuition and [[his]369-newton followers]8598-his followers showed with increasing clearness the inability of the human mind to apprehend anything outside the range of experience . The ultimate claim of [the Church]1212-the church rests on the hypothesis of an intuitive faculty in [man]2185-man . Disprove the existence of this faculty , and reason must remain the supreme test of truth . Against reason the fabric of theological doctrine can not long hold out , and [the Church]72-the church 's doctrinal authority once shaken , [men]8356-men will no longer fear to test by ordinary rules the practical results of [her]2656-his new pupil teaching . [We]8602-we have not joined [the great army of truth]8603-the great army of truth to waste [our]8602-we time in vain disputations over metaphysical subtleties . [Our]8602-we aim is , by freeing the mind of [man]2185-man from superstition to relieve [him]2185-man from the practical abuses it entails . As it is impossible to examine any fiscal or industrial problem without discovering that the chief obstacle to improvement lies in [the Church]1212-the church 's countless privileges and exemptions , so in every department of human activity [we]8602-we find some inveterate wrong taking shelter under the claim of a divinely - revealed authority . This claim demolished , the stagnant current of human progress will soon burst its barriers and set with a mighty rush toward the wide ocean of truth and freedom ... "[2658-he] That general belief in the perfectibility of [man]2185-man which cheered [the eighteenth - century thinkers]2660-the eighteenth - century thinkers in [their]2660-the eighteenth - century thinkers struggle for intellectual liberty coloured with a delightful brightness this vision of a renewed humanity . [It]2661-it threw its beams on every branch of research , and shone like an aureole round those who laid down fortune and advancement to purchase the new redemption of [mankind]2662-mankind . Foremost among these , as [Odo]234-odo now learned , were [many of [[his]234-odo own countrymen]2664-his own countrymen]2663-many of his own countrymen . In [his]234-odo talks with [Vivaldi]362-fulvia [he]234-odo first explored the course of Italian thought and heard the names of [the great jurists]2665-the great jurists , [Vico]370-vico and [Gravina]324-gravina , and of [[his]234-odo own contemporaries]2666-his own contemporaries , [Filangieri]325-filangieri , [Verri]371-verri and [Beccaria]372-beccaria . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia lent [him]234-odo [Beccaria]372-beccaria 's famous volume and several numbers of the " Caffe , "[362-fulvia] the brilliant gazette which [Verri]371-verri and [[his]371-verri associates]2667-his associates were then publishing in [Milan]14-milan , and in which all the questions of the day , theological , economic and literary , were discussed with a freedom possible only under the lenient Austrian rule . " Ah , "[362-fulvia] [Vivaldi]362-fulvia cried , " [Milan]14-milan is indeed [the home of [the free spirit]8607-the free spirit]8606-the home of the free spirit , and were [I]362-fulvia not persuaded that [a man]8112-a man 's first duty is to improve the condition of [[his]8112-a man own city]8609-his own city and state , [I]362-fulvia should long ago have left [this unhappy kingdom]8610-this unhappy kingdom ; indeed [I]362-fulvia sometimes fancy [I]362-fulvia may yet serve [[my]362-fulvia own people]8611-my own people better by proclaiming the truth openly at a distance than by whispering it in [their]8611-my own people midst . "[362-fulvia] It was a surprise to [Odo]234-odo to learn that the new ideas had already taken such hold in [Italy]5-italy , and that some of [the foremost thinkers on scientific and economic subjects]2668-the foremost thinkers on scientific and economic subjects were among [[his]234-odo own countrymen]2664-his own countrymen . Like [all eighteenth - century Italians of [his]234-odo class]2670-all eighteenth - century italians of his class [he]234-odo had been taught to look to [France]22-france as the source of all culture , intellectual and social ; and [he]234-odo was amazed to find that in jurisprudence , and in some of the natural sciences , [Italy]5-italy led the learning of [Europe]40-europe . Once or twice [Fulvia]362-fulvia showed [herself]362-fulvia for a moment ; but [her]362-fulvia manner was retiring and almost constrained , and [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father always contrived an excuse for dismissing [her]362-fulvia . This was the more noticeable as [she]362-fulvia continued to appear at the meetings of [the Honey - Bees]357-the honey - bees , where [she]362-fulvia joined freely in the conversation , and sometimes diverted [the guests]2672-the guests by playing on the harpsichord or by recitations from [the poets]2673-the poets ; all with such art and grace , and withal so much simplicity , that it was clear [she]362-fulvia was accustomed to the part . [Odo]234-odo was thus driven to the not unflattering conclusion that [she]362-fulvia had been instructed to avoid [his]234-odo company ; and after the first disappointment [he]234-odo was too honest to regret it . [He]234-odo was deeply drawn to [the girl]2319-the girl ; but what part could [she]362-fulvia play in the life of [a man of [his]234-odo rank]2675-a man of his rank ? [The cadet of [an impoverished house]2677-an impoverished house]2676-the cadet of an impoverished house , it was unlikely that [he]234-odo would marry ; and should [he]234-odo do so , custom forbade even the thought of taking [a wife outside of [[his]234-odo class]2387-his class]2678-a wife outside of his class . Had [he]234-odo been admitted to free intercourse with [Fulvia]362-fulvia , love might have routed such prudent counsels ; but in [the society of [[her]362-fulvia father 's associates]2681-her father 's associates , where [she]362-fulvia moved , as in a halo of learning , amid the respectful admiration of [middle - aged philosophers]2682-middle - aged philosophers and [jurists]2683-jurists]2680-the society of her father 's associates , where she moved , as in a halo of learning , amid the respectful admiration of middle - aged philosophers and jurists , [she]362-fulvia seemed as inaccessible as [a young Minerva]2684-a young minerva . [Odo]234-odo , at first , had been careful not to visit [Vivaldi]362-fulvia too often ; but [the Professor]2482-the professor 's conversation was so instructive , and [[his]2482-the professor library]2686-his library so inviting , that inclination got the better of prudence , and [the young man]2380-the young man fell into the habit of turning almost daily down [the lane behind [the Corpus Domini]66-the corpus domini]2441-the lane behind the corpus domini . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , too proud to betray any concern for [his]2482-the professor personal safety , showed no sign of resenting the frequency of these visits ; indeed , [he]2482-the professor received [Odo]234-odo with an increasing cordiality that , to [an older observer]2689-an older observer , might have betokened an effort to hide [his]2482-the professor apprehension . One afternoon , escaping later than usual from [the Valentino]62-the valentino , [Odo]234-odo had again bent toward [the quiet quarter behind [the palace]768-the palace]2690-the quiet quarter behind the palace . [He]234-odo was afoot , with a cloak over [his]234-odo laced coat , and the day being Easter Monday [the streets]744-the streets were filled with a throng of pleasure - seekers amid whom it seemed easy enough for [a man to pass unnoticed]2693-a man to pass unnoticed . [Odo]234-odo , as [he]234-odo crossed [the Piazza Castello]2694-the piazza castello , thought [it]2695-it had never presented a gayer scene . Booths with brightly - striped awnings had been set up under [the arcades]2696-the arcades , which were thronged with [idlers of all classes]2697-idlers of all classes ; [court - coaches]2698-court - coaches dashed across [the square]1592-the square or rolled in and out of [the palace]768-the palace - gates ; and [the Palazzo Madama]2701-the palazzo madama , lifting against the sunset [its]2701-the palazzo madama ivory - tinted columns and statues , seemed rather some pictured fabric of [[Claude]373-claude 's or [Bibbiena]374-bibbiena 's]2702-claude 's or bibbiena 's than [an actual building of brick and marble]2703-an actual building of brick and marble . The turn of a corner carried [him]234-odo from this spectacle into the solitude of [a by - street]2704-a by - street where [his]234-odo own tread was the only sound . [He]234-odo walked on carelessly ; but suddenly [he]234-odo heard what seemed an echo of [his]234-odo step . [He]234-odo stopped and faced about . [No one]725-no one was in sight but [a blind beggar]2706-a blind beggar crouching at the side - door of [the Corpus Domini]66-the corpus domini . [Odo]234-odo walked on , listening , and again [he]234-odo heard the step , and again turned to find [himself]234-odo alone . [He]234-odo tried to fancy that [his]234-odo ear had tricked [him]234-odo ; but [he]234-odo knew too much of the subtle methods of Italian espionage not to feel a secret uneasiness . [His]234-odo better judgment warned [him]234-odo back ; but the desire to spend a pleasant hour prevailed . [He]234-odo took a turn through [the neighbouring streets]2707-the neighbouring streets , in the hope of diverting suspicion , and ten minutes later was at [[the Professor]2482-the professor 's gate]2709-the professor 's gate . [It]2709-the professor 's gate opened at once , and to [his]234-odo amazement [Fulvia]362-fulvia stood before [him]234-odo . [She]362-fulvia had thrown a black mantle over [her]362-fulvia head , and [her]362-fulvia face looked pale and vivid in the fading light . Surprise for a moment silenced [Odo]234-odo , and before [he]234-odo could speak [the girl]2319-the girl , without pausing to close the gate , had drawn [him]234-odo toward [her]362-fulvia and flung [her]362-fulvia arms about [his]234-odo neck . In the first disorder of [his]234-odo senses [he]234-odo was conscious only of seeking [her]362-fulvia lips ; but an instant later [he]234-odo knew it was no kiss of love that met [his]234-odo own , and [he]234-odo felt [her]362-fulvia tremble violently in [his]234-odo arms . [He]234-odo saw in a flash that [he]234-odo was on unknown ground ; but [his]234-odo one thought was that [Fulvia]362-fulvia was in trouble and looked to [him]234-odo for aid . [He]234-odo gently freed [himself]234-odo from [her]362-fulvia hold and tried to shape a soothing question ; but [she]362-fulvia caught [his]234-odo arm and , laying a hand over [his]234-odo mouth , drew [him]234-odo across [the garden]8185-the garden and into [the house]1917-the house . [The lower floor]2713-the lower floor stood dark and empty . [He]234-odo followed [Fulvia]362-fulvia up [the stairs]2714-the stairs and into [the library]2154-the library , which was also empty . The shutters stood wide , admitting the evening freshness and a drowsy scent of jasmine from [the garden]8185-the garden . [Odo]234-odo could not control a thrill of strange anticipation as [he]234-odo found [himself]234-odo alone in [this silent room]2717-this silent room with [the girl whose heart had so lately beat against [his]234-odo own]2718-the girl whose heart had so lately beat against his own . [She]362-fulvia had sunk into a chair , with [her]362-fulvia face hidden , and for a moment or two [he]234-odo stood before [her]362-fulvia without speaking . Then [he]234-odo knelt at [her]362-fulvia side and took [her]362-fulvia hands with a murmur of endearment . At [his]234-odo touch [she]362-fulvia started up . " And it was [I]362-fulvia , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried , " who persuaded [[my]362-fulvia father]8146-my father that [he]8146-my father might trust [you]234-odo ! "[362-fulvia] And [she]362-fulvia sank back sobbing . [Odo]234-odo rose and moved away , waiting for [her]362-fulvia overwrought emotion to subside . At length [he]234-odo gently asked , " Do [you]362-fulvia wish [me]234-odo to leave [you]362-fulvia ? "[234-odo] [She]362-fulvia raised [her]362-fulvia head . " No , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said firmly , though [her]362-fulvia lip still trembled ; " [you]234-odo must first hear an explanation of [my]362-fulvia conduct ; though it is scarce possible , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia added , flushing to the brow , " that [you]234-odo have not already guessed the purpose of this lamentable comedy . "[362-fulvia] " [I]234-odo guess nothing , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo replied , " save that perhaps [I]234-odo may in some way serve [you]362-fulvia . "[234-odo] " Serve [me]362-fulvia ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried , with a flash of anger through [her]362-fulvia tears . " It is a late hour to speak of service , after what [you]234-odo have brought on [this house]8613-this house ! "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo turned pale . " Here indeed , [madam]8129-madam , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " are words that need an explanation . "[234-odo] " Oh , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia broke forth , " and [you]234-odo shall have it ; though [I]362-fulvia think to any other it must be writ large upon [my]362-fulvia countenance . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia rose and paced the floor impetuously . " Is it possible , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia began again , " [you]234-odo do not yet perceive the sense of that execrable scene ? Or do [you]234-odo think , by feigning ignorance , to prolong [my]362-fulvia humiliation ? Oh , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , pausing before [him]234-odo , [her]362-fulvia breast in a tumult , [her]362-fulvia eyes alight , " it was [I]362-fulvia who persuaded [[my]362-fulvia father]8146-my father of [your]234-odo discretion and prudence , it was through [my]362-fulvia influence that [he]8146-my father opened [himself]8146-my father to [you]234-odo so freely ; and is this the return [you]234-odo make ? Alas , why did [you]234-odo leave [[your]234-odo fashionable friends]8616-your fashionable friends and a world in which [you]234-odo are so fitted to shine , to bring unhappiness on [an obscure household that never dreamed of courting [your]234-odo notice]8617-an obscure household that never dreamed of courting your notice ? "[362-fulvia] As [she]362-fulvia stood before [him]234-odo in [her]362-fulvia radiant anger , it went hard with [Odo]234-odo not to silence with a kiss a resentment that [he]234-odo guessed to be mainly directed against [herself]362-fulvia ; but [he]234-odo controlled [himself]234-odo and said quietly : " [Madam]8129-madam , [I]234-odo were [a dolt]8619-a dolt not to perceive that [I]234-odo have had the misfortune to offend ; but when or how , [I]234-odo swear to [heaven]1787-heaven [I]234-odo know not ; and till [you]8129-madam enlighten [me]234-odo [I]234-odo can neither excuse nor defend [myself]234-odo . "[234-odo] [She]362-fulvia turned pale , but instantly recovered [her]362-fulvia composure . " [You]234-odo are right , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said ; " [I]362-fulvia rave like [a foolish girl]8621-a foolish girl ; but indeed [I]362-fulvia scarce know if [I]362-fulvia am in [my]362-fulvia waking senses"--She[362-fulvia] paused , as if to check a fresh rush of emotion . " Oh , [sir]8257-sir , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried , " can [you]8257-sir not guess what has happened ? [You]8257-sir were warned , [I]362-fulvia believe , not to frequent [this house]8613-this house too openly ; but of late [you]8257-sir have been [an almost daily visitor]8624-an almost daily visitor , and [you]8257-sir never come here but [you]8257-sir are followed . [[My]362-fulvia father]8146-my father 's doctrines have long been under suspicion , and to be accused of perverting [a man of [your]8257-sir rank]8626-a man of your rank must be [his]8146-my father ruin . [He]8146-my father was too proud to tell [you]8257-sir this , and profiting today by [his]8146-my father absence , and knowing that if [you]8257-sir came [the spies]8627-the spies would be at [your]8257-sir heels , [I]362-fulvia resolved to meet [you]8257-sir at the gate , and welcome [you]8257-sir in such a way that [[our]8628-our enemies]8629-our enemies should be deceived as to the true cause of [your]8257-sir visits . "[362-fulvia] [Her]2719-you voice wavered on the last words , but [she]2719-you faced [him]2720-i proudly , and it was [Odo]234-odo whose gaze fell . Never perhaps had [he]2720-i been conscious of cutting [a meaner figure]2721-a meaner figure ; yet shame was so blent in [him]2720-i with admiration for [the girl]2319-the girl 's nobility and courage , that compunction was swept away in the impulse that flung [him]2720-i at [her]2719-you feet . " Ah , "[2720-i] [he]2720-i cried , " [I]2720-i have been blind indeed , and what [you]2719-you say abases [me]2720-i to [earth]575-earth . Yes , [I]2720-i was warned that [my]2720-i visits might compromise [[your]2719-you father]8631-your father ; nor had [I]2720-i any pretext for returning so often but [my]2720-i own selfish pleasure in [his]8631-your father discourse ; or so at least , "[2720-i] [he]2720-i added in a lower voice , " [I]2720-i chose to fancy -- but when [we]8632-we met just now at the gate , if [you]2719-you acted a comedy , believe [me]2720-i , [I]2720-i did not ; and if [I]2720-i have come day after day to [this house]8613-this house , it is because , unknowingly , [I]2720-i came for [you]2719-you . "[2720-i] The words had escaped [him]2720-i unawares , and [he]2720-i was too sensible of their untimeliness not to be prepared for the gesture with which [she]2723-she cut [him]2720-i short . " Oh , "[2723-she] said [she]2723-she , in a tone of the liveliest reproach , " spare [me]2723-she this last affront if [you]2720-i wish [me]2723-she to think the harm [you]2720-i have already done was done unknowingly ! "[2723-she] [Odo]234-odo rose to [his]234-odo feet , tingling under the rebuke . " If respect and admiration be an affront , [madam]8129-madam , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " [I]234-odo can not remain in [your]2723-she presence without offending , and nothing is left [me]234-odo but to withdraw ; but before going [I]234-odo would at least ask if there is no way of repairing the harm that [my]234-odo over - assiduity has caused . "[234-odo] [She]2723-she flushed high at the question . " Why , that , "[2723-she] [she]2723-she said , " is in part , [I]2723-she trust , already accomplished ; indeed , "[2723-she] [she]2723-she went on with an effort , " it was when [I]2723-she learned [the authorities]2448-the authorities suspected [you]234-odo of coming [here]8091-here on a gallant adventure that [I]2723-she devised the idea of meeting [you]234-odo at the gate ; and for the rest , [sir]8257-sir , the best reparation [you]234-odo can make is one that will naturally suggest itself to [a gentleman whose time must already be so fully engaged]8638-a gentleman whose time must already be so fully engaged . "[2723-she] And with that [she]2723-she made [him]234-odo a deep reverence , and withdrew to [the inner room]2724-the inner room . 2.5 . When [the Professor]2482-the professor 's gate closed on [Odo]234-odo night was already falling and the oil - lamp at the end of the arched passage - way shed its weak circle of light on [the pavement]2726-the pavement . This light , as [Odo]234-odo emerged , fell on a retreating figure which resembled that of [the blind beggar [he]234-odo had seen crouching on the steps of [the Corpus Domini]66-the corpus domini]2727-the blind beggar he had seen crouching on the steps of the corpus domini . [He]234-odo ran forward , but [the man]1626-the man hurried across [the little square]2729-the little square and disappeared in the darkness . [Odo]234-odo had not seen [his]1626-the man face ; but though [his]1626-the man dress was tattered , and [he]1626-the man leaned on [a beggar]2730-a beggar 's staff , something about [his]1626-the man broad rolling back recalled the well - filled outline of Cantapresto 's cassock . Sick at heart , [Odo]234-odo rambled on from [one street]2731-one street to another , avoiding [the more crowded quarters]2732-the more crowded quarters , and losing [himself]234-odo more than once in [the districts near [the river]2315-the river , where [young gentlemen of [his]234-odo figure]2735-young gentlemen of his figure seldom showed [themselves]2735-young gentlemen of his figure unattended]2733-the districts near the river , where young gentlemen of his figure seldom showed themselves unattended . [The populace]2736-the populace , however , was all abroad , and [he]234-odo passed as unregarded as though [his]234-odo sombre thoughts had enveloped [him]234-odo in actual darkness . It was late when at length [he]234-odo turned again into [the Piazza Castello]77-the piazza castello , which was brightly lit and still thronged with [pleasure - seekers]2737-pleasure - seekers . As [he]234-odo approached , [the crowd]1568-the crowd divided to make way for [three or four handsome travelling - carriages]2739-three or four handsome travelling - carriages , preceded by [linkmen]747-linkmen and [liveried out - riders]2741-liveried out - riders and followed by [a dozen mounted equerries]2742-a dozen mounted equerries . [The people]1003-the people , evidently in the humour to greet every incident of [the streets]744-the streets as part of a show prepared for [their]1003-the people diversion , cheered lustily as [the carriages]2745-the carriages dashed across [the square]1592-the square ; and [Odo]234-odo , turning to [a man at [his]234-odo elbow]2747-a man at his elbow , asked who [the distinguished visitors]2748-the distinguished visitors might be . " Why , [sir]8257-sir , "[2749-the other laughing] said [the other laughing]2749-the other laughing , " [I]2749-the other laughing understand it is only an Embassage from [some neighbouring state]8640-some neighbouring state ; but when [[our]8641-our good people]8642-our good people are in [their]8642-our good people Easter mood [they]8642-our good people are ready to take [a mail - coach for [Elijah]375-elijah 's chariot]8643-a mail - coach for elijah 's chariot and [[their]8642-our good people wives]639-their wives ' scolding for the Gift of Tongues . "[2749-the other laughing] [Odo]234-odo spent a restless night face to face with [his]234-odo first humiliation . Though [the girl]2319-the girl 's rebuff had cut [him]234-odo to the quick , it was the vision of the havoc [his]234-odo folly had wrought that stood between [him]234-odo and sleep . To have endangered the liberty , the very life , perhaps , of [a man [he]234-odo loved and venerated , and who had welcomed [him]234-odo without heed of personal risk]2751-a man he loved and venerated , and who had welcomed him without heed of personal risk , this indeed was bitter to [his]234-odo youthful self - sufficiency . The thought of [Giannone]358-pietro giannone 's fate was like a cold clutch at [his]234-odo heart ; nor was there any balm in knowing that it was at [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's request [he]234-odo had been so freely welcomed ; for [he]234-odo was persuaded that , whatever [her]362-fulvia previous feeling might have been , the scene just enacted must render [him]234-odo forever odious to [her]362-fulvia . Turn whither it would , [his]234-odo tossing vanity found no repose ; and dawn rose for [him]234-odo on a thorny waste of disillusionment . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto broke in early on this vigil , flushed with the importance of a letter from [the Countess Valdu]297-the countess valdu . [The lady]660-the lady summoned [[her]660-the lady son]1486-her son to dinner , " to meet [an old friend]8645-an old friend and [distinguished visitor]8646-distinguished visitor "[660-the lady] ; and a verbal message bade [Odo]234-odo come early and wear [his]234-odo new uniform . [He]234-odo was too well acquainted with [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's exaggerations to attach much importance to the summons ; but being glad of an excuse to escape [his]234-odo daily visit at [the Palazzo Tournanches]75-the palazzo tournanches , [he]234-odo sent [Donna Laura]243-donna laura word that [he]234-odo would wait on [her]243-donna laura at two . On the very threshold of [Casa Valdu]48-casa valdu , [Odo]234-odo perceived that unwonted preparations were afoot . The shabby liveries of [the servants]755-the servants had been refurbished and the marble floor newly scoured ; and [he]234-odo found [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother seated in [the drawing - room]2757-the drawing - room , [an apartment never unshrouded save on the most ceremonious occasions]2758-an apartment never unshrouded save on the most ceremonious occasions . As to [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , [she]243-donna laura had undergone the same process of renovation , and with more striking results . It seemed to [Odo]234-odo , when [she]243-donna laura met [him]234-odo sparkling under [her]243-donna laura rouge and powder , as though some withered flower had been dipped in water , regaining for the moment a languid semblance of its freshness . [Her]243-donna laura eyes shone , [her]243-donna laura hand trembled under [his]234-odo lips , and the diamonds rose and fell on [her]243-donna laura eager bosom . " [You]234-odo are late ! "[243-donna laura] [she]243-donna laura tenderly reproached [him]234-odo ; and before [he]234-odo had time to reply , the double doors were thrown open , and [the major - domo]2759-the major - domo announced in an awed voice : " [[His]2759-the major - domo excellency]8647-his excellency [Count Lelio Trescorre]254-trescorre . "[2759-the major - domo] [Odo]234-odo turned with a start . To [his]234-odo mind , already crowded with a confusion of thoughts , the name summoned a throng of memories . [He]234-odo saw again [[[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's apartments at [Pianura]4-pianura]2761-his mother 's apartments at pianura , and [the handsome youth with lace ruffles and a clouded amber cane]2762-the handsome youth with lace ruffles and a clouded amber cane , who came and went among [[her]243-donna laura other visitors]2763-her other visitors with an air of such superiority , and who rode beside [the travelling - carriage]1014-the travelling - carriage on the first stage of [their]2765-their journey to [Donnaz]7-donnaz . To [that handsome youth]2766-that handsome youth [the gentleman just announced]2767-the gentleman just announced bore the likeness of the finished portrait to the sketch . [He]2766-that handsome youth was [a man of about two - and - thirty , of the middle height]2768-a man of about two - and - thirty , of the middle height , with a delicate dark face and an air of arrogance not unbecomingly allied to an insinuating courtesy of address . [His]2766-that handsome youth dress of sombre velvet , with a star on the breast , and a profusion of the finest lace , suggested the desire to add dignity and weight to [his]2766-that handsome youth appearance without renouncing the softer ambitions of [his]2766-that handsome youth age . [He]2766-that handsome youth received with a smile [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's agitated phrases of welcome . " [I]2766-that handsome youth come , "[2766-that handsome youth] said [he]2766-that handsome youth kissing [her]243-donna laura hand , " in [my]2766-that handsome youth private character , not as [the Envoy of [Pianura]290-pianura]8648-the envoy of pianura , but as [the friend and servant of [the Countess Valdu]297-the countess valdu]8649-the friend and servant of the countess valdu ; and [I]2766-that handsome youth trust , "[2766-that handsome youth] [he]2766-that handsome youth added turning to [Odo]234-odo , " of [the Cavaliere Valsecca]8650-the cavaliere valsecca also . "[2766-that handsome youth] [Odo]234-odo bowed in silence . " [You]234-odo may have heard , "[254-trescorre] [Trescorre]254-trescorre continued , addressing [him]2766-that handsome youth in the same engaging tone , " that [I]2766-that handsome youth am come to [Turin]17-turin on a mission from [[his]2766-that handsome youth Highness]941-his highness to [the court of [Savoy]16-savoy]8652-the court of savoy : a trifling matter of boundary - lines and customs , which [I]2766-that handsome youth undertook at [the Duke]682-the duke 's desire , the more readily , it must be owned , since it gave [me]2766-that handsome youth the opportunity to renew [my]2766-that handsome youth acquaintance with friends whom absence has not taught [me]2766-that handsome youth to forget . "[2766-that handsome youth] [He]2766-that handsome youth smiled again at [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , who blushed like [a girl]2391-a girl . The curiosity which [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's words excited was lost to [Odo]234-odo in the painful impression produced by [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's agitation . To see [her]664-his mother , [a woman already past [her]664-his mother youth]2771-a woman already past her youth , and aged by [her]664-his mother very efforts to preserve it , trembling and bridling under the cool eye of masculine indifference , was a spectacle the more humiliating that [he]2766-that handsome youth was too young to be moved by its human and pathetic side . [He]2766-that handsome youth recalled once seeing a memento mori of delicately - tinted ivory , which represented [a girl]2391-a girl 's head , one side all dewy freshness , the other touched with death ; and it seemed to [him]2766-that handsome youth that [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother 's face resembled this tragic toy , the side [her]664-his mother mirror reflected being still rosy with youth , while that which [others]1388-others saw was already a ruin . [His]2766-that handsome youth heart burned with disgust as [he]2766-that handsome youth followed [Donna Laura]243-donna laura and [Trescorre]254-trescorre into [the dining - room]2775-the dining - room , which had been set out with all the family plate , and decked with rare fruits and flowers . [The Countess]1915-the countess had excused [[her]1915-the countess husband]1112-her husband on the plea of [his]1112-her husband official duties , and [the three]2778-the three sat down alone to a meal composed of the costliest delicacies . [[Their]2778-the three guest]1434-their guest , who ate little and drank less , entertained [them]2778-the three with the latest news of [Pianura]290-pianura , touching discreetly on the growing estrangement between [the Duke]682-the duke and [Duchess]236-pianura , and speaking with becoming gravity of [the heir]2781-the heir 's weak health . It was clear that [the speaker]2090-the speaker , without filling an official position at [the court]814-the court , was already deep in [the Duke]682-the duke 's counsels , and perhaps also in [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's ; and [Odo]234-odo guessed under [his]234-odo smiling indiscretions the cool aim of the man who never wastes a shot . Toward the close of the meal , when [the servants]755-the servants had withdrawn , [he]1112-her husband turned to [Odo]234-odo with a graver manner . " [You]234-odo have perhaps guessed , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[1112-her husband] [he]1112-her husband said , " that in venturing to claim [the Countess]1915-the countess 's hospitality in so private a manner , [I]1112-her husband had in mind the wish to open [myself]1112-her husband to [you]234-odo more freely than would be possible at [court]8243-court . "[1112-her husband] [He]1112-her husband paused a moment , as though to emphasise [his]1112-her husband words ; and [Odo]234-odo fancied [he]1112-her husband cultivated the trick of deliberate speaking to counteract [his]1112-her husband natural arrogance of manner . " The time has come , "[1112-her husband] [he]1112-her husband went on , " when it seems desirable that [you]234-odo should be more familiar with the state of affairs at [Pianura]4-pianura . For some years it seemed likely that [the Duchess]899-the duchess would give [[his]899-the duchess Highness]941-his highness [another son]8659-another son ; but circumstances now appear to preclude that hope ; and it is the general opinion of [the court physicians]8660-the court physicians that [the young prince]8661-the young prince has not many years to live . "[1112-her husband] [He]1112-her husband paused again , fixing [his]1112-her husband eyes on [Odo]234-odo 's flushed face . " [The Duke]682-the duke , "[1112-her husband] [he]1112-her husband continued , " has shown a natural reluctance to face a situation so painful both to [his]682-the duke heart and [his]682-the duke ambitions ; but [his]682-the duke feelings as [a parent]8663-a parent have yielded to [his]682-the duke duty as [a sovereign]8664-a sovereign , and [he]682-the duke recognises the fact that [you]234-odo should have an early opportunity of acquainting [yourself]234-odo more nearly with the affairs of [the duchy]1310-the duchy , and also of seeing something of [the other courts of [Italy]5-italy]8666-the other courts of italy . [I]1112-her husband am persuaded , "[1112-her husband] [he]1112-her husband added , " that , young as [you]234-odo are , [I]1112-her husband need not point out to [you]234-odo on what slight contingencies all human fortunes hang , and how completely [the heir]2781-the heir 's recovery or the birth of [another prince]8668-another prince must change the aspect of [your]234-odo future . [You]234-odo have , [I]1112-her husband am sure , the heart to face such chances with becoming equanimity , and to carry the weight of conditional honours without any undue faith in [their]8669-their permanence . "[1112-her husband] The admonition was so lightly uttered that it seemed rather a tribute to [Odo]234-odo 's good sense than a warning to [his]234-odo inexperience ; and indeed it was difficult for [him]234-odo , in spite of an instinctive aversion to [the man]1626-the man , to quarrel with anything in [his]234-odo address or language . [Trescorre]254-trescorre in fact possessed the art of putting [younger men]2788-younger men at [their]2788-younger men ease , while appearing as an equal among [[his]254-trescorre elders]1313-his elders : a gift doubtless developed by the circumstances of court life , and the need of at once commanding respect and disarming diffidence . [He]1112-her husband took leave upon [his]1112-her husband last words , declaring , in reply to [the Countess]1915-the countess 's protests , that [he]1112-her husband had promised to accompany [the court]814-the court that afternoon to [Stupinigi]277-stupinigi . " But [I]1112-her husband hope , "[1112-her husband] [he]1112-her husband added , turning to [Odo]234-odo , " to continue [our]8670-our talk at greater length , if [you]234-odo will favour [me]1112-her husband with a visit tomorrow at [[my]1112-her husband lodgings]8671-my lodgings . "[1112-her husband] No sooner was the door closed on [[her]1915-the countess illustrious visitor]2792-her illustrious visitor than [Donna Laura]243-donna laura flung [herself]243-donna laura on [Odo]234-odo 's bosom . " [I]243-donna laura always knew it , "[243-donna laura] [she]243-donna laura cried , " [[my]243-donna laura dearest]8672-my dearest ; but , oh , that [I]243-donna laura should live to see the day ! "[243-donna laura] and [she]243-donna laura wept and clung to [him]234-odo with a thousand endearments , from the nature of which [he]234-odo gathered that [she]243-donna laura already beheld [him]234-odo on the throne of [Pianura]4-pianura . To [his]234-odo laughing reminder of the distance that still separated [him]234-odo from that dizzy eminence , [she]243-donna laura made answer that there was far more than [he]234-odo knew , that [the Duke]682-the duke had fallen into all manner of excesses which had already gravely impaired [his]234-odo health , and that for [her]243-donna laura part [she]243-donna laura only hoped [[her]243-donna laura son]1486-her son , when raised to a station so far above [her]243-donna laura own , would not forget the tenderness with which [she]243-donna laura had ever cherished [him]234-odo , or the fact that [Count Valdu]289-count valdu 's financial situation was one quite unworthy [the stepfather of [a reigning prince]2796-a reigning prince]2795-the stepfather of a reigning prince . Escaping at length from this parody of [his]234-odo own sensations , [Odo]234-odo found [himself]234-odo in a tumult of mind that solitude served only to increase . Events had so pressed upon [him]234-odo within the last few days that at times [he]234-odo was reduced to a passive sense of spectatorship , an inability to regard [himself]234-odo as the centre of so many converging purposes . It was clear that [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's mission was mainly a pretext for seeing [[the Duke]682-the duke 's young kinsman]2798-the duke 's young kinsman ; and that some special motive must have impelled [the Duke]682-the duke to show such sudden concern for [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin 's welfare . [Trescorre]254-trescorre need hardly have cautioned [Odo]234-odo against fixing [his]234-odo hopes on the succession . [The Duke]682-the duke [himself]682-the duke was [a man not above five - and - thirty]2802-a man not above five - and - thirty , and more than one chance stood between [Odo]234-odo and [the duchy]1310-the duchy ; nor was it this contingency that set [his]234-odo pulses beating , but rather the promise of an immediate change in [his]234-odo condition . [The Duke]682-the duke wished [him]234-odo to travel , to visit [the different courts of [Italy]5-italy]2805-the different courts of italy : what was the prospect of ruling over [a stagnant principality]2806-a stagnant principality to this near vision of [the world]844-the world and the glories thereof , suddenly discovered from the golden height of opportunity ? Save for a few weeks of autumn villeggiatura at [some neighbouring chase or [vineyard]2809-vineyard]2808-some neighbouring chase or vineyard , [Odo]234-odo had not left [Turin]17-turin for nine years . [He]234-odo had come [there]606-there [a child]1186-a child and had grown to manhood among the same narrow influences and surroundings . To be turned loose on [the world]844-the world at two - and - twenty , with such an arrears of experience to [his]234-odo credit , was to enter on a richer inheritance than [any duchy]2813-any duchy ; and in [Odo]234-odo 's case the joy of the adventure was doubled by its timeliness . That fate should thus break at a stroke the meshes of habit , should stoop to play the advocate of [his]234-odo secret inclinations , seemed to promise [him]234-odo the complicity of [the gods]2814-the gods . Once in a lifetime , chance will thus snap the toils of [a man]8112-a man 's making ; and it is instructive to see [the poor puppet]2816-the poor puppet adore the power that connives at [his]234-odo evasion ... [Trescorre]254-trescorre remained a week in [Turin]17-turin ; and [Odo]234-odo saw [him]254-trescorre daily at [court]8243-court , at [[his]254-trescorre lodgings]2818-his lodgings , or in [company]2819-company . The little sovereignty of [Pianura]236-pianura being an important factor in the game of political equilibrium , [[her]236-pianura envoy]2820-her envoy was sure of a flattering reception from [the neighbouring powers]2821-the neighbouring powers ; and [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's person and address must have commended [him]254-trescorre to the most fastidious company . [He]254-trescorre continued to pay particular attention to [Odo]234-odo , and the rumour was soon abroad that [the Cavaliere Valsecca]8650-the cavaliere valsecca had been sent for to visit [[his]8650-the cavaliere valsecca cousin]670-his cousin , [the reigning Duke]2824-the reigning duke ; a rumour which , combined with [Donna Laura]243-donna laura 's confidential hints , made [Odo]234-odo the centre of much feminine solicitude , and roused [the Countess Clarice]2398-the countess clarice to a vivid sense of [her]2398-the countess clarice rights . These circumstances , and [his]254-trescorre own tendency to drift on the current of sensation , had carried [Odo]234-odo more easily than [he]254-trescorre could have hoped past the painful episode of [[the Professor]2482-the professor 's garden]2827-the professor 's garden . [He]254-trescorre was still tormented by the sense of [his]254-trescorre inability to right so grave a wrong ; but [he]254-trescorre found solace in the thought that [his]254-trescorre absence was after all the best reparation [he]254-trescorre could make . [Trescorre]254-trescorre , though distinguishing [Odo]234-odo by [his]234-odo favours , had not again referred to the subject of [their]2828-their former conversation ; but on the last day of [his]254-trescorre visit [he]254-trescorre sent for [Odo]234-odo to [[his]254-trescorre lodgings]2818-his lodgings and at once entered upon the subject . " [[His]254-trescorre Highness]941-his highness , "[254-trescorre] said [he]254-trescorre , " does not for the present recommend [your]8674-your resigning [your]8674-your commission in [the Sardinian army]8675-the sardinian army ; but as [he]941-his highness desires [you]8674-your to visit [him]941-his highness at [Pianura]4-pianura , and to see something of [the neighbouring courts]8676-the neighbouring courts , [he]941-his highness has charged [me]254-trescorre to obtain for [you]8674-your a two years ' leave of absence from [[his]254-trescorre Majesty]1406-his majesty 's service : a favour [the King]658-the king has already been pleased to accord . [The Duke]682-the duke has moreover resolved to double [your]8674-your present allowance and has entrusted [me]254-trescorre with the sum of two hundred ducats , which [he]941-his highness desires [you]8674-your to spend in the purchase of [a travelling - carriage]8680-a travelling - carriage , and such other appointments as are suitable to [a gentleman of [your]8674-your rank and expectations]8681-a gentleman of your rank and expectations . "[254-trescorre] As [he]2830-i spoke , [he]2830-i unlocked [his]2830-i despatch - box and handed a purse to [Odo]234-odo . " [[His]254-trescorre Highness]941-his highness , "[2830-i] [he]2830-i continued , " is impatient to see [you]8674-your ; and once [your]8674-your preparations are completed , [I]2830-i should advise [you]8674-your to set out without delay ; that is , "[2830-i] [he]2830-i added , after one of [his]2830-i characteristic pauses , " if [I]2830-i am right in supposing that there is no obstacle to [your]8674-your departure . "[2830-i] [Odo]234-odo , inferring an allusion to [the Countess Clarice]338-the countess clarice , smiled and coloured slightly . " [I]2830-i know of none , "[2830-i] [he]2830-i said . [Trescorre]254-trescorre bowed . " [I]2830-i am glad to hear it , "[2830-i] [he]2830-i said , " for [I]2830-i know that [a man of [your]8674-your age]8683-a man of your age and appearance may have other inclinations than [his]8683-a man of your age own to consider . Indeed , [I]2830-i have had reports of a connection that [I]2830-i should not take the liberty of mentioning , were it not that [your]8674-your interest demands it . "[2830-i] [He]2830-i waited a moment , but [Odo]234-odo remained silent . " [I]2830-i am sure , "[2830-i] [he]2830-i went on , " [you]8674-your will do [me]2830-i the justice of believing that [I]2830-i mean no reflection on [the lady]660-the lady , when [I]2830-i warn [you]8674-your against being seen too often in [the quarter behind [the Corpus Domini]8686-the corpus domini]8685-the quarter behind the corpus domini . Such attachments , though engaging at the outset to a fastidious taste , are often more troublesome than [a young man of [your]8674-your age]8687-a young man of your age can foresee ; and in this case the situation is complicated by the fact that [[the girl]2319-the girl 's father]8689-the girl 's father is in ill odour with [the authorities]2448-the authorities , so that , should the motive of [your]8674-your visits be mistaken , [you]8674-your might find [yourself]8674-your inconveniently involved in the proceedings of the Holy Office . "[2830-i] [Odo]234-odo , who had turned pale , controlled [himself]234-odo sufficiently to listen in silence , and with as much pretence of indifference as [he]234-odo could assume . It was the peculiar misery of [his]234-odo situation that [he]234-odo could not defend [Fulvia]362-fulvia without betraying [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father , and that of the two alternatives prudence bade [him]234-odo reject the one that chivalry would have chosen . It flashed across [him]234-odo , however , that [he]234-odo might in some degree repair the harm [he]234-odo had done by finding out what measures were to be taken against [Vivaldi]362-fulvia ; and to this end [he]234-odo carelessly asked:--"Is it possible that [the Professor]2482-the professor has done anything to give offence in such quarters ? "[234-odo] [His]234-odo assumption of carelessness was perhaps overdone ; for [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's face grew as blank as a shuttered house - front . " [I]234-odo have heard rumours of the kind , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo rejoined ; " but they would scarcely have attracted [my]234-odo notice had [I]234-odo not learned of [your]234-odo honouring [the young lady]8692-the young lady with [your]234-odo favours . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo glanced at [Odo]234-odo with a smile . " Were [I]234-odo [a father]8693-a father , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo added , " with [a son of [your]234-odo age]8694-a son of your age , [my]234-odo first advice to [him]8694-a son of your age would be to form no sentimental ties but in [his]8694-a son of your age own society or in the world of pleasure -- the only two classes where the rules of the game are understood . "[234-odo] 2.6 . [Odo]234-odo had appointed to leave [Turin]17-turin some two weeks after [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's departure ; but the preparations for [a young gentleman]8411-a young gentleman 's travels were in those days a momentous business , and one not to be discharged without vexatious postponements . [The travelling - carriage]1014-the travelling - carriage must be purchased and fitted out , the gold - mounted dressing - case selected and engraved with [the owner]2834-the owner 's arms , [servants]748-servants engaged and provided with liveries , and [the noble tourist]2836-the noble tourist 's own wardrobe stocked with an assortment of costumes suited to the vicissitudes of travel and the requirements of court life . [Odo]234-odo 's impatience to be gone increased with every delay , and at length [he]234-odo determined to go forward at all adventure , leaving [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto to conclude the preparations and overtake [him]234-odo later . It had been agreed with [Trescorre]254-trescorre that [Odo]234-odo , on [his]234-odo way to [Pianura]4-pianura , should visit [[his]234-odo grandfather]936-his grandfather , [the old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , whose increasing infirmities had for some years past imprisoned [him]234-odo on [[his]234-odo estates]1253-his estates , and accordingly about the Ascension [he]234-odo set out in the saddle for [Donnaz]255-donnaz , attended only by [one servant]2840-one servant , and having appointed that [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto should meet [him]234-odo with [the carriage]8109-the carriage at [Ivrea]37-ivrea . The morning broke cloudy as [he]234-odo rode out of the gates . Beyond [the suburbs]2842-the suburbs a few drops fell , and as [he]234-odo pressed forward [the country]818-the country lay before [him]234-odo in the emerald freshness of a spring rain , vivid strips of vineyard alternating with silvery bands of oats , the domes of the walnut - trees dripping above [the roadside]1772-the roadside , and the poplars along the water - courses all slanting one way in the soft continuous downpour . [He]234-odo had left [Turin]17-turin in that mood of clinging melancholy which waits on the most hopeful departures , and [the landscape]2845-the landscape seemed an image of anticipations clouded with regret . [He]234-odo had had a stormy but tender parting with [Clarice]338-the countess clarice , whose efforts to act [the forsaken Ariadne]376-the forsaken ariadne were somewhat marred by [her]338-the countess clarice irrepressible pride in [[her]338-the countess clarice lover]2846-her lover 's prospects , and whose last word had charged [him]234-odo to bring [her]338-the countess clarice back one of the rare lap - dogs bred by [the monks of [Bologna]79-bologna]2847-the monks of bologna . Seen down the lengthening vista of separation even [Clarice]338-the countess clarice seemed regrettable ; and [Odo]234-odo would have been glad to let [his]234-odo mind linger on [their]2848-their farewells . But another thought importuned [him]234-odo . [He]234-odo had left [Turin]17-turin without news of [Vivaldi]362-fulvia or [Fulvia]362-fulvia , and without having done anything to conjure the peril to which [his]234-odo rashness had exposed [them]2848-their . More than once [he]234-odo had been about to reveal [his]234-odo trouble to [Alfieri]306-alfieri ; but shame restrained [him]234-odo when [he]234-odo remembered that it was [Alfieri]306-alfieri who had vouched for [his]234-odo discretion . After [his]234-odo conversation with [Trescorre]254-trescorre [he]234-odo had tried to find some way of sending a word of warning to [Vivaldi]362-fulvia ; but [he]234-odo had [no messenger whom [he]234-odo could trust]2849-no messenger whom he could trust ; and would not [Vivaldi]362-fulvia justly resent a warning from such a source ? [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo the prisoner of [his]234-odo own folly , and as [he]234-odo rode along [the wet country roads]2850-the wet country roads [an invisible gaoler]2851-an invisible gaoler seemed to spur beside [him]234-odo . The clouds lifted at noon ; and leaving [the plain]1139-the plain [he]234-odo mounted into [a world sparkling with sunshine and quivering with new - fed streams]2853-a world sparkling with sunshine and quivering with new - fed streams . The first breath of mountain - air lifted the mist from [his]234-odo spirit , and [he]234-odo began to feel [himself]234-odo [a boy]2854-a boy again as [he]234-odo entered [the high gorges]2855-the high gorges in the cold light after sunset .
