It was about the full of the moon , and in [his]234-odo impatience to reach [Donnaz]7-donnaz [he]234-odo resolved to push on after nightfall . [The forest]2856-the forest was still thinly - leaved , and the rustle of wind in the branches and the noise of the torrents recalled [his]234-odo first approach to [the castle]1126-the castle , in the wild winter twilight . The way lay in darkness till the moon rose , and once or twice [he]234-odo took a wrong turn and found [himself]234-odo engaged in [some overgrown woodland track]2858-some overgrown woodland track ; but [he]234-odo soon regained [the high - road]2859-the high - road , and [[his]234-odo servant]2252-his servant , [a young fellow of indomitable cheerfulness]2861-a young fellow of indomitable cheerfulness , took the edge off [their]2862-their solitude by frequent snatches of song . At length the moon rose , and toward midnight [Odo]234-odo , spurring out of [a dark glen]2863-a dark glen , found [himself]234-odo at the opening of [the valley of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]2864-the valley of donnaz . A cold radiance bathed [the familiar pastures]2865-the familiar pastures , [the houses of [the village]1028-the village along [the stream]1496-the stream]2866-the houses of the village along the stream , and the turrets and crenellations of the castle at [the head of [the gorge]1141-the gorge]2869-the head of the gorge . The air was bitter , and the horses ' hoofs struck sharply on [the road]726-the road as [they]2862-their trotted past [the slumbering houses]2872-the slumbering houses and halted at the gateway through which [Odo]234-odo had first been carried as [a sleepy child]2873-a sleepy child . It was long before [the travellers]1059-the travellers ' knock was answered , but [a bewildered porter]2875-a bewildered porter at length admitted [them]2862-their , and [Odo]234-odo cried out when [he]234-odo recognised in [the man]1626-the man 's face the features of [one of [the lads who had taught [him]234-odo to play pallone in [the castle court]1123-the castle court]2878-the lads who had taught him to play pallone in the castle court]2877-one of the lads who had taught him to play pallone in the castle court . Within doors all were abed ; but [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere was expected , and supper laid for [him]8130-the cavaliere in [the very chamber where [he]8130-the cavaliere had slept as [a lad]2882-a lad]2881-the very chamber where he had slept as a lad . The sight of so much that was strange and yet familiar -- of the old stone walls , the banners , the flaring lamps and worn slippery stairs -- all so much barer , smaller , more dilapidated than [he]234-odo had remembered -- stirred the deep springs of [his]234-odo piety for inanimate things , and [he]234-odo was seized with a fancy to snatch up a light and explore the recesses of [the castle]1126-the castle . But [he]234-odo had been in the saddle since dawn , and the keen air and the long hours of riding were in [his]234-odo blood . They weighted [his]234-odo lids , relaxed [his]234-odo limbs , and gently divesting [him]234-odo of [his]234-odo hopes and fears , pressed [him]234-odo down in the deep sepulchre of a dreamless sleep ... [Odo]234-odo remained a month at [Donnaz]7-donnaz . [[His]234-odo grandfather]936-his grandfather 's happiness in [his]234-odo presence would in itself have sufficed to detain [him]234-odo , apart from [his]234-odo natural tenderness for old scenes and associations . It was one of the compensations of [his]234-odo rapidly travelling imagination that the past , from each new vantage - ground of sensation , acquired a fascination which to the more sober - footed fancy only the perspective of years can give . Life , in childhood , is a picture - book of which the text is undecipherable ; and [the youth now revisiting the unchanged setting of [his]234-odo boyhood]2885-the youth now revisiting the unchanged setting of his boyhood was spelling out for the first time the legend beneath the picture . [The old Marquess]1131-the old marquess , though broken in body , still ruled [[his]1131-the old marquess household]1173-his household from [his]1131-the old marquess seat beside the hearth . The failure of bodily activity seemed to have doubled [his]1131-the old marquess moral vigour , and the walls shook with the vehemence of [his]1131-the old marquess commands . [The Marchioness]1174-the marchioness was sunk in a state of placid apathy from which only [[her]1174-the marchioness husband]1112-her husband 's outbursts roused [her]1174-the marchioness ; [one of [the canonesses]1501-the canonesses]1762-one of the canonesses was dead , and the other , drier and more shrivelled than ever , pined in [her]1174-the marchioness corner like a statue whose mate is broken . [Bruno]258-bruno was dead too ; [his]258-bruno old dog 's bones had long since enriched [a corner of [the vineyard]2893-the vineyard]2892-a corner of the vineyard ; and [some of [the younger lads that [Odo]234-odo had known about [the place]1030-the place]2895-the younger lads that odo had known about the place]2894-some of the younger lads that odo had known about the place were grown to [sober - faced men with [wives]2898-wives and [children]786-children]2897-sober - faced men with wives and children . [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso was still [chaplain of [Donnaz]7-donnaz]2900-chaplain of donnaz ; and [Odo]234-odo saw with surprise that [the grave ecclesiastic who had formerly seemed an old man to [him]234-odo]2901-the grave ecclesiastic who had formerly seemed an old man to him was in fact scarce past the middle age . In general aspect [he]234-odo was unchanged ; but [his]234-odo countenance had darkened , and what [Odo]234-odo had once taken for harshness of manner [he]234-odo now perceived to be a natural melancholy . [The young man]2380-the young man had not been long at [Donnaz]7-donnaz without discovering that in that little world of crystallised traditions [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain was [the only person conscious of the new forces abroad]2904-the only person conscious of the new forces abroad . It had never occurred to [the Marquess]1107-the marquess that anything short of a cataclysm such as it would be blasphemy to predict could change the divinely established order whereby [the territorial lord]2906-the territorial lord took tithes from [[his]2906-the territorial lord peasantry]1260-his peasantry and pastured [his]2906-the territorial lord game on [their]1260-his peasantry crops . The hierarchy which rested on the bowed back of [the toiling serf]2908-the toiling serf and culminated in the figure of [the heaven - sent King]2909-the heaven - sent king seemed to [him]1107-the marquess as immutable as [the everlasting hills]2910-the everlasting hills . [The men of [[his]1107-the marquess generation]2100-his generation]2911-the men of his generation had not learned that [it]2913-it was built on a human foundation and that a sudden movement of the underlying mass might shake the structure to its pinnacle . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess , who , like [Donna Laura]243-donna laura , already beheld [Odo]234-odo on the throne of [Pianura]236-pianura , was [prodigal of counsels which showed a touching inability to discern the new aspect under which old difficulties were likely to present themselves]2915-prodigal of counsels which showed a touching inability to discern the new aspect under which old difficulties were likely to present themselves . That [a ruler]2916-a ruler should be brave , prudent , personally abstemious , and nobly lavish in [his]2916-a ruler official display ; that [he]2916-a ruler should repress any attempts on the privileges of [the Church]1212-the church , while at the same time protecting [his]2916-a ruler authority from the encroachments of [the Holy See]2918-the holy see ; these axioms seemed to [the old man]1195-the old man to sum up [the sovereign]1435-the sovereign 's duty to [the state]2921-the state . The relation , to [his]1195-the old man mind , remained a distinctly personal and paternal one ; and [Odo]234-odo 's attempts to put before [him]1195-the old man the new theory of government , as a service performed by [the ruler]2922-the ruler in the interest of [the ruled]2923-the ruled , resulted only in stirring up the old sediment of absolutism which [generations of feudal power]2924-generations of feudal power had deposited in [the Donnaz]255-donnaz blood . Only [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain perceived what new agencies were at work ; but even [he]8222-the chaplain looked on as [a watcher from [a distant tower]2927-a distant tower , who sees opposing armies far below [him]8222-the chaplain in the night , without being able to follow [their]2928-their movements or guess which way the battle goes]2926-a watcher from a distant tower , who sees opposing armies far below him in the night , without being able to follow their movements or guess which way the battle goes . " The days , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said to [Odo]234-odo , " are evil . [[The Church]1212-the church 's enemies]1223-the church 's enemies , [the basilisks and dragons of unbelief and license]8697-the basilisks and dragons of unbelief and license , are stirring in [[their]8697-the basilisks and dragons of unbelief and license old lairs]8698-their old lairs , [the dark places of [the human spirit]8700-the human spirit]8699-the dark places of the human spirit . It is time that a fresh purification by blood should cleanse [the earth]1750-the earth of its sins . That hour has already come in [France]22-france , where the blood of [heretics]1582-heretics has lately fertilised the soil of faith ; it will come here , as surely as [I]234-odo now stand before [you]8703-you ; and till it comes [the faithful]8704-the faithful can only weary [heaven]1787-heaven with [their]8704-the faithful entreaties , if haply thereby [they]8704-the faithful may mitigate the evil . [I]234-odo shall remain here , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo continued , " while [the Marquess]1107-the marquess needs [me]234-odo ; but that task discharged , [I]234-odo intend to retire to one of the contemplative orders , and with [my]234-odo soul perpetually uplifted like the arms of [Moses]377-moses , wear out [my]234-odo life in prayer for [those whom the latter days]8707-those whom the latter days shall overtake . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo had listened in silence ; but after a moment [he]234-odo said : " [[My]234-odo father]8146-my father , among [those who have called in to question the old order of things]8709-those who have called in to question the old order of things there are [many animated by no mere desire for change , no idle inclination to pry into the divine mysteries]8710-many animated by no mere desire for change , no idle inclination to pry into the divine mysteries , but who earnestly long to ease the burden of [mankind]2662-mankind and let light into what [you]8146-my father have called [the dark places of the spirit]8712-the dark places of the spirit . How is it , [they]8709-those who have called in to question the old order of things ask , that though [Christ]264-christ came to save [the poor]8713-the poor and [the humble]8714-the humble , it is on [them]8709-those who have called in to question the old order of things that life presses most heavily after eighteen hundred years of [His]264-christ rule ? All can not be well in [a world where such contradictions exist]8715-a world where such contradictions exist , and what if some of the worst abuses of the age have found lodgment in the very ramparts that faith has built against [them]8709-those who have called in to question the old order of things ? "[234-odo] [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso 's face grew stern and [his]261-don gervaso eyes rested sadly on [Odo]234-odo . " [You]234-odo speak , "[261-don gervaso] said [he]261-don gervaso , " of bringing light into [dark places]8716-dark places ; but what light is there on [earth]575-earth save that which is shed by the Cross , and where shall [they]8709-those who have called in to question the old order of things find guidance who close [their]8709-those who have called in to question the old order of things eyes to that divine illumination ? "[261-don gervaso] " But is there not , "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo rejoined , " a divine illumination within each of [us]8718-us , the light of truth which [we]8718-us must follow at any cost -- or have the worst evils and abuses only to take refuge in [the Church]1212-the church to find sanctuary there , as [malefactors]8720-malefactors find it ? "[234-odo] [The chaplain]8222-the chaplain shook [his]8222-the chaplain head . " It is as [I]8222-the chaplain feared , "[8222-the chaplain] [he]8222-the chaplain said , " and [Satan]378-satan has spread [his]378-satan subtlest snare for [you]234-odo ; for if [he]378-satan tempts some in the guise of sensual pleasure , or of dark fears and spiritual abandonment , it is said that to those [he]378-satan most thirsts to destroy [he]378-satan appears in the likeness of [[their]8709-those who have called in to question the old order of things Saviour]8721-their saviour . [You]234-odo tell [me]8222-the chaplain it is to right the wrongs of [the poor]8713-the poor and [the humble]8714-the humble that [[your]234-odo new friends]8724-your new friends , [the philosophers]8362-the philosophers , have assailed the authority of [Christ]264-christ . [I]8222-the chaplain have only one answer to make : [Christ]264-christ , as [you]234-odo said just now , died for [the poor]8713-the poor -- how many of [[your]234-odo philosophers]8727-your philosophers would do as much ? Because [men]8356-men hunger and thirst , is that a sign that [He]264-christ has forsaken [them]8356-men ? And since when have earthly privileges been the token of [His]264-christ favour ? May [He]264-christ not rather have designed that , by continual sufferings and privations , [they]8356-men shall lay up for [themselves]8356-men treasures in Heaven such as [your]234-odo eyes and [mine]8222-the chaplain shall never see or [our]8729-we ears hear ? And how dare [you]234-odo assume that any temporal advantages could atone for that of which [your]234-odo teachings must deprive [them]8356-men -- the heavenly consolations of the love of [Christ]264-christ ? "[8222-the chaplain] [Odo]234-odo listened with a sense of deepening discouragement . " But is it necessary , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo urged , " to confound [Christ]264-christ with [[His]264-christ ministers]8730-his ministers , the law with [its exponents]8731-its exponents ? May not [men]8356-men preserve [their]8356-men hope of heaven and yet lead more endurable lives on [earth]575-earth ? "[234-odo] " Ah , [[my]261-don gervaso child]8734-my child , beware , for this is the heresy of private judgment , which has already drawn down thousands into the pit . It is one of the most insidious errors in which the spirit of evil has ever masqueraded ; for it is based on the fallacy that [we]8729-we , [blind creatures of a day]8735-blind creatures of a day , and [ourselves]8729-we in the meshes of sin , can penetrate the counsels of [the Eternal]379-the eternal , and test the balances of the heavenly Justice . [I]261-don gervaso tremble to think into what an abyss [your]234-odo noblest impulses may fling [you]234-odo , if [you]234-odo abandon [yourself]234-odo to such illusions ; and more especially if it pleases [God]249-god to place in [your]234-odo hands a small measure of that authority of which [He]249-god is the supreme repository.--When [I]261-don gervaso took leave of [you]234-odo here nine years since , "[261-don gervaso] [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso continued in a gentler tone , " [we]8729-we prayed together in [the chapel]578-the chapel ; and [I]261-don gervaso ask [you]234-odo , before setting out on [your]234-odo new life , to return there with [me]261-don gervaso and lay [your]234-odo doubts and difficulties before [Him]261-don gervaso who alone is able to still the stormy waves of the soul . "[261-don gervaso] [Odo]234-odo , touched by the appeal , accompanied [him]261-don gervaso to [the chapel]578-the chapel , and knelt on the steps whence [his]261-don gervaso young spirit had once soared upward on the heavenly pleadings of the Mass. [The chapel]578-the chapel was as carefully tended as ever ; and amid the comely appointments of the altar shone forth that Presence which speaks to [men]8356-men of an act of love perpetually renewed . But to [Odo]234-odo the voice was mute , the divinity wrapped in darkness ; and [he]234-odo remembered reading in some Latin author that [the ancient oracles]2933-the ancient oracles had ceased to speak when [[their]2933-the ancient oracles questioners]2934-their questioners lost faith in [them]2933-the ancient oracles . [He]234-odo knew not whether [his]234-odo own faith was lost ; [he]234-odo felt only that it had put forth on a sea of difficulties across which [he]234-odo saw the light of no divine command . In this mood there was no more help to be obtained from [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso than from [the Marquess]255-donnaz . [Odo]234-odo 's last days at [Donnaz]7-donnaz were clouded by a sense of the deep estrangement between [himself]234-odo and that life of which the outward aspect was so curiously unchanged . [His]234-odo past seemed to look at [him]234-odo with unrecognising eyes , to bar the door against [his]234-odo knock ; and [he]234-odo rode away saddened by that sense of isolation which follows the first encounter with a forgotten self . At Ivrea the sight of [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto and [the travelling - carriage]1014-the travelling - carriage roused [him]234-odo as from a waking dream . Here , at [his]234-odo beck were the genial realities of life , embodied , humorously enough , in the bustling figure which for so many years had played a kind of comic accompaniment to [his]234-odo experiences . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto was in a fever of expectation . To set forth on [the road]726-the road again , after nine years of well - fed monotony , and under conditions so favourable to [his]234-odo physical well - being , was to drink the wine of romance from a golden cup . [Odo]234-odo was at the age when the spirit lies as naturally open to the variations of mood as a lake to the shifting of the breeze ; and [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's exuberant humour , and the novel details of [their]2937-them travelling equipment , had soon effaced the graver influences of [Donnaz]255-donnaz . Life stretched before [him]234-odo alluring and various as [the open road]2938-the open road ; and [his]234-odo pulses danced to the tune of the postillion 's whip as [the carriage]8109-the carriage rattled out of the gates . It was a bright morning and [the plain]1139-the plain lay beneath [them]2937-them like [a planted garden]2941-a planted garden , in all the flourish and verdure of June ; but [the roads]2942-the roads being deep in mire , and unrepaired after the ravages of the winter , it was past noon before [they]2937-them reached [the foot of [the hills]1079-the hills]2943-the foot of the hills . Here matters were little better , for [the highway]2945-the highway was ploughed deep by the wheels of [the numberless vans]2946-the numberless vans and coaches journeying from [one town]2947-one town to another during the Whitsun holidays , so that even [a young gentleman travelling post]2948-a young gentleman travelling post must resign [himself]2948-a young gentleman travelling post to a plebeian rate of progression . [Odo]234-odo at first was too much pleased with the novelty of the scene to quarrel with any incidental annoyances ; but as the afternoon wore on the way began to seem long , and [he]234-odo was just giving utterance to [his]234-odo impatience when [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , putting [his]267-cantapresto head out of the window , announced in a tone of pious satisfaction that just ahead of [them]2937-them were [a party of [travellers]2950-travellers in far worse case than [themselves]2937-them]2949-a party of travellers in far worse case than themselves . [Odo]234-odo , leaning out , saw that , a dozen yards ahead , a modest chaise of antique pattern had in fact come to grief by [the roadside]1772-the roadside . [He]234-odo called to [his]234-odo postillion to hurry forward , and [they]2937-them were soon abreast of the wreck , about which [several people]2952-several people were grouped in anxious colloquy . [Odo]234-odo sprang out to offer [his]234-odo services ; but as [he]234-odo alit [he]234-odo felt [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's hand on [his]234-odo sleeve . " [Cavaliere]234-odo , "[1599-the soprano] [the soprano]1599-the soprano whispered , " these are [plainly people of no condition]8737-plainly people of no condition , and [we]2937-them have yet a good seven miles to [Vercelli]13-vercelli , where all [the inns]8738-the inns will be crowded for the Whitsun fair . Believe [me]1599-the soprano , it were better to go forward . "[1599-the soprano] [Odo]234-odo advanced without heeding this admonition ; but a moment later [he]234-odo had almost regretted [his]234-odo action ; for in the centre of [the group about the chaise]2954-the group about the chaise stood [the two persons whom , of all [the world]844-the world]2955-the two persons whom , of all the world , [he]234-odo was at that moment least wishful of meeting . 2.7 . It was in fact [Vivaldi]362-fulvia who , putting aside the knot of [idlers about the chaise]2957-idlers about the chaise , stepped forward at [Odo]234-odo 's approach . [The philosopher]8502-the philosopher 's countenance was perturbed , [his]234-odo travelling - coat spattered with mud , and [[his]234-odo daughter]1475-his daughter , hooded and veiled , clung to [him]234-odo with an air of apprehension that smote [Odo]234-odo to the heart . [He]234-odo caught a blush of recognition beneath [her]1475-his daughter veil ; and as [he]234-odo drew near [she]1475-his daughter raised a finger to [her]1475-his daughter lip and faintly shook [her]1475-his daughter head . The mute signal reassured [him]234-odo . " [I]234-odo see , [sir]8257-sir , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , turning courteously to [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , " that [you]8257-sir are in a bad plight , and [I]234-odo hope that [I]234-odo or [[my]234-odo carriage]8740-my carriage may be of service to [you]8257-sir . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo ventured a second glance at [Fulvia]362-fulvia , but [she]362-fulvia had turned aside and was inspecting the wheel of the chaise with an air of the most disheartening detachment . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , who had returned [Odo]234-odo 's greeting without any sign of ill - will , bowed slightly and seemed to hesitate a moment . " [Our]8741-our plight , as [you]8257-sir see , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " is indeed a grave one ; for the wheel has come off [[our]8741-our carriage]8742-our carriage and [[my]234-odo driver]8743-my driver here tells [me]234-odo there is [no smithy this side [Vercelli]13-vercelli]8744-no smithy this side vercelli , where it is imperative [we]8741-our should lie tonight . [I]234-odo hope , however , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo added , glancing down [the road]726-the road , " that with all the traffic now coming and going [we]8741-our may soon be overtaken by [some vehicle]8745-some vehicle that will carry [us]8741-our to [our]8741-our destination . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo spoke calmly , but it was plain some pressing fear underlay [his]234-odo composure , and the nature of the emergency was but too clear to [Odo]234-odo . " Will not [[my]234-odo carriage]8740-my carriage serve [you]362-fulvia ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo hastily rejoined . " [I]234-odo am for [Vercelli]13-vercelli , and if [you]362-fulvia will honour [me]234-odo with [[your]362-fulvia company]8747-your company [we]8748-we can go forward at once . "[234-odo] [Fulvia]362-fulvia , during this exchange of words , had affected to be engaged with the luggage , which lay in a heap beside the chaise ; but at this point [she]362-fulvia lifted [her]362-fulvia head and shot a glance at [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father from under [her]362-fulvia black travelling - hood . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia 's constraint increased . " This , [sir]8257-sir , "[1415-her father] said [he]1415-her father , " is a handsome offer , and one for which [I]1415-her father thank [you]8257-sir ; but [I]1415-her father fear [our]8748-we presence may incommode [you]8257-sir and the additional weight of [our]8748-we luggage perhaps delay [your]8257-sir progress . [I]1415-her father have little fear but [some van or waggon]8750-some van or waggon will overtake [us]8748-we before nightfall ; and should it chance otherwise , "[1415-her father] [he]1415-her father added with a touch of irresistible pedantry , " why , it behoves [us]8748-we to remember that [we]8748-we shall be none the worse off , since [the sage]8751-the sage is independent of circumstances . "[1415-her father] [Odo]234-odo could hardly repress a smile . " Such philosophy , [sir]8257-sir , is admirable in principle , but in practice hardly applicable to [a lady unused to passing [her]8753-a lady unused to passing her nights in a rice - field nights in [a rice - field]8754-a rice - field]8753-a lady unused to passing her nights in a rice - field . [The region about here]8755-the region about here is notoriously unhealthy and [you]8257-sir will surely not expose [[your]8257-sir daughter]8756-your daughter to the risk of remaining by [the roadside]1772-the roadside or of finding a lodging in [[some peasant]8758-some peasant 's hut]8759-some peasant 's hut . "[362-fulvia] [Vivaldi]362-fulvia drew [himself]362-fulvia up . " [[My]1415-her father daughter]8760-my daughter , "[1415-her father] said [he]1415-her father , " has been trained to face graver emergencies with an equanimity [I]1415-her father have no fear of putting to the touch--'the calm of a mind blest in the consciousness of its virtue ' ; and were it not that circumstances are somewhat pressing-- "[1415-her father] [he]1415-her father broke off and glanced at [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , who was fidgeting about [[Odo]234-odo 's carriage]2962-odo 's carriage or talking in undertones with [the driver of the chaise]2963-the driver of the chaise . " Come , [sir]8257-sir , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo urgently , " Let [[my]234-odo servants]8762-my servants put [your]8257-sir luggage up and [we]8763-we 'll continue this argument on [the road]726-the road . "[234-odo] [Vivaldi]362-fulvia again paused . " [Sir]8257-sir , "[1415-her father] [he]1415-her father said at length , " will [you]8257-sir first step aside with [me]1415-her father a moment ? "[1415-her father] [he]1415-her father led [Odo]234-odo a few paces down [the road]726-the road . " [I]1415-her father make no pretence , "[1415-her father] [he]1415-her father went on when [they]2965-they were out of [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's hearing , " of concealing from [you]8257-sir that this offer comes very opportune to [our]8763-we needs , for it is urgent [we]8763-we should be out of [Piedmont]60-piedmont by tomorrow . But before accepting a seat in [[your]8257-sir carriage]8766-your carriage , [I]1415-her father must tell [you]8257-sir that [you]8257-sir offer it to [a proscribed man]8767-a proscribed man ; since [I]1415-her father have little reason to doubt that by this time [the sbirri]8365-the sbirri are on [my]1415-her father track . "[1415-her father] It was impossible to guess from [Vivaldi]362-fulvia 's manner whether [he]1415-her father suspected [Odo]234-odo of being the cause of [his]1415-her father misadventure ; and [the young man]2380-the young man , though flushing to the forehead , took refuge in the thought of [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's signal and maintained a self - possessed silence . " The motive of [my]362-fulvia persecution , "[362-fulvia] [Vivaldi]362-fulvia continued , " [I]362-fulvia need hardly explain to one acquainted with [[my]362-fulvia house]8535-my house and with the aims and opinions of [those who frequent [it]8535-my house]8770-those who frequent it . [We]8771-we live , alas , in an age when it is a moral offence to seek enlightenment , a political crime to share it with [others]1388-others . [I]362-fulvia have long foreseen that any attempt to raise the condition of [[my]362-fulvia countrymen]8773-my countrymen must end in imprisonment or flight ; and though perhaps to have suffered the former had been a more impressive vindication of [my]362-fulvia views , why , [sir]8257-sir , [the father]8775-the father at the last moment overruled [the philosopher]8502-the philosopher , and thinking of [[my]362-fulvia poor girl]8777-my poor girl there , who but for [me]362-fulvia stands alone in [the world]844-the world , [I]362-fulvia resolved to take refuge in a state where [a man]8112-a man may work for the liberty of [others]1388-others without endangering [his]8112-a man own . "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo had listened with rising eagerness . Was not here an opportunity , if not to atone , at least to give practical evidence of [his]234-odo contrition ? " What [you]234-odo tell [me]234-odo [sir]8257-sir , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo exclaimed , " can not but increase [my]234-odo zeal to serve [you]234-odo . Here is no time to palter . [I]234-odo am on [my]234-odo way to [Lombardy]81-lombardy , which , from what [you]234-odo say , [I]234-odo take to be [your]234-odo destination also ; and if [you]234-odo and [[your]234-odo daughter]8756-your daughter will give [me]234-odo [your]234-odo company across [the border]2189-the border [I]234-odo think [you]234-odo need fear no farther annoyance from [the police]8784-the police , since [[my]234-odo passports]8785-my passports , as [the Duke of [[Pianura]236-pianura 's cousin]8787-pianura 's cousin]8786-the duke of pianura 's cousin , cover [any friends [I]234-odo choose to take in [my]234-odo company]8788-any friends i choose to take in my company . "[234-odo] " Why , [sir]8257-sir , "[362-fulvia] said [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , visibly moved by the readiness of the response , " here is a generosity so far in excess of [our]8790-we present needs that it encourages [me]362-fulvia to accept the smaller favour of travelling with [you]8257-sir to [Vercelli]13-vercelli . There [we]8790-we have friends with whom [we]8790-we shall be safe for the night , and soon after sunrise [I]362-fulvia hope [we]8790-we may be across the border . "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo at once followed up [his]234-odo advantage by pointing out that it was on the border that difficulties were most likely to arise ; but after a few moments of debate [Vivaldi]362-fulvia declared [he]234-odo must first take counsel with [[his]234-odo daughter , who still hung like a mute interrogation on the outskirts of [their]2968-their talk]2967-his daughter , who still hung like a mute interrogation on the outskirts of their talk . After a few words with [her]2967-his daughter , who still hung like a mute interrogation on the outskirts of their talk , [he]234-odo returned to [Odo]234-odo . " [[My]234-odo daughter]8760-my daughter , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " whose good sense puts [my]234-odo wisdom to the blush , wishes [me]234-odo first to enquire if [you]234-odo purpose returning to [Turin]17-turin ; since in that case , as [she]2967-his daughter , who still hung like a mute interrogation on the outskirts of their talk points out , [your]234-odo kindness might result in annoyances to which [we]2968-their have no right to expose [you]234-odo . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo coloured . " Such considerations , [I]362-fulvia beg [[your]234-odo daughter]8756-your daughter to believe , would not weigh with [me]362-fulvia an instant ; but as [I]362-fulvia am leaving [Piedmont]60-piedmont for two years [I]362-fulvia am not so happy as to risk anything by serving [you]234-odo . "[362-fulvia] [Vivaldi]362-fulvia on this assurance at once consented to accept a seat in [[his]234-odo carriage]2969-his carriage as far as [Boffalora]82-boffalora , [the first village beyond [the Sardinian frontier]2971-the sardinian frontier]2970-the first village beyond the sardinian frontier . It was agreed that at [Vercelli]13-vercelli [Odo]234-odo was to set down [[his]234-odo companions]2972-his companions at [an inn]2973-an inn whence , alone and privately , [they]2972-his companions might gain [[[their]2972-his companions friend]2974-their friend 's house]2975-their friend 's house ; that on the morrow at daybreak [he]234-odo was to take [them]2972-his companions up at [a point near [the convent of the Umiliati]2977-the convent of the umiliati]2976-a point near the convent of the umiliati , and that thence [they]2972-his companions were to push forward without a halt for [Boffalora]82-boffalora . This agreement reached , [Odo]234-odo was about to offer [Fulvia]362-fulvia a hand to [the carriage]8109-the carriage when an unwelcome thought arrested [him]234-odo . " [I]234-odo hope , [sir]8257-sir , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , again turning to [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , and blushing furiously as [he]234-odo spoke , " that [you]8257-sir feel assured of [my]234-odo discretion ; but [I]234-odo ought perhaps to warn [you]8257-sir that [[my]234-odo companion]8794-my companion yonder , though [the good - naturedest fellow alive]8795-the good - naturedest fellow alive , is not one to live long on good terms with a secret , whether [his]8794-my companion own or another 's . "[234-odo] " [I]362-fulvia am obliged to [you]8257-sir , "[362-fulvia] said [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , " for the hint ; but [[my]362-fulvia daughter]8760-my daughter and [I]362-fulvia are like [those messengers who , in time of war , learn to carry [their]8797-those messengers who , in time of war , learn to carry their despatches beneath their tongues despatches beneath [their]8797-those messengers who , in time of war , learn to carry their despatches beneath their tongues tongues]8797-those messengers who , in time of war , learn to carry their despatches beneath their tongues . [You]8257-sir may trust [us]8798-us not to betray [ourselves]8798-us ; and [[your]8257-sir friend]8799-your friend may , if [he]8799-your friend chooses , suppose [me]362-fulvia to be travelling to [Milan]14-milan to act as [governor]8800-governor to [a young gentleman of quality]8801-a young gentleman of quality . "[362-fulvia] [The Professor]2482-the professor 's luggage had by this been put on [[Odo]234-odo 's carriage]2962-odo 's carriage , and the latter advanced to [Fulvia]362-fulvia . [He]234-odo had drawn a favourable inference from the concern [she]362-fulvia had shown for [his]234-odo welfare ; but to [his]234-odo mortification [she]362-fulvia merely laid two reluctant finger tips in [his]234-odo hand and took [her]362-fulvia seat without a word of thanks or so much as a glance at [[her]362-fulvia rescuer]2981-her rescuer . This unmerited repulse , and the constraint occasioned by [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's presence , made the remainder of the drive interminable . Even [the Professor]2482-the professor 's apposite reflections on rice - growing and the culture of the mulberry did little to shorten the way ; and when at length [the bell - towers of [Vercelli]13-vercelli]2983-the bell - towers of vercelli rose in sight [Odo]234-odo felt the relief of [a man who has acquitted [himself]234-odo of a tedious duty . [He]234-odo had looked forward with the most romantic anticipations to the outcome of this chance encounter with [Fulvia]362-fulvia]2984-a man who has acquitted himself of a tedious duty . he had looked forward with the most romantic anticipations to the outcome of this chance encounter with fulvia ; but the unforgiving humour which had lent [her]362-fulvia a transitory charm now became as disfiguring as some physical defect ; and [his]234-odo heart swelled with the defiance of youthful disappointment . It was near the angelus when [they]2985-they entered [the city]2261-the city . Just within the gates [Odo]234-odo set down [[his]234-odo companions]2972-his companions , who took leave of [him]234-odo , [the one with the heartiest expressions of gratitude]2988-the one with the heartiest expressions of gratitude , the other with a hurried inclination of [her]362-fulvia veiled head . Thence [he]234-odo drove on to [the Three Crowns]2989-the three crowns , where [he]234-odo designed to lie . [The streets]744-the streets were still crowded with [holiday - makers]2991-holiday - makers and decked out with festal hangings . Tapestries and silken draperies adorned the balconies of [the houses]2992-the houses , innumerable tiny lamps framed the doors and windows , and [the street - shrines]2993-the street - shrines were dressed with a profusion of flowers ; while [every square and open space in [the city]2261-the city]2994-every square and open space in the city was crowded with booths , with the tents of [ambulant comedians]2996-ambulant comedians and [dentists]1663-dentists , and with the outspread carpets of [snake - charmers]2998-snake - charmers , [posture - makers]2999-posture - makers and [jugglers]1547-jugglers . Among [this mob of quacks and pedlars]3001-this mob of quacks and pedlars circulated [other fantastic figures]3002-other fantastic figures , [the camp - followers of the army of [hucksters]3004-hucksters]3003-the camp - followers of the army of hucksters : [dwarfs and cripples]3005-dwarfs and cripples , [mendicant friars]3006-mendicant friars , [gypsy fortune - tellers]3007-gypsy fortune - tellers , and [the itinerant reciters of [Ariosto]308-ariosto and [Tasso]380-tasso]3008-the itinerant reciters of ariosto and tasso . With these mingled [the towns - people in holiday dress , [the well - to - do farmers]3010-the well - to - do farmers and [[their]3010-the well - to - do farmers wives]639-their wives , and a throng of [nondescript idlers]3012-nondescript idlers , ranging from [the servants of [the nobility]1665-the nobility pushing [their]3013-the servants of the nobility pushing their way insolently through the crowd way insolently through [the crowd]1568-the crowd]3013-the servants of the nobility pushing their way insolently through the crowd , to [those sinister vagabonds who lurk , as it were , in the interstices of every concourse of people]3016-those sinister vagabonds who lurk , as it were , in the interstices of every concourse of people]3009-the towns - people in holiday dress , the well - to - do farmers and their wives , and a throng of nondescript idlers , ranging from the servants of the nobility pushing their way insolently through the crowd , to those sinister vagabonds who lurk , as it were , in the interstices of every concourse of people . It was not long before the noise and animation about [him]3017-him had dispelled [Odo]234-odo 's ill - humour . [The world]844-the world was too fair to be darkened by [a girl]2391-a girl 's disdain , and a reaction of feeling putting [him]234-odo in tune with the humours of [the market - place]3020-the market - place , [he]234-odo at once set forth on foot to view [the city]2261-the city . It was now near sunset and the day 's decline irradiated [the stately front of [the Cathedral]3023-the cathedral]3022-the stately front of the cathedral , the walls of [the ancient Hospital that faced [it]3023-the cathedral]3024-the ancient hospital that faced it , and [the groups]3025-the groups gathered about [the stalls]1069-the stalls and platforms obstructing [the square]1592-the square . Even in [his]234-odo travelling - dress [Odo]234-odo was not [a figure to pass unnoticed]3028-a figure to pass unnoticed , and [he]234-odo was soon assailed by laughing compliments on [his]234-odo looks and invitations to visit the various shows concealed behind the flapping curtains of [the tents]3029-the tents . There were enough pretty faces in [the crowd]1568-the crowd to justify such familiarities , and even so modest a success was not without solace to [his]234-odo vanity . [He]234-odo lingered for some time in [the square]1592-the square , answering the banter of [the blooming market - women]3032-the blooming market - women , inspecting the filigree - ornaments from [Genoa]23-genoa , and watching [a little yellow bitch in a hooped petticoat and lappets dance the furlana]3033-a little yellow bitch in a hooped petticoat and lappets dance the furlana to the music of [an armless fiddler who held the bow in [his]3034-an armless fiddler who held the bow in his teeth teeth]3034-an armless fiddler who held the bow in his teeth . As [he]234-odo turned from this show [Odo]234-odo 's eye was caught by [a handsome girl who , on the arm of [a dashing cavalier in somewhat shabby velvet]3036-a dashing cavalier in somewhat shabby velvet , was cheapening a pair of gloves at [a neighbouring stall]3037-a neighbouring stall]3035-a handsome girl who , on the arm of a dashing cavalier in somewhat shabby velvet , was cheapening a pair of gloves at a neighbouring stall . [The girl , who was masked]3038-the girl , who was masked , shot a dark glance at [Odo]234-odo from under [her]3038-the girl , who was masked three - cornered Venetian hat ; then , tossing down a coin , [she]3038-the girl , who was masked gathered up the gloves and drew [[her]3038-the girl , who was masked companion]2330-her companion away . The manoeuvre was almost a challenge , and [Odo]234-odo was about to take it up when [a pretty boy in a Scaramouch habit , waylaying [him]234-odo with various graceful antics]3040-a pretty boy in a scaramouch habit , waylaying him with various graceful antics , thrust a play - bill in [his]234-odo hand ; and on looking round [he]234-odo found [the girl]2319-the girl and [[her]2319-the girl gallant]3042-her gallant had disappeared . The play - bill , with a wealth of theatrical rhetoric , invited [Odo]234-odo to attend the Performance to be given that evening at [the Philodramatic Academy]3043-the philodramatic academy by [the celebrated Capo Comico Tartaglia of [Rimini]83-rimini]3044-the celebrated capo comico tartaglia of rimini and [[his]3044-the celebrated capo comico tartaglia of rimini world - renowned company of Comedians]3045-his world - renowned company of comedians , who , in the presence of [the aristocracy of [Vercelli]13-vercelli]3046-the aristocracy of vercelli , were to present a new comedy entitled " [Le Gelosie di Milord Zambo]381-milord zambo , "[3044-the celebrated capo comico tartaglia of rimini] with an Intermezzo of singing and dancing by [the best Performers of [their]3047-the best performers of their kind kind]3047-the best performers of their kind . Dusk was already falling , and [Odo]234-odo , who had brought no letters to [the gentry of [Vercelli]13-vercelli]3048-the gentry of vercelli , where [he]234-odo intended to stay but a night , began to wonder how [he]234-odo should employ [his]234-odo evening . [He]234-odo had hoped to spend it in [[Vivaldi]362-fulvia 's company]3049-vivaldi 's company , but [the Professor]2482-the professor not having invited [him]234-odo , [he]234-odo saw no prospect but to return to [the inn]1050-the inn and sup alone with [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto . In the doorway of [the Three Crowns]2989-the three crowns [he]234-odo found [the soprano]1599-the soprano awaiting [him]234-odo . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , who had been as mute as a fish during the afternoon 's drive , now bustled forward with a great show of eagerness . " What poet was it , "[267-cantapresto] [he]267-cantapresto cried , " [that paragoned youth]8802-that paragoned youth to the Easter sunshine , which , wherever it touches , causes a flower to spring up ? Here [we]8803-we are scarce alit in [a strange city]8804-a strange city , and already [a messenger]8805-a messenger finds the way to [[our]8803-we inn]8806-our inn with a most particular word from [[his]8805-a messenger lady]1996-his lady to [the Cavaliere Odo Valsecca]234-odo . "[267-cantapresto] And [he]267-cantapresto held out a perfumed billet sealed with a flaming dart . [Odo]234-odo 's heart gave a leap at the thought that the letter might be from [Fulvia]362-fulvia ; but on breaking the seal [he]234-odo read these words , scrawled in an unformed hand:-- " Will [the Cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo accept from [an old friend]8645-an old friend , who desires to renew [her]8645-an old friend acquaintance with [him]234-odo , the trifling gift of a side - box at [Don Tartaglia]84-don tartaglia 's entertainment this evening ? "[234-odo] Vexed at [his]234-odo credulity , [Odo]234-odo tossed the invitation to [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto ; but a moment later , recalling the glance of [the pretty girl]3054-the pretty girl in [the market - place]3020-the market - place , [he]234-odo began to wonder if the billet might not be the prelude to a sufficiently diverting adventure . It at least offered a way of passing the evening ; and after a hurried supper [he]234-odo set out with [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto for [the Philodramatic Academy]3043-the philodramatic academy . It was late when [they]3057-they entered [their]3057-they box , and several masks were already capering before the footlights , exchanging lazzi with [the townsfolk in the pit]3058-the townsfolk in the pit , and addressing burlesque compliments to the quality in the boxes . [The theatre]1559-the theatre seemed small and shabby after those of [Turin]17-turin , and there was little in the old - fashioned fopperies of [a provincial audience]3060-a provincial audience to interest [a young gentleman fresh from [the capital]3062-the capital]3061-a young gentleman fresh from the capital . [Odo]234-odo looked about for [any one resembling the masked beauty of [the market - place]3020-the market - place]3063-any one resembling the masked beauty of the market - place ; but [he]234-odo beheld [only ill - dressed dowagers]3065-only ill - dressed dowagers and [matrons]3066-matrons , or [ladies of [the town]593-the town]3067-ladies of the town more conspicuous for [their]3067-ladies of the town effrontery than for [their]3067-ladies of the town charms . The main diversion of the evening was by [this begun]3069-this begun . It was a comedy in the style of [Goldoni]288-goldoni 's early pieces , representing the actual life of the day , but interspersed with the antics of the masks , to whose improvised drolleries [the people]1003-the people still clung . [A terrific Don Spavento in cloak and sword]3071-a terrific don spavento in cloak and sword played [the jealous English nobleman]3072-the jealous english nobleman , [Milord Zambo]381-milord zambo , and the part of [Tartaglia]382-tartaglia was taken by [the manager]3073-the manager , [one of the best - known interpreters of the character in [Italy]5-italy]3074-one of the best - known interpreters of the character in italy . [Tartaglia]382-tartaglia was [the guardian of the prima amorosa]3075-the guardian of the prima amorosa , whom [the enamoured Briton]3076-the enamoured briton pursued ; and in [the Columbine]383-the columbine , when [she]382-tartaglia sprang upon the stage with a pirouette that showed [her]382-tartaglia slender ankles and embroidered clocks , [Odo]234-odo instantly recognised the graceful figure and killing glance of [[his]234-odo masked beauty]3077-his masked beauty . [Her]382-tartaglia face , which was now uncovered , more than fulfilled the promise of [her]382-tartaglia eyes , being indeed as arch and engaging a countenance as ever flashed distraction across the foot - lights . [She]382-tartaglia was greeted with an outburst of delight that cost [her]382-tartaglia a sour glance from [the prima amorosa]3078-the prima amorosa , and presently [the theatre]1559-the theatre was ringing with [her]382-tartaglia improvised sallies , uttered in the gay staccato of the Venetian dialect . There was to [Odo]234-odo something perplexingly familiar in this accent and in the light darting movements of [her]382-tartaglia little head framed in a Columbine 's ruff , with a red rose thrust behind one ear ; but after a rapid glance about [the house]1917-the house [she]382-tartaglia appeared to take no notice of [him]234-odo and [he]234-odo began to think it must be to [some one else [he]234-odo owed [his]234-odo invitation]3081-some one else he owed his invitation . From this question [he]234-odo was soon diverted by [his]234-odo increasing enjoyment of the play . It was not indeed a remarkable example of its kind , being crudely enough put together , and turning on a series of ridiculous and disconnected incidents ; but to a taste formed on the frigid elegancies of [Metastasio]300-metastasio and [the French stage]3082-the french stage there was something refreshing in this plunge into the coarse homely atmosphere of [the old popular theatre]3083-the old popular theatre . Extemporaneous comedies were no longer played in [the great cities]3084-the great cities , and [Odo]234-odo listened with surprise to the swift thrust and parry , the inexhaustible flow of jest and repartee , the readiness with which [the comedians]3085-the comedians caught up [each other]3086-each other 's leads , like [dancers whirling without a false step through the mazes of some rapid contradance]3087-dancers whirling without a false step through the mazes of some rapid contradance . So engaged was [he]234-odo that [he]234-odo no longer observed [the Columbine]383-the columbine save as [a figure in this flying reel]3088-a figure in this flying reel ; but presently a burst of laughter fixed [his]234-odo attention and [he]234-odo saw that [she]3089-she was darting across [the stage]8311-the stage pursued by [Milord Zambo]381-milord zambo , who , furious at the coquetries of [[his]234-odo betrothed]3091-his betrothed , was avenging [himself]234-odo by [his]234-odo attentions to [the Columbine]383-the columbine . Half way across , [her]3089-she foot caught and [she]3089-she fell on one knee . [Zambo]381-milord zambo rushed to the rescue ; but springing up instantly , and feigning to treat [his]234-odo advance as a part of the play , [she]3089-she cried out with a delicious assumption of outraged dignity:-- " Not a step farther , [villain]8809-villain ! Know that it is sacrilege for [a common mortal]8810-a common mortal to embrace [one who has been kissed by [[his]8810-a common mortal most illustrious Highness [the Heir - presumptive of Pianura]1749-the heir - presumptive of pianura]8812-his most illustrious highness the heir - presumptive of pianura]8811-one who has been kissed by his most illustrious highness the heir - presumptive of pianura ! "[3089-she] " [[Mirandolina]267-cantapresto of [Chioggia]44-chioggia]8393-mirandolina of chioggia ! "[234-odo] sprang to [Odo]234-odo 's lips . At the same instant [the Columbine]3092-the columbine turned about and swept [him]234-odo a deep curtsey , to the delight of [the audience , who had no notion of what was going forward]3093-the audience , who had no notion of what was going forward , but were in the humour to clap any whim of [their]3093-the audience , who had no notion of what was going forward favourite 's ; then [she]3089-she turned and darted off the stage , and the curtain fell on a tumult of applause . [Odo]234-odo had hardly recovered from [his]234-odo confusion when the door of the box opened and [the young Scaramouch [he]234-odo had seen in [the market - place]3020-the market - place]3094-the young scaramouch he had seen in the market - place peeped in and beckoned to [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto . [The soprano]1599-the soprano rose with alacrity , leaving [Odo]234-odo alone in the dimly - lit box , [his]234-odo mind agrope in a labyrinth of memories . A moment later [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto returned with that air of furtive relish that always proclaimed [him]234-odo [the bearer of a tender message]3097-the bearer of a tender message . The one [he]234-odo now brought was to the effect that the [Signorina Miranda Malmocco]384-miranda , justly renowned as [one of [the first Columbines of [Italy]5-italy]3099-the first columbines of italy]3098-one of the first columbines of italy , had charged [him]234-odo to lay at [the Cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo 's feet [her]384-miranda excuses for the liberty [she]384-miranda had taken with [his]234-odo illustrious name , and to entreat that [he]234-odo would show [his]234-odo magnanimity by supping with [her]384-miranda after the play in [[her]384-miranda room]1410-her room at [the Three Crowns]2989-the three crowns -- a request [she]384-miranda was emboldened to make by the fact that [she]384-miranda was lately from [Pianura]4-pianura , and could give [him]234-odo the last news of [the court]814-the court . The message chimed with [Odo]234-odo 's mood , and the play over [he]234-odo hastened back to [the inn]1050-the inn with [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , and bid [the landlord]3104-the landlord send to [[the Signorina Miranda]384-miranda 's room]3105-the signorina miranda 's room whatever delicacies [the town]593-the town could provide . [Odo]234-odo on arriving that afternoon had [himself]234-odo given orders that [[his]234-odo carriage]2969-his carriage should be at the door the next morning an hour before sunrise ; and [he]234-odo now repeated these instructions to [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , charging [him]234-odo on [his]234-odo life to see that nothing interfered with [their]3108-their fulfilment . [The soprano]1599-the soprano objected that the hour was already late , and that [they]3108-their could easily perform the day 's journey without curtailing [their]3108-their rest ; but on [Odo]234-odo 's reiteration of the order [he]234-odo resigned [himself]234-odo , with the remark that it was a pity old age had no savings - bank for the sleep that [youth]3110-youth squandered . 2.8 . It was something of a disappointment to [Odo]234-odo , on entering [[the Signorina Miranda]3111-the signorina miranda 's room]3105-the signorina miranda 's room , to find that [she]3111-the signorina miranda was not alone . Engaged in feeding [her]3111-the signorina miranda pet monkey with sugar - plums was [the young man who had given [her]3111-the signorina miranda [his]3113-the young man who had given her his arm in the piazza arm in [the Piazza]3114-the piazza]3113-the young man who had given her his arm in the piazza . [This gentleman , whom [she]3111-the signorina miranda introduced to [Odo]234-odo]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo as [[her]3111-the signorina miranda cousin]3116-her cousin and [travelling companion]3117-travelling companion , [the Count of [Castelrovinato]391-coeur - volant]3118-the count of castelrovinato , had the same air of tarnished elegance as [his]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo richly - laced coat and discoloured ruffles . [He]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo seemed , however , of a lively and obliging humour , and [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto observed with a smile that [she]3111-the signorina miranda could give no better notion of [his]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo amiability than by mentioning that [he]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo was known among [[her]3111-the signorina miranda friends]3119-her friends as [the Cavaliere Frattanto]3120-the cavaliere frattanto . This praise , [Odo]234-odo thought , seemed scarcely to [the cousin]3121-the cousin 's liking ; but [he]234-odo carried it off with the philosophic remark that it is the mortar between the bricks that holds [the building]3122-the building together . " At present , "[267-cantapresto] said [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto laughing , " [he]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo is engaged in propping up [a ruin]8815-a ruin ; for [he]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo has fallen desperately in love with [[our]8816-our prima amorosa]8817-our prima amorosa , [a lady who lost [her]8818-a lady who lost her virtue under the pharaohs virtue under [the Pharaohs]385-the pharaohs]8818-a lady who lost her virtue under the pharaohs , but whom , for [his]3115-this gentleman , whom she introduced to odo sake , [I]267-cantapresto have been obliged to include in [our]8816-our little supper . "[267-cantapresto] This , it was clear , was merely a way of palliating [the Count]813-the count 's infatuation for [herself]3111-the signorina miranda ; but [he]234-odo took the second thrust as good - naturedly as the first , remarking that [he]234-odo had been bred for [an archeologist]3124-an archeologist and had never lost [his]234-odo taste for the antique . [[Odo]234-odo 's servants]3125-odo 's servants now appearing with a pasty of beccafichi , some bottles of old Malaga and a tray of ices and fruits , [the three]2778-the three seated [themselves]2778-the three at the table , which [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto had decorated with a number of wax candles stuck in the cut - glass bottles of [the Count]813-the count 's dressing - case . Here [they]2778-the three were speedily joined by [the actress]3128-the actress 's monkey and parrot , who had soon spread devastation among the dishes . While [Miranda]384-miranda was restoring order by boxing the monkey 's ears and feeding the shrieking bird from [her]384-miranda lips , the door opened to admit [the prima amorosa]3078-the prima amorosa , [a lady whose mature charms and mellifluous manner]3130-a lady whose mature charms and mellifluous manner suggested a fine fruit preserved in syrup . [The newcomer]3131-the newcomer was clearly engrossed in captivating [the Count]813-the count , and [the latter]870-the latter amply justified [his]234-odo nick - name by the cynical complaisance with which [he]234-odo cleared the way for [Odo]234-odo by responding to [her]384-miranda advances . The tete - a - tete thus established , [Miranda]384-miranda at once began to excuse [herself]384-miranda for the means [she]384-miranda had taken to attract [Odo]234-odo 's attention at [the theatre]1559-the theatre . [She]384-miranda had heard from [the innkeeper]3135-the innkeeper that [the Duke of [[Pianura]236-pianura 's cousin]8787-pianura 's cousin]8786-the duke of pianura 's cousin , [the Cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo , was expected that day in [Vercelli]13-vercelli ; and seeing in [the Piazza]3114-the piazza [a young gentleman in travelling - dress and French toupet]3139-a young gentleman in travelling - dress and french toupet , had at once guessed [him]3139-a young gentleman in travelling - dress and french toupet to be [the distinguished stranger from [Turin]17-turin]3140-the distinguished stranger from turin . At [the theatre]1559-the theatre [she]384-miranda had been much amused by the air of apprehension with which [Odo]234-odo had appeared to seek , among [the dowdy or vulgar inmates of the boxes]3142-the dowdy or vulgar inmates of the boxes , [the sender of the mysterious billet]3143-the sender of the mysterious billet ; and the contrast between [the elegant gentleman in embroidered coat and gold - hilted sword]3144-the elegant gentleman in embroidered coat and gold - hilted sword , and [the sleepy bewildered little boy of the midnight feast at [Chivasso]42-chivasso]3145-the sleepy bewildered little boy of the midnight feast at chivasso , had seized [her]384-miranda with such comic effect that [she]384-miranda could not resist a playful allusion to [their]3146-their former meeting . All this was set forth with so sprightly an air of mock - contrition that , had [Odo]234-odo felt the least resentment , it must instantly have vanished . [He]234-odo was , however , in the humour to be pleased by whatever took [his]234-odo mind off [his]234-odo own affairs , and none could be more skilled than [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto in profiting by such a mood . [He]234-odo pressed [her]384-miranda to tell [him]234-odo something of what had befallen [her]384-miranda since [they]3146-their had met , but [she]384-miranda replied by questioning [him]234-odo about [his]234-odo own experiences , and on learning that [he]234-odo had been called to [Pianura]236-pianura on account of [the heir]2781-the heir 's ill - health [she]384-miranda declared it was notorious that [the little prince]3148-the little prince had not long to live , and that [the Duke]682-the duke could not hope for [another son]8659-another son . " [The Duke]290-pianura 's life , however , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo , " is as good as [mine]234-odo , and in truth [I]234-odo am far less moved by [my]234-odo remote hopes of the succession than by the near prospect of visiting [so many famous cities]8819-so many famous cities and seeing so much that is novel and entertaining . "[234-odo] [Miranda]384-miranda shrugged [her]384-miranda pretty shoulders . " Why , as to [the Duke]682-the duke 's life , "[384-miranda] said [she]384-miranda , " there are some that would not give a counterfeit penny for it ; but indeed [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness lives so secluded from [the world]844-the world , and is surrounded by persons so jealous to conceal [his]682-the duke true condition even from the court , that the reports of [his]682-the duke health are no more to be trusted than the other strange rumours about [him]682-the duke . [I]384-miranda was told in [Pianura]4-pianura that but [four persons]8823-four persons are admitted to [his]682-the duke familiarity : [[his]682-the duke confessor]2233-his confessor , [[his]682-the duke mistress]8825-his mistress , [Count Trescorre]254-trescorre , who is already [comptroller of finance and will soon be prime - minister]8826-comptroller of finance and will soon be prime - minister , and [a strange German doctor]8827-a strange german doctor or astrologer that is lately come to [the court]814-the court . As to [the Duchess]899-the duchess , [she]899-the duchess never sees [him]682-the duke ; and were it not for [Trescorre]254-trescorre , who has had the wit to stand well with both sides , [I]384-miranda doubt if [she]899-the duchess would know more of what goes on about [[her]899-the duchess husband]1112-her husband than any scullion in [the ducal kitchens]8831-the ducal kitchens . "[384-miranda] [She]3151-she spoke with the air of [one well - acquainted with the subject]3152-one well - acquainted with the subject , and [Odo]234-odo , curious to learn more , asked [her]3151-she how [she]3151-she came to have such an insight into the intrigues of [the court]814-the court . " Why , "[3151-she] said [she]3151-she , " in the oddest way imaginable -- by being [the guest of [[his]682-the duke lordship]8266-his lordship [the Bishop of [Pianura]4-pianura]8318-the bishop of pianura]8832-the guest of his lordship the bishop of pianura ; and since [you]234-odo asked [me]3151-she just now to tell [you]234-odo something of [my]3151-she adventures , [I]3151-she will , if [you]234-odo please , begin by relating the occurrences that procured [me]3151-she this extraordinary honour . But first , "[3151-she] [she]3151-she added with a smile , " would it not be well to open another bottle of Malaga ? "[3151-she] [MIRANDOLINA]267-cantapresto 'S STORY . [You]3154-you must know , [she]3151-she continued , when [Odo]234-odo had complied with [her]3151-she request , that soon after [our]3155-our parting at [Chivasso]42-chivasso [the company with which [I]0-i was travelling]3156-the company with which i was travelling came to grief through the dishonesty of [the Harlequin , who ran away with [[the Capo Comico]386-the capo comico 's wife]3158-the capo comico 's wife , carrying with [him]386-the capo comico , besides [the lady]660-the lady , the far more irretrievable treasure of [our]3155-our modest earnings]3157-the harlequin , who ran away with the capo comico 's wife , carrying with him , besides the lady , the far more irretrievable treasure of our modest earnings . This brought [us]3155-our to destitution , and [the troop]3160-the troop was disbanded . [I]0-i had nothing but the spangled frock on [my]0-i back , and thinking to make some use of [my]0-i sole possession [I]0-i set out as [a dancer]3161-a dancer with [the flute - player of the company]3162-the flute - player of the company , [a good - natured fellow that had a performing marmozet from [the Indies]87-the indies]3163-a good - natured fellow that had a performing marmozet from the indies . [We]3155-our three wandered from [one town]2947-one town to another , spreading [our]3155-our carpet wherever there was a fair or [a cattle - market]3165-a cattle - market , going hungry in bad seasons , and in [our]3155-our luckier days attaching [ourselves]3155-our to [some band of strolling posture - makers or comedians]3166-some band of strolling posture - makers or comedians . One day , after about a year of this life , [I]0-i had the good fortune , in [the market - place of [Parma]15-parma]3167-the market - place of parma , to attract the notice of [a rich English nobleman who was engaged in writing a book on the dances of the ancients]3168-a rich english nobleman who was engaged in writing a book on the dances of the ancients . [This gentleman]8523-this gentleman , though no longer young , and afflicted with that strange English malady that obliges [a man]8112-a man to wrap [his]8112-a man feet in swaddling - clothes like [a new - born infant]3171-a new - born infant , was of a generous and paternal disposition , and offered , if [I]0-i would accompany [him]8523-this gentleman to [Florence]88-florence , to give [me]0-i a [home]1346-home and a genteel education . [I]0-i remained with [him]8523-this gentleman about two years , during which time [he]8523-this gentleman had [me]0-i carefully instructed in music , French and the art of the needle . In return for this , [my]0-i principal duties were to perform in antique dances before [the friends of [[my]0-i benefactor]3174-my benefactor -- whose name [I]0-i could never learn to pronounce -- and to read aloud to [him]8523-this gentleman the works of [the modern historians and philosophers]3175-the modern historians and philosophers]3173-the friends of my benefactor -- whose name i could never learn to pronounce -- and to read aloud to him the works of the modern historians and philosophers . [We]3176-we lived in [a large palace with exceedingly high - ceilinged rooms , which [[my]0-i friend]3178-my friend]3177-a large palace with exceedingly high - ceilinged rooms , which my friend [would never have warmed on account of [his]3178-my friend plethoric habit , and as [I]0-i had to dance at all seasons in the light draperies worn by [the classical goddesses]3180-the classical goddesses]3179-would never have warmed on account of his plethoric habit , and as i had to dance at all seasons in the light draperies worn by the classical goddesses , [I]0-i suffered terribly from chilblains and contracted a cruel cough . To this , however , [I]0-i might have resigned [myself]0-i ; but when [I]0-i learned from [a young abate who frequented [the house]1917-the house that the books [I]0-i was compelled to read were condemned by [the Church]1212-the church]3181-a young abate who frequented the house that the books i was compelled to read were condemned by the church , and could not be perused without deadly peril to the soul , [I]0-i at once resolved to fly from such contaminating influences . Knowing that [[his]8523-this gentleman lordship]8266-his lordship would not consent to [my]0-i leaving [him]8523-this gentleman , [I]0-i took the matter out of [his]8523-this gentleman hands by slipping out one day during the carnival , carrying with [me]0-i from [that accursed house]3185-that accursed house nothing but the few jewels that [[my]0-i benefactor]3174-my benefactor had expressed the intention of leaving [me]0-i in [his]8523-this gentleman will . At [the nearest church]3187-the nearest church [I]0-i confessed [my]0-i involuntary sin in reading the prohibited books , and having received absolution and the sacrament , [I]0-i joined [[my]0-i friend]3178-my friend the abate at [Cafaggiolo]89-cafaggiolo , whence [we]3189-we travelled to [Modena]90-modena , where [he]3178-my friend was acquainted with [a theatrical manager]3190-a theatrical manager just then in search of [a Columbine]3191-a columbine . [My]0-i dancing and posturing at [Florence]88-florence had given [me]0-i something of a name among [the dilettanti]3192-the dilettanti , and [I]0-i was at once engaged by [the manager]3073-the manager , who took [me]0-i to [Venice]41-venice , where [I]0-i subsequently joined [the company of [the excellent Tartaglia with whom [I]0-i am now acting]3195-the excellent tartaglia with whom i am now acting]3194-the company of the excellent tartaglia with whom i am now acting . Since then [I]0-i have been attended by continued success , which [I]0-i can not but ascribe to [my]0-i virtuous resolve to face poverty and distress rather than profit a moment longer by the beneficence of [an atheist]3196-an atheist . All this [I]0-i have related to show [you]3197-you how [the poor ignorant girl [you]3197-you met at [Chivasso]42-chivasso]3198-the poor ignorant girl you met at chivasso was able to acquire something of the arts and usages of [good company]3199-good company ; but [I]0-i will now pass on to the incident of [my]0-i visit to [Pianura]4-pianura . [[Our]3200-our manager]3201-our manager , then , had engaged some time since to give a series of performances at [Pianura]4-pianura during the last carnival . [[The Bishop]1234-the bishop 's nephew]8265-the bishop 's nephew , [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto , who has a pronounced taste for the theatre , had been instrumental in making the arrangement ; but at the last moment [he]8265-the bishop 's nephew wrote [us]3200-our that , owing to the influence of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's confessor]3205-the duke 's confessor , [the Bishop]1234-the bishop had been obliged to prohibit the appearance of [women]771-women on the stage of [Pianura]4-pianura . This was a cruel blow , as [we]3200-our had prepared a number of comedies in which [I]0-i was to act the leading part ; and [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto was equally vexed , since [he]267-cantapresto did [me]0-i the honour of regarding [me]0-i as [the chief ornament of [the company]1753-the company]3208-the chief ornament of the company . At length it was agreed that , to overcome the difficulty , it should be given out that [the celebrated Tartaglia of [Rimini]83-rimini]3210-the celebrated tartaglia of rimini would present [himself]3210-the celebrated tartaglia of rimini at [Pianura]4-pianura with [[his]3210-the celebrated tartaglia of rimini company of [comedians]3212-comedians]3211-his company of comedians , among whom was the popular favourite , [Mirandolino of Chioggia]388-mirandolino of chioggia , [twin brother of [the Signorina Miranda Malmocco]384-miranda]3213-twin brother of the signorina miranda malmocco , and trained by [that actress]3214-that actress to play in all [her]3214-that actress principal parts . This satisfied the scruples and interests of [all concerned]3215-all concerned , and soon afterward [I]0-i made [my]0-i first appearance in [Pianura]4-pianura . [My]0-i success was greater than [we]3216-we had foreseen ; for [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i into the part with such zest that [every one]3217-every one was taken in , and even [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto required the most categorical demonstration to convince [him]267-cantapresto that [I]0-i was not [[my]0-i own brother]3218-my own brother . The illusion [I]0-i produced was , however , not without its inconveniences ; for , among [the ladies who thronged to see [the young Mirandolino]3220-the young mirandolino]3219-the ladies who thronged to see the young mirandolino , were [several who desired a closer acquaintance with [him]3220-the young mirandolino]3221-several who desired a closer acquaintance with him ; and one of these , as it happened , was [[the Duke]682-the duke 's mistress]3223-the duke 's mistress , [the Countess Belverde]389-the belverde . [You]3224-you will see the embarrassment of [my]0-i situation . If [I]0-i failed to respond to [her]389-the belverde advances , [her]389-the belverde influence was sufficient to drive [us]3225-us from [the town]593-the town at the opening of a prosperous season ; if [I]0-i discovered [my]0-i sex to [her]389-the belverde , [she]389-the belverde might more cruelly avenge [herself]389-the belverde by throwing [the whole company]3227-the whole company into [prison]3228-prison , to be dealt with by [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office . Under these circumstances , [I]0-i decided to appeal to [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , but without , of course , revealing to [him]1234-the bishop that [I]0-i was , so to speak , [[my]0-i own sister]3231-my own sister . [[His]1234-the bishop lordship]8266-his lordship , who is never sorry to do [the Belverde]389-the belverde a bad turn , received [me]0-i with the utmost indulgence , and declared that , to protect [my]0-i innocence from the designs of [[this new Potiphar]3233-this new potiphar 's wife]3234-this new potiphar 's wife , [he]1234-the bishop would not only give [me]0-i a lodging in [the Episcopal palace]3235-the episcopal palace , but confer on [me]0-i the additional protection of [the minor orders]3236-the minor orders . This was rather more than [I]0-i had bargained for , but [he]1234-the bishop that wants the melon is [a fool]3237-a fool to refuse the rind , and [I]0-i thanked [the Bishop]1234-the bishop for [his]1234-the bishop kindness and allowed [him]1234-the bishop to give out that , [my]0-i heart having been touched by grace , [I]0-i had resolved , at the end of the season , to withdraw from the stage and prepare to enter [the Church]1212-the church . [I]0-i now fancied [myself]0-i safe ; for [I]0-i knew [the Countess]1915-the countess could not attempt [my]0-i removal without risk of having [her]1915-the countess passion denounced to [the Duke]682-the duke . [I]0-i spent several days very agreeably in [the Episcopal palace]3235-the episcopal palace , entertained at [[his]682-the duke lordship]8266-his lordship 's own table , and favoured with private conversations during which [he]682-the duke told [me]0-i many curious and interesting things about [the Duke]682-the duke and [the court]814-the court , and delicately abstained from all allusion to [my]0-i coming change of vocation . [The Countess]1915-the countess , however , had not been idle . One day [I]0-i received notice that [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office disapproved of the appearance on the stage of [a young man about to]3248-a young man about to enter [the Church]1212-the church , and requested [me]0-i to withdraw at once to [the Barnabite monastery]3250-the barnabite monastery , where [I]0-i was to remain till [I]0-i received the minor orders . Now [the Abbot of the Barnabites]3251-the abbot of the barnabites was [[the Belverde]389-the belverde 's brother]3252-the belverde 's brother , and [I]0-i saw at once that to obey [his]3251-the abbot of the barnabites order would place [me]0-i in [that lady]3253-that lady 's power . [I]0-i again addressed [myself]0-i to [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , but to [my]0-i despair [he]1234-the bishop declared [himself]1234-the bishop unable to aid [me]0-i farther , saying that [he]1234-the bishop dared not offend [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office , and that [he]1234-the bishop had already run considerable risk in protecting [me]0-i from [the Countess]1915-the countess . [I]0-i was accordingly transferred to [the monastery]1571-the monastery , in spite of [my]0-i own entreaties and those of [the good [Tartaglia]382-tartaglia , who moved [heaven and earth]3259-heaven and earth to save [[his]3258-the good tartaglia , who moved heaven and earth to save his columbine from sequestration Columbine]3260-his columbine from sequestration]3258-the good tartaglia , who moved heaven and earth to save his columbine from sequestration . [You]3261-you may imagine [my]0-i despair . [My]0-i fear of doing [Tartaglia]382-tartaglia an injury kept [me]0-i from revealing [my]0-i sex , and for twenty - four hours [I]0-i languished in [[my]0-i cell]3262-my cell , refusing food and air , and resisting the repeated attempts of [the good monks]3263-the good monks to alleviate [my]0-i distress . At length however [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i that [the Countess]1915-the countess would soon appear ; and it flashed across [me]0-i that [the one person who could protect [me]0-i from [her]1915-the countess]3265-the one person who could protect me from her was [[her]1915-the countess brother]3266-her brother . [I]0-i at once sought an interview with [the Abbot]3267-the abbot , who received [me]0-i with great indulgence . [I]0-i explained to [him]3267-the abbot that the distress [I]0-i suffered was occasioned by the loss that [my]0-i sequestration was causing [[my]0-i excellent manager]3268-my excellent manager , and begged [him]3267-the abbot to use [his]3267-the abbot influence to have [me]0-i released from [the monastery]1571-the monastery . [The Abbot]3267-the abbot listened attentively , and after a pause replied that there was but [one person who could arrange the matter]3271-one person who could arrange the matter , and that was [[his]3267-the abbot sister]3272-his sister [the Countess Belverde , whose well - known piety gave [her]1915-the countess considerable influence in such matters]389-the belverde . [I]0-i now saw that no alternative remained but to confess the truth ; and with tears of agitation [I]0-i avowed [my]0-i sex , and threw [myself]0-i on [his]3267-the abbot mercy . [I]0-i was not disappointed in the result . [The Abbot]3267-the abbot listened with the greatest benevolence to all the details of [my]0-i adventure . [He]3267-the abbot laughed heartily at [[his]3267-the abbot sister]3272-his sister 's delusion , but said [I]0-i had done right in not undeceiving [her]3272-his sister , as [her]3272-his sister dread of ridicule might have led to unpleasant reprisals . [He]3267-the abbot declared that for the present [he]3267-the abbot could not on any account consent to let [me]0-i out of [his]3267-the abbot protection ; but [he]3267-the abbot promised if [I]0-i submitted [myself]0-i implicitly to [his]3267-the abbot guidance , not only to preserve [me]0-i from [the Belverde]389-the belverde 's machinations , but to ensure [my]0-i reappearing on the stage within two days at the latest . Knowing [him]3267-the abbot to be [a very powerful personage]3275-a very powerful personage [I]0-i thought it best to accept these conditions , which in any case it would have been difficult to resist ; and the next day [he]3267-the abbot informed [me]0-i that [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office had consented to [the Signorina Miranda Malmocco]384-miranda 's appearing on the stage of [Pianura]4-pianura during the remainder of the season , in consideration of the financial injury caused to [the manager of the company]3277-the manager of the company by the edifying conversion of [[her]384-miranda twin - brother]3278-her twin - brother .
