" In this way , "[3267-the abbot] [the Abbot]3267-the abbot was pleased to explain , " [you]0-i will be quite safe from [[my]3267-the abbot sister]8163-my sister , who is [a woman of the most unexceptionable morals]8836-a woman of the most unexceptionable morals , and at the same time [you]0-i will not expose [[our]8837-our excellent Bishop]8838-our excellent bishop to the charge of having been [a party to a grave infraction of ecclesiastical discipline.--My only condition]8839-a party to a grave infraction of ecclesiastical discipline.--my only condition , "[3267-the abbot] [he]3267-the abbot added with a truly paternal smile , " is that , after [the Signorina Miranda]384-miranda 's performance at [the theatre]1559-the theatre [[her]384-miranda twin - brother]3278-her twin - brother [the Signor Mirandolino]390-the signor mirandolino shall return every evening to [the monastery]1571-the monastery : a condition which seems necessary to the preservation of [our]8837-our secret , and which [I]3267-the abbot trust [you]8843-you will not regard as too onerous , in view of the service [I]3267-the abbot have been happy enough to render [you]8843-you . "[3267-the abbot] It would have ill become [me]0-i to dispute [the excellent ecclesiastic]3280-the excellent ecclesiastic 's wishes , and [Tartaglia]382-tartaglia and [the rest of [the company]1753-the company]3281-the rest of the company having been sworn to secrecy , [I]0-i reappeared that very evening in one of [my]0-i favourite parts , and was afterward carried back to [the monastery]1571-the monastery in the most private manner . The [Signorina Malmocco]384-miranda 's successes soon repaired the loss occasioned by [[her]384-miranda brother]3266-her brother 's withdrawal , and if any suspected [their]3285-their identity all were interested to conceal [their]3285-their suspicions . Thus it came about that [my]0-i visit to [Pianura]4-pianura , having begun under the roof of [a Bishop]1232-a bishop , ended in [a monastery of [Barnabites]3288-barnabites]3287-a monastery of barnabites -- nor have [I]0-i any cause to complain of the hospitality of [either of [[my]0-i hosts]3290-my hosts]3289-either of my hosts ... * * * * * [Odo]234-odo , charmed by the vivacity with which this artless narrative was related , pressed [Miranda]384-miranda to continue the history of [her]384-miranda adventures . [The actress]3128-the actress laughingly protested that [she]384-miranda must first refresh [herself]384-miranda with one of the ices [he]234-odo had so handsomely provided ; and meanwhile [she]384-miranda begged [the Count]813-the count to favour [them]3285-their with a song . [This gentleman]8523-this gentleman , who seemed glad of any pretext for detaching [himself]8523-this gentleman from [[his]8523-this gentleman elderly flame]3294-his elderly flame , rescued [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto 's lute from the inquisitive fingering of the monkey , and striking a few melancholy chords , sang the following words , which [he]8523-this gentleman said [he]8523-this gentleman had learned from [a peasant of the Abruzzi:-- Flower of the thyme]3295-a peasant of the abruzzi:-- flower of the thyme ! [She]384-miranda draws [me]0-i as [your]3296-your fragrance draws the bees , [She]384-miranda draws [me]0-i as the cold moon draws [the seas]3297-the seas , And summer winter - time . Flower of the broom ! Like [you]3296-your [she]384-miranda blossoms over [dark abysses]3298-dark abysses , And close to ruin bloom [her]384-miranda sweetest kisses , And on the brink of doom . Flower of the rue ! [She]384-miranda wore [you]3296-your on [her]384-miranda breast when first [we]3299-we met . [I]0-i begged [your]3296-your blossom and [I]0-i wear it yet-- Flower of regret ! The song ended , [the prima amorosa]3078-the prima amorosa , overcome by what [she]3078-the prima amorosa visibly deemed an appeal to [her]3078-the prima amorosa feelings , declared with some agitation that the hour was late and [she]3078-the prima amorosa must withdraw . [Miranda]384-miranda wished [the actress]3128-the actress an affectionate goodnight and asked [the Count]813-the count to light [her]384-miranda to [[her]384-miranda room]1410-her room , which was on the farther side of [the gallery surrounding [the courtyard of [the inn]1050-the inn]3305-the courtyard of the inn]3304-the gallery surrounding the courtyard of the inn . [Castelrovinato]391-coeur - volant complied with [his]391-coeur - volant usual air of resignation , and the door closing on [the couple]3307-the couple , [Odo]234-odo and [Miranda]384-miranda found [themselves]3307-the couple alone . " And now , "[3308-the good - natured girl] said [the good - natured girl]3308-the good - natured girl , placing [herself]3308-the good - natured girl on the sofa and turning to [[her]3308-the good - natured girl guest]3309-her guest with a smile , " if [you]3309-her guest will take a seat at [my]3308-the good - natured girl side [I]3308-the good - natured girl will gladly continue the history of [my]3308-the good - natured girl adventures "[3308-the good - natured girl] ... 2.9 . [Odo]234-odo woke with a start . [He]234-odo had been trying to break down a great gold - barred gate , behind which [Fulvia]362-fulvia , pale and disordered , struggled in the clutch of [the blind beggar of the Corpus Domini]3310-the blind beggar of the corpus domini ... [He]234-odo sat up and looked about [him]234-odo . The gate was still there ; but as [he]234-odo gazed it resolved itself into [his]234-odo shuttered window , barred with wide lines of sunlight . It was day , then ! [He]234-odo sprang out of bed and flung open the shutters . Beneath [him]234-odo lay [the piazza of [Vercelli]13-vercelli]3311-the piazza of vercelli , bathed in the vertical brightness of a summer noon ; and as [he]234-odo stared out on this inexorable scene , the clock over [the Hospital]3312-the hospital struck twelve . Twelve o'clock ! And [he]234-odo had promised to meet [Vivaldi]362-fulvia at dawn behind [the Umiliati]92-the umiliati ! As the truth forced itself on [Odo]234-odo [he]234-odo dropped into a chair and hid [his]234-odo face with a groan . [He]234-odo had failed [them]3313-them again , then -- and this time how cruelly and basely ! [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo the victim of a conspiracy which in some occult manner was forever forcing [him]234-odo to outrage and betray [the two beings [he]234-odo most longed to serve]3314-the two beings he most longed to serve . The idea of a conspiracy flashed a sudden light on [his]234-odo evening 's diversion , and [he]234-odo sprang up with a cry . Yes ! It was a plot , and [any but a dolt]3315-any but a dolt must have traced [the soprano]1599-the soprano 's hand in this vulgar assault upon [his]234-odo senses . [He]234-odo choked with anger at the thought of having played the dupe when two lives [he]234-odo cherished were staked upon [his]234-odo vigilance ... To [his]234-odo furious summons [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto presented a blank wall of ignorance . Yes , [the Cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere had given orders that [the carriage]8109-the carriage should be ready before daybreak ; but who was authorised to wake [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere ? After keeping [the carriage]8109-the carriage two hours at the door [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto had ventured to send it back to [the stable]687-the stable ; but the horses should instantly be put to , and within an hour [they]3322-they would be well forward on [their]3322-they journey . Meanwhile , should [the barber]3323-the barber be summoned at once ? Or would [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere first refresh [himself]8130-the cavaliere with an excellent cup of chocolate , prepared under [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's own supervision ? [Odo]234-odo turned on [him]267-cantapresto savagely . " [Traitor]8844-traitor -- [spy]8845-spy ! In whose pay-- ? "[234-odo] But the words roused [him]267-cantapresto to a fresh sense of peril . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto , though [he]267-cantapresto might have guessed [Odo]234-odo 's intention , was not privy to [his]234-odo plan of rejoining [Vivaldi]362-fulvia and [Fulvia]362-fulvia ; and it flashed across [the young man]2380-the young man that [his]2380-the young man self - betrayal must confirm [the others]2506-the others ' suspicions . [His]2380-the young man one hope of protecting [[his]2380-the young man friends]2637-his friends was to affect indifference to what had happened ; and this was made easier , by the reflection that [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto was after all but a tool in more powerful hands . To be spied on was so natural to [an Italian of that day]3328-an italian of that day that [the victim]3329-the victim 's instinct was rather to circumvent [the spy]3330-the spy than to denounce [him]3330-the spy . [Odo]234-odo dismissed [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto with the reply that [he]234-odo would give orders about [the carriage]8109-the carriage later ; desiring that meanwhile [the soprano]1599-the soprano should purchase the handsomest set of filigree ornaments to be found in [Vercelli]13-vercelli , and carry them with [the Cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo 's compliments to [the Signorina Malmocco]384-miranda . Having thus rid [himself]2380-the young man of observation [he]2380-the young man dressed as rapidly as possible , trying the while to devise some means of tracing [Vivaldi]362-fulvia . But the longer [he]2380-the young man pondered the attempt the more plainly [he]2380-the young man saw its futility . [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , doubtless from motives of prudence , had not named [the friend with whom [he]2380-the young man and [Fulvia]362-fulvia were to take shelter]3333-the friend with whom he and fulvia were to take shelter ; nor did [Odo]234-odo even know in [what quarter of [the city]2261-the city]3334-what quarter of the city to seek [them]3336-them . To question [the police]8784-the police was to risk [their]8784-the police last chance of safety ; and for the same reason [he]2380-the young man dared not enquire of [the posting - master]3338-the posting - master whether [any travellers]3339-any travellers had set out that morning for [Lombardy]81-lombardy . [His]2380-the young man natural activity of mind was hampered by a leaden sense of remissness . With what anguish of spirit must [Vivaldi]362-fulvia and [Fulvia]362-fulvia have awaited [him]2380-the young man in that hour of dawn behind [the convent]3340-the convent ! What thoughts must have visited [the girl]2319-the girl 's mind as day broadened , [the city]2261-the city woke , and peril pressed on [them]3336-them with every voice and eye ! And when at length [they]3336-them saw that [he]2380-the young man had failed [them]3336-them , which way did [their]3336-them hunted footsteps turn ? Perhaps [they]3336-them dared not go back to [the friend who had taken [them]3336-them in for the night]3343-the friend who had taken them in for the night . Perhaps even now [they]3336-them wandered through [the streets]744-the streets , fearing arrest if [they]3336-them revealed [themselves]3336-them by venturing to engage [a carriage]729-a carriage , at every turn of [his]2380-the young man thoughts [Odo]234-odo was mocked by some vision of disaster ; and an hour of perplexity yielded no happier expedient than that of repairing to [the meeting - place behind [the Umiliati]3347-the umiliati]3346-the meeting - place behind the umiliati . It was [a deserted lane]3348-a deserted lane with [few passers]3349-few passers ; and after vainly questioning the blank wall of [the convent]3340-the convent and the gates of [a sinister - looking alms - house that faced [it]3346-the meeting - place behind the umiliati]3351-a sinister - looking alms - house that faced it , [he]2380-the young man retraced [his]2380-the young man steps to [the inn]1050-the inn . [He]2380-the young man spent a day of futile research and bitter thoughts , now straying forth in the hope of meeting [Vivaldi]362-fulvia , now hastening back to [the Three Crowns]93-the three crowns on the chance that some message might await [him]2380-the young man . [He]2380-the young man dared not let [his]2380-the young man mind rest on what might have befallen [[his]2380-the young man friends]2637-his friends ; yet the alternative of contemplating [his]2380-the young man own course was scarcely more endurable . Nightfall brought the conviction that [the Professor]2482-the professor and [Fulvia]362-fulvia had passed beyond [his]2380-the young man reach . It was clear that if [they]2637-his friends were still in [Vercelli]13-vercelli [they]2637-his friends did not mean to make [their]2637-his friends presence known to [him]2380-the young man , while in the event of [their]2637-his friends escape [he]2380-the young man was without means of tracing [them]2637-his friends farther . [He]2380-the young man knew indeed that [their]2637-his friends destination was [Milan]14-milan , but , should [they]2637-his friends reach there safely , what hope was there of finding [them]2637-his friends in [a city of]3355-a city of [strangers]3356-strangers ? By a stroke of folly [he]2380-the young man had cut [himself]2380-the young man off from all communication with [them]2637-his friends , and [his]2380-the young man misery was enhanced by the discovery of [his]2380-the young man weakness . [He]2380-the young man who had fed [his]2380-the young man fancy on high visions , cherishing in [himself]2380-the young man [the latent patriot and hero]3357-the latent patriot and hero , had been driven by [a girl]2391-a girl 's caprice to break the first law of manliness and honour ! The event had already justified [her]2391-a girl ; and in a flash of self - contempt [he]2380-the young man saw [himself]2380-the young man as [she]2391-a girl no doubt beheld [him]2380-the young man -- the fribble preying like a summer insect on the slow growths of difficult years ... In bitterness of spirit [he]2380-the young man set out the next morning for [Pianura]4-pianura . A half - melancholy interest drew [him]2380-the young man back to the scene of [his]2380-the young man lonely childhood , and [he]2380-the young man had started early in order to push on that night to [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . At [Valsecca]234-odo , [the regular posting - station between [Vercelli]13-vercelli and [Pianura]4-pianura]3359-the regular posting - station between vercelli and pianura , [he]2380-the young man sent [Cantapresto]3360-cantapresto forward to [the capital]3062-the capital , and in a stormy yellow twilight drove alone across [the waste land]3362-the waste land that dipped to [the marshes]3363-the marshes . On [his]2380-the young man right the woods of the ducal chase hung black against the sky ; and presently [he]2380-the young man saw ahead of [him]2380-the young man [the old square keep]3364-the old square keep , with a flight of swallows circling low about [its]3364-the old square keep walls . In [the muddy farm - yard]3365-the muddy farm - yard [a young man]3366-a young man was belabouring a donkey laden with mulberry - shoots . [He]3366-a young man stared for a moment at [Odo]234-odo 's approach and then sullenly returned to [his]3366-a young man task . [Odo]234-odo sprang out into the mud . " Why do [you]905-the other beat [the brute]8846-the brute ? "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo indignantly . [The other]905-the other turned a dull face on [him]2380-the young man and [he]2380-the young man recognised [[his]2380-the young man old enemy]3368-his old enemy [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo . " [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo , "[2380-the young man] [he]2380-the young man cried , " do n't [you]237-giannozzo know [me]2380-the young man ? [I]2380-the young man am [the Cavaliere [Valsecca]234-odo , whose ears [you]237-giannozzo used to box when [you]237-giannozzo were [a lad]2882-a lad]8847-the cavaliere valsecca , whose ears you used to box when you were a lad . Must [you]237-giannozzo always be pummelling something , that [you]237-giannozzo ca n't let [that poor brute]8849-that poor brute alone at the end of [its]8849-that poor brute day 's work ? "[2380-the young man] [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo , dropping [his]237-giannozzo staff , stammered out that [he]237-giannozzo craved [his]237-giannozzo excellency 's pardon for not knowing [him]237-giannozzo , but that as for the ass it was a stubborn devil that would not have carried [Jesus Christ]264-christ without gibbing . " The beast is tired and hungry , "[234-odo] cried [Odo]234-odo , [his]234-odo old compassion for the sufferings of the farm - animals suddenly reviving . " How many hours have [you]234-odo worked it without rest or food ? "[234-odo] " No more than [I]237-giannozzo have worked [myself]237-giannozzo , "[237-giannozzo] said [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo sulkily ; " and as for its being hungry , why should it fare better than [[its]8850-its masters]8851-its masters ? "[237-giannozzo] [Their]3369-their words had called out of [the house]1917-the house [a lean bent woman]3371-a lean bent woman , whose shrivelled skin showed through the rents in [her]3371-a lean bent woman unbleached shift . At sight of [Odo]234-odo [she]3371-a lean bent woman pushed [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo aside and hurried forward to ask how [she]3371-a lean bent woman might serve [the gentleman]918-the gentleman . " With supper and a bed , [[my]234-odo good Filomena]8852-my good filomena , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo ; and [she]3371-a lean bent woman flung [herself]3371-a lean bent woman at [his]918-the gentleman feet with a cry . " Saints of [heaven]1787-heaven , that [I]3371-a lean bent woman should not have known [his]918-the gentleman excellency ! But [I]3371-a lean bent woman am half blind with the fever , and who could have dreamed of such an honour ? "[3371-a lean bent woman] [She]3371-a lean bent woman clung to [his]918-the gentleman knees in the mud , kissing [his]918-the gentleman hands and calling down blessings on [him]918-the gentleman . " And as for [you]918-the gentleman , [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo , [[you]918-the gentleman curd - faced fool]8854-you curd - faced fool , quick , see that [his]918-the gentleman excellency 's horses are stabled and go call [[your]918-the gentleman father]8631-your father from [the cow - house]8856-the cow - house while [I]3371-a lean bent woman prepare [his]918-the gentleman excellency 's supper . And fetch [me]3371-a lean bent woman in a faggot to light the fire in [the bailiff 's parlour]705-the bailiff 's parlour . "[3371-a lean bent woman] [Odo]234-odo followed [her]3371-a lean bent woman into [the kitchen]569-the kitchen , where [he]234-odo had so often crouched in a corner to eat [his]234-odo polenta out of reach of [her]3371-a lean bent woman vigorous arm . [The roof]3374-the roof seemed lower and more smoke - blackened than ever , but the hearth was cold , and [he]234-odo noticed that no supper was laid . [Filomena]229-filomena led [him]234-odo into [[the bailiff]688-the bailiff 's parlour]705-the bailiff 's parlour , where a mortal chill seized [him]234-odo . Cobwebs hung from the walls , the window - panes were broken and caked with grime , and the few green twigs which [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo presently threw on the hearth poured a cloud of smoke into the cold heavy air . There was a long delay while supper was preparing , and when at length [Filomena]229-filomena appeared , it was only to produce , with many excuses , a loaf of vetch - bread , a bit of cheese and some dried quinces . There was nothing else in [the house]1917-the house , [she]3371-a lean bent woman declared : not so much as a bit of lard to make soup with , a handful of pasti or a flask of wine . In the old days , as [[his]234-odo excellency]8647-his excellency might remember , [they]3379-their had eaten a bit of meat on Sundays , and drunk aquarolle with [their]3379-their supper ; but since the new taxes it was as much as [the farmers]3380-the farmers could do to feed [their]3380-the farmers cattle , without having a scrap to spare for [themselves]3380-the farmers . [Jacopone]235-jacopone , [she]3371-a lean bent woman continued , was bent double with the rheumatism , and had not been able to drive a plough or to work in [the mulberries]3381-the mulberries for over two years . [He]234-odo and [the farm - lads]3382-the farm - lads sat in [the cow - stables]3383-the cow - stables when [their]3379-their work was over , for the sake of the heat , and [she]3371-a lean bent woman carried [their]3379-their black bread out there to [them]3379-their : a cold supper tasted better in a warm place , and as [[his]234-odo excellency]8647-his excellency knew , all the windows in [the house]1917-the house were unglazed save in [[the bailiff]688-the bailiff 's parlour]705-the bailiff 's parlour . [[Her]3371-a lean bent woman man]3388-her man would be in presently to pay [his]3388-her man duty to [[his]3388-her man excellency]8647-his excellency ; but [he]3388-her man had grown dull - witted since the rheumatism took [him]3388-her man , and [[his]234-odo excellency]8647-his excellency must not take it ill if [his]3388-her man talk was a little childish . Thereupon [Filomena]229-filomena excused [herself]229-filomena , that [she]229-filomena might put a clean shirt on [Jacopone]235-jacopone , and [Odo]234-odo was left to [his]234-odo melancholy musings . [His]234-odo mind had of late run much on economic abuses ; but what was any philandering with reform to this close contact with misery ? It was as though white hungry faces had suddenly stared in at the windows of [his]234-odo brightly - lit life . What did [these people]3391-these people care for education , enlightenment , the religion of humanity ? What [they]3391-these people wanted was fodder for [their]3391-these people cattle , a bit of meat on Sundays and a faggot on the hearth . [Filomena]229-filomena presently returned with [[her]229-filomena husband]1112-her husband ; but [Jacopone]235-jacopone had shrunk into [a crippled tremulous old man]3393-a crippled tremulous old man , who pulled a vague forelock at [Odo]234-odo without sign of recognition . [Filomena]229-filomena , it was clear , was [master at]3394-master at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo ; for though [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo was [a man grown , and did a man]3395-a man grown , and did a man 's work , [he]237-giannozzo still danced to the tune of [[his]237-giannozzo mother]664-his mother 's tongue . It was from [her]229-filomena that [Odo]234-odo , shivering over the smoky hearth , gathered the details of [their]3391-these people wretched state . [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo being a part of [the ducal domain]3397-the ducal domain , [they]3391-these people had led in [their]3391-these people old days an easier life than [[their]3391-these people neighbours]3398-their neighbours ; but the new taxes had stripped [them]3391-these people as bare as a mulberry - tree in June . " How is [a Christian to live , excellency]8858-a christian to live , excellency , with the salt - tax doubled , so that the cows go dry for want of it ; with half a zecchin on every pair of oxen , a stajo of wheat and two fowls to [the parish]8859-the parish , and not so much as a bite of grass allowed on [[the Duke]682-the duke 's lands]8861-the duke 's lands ? In [his]682-the duke late Highness 's day [the poor folk]8862-the poor folk were allowed to graze [their]8862-the poor folk cattle on the borders of the chase ; but now [a man]8112-a man dare not pluck a handful of weeds there , or so much as pick up a fallen twig ; though the deer may trample [his]682-the duke young wheat , and feed off the patch of beans at [his]682-the duke very door . [They]8864-they do say [the Duchess]899-the duchess has a kind heart , and gives away money to [the towns - folk]8866-the towns - folk ; but [[we]8867-we country - people who spend [our]8867-we lives raising fodder for [her]899-the duchess game]8868-we country - people who spend our lives raising fodder for her game never hear of [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness but when [one of [[her]899-the duchess game - keepers]8871-her game - keepers]8870-one of her game - keepers comes down on [us]8867-we for poaching or stealing wood.--Yes , by [the saints]1218-the saints , and it was [[her]899-the duchess Highness who sent [[a neighbour]8874-a neighbour 's lad]8875-a neighbour 's lad to [the galleys]8876-the galleys last year for felling a tree in the chase]8873-her highness who sent a neighbour 's lad to the galleys last year for felling a tree in the chase ; [a good lad as ever dug furrow]8877-a good lad as ever dug furrow , but [he]8877-a good lad as ever dug furrow lacked wood for a new plough - share , and how in [God]249-god 's name was [he]8877-a good lad as ever dug furrow to plough [[his]8877-a good lad as ever dug furrow field]8878-his field without it ? "[3399-she] So [she]3399-she went on , like a torrent after the spring rains ; but when [he]3400-he named [Momola]241-momola [she]3399-she fell silent , and [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo , looking sideways , drummed with [his]237-giannozzo heel on the floor . [Odo]234-odo glanced from one to [the other]905-the other . " [She]241-momola 's dead , then ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried . [Filomena]229-filomena opened deprecating palms . " Can one tell , excellency ? It may be [she]241-momola is off with the gypsies . "[229-filomena] " The gypsies ? How long since ? "[905-the other] " [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo , "[664-his mother] cried [[his]237-giannozzo mother]664-his mother , as [he]237-giannozzo stood glowering , " go see that [the stable]687-the stable is locked and [his]237-giannozzo excellency 's horses bedded down . "[237-giannozzo] [He]237-giannozzo slunk out and [she]664-his mother began to gather up the remains of [Odo]234-odo 's meagre supper . " But [you]234-odo must remember when this happened . "[664-his mother] " [Holy Mother]392-holy mother ! It was the year [we]8880-we had frost in April and lost [our]8880-we hatching for want of leaves . But as for [that child of ingratitude]8881-that child of ingratitude , one day [she]241-momola was here , the next [she]241-momola was gone -- clean gone , as a nut drops from the tree -- and [I]234-odo that had given the blood of [my]234-odo veins to nourish [her]241-momola ! Since then , [God]249-god is [[my]234-odo witness]8882-my witness , [we]8880-we have had nothing but misfortune . The next year it was the weevils in the wheat ; and so it goes . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo was silent , seeing it was vain to press [her]664-his mother . [He]234-odo fancied that [the girl]2319-the girl must have died -- of neglect perhaps , or ill usage -- and that [they]3404-they feared to own it . [His]234-odo heart swelled , but not against [them]3404-they : [they]3404-they seemed to [him]234-odo no more accountable than cowed hunger - driven animals . [He]234-odo tossed impatiently on the hard bed [Filomena]229-filomena had made up for [him]234-odo in [[the bailiff]688-the bailiff 's parlour]705-the bailiff 's parlour , and was afoot again with the first light . Stepping out into [the farm - yard]3407-the farm - yard [he]234-odo looked abroad over [the flat grey face of [the land]8269-the land]3408-the flat grey face of the land . Around [the keep]598-the keep stretched [the new - ploughed fields]3411-the new - ploughed fields and [the pollarded mulberry orchards]3412-the pollarded mulberry orchards ; but these , with [the clustered hovels of [the village]1028-the village]3413-the clustered hovels of the village , formed a mere islet in [the surrounding waste of marsh and woodland]3415-the surrounding waste of marsh and woodland . The scene symbolised fitly enough of social conditions of [the country]818-the country : [the over - crowded peasantry]3417-the over - crowded peasantry huddled on [[their]3417-the over - crowded peasantry scant patches of [arable ground]3419-arable ground]3418-their scant patches of arable ground , while [miles of barren land]3420-miles of barren land represented the feudal rights that hemmed [them]3417-the over - crowded peasantry in on every side . [Odo]234-odo walked across [the yard]709-the yard to [the chapel]578-the chapel . On the threshold [he]234-odo stumbled over a heap of mulberry - shoots and a broken plough - share . Twilight held [the place]1030-the place ; but as [he]234-odo stood there the frescoes started out in the slant of the sunrise like dead faces floating to the surface of [a river]1639-a river . [Dead faces]3425-dead faces , yes : plaintive spectres of [his]234-odo childish fears and longings , lost in the harsh daylight of experience . [He]234-odo had forgotten the very dreams [they]3426-they stood for : [Lethe]393-lethe flowed between and only one voice reached across the torrent . It was that of [Saint Francis]239-saint francis , [lover of the poor ...]3427-lover of the poor ... The morning was hot as [Odo]234-odo drove toward [Pianura]4-pianura , and limping ahead of [him]234-odo in the midday glare [he]234-odo presently saw the figure of [a hump - backed man in a decent black dress and three - cornered hat]3428-a hump - backed man in a decent black dress and three - cornered hat . There was something familiar in [the man]1626-the man 's gait , and in the shape of [his]1626-the man large head , poised on narrow stooping shoulders , and as [the carriage]8109-the carriage drew abreast of [him]1626-the man , [Odo]234-odo , leaning from the window , cried out , " [Brutus]251-brutus -- this must be [Brutus]251-brutus ! "[234-odo] " [[Your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency has the advantage of [me]8158-the hunchback , "[8158-the hunchback] said [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback , turning on [him]234-odo a thin face lit by the keen eyes that had once searched [his]1626-the man childish soul . [Odo]234-odo met the rebuff with a smile . " Does that , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " prevent [my]234-odo suggesting that [you]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder might continue [your]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder way more comfortably in [[my]234-odo carriage]8740-my carriage ? [The road]726-the road is hot and dusty , and , as [you]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder see , [I]234-odo am in want of company . "[234-odo] [The pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder , had the sheepish air of [a man whose rudeness has missed the mark]3433-a man whose rudeness has missed the mark . " Why , [sir]8257-sir , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , recovering [himself]234-odo , " comfort is all a matter of habit , and [I]234-odo daresay the jolting of [[your]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder carriage]8766-your carriage might seem to [me]234-odo more unpleasant than the heat and dust of [the road]726-the road , to which necessity has long since accustomed [me]234-odo . "[234-odo] " In that case , "[234-odo] returned [Odo]234-odo with increasing amusement , " [you]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder will have the additional merit of sacrificing [your]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder pleasure to add to [mine]234-odo . "[8158-the hunchback] [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback stared . " And what have [you]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder or [yours]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder ever done for [me]234-odo , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo retorted , " that [I]234-odo should sacrifice to [your]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder pleasure even the wretched privilege of being dusted by the wheels of [[your]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder coach]8889-your coach ? "[234-odo] " Why , that , "[234-odo] replied [Odo]234-odo , " is a question [I]234-odo can scarce answer till [you]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder give [me]234-odo the opportunity of naming myself.--If [you]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder are indeed [Carlo Gamba]282-gamba , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo continued , " [I]8158-the hunchback am [[your]3432-the pedestrian , who seemed unprepared for this affable rejoinder old friend]8890-your old friend and companion [Odo Valsecca]234-odo . "[8158-the hunchback] [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback started . " [The Cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo ! "[8158-the hunchback] [he]8158-the hunchback cried . " [I]8158-the hunchback had heard that [you]234-odo were expected . "[8158-the hunchback] [He]8158-the hunchback stood gazing at [Odo]234-odo . " [[Our]8891-our next Duke]8892-our next duke ! "[8158-the hunchback] [he]8158-the hunchback muttered . [Odo]234-odo smiled . " [I]234-odo had rather , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " that [my]234-odo past commended [me]234-odo than [my]234-odo future . It is more than doubtful if [I]234-odo am ever able to offer [you]234-odo a seat in [[the Duke]682-the duke 's carriage]8894-the duke 's carriage ; but [Odo Valsecca]234-odo 's is very much at [your]234-odo service . "[234-odo] [Gamba]282-gamba bowed with a kind of awkward dignity . " [I]282-gamba am grateful for [a friend]8895-a friend 's kindness , "[282-gamba] [he]282-gamba said , " but [I]282-gamba do not ride in [[a nobleman]1351-a nobleman 's carriage]8897-a nobleman 's carriage . "[282-gamba] " There , "[234-odo] returned [Odo]234-odo with perfect good - humour , " [you]282-gamba have had advantage of [ME]234-odo ; for [I]234-odo can no more escape doing so than [you]282-gamba can escape spending [your]282-gamba life in the company of [an ill - tempered man]8898-an ill - tempered man . "[234-odo] And courteously lifting [his]234-odo hat [he]234-odo called to [the postillion]3436-the postillion to drive on . [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback at this , flushing red , laid a hand on the carriage door . " [Sir]8257-sir , "[8158-the hunchback] said [he]8158-the hunchback , " [I]8158-the hunchback freely own [myself]8158-the hunchback in the wrong ; but a smooth temper was not one of the blessings [[my]8158-the hunchback unknown parents]8900-my unknown parents bequeathed to [me]8158-the hunchback ; and [I]8158-the hunchback confess [I]8158-the hunchback had heard of [you]234-odo as one little concerned with [[your]234-odo inferiors]8901-your inferiors except as [they]8901-your inferiors might chance to serve [your]234-odo pleasure . "[8158-the hunchback] It was [Odo]234-odo 's turn to colour . " Look , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " at the fallibility of rumour ; for [I]234-odo had heard of [you]234-odo as something of [a philosopher]8902-a philosopher , and here [I]234-odo find [you]234-odo not only taking [a man]8112-a man 's character on hearsay but denying [him]8112-a man the chance to prove [you]234-odo mistaken ! "[234-odo] " [I]282-gamba deny it no longer , "[282-gamba] said [Gamba]282-gamba stepping into [the coach]3438-the coach ; " but as to philosophy , the only claim [I]282-gamba can make to it is that of being by birth [a peripatetic]8904-a peripatetic . "[282-gamba] [His]282-gamba dignity appeased , [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback proved [himself]8158-the hunchback [a most engaging companion]3440-a most engaging companion , and as [the carriage]8109-the carriage lumbered slowly toward [Pianura]4-pianura [he]8158-the hunchback had time not only to recount [his]8158-the hunchback own history but to satisfy [Odo]234-odo as to many points of the life awaiting [him]8158-the hunchback . [Gamba]282-gamba , it appeared , owed [his]282-gamba early schooling to [a Jesuit priest who , visiting [the foundling asylum]3443-the foundling asylum]3442-a jesuit priest who , visiting the foundling asylum , had been struck by [the child]686-the child 's quickness , and had taken [him]686-the child [home]1346-home and bred [him]686-the child to be [a clerk]3446-a clerk . [The priest]1732-the priest 's death left [his]282-gamba charge adrift , with a smattering of scholarship above [[his]282-gamba station]3448-his station , and none to whom [he]282-gamba could turn for protection . For a while [he]282-gamba had lived , as [he]282-gamba said , like a street - cat , picking up a meal where [he]282-gamba could , and sleeping in [church porches]3449-church porches and under [street - arcades]3450-street - arcades , till [one of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's servants]3453-the duke 's servants]3451-one of the duke 's servants took pity on [him]282-gamba and [he]282-gamba was suffered to hang about [the palace]768-the palace and earn [his]282-gamba keep by doing the lacquey 's errands . [The Duke]682-the duke 's attention having been called to [him]282-gamba as [a lad of parts]3456-a lad of parts , [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness had given [him]282-gamba to [the Marquess of [Cerveno]394-cerveno , in whose service [he]282-gamba remained till shortly before [that young nobleman]3458-that young nobleman 's death]394-cerveno . [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback passed hastily over this period ; but [his]8158-the hunchback reticence was lit by the angry flash of [his]8158-the hunchback eyes . After [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's death [he]8158-the hunchback had lived for a while from hand to mouth , copying music , writing poetry for weddings and funerals , doing pen - and - ink portraits at a scudo apiece , and putting [his]8158-the hunchback hand to any honest job that came [his]8158-the hunchback way . [Count Trescorre]254-trescorre , who now and then showed a fitful recognition of the tie that was supposed to connect [them]3461-them , at length heard of the case to which [he]8158-the hunchback was come and offered [him]8158-the hunchback a trifling pension . This [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback refused , asking instead to be given some fixed employment . [Trescorre]254-trescorre then obtained [his]254-trescorre appointment as [assistant to [[the Duke]682-the duke 's librarian]3465-the duke 's librarian]3463-assistant to the duke 's librarian , [a good old priest engrossed in compiling the early history of [Pianura]4-pianura from [the ducal archives]3467-the ducal archives]3466-a good old priest engrossed in compiling the early history of pianura from the ducal archives ; and this post [Gamba]282-gamba had now filled for two years . " It must , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo , " be one singularly congenial to [you]282-gamba , if , as [I]234-odo have heard , [you]282-gamba are of a studious habit . Though [I]234-odo suppose , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo tentatively added , " [the library]2154-the library is not likely to be rich in works of the new scientific and philosophic schools . "[234-odo] [[His]234-odo companion]840-his companion received this observation in silence ; and after a moment [Odo]234-odo continued : " [I]234-odo have a motive in asking , since [I]234-odo have been somewhat deeply engaged in the study of [these writers]8906-these writers , and [my]234-odo dearest wish is to continue while in [Pianura]4-pianura [my]234-odo examination of [their]8906-these writers theories , and if possible to become acquainted with any who share [their]8906-these writers views . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo was not insensible of the risk of thus opening [himself]234-odo to [a stranger]3469-a stranger ; but the sense of peril made [him]234-odo the more eager to proclaim [himself]234-odo on the side of the cause [he]234-odo seemed to have deserted . [Gamba]282-gamba turned as [he]234-odo spoke , and [their]3470-their eyes met in one of those revealing glances that lay the foundations of friendship . " [I]8158-the hunchback fear , [Cavaliere]234-odo , "[8158-the hunchback] said [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback with a smile , " that [you]234-odo will find both branches of investigation somewhat difficult to pursue in [Pianura]4-pianura ; for [the Church]72-the church takes care that neither [the philosophers]8362-the philosophers nor [their]8362-the philosophers books shall gain a footing in [our]8908-our most Christian state . Indeed , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo added , " not only must [the library]2154-the library be free from heretical works , but [the librarian clear of heretical leanings]8910-the librarian clear of heretical leanings ; and since [you]234-odo have honoured [me]234-odo with [your]234-odo confidence [I]234-odo will own that , [the court]814-the court having got wind of [my]234-odo supposed tendency to liberalism , [I]234-odo live in daily expectation of dismissal . For the moment [they]814-the court are content to keep [their]814-the court spies on [me]234-odo ; but were it not for the protection of [the good abate]8912-the good abate , [[my]234-odo superior]8913-my superior , [I]234-odo should long since have been turned out . "[234-odo] " And why , "[234-odo] asked [Odo]234-odo , " do [you]234-odo speak of [the court]814-the court and [the Church]1212-the church as one ? "[234-odo] " Because , [sir]8257-sir , in [[our]8917-our virtuous duchy]8918-our virtuous duchy the terms are interchangeable . [The Duke]682-the duke is in fact so zealous [a son of [the Church]1212-the church]8920-a son of the church that if [the latter]870-the latter showed any leniency to [sinners]8923-sinners the secular arm would promptly repair [her]870-the latter negligence . [[His]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness , as [you]8925-you may have heard , is ruled by [[his]682-the duke confessor]2233-his confessor , [an adroit Dominican]8927-an adroit dominican . [The confessor]8928-the confessor , it is true , has [two rivals]8929-two rivals , [the Countess Belverde]389-the belverde , [a lady distinguished for [her]389-the belverde piety]8930-a lady distinguished for her piety , and [a German astrologer or alchemist]8931-a german astrologer or alchemist , lately come to [Pianura]4-pianura , and calling [himself]8928-the confessor [a descendant of [the Egyptian priesthood]8933-the egyptian priesthood]8932-a descendant of the egyptian priesthood and [an adept of the higher or secret doctrines of Neoplatonism]8934-an adept of the higher or secret doctrines of neoplatonism . [These three]8935-these three , however , though ostensibly rivals for [the Duke]682-the duke 's favour , live on such good terms with one another that [they]8935-these three are suspected of having entered into a secret partnership ; while some regard [them]8935-these three all as [the emissaries of [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits , who , since the suppression of [the Society]8939-the society]8937-the emissaries of the jesuits , who , since the suppression of the society , are known to have kept a footing in [Pianura]4-pianura , as in [most of [the Italian states]8941-the italian states]8940-most of the italian states . As to [the Duke]682-the duke , the death of [the Marquess of [Cerveno]394-cerveno]8288-the marquess of cerveno , the failing health of [the little prince]3148-the little prince , and [his]682-the duke own strange physical infirmities , have so preyed on [his]682-the duke mind that [he]682-the duke is the victim of [any who are unscrupulous enough to trade on the fears of a diseased imagination]8945-any who are unscrupulous enough to trade on the fears of a diseased imagination . [[His]682-the duke counsellors]8946-his counsellors , however divided in doctrine , have at least one end in common ; and that is , to keep the light of reason out of [the darkened chamber in which [they]8946-his counsellors have confined [him]682-the duke]8947-the darkened chamber in which they have confined him ; and with [such a ruler and such principles of government]8948-such a ruler and such principles of government , [you]8949-you may fancy that poor philosophy has not where to lay [her]8950-her head . "[8158-the hunchback] " And [the people]1003-the people ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo pursued . " What of the fiscal administration ? In [some states]8952-some states where liberty of thought is forbidden the material welfare of the subject is nevertheless considered . "[234-odo] [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback shook [his]8158-the hunchback head . " It may be so , "[8158-the hunchback] said [he]8158-the hunchback , " though [I]8158-the hunchback had thought the principle of moral tyranny must infect every branch of public administration . With [us]8953-us , at all events , where [the Church party]8954-the church party rules , the privileges and exemptions of [the clergy]1929-the clergy are the chief source of suffering , and the state of passive ignorance in which [they]8946-his counsellors have kept [the people]1003-the people has bred in the latter a dull resignation that is the surest obstacle to reform . Oh , [sir]8257-sir , "[8158-the hunchback] [he]8158-the hunchback cried , [his]8158-the hunchback eyes darkening with emotion , " if [you]8949-you could see , as [I]8158-the hunchback do , [the blind brute misery on which all the magnificence of rank and all the refinements of luxury are built]8958-the blind brute misery on which all the magnificence of rank and all the refinements of luxury are built , [you]8949-you would feel , as [you]8949-you drive along [this road]8959-this road , that with every turn of the wheels [you]8949-you are passing over the bodies of [those who have toiled without ceasing]8960-those who have toiled without ceasing that [you]8949-you might ride in [a gilt coach]8961-a gilt coach , and have gone hungry that [you]8949-you might feast in [[Kings]8962-kings ' palaces]8963-kings ' palaces ! "[8158-the hunchback] The touch of rhetoric in this adjuration did not discredit it with [Odo , to whom the words were as caustic on an open wound]3473-odo , to whom the words were as caustic on an open wound . [He]3473-odo , to whom the words were as caustic on an open wound turned to make some impulsive answer ; but as [he]3473-odo , to whom the words were as caustic on an open wound did so [he]3473-odo , to whom the words were as caustic on an open wound caught sight of [the towers of [Pianura]4-pianura]3474-the towers of pianura rising above [the orchards and market - gardens of [the suburbs]2842-the suburbs]3475-the orchards and market - gardens of the suburbs . The sight started a new train of feeling , and [Gamba]282-gamba , perceiving it , said quietly : " But this is no time to speak of such things . "[282-gamba] A moment later [the carriage]8109-the carriage had passed under the great battlemented gates , with [their]3478-their Etruscan bas - reliefs , and the motto of [the house of [Valsecca]234-odo]3479-the house of valsecca -- Humilitas -- surmounted by the ducal escutcheon . Though the hour was close on noon [the streets]744-the streets were as animated as at the angelus , and [the carriage]8109-the carriage could hardly proceed for [the crowd]1568-the crowd obstructing [its]8109-the carriage passage . So unusual at that period was such a sight in [one of [the lesser Italian cities]3484-the lesser italian cities]3483-one of the lesser italian cities that [Odo]234-odo turned to [Gamba]282-gamba for an explanation . At the same moment a roar rose from [the crowd]1568-the crowd ; and [the coach]3438-the coach turning into the Corso which led to [the ducal palace]3487-the ducal palace and [the centre of [the town]593-the town]3488-the centre of the town , [Odo]234-odo caught sight of [a strange procession advancing from that direction]3490-a strange procession advancing from that direction . It was headed by [a clerk]3446-a clerk or [usher with a black cap and staff]3492-usher with a black cap and staff , behind whom marched [two bare - foot friars]3493-two bare - foot friars escorting between [them]3493-two bare - foot friars [a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate]3494-a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate , [his]3494-a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate hands bound behind [him]3494-a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate and [his]3494-a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate head surmounted by a paste - board mitre inscribed with the title : [A Destroyer of Female Chastity]3495-a destroyer of female chastity . [This man , who was of a simple and decent aspect]3496-this man , who was of a simple and decent aspect , was so dazed by the buffeting of [the crowd , so spattered by the mud and filth hurled at him from a hundred taunting hands]3497-the crowd , so spattered by the mud and filth hurled at him from a hundred taunting hands , and [his]3494-a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate countenance distorted by so piteous a look of animal fear , that [he]3494-a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate seemed more like [a madman]8117-a madman being haled to Bedlam than [a penitent]3499-a penitent making public amends for [his]3494-a middle - aged man in the dress of an abate offence . " Are such failings always so severely punished in [Pianura]4-pianura ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo asked , turning ironically to [Gamba]282-gamba as [the mob]3500-the mob and [its victim]3501-its victim passed out of sight . [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback smiled . " Not , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " if [the offender]8964-the offender be in a position to benefit by the admirable doctrines of probabilism , the direction of intention , or any one of the numerous expedients by which [an indulgent Church]8965-an indulgent church has smoothed the way of [the sinner]8966-the sinner ; but as [God]249-god does not give the crop unless [man]2185-man sows the seed , so [[His]2185-man ministers]8730-his ministers bestow grace only when [the penitent]8969-the penitent has enriched the treasury . [The fellow]8970-the fellow , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo added , " is [a man of some learning and of a retired and orderly way of living]8971-a man of some learning and of a retired and orderly way of living , and the charge was brought against [him]8970-the fellow by [a jeweller]8972-a jeweller and [[his]8972-a jeweller wife]1713-his wife , who owed [him]8970-the fellow a sum of money and are said to have chosen this way of evading payment . [The priests]8974-the priests are always glad to find [a scape - goat of the sort]8975-a scape - goat of the sort , especially when there are murmurs against the private conduct of those in high places , and [the woman]8976-the woman , having denounced [him]8970-the fellow , was immediately assured by [[her]8976-the woman confessor]1925-her confessor that any debt incurred to [a seducer]8978-a seducer was null and void , and that [she]8976-the woman was entitled to a hundred scudi of damages for having been led into sin . "[234-odo] 2.10 . At [the Duke]682-the duke 's express wish , [Odo]234-odo was to lodge in [the palace]768-the palace ; and when [he]234-odo entered [the courtyard]1745-the courtyard [he]234-odo found [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto waiting to lead [him]234-odo to [[his]234-odo apartment]3506-his apartment . [The rooms assigned to [him]234-odo]3507-the rooms assigned to him lay at the end of [one of the wings overlooking [the gardens]8159-the gardens]3508-one of the wings overlooking the gardens ; and as [he]234-odo mounted the great stairway and walked down [the corridors]948-the corridors with [their]948-the corridors frescoed walls and busts of [Roman emperors]3511-roman emperors [he]234-odo recalled the far - off night when [he]234-odo had passed through the same scenes as [a frightened awe - struck child]3512-a frightened awe - struck child . Where [he]234-odo had then beheld a supernatural fabric , peopled with divinities of bronze and marble , and glowing with light and colour , [he]234-odo now saw [a many - corridored palace]3513-a many - corridored palace , stately indeed , and full of a faded splendour , but dull and antiquated in comparison with the new - fangled elegance of [the Sardinian court]1534-the sardinian court . Yet at every turn some object thrilled the fibres of old association or pride of race . Here [he]234-odo traversed [a gallery]3515-a gallery hung with the portraits of [[his]234-odo line]3516-his line ; there caught a glimpse of [the pages]3517-the pages ' antechamber through which [he]234-odo and [[his]234-odo mother]664-his mother had been led when [they]3519-they waited on [the Duke]682-the duke ; and from the windows of [[his]234-odo closet]3521-his closet [he]234-odo overlooked [the alleys and terraces where [he]234-odo had wandered with [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback]3522-the alleys and terraces where he had wandered with the hunchback . One of [the Duke]682-the duke 's pages came to say that [[his]234-odo Highness]941-his highness would receive [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere when [the court]814-the court rose from dinner ; and finding [himself]234-odo with two hours on [his]234-odo hands , [Odo]234-odo determined to await [[his]234-odo kinsman]3528-his kinsman 's summons in [the garden]8185-the garden . Thither [he]234-odo presently repaired ; and was soon , with a mournful pleasure , retracing the paths [he]234-odo had first explored in such an ecstasy of wonder . [The pleached walks]3530-the pleached walks and parterres were in all the freshness of June . Roses and jasmine mingled on [the terrace - walls]3531-the terrace - walls , citron - trees ingeniously grafted with red and white carnations stood in Faenza jars before [the lemon - house]865-the lemon - house , and marble nymphs and fauns peeped from thickets of flowering camellias . A noise of childish voices presently attracted [Odo]234-odo , and following [a tunnel of clipped limes]3533-a tunnel of clipped limes [he]234-odo came out on [a theatre cut in the turf and set about with statues of [Apollo]395-apollo and [the Muses]396-the muses]3534-a theatre cut in the turf and set about with statues of apollo and the muses . [A handful of boys in military dress]3535-a handful of boys in military dress were performing a series of evolutions in the centre of [this space]1572-this space ; and facing [them]3535-a handful of boys in military dress stood [a child of about ten years]3537-a child of about ten years , in [a Colonel]3538-a colonel 's uniform covered with orders , [his]3537-a child of about ten years hair curled and powdered , a paste - board sword in [his]3537-a child of about ten years hand , and [his]3537-a child of about ten years frail body supported on one side by [a turbaned dwarf]3539-a turbaned dwarf , and on the other by [an ecclesiastic who was evidently [[his]3537-a child of about ten years governor]1208-his governor]3540-an ecclesiastic who was evidently his governor . [The child]686-the child , as [Odo]234-odo approached , was calling out [his]686-the child orders to [[his]686-the child regiment]3543-his regiment in a weak shrill voice , moving now here , now there on [his]686-the child booted tottering legs , as [[his]686-the child two supporters]3544-his two supporters guided [him]686-the child , and painfully trying to flourish the paper weapon that was too heavy for [his]686-the child nerveless wrist . [Odo]234-odo had been about to advance and do homage to [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin ; but a sign from [the man in the background]3549-the man in the background arrested [him]234-odo . This ceremony over , [the tall man]3555-the tall man advanced to [Odo]234-odo with a bow and asked pardon for the liberty [he]3555-the tall man had taken . " [You]234-odo are doubtless , "[3555-the tall man] said [he]3555-the tall man , " [[his]2781-the heir Highness 's cousin]8979-his highness 's cousin , [the Cavaliere Valsecca]8650-the cavaliere valsecca ; and [my]3555-the tall man excuse for intruding between [yourself]234-odo and [the prince]8981-the prince is that [I]3555-the tall man am [[the Duke]682-the duke 's physician]8983-the duke 's physician , [Count Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern , and that [the heir]2781-the heir is at present undergoing a course of treatment under [my]3555-the tall man care . [His]2781-the heir health , as [you]234-odo probably know , has long been a cause of anxiety to [[his]2781-the heir illustrious parents]8985-his illustrious parents , and when [I]3555-the tall man was summoned to [Pianura]4-pianura [the College of Physicians]8986-the college of physicians had given up all hope of saving [him]2781-the heir . Since [my]3555-the tall man coming , however , [I]3555-the tall man flatter [myself]3555-the tall man that a marked change is perceptible . [My]3555-the tall man method is that of invigorating the blood by exciting the passions most likely to produce a generous vital ardour . Thus , by organising these juvenile manoeuvres , [I]3555-the tall man arouse [the prince]8981-the prince 's martial zeal ; by encouraging [him]8981-the prince to study the history of [[his]8981-the prince ancestors]1224-his ancestors , [I]3555-the tall man evoke [his]8981-the prince political ambition ; by causing [him]8981-the prince to be led about [the gardens]8159-the gardens on a pony , accompanied by a miniature pack of Maltese dogs in pursuit of [a tame doe]8990-a tame doe , [I]3555-the tall man stimulate the passion of the chase ; but it is essential to [my]3555-the tall man system that one emotion should not violently counteract another , and [I]3555-the tall man am therefore obliged to protect [[my]3555-the tall man noble patient]8991-my noble patient from the sudden intrusion of new impressions . "[3555-the tall man] This explanation , delivered in a sententious tone , and with a strong German accent , seemed to [Odo]234-odo no more than a learned travesty of the familiar and pathetic expedient of distracting [a sick child]3556-a sick child by the pretence of manly diversions . [He]234-odo was struck , however , by [the physician]3557-the physician 's aspect , and would have engaged [him]234-odo in talk had not [one of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's gentlemen]911-the duke 's gentlemen]3558-one of the duke 's gentlemen appeared with the announcement that [[his]234-odo Highness]941-his highness would be pleased to receive [the Cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo . Like [most dwellings of [its]3563-its kind in [Italy]5-italy]3562-most dwellings of its kind in italy , [the palace of Pianura]3564-the palace of pianura resembled one of those shells which reveal by [their]3565-their outer convolutions the gradual development of the creature housed within . [[The present Duke]3608-the present duke 's father]3609-the present duke 's father had expressed the most recent tendency of the race by the erection of [a chapel in the florid Jesuit style]3610-a chapel in the florid jesuit style ; and the group of buildings thus chronicled in rich durable lines the varying passions and ambitions of three hundred years of power . As [Odo]234-odo followed [his]234-odo guide toward [[the Duke]682-the duke 's apartments]3612-the duke 's apartments [he]234-odo remarked a change in the aspect of [the palace]768-the palace . " [You]234-odo find [me]682-the duke , [cousin]929-cousin , "[682-the duke] said [he]682-the duke after a brief greeting , " much troubled by a question that has of late incessantly disturbed [my]682-the duke rest -- can the soul , after full intuition of [God]249-god , be polluted by the sins of the body ? "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke clutched [Odo]234-odo 's hand in [his]682-the duke burning grasp . " Is it possible that there are [human beings]8993-human beings so heedless of [their]8993-human beings doom that [they]8993-human beings can go about [their]8993-human beings earthly pleasures with this awful problem unsolved ? Oh , why has not [some Pope]8994-some pope decided it ? Why has [God]249-god left this hideous uncertainty hanging over [us]8995-us ? [You]234-odo know the doctrine of Plotinus--'he who has access to [God]249-god leaves the virtues behind [him]682-the duke as the images of the gods are left in [the outer temple]8996-the outer temple . ' [Many of [the fathers]1227-the fathers]8997-many of the fathers believed that [the Neoplatonists]8999-the neoplatonists were permitted to foreshadow in [their]8999-the neoplatonists teachings the revelation of [Christ]264-christ ; but on these occult points much doubt remains , and though certain of [the great theologians]9000-the great theologians have inclined to this interpretation , there are [others who hold that it leans to the heresy of Quietism]9001-others who hold that it leans to the heresy of quietism . "[682-the duke] [Odo]234-odo , who had inferred in [the Duke]682-the duke 's opening words an allusion to [the little prince]3148-the little prince 's ill - health , or to some political anxiety , was at a loss how to reply to this strange appeal ; but after a moment [he]234-odo said , " [I]234-odo have heard that [[your]682-the duke Highness 's director]9002-your highness 's director is [a man of great learning and discrimination]9003-a man of great learning and discrimination . " [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " is in fact well - versed in theology ; but there are certain doctrines inaccessible to all but [a few who have received the direct illumination of heaven]9005-a few who have received the direct illumination of heaven , and on this point [I]234-odo can not feel that [his]234-odo judgment is final . " May [you]682-the duke never know , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , " the agony of [a father whose child]9006-a father whose child is dying , of [a sovereign who longs to labour for the welfare of [[his]9006-a father whose child people]1264-his people , but who is racked by the thought that in giving [his]9006-a father whose child mind to temporal duties and domestic affections while such spiritual difficulties are still unsolved , [he]9006-a father whose child may be preparing for [himself]9006-a father whose child an eternity of torture such as that-- "[234-odo] and [he]234-odo pointed to an old and blackened picture of the Last Judgment that hung on the opposite wall]9007-a sovereign who longs to labour for the welfare of his people , but who is racked by the thought that in giving his mind to temporal duties and domestic affections while such spiritual difficulties are still unsolved , he may be preparing for himself an eternity of torture such as that-- " and he pointed to an old and blackened picture of the last judgment that hung on the opposite wall . [Odo]234-odo tried to frame a soothing rejoinder ; but [the Duke]682-the duke passionately interrupted [him]234-odo . " Alas , [cousin]929-cousin , no rest is possible for [one who has attained the rapture of the Beatific Vision]9010-one who has attained the rapture of the beatific vision , yet who trembles lest the mere mechanical indulgence of the senses may still subject [him]9006-a father whose child to the common penalty of sin ! As [a man who has devoted [himself]9006-a father whose child to the study of theology]9011-a man who has devoted himself to the study of theology is privileged to argue on questions forbidden to the vulgar , so surely fasting , maceration and ecstasy must liberate the body from the bondage of prescribed morality . Shall no distinction be recognised between [my]3657-i conduct and that of [the common sot or debauchee whose soul lies in blind subjection to [his]9006-a father whose child lower instincts]9012-the common sot or debauchee whose soul lies in blind subjection to his lower instincts ? [I]3657-i , who have laboured early and late to remove temptation from [[my]3657-i people]9013-my people -- [who have punished offences against conduct as unsparingly as spiritual error]9014-who have punished offences against conduct as unsparingly as spiritual error -- [I]3657-i , who have not scrupled to destroy every picture in [[my]3657-i galleries]9015-my galleries that contained [a nude figure or a wanton attitude]9016-a nude figure or a wanton attitude -- [I]3657-i , [who have been blessed from childhood by tokens of divine favour and miraculous intervention]9017-who have been blessed from childhood by tokens of divine favour and miraculous intervention -- can [I]3657-i doubt that [I]3657-i have earned the privileges of that higher state in which the soul is no longer responsible for the failings of the body ? Si autem et sic impius sum , quare frustra laboravi ? "[3657-i] And [he]3657-i sank back on [his]3657-i pillows limp as an empty glove . Alarmed at [his]3657-i disorder , [Odo]234-odo stood irresolute whether to call for help ; but as [he]234-odo hesitated [the Duke]682-the duke feebly drew from [his]682-the duke bosom a gold key attached to a slender Venetian chain . " This , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " unlocks the small tortoise - shell cabinet yonder . In it [you]682-the duke will find a phial of clear liquor , a few drops of which will restore [me]234-odo . ' Tis an essence distilled by [the Benedictine nuns of the Perpetual Adoration and peculiarly effective in accesses of spiritual disturbance]9019-the benedictine nuns of the perpetual adoration and peculiarly effective in accesses of spiritual disturbance . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo complied , and having poured the liquor into a glass , held it to [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin 's lips . " [I]234-odo am , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " unhappily subject to such seizures after any prolonged exertion , and a conversation [I]234-odo have just had with [[my]234-odo director]9020-my director has left [me]234-odo in no fit state to receive [you]682-the duke . "[234-odo] [He]3661-me leaned back with a gesture of dismissal ; but added , reddening slightly , as [Odo]234-odo prepared to withdraw : " [You]234-odo will oblige [me]3661-me , [cousin]929-cousin , when [you]929-cousin meet [[my]3661-me physician]9058-my physician , [Count Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern , by not touching on the matter of the restorative [you]929-cousin have seen [me]3661-me take . "[3661-me] [Odo]234-odo left [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin 's presence with a feeling of deep discouragement . To [a spirit aware of the new influences abroad , and fresh from contact with evils rooted in the very foundations of the existing system]3663-a spirit aware of the new influences abroad , and fresh from contact with evils rooted in the very foundations of the existing system , there was a peculiar irony in being advised to seek guidance and instruction in the society of [ecstatic nuns]3664-ecstatic nuns and [cloistered theologians]3665-cloistered theologians . [The Duke]682-the duke , with [his]682-the duke sickly soul agrope in a maze of Neoplatonism and probabilism , while [[his]682-the duke people]1264-his people groaned under unjust taxes , while knowledge and intellectual liberty languished in a kind of moral pest - house , seemed to [Odo]234-odo like [a ruler who , in time of famine , should keep the royal granaries locked and spend [his]682-the duke days praying for the succour that [his]682-the duke own hand might have dispensed]3668-a ruler who , in time of famine , should keep the royal granaries locked and spend his days praying for the succour that his own hand might have dispensed . In [the tapestry room]3669-the tapestry room [one of [[his]682-the duke Highness 's gentlemen]3671-his highness 's gentlemen]3670-one of his highness 's gentlemen waited to reconduct [Odo]234-odo . [Their]3672-their way lay through [the portrait gallery of which [he]234-odo had previously caught a glimpse]3673-the portrait gallery of which he had previously caught a glimpse , and here [he]234-odo begged [[his]234-odo guide]3674-his guide to leave [him]234-odo . [He]234-odo felt a sudden desire to meet [[his]234-odo unknown ancestors]3675-his unknown ancestors face to face , and to trace the tendencies which , from [the grim Bracciaforte]398-bracciaforte and [the stately sceptical humanist of [Leo]402-leo x. 's age]3676-the stately sceptical humanist of leo 's age , had mysteriously forced the race into its ever - narrowing mould . The dusky canvases , hung high in tarnished escutcheoned frames , presented a continuous chronicle of the line , from [Bracciaforte]398-bracciaforte [himself]398-bracciaforte , with [his]398-bracciaforte predatory profile outlined by some early Tuscan hand against the turrets of [[his]398-bracciaforte impregnable fortress]3677-his impregnable fortress . [Odo]234-odo lingered long on this image , but it was not till [he]234-odo stood beneath [Piero della Francesca]410-piero della francesca 's portrait of [the first Duke]3574-the first duke that [he]234-odo felt the thrill of kindred instincts . In this grave face , with its sensuous mouth and melancholy speculative eyes , [he]234-odo recognised the mingled strain of impressionability and unrest that had reached such diverse issues in [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin and [himself]234-odo . [The great Duke of the " Golden Age]9059-the great duke of the " golden age , "[9059-the great duke of the " golden age] in [his]3574-the first duke Titianesque brocade , the statuette of a naked faun at [his]3574-the first duke elbow , and a faun - like smile on [his]3574-the first duke own ruddy lips , represented another aspect of the ancestral spirit : the rounded temperament of an age of Cyrenaicism , in which every moment was a ripe fruit sunned on all sides . A little farther on , the shadow of the Council of [Trent]262-trent began to fall on the ducal faces , as the uniform blackness of the Spanish habit replaced the sumptuous colours of the Renaissance . Here was [the persecuting Bishop]3680-the persecuting bishop , [Paul IV]411-paul iv . 's ally against [the Spaniards]3681-the spaniards , painted by [Caravaggio]412-caravaggio in hauberk and mailed gloves , with [his]412-caravaggio motto -- Etiam cum gladio -- surmounting the episcopal chair ; there [the Duke who , after a life of hard warfare and stern piety]3682-the duke who , after a life of hard warfare and stern piety , had resigned [his]3682-the duke who , after a life of hard warfare and stern piety office to [[his]3682-the duke who , after a life of hard warfare and stern piety son]3683-his son and died in [the " angelica vestis "[412-caravaggio] of the tertiary order]3684-the " angelica vestis " of the tertiary order ; and [the " beatified "[412-caravaggio] Duchess who had sold [her]3685-the " beatified " duchess who had sold her jewels to buy corn for the poor during the famine of 1670 , and had worn a hair - shirt under a corset that seemed stiff enough to serve all the purposes of bodily mortification jewels to buy corn for [the poor during the famine of 1670]3686-the poor during the famine of 1670 , and had worn a hair - shirt under a corset that seemed stiff enough to serve all the purposes of bodily mortification]3685-the " beatified " duchess who had sold her jewels to buy corn for the poor during the famine of 1670 , and had worn a hair - shirt under a corset that seemed stiff enough to serve all the purposes of bodily mortification . So the file descended , the colours fading , the shadows deepening , till it reached [a baby porporato of the last century]3687-a baby porporato of the last century , who had donned [the cardinal]3688-the cardinal 's habit at four , and stood rigid and a little pale in [his]3574-the first duke red robes and lace , with a crucifix and a skull on the table to which the top of [his]3574-the first duke berretta hardly reached . It seemed to [Odo]234-odo as [he]234-odo gazed on the long line of faces as though [[their]3689-their owners]3690-their owners had entered one by one into a narrowing defile , where the sun rose later and set earlier on [each successive traveller]3691-each successive traveller ; and in every countenance , from that of [the first Duke]3574-the first duke to that of [[his]234-odo own peruked and cuirassed grandfather]3693-his own peruked and cuirassed grandfather , [he]234-odo discerned the same symptom of decadency : that duality of will which , in a delicately - tempered race , is the fatal fruit of an undisturbed pre - eminence . [They]3694-they had ruled too long and enjoyed too much ; and [the poor creature [he]234-odo had just left to [his]234-odo dismal scruples and forebodings]3695-the poor creature he had just left to his dismal scruples and forebodings seemed the mere empty husk of long - exhausted passions . 2.11 . [The Duchess]899-the duchess was lodged in [the Borromini wing of [the palace]768-the palace]3697-the borromini wing of the palace , and thither [Odo]234-odo was conducted that evening . [The Duchess , who soon entered]3708-the duchess , who soon entered , received [Odo]234-odo with the flighty good - nature of a roving mind ; but as [her]3708-the duchess , who soon entered deep - blue gaze met [his]234-odo [her]3708-the duchess , who soon entered colour rose , [her]3708-the duchess , who soon entered eyes lingered on [his]234-odo face , and [she]3708-the duchess , who soon entered invited [him]234-odo to a seat at [her]3708-the duchess , who soon entered side . [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina was of Austrian descent , and something in [her]413-maria clementina free and noble port and the smiling arrogance of [her]413-maria clementina manner recalled the aspect of [[her]413-maria clementina distant kinswoman]3709-her distant kinswoman , [the young Queen of [France]22-france]3710-the young queen of france . " Have [you]234-odo seen [[my]3708-the duchess , who soon entered son]8132-my son ? "[3708-the duchess , who soon entered] [she]3708-the duchess , who soon entered asked . " [I]3711-i remember [you]234-odo [a little boy scarce bigger than [Ferrante]414-prince ferrante , whom [[your]234-odo mother]8087-your mother brought to kiss [my]3711-i hand in the very year of [my]3711-i marriage]9061-a little boy scarce bigger than ferrante , whom your mother brought to kiss my hand in the very year of my marriage . The book is on the Index , [I]3711-i believe , and if [[my]3711-i director]9020-my director knew [I]3711-i had it in [[my]3711-i library]9078-my library [I]3711-i should be set up in the stocks in [the market - place]3020-the market - place and all [my]3711-i court - gowns burnt at the Church door as a warning against the danger of importing the new fashions from [France!--I]96-france!--i hope [you]3711-i hunt , [cousin]929-cousin ? "[3711-i] [she]3711-i cried suddenly . " ' Tis [my]3711-i chief diversion and one [I]3711-i would have [[my]3711-i friends]8538-my friends enjoy with [me]3711-i . [[His]9082-his Highness]941-his highness has lately seen fit to cut down [[my]3711-i stables]9084-my stables , so that [I]3711-i have scarce forty saddle - horses to [my]3711-i name , and the greater part but sorry nags at that ; yet [I]3711-i can still find a mount for [any friend that will ride with [me]3711-i]9085-any friend that will ride with me and [I]3711-i hope to see [you]3711-i among the number if [the Duke]682-the duke can spare [you]3711-i now and then from mass and benediction . "[3711-i] The impression produced on [the Duchess]899-the duchess by [the cavaliere Valsecca]234-odo was closely observed by [several members of the group surrounding [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness]3713-several members of the group surrounding her highness . " [The Countess]1915-the countess , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " or [I]234-odo should rather say [the Marchioness of [Boscofolto]97-boscofolto]9096-the marchioness of boscofolto , since [the Duke]682-the duke has just bestowed on [her]9096-the marchioness of boscofolto the fief of that name , is impatient to make [your]1915-the countess acquaintance ; and since [you]1915-the countess doubtless remember the saying of [the Marquis de Montesquieu]417-the marquis de montesquieu , that to know [a ruler]2916-a ruler [one]8494-one must know [[his]8494-one confessor]2233-his confessor and [[his]8494-one mistress]8825-his mistress , [you]1915-the countess will perhaps be glad to seize both opportunities in one . "[254-trescorre] As [they]3749-they crossed [the room]782-the room [he]254-trescorre added in a low tone : " [The Duchess]899-the duchess , in spite of [her]899-the duchess remarkable strength of character , is still of an age to be readily open to new influences . [I]254-trescorre observed [she]899-the duchess was much taken by [your]234-odo conversation , and [you]234-odo would be doing [her]899-the duchess a service by engaging [her]899-the duchess not to oppose this pilgrimage to [Boscofolto]97-boscofolto .
