"[254-trescorre] And [he]254-trescorre withdrew with a smile as [Odo]234-odo approached the card - table . [Odo]234-odo left [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's circle]3752-the duchess 's circle with an increased desire to penetrate more deeply into the organisation of [the little world about [him]234-odo]3753-the little world about him , to trace the operation of its various parts , and to put [his]234-odo hand on the mainspring about which they revolved ; and [he]234-odo wondered whether [Gamba]282-gamba , whose connection with [the ducal library]3754-the ducal library must give [him]234-odo some insight into the affairs of [the court]814-the court , might not prove as instructive a guide through this labyrinth as through the mazes of [the ducal garden]3756-the ducal garden . [[The Duke]682-the duke 's library]3758-the duke 's library filled [a series of rooms designed in the classical style of [the cinque - cento]3760-the cinque - cento]3759-a series of rooms designed in the classical style of the cinque - cento . On the very threshold [Odo]234-odo was conscious of leaving behind the trivial activities of [the palace]768-the palace , with the fantastic architecture which seemed [their]768-the palace natural setting . Here all was based on a noble permanence of taste , a convergence of accumulated effort toward a chosen end ; and the door was fittingly surmounted by [Seneca]368-seneca 's definition of [the wise man]3762-the wise man 's state : " Omnia illi secula ut deo serviunt . "[368-seneca] [Odo]234-odo would gladly have lingered among the books which filled [the rooms]1157-the rooms with an incense - like aroma of old leather . [His]234-odo imagination caressed in passing the yellowish vellum backs , the worn tooling of Aldine folios , the heavy silver clasps of ancient chronicles and psalters ; but [his]234-odo first object was to find [Gamba]282-gamba and renew the conversation of the previous day . In this [he]234-odo was disappointed . [The only occupant of [the library]2154-the library]3764-the only occupant of the library was [the hunchback 's friend and protector]3766-the hunchback 's friend and protector , the abate Crescenti , [a tall white - haired priest with the roseate gravity and benevolent air of a donator in some Flemish triptych]3767-a tall white - haired priest with the roseate gravity and benevolent air of a donator in some flemish triptych . [The abate]624-the abate , courteously welcoming [Odo]234-odo , explained that [he]234-odo had despatched [[his]234-odo assistant]3769-his assistant to [the Benedictine monastery]3770-the benedictine monastery to copy certain ancient records of transactions between [that order]3771-that order and [the Lords of [Valsecca]234-odo]3772-the lords of valsecca , and added that [Gamba]282-gamba , on [his]282-gamba return , should at once be apprised of [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere 's wish to see [him]234-odo . [The abate]624-the abate [himself]624-the abate had been engaged , when [[his]624-the abate visitor]1440-his visitor entered , in collating manuscripts , but on [Odo]234-odo 's begging [him]624-the abate to return to [his]624-the abate work , [he]234-odo said with a smile : " [I]234-odo do not suffer from an excess of interruptions , for [the library]2154-the library is [the least visited portion of [the palace]768-the palace]9128-the least visited portion of the palace , and [I]234-odo am glad to welcome any who are disposed to inspect [its]2154-the library treasures . [I]234-odo know not , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo added , " if the report of [my]234-odo humble labours has ever reached [you]8111-cavaliere ; "[234-odo] and on [Odo]234-odo 's affirmative gesture [he]234-odo went on , with the eagerness of [a shy man who gathers assurance from the intelligence of [[his]234-odo listener]3777-his listener]3776-a shy man who gathers assurance from the intelligence of his listener : " Such researches into the rude and uncivilised past seem to [me]234-odo as essential to the comprehension of the present as the mastering of the major premiss to the understanding of a syllogism ; and to [those who reproach [me]234-odo for wasting [my]234-odo life over the chronicles of barbarian invasions and the records of [monkish litigations]9132-monkish litigations]9131-those who reproach me for wasting my life over the chronicles of barbarian invasions and the records of monkish litigations , instead of contemplating the illustrious deeds of [Greek sages]9133-greek sages and [Roman heroes]9134-roman heroes , [I]234-odo confidently reply that it is more useful to [a man]8112-a man to know [[his]8112-a man own father]9136-his own father 's character than that of [a remote ancestor]9137-a remote ancestor . Even in this quiet retreat , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo went on , " [I]234-odo hear much talk of abuses and of the need for reform ; and [I]234-odo often think that if [they]9138-they who rail so loudly against existing institutions would take the trouble to trace [them]9138-they to [their]9138-they source , and would , for instance , compare this state as [it]9139-it is today with [its]9139-it condition five hundred or a thousand years ago , instead of measuring it by the standard of [some imaginary Platonic republic]9140-some imaginary platonic republic , [they]9138-they would find , if not less subject for complaint , yet fuller means of understanding and remedying the abuses [they]9138-they discover . "[234-odo] This view of history was one so new in the abate [Crescenti]234-odo 's day that it surprised [Odo]234-odo with the revelation of unsuspected possibilities . How was it that among [the philosophers whose works [he]234-odo had studied , none had thought of tracing in the social and political tendencies of the race the germ of wrongs so confidently ascribed to the cunning of [priests]3779-priests and the rapacity of [princes]2145-princes]3778-the philosophers whose works he had studied , none had thought of tracing in the social and political tendencies of the race the germ of wrongs so confidently ascribed to the cunning of priests and the rapacity of princes ? [Odo]234-odo listened with growing interest while [Crescenti]234-odo , encouraged by [his]234-odo questions , pointed out how the abuses of feudalism had arisen from [the small land - owner]3781-the small land - owner 's need of protection against [the northern invader]3782-the northern invader , as the concentration of royal prerogative had been the outcome of [the king]658-the king 's intervention between [[his]658-the king great vassals]3784-his great vassals and [the communes]3785-the communes . The discouragement which had obscured [Odo]234-odo 's outlook since [his]234-odo visit to [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo was cleared away by the discovery that in a sympathetic study of the past might lie the secret of dealing with present evils . [His]234-odo imagination , taking the intervening obstacles at a bound , arrived at once at the general axiom to which such inductions pointed ; and if [he]234-odo afterward learned that human development follows no such direct line of advance , but must painfully stumble across the wastes of error , prejudice and ignorance , while [the theoriser]3786-the theoriser traverses the same distance with a stroke of [his]3786-the theoriser speculative pinions ; yet the influence of these teachings tempered [his]234-odo judgments with charity and dignified [his]234-odo very failures by a tragic sense of their inevitableness . [Crescenti]234-odo suggested that [Gamba]282-gamba should wait on [Odo]234-odo that evening ; but [the latter]870-the latter , being uncertain how far [he]870-the latter might dispose of [his]870-the latter time , enquired where the hunchback lodged , with a view of sending for [him]870-the latter at a convenient moment . Having dined at [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's table , and soon wearying of the vapid company of [[her]899-the duchess associates]3789-her associates , [he]234-odo yielded to the desire for contrast that so often guided [his]234-odo course , and set out toward sunset in search of [[Gamba]282-gamba 's lodging]3790-gamba 's lodging . It was [his]234-odo first opportunity of inspecting [the town]593-the town at leisure , and for a while [he]234-odo let [his]234-odo curiosity lead [him]234-odo as it would . [The streets near [the palace]768-the palace]3792-the streets near the palace were full of [noble residences]3794-noble residences , recording , in [their]3794-noble residences sculptured doorways , in the wrought - iron work of torch - holders and window - grilles , and in every architectural detail , the gradual change of taste that had transformed the machicolations of [the mediaeval fighter]3795-the mediaeval fighter into the open cortiles and airy balconies of [[his]234-odo descendant]3796-his descendant . Here and there , amid these inveterate records of dominion , rose the monuments of [a mightier and more ancient power]3797-a mightier and more ancient power . Of [these churches]3798-these churches and [monasteries]1872-monasteries the greater number , dating only from the ascendancy of [the Valseccas]421-the valseccas , showed an ordered and sumptuous architecture ; but [one or two buildings]3800-one or two buildings surviving from the period of [the free city]3801-the free city stood out among [them]3794-noble residences with the austerity of [desert saints in a throng of court ecclesiastics]3802-desert saints in a throng of court ecclesiastics . The columns of [the Cathedral porch]3803-the cathedral porch were still supported on featureless porphyry lions worn smooth by [generations of loungers]3804-generations of loungers ; and above [the octagonal baptistery]3805-the octagonal baptistery ran a fantastic basrelief wherein the spirals of the vine framed an allegory of [men]8356-men and monsters symbolising , in [their]3794-noble residences mysterious conflicts , the ever - recurring Manicheism of the middle ages . Fresh from [his]234-odo talk with [Crescenti]234-odo , [Odo]234-odo lingered curiously on these sculptures , which but the day before [he]234-odo might have passed by as the efforts of [ignorant workmen]3807-ignorant workmen , but which now seemed full of the significance that belongs to any incomplete expression of human thought or feeling . Of their relation to the growth of art [he]234-odo had as yet no clear notion ; but as evidence of sensations that [[his]234-odo forefathers]3808-his forefathers had struggled to record , [they]3794-noble residences touched [him]234-odo like the inarticulate stammerings in which childhood strives to convey its meaning . [He]234-odo found [Gamba]282-gamba 's lodging on [the upper floor of [a decayed palace]3810-a decayed palace]3809-the upper floor of a decayed palace in [one of [the by - lanes near [the Cathedral]3023-the cathedral]3812-the by - lanes near the cathedral]3811-one of the by - lanes near the cathedral . The pointed arcades of [this ancient building]3814-this ancient building enclosed the remains of floriated mouldings , and the walls of [the court]814-the court showed traces of fresco - painting ; but clothes - lines now hung between the arches , and about the well - head in the centre of [the court]814-the court sat [a group of tattered women with [half - naked children]3818-half - naked children playing in the dirt at [their]3817-a group of tattered women with half - naked children playing in the dirt at their feet feet]3817-a group of tattered women with half - naked children playing in the dirt at their feet . [One of [these women]3820-these women]3819-one of these women directed [Odo]234-odo to [the staircase which ascended between damp stone walls to [Gamba]282-gamba 's door]3821-the staircase which ascended between damp stone walls to gamba 's door . This was opened by [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback [himself]8158-the hunchback , who , with an astonished exclamation , admitted [[his]8158-the hunchback visitor]1440-his visitor to [a scantily furnished room littered with books and papers]3824-a scantily furnished room littered with books and papers . [A child]1186-a child sprawled on the floor , and [a young woman , who had been sewing in the fading light of the attic window]3826-a young woman , who had been sewing in the fading light of the attic window , snatched [him]1186-a child up as [Odo]234-odo entered . [Her]3826-a young woman , who had been sewing in the fading light of the attic window back being turned to the light , [he]234-odo caught only a slender youthful outline ; but something in the turn of the head , the shrinking curve of the shoulders , carried [him]234-odo back to the little barefoot figure cowering in [a corner of [the kitchen]569-the kitchen at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]3827-a corner of the kitchen at pontesordo , while [the farm - yard]3407-the farm - yard rang with [Filomena]229-filomena 's call--"Where are [you]3826-a young woman , who had been sewing in the fading light of the attic window then , [child of iniquity]8217-child of iniquity ? "[229-filomena] " [Momola]241-momola -- don't [you]241-momola know [me]234-odo ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo exclaimed . [She]3826-a young woman , who had been sewing in the fading light of the attic window hung back trembling , as though the sound of [his]234-odo voice roused an echo of fear ; but [Gamba]282-gamba , reddening slightly , took [her]3826-a young woman , who had been sewing in the fading light of the attic window hand and led [her]3826-a young woman , who had been sewing in the fading light of the attic window forward . " It is , indeed , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " [[[your]9142-your excellency]8157-your excellency 's old playmate , [the Momola of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]241-momola , who consents to share [my]234-odo poverty and who makes [me]234-odo forget it by the tenderness of [her]241-momola devotion]9144-your excellency 's old playmate , the momola of pontesordo , who consents to share my poverty and who makes me forget it by the tenderness of her devotion . "[234-odo] But [Momola]241-momola , at this , found voice . " Oh , [sir]8257-sir , "[241-momola] [she]241-momola cried , " it is [he]8257-sir who took [me]241-momola in when [I]241-momola was half - dead and starving , who many a time went hungry to feed [me]241-momola , and who cares for [the child]686-the child as if it were [his]686-the child own ! "[241-momola] As [she]241-momola stood there , in [her]241-momola half - wild hollowed - eyed beauty , which seemed a sickly efflorescence of [the marshes]3363-the marshes , pressing to [her]241-momola breast another " child of iniquity "[241-momola] as pale and elfish as [her]241-momola former self , [she]241-momola seemed to [Odo]234-odo the embodiment of ancient wrongs , risen from the wasted soil to haunt the dreams of [[its]3831-its oppressors]3832-its oppressors . [Gamba]282-gamba shrugged [his]282-gamba shoulders . " Why , "[282-gamba] said [he]282-gamba , " [a child of [my]282-gamba own]9147-a child of my own is a luxury [I]282-gamba am never likely to possess as long as [I]282-gamba have wit to remember the fundamental axiom of philosophy : entia non sunt multiplicanda praeter necessitatum ; so it is natural enough fate should single [me]282-gamba out to repair the negligence of [those who have failed to observe that admirable principle]9148-those who have failed to observe that admirable principle . " [They]9148-those who have failed to observe that admirable principle seemed unwilling to speak of [her]241-momola . What is [her]241-momola story and where did [you]282-gamba first know [her]241-momola ? "[282-gamba] [Gamba]282-gamba 's face darkened . " [You]282-gamba will remember , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[282-gamba] [he]282-gamba said , " that some time after [your]282-gamba departure from [Pianura]4-pianura [I]282-gamba passed into the service of [the Marquess of Cerveno]8288-the marquess of cerveno , then [a youth of about twenty , who combined with graceful manners and a fair exterior a nature so corrupt and cowardly]9152-a youth of about twenty , who combined with graceful manners and a fair exterior a nature so corrupt and cowardly that [he]8288-the marquess of cerveno seemed like some such noble edifice as this , designed to house great hopes and high ambitions , but fallen to base uses and become the shelter of [thieves and prostitutes]9153-thieves and prostitutes . [Prince Ferrante]414-prince ferrante being sickly from [his]414-prince ferrante birth , [the Marquess]1107-the marquess was always looked on as [[the Duke]682-the duke 's successor]9156-the duke 's successor , and to [Trescorre]254-trescorre , who even then , as [Master of the Horse]1314-master of the horse , cherished the ambitions [he]254-trescorre has since realised , no prospect could have been more distasteful . [[My]282-gamba noble brother]9158-my noble brother , to do [him]254-trescorre justice , has always hated [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits , who , as [you]282-gamba doubtless know , were all - powerful here before the recent suppression of [the Order]9160-the order . [The Marquess of [Cerveno]394-cerveno]8288-the marquess of cerveno was as completely under [their]2221-the jesuits control as [the Duke]682-the duke is under that of [the Dominicans]422-the dominicans , and [Trescorre]254-trescorre knew that with [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's accession [his]254-trescorre own rule must end . [He]254-trescorre did [his]254-trescorre best to gain an influence over [[his]254-trescorre future ruler]9164-his future ruler , but failing in this resolved to ruin [him]254-trescorre . "[282-gamba] [Cerveno]394-cerveno , like all [[your]3833-your house]3834-your house , was passionately addicted to the chase , and spent much time hunting in [the forest of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]3835-the forest of pontesordo . One day the stag was brought to bay in [the farm - yard of [the old manor]3837-the old manor]3836-the farm - yard of the old manor , and there [Cerveno]394-cerveno saw [Momola]241-momola , then [a girl of sixteen , of a singular wild beauty which sickness and trouble have since effaced]3838-a girl of sixteen , of a singular wild beauty which sickness and trouble have since effaced . [The young Marquess]3839-the young marquess was instantly taken ; and though hitherto indifferent to [women]771-women , yielded so completely to [his]3839-the young marquess infatuation that [Trescorre]254-trescorre , ever on the alert , saw in it an unexpected means to [his]3839-the young marquess end . [He]3839-the young marquess instantly married [Momola]241-momola to [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo , whom [she]241-momola feared and hated ; [he]3839-the young marquess schooled [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo in the part of [the jealous and vindictive husband]3841-the jealous and vindictive husband , and by the liberal use of money contrived that [Momola]241-momola , while suffered to encourage [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's addresses , should be kept so close that [Cerveno]394-cerveno could not see [her]241-momola save by coming to [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . This was the first step in the plan ; the next was to arrange that [Momola]241-momola should lure [[her]241-momola lover]2846-her lover to [the hunting - lodge on [the edge of the chase]3845-the edge of the chase]8295-the hunting - lodge on the edge of the chase . [This lodge]3846-this lodge , as [[your]3847-your excellency]8157-your excellency may remember , lies level with [the marsh]724-the marsh , and so open to noxious exhalations that a night 's sojourn there may be fatal . The infernal scheme was carried out with the connivance of [the scoundrels at [the farm]565-the farm , who had no scruples about selling [the girl]2319-the girl for a few ducats]3850-the scoundrels at the farm , who had no scruples about selling the girl for a few ducats ; and as to [Momola]241-momola , can [you]3847-your wonder that [her]241-momola loathing of [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo and of [her]241-momola wretched life at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo threw [her]241-momola defenceless into [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's toils ? All was cunningly planned to exasperate [Cerveno]394-cerveno 's passion and [Momola]241-momola 's longing to escape ; and at length , pressed by [his]254-trescorre entreaties and innocently carrying out the designs of [[his]254-trescorre foe]3853-his foe , [the poor girl]3854-the poor girl promised to meet [him]254-trescorre after night - fall at [the hunting - lodge]3855-the hunting - lodge . The secrecy of the adventure , and the peril to which it exposed [him]254-trescorre ( for [Trescorre]254-trescorre had taken care to paint [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo and [[his]254-trescorre father]667-his father in the darkest colours ) were fuel to [Cerveno]394-cerveno 's passion , and [he]254-trescorre went night after night to [Pontesordo]241-momola . The time was August , when [the marsh]724-the marsh breathes death , and [the Duke]682-the duke , apprised of [his]682-the duke favourite 's imprudence , forbade [his]682-the duke returning to the chase . " Nothing could better have served [Trescorre]254-trescorre ; for opposition spurred [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's languid temper , and [he]254-trescorre had now the incredible folly to take up [his]254-trescorre residence in [the lodge]9166-the lodge . Within three weeks the fever held [him]254-trescorre . [He]254-trescorre was at once taken to [Pianura]4-pianura , and on recovering from [his]254-trescorre seizure was sent to take the mountain air at [the baths of [Lucca]19-lucca]1321-the baths of lucca . But the poison was in [his]254-trescorre blood . [He]254-trescorre never regained more than a semblance of health , and [his]254-trescorre madness having run its course , [his]254-trescorre passion for [Momola]241-momola turned to hate of [the poor girl to whom [he]254-trescorre ascribed [his]254-trescorre destruction]9168-the poor girl to whom he ascribed his destruction . [Giannozzo]237-giannozzo , meanwhile , terrified by the report that [the Duke]682-the duke had winded the intrigue , and fearing to be charged with connivance , thought to prove [his]254-trescorre innocence by casting off [[his]254-trescorre wife]1713-his wife and disowning [[her]1713-his wife child]9171-her child . "[682-the duke] What part [I]0-i played in this grim business [I]0-i leave [[your]3859-your excellency]8157-your excellency to conceive . As [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's creature [I]0-i was forced to assist at the spectacle without power to stay its consequences ; but when [the child]686-the child was born [I]0-i carried the news to [[my]0-i master]3863-my master and begged [him]3863-my master to come to [the mother]584-the mother 's aid . For answer , [he]3863-my master had [me]0-i beaten by [his]3863-my master lacqueys and flung out of [[his]3863-my master house]1355-his house . [I]0-i stomached the beating and addressed [myself]0-i to [Trescorre]254-trescorre . [[My]0-i noble brother]9158-my noble brother , whose insight is seldom at fault , saw that [I]0-i knew enough to imperil [him]3863-my master . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess was dying and [[his]1107-the marquess enemy]3868-his enemy could afford to be generous . [He]1107-the marquess gave [me]0-i a little money and the following year obtained from [the Duke]682-the duke [my]0-i appointment as [assistant librarian]3870-assistant librarian . In this way [I]0-i was able to give [Momola]241-momola a [home]1346-home , and to save [[her]241-momola child]9171-her child from [the Innocenti]423-the innocenti . [She]241-momola and [I]0-i , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , are [the misshapen offspring of [that cruel foster - parent]3875-that cruel foster - parent , who rears more than half the malefactors in [the state]2921-the state]3874-the misshapen offspring of that cruel foster - parent , who rears more than half the malefactors in the state ; but please heaven [the boy]839-the boy shall have a better start in life , and perhaps grow up to destroy some of the evils on which that cursed charity thrives . " This narrative , and the sight of [Momola]241-momola and [[her]241-momola child]9171-her child , followed so strangely on the spectacle of sordid misery [he]3875-that cruel foster - parent had witnessed at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo , that an inarticulate pity held [Odo]234-odo by the throat . [Gamba]282-gamba 's anger against [the people at [the farm]565-the farm]9173-the people at the farm seemed as senseless as [their]9173-the people at the farm own cruelty to [their]9173-the people at the farm animals . What were [they]9173-the people at the farm all -- [Momola]241-momola , [[her]241-momola child]9171-her child , and [[her]241-momola persecutors]9176-her persecutors -- but a sickly growth of the decaying social order ? [He]0-i felt an almost physical longing for fresh air , light , the rush of a purifying wind through the atmosphere of moral darkness that surrounded [him]0-i . 2.12 . To relieve the tension of [his]0-i thoughts [he]0-i set forth to [Gamba]282-gamba the purpose of [his]0-i visit . "[0-i] [I]0-i am , " said [he]0-i , "[0-i] much like [a stranger at a masked ball]3878-a stranger at a masked ball , where all the masks are acquainted with [each other]3086-each other 's disguises and concerted to mystify [the visitor]3880-the visitor . Among [the persons [I]0-i have met at court]3881-the persons i have met at court several have shown [themselves]3881-the persons i have met at court ready to guide [me]0-i through this labyrinth ; but , till [they]3881-the persons i have met at court [themselves]3881-the persons i have met at court unmask and declare [[their]3881-the persons i have met at court true characters]3882-their true characters , [I]0-i am doubtful whither [they]3881-the persons i have met at court may lead [me]0-i ; nor do [I]0-i know of any so well fitted as [yourself]3883-you to give [me]0-i a clue to [my]0-i surroundings . As for [my]0-i own disguise , " [he]0-i added with a smile , "[0-i] [I]0-i believe [I]0-i removed it sufficiently on [our]3884-our first meeting to leave [you]3883-you no doubt as to the use to which [your]3883-you information will be put . " [Gamba]282-gamba , who seemed touched by this appeal , nevertheless hesitated before replying . At length [he]282-gamba said : "[0-i] [I]0-i have the fullest trust in [[your]3883-you excellency]8157-your excellency 's honour ; but [I]0-i must remind [you]3883-you that during [your]3883-you stay [here]8091-here [you]3883-you will be under the closest observation and that any opinions [you]3883-you express will at once be attributed to [the persons [you]3883-you are known to frequent]3887-the persons you are known to frequent . [I]0-i would not , " [he]0-i continued hastily , "[0-i] say this for [myself]0-i alone , but [I]0-i have two mouths to feed and [my]0-i views are already under suspicion . " Reassured by [Odo]234-odo 's protestations , or rather , perhaps , by the more convincing warrant of [his]234-odo look and manner , [Gamba]282-gamba proceeded to give [him]234-odo a detailed description of the little world in which chance had placed [them]3890-them . "[3883-you] If [you]3883-you have seen [the Duke]682-the duke , " said [he]0-i , "[3883-you] [I]0-i need not tell [you]3883-you that it is not [he]682-the duke who governs [the duchy]1310-the duchy . [We]3890-them are ruled at present by [a triumvirate consisting of [the Belverde]389-the belverde , [the Dominican]3738-the dominican and [Trescorre]254-trescorre]3891-a triumvirate consisting of the belverde , the dominican and trescorre . [Pievepelago]416-pievepelago , [the Prime Minister]815-the prime minister , is a dummy put in place by [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits and kept there by [the rivalries of [the other three]3896-the other three]3895-the rivalries of the other three ; but [he]815-the prime minister is in [his]815-the prime minister dotage and [the courtiers]3715-the courtiers are already laying wagers as to [[his]815-the prime minister successor]3898-his successor . [Many]3899-many think [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio will replace [him]815-the prime minister , but [I]0-i stake [my]0-i faith on [Trescorre]254-trescorre . [The Duke]682-the duke dislikes [him]254-trescorre , but [he]254-trescorre is popular with [the middle class]2325-the middle class , who , since [they]2325-the middle class have shaken off the yoke of [the Jesuits]336-the jesuits , would not willingly see [an ecclesiastic at the head of [the state]2921-the state]3902-an ecclesiastic at the head of the state . [The duchess]899-the duchess 's influence is also against [the Dominican]3738-the dominican , for [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness , being , as [you]3907-you know , connected with [the Austrian court]3908-the austrian court , is by tradition unfavourable to [the Church party]8954-the church party . [The Duchess]419-duchess 's preferences would weigh little with [the Duke]682-the duke were it not that [she]419-duchess is [sole heiress to [the old Duke of [Monte Alloro]99-monte alloro]3912-the old duke of monte alloro]3911-sole heiress to the old duke of monte alloro , and that any attempt to bring [that principality]3913-that principality under the control of [the Holy See]2918-the holy see might provoke the interference of [Austria]100-austria . " In so ticklish a situation [I]3915-i see none but [Trescorre]254-trescorre to maintain the political balance . [He]254-trescorre has been adroit enough to make [himself]254-trescorre necessary to [the Duchess]899-the duchess without alienating [the Duke]682-the duke ; [he]254-trescorre has introduced one or two trifling reforms that have given [him]254-trescorre a name for liberality in spite of the heavy taxes with which [he]254-trescorre has loaded [the peasantry]8358-the peasantry ; and has in short so played [his]254-trescorre cards as to profit by the foibles of both parties . [[Her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness , "[3915-i] [he]3915-i continued , in reply to a question of [Odo]234-odo 's , " was much taken by [him]3915-i when [she]899-the duchess first came to [Pianura]4-pianura ; and before [her]899-the duchess feeling had cooled [he]3915-i had contrived to make [himself]3915-i indispensable to [her]899-the duchess . [The Duchess]419-duchess is always in debt ; and [Trescorre]254-trescorre , as [Comptroller of Finance]9181-comptroller of finance , holds [her]419-duchess by [her]419-duchess besetting weakness . Before [his]254-trescorre appointment [her]419-duchess extravagance was the scandal of [the town]593-the town . [She]419-duchess borrowed from [[her]419-duchess ladies]9183-her ladies , [her]419-duchess pages , [her]419-duchess very lacqueys ; when [she]419-duchess went on a visit to [[her]419-duchess uncle]9184-her uncle of [Monte Alloro]99-monte alloro [she]419-duchess pocketed the money [he]254-trescorre bestowed on [[her]419-duchess servants]1612-her servants ; nay , [she]419-duchess was even accused of robbing [the Marchioness of Pievepelago]266-the marchioness , who , having worn one evening a diamond necklace which excited [her]419-duchess Highness 's admiration , was waylaid on the way [home]1346-home and the jewels torn from [her]419-duchess neck by [a crowd of masked ruffians among whom [she]419-duchess is said to have recognised one of [the ducal servants]9188-the ducal servants]9187-a crowd of masked ruffians among whom she is said to have recognised one of the ducal servants . These are doubtless idle reports ; but it is certain that [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's appointment engaged [him]254-trescorre still more to [the Duchess]899-the duchess by enabling [him]254-trescorre to protect [her]899-the duchess from such calumnies ; while by increasing the land taxes [he]254-trescorre has discharged the worst of [her]899-the duchess debts and thus made [himself]254-trescorre popular with [the tradesmen [she]899-the duchess had ruined]9190-the tradesmen she had ruined . [[Your]9191-your excellency]8157-your excellency must excuse [my]3915-i attempting to paint the private character of [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness . Such facts as [I]3915-i have reported are of public notoriety , but to exceed them would be an unwarranted presumption . [I]3915-i know [she]899-the duchess has the name of being affable to [[her]899-the duchess dependents]9194-her dependents , capable of a fitful generosity , and easily moved by distress ; and it is certain that [her]899-the duchess domestic situation has been one to excite pity and disarm criticism . "[3915-i] With regard to [[his]3916-his Highness]941-his highness , it is difficult either to detect [his]3916-his motives or to divine [his]3916-his preferences . [His]3916-his youth was spent in pious practices ; and a curious reason is given for the origin of this habit . [He]3916-his was educated , as [[your]3918-your excellency]8157-your excellency is doubtless aware , by [a French philosopher of the school of [Hobbes]425-hobbes]3920-a french philosopher of the school of hobbes ; and it is said that in the interval of [his]3916-his tasks [the poor Duke]3921-the poor duke , bewildered by [[his]3916-his governor]1208-his governor 's distinctions between conception and cognition , and the object and [the sentient]3923-the sentient , used to spend [his]3916-his time praying [the saints]1218-the saints to assist [him]3916-his in [his]3916-his atheistical studies ; indeed a satire of the day ascribes [him]3916-his as making a novena to [the Virgin]3925-the virgin to obtain a clearer understanding of the universality of matter . Others with more likelihood aver that [he]3916-his frequented [the churches]2240-the churches to escape from the tyranny of [[his]3916-his pedagogue]3927-his pedagogue ; and it is certain that from one cause or another [his]3916-his education threw [him]3916-his into the opposite extreme of a superstitious and mechanical piety . [His]3916-his marriage , [his]3916-his differences with [the Duchess]899-the duchess , and the evil influence of [Cerveno]394-cerveno , exposed [him]3916-his to new temptations , and for a time [he]3916-his led a life which seemed to justify the worst charges of [the enemies of materialism]3929-the enemies of materialism . Recent events have flung [him]3916-his back on the exaggerated devotion of [his]3916-his youth , and now , when [his]3916-his health permits , [he]3916-his spends [his]3916-his time serving mass , singing in the choir at benediction and making pilgrimages to the relics of [the saints in [the different churches of [the duchy]1310-the duchy]3931-the different churches of the duchy]3930-the saints in the different churches of the duchy . " A few years since , at the instigation of [[his]3916-his confessor]2233-his confessor , [he]3916-his destroyed every picture in [the ducal gallery]9196-the ducal gallery that contained any naked figure or represented any subject offensive to religion . Among [them]9197-them was [Titian]426-titian 's famous portrait of [[Duke Ascanio]399-ascanio 's mistress]9198-duke ascanio 's mistress , known as [[the Goldsmith]9199-the goldsmith 's Daughter]9200-the goldsmith 's daughter , and a Venus by the Venetian painter [Giorgione]427-giorgione , so highly esteemed in its day that [Pope Leo X.]402-leo x. is said to have offered in exchange for it the gift of a papal benefice , and [a Cardinal]9201-a cardinal 's hat for [[Duke Guidobaldo]428-duke guidobaldo 's younger son]9202-duke guidobaldo 's younger son . [[His]3916-his Highness]941-his highness , moreover , impedes the administration of justice by resisting all attempts to restrict [the Church]1212-the church 's right of sanctuary , and upholds the decree forbidding [[his]3916-his subjects]8419-his subjects to study at [the University of [Pavia]12-pavia]101-the university of pavia , where , as [you]9206-you know , the natural sciences are professed by [the ablest scholars of [Italy]5-italy]9207-the ablest scholars of italy . [He]3916-his allows no public duties to interfere with [his]3916-his private devotions , and whatever the urgency of affairs , gives no audience to [[his]3916-his ministers]8730-his ministers on holydays ; and [a Cardinal a latere recently passing through [the duchy]1310-the duchy on [his]9209-a cardinal a latere recently passing through the duchy on his return to rome return to [Rome]11-rome]9209-a cardinal a latere recently passing through the duchy on his return to rome was not received at [the Duke]682-the duke 's table because [he]9209-a cardinal a latere recently passing through the duchy on his return to rome chanced to arrive on a Friday . "[3933-his] [[His]3933-his Highness]941-his highness 's fears for [Prince Ferrante]414-prince ferrante 's health have drawn a swarm of quacks to [Pianura]4-pianura , and the influence of [the Church]1212-the church is sometimes counteracted by that of [the physicians with whom [the Duke]682-the duke surrounds [himself]682-the duke]3936-the physicians with whom the duke surrounds himself . The latest of these , [the famous Count Heiligenstern , who is said to have performed some remarkable cures by means of the electrical fluid and of animal magnetism]3938-the famous count heiligenstern , who is said to have performed some remarkable cures by means of the electrical fluid and of animal magnetism , has gained such an ascendancy over [the Duke]682-the duke that [some]3940-some suspect [him]3938-the famous count heiligenstern , who is said to have performed some remarkable cures by means of the electrical fluid and of animal magnetism of being [an agent of [the Austrian court]3908-the austrian court]3941-an agent of the austrian court , while [others]1388-others declare that [he]3938-the famous count heiligenstern , who is said to have performed some remarkable cures by means of the electrical fluid and of animal magnetism is [a Jesuit en robe courte]3944-a jesuit en robe courte . But just at present [the people]1003-the people scent [a Jesuit under every habit]3946-a jesuit under every habit , and it is even rumoured that [the Belverde]389-the belverde is secretly affiliated to [a female branch of the Society]3947-a female branch of the society . With [such a sovereign]3948-such a sovereign and [such ministers]3949-such ministers , [[your]3950-your excellency]8157-your excellency need not be told how [the state]2921-the state is governed . [Trescorre]254-trescorre , heaven save the mark ! represents [the liberal party]3953-the liberal party ; but [his]254-trescorre liberalism is like the generosity of [the unarmed traveller who throws [his]3954-the unarmed traveller who throws his purse to a foot - pad purse to a foot - pad]3954-the unarmed traveller who throws his purse to a foot - pad ; and [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio is at hand to see that [the people]1003-the people are not bettered at the expense of [the Church]72-the church . " As to [the Duke]682-the duke , having no settled policy , and being governed only through [his]682-the duke fears , [he]682-the duke leans first to one influence and then to another ; but since the suppression of [the Jesuits]336-the jesuits nothing can induce [him]682-the duke to attack any ecclesiastical privileges . [The diocese of Pianura]9213-the diocese of pianura holds a fief known as [the Caccia del Vescovo]9214-the caccia del vescovo , long noted as [the most lawless district of [the duchy]1310-the duchy]9215-the most lawless district of the duchy . Before the death of [the late Pope]9217-the late pope , [Trescorre]254-trescorre had prevailed on [the Duke]682-the duke to annex [it]9214-the caccia del vescovo to [the principality]9219-the principality ; but the dreadful fate of [Ganganelli]429-ganganelli has checked [bolder sovereigns]9220-bolder sovereigns than [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness in [their]9220-bolder sovereigns attempts on the immunities of the Church , and one of [the fairest regions of [our]9223-our unhappy state]9222-the fairest regions of our unhappy state remains a barren waste , the lair of [outlaws]9224-outlaws and [assassins]9225-assassins , and a menace to [the surrounding country]9226-the surrounding country . [[His]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness is not incapable of generous impulses and [his]682-the duke occasional acts of humanity might endear [him]682-the duke to [[his]682-the duke people]1264-his people were it not that [they]1264-his people despise [him]682-the duke for being [the creature of [[his]682-the duke favourites]9230-his favourites]9229-the creature of his favourites . Thus , the gift of [Boscofolto]430-boscofolto to [the Belverde]389-the belverde has excited the bitterest discontent ; for [the Countess]1915-the countess is notorious for [her]1915-the countess cruel exactions , and it is certain that at [her]1915-the countess death this rich fief will revert to [the Church]1212-the church . And now , "[282-gamba] [Gamba]282-gamba ended with a smile , " [I]282-gamba have made known to [[your]9233-your excellency]8157-your excellency the chief characters in the masque , as rumour depicts [them]1264-his people to the vulgar . As to the court , like [the government]2558-the government , it is divided into two parties : [the Duke]682-the duke 's , headed by [the Belverde]389-the belverde , and containing [the staider and more conservative members of the Church and nobility]9237-the staider and more conservative members of the church and nobility ; and [the Duchess]419-duchess 's , composed of [every fribble and flatterer]9238-every fribble and flatterer , [every gamester and rake]9239-every gamester and rake , [every intriguing woman]9240-every intriguing woman and [vulgar parvenu that can worm a way into [her]419-duchess favour]9241-vulgar parvenu that can worm a way into her favour . In such an atmosphere [you]9233-your may fancy how knowledge thrives . [[The Duke]682-the duke 's library]3758-the duke 's library consists of a few volumes of theological casuistry , and [[her]419-duchess Highness]8209-her highness never opens a book unless it be to scandalise [[her]8209-her highness husband]1112-her husband by reading some prohibited pamphlet from [France]22-france . [The University]102-the university , since the fall of [the Jesuits]336-the jesuits , has been in charge of the Barnabite order , and , for aught [I]282-gamba know , the Ptolemaic system is still taught [there]606-there , together with the dialectic of [Aristotle]431-aristotle . As to science , it is anathema ; and the press being subject to the restrictions of the Holy Office , and [the University]9247-the university closed to modern thought , but [few scholars]9248-few scholars are to be found in [the duchy]1310-the duchy , save [those who occupy [themselves]9250-those who occupy themselves with belles - lettres with belles - lettres]9250-those who occupy themselves with belles - lettres , or , like [the abate Crescenti]9251-the abate crescenti , are engaged in historical research . [Pianura]4-pianura , even in the late Duke 's day , had [its circle of lettered noblemen who patronised the arts and founded [the local Arcadia]2211-the local arcadia]9252-its circle of lettered noblemen who patronised the arts and founded the local arcadia ; but such pursuits are out of fashion , [the Arcadia]432-the arcadia languishes , and [the Bishop of [Pianura]4-pianura]8318-the bishop of pianura is the only dignitary that still plays [the Mecaenas]103-the mecaenas . [[His]1112-her husband lordship]8266-his lordship , whose theological laxity and coolness toward the Holy Office have put [him]1112-her husband out of favour with [the Duke]682-the duke , has , [I]282-gamba am told , a fine cabinet of paintings ( some of them , it is rumoured , the very pictures that [[his]1112-her husband Highness]941-his highness ordered to be burnt ) and [the episcopal palace]3235-the episcopal palace swarms with rhyming abatini , [fashionable playwrights]9259-fashionable playwrights and [musicians]1661-musicians , and [the travelling archeologists who hawk [their]9261-the travelling archeologists who hawk their antiques about from one court to another antiques about from [one court]9262-one court to another]9261-the travelling archeologists who hawk their antiques about from one court to another . Here [you]9263-you may assist at interminable disputes as to the relative merits of [Tasso]380-tasso and [Ariosto]308-ariosto , or listen to a learned dissertation on the verse engraved on a carnelian stone ; but as to the questions now agitating [the world]844-the world , they are held of less account than a problem in counterpoint or the construction of a doubtful line in [Ovid]433-ovid . As long as Truth goes naked [she]941-his highness can scarce hope to be received in good company ; and [her]941-his highness appearance would probably cause as much confusion among [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's literati]9266-the bishop 's literati as in the councils of the Holy Office . "[282-gamba] The old analogy likening the human mind to an imperfect mirror , which modifies the images it reflects , occurred more than once to [Odo]234-odo during the hunchback 's lively delineation . It was impossible not to remember that [the speaker]2090-the speaker owed [his]2090-the speaker education to the charity of the order [he]2090-the speaker denounced ; and this fact suggested to [Odo]234-odo that the other lights and shadows in the picture might be disposed with more art than accuracy . Still , they doubtless embodied a negative truth , and [Odo]234-odo thought it probable that such intellectual diversion as [he]234-odo could hope for must be sought in [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's circle]3958-the bishop 's circle . It was two days later that [he]234-odo first beheld [that prelate]3959-that prelate , heading the ducal pilgrimage to [the shrine of [the mountain Virgin]3961-the mountain virgin]3960-the shrine of the mountain virgin . The day had opened with a confused flight of chimes from [every bell - tower in [Pianura]4-pianura]3962-every bell - tower in pianura , as though a migratory flock of notes had settled for a moment on [the roofs and steeples of [the city]2261-the city]3963-the roofs and steeples of the city . [The ducal party]3965-the ducal party set forth early from [the palace]768-the palace , but [the streets]744-the streets were already spanned with arches and garlands of foliage , tapestries and religious paintings decked the facades of [the wealthier houses]3968-the wealthier houses , and at [every street - shrine]3969-every street - shrine a cluster of candle - flames hovered like yellow butterflies above the freshly - gathered flowers . The windows were packed with [spectators]3970-spectators , and [the crowds who intended to accompany the pilgrimage]3971-the crowds who intended to accompany the pilgrimage were already gathering , with [their]3971-the crowds who intended to accompany the pilgrimage painted and gilt candles , from [every corner of [the town]593-the town]3972-every corner of the town . [Each church]3974-each church and monastery door poured forth [[its]3974-each church [priests]3779-priests]3975-its priests or [friars]3977-friars to swell the line , and [the various lay confraternities]3978-the various lay confraternities , issuing in [their]3978-the various lay confraternities distinctive dress from [[their]3978-the various lay confraternities " lodges "[3978-the various lay confraternities] or assembly - rooms]3979-their " lodges " or assembly - rooms , formed a link between the secular and religious divisions of the procession . [The market - place]3020-the market - place was strewn with sand and sweet herbs ; and here , on the doorsteps of [the Cathedral]3023-the cathedral , between the featureless porphyry lions , [the Bishop]1234-the bishop waited with [his]1234-the bishop red - robed chapter , and [the deacons]3983-the deacons carrying the painted banners of [the diocese]3984-the diocese . Seen thus , with the cloth - of - gold dalmatic above [his]1234-the bishop pontifical tunic , the mitre surmounting [his]1234-the bishop clear - cut impassive face , and the crozier held aloft in [his]1234-the bishop jewelled gloves , [he]1234-the bishop might have stood for a chryselephantine divinity in [the porch of [some pagan temple]3986-some pagan temple]3985-the porch of some pagan temple . [Odo]234-odo , riding beside [the Duke]682-the duke 's litter , had leisure to note not only the diverse features of the procession but their varying effect on [the spectators]1642-the spectators . It was plain that , as [Trescorre]254-trescorre had said , the pilgrimage was popular with [the people]1003-the people . That imaginative sensuousness which has perpetually renewed [the Latin Church]3990-the latin church by giving form and colour to [her]3990-the latin church dogmatic abstractions , by transforming every successive phase of [her]3990-the latin church belief into something to be seen and handled , found an irresistible outlet in a ceremony that seemed to combine with its devotional intent a secret element of expiation . [The little prince]3148-the little prince was dimly felt to be paying for the prodigality of [[his]3148-the little prince fathers]3992-his fathers , to be in some way a link of suffering between the tongue - tied misery of [the fields]3993-the fields and the insolent splendour of [the court]814-the court ; and a vague faith in the vicarious efficacy of [his]3148-the little prince devotion drew [the crowd]1568-the crowd into momentary sympathy with [its rulers]3996-its rulers . Yet this was but an underlying element in the instinctive delight of [the people]1003-the people in the outward forms of [their]1003-the people religion . [Odo]234-odo 's late experiences had wakened [him]234-odo to the influences acting on that obscure substratum of human life that still seemed , to [most men of [his]234-odo rank]3998-most men of his rank , of no more account than the brick lining of [[their]3998-most men of his rank marble - coated palaces]3999-their marble - coated palaces . As [he]234-odo watched the mounting excitement of [the throng]1596-the throng , and pictured to [himself]234-odo the lives suddenly lit up by this pledge of unseen promises , [he]234-odo wondered that [the enemies of [the Church]1212-the church]2207-the enemies of the church should ascribe [her]1212-the church predominance to any cause but the natural needs of the heart . [The people]1003-the people lived in [unlit hovels]4004-unlit hovels , for there was a tax on mental as well as on material windows ; but here was a light that could pierce the narrowest crevice and scatter the darkness with a single ray . [Odo]234-odo noted with equal interest the impression produced by [the various members of the court]4005-the various members of the court and [the Church dignitaries]4006-the church dignitaries . [The Duke]682-the duke 's litter was coldly received , but a pitying murmur widened about the gilt chair in which [Prince Ferrante]414-prince ferrante was seated at [[his]414-prince ferrante governor]1208-his governor 's side , and the approach of [Trescorre]254-trescorre , mounted on a fine horse and dressed with [his]254-trescorre usual sober elegance , woke a shout that made [him]254-trescorre for a moment [the central figure of the procession]4009-the central figure of the procession . [The Bishop]1234-the bishop was none too warmly welcomed ; but when [Crescenti]234-odo appeared , white - haired and erect among [the parish priests]4011-the parish priests , [the crowd]1568-the crowd swayed toward [him]234-odo like grasses in the suction of a current ; and [one of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's gentlemen]911-the duke 's gentlemen]3558-one of the duke 's gentlemen , seeing [Odo]234-odo 's surprise , said with a smile : " [No one]725-no one does more good in [Pianura]4-pianura than [[our]9268-our learned librarian]9269-our learned librarian . "[3558-one of the duke 's gentlemen] A different and still more striking welcome awaited [the Duchess]899-the duchess , who presently appeared on [her]899-the duchess favourite white hackney , surrounded by [the members of [her]899-the duchess household]4017-the members of her household . [Her]899-the duchess reluctance to take part in the pilgrimage had been overcome by the exhilaration of showing [herself]899-the duchess to [the public]4018-the public , and as [she]899-the duchess rode along in [her]899-the duchess gold - embroidered habit and plumed hat [she]899-the duchess was just such an image of radiant and indulgent sovereignty as turns enforced submission into a romantic allegiance . [Her]899-the duchess flushing cheek and kindled eye showed the reaction of the effect [she]899-the duchess produced , and if [[her]899-the duchess subjects]4019-her subjects forgot [her]899-the duchess debts , [her]899-the duchess violences and follies , [she]899-the duchess was perhaps momentarily transformed into the being [their]4019-her subjects enthusiasm created . [She]899-the duchess was at any rate keenly alive to the admiration [she]899-the duchess excited and eager to enhance it by those showy impulses of benevolence that catch the public eye ; as when , at the city gates , [she]899-the duchess stopped [her]899-the duchess horse to intervene in behalf of [a soldier who had been put under arrest for some slight infraction of duty]4020-a soldier who had been put under arrest for some slight infraction of duty , and then rode on enveloped in the passionate shouting of [the crowd]1568-the crowd . [The shrine at which [the young prince]8661-the young prince was to pay [his]8661-the young prince devotions]4022-the shrine at which the young prince was to pay his devotions stood just beyond [the city]2261-the city , on the summit of one of [the low knolls which pass for hills in [the level landscape of [Pianura]4-pianura]4026-the level landscape of pianura]4025-the low knolls which pass for hills in the level landscape of pianura . [The white - columned church with [its]4027-the white - columned church with its classical dome and portico classical dome and portico]4027-the white - columned church with its classical dome and portico had been erected as a thank - offering after the plague of 1630 , and [the nave]4028-the nave was lined with life - sized votive figures of [Dukes]642-dukes and Duchesses clad in the actual wigs and robes that had dressed [their]4019-her subjects transient grandeur . As the procession wound into [the church]1212-the church , to the ringing of bells and the chanting of the choir , [Odo]234-odo was struck by the spectacle of [that line of witnesses]4031-that line of witnesses , watching in glassy - eyed irony the pomp and display to which [their]4019-her subjects moldering robes and tarnished insignia seemed to fix so brief a term . Once or twice already [he]234-odo had felt the shows of human power as no more than vanishing reflections on the tide of being ; and now , as [he]234-odo knelt near the shrine , with [its]4022-the shrine at which the young prince was to pay his devotions central glitter of jewels and its nimbus of wavering lights , and listened to the reiterated ancient wail : " Mater inviolata , ora pro nobis ! Virgo veneranda , ora pro nobis ! Speculum justitiae , ora pro nobis ! "[434-the mountain madonna] it seemed to [him]234-odo as though the bounds of life and death were merged , and the sumptuous group of which [he]234-odo formed a part already dusted over with oblivion . 2.13 . Spite of [the Mountain Madonna]434-the mountain madonna 's much - vaunted powers , the first effect of the pilgrimage was to provoke a serious indisposition in [the Duke]682-the duke . Exhausted by fasting and emotion , [he]234-odo withdrew to [[his]234-odo apartments]4033-his apartments and for several days denied [himself]234-odo to all but Heiligenstern , who was suspected by some of suffering [[his]234-odo patient]4034-his patient 's disorder to run its course with a view to proving the futility of such remedies . This break in [his]234-odo intercourse with [[his]234-odo kinsman]3528-his kinsman left [Odo]234-odo free to take the measure of [his]234-odo new surroundings . The company most naturally engaging [him]234-odo was that which surrounded [the Duchess]899-the duchess ; but [he]234-odo soon wearied of the trivial diversions it offered . It had ever been necessary to [him]234-odo that [his]234-odo pleasures should touch the imagination as well as the senses ; and with such refinement of enjoyment [the gallants of [Pianura]4-pianura]4037-the gallants of pianura were unacquainted . [Odo]234-odo indeed perceived with a touch of amusement that , in a society where [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto set the pace , [he]234-odo must needs lag behind [his]234-odo own lacquey . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto had , in fact , been hailed by [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's nephew]8265-the bishop 's nephew with a cordiality that proclaimed [them]4040-them [old associates]4041-old associates in folly ; and [the soprano]1599-the soprano 's manner seemed to declare that , if ever [he]234-odo had held the candle for [Don Serafino]267-cantapresto , [he]234-odo did not grudge the grease that might have dropped on [his]234-odo cassock . [He]234-odo was soon [prime favourite]4043-prime favourite and court buffoon in [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's circle , organising pleasure - parties , composing scenarios for [her]899-the duchess Highness 's private theatre , and producing at court any comedian or juggler the report of whose ability reached [him]234-odo from [the market - place]3020-the market - place . Indefatigable in the contriving of such diversions , [he]234-odo soon virtually passed out of [Odo]234-odo 's service into that of [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness : a circumstance which [the young man]2380-the young man the less regretted as it left [him]2380-the young man freer to cultivate the acquaintance of [Gamba]282-gamba and [[his]282-gamba friends]2637-his friends without exposing [them]4049-them to [Cantapresto]3360-cantapresto 's espionage . [Odo]234-odo had felt [himself]234-odo specially drawn toward [the abate Crescenti]9251-the abate crescenti ; and the afternoon after [their]4052-their first meeting [he]234-odo had repaired to [[the librarian]4053-the librarian 's dwelling]4054-the librarian 's dwelling . [Crescenti]234-odo was [the priest of [an ancient parish lying near [the fortress]4057-the fortress]4056-an ancient parish lying near the fortress]4055-the priest of an ancient parish lying near the fortress ; and [[his]234-odo tiny house]4058-his tiny house was wedged in an angle of the city walls , like a bird 's nest in the mouth of a disused canon . A long flight of steps led up to [[his]234-odo study]8527-his study , which on the farther side opened level with a vine - shaded patch of herbs and damask roses in the projection of [a ruined bastion]4060-a ruined bastion . [This interior]4061-this interior , [the home of studious peace]4062-the home of studious peace , was as cheerful and well - ordered as [[its]4061-this interior inmate]4063-its inmate 's mind ; and [Odo]234-odo , seated under the vine pergola in the late summer light , and tasting [the abate 's Val Pulicella]4064-the abate 's val pulicella while [he]234-odo turned over the warped pages of old codes and chronicles , felt the stealing charm of a sequestered life . [He]234-odo had learned from [Gamba]282-gamba that [Crescenti]234-odo was [a faithful parish priest]4065-a faithful parish priest as well as [an assiduous scholar]4066-an assiduous scholar , but [he]234-odo saw that [the librarian]4053-the librarian 's beneficence took that purely personal form which may coexist with a serene acceptance of the general evils underlying particular hardships . [His]234-odo charities were performed in the old unquestioning spirit of the Roman distribution of corn ; and doubtless [the good man who carries [his]4068-the good man who carries his loaf of bread and his word of hope into his neighbour 's hovel loaf of bread and [his]4068-the good man who carries his loaf of bread and his word of hope into his neighbour 's hovel word of hope into [[his]4068-the good man who carries his loaf of bread and his word of hope into his neighbour 's hovel neighbour]2072-his neighbour 's hovel]4068-the good man who carries his loaf of bread and his word of hope into his neighbour 's hovel reaps a more tangible return than [the lonely thinker who schemes to undermine the strongholds of injustice]4070-the lonely thinker who schemes to undermine the strongholds of injustice . Still there was a perplexing contrast between the superficiality of [Crescenti]234-odo 's moral judgments and the breadth and penetration of [his]234-odo historic conceptions . [Odo]234-odo was too inexperienced to reflect that [a man]8112-a man 's sense of the urgency of improvement lies mainly in the line of [his]234-odo talent : as [the merchant]4072-the merchant is persuaded that [the roads]2942-the roads [most in need of mending]4074-most in need of mending are those on which [his]4072-the merchant business makes [him]4072-the merchant travel . [Odo]234-odo [himself]234-odo was already conscious of living in [a many - windowed house]4075-a many - windowed house , with outlooks diverse enough to justify more than one view of [the universe]2402-the universe ; but [he]234-odo had no conception of that concentration of purpose that may make the mind 's flight to its goal as direct and unvarying as the course of a homing bird . The talk turning on [Gamba]282-gamba , [Crescenti]234-odo spoke of the help which the hunchback gave [him]282-gamba in [his]282-gamba work among [the poor]8713-the poor . " [His]282-gamba early hardships , "[282-gamba] said [he]282-gamba , " have given [him]282-gamba an insight into character that [my]282-gamba happier circumstances have denied [me]282-gamba ; and [he]282-gamba has more than once been the means of reclaiming some wretch that [I]282-gamba despaired of . Unhappily , [his]282-gamba parts and learning are beyond [his]282-gamba station , and will not let [him]282-gamba rest in the performance of [his]282-gamba duties . [His]282-gamba mind , [I]282-gamba often tell [him]282-gamba , is like one of [those inn parlours hung with elaborate maps of the three [Heretical Cities]9271-heretical cities]9270-those inn parlours hung with elaborate maps of the three heretical cities ; whereas the only topography with which [the virtuous traveller]9272-the virtuous traveller need be acquainted is that of [the Heavenly City to which all [our]9274-our journeyings]9273-the heavenly city to which all our journeyings should tend . The soundness of [his]282-gamba heart reassures [me]282-gamba as to [this distemper of the reason]9275-this distemper of the reason ; but [others]1388-others are less familiar with [his]282-gamba good qualities and [I]282-gamba tremble for the risks to which [his]282-gamba rashness may expose [him]282-gamba . "[282-gamba] [The librarian]4053-the librarian went on to say that [Gamba]282-gamba had a pretty poetical gift which [he]282-gamba was suspected of employing in the composition of anonymous satires on [the court]814-the court , [the government]2558-the government and [the Church]1212-the church . At that period [every Italian town]4082-every italian town was as full of lampoons as [a marsh of mosquitoes]4083-a marsh of mosquitoes , and it was as difficult in the one case as the other for [the sufferer]1627-the sufferer to detect the specific cause of [his]1627-the sufferer sting . The moment in [Italy]5-italy was a strange one . The tide of reform had been turned back by the very act devised to hasten it : the suppression of [the Society of Jesus]9028-the society of jesus . The shout of liberation that rose over the downfall of [the order]9160-the order had sunk to a guarded whisper . The dark legend already forming around [Ganganelli]429-ganganelli 's death , the hint of that secret liquor distilled for [the order]9160-the order 's use in [a certain convent of [Perugia]104-perugia]4088-a certain convent of perugia , hung like a menace on the political horizon ; and [the disbanded Society]106-the society seemed to have tightened its hold on the public conscience as [a dying man]4089-a dying man 's clutch closes on [[his]4089-a dying man victorious enemy]4090-his victorious enemy . So profoundly had [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits impressed [the world]844-the world with the sense of [their]2221-the jesuits mysterious power that [they]2221-the jesuits were felt to be like one of those animal organisms which , when torn apart , carry on a separate existence in every fragment . [Ganganelli]429-ganganelli 's bull had provided against [their]2221-the jesuits exerting any political influence , or controlling opinion as [confessors]4093-confessors or as [public educators]4094-public educators ; but [they]2221-the jesuits were known to be everywhere in [Italy]5-italy , either hidden in other orders , or acting as [lay agents of [foreign powers]4096-foreign powers]4095-lay agents of foreign powers , as [tutors in private families]4097-tutors in private families , or simply as [secular priests]4098-secular priests . Even the confiscation of [their]2221-the jesuits wealth did not seem to diminish the popular sense of [their]2221-the jesuits strength . Perhaps because that strength had never been completely explained , even by [their]2221-the jesuits immense temporal advantages , it was felt to be latent in [themselves]2221-the jesuits , and somehow capable of withstanding every kind of external assault . [They]2221-the jesuits had moreover benefited by the reaction which always follows on the breaking up of [any great organisation]4099-any great organisation . [[Their]2221-the jesuits detractors]4100-their detractors were already beginning to forget [their]4100-their detractors faults and remember [their]4100-their detractors merits . [The people]1003-the people had been taught to hate [the Society]106-the society as the possessor of wealth and privileges which should have been [theirs]1003-the people ; but when [the Society]8939-the society fell [its]8939-the society possessions were absorbed by the other powers , and in many cases [the people]1003-the people suffered from abuses and maladministration which [they]1003-the people had not known under [[their]1003-the people Jesuit landlords]4104-their jesuit landlords . [The aristocracy]1928-the aristocracy had always been in sympathy with the order , and in [many states]4106-many states [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits had been banished simply as a measure of political expediency , a sop to [the restless masses]4108-the restless masses . In these cases the latent power of [the order]9160-the order was concealed rather than diminished by the pretence of [a more liberal government]4110-a more liberal government , and everywhere , in one form or another , the unseen influence was felt to be on the watch for [those who dared to triumph over it]4111-those who dared to triumph over it too soon . Such conditions fostered the growth of social satire . Constructive ambition was forced back into its old disguises , and ridicule of individual weaknesses replaced the general attack on beliefs and institutions . Satirical poems in manuscript passed from hand to hand in [coffee - houses]4112-coffee - houses , [casinos]4113-casinos and [drawing - rooms]4114-drawing - rooms , and every conspicuous incident in social or political life was borne on a biting quatrain to the confines of [the state]2921-the state . [The Duke]682-the duke 's gift of [Boscofolto]97-boscofolto to [the Countess Belverde]389-the belverde had stirred up a swarm of epigrams , and the most malignant among them , [Crescenti]234-odo averred , were openly ascribed to [Gamba]282-gamba . " A few more imprudences , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo added , " must cost [him]282-gamba [his]282-gamba post ; and if [[your]4053-the librarian excellency]8157-your excellency has any influence with [him]282-gamba [I]234-odo would urge its being used to restrain [him]282-gamba from such excesses . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo , on taking [his]234-odo leave of [the librarian]4053-the librarian , ran across [Gamba]282-gamba at [the first street - corner]4118-the first street - corner ; and [they]4119-they had not proceeded a dozen yards together when the eye of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's kinsman]4121-the duke 's kinsman fell on a snatch of doggerel scrawled in chalk on an adjacent wall . " Beware ( the quatrain ran ) [[O]9278-o virtuous wife or [maid]9280-maid]9279-o virtuous wife or maid , [[Our]4119-they ruler]9281-our ruler 's fondness for the shade , Lest first [he]9281-our ruler woo [thee]9278-o to the leafy glade And then into the deeper wood persuade . "[4121-the duke 's kinsman] This crude play on the [Belverde]389-the belverde 's former title and the one [she]389-the belverde had recently acquired was signed " [Carlo Gamba]282-gamba . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo glanced curiously at [the hunchback , who met the look]4122-the hunchback , who met the look with a composed smile . " [[My]234-odo enemies]9282-my enemies do n't do [me]234-odo justice , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo ; " [I]234-odo could do better than that if [I]234-odo tried ; "[234-odo] and [he]234-odo effaced the words with a sweep of [his]234-odo shabby sleeve . [Other lampoons of the same quality]4123-other lampoons of the same quality were continually cropping up on [the walls of [Pianura]4-pianura]4124-the walls of pianura , and [the ducal police]4125-the ducal police were kept as busy rubbing them out as a band of weeders digging docks out of [a garden]4126-a garden . [The Duchess]899-the duchess 's debts , [the Duke]682-the duke 's devotions , [the Belverde]389-the belverde 's extortions , [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern 's mummery , and the political rivalry between [Trescorre]254-trescorre and [the Dominican]3738-the dominican , were sauce to [the citizen]4130-the citizen 's daily bread ; but there was nothing in these popular satires to suggest [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback 's trenchant irony . It was in [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's palace]4133-the bishop 's palace that [Odo]234-odo read the first lampoon in which [he]234-odo recognised [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend 's touch . In this society of polished dilettanti such documents were valued rather for their literary merits than for their political significance ; and the pungent lines in which [the Duke]682-the duke 's panaceas were hit off ( the Belverde figuring among them as a Lenten diet , a dinner of herbs , and a wonder - working bone ) caused a flutter of professional envy in [the episcopal circle]4136-the episcopal circle . [The Bishop]1234-the bishop received [company]2819-company every evening ; and [Odo]234-odo soon found that , as [Gamba]282-gamba had said , it was the best company in [Pianura]4-pianura . [[His]1234-the bishop lordship]8266-his lordship lived in great state in [the Gothic palace adjoining [the Cathedral]3023-the cathedral]4140-the gothic palace adjoining the cathedral . [The gloomy vaulted rooms of [the original structure]4143-the original structure]4142-the gloomy vaulted rooms of the original structure had been abandoned to [the small fry of [the episcopal retinue]4145-the episcopal retinue]4144-the small fry of the episcopal retinue . In [the chambers around [the courtyard]1745-the courtyard [[his]1234-the bishop lordship]8266-his lordship]4146-the chambers around the courtyard his lordship drove a thriving trade in wines from [[his]1234-the bishop vineyards]4149-his vineyards , while [[his]1234-the bishop clients]4150-his clients awaited [his]1234-the bishop pleasure in [the armoury]4151-the armoury , where the panoplies of [[his]1234-the bishop fighting predecessors]4152-his fighting predecessors still rusted on the walls . Behind [this facade]4153-this facade [a later prelate]4154-a later prelate had built [a vast wing overlooking [a garden which descended by easy terraces]4156-a garden which descended by easy terraces to [the Piana]94-the piana]4155-a vast wing overlooking a garden which descended by easy terraces to the piana . In [the high - studded apartments of this wing]4157-the high - studded apartments of this wing [the Bishop]1234-the bishop held [[his]1234-the bishop court]4159-his court and lived the life of [a wealthy secular nobleman]4160-a wealthy secular nobleman . [His]1234-the bishop days were agreeably divided between hunting , inspecting [[his]1234-the bishop estates]1253-his estates , receiving the visits of [antiquarians]4162-antiquarians , [artists]4163-artists and [literati]4164-literati , and superintending the embellishments of [[his]1234-the bishop gardens]4165-his gardens , then the most famous in [North Italy]107-north italy ; while [his]1234-the bishop evenings were given to the more private diversions which [his]1234-the bishop age and looks still justified . In religious ceremonies or in formal intercourse with [[his]1234-the bishop clergy]4166-his clergy [he]1234-the bishop was [the most imposing and sacerdotal of [bishops]1279-bishops]4167-the most imposing and sacerdotal of bishops ; but in private life none knew better how to disguise [his]1234-the bishop cloth . [He]1234-the bishop was moreover [a man of parts , and from the construction of a Latin hexameter to the growing of a Holland bulb]4169-a man of parts , and from the construction of a latin hexameter to the growing of a holland bulb , had a word worth hearing on all subjects likely to engage [the dilettante]4170-the dilettante . A liking soon sprang up between [Odo]234-odo and [this versatile prelate]4171-this versatile prelate ; and in the retirement of [[[his]234-odo lordship]8266-his lordship 's cabinet]4173-his lordship 's cabinet , or pacing with [him]234-odo [the garden - alleys set with ancient marbles]4174-the garden - alleys set with ancient marbles , [the young man]2380-the young man gathered many precepts of that philosophy of pleasure which [the great churchmen of the eighteenth century practised with such rare completeness]4176-the great churchmen of the eighteenth century practised with such rare completeness . [The Bishop]1234-the bishop had not , indeed , given much thought to the problems which most deeply engaged [[his]1234-the bishop companion]840-his companion . [His]1234-the bishop theory of life took no account of the future and concerned itself little with social conditions outside [[his]1234-the bishop own class]4179-his own class ; but [he]1234-the bishop was acquainted with the classical schools of thought , and , having once acted as [[the late Duke]4180-the late duke 's envoy to [the French court]4182-the french court]4181-the late duke 's envoy to the french court , had frequented [the Baron d'Holbach 's drawing - room]4183-the baron d'holbach 's drawing - room and familiarised [himself]1234-the bishop with the views of [the Encyclopaedists]4184-the encyclopaedists ; though it was clear that [he]1234-the bishop valued [their]4184-the encyclopaedists teachings chiefly as an argument against asceticism . " Life , "[1234-the bishop] said [he]1234-the bishop to [Odo]234-odo , as [they]4185-we sat one afternoon in [a garden - pavilion above [the river]2315-the river]4186-a garden - pavilion above the river , a marble Mercury confronting [them]4185-we at the end of a vista of clipped myrtle , " life , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , is a stock on which [we]4185-we may graft what fruit or flower [we]4185-we choose . See the orange - tree in [that Capo di Monte jar]9284-that capo di monte jar : in a week or two it will be covered with red roses . Here again is a citron set with carnations ; and but yesterday [[my]4188-my gardener]9285-my gardener sent [me]4188-my word that [he]9285-my gardener had at last succeeded in flowering a pomegranate with jasmine . In such cases [the gardener]9286-the gardener chooses as [his]9285-my gardener graft the flower which , by its colour and fragrance , shall most agreeably contrast with the original stock ; and [he]1234-the bishop who orders [his]1234-the bishop life on the same principle , grafting it with pleasures that form a refreshing off - set to the obligations of [his]1234-the bishop rank and calling , may regard [himself]1234-the bishop as justified by Nature , who , as [you]9287-you see , smiles on such abnormal unions among [her]9288-her children.--Not long ago , "[4188-my] [he]4188-my went on , with a reminiscent smile , " [I]4188-my had here under [my]4188-my roof [a young person who practised to perfection this art of engrafting life with the unexpected]9289-a young person who practised to perfection this art of engrafting life with the unexpected . Though [she]9289-a young person who practised to perfection this art of engrafting life with the unexpected was only [a player in a strolling company]9290-a player in a strolling company -- [a sweetheart of [[my]4188-my wild nephew]9292-my wild nephew 's , as [you]9287-you may guess]9291-a sweetheart of my wild nephew 's , as you may guess -- [I]4188-my have met few of [her]9289-a young person who practised to perfection this art of engrafting life with the unexpected sex whose conversation was so instructive or who so completely justified the Scriptural adage , "[4188-my] the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning ... " [He]4188-my broke off to sip [his]4188-my chocolate . "[4188-my] But why , " [he]4188-my continued , "[4188-my] do [I]0-i talk thus to [a young man whose path is lined with such opportunities]4189-a young man whose path is lined with such opportunities ? The secret of happiness is to say with [the great Emperor]4190-the great emperor , ' Everything is fruit to [me]0-i which [thy]4190-the great emperor seasons bring , O Nature . ' " "[4190-the great emperor] Such a creed , [monsignore]4191-monsignore , " [Odo]234-odo ventured to return , "[4190-the great emperor] is as flattering to the intelligence as to the senses ; for surely it better becomes a reasoning being to face fate as [an equal]4192-an equal than to cower before it like [a slave]4193-a slave ; but , since [you]4191-monsignore have opened [yourself]4191-monsignore so freely on the subject , may [I]0-i carry [your]4191-monsignore argument a point farther and ask how [you]4191-monsignore reconcile [your]4191-monsignore conception of [man]2185-man 's destiny with the authorised teachings of [the Church]1212-the church ? " [The Bishop]1234-the bishop raised [his]1234-the bishop head with a guarded glance . "[234-odo] [Cavaliere]234-odo , " said [he]1234-the bishop , "[234-odo] [the ancients]4196-the ancients did not admit the rabble to [their]4196-the ancients sacred mysteries ; nor dare [we]4197-our permit the unlettered to enter [the hollowed precincts of [the temple of Reason]4199-the temple of reason]4198-the hollowed precincts of the temple of reason . " "[234-odo] True , " [Odo]234-odo acquiesced ; "[234-odo] but if the teachings of Christianity are the best safeguard of [the people]1003-the people , should not those teachings at least be stripped of the grotesque excrescences with which the superstitions of [the people]1003-the people and -- perhaps -- the greed and craft of [the priesthood]4202-the priesthood have smothered the simple precepts of [Jesus]264-christ ? " [The Bishop]1234-the bishop shrugged [his]1234-the bishop shoulders . "[264-christ] As long , " said [he]1234-the bishop , "[1003-the people] as [the people]1003-the people need the restraint of a dogmatic religion so long must [we]4197-our do [our]4197-our utmost to maintain its outward forms .
