In [our]4197-our market - place on feast - days there appears the strange figure of [a man who carries a banner painted with an image of [Saint Paul]435-saint paul surrounded by a mass of writhing serpents]4204-a man who carries a banner painted with an image of saint paul surrounded by a mass of writhing serpents . [This man]4205-this man calls [himself]4205-this man a descendant of [the apostle]4206-the apostle and sells to [[our]4197-our peasants]4207-our peasants the miraculous powder with which [he]4205-this man killed the great serpent at [Malta]108-malta . If it were not for the banner , the legend , the descent from [Saint Paul]435-saint paul , how much efficacy do [you]4208-you think those powders would have ? And how long do [you]4208-you think the precepts of [an invisible divinity]4209-an invisible divinity would restrain the evil passions of [an ignorant peasant]4210-an ignorant peasant ? It is because [he]4205-this man is afraid of [the plaster God in [[his]4205-this man parish church]4212-his parish church]4211-the plaster god in his parish church , and of [the priest who represents [that God]4214-that god]4213-the priest who represents that god , that [he]4205-this man still pays [his]4205-this man tithes and forfeitures and keeps [his]4205-this man hands from [our]4197-our throats . By [Diana]436-diana , " cried [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , taking snuff , "[436-diana] [I]0-i have no patience with [those of [my]0-i calling who go about whining for apostolic simplicity , and would rob [the churches]2240-the churches of [their]2240-the churches ornaments and [the faithful]8704-the faithful of [their]2240-the churches ceremonies]4215-those of my calling who go about whining for apostolic simplicity , and would rob the churches of their ornaments and the faithful of their ceremonies . " For [my]0-i part , "[0-i] [he]0-i added , glancing with a smile about the delicately - stuccoed walls of [the pavilion]4218-the pavilion , through the windows of which climbing roses shed their petals on the rich mosaics transferred from [a Roman bath]4219-a roman bath , " for [my]0-i part , when [I]0-i remember that ' tis to [Jesus of Nazareth]437-jesus of nazareth [I]0-i owe the good roof over [my]0-i head and the good nags in [[my]0-i stable]9296-my stable ; nay , the very venison and pheasants from [my]0-i preserves , with the gold plate [I]0-i eat them off , and above all the leisure to enjoy as they deserve these excellent gifts of [the Creator]9297-the creator -- when [I]0-i consider this , [I]0-i say , [I]0-i stand amazed at those who would rob so beneficent [a deity of the least of]9298-a deity of the least of [his]9297-the creator privileges.--But why , "[0-i] [he]0-i continued again after a moment , as [Odo]234-odo remained silent , " should [we]9299-we vex [ourselves]9299-we with such questions , when [Providence]352-providence has given [us]9299-we so fair [a world to enjoy]9300-a world to enjoy and such varied faculties with which to apprehend [its]9300-a world to enjoy beauties ? [I]0-i think [you]234-odo have not seen the Venus Callipyge in bronze that [I]0-i have lately received from [Rome]11-rome ? "[0-i] And [he]0-i rose and led the way to [the house]1917-the house . This conversation revealed to [Odo]234-odo a third conception of the religious idea . In Piedmont religion imposed itself as a military discipline , the enforced duty of [the Christian citizen]4221-the christian citizen to the heavenly state ; to [the Duke]682-the duke it was a means of purchasing spiritual immunity from the consequences of bodily weakness ; to [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , it replaced [the panem et circenses of ancient]4224-the panem et circenses of ancient [Rome]11-rome . Where , in all this , was the share of [those whom [Christ]264-christ had come to save]4225-those whom christ had come to save ? Where was [Saint Francis]239-saint francis 's devotion to [[his]239-saint francis heavenly bride]4226-his heavenly bride , [the Lady Poverty]438-the lady poverty ? Though here and there [a good parish priest]4227-a good parish priest like [Crescenti]234-odo ministered to the temporal wants of [the peasantry]8358-the peasantry , it was only [the free - thinker]4229-the free - thinker and [the atheist who , at the risk of life and fortune]4230-the atheist who , at the risk of life and fortune , laboured for [their]4230-the atheist who , at the risk of life and fortune moral liberation . [Odo]234-odo listened with a saddened heart , thinking , as [he]234-odo followed [[his]234-odo host]4231-his host through the perfumed shade of [the gardens]8159-the gardens , and down [the long saloon at the end of which [the Venus]4234-the venus stood]4233-the long saloon at the end of which the venus stood , of [those who for the love of [man]2185-man]4235-those who for the love of man had denied [themselves]4235-those who for the love of man such delicate emotions and gone forth cheerfully to exile or imprisonment . These were [the true lovers of [the Lady Poverty]4238-the lady poverty]4237-the true lovers of the lady poverty , [the band in which [he]234-odo longed to be enrolled]4239-the band in which he longed to be enrolled ; yet how restrain a thrill of delight as [the slender dusky goddess]4240-the slender dusky goddess detached [herself]4240-the slender dusky goddess against the cool marble of [her]4240-the slender dusky goddess niche , looking , in the sun - rippled green penumbra of [the saloon]4241-the saloon , with a sound of water falling somewhere out of sight , as though [she]4240-the slender dusky goddess had just stepped dripping from the wave ? In [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's company]4243-the duchess 's company life struck another gait . Here was no waiting on subtle pleasures , but a headlong gallop after the cruder sort . Hunting , gaming and masquerading filled [her]899-the duchess Highness 's days ; and [Odo]234-odo had felt small inclination to keep pace with the cavalcade , but for the flying huntress at its head . To [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's " view halloo "[899-the duchess] every drop of blood in [him]234-odo responded ; but a vigilant image kept [his]234-odo bosom barred . So [they]4245-they rode , danced , diced together , but like [strangers who cross hands at a veglione]4246-strangers who cross hands at a veglione . Once or twice [he]234-odo fancied [the Duchess]899-the duchess was for unmasking ; but [her]899-the duchess impulses came and went like fireflies in the dusk , and it suited [his]234-odo humour to remain [a looker - on]4248-a looker - on . So life piped to [him]234-odo during [his]234-odo first days at [Pianura]4-pianura : a merry tune in [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's company]4250-the bishop 's company , a mad one in [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's ; but always with the same sad undertone , like the cry of the wind on a warm threshold . 2.14 . [Trescorre]254-trescorre too kept [open house]4252-open house , and here [Odo]234-odo found a warmer welcome than [he]234-odo had expected . Though [Trescorre]254-trescorre was still [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's accredited lover]4254-the duchess 's accredited lover , it was clear that the tie between [them]4245-they was no longer such as to make [him]234-odo resent [her]899-the duchess kindness to [[her]899-the duchess young kinsman]4255-her young kinsman . [He]234-odo seemed indeed anxious to draw [Odo]234-odo into [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness 's circle , and surprised [him]234-odo by a frankness and affability of which [his]234-odo demeanour at [Turin]17-turin had given no promise . As [leader of [the anti - clericals]4258-the anti - clericals]4257-leader of the anti - clericals [he]234-odo stood for such liberalism as dared show its head in [Pianura]4-pianura ; and [he]234-odo seemed disposed to invite [Odo]234-odo 's confidence in political matters . [The latter]870-the latter was , however , too much [the child of [his]234-odo race]4260-the child of his race not to hang back from such an invitation . [He]234-odo did not distrust [Trescorre]254-trescorre more than [the other courtiers]4261-the other courtiers ; but it was a time when every ear was alert for the foot - fall of treachery , and [the rashest man]4262-the rashest man did not care to taste first of any cup that was offered [him]234-odo . These scruples [Trescorre]254-trescorre made it [his]254-trescorre business to dispel . [He]254-trescorre was [the only person at court]4263-the only person at court who was willing to discuss politics , and [his]254-trescorre clear view of affairs excited [Odo]234-odo 's admiration if not [his]234-odo concurrence . [Odo]234-odo 's was in fact one of those dual visions which instinctively see both sides of a case and take the defence of the less popular . [Gamba]282-gamba 's principles were dear to [him]234-odo ; but [he]234-odo did not therefore believe in the personal baseness of [every opponent of the cause]4264-every opponent of the cause . [He]234-odo had refrained from mentioning the hunchback to [[his]234-odo supposed brother]4265-his supposed brother ; but [the latter]870-the latter , in one of [their]4267-their talks , brought forward [Gamba]282-gamba 's name , without reference to the relationship , but with high praise for [the young librarian]4268-the young librarian 's parts . This , at the moment , put [Odo]234-odo on [his]234-odo guard ; but [Trescorre]254-trescorre having one day begged [him]254-trescorre to give [Gamba]282-gamba warning of some petty danger that threatened [him]282-gamba from the clerical side , it became difficult not to believe in an interest so attested ; the more so as [Trescorre]254-trescorre let it be seen that [Gamba]282-gamba 's political views were not such as to distract from [his]254-trescorre sympathy . " [The fellow]8970-the fellow 's brains , "[254-trescorre] said [he]254-trescorre , " would be of infinite use to [me]254-trescorre ; but perhaps [he]8970-the fellow serves [us]4267-their best at a distance . All [I]254-trescorre ask is that [he]8970-the fellow shall not risk [himself]8970-the fellow too near [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio 's talons , for [he]8970-the fellow would be a pretty morsel to throw to the Holy Office , and the weak point of [such a man]9302-such a man 's position is that , however dangerous in life , [he]8970-the fellow can threaten [no one]725-no one from the grave . "[254-trescorre] [Odo]234-odo reported this to [Gamba]282-gamba , who heard with a two - edged smile . " Yes , "[282-gamba] was [his]282-gamba comment , " [he]8970-the fellow fears [me]282-gamba enough to want to see [me]282-gamba safe in [his]8970-the fellow fold . "[282-gamba] [Odo]234-odo flushed at the implication . " And why not ? "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo . " Could [you]282-gamba not serve the cause better by attaching [yourself]282-gamba openly to [the liberals]9304-the liberals than by lurking in [the ditch]9305-the ditch to throw mud at [both parties]9306-both parties ? "[234-odo] " [The liberals]9304-the liberals ! "[282-gamba] sneered [Gamba]282-gamba . " Where are [they]9304-the liberals ? And what have [they]9304-the liberals done ? It was [they]9304-the liberals who drove out [the Jesuits]336-the jesuits ; but to whom did [the Society]8939-the society 's lands go ? To [the Duke]682-the duke , every acre of [them]9304-the liberals ! And [the peasantry]8358-the peasantry suffered far less under [the fathers]1227-the fathers , who were [good agriculturists]9312-good agriculturists , than under [the Duke]682-the duke , who is too busy with [monks and astrologers]9314-monks and astrologers to give [his]682-the duke mind to irrigation or the reclaiming of [waste land]9315-waste land . As to [the University]9247-the university , who replaced [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits [there]606-there ? [Professors from [Padua]109-padua or [Pavia]12-pavia]9319-professors from padua or pavia ? Heaven forbid ! But holy Barnabites that have scarce Latin enough to spell out the Lives of [the Saints]1218-the saints ! [The Jesuits]336-the jesuits at least gave a good education to [the upper classes]9321-the upper classes ; but now [the young noblemen]9322-the young noblemen are as ignorant as [peasants]9323-peasants . "[282-gamba] [Trescorre]254-trescorre received at [[his]254-trescorre house]1355-his house , besides [the court functionaries]4270-the court functionaries , [all [the liberal faction]4272-the liberal faction and [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's personal friends]4274-the duchess 's personal friends]4271-all the liberal faction and the duchess 's personal friends . [He]254-trescorre kept a lavish state , but lacking [the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's social gifts , was less successful in fusing the different elements of [[his]254-trescorre circle]4276-his circle . [The Duke]682-the duke , for the first few weeks after [[his]682-the duke kinsman]3528-his kinsman 's arrival , received no company ; and did not even appear in [[the Belverde]389-the belverde 's drawing - rooms]4279-the belverde 's drawing - rooms ; but [Odo]234-odo deemed it none the less politic to show [himself]682-the duke [there]606-there without delay . [The new Marchioness of [Boscofolto]97-boscofolto]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto lived in [one of [the finest palaces of [Pianura]4-pianura]4283-the finest palaces of pianura]4282-one of the finest palaces of pianura , but prodigality was the least of [her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto failings , and the meagreness of [her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto hospitality was an unfailing source of epigram to [the drawing - rooms of [the opposition]4285-the opposition]4284-the drawing - rooms of the opposition . True , [she]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto kept open table for [half [the clergy]1929-the clergy in [the town]593-the town]4286-half the clergy in the town ( omitting , of course , [those worldly ecclesiastics who frequented [the episcopal palace]3235-the episcopal palace]4289-those worldly ecclesiastics who frequented the episcopal palace ) , but it was whispered that [she]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto had persuaded [[her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto cook]4291-her cook to take half wages in return for the privilege of victualling [such holy men]4292-such holy men , and that the same argument enabled [her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto to obtain [her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto provisions below the market price . In [[her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto outer ante - chamber]4293-her outer ante - chamber [the servants]755-the servants yawned dismally over a cold brazier , without so much as a game of cards to divert [them]755-the servants , and the long enfilade of saloons leading to [[her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto drawing - room]4295-her drawing - room was so scantily lit that [[her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto guests]4296-her guests could scarce recognise [each other]3086-each other in passing . In [the room where [she]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto sat]4298-the room where she sat , a tall crucifix of ebony and gold stood at [her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto elbow and a holy - water cup encrusted with jewels hung on the wall at [her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto side . [A dozen or more ecclesiastics]4299-a dozen or more ecclesiastics were always gathered in stiff seats about the hearth ; and the aspect of [the apartment]2431-the apartment , and [the Marchioness]1174-the marchioness 's semi - monastic costume , justified the nickname of " the sacristy , "[899-the duchess] which [the Duchess]899-the duchess had bestowed on [[[her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto rival]4303-her rival 's drawing - room]4304-her rival 's drawing - room . Around the small fire on this cheerless hearth the fortunes of [the state]2921-the state were discussed and directed , benefices disposed of , court appointments debated , and reputations made and unmade in tones that suggested the low drone of a group of [canons]4306-canons intoning the psalter in [an empty cathedral]4307-an empty cathedral . [The Marchioness]1174-the marchioness , who appeared as eager as [the others]2506-the others to win [Odo]234-odo to [[her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto party]4310-her party , received [him]234-odo with every mark of consideration and pressed [him]234-odo to accompany [her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto on a visit to [[her]4281-the new marchioness of boscofolto brother]3266-her brother , [the Abbot of [the Barnabites]4313-the barnabites]3251-the abbot of the barnabites ; an invitation which [he]234-odo accepted with the more readiness as [he]234-odo had not forgotten the part played by [that religious]4314-that religious in the adventure of [[Mirandolina]267-cantapresto of [Chioggia]44-chioggia]8393-mirandolina of chioggia . [He]234-odo found [the Abbot]3267-the abbot [a man with a bland intriguing eye and centuries of pious leisure]4317-a man with a bland intriguing eye and centuries of pious leisure in [his]3267-the abbot voice . [He]234-odo received [[his]234-odo visitors]4318-his visitors in [a room hung with smoky pictures of [the Spanish school]4320-the spanish school]4319-a room hung with smoky pictures of the spanish school , showing [Saint Jerome]439-saint jerome in [the wilderness]4321-the wilderness , the death of [Saint Peter Martyr]440-saint peter martyr , and other sanguinary passages in the lives of [the saints]1218-the saints ; and [Odo]234-odo , seated among such surroundings , and hearing [the Abbot]3267-the abbot deplore the loose lives and religious negligence of [certain members of [the court]814-the court]4324-certain members of the court , could scarce repress a smile as the thought of [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto flitted through [his]234-odo mind . " [She]4326-she must , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo reflected , " have found this a sad change from [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's palace]4133-the bishop 's palace ; "[234-odo] and admired with what philosophy [she]4326-she had passed from [one protector]4327-one protector to the other . Life in [Pianura]4-pianura , after the first few weeks , seemed on the whole a tame business to [a youth of [his]234-odo appetite]4328-a youth of his appetite ; and [he]234-odo secretly longed for a pretext to resume [his]234-odo travels . None , however , seemed likely to offer ; for it was clear that [the Duke]682-the duke , in the interval of more pressing concerns , wished to study and observe [[his]682-the duke kinsman]3528-his kinsman . When sufficiently recovered from the effects of the pilgrimage , [he]682-the duke sent for [Odo]234-odo and questioned [him]234-odo closely as to the way in which [he]234-odo had spent [his]234-odo time since coming to [Pianura]4-pianura , the acquaintances [he]234-odo had formed and [the churches [he]234-odo had frequented]4331-the churches he had frequented . [Odo]234-odo prudently dwelt on the lofty tone of [[the Belverde]389-the belverde 's circle]4332-the belverde 's circle , and on the privilege [he]234-odo had enjoyed in attending [her]389-the belverde on a visit to [the holy Abbot of [the Barnabites]4313-the barnabites]9056-the holy abbot of the barnabites ; touching more lightly on [his]234-odo connection with [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , and omitting all mention of [Gamba]282-gamba and [Crescenti]234-odo . [The Duke]682-the duke assumed a listening air , but it was clear that [he]682-the duke could not put off [his]682-the duke private thoughts long enough to give an open mind to other matters ; and [Odo]234-odo felt that [he]234-odo was nowhere so secure as in [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin 's company . [He]234-odo remembered , however , that [the Duke]682-the duke had plenty of eyes to replace [his]682-the duke own , and that a secret which was safe in [his]682-the duke actual presence might be in mortal danger on [his]682-the duke threshold . [[His]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness on this occasion was pleased to inform [[his]682-the duke kinsman]3528-his kinsman that [he]941-his highness had ordered [Count Trescorre]254-trescorre to place at [the young man]2380-the young man 's disposal an income enabling [him]254-trescorre to keep [a carriage]729-a carriage and pair , four saddle - horses and [five servants]4343-five servants . It was scant measure for [an heir - presumptive]4344-an heir - presumptive , and [Odo]234-odo wondered if [the Belverde]389-the belverde had had a hand in the apportionment ; but [his]234-odo indifference to such matters ( for though personally fastidious [he]234-odo cared little for display ) enabled [him]234-odo to show such gratitude that [the Duke]682-the duke , fancying [he]234-odo might have been content with less , had nearly withdrawn two of the saddle - horses . This becoming behaviour greatly advanced [the young man]2380-the young man in the esteem of [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness , who accorded [him]2380-the young man on the spot [the petites entrees of [the ducal apartments]4349-the ducal apartments]4348-the petites entrees of the ducal apartments . It was a privilege [Odo]234-odo had no mind to abuse ; for if life moved slowly in [[the Belverde]389-the belverde 's circle]4332-the belverde 's circle it was at a standstill in [the Duke]682-the duke 's . [[His]234-odo Highness]941-his highness never went abroad but to serve mass in [some church]4353-some church ( [his]234-odo almost daily practice ) or to visit [one of [the numerous monasteries within [the city]2261-the city]4355-the numerous monasteries within the city]4354-one of the numerous monasteries within the city . From Ash Wednesday to Easter Monday it was [his]234-odo custom to transact no public or private business . During this time [he]234-odo received [none of [[his]234-odo ministers]8730-his ministers]4357-none of his ministers , and saw [[his]234-odo son]3683-his son but for a few moments once a day ; while in Holy Week [he]234-odo made a retreat with [the Barnabites]408-the barnabites , [the Belverde]9090-the belverde withdrawing for the same period to [the convent of the Perpetual Adoration]4361-the convent of the perpetual adoration . [Odo]234-odo , as [his]234-odo new life took shape , found [his]234-odo chief interest in [the society of [Crescenti]234-odo and [Gamba]282-gamba]4362-the society of crescenti and gamba . In [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's company]4243-the duchess 's company [he]234-odo might have lost all taste for soberer pleasures , but that [his]234-odo political sympathies wore [a girl]2391-a girl 's reproachful shape . Ever at [his]234-odo side , more vividly than in the body , [Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia became the symbol of [his]234-odo best aims and deepest failure . Sometimes , indeed , [her]362-fulvia look drove [him]234-odo forth in [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's train]4367-the duchess 's train , but more often , drawing [him]234-odo from [the crowd of [pleasure - seekers]2737-pleasure - seekers]4368-the crowd of pleasure - seekers , beckoned the way to solitude and study . Under [Crescenti]234-odo 's tuition [he]234-odo began the reading of [Dante]331-dante , who just then , after generations of neglect , was once more lifting [his]331-dante voice above [the crowd of minor singers]4370-the crowd of minor singers . The mighty verse swept [Odo]234-odo out to open seas of thought , and from [his]234-odo vision of [that earlier Italy]4371-that earlier italy , [hapless , bleeding , but alive and breast to breast with the foe]4372-hapless , bleeding , but alive and breast to breast with the foe , [he]234-odo drew the presage of [[his]234-odo country]4373-his country 's resurrection . Passing from this high music to the company of [Gamba]282-gamba and [[his]282-gamba friends]2637-his friends was like leaving [a church]1114-a church where the penitential psalms are being sung for the market - place where mud and eggs are flying . The change was not agreeable to a fastidious taste ; but , as [Gamba]282-gamba said , [you]4376-you can not clean out [a stable]4377-a stable by waving incense over it . After some hesitation , [he]282-gamba had agreed to make [Odo]234-odo acquainted with those who , like [himself]234-odo , were secretly working in the cause of progress . These were mostly of [the middle class]2325-the middle class , [physicians]4379-physicians , [lawyers]4380-lawyers , and [such men of letters]4381-such men of letters as could subsist on the scant wants of [an unliterary town]4382-an unliterary town . Ablest among [them]4383-them was [the bookseller , [Andreoni]441-andreoni , whose shop was the meeting place of [all the literati of [Pianura]4-pianura]4385-all the literati of pianura]4384-the bookseller , andreoni , whose shop was the meeting place of all the literati of pianura . [Andreoni]441-andreoni , famous throughout [Italy]5-italy for [his]441-andreoni editions of the classics , was [a man of liberal views and considerable learning]4386-a man of liberal views and considerable learning , and in [[his]441-andreoni private room]4387-his private room were to be found many prohibited volumes , such as [Beccaria]372-beccaria 's Crime and Punishment , [Gravina]324-gravina 's Hydra Mystica , [Concini]442-concini 's History of Probabilism and the Amsterdam editions of the French philosophical works . [The reformers]4388-the reformers met at various places , and [their]4388-the reformers meetings were conducted with as much secrecy as those of [the Honey - Bees]2571-the honey - bees . [Odo]234-odo was at first surprised that [they]4388-the reformers should admit [him]234-odo to [their]4388-the reformers conferences ; but [he]234-odo soon divined that the gatherings [he]234-odo attended were not those at which the private designs of [the party]1452-the party were discussed . It was plain that [they]4388-the reformers belonged to some kind of secret association ; and before [he]234-odo had been long in [Pianura]4-pianura [he]234-odo learned that [the society of [the Illuminati]4392-the illuminati]4391-the society of the illuminati , [that bugbear of [priests]3779-priests and [princes]2145-princes]4393-that bugbear of priests and princes , was supposed to have [agents]4396-agents at work in [the duchy]1310-the duchy . [Odo]234-odo had heard little of this execrated league , but that it was said to preach atheism , tyrannicide and the complete abolition of territorial rights ; but this , being the report of [the enemy]4398-the enemy , was to be received with a measure of doubt . [He]234-odo tried to learn from [Gamba]282-gamba whether [the Illuminati]443-the illuminati had [a lodge in [the city]2261-the city]4399-a lodge in the city ; but on this point [he]234-odo could extract no information . Meanwhile [he]234-odo listened with interest to discussions on taxation , irrigation , and such economic problems as might safely be aired in [his]234-odo presence . These talks brought vividly before [him]234-odo the political corruption of [the state]2921-the state and the misery of [the unprivileged classes]4402-the unprivileged classes . [All the land in [the duchy]1310-the duchy]4403-all the land in the duchy was farmed on the metayer system , and with such ill results that [the peasants]8472-the peasants were always in debt to [[their]8472-the peasants landlords]4406-their landlords . The weight of the evil lay chiefly on [the country - people , who had to pay on every pig [they]4407-the country - people , who had to pay on every pig they killed , on all the produce they carried to market killed , on all the produce [they]4407-the country - people , who had to pay on every pig they killed , on all the produce they carried to market carried to market]4407-the country - people , who had to pay on every pig they killed , on all the produce they carried to market , on [their]4407-the country - people , who had to pay on every pig they killed , on all the produce they carried to market farm implements , [their]4407-the country - people , who had to pay on every pig they killed , on all the produce they carried to market mulberry - orchards and [their]4407-the country - people , who had to pay on every pig they killed , on all the produce they carried to market silk - worms , to say nothing of the tithes to [the parish]8859-the parish . So oppressive were these obligations that [many of [the peasants]8472-the peasants]4409-many of the peasants , forsaking [[their]4409-many of the peasants farms]4411-their farms , enrolled [themselves]4409-many of the peasants in the mendicant orders , thus actually strengthening the hand of [[their]4409-many of the peasants oppressors]4412-their oppressors . Of legislative redress there was no hope , and [the Duke]682-the duke was inaccessible to all but [[his]682-the duke favourites]9230-his favourites . The previous year , as [Odo]234-odo learned , [eight hundred poor labourers , exasperated by want]4415-eight hundred poor labourers , exasperated by want , had petitioned [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness to relieve [them]4415-eight hundred poor labourers , exasperated by want of the corvee ; but though [they]4415-eight hundred poor labourers , exasperated by want had raised fifteen hundred scudi to bribe [the court official who was to present [their]4415-eight hundred poor labourers , exasperated by want address]4417-the court official who was to present their address , no reply had ever been received . In [the city]2261-the city itself , the monopoly of corn and tobacco weighed heavily on [the merchants]4419-the merchants , and the strict censorship of the press made the open ventilation of wrongs impossible , while [the Duke]682-the duke 's sbirri and [the agents of [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office]4421-the agents of the holy office could drag [a man]8112-a man 's thoughts from [his]8112-a man bosom and search [his]8112-a man midnight dreams . [The Church party]8954-the church party , in the interest of [their]8954-the church party order , fostered [the Duke]682-the duke 's fears of sedition and branded [every innovator]4426-every innovator as [an atheist]3196-an atheist ; [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office having even cast grave doubts on the orthodoxy of [a nobleman who had tried to introduce the English system of ploughing on [[his]4429-a nobleman who had tried to introduce the english system of ploughing on his estates estates]1253-his estates]4429-a nobleman who had tried to introduce the english system of ploughing on his estates . It was evident to [Odo]234-odo that the secret hopes of [the reformers]4388-the reformers centred in [him]234-odo , and the consciousness of [their]4388-the reformers belief was sweeter than love in [his]234-odo bosom . It diverted [him]234-odo from the follies of [[his]234-odo class]2387-his class , fixed [his]234-odo thoughts at an age when they are apt to range , and thus slowly shaped and tempered [him]234-odo for high uses . In this fashion the weeks passed and summer came . It was [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's habit to escape the August heats by retiring to [the dower - house on [the Piana]94-the piana]4434-the dower - house on the piana , a league beyond the gates ; but [the little prince]3148-the little prince being still under the care of [the German physician]4436-the german physician , who would not consent to [his]3148-the little prince removal , [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness reluctantly lingered in [Pianura]4-pianura . With the first leafing of the oaks [Odo]234-odo 's old love for the budding earth awoke , and [he]234-odo rode out daily in [the forest]2856-the forest toward [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . [It]4439-it was but a flat stretch of shade , lacking the voice of streams and the cold breath of [mountain - gorges]4440-mountain - gorges : a wood without humours or surprises ; but the mere spring of the turf was delightful as [he]234-odo cantered down [the grass alleys roofed with level boughs]4441-the grass alleys roofed with level boughs , the outer sunlight just gilding the lip of [the long green tunnel]4442-the long green tunnel . Sometimes [he]234-odo attended [the Duchess]899-the duchess , but oftener chose to ride alone , setting forth early after a night at cards or a late vigil in [[Crescenti]234-odo 's study]4444-crescenti 's study . One of these solitary rides brought [him]234-odo without premeditation to [a low building on [the fenny edge of the wood]4446-the fenny edge of the wood]4445-a low building on the fenny edge of the wood . [It]4445-a low building on the fenny edge of the wood was [a small house]4447-a small house , added , [it]4445-a low building on the fenny edge of the wood appeared , to an ancient brick front adorned with pilasters , perhaps a fragment of [some woodland temple]4448-some woodland temple . The door - step was overgrown with a stealthy green moss and tufted with giant fennel ; and a shutter swinging loose on [its]4445-a low building on the fenny edge of the wood hinge gave a glimpse of inner dimness . [Odo]234-odo guessed at once that this was [the hunting lodge where [Cerveno]394-cerveno had found [his]394-cerveno death]4449-the hunting lodge where cerveno had found his death ; and as [he]234-odo stood looking out across [the oozy secrets of [the marsh]724-the marsh]4450-the oozy secrets of the marsh , the fever seemed to hang on [his]234-odo steps . [He]234-odo turned away with a shiver ; but whether it were the sullen aspect of [the house]1917-the house , or the close way in which the wood embraced [it]1917-the house , [the place]1030-the place suddenly laid a detaining hand upon [him]234-odo . It was as though [he]234-odo had reached the heart of solitude . Even the faint woodland noises seemed to recede from that dense circle of shade , and [the marsh]724-the marsh turned a dead eye to heaven . [Odo]234-odo tethered [his]234-odo horse to a bough and seated [himself]234-odo on [the doorstep]4455-the doorstep ; but presently [his]234-odo musings were disturbed by the sound of voices , and [the Duchess]899-the duchess , attended by [[her]899-the duchess gentlemen]4457-her gentlemen , swept by at the end of a long glade . [He]234-odo fancied [she]899-the duchess waved [her]899-the duchess hand to [him]234-odo ; but being in no humour to join [the cavalcade]4458-the cavalcade , [he]234-odo remained seated , and [the riders]4459-the riders soon passed out of sight . As [he]234-odo sat there sombre thoughts came to [him]234-odo , stealing up like exhalations from [the fen]4460-the fen . [He]234-odo saw [his]234-odo life stretched out before [him]234-odo , full of broken purposes and ineffectual effort . Public affairs were in so perplexed a case that consistent action seemed impossible to [either party]4461-either party , and [their]4461-either party chief efforts were bent toward directing the choice of [a regent]4462-a regent . It was this , rather than the possibility of [his]234-odo accession , which fixed the general attention on [Odo]234-odo , and pledged [him]234-odo to circumspection . While not concealing that in economic questions [his]234-odo sympathies were with [the liberals]9304-the liberals , [he]234-odo had carefully abstained from political action , and had hoped , by the strict observance of [his]234-odo religious duties , to avoid the enmity of [the Church party]8954-the church party . [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's undisguised sympathy seemed the pledge of liberal support , and it could hardly be doubted that the choice of [a regent in [the Church party]8954-the church party]4465-a regent in the church party would be unpopular enough to imperil [the dynasty]4467-the dynasty . With [Austria]100-austria hovering on the horizon [the Church herself]4468-the church herself was not likely to take such risks ; and thus all interests seemed to centre in [Odo]234-odo 's appointment . New elements of uncertainty were , however , perpetually disturbing the prospect . Among these was [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern 's growing influence over [the Duke]682-the duke . [Odo]234-odo had seen little of [the German physician]4436-the german physician since [their]4471-their first meeting . Hearsay had it that [he]234-odo was close - pressed by [the spies of the Holy Office]4472-the spies of the holy office , and perhaps for this reason [he]234-odo remained withdrawn in [[the Duke]682-the duke 's private apartments]4474-the duke 's private apartments and rarely showed [himself]234-odo abroad . [The little prince]3148-the little prince , [[his]234-odo patient]4034-his patient , was as seldom seen , and the accounts of [the German]445-the german 's treatment were as conflicting as the other rumours of [the court]814-the court . It was noised on all sides , however , that [the Duke]682-the duke was ill - satisfied with the results of the pilgrimage , and resolved upon less hallowed measures to assure [[his]682-the duke heir]4479-his heir 's recovery . Hitherto , it was believed , [the German]4480-the german had conformed to the ordinary medical treatment ; but [the clergy]1929-the clergy now diligently spread among [the people]1003-the people the report that supernatural agencies were to be employed . This rumour caused such general agitation that it was said [both parties]9306-both parties had made secret advances to [the Duchess]899-the duchess in the hope of inducing [her]899-the duchess to stay the scandal . Though [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina felt little real concern for the public welfare , [her]413-maria clementina stirring temper had more than once roused [her]413-maria clementina to active opposition of [the government]2558-the government , and [her]413-maria clementina kinship with [the old Duke of [Monte Alloro]99-monte alloro]3912-the old duke of monte alloro made [her]413-maria clementina a strong factor in the political game . Of late , however , [she]413-maria clementina seemed to have wearied of this sport , throwing [herself]413-maria clementina entirely into the private diversions of [[her]413-maria clementina station]4487-her station , and alluding with laughing indifference to [[her]413-maria clementina husband]1112-her husband 's necromantic researches . Such was the conflicting gossip of the hour ; but it was in fact idle to forecast the fortunes of a state dependent on [a valetudinary]4489-a valetudinary 's whims ; and rumour was driven to feed upon [her]413-maria clementina own conjectures . To [Odo]234-odo the state of affairs seemed a satire on [his]234-odo secret aspirations . In [a private station]4490-a private station or as [a ruling prince]4491-a ruling prince [he]234-odo might have served [[his]234-odo fellows]4492-his fellows : as [a princeling on the edge of power]4493-a princeling on the edge of power [he]234-odo was no more than the cardboard sword in [a toy armoury]4494-a toy armoury . Suddenly [he]234-odo heard [his]234-odo name pronounced and starting up saw [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina at [his]234-odo side . [She]413-maria clementina rode alone , and held out [her]413-maria clementina hand as [he]234-odo approached . " [I]413-maria clementina have had an accident , "[413-maria clementina] said [she]413-maria clementina , breathing quickly . " [My]413-maria clementina girth is broke and [I]413-maria clementina have lost the rest of [[my]413-maria clementina company]9326-my company . "[413-maria clementina] [She]413-maria clementina was glowing with [her]413-maria clementina quick ride , and as [Odo]234-odo lifted [her]413-maria clementina from the saddle [her]413-maria clementina loosened hair brushed [his]234-odo face like a kiss . For a moment [she]413-maria clementina seemed like life 's answer to the dreary riddle of [his]234-odo fate . " Ah , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina sighed , leaning on [him]234-odo , " [I]413-maria clementina am glad [I]413-maria clementina found [you]234-odo , [cousin]929-cousin ; [I]413-maria clementina hardly knew how weary [I]413-maria clementina was ; "[413-maria clementina] and [she]413-maria clementina dropped languidly to the doorstep . [Odo]234-odo 's heart was beating hard . [He]234-odo knew it was only the stir of the spring sap in [his]234-odo veins , but [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina wore a look of morning brightness that might have made a soberer judgment blink . [He]234-odo turned away to examine [her]413-maria clementina saddle . As [he]234-odo did so , [he]234-odo observed that [her]413-maria clementina girth was not torn , but clean cut , as with sharp scissors . [He]234-odo glanced up in surprise , but [she]413-maria clementina sat with drooping lids , [her]413-maria clementina head thrown back against the lintel ; and repressing the question on [his]234-odo lips [he]234-odo busied [himself]234-odo with the adjustment of the saddle . When it was in place [he]234-odo turned to give [her]413-maria clementina a hand ; but [she]413-maria clementina only smiled up at [him]234-odo through [her]413-maria clementina lashes . " What ! "[413-maria clementina] said [she]413-maria clementina with an air of lovely lassitude , " are [you]234-odo so impatient to be rid of [me]413-maria clementina ? [I]413-maria clementina should have been so glad to linger [here]8091-here a little . "[413-maria clementina] [She]413-maria clementina put [her]413-maria clementina hand in [his]234-odo and let [him]234-odo lift [her]413-maria clementina to [her]413-maria clementina feet . " How cool and still it is ! Look at that little spring bubbling through the moss . Could [you]234-odo not fetch [me]413-maria clementina a drink from it ? "[413-maria clementina] [She]413-maria clementina tossed aside [her]413-maria clementina riding - hat and pushed back the hair from [her]413-maria clementina warm forehead . " [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness must not drink of the water here , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo , releasing [her]413-maria clementina hand . [She]413-maria clementina gave [him]234-odo a quick derisive glance . " Ah , true , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina cried ; " this is [the house to which [that abandoned wretch]9331-that abandoned wretch used to lure poor [Cerveno]394-cerveno]9330-the house to which that abandoned wretch used to lure poor cerveno . "[413-maria clementina] [She]413-maria clementina drew back to look at [the lodge]9166-the lodge . " Were [you]234-odo ever in [it]9166-the lodge ? "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina asked curiously . " [I]413-maria clementina should like to see how [the place]1030-the place looks . "[413-maria clementina] [She]413-maria clementina laid [her]413-maria clementina hand on the door - latch , and to [Odo]234-odo 's surprise it yielded to [her]413-maria clementina touch . " [We]9333-we 're in luck , [I]413-maria clementina vow , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina declared with a laugh . " Come [cousin]929-cousin , let [us]9333-we visit [the temple of romance]9335-the temple of romance together . "[413-maria clementina] The allusion to [Cerveno]394-cerveno jarred on [Odo]234-odo , and [he]234-odo followed [her]413-maria clementina in silence . Within doors , [the lodge]9166-the lodge was seen to consist of [a single room , gaily painted with hunting - scenes framed in garlands of stucco]4497-a single room , gaily painted with hunting - scenes framed in garlands of stucco . In the dusk [they]4498-they could just discern the outlines of carved and gilded furniture , and a Venice mirror gave back [their]4498-they faces like phantoms in a magic crystal . " This is stifling , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo impatiently . " Would [your]413-maria clementina Highness not be better in the open ? "[234-odo] " No , no , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina persisted . " Unbar the shutters and [we]9333-we shall have air enough . [I]413-maria clementina love [a deserted house]9336-a deserted house : [I]413-maria clementina have always fancied that if one came in noiselessly enough one might catch the ghosts of [the people who used to live in it]9337-the people who used to live in it . "[413-maria clementina] [He]234-odo obeyed in silence , and [the green - filtered forest]4499-the green - filtered forest noon filled [the room]782-the room with a quiver of light . A chill stole upon [Odo]234-odo as [he]234-odo looked at the dust - shrouded furniture , the painted harpsichord with green mould creeping over [its]9166-the lodge keyboard , the consoles set with empty wine flagons and goblets of Venice glass . [The place]1030-the place was like [the abandoned corpse of pleasure]4502-the abandoned corpse of pleasure . But [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina laughed and clapped [her]413-maria clementina hands . " This is enchanting , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina cried , throwing [herself]413-maria clementina into an arm - chair of threadbare damask , " and [I]413-maria clementina shall rest here while [you]234-odo refresh [me]413-maria clementina with a glass of Lacrima Christi from one of those dusty flagons . They are empty , [you]234-odo say ? Never mind , for [I]413-maria clementina have a flask of cordial in [my]413-maria clementina saddle - bag . Fetch it , [cousin]929-cousin , and wash these two glasses in the spring , that [we]9339-we may toast [all the dead lovers that have drunk out of them]9340-all the dead lovers that have drunk out of them . "[413-maria clementina] When [Odo]234-odo returned with the flask and glasses , [she]413-maria clementina had brushed the dust from a slender table of inlaid wood , and drawn a seat near [her]413-maria clementina own . [She]413-maria clementina filled the two goblets with cordial and signed to [Odo]234-odo to seat [himself]234-odo beside [her]413-maria clementina . " Why do [you]234-odo pull such a glum face ? " Is it that [you]234-odo are thinking of poor [Cerveno]394-cerveno ? On [my]413-maria clementina soul , [I]413-maria clementina question if [he]394-cerveno needs [your]234-odo pity ! [He]394-cerveno had [his]394-cerveno hour of folly , and was too gallant [a gentleman]2198-a gentleman not to pay the shot . For [my]413-maria clementina part [I]413-maria clementina would rather drink a poisoned draught than die of thirst . "[413-maria clementina] The wine was rising in waves of colour over [her]413-maria clementina throat and brow , and setting [her]413-maria clementina glass down [she]413-maria clementina suddenly laid [her]413-maria clementina ungloved hand on [Odo]234-odo 's . [She]413-maria clementina drew back , but with a look that seemed to leave [her]413-maria clementina hand in [his]234-odo . "[234-odo] [he]234-odo echoed smiling . [He]234-odo was thinking how easily [a man]8112-a man might go under in that deep blue gaze of [hers]413-maria clementina . "[413-maria clementina] [Odo]234-odo 's self - possession returned in a flash . "[4509-her] The words seemed to be driven out on [her]4509-her quick breathing , and the blood came and went in [her]4509-her cheek like [a hurried messenger]4513-a hurried messenger . [She]4509-her caught up [her]4509-her riding - hat and turned to put it on before the Venice mirror . " [[Your]899-the duchess Highness]8397-your highness is weary and the air here insalubrious . Shall [we]9380-we not ride ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . "[413-maria clementina] 2.15 . [Odo , as in duty bound]4517-odo , as in duty bound , waited the next morning on [the Duchess]899-the duchess ; but word was brought that [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness was indisposed , and could not receive [him]234-odo till evening . [He]234-odo passed a drifting and distracted day . The fear lay much upon [him]234-odo that danger threatened [Gamba]282-gamba and [[his]234-odo associates]2667-his associates ; yet to seek [them]4521-them out in the present conjuncture might be to play the stalking - horse to [[their]4521-them enemies]4522-their enemies . Moreover , [he]234-odo fancied [the Duchess]899-the duchess not incapable of using political rumours to further [her]899-the duchess private caprice ; and scenting no immediate danger [he]234-odo resolved to wait upon events . On rising from dinner [he]234-odo was surprised by a summons from [the Duke]682-the duke . The message , an unusual one at that hour , was brought by [a slender pale lad]4525-a slender pale lad , not in [his]234-odo Highness 's service , but in that of [the German physician Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern . [The boy]839-the boy , who was said to be [a Georgian rescued from [[the Grand Signior]447-the grand signior 's galleys]4528-the grand signior 's galleys , and whose small oval face was as smooth as [a girl]2391-a girl 's]4527-a georgian rescued from the grand signior 's galleys , and whose small oval face was as smooth as a girl 's , accosted [Odo]234-odo in [one of [the remoter garden alleys]4531-the remoter garden alleys]4530-one of the remoter garden alleys with the request to follow [him]839-the boy at once to [[the Duke]682-the duke 's apartment]4533-the duke 's apartment . [Odo]234-odo complied , and [[his]234-odo guide]3674-his guide loitered ahead with an air of unconcern , as though not wishing to have [his]234-odo errand guessed . As [they]4535-they passed through [the tapestry gallery preceding [the gentlemen]1449-the gentlemen 's antechamber]4536-the tapestry gallery preceding the gentlemen 's antechamber , footsteps and voices were heard within . Instantly [the boy]839-the boy was by [Odo]234-odo 's side and had drawn [him]234-odo into the embrasure of a window . A moment later [Trescorre]254-trescorre left the antechamber and walked rapidly past [[their]4535-they hiding - place]4539-their hiding - place . As soon as [he]254-trescorre was out of sight [the Georgian]4540-the georgian led [Odo]234-odo from [his]234-odo concealment and introduced [him]234-odo by a private way to [[the Duke]682-the duke 's closet]4542-the duke 's closet . [[His]234-odo Highness]941-his highness was in [[his]234-odo bed - chamber]3648-his bed - chamber ; and [Odo]234-odo , on being admitted , found [him]234-odo , still in dressing - gown and night - cap , kneeling with a disordered countenance before the ancient picture of the Last Judgment that hung on the wall facing [his]234-odo bed . [He]234-odo seemed to have forgotten that [he]234-odo had asked for [[his]234-odo kinsman]3528-his kinsman ; for on [the latter]870-the latter 's entrance [he]234-odo started up with a suspicious glance and hastily closed the panels of the picture , which ( as [Odo]234-odo now noticed ) appeared to conceal an inner painting . Then , gathering [his]234-odo dressing - gown about [him]234-odo , [he]234-odo led the way to [[his]234-odo closet]3521-his closet and bade [[his]234-odo visitor]1440-his visitor be seated . " [I]234-odo have , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , speaking in a low voice , and glancing apprehensively about [him]234-odo , " summoned [you]234-odo hither privately to speak on a subject which concerns none but [ourselves.--You]234-odo met [no one]725-no one on [your]234-odo way ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo broke off to enquire . [Odo]234-odo told [him]234-odo that [Count Trescorre]254-trescorre had passed , but without perceiving [him]234-odo . [The Duke]682-the duke seemed relieved . " [My]682-the duke private actions , "[682-the duke] said [he]682-the duke querulously , " are too jealously spied upon by [[my]682-the duke ministers]9384-my ministers . Such surveillance is an offence to [my]682-the duke authority , and [[my]682-the duke subjects]9385-my subjects shall learn that it will not frighten [me]682-the duke from [my]682-the duke course . "[682-the duke] [He]682-the duke straightened [his]682-the duke bent shoulders and tried to put on the majestic look of [his]682-the duke official effigy . " It appears , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke continued , with one of [his]682-the duke sudden changes of manner , " that [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's uncle]9387-the duchess 's uncle , [the Duke of [Monte Alloro]99-monte alloro]9388-the duke of monte alloro , has heard favourable reports of [your]899-the duchess wit and accomplishments , and is desirous of receiving [you]899-the duchess at [[his]9388-the duke of monte alloro court]4159-his court . "[682-the duke] [He]682-the duke paused , and [Odo]234-odo concealed [his]234-odo surprise behind a profound bow . " [I]682-the duke own , "[682-the duke] [the Duke]682-the duke went on , " that the invitation comes unseasonably , since [I]682-the duke should have preferred to keep [you]899-the duchess at [my]682-the duke side ; but [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness 's great age , and [his]682-the duke close kinship to [[my]682-the duke wife]9391-my wife , through whom the request is conveyed , make it impossible for [me]682-the duke to refuse . "[682-the duke] [The Duke]682-the duke again paused , as though uncertain how to proceed . At length [he]682-the duke resumed:--"I will not conceal from [you]899-the duchess that [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness is subject to the fantastical humours of [his]682-the duke age . [He]682-the duke makes it a condition that the length of [your]899-the duchess stay shall not be limited ; but should [you]899-the duchess fail to suit [his]682-the duke mood [you]899-the duchess may find [yourself]899-the duchess out of favour in a week . [He]682-the duke writes of wishing to send [you]899-the duchess on a private mission to [the court of [Naples]59-naples]9393-the court of naples ; but this may be no more than a passing whim . [I]4552-he see no way , however , but to let [you]899-the duchess go , and to hope for a favourable welcome for [you]899-the duchess . [The Duchess]899-the duchess is determined upon giving [[her]899-the duchess uncle]9184-her uncle this pleasure , and in fact has consented in return to oblige [me]4552-he in an important matter . "[4552-he] [He]4552-he flushed and averted [his]4552-he eyes . " [I]4552-he name this , "[4552-he] [he]4552-he added with an effort , " only that [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness may be aware that it depends on [herself]8209-her highness whether [I]4552-he hold to [my]4552-he side of the bargain . [Your]899-the duchess papers are already prepared and [you]899-the duchess have [my]4552-he permission to set out at [your]899-the duchess convenience . Meanwhile it were well that [you]899-the duchess should keep [your]899-the duchess preparations private , at least till [you]899-the duchess are ready to take leave . "[4552-he] And with the air of dignity [he]4552-he could still assume on occasion , [he]4552-he rose and handed [Odo]234-odo [his]4552-he passport . [Odo]234-odo left [the closet]997-the closet with a beating heart . It was clear that [his]234-odo departure from [Pianura]4-pianura was as strongly opposed by [some one in high authority]4554-some one in high authority as it was favoured by [the Duchess]899-the duchess ; and why opposed and by whom [he]234-odo could not so much as hazard a guess . In the web of court intrigues it was difficult for [the wariest]4556-the wariest to grope [his]234-odo way ; and [Odo]234-odo was still new to such entanglements . [His]234-odo first sensation was one of release , of a future suddenly enlarged and cleared . The door was open again to opportunity , and [he]234-odo was of an age to greet the unexpected like [a bride]4557-a bride . Only one thought disturbed [him]234-odo . It was clear that [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina had paid high for [his]234-odo security ; and did not [her]413-maria clementina sacrifice , whatever its nature , constitute a claim upon [his]234-odo future ? In sending [him]234-odo to [[her]413-maria clementina uncle]9184-her uncle , whose known favourite [she]413-maria clementina was , [she]413-maria clementina did not let [him]234-odo out of [her]413-maria clementina hand . If [he]234-odo accepted this chance of escape [he]234-odo must hereafter come and go as [she]413-maria clementina bade . At the thought , [his]234-odo bounding fancy slunk back humbled . [He]234-odo saw [himself]234-odo as [[Trescorre]254-trescorre 's successor]4559-trescorre 's successor , [[his]234-odo sovereign 's official lover]4560-his sovereign 's official lover , taking up again , under more difficult circumstances , and without the zest of inexperience , the dull routine of [his]234-odo former bondage . No , a thousand times no ; [he]234-odo would fetter [himself]234-odo to [no woman]4561-no woman 's fancy ! Better find a pretext for staying in [Pianura]4-pianura , affront [the Duchess]899-the duchess by refusing [her]899-the duchess aid , risk [his]234-odo prospects , [his]234-odo life even , than bow [his]234-odo neck twice to the same yoke . All [her]899-the duchess charm vanished in this vision of unwilling subjection ... Disturbed by these considerations , and anxious to compose [his]234-odo spirits , [Odo]234-odo bethought [himself]234-odo of taking refuge in [[the Bishop]1234-the bishop 's company]4250-the bishop 's company . Here at least the atmosphere was clear of mystery : [the Bishop]1234-the bishop held aloof from political intrigue and breathed an air untainted by the odium theologicum . [Odo]234-odo found [[his]234-odo lordship]8266-his lordship seated in [the cool tessellated saloon which contained [his]234-odo chiefest treasures]4567-the cool tessellated saloon which contained his chiefest treasures -- marble busts ranged on pedestals between the windows , the bronze Venus Callipyge , and various tables of pietra commessa set out with vases and tazzas of antique pattern . A knot of virtuosi gathered about one of these tables were engaged in examining a collection of engraved gems displayed by a lapidary of [Florence]88-florence ; while [others]1388-others inspected a Greek manuscript which [the Bishop]1234-the bishop had lately received from [Syria]111-syria . Beyond the windows , [a cedrario or orange - walk]4570-a cedrario or orange - walk stretched [its]4570-a cedrario or orange - walk sunlit vista to [the terrace]4571-the terrace above [the river]2315-the river ; and the black cassocks of [one or two priests who were strolling in the clear green shade of [a pleached alley]4574-a pleached alley]4573-one or two priests who were strolling in the clear green shade of a pleached alley made pleasant spots of dimness in the scene . Even here , however , [Odo]234-odo was aware of a certain disquietude . [[The Bishop]1234-the bishop 's visitors]4576-the bishop 's visitors , instead of engaging in animated disputations over [[his]234-odo lordship]8266-his lordship 's treasures , showed a disposition to walk apart , conversing in low tones ; and [he]1234-the bishop [himself]1234-the bishop , presently complaining of the heat , invited [Odo]234-odo to accompany [him]1234-the bishop to [the grot beneath [the terrace]4571-the terrace]4578-the grot beneath the terrace . In [this shaded retreat]4580-this shaded retreat , studded with shells and coral and cooled by an artificial wind forced through the conchs of marble Tritons , [[his]234-odo lordship]8266-his lordship at once began to speak of the rumours of public disaffection . " As [you]9397-you know , "[8266-his lordship] said [he]8266-his lordship , " [my]8266-his lordship duties and tastes alike seclude [me]8266-his lordship from political intrigue , and the scandal of the day seldom travels beyond [[my]8266-his lordship kitchens]9398-my kitchens . But as creaking signboards announce a storm , the hints and whispers of [[my]8266-his lordship household]9399-my household tell [me]8266-his lordship there is mischief abroad . [My]8266-his lordship position protects [me]8266-his lordship from personal risk , and [my]8266-his lordship lack of ambition from political enmity ; for it is notorious [I]8266-his lordship would barter the highest honours in [the state]2921-the state for a Greek vase or a bronze of Herculanaeum -- not to mention the famous Venus of [Giorgione]427-giorgione , which , if report be true , [[his]234-odo Highness]941-his highness has burned at [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio 's instigation . But [yours]9397-you , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , is a less sheltered walk , and perhaps a friendly warning may be of service . Yet , "[8266-his lordship] [he]8266-his lordship added after a pause , " a warning [I]8266-his lordship can scarce call it , since [I]8266-his lordship know not from what quarter the danger impends . Proximus ardet [Ucalegon]113-ucalegon ; but there is no telling which way the flames may spread . [I]8266-his lordship can only advise [you]9397-you that [the Duke]682-the duke 's growing infatuation for [[his]682-the duke German magician]9404-his german magician has bred the most violent discontent among [[his]682-the duke subjects]8419-his subjects , and that [both parties]9306-both parties appear resolved to use this disaffection to [their]9306-both parties advantage . It is said [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness intends to subject [the little prince]3148-the little prince to some mysterious treatment connected with the rites of [the Egyptian priesthood]8933-the egyptian priesthood , of whose secret doctrine [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern pretends to be [an adept]9410-an adept . Yesterday it was bruited that [the Duchess]899-the duchess loudly opposed the experiment ; this afternoon it is given out that [she]899-the duchess has yielded . What the result may be , [none]1118-none can foresee ; but whichever way the storm blows , the chief danger probably threatens those who have had any connection with the secret societies known to exist in [the duchy]1310-the duchy . "[8266-his lordship] [Odo]234-odo listened attentively , but without betraying any great surprise ; and [the Bishop]1234-the bishop , evidently reassured by [his]1234-the bishop composure , suggested that , the heat of the day having declined , [they]4583-their should visit the new Indian pheasants in [[his]1234-the bishop volary]4584-his volary . [The Bishop]1234-the bishop 's hints had not helped [[his]1234-the bishop listener]3777-his listener to a decision . [Odo]234-odo indeed gave Cantapresto orders to prepare as privately as possible for [their]4583-their departure ; but rather to appear to be carrying out [the Duke]682-the duke 's instructions than with any fixed intention of so doing . How to find a pretext for remaining [he]682-the duke was yet uncertain . To disobey [the Duke]682-the duke was impossible ; but in the general state of tension it seemed likely enough that both [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness and [the Duchess]899-the duchess might change [their]4583-their minds within the next twenty - four hours . [He]682-the duke was reluctant to appear that evening in [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's circle ; but the command was not to be evaded , and [he]682-the duke went thither resolved to excuse [himself]682-the duke early . [He]682-the duke found [her]899-the duchess Highness surrounded by the usual rout that attended [her]899-the duchess . [She]899-the duchess was [herself]899-the duchess in a mood of wild mirth , occasioned by the drolleries of [an automatic female figure which [a travelling showman introduced by [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto had obtained leave to display at [court]8243-court]4593-a travelling showman introduced by cantapresto had obtained leave to display at court]4592-an automatic female figure which a travelling showman introduced by cantapresto had obtained leave to display at court . [This lively puppet]4595-this lively puppet performed with surprising skill on the harpsichord , giving [the company]1753-the company , among other novelties , selections from [the maestro Piccini]4597-the maestro piccini 's latest opera and a concerto of [the German composer Gluck]4598-the german composer gluck . [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina seemed at first unaware of [[her]413-maria clementina kinsman]4599-her kinsman 's presence , and [he]682-the duke began to hope [he]682-the duke might avoid any private talk with [her]413-maria clementina ; but when [the automaton]4600-the automaton had been dismissed and the card - tables were preparing , [one of [[her]413-maria clementina gentlemen]4457-her gentlemen]4601-one of her gentlemen summoned [him]682-the duke to [her]413-maria clementina side . As usual , [she]413-maria clementina was highly rouged in the French fashion , and [her]413-maria clementina cold blue eyes had a light which set off the extraordinary fairness of [her]413-maria clementina skin . " [Cousin]446-cousin , "[413-maria clementina] said [she]413-maria clementina at once , " have [you]446-cousin [your]446-cousin papers ? "[413-maria clementina] [Her]413-maria clementina tone was haughty and yet eager , as though [she]413-maria clementina scorned to show [herself]413-maria clementina concerned , yet would not have had [him]682-the duke believe in [her]413-maria clementina indifference . [Odo]234-odo bowed without speaking . " And when do [you]446-cousin set out ? "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina continued . " [[My]413-maria clementina good uncle]9414-my good uncle is impatient to receive [you]446-cousin . "[413-maria clementina] " At the earliest moment , [madam]8129-madam , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke replied with some hesitation . The hesitation was not lost on [her]413-maria clementina and [he]682-the duke saw [her]413-maria clementina flush through [her]413-maria clementina rouge . " Ah , "[413-maria clementina] said [she]413-maria clementina in a low voice , " the earliest moment is none too early!--Do [you]446-cousin go tomorrow ? "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina persisted ; but just then [Trescorre]254-trescorre advanced toward [them]4603-them , and under a burst of assumed merriment [she]413-maria clementina privately signed to [Odo]234-odo to withdraw . [He]682-the duke was glad to make [his]682-the duke escape , for the sense of walking among hidden pitfalls was growing on [him]682-the duke . That [he]682-the duke had acquitted [himself]682-the duke awkwardly with [the Duchess]899-the duchess [he]682-the duke was well aware ; but [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's interruption had at least enabled [him]682-the duke to gain time . An increasing unwillingness to leave [Pianura]290-pianura had replaced [his]682-the duke former impatience to be gone . The reluctance to desert [[his]682-the duke friends]2637-his friends was coupled with a boyish desire to stay and see the game out ; and behind all [his]682-the duke other impulses lurked the instinctive resistance to any feminine influence save one . The next morning [he]682-the duke half - expected another message from [the Duchess]899-the duchess ; but none came , and [he]682-the duke judged [her]899-the duchess to be gravely offended . [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto appeared early with the rumour that some kind of magical ceremony was to be performed that evening in [the palace]768-the palace ; and toward noon [the Georgian boy]4608-the georgian boy again came privately to [Odo]234-odo and requested [him]234-odo to wait on [the Duke]682-the duke when [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness rose from supper . This increased [Odo]234-odo 's fears for [Gamba]282-gamba , [Andreoni]441-andreoni and [the other reformers]4611-the other reformers ; yet [he]234-odo dared neither seek [them]2637-his friends out in person nor entrust a message to [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto . As the day passed , however , [he]682-the duke began to throw off [his]682-the duke apprehensions . It was not the first time since [he]682-the duke had come to [Pianura]4-pianura that there had been ominous talk of political disturbances , and [he]682-the duke knew that [Gamba]282-gamba and [[his]282-gamba friends]2637-his friends were not without means of getting under [shelter]4613-shelter . As to [his]682-the duke own risk , [he]682-the duke did not give it a thought . [He]682-the duke was not of an age or a temper to weigh personal danger against the excitement of conflict ; and as evening drew on [he]682-the duke found [himself]682-the duke wondering with some impatience if after all nothing unusual would happen . [He]682-the duke supped alone , and at the appointed hour proceeded to [[the Duke]682-the duke 's apartments]3612-the duke 's apartments , taking no farther precaution than to carry [his]682-the duke passport about [him]682-the duke . [The palace]768-the palace seemed deserted . [Everywhere]448-everywhere an air of apprehension and mystery hung over [the long corridors]847-the long corridors and dimly - lit antechambers . The day had been sultry , with a low sky foreboding great heat , and not a breath of air entered at the windows . There were [few persons about]4618-few persons about , but [one or two beggars]4619-one or two beggars lurked as usual on the landings of [the great staircase]4620-the great staircase , and [Odo]234-odo , in passing , felt [his]234-odo sleeve touched by [a woman cowering under the marble ramp in the shadow thrown by a colossal Caesar]4621-a woman cowering under the marble ramp in the shadow thrown by a colossal caesar . Looking down , [he]234-odo heard a voice beg for alms , and as [he]234-odo gave it [the woman]8976-the woman pressed a paper into [his]234-odo hand and slipped away through the darkness . [Odo]234-odo hastened on till [he]234-odo could assure [himself]234-odo of being unobserved ; then [he]234-odo unfolded the paper and read these words in [Gamba]282-gamba 's hand : " Have no fear for [any one]797-any one 's safety but [your]234-odo own . "[234-odo] With a sense of relief [he]234-odo hid the message and entered [[the Duke]682-the duke 's antechamber]4624-the duke 's antechamber . Here [he]234-odo was received by [[Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern 's Oriental servant , who , with a mute salutation , led [him]234-odo into [a large room where [the Duke]682-the duke 's pages usually waited]4626-a large room where the duke 's pages usually waited]4625-heiligenstern 's oriental servant , who , with a mute salutation , led him into a large room where the duke 's pages usually waited . The walls of [this apartment]2474-this apartment had been concealed under hangings of black silk worked with cabalistic devices . Oil - lamps set on tripods of antique design shed a faint light over [the company seated at one end of [the room]782-the room]4629-the company seated at one end of the room , among whom [Odo]234-odo recognised [the chief dignitaries of [the court]814-the court]4631-the chief dignitaries of the court . [The ladies]1106-the ladies looked pale but curious , [the men for the most part]4634-the men for the most part indifferent or disapproving . Intense quietness prevailed , broken only by the soft opening and closing of the door through which [the guests]2672-the guests were admitted . Presently [the Duke]682-the duke and [Duchess]419-duchess emerged from [[[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness 's closet]3733-his highness 's closet . [They]4639-they were followed by [Prince Ferrante]414-prince ferrante , supported by [[his]414-prince ferrante governor]1208-his governor and [[his]414-prince ferrante dwarf]4641-his dwarf , and robed in a silken dressing - gown which hung in voluminous folds about [his]414-prince ferrante little shrunken body . [[Their]4639-they Highnesses]9108-their highnesses seated [themselves]9108-their highnesses in two armchairs in front of [the court]814-the court , and [the little prince]3148-the little prince reclined beside [[his]3148-the little prince mother]664-his mother . No sooner had [they]4639-they taken [their]4639-they places than [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern stepped forth , wearing [a doctor]2519-a doctor 's gown and a quaintly - shaped bonnet or mitre . In [his]397-heiligenstern long robes and strange headdress [he]397-heiligenstern looked extraordinarily tall and pale , and [his]397-heiligenstern features had the glassy - eyed fixity of an ancient mask . [He]397-heiligenstern was followed by [[his]397-heiligenstern two attendants]4647-his two attendants , [the Oriental]4648-the oriental carrying a frame - work of polished metal , not unlike a low narrow bed , which [he]397-heiligenstern set down in the middle of [the room]782-the room ; while [the Georgian lad]4650-the georgian lad , who had exchanged [his]4650-the georgian lad fustanella and embroidered jacket for a flowing white robe , bore in [his]4650-the georgian lad hands a crystal globe set in a gold stand . Having reverently placed it on a small table , [the boy]839-the boy , at a signal from [[his]839-the boy master]2377-his master , drew forth a phial and dropped its contents into a bronze vat or brazier which stood at the far end of [the room]782-the room . Instantly clouds of perfumed vapour filled the air , and as these dispersed it was seen that the black hangings of the walls had vanished with them , and [the spectators]1642-the spectators found [themselves]1642-the spectators seated in a kind of open temple through which the eye travelled down [colonnaded vistas set with statues and fountains]4655-colonnaded vistas set with statues and fountains . This magical prospect was bathed in sunlight , and [Odo]234-odo observed that , though the lamps had gone out , the same brightness suffused [the room]782-the room and illuminated the wondering faces of [the audience]4657-the audience . [The little prince]3148-the little prince uttered a cry of delight , and [the magician]4659-the magician stepped forward , raising a long white wand in [his]4659-the magician hand . " This , "[4659-the magician] said [he]4659-the magician , in measured accents , " is an evocation of the Temple of Health , into whose blissful precincts the wisdom of [the ancients]4196-the ancients was able to lead [the sufferer who put [his]9418-the sufferer who put his trust in them trust in [them]4196-the ancients]9418-the sufferer who put his trust in them . This deceptio visus , or product of rhabdomancy , easily effected by [an adept of the Egyptian mysteries]9419-an adept of the egyptian mysteries , is designed but to prefigure the reality which awaits [those who seek health]9420-those who seek health through the ministry of [the disciples of [Iamblichus]449-iamblichus]9421-the disciples of iamblichus . It is no longer denied among [men of learning]9422-men of learning that [those who have been instructed in the secret doctrine of the ancients]9423-those who have been instructed in the secret doctrine of the ancients are able , by certain correspondences of nature , revealed only to [the initiated]9424-the initiated , to act on the inanimate world about [them]9424-the initiated , and on the animal economy , by means beyond the common capabilities of [man]2185-man . "[4659-the magician] [He]4659-the magician paused a moment , and then , turning with a low bow to [the Duke]682-the duke , enquired whether [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness desired the rites to proceed . [The Duke]682-the duke signed [his]682-the duke assent , and [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern , raising [his]397-heiligenstern wand , evoked another volume of mist . This time it was shot through with green flames , and as the wild light subsided [the room]782-the room was once more revealed with [its]782-the room black hangings , and the lamps flickered into life again . After another pause , doubtless intended to increase the tension of [the spectators]1642-the spectators , [the magician]4659-the magician bade [[his]4659-the magician servant]2252-his servant place the crystal before [him]4659-the magician . [He]4659-the magician then raised [his]4659-the magician hands as if in prayer , speaking in a strange chanting jargon , in which [Odo]234-odo detected fragments of Greek and Latin , and the recurring names of [the Judaic demons and angels]4667-the judaic demons and angels . As this ceased [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern beckoned to [the Georgian boy]4608-the georgian boy , who approached [him]397-heiligenstern with bowed head and reverently folded hands . " [[Your]941-his highness Highness]8397-your highness , "[397-heiligenstern] said [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern , " and [this distinguished company]9427-this distinguished company , are doubtless familiar with the magic crystal of [the ancients]4196-the ancients , in which the future may be deciphered by the pure in heart . [This lad]9429-this lad , whom [I]397-heiligenstern rescued from slavery and have bred to [my]397-heiligenstern service in the solemn rites of [the priesthood of [Isis]450-isis]9430-the priesthood of isis , is as clear in spirit as the crystal which stands before [you]941-his highness . The future lies open to [him]9429-this lad in this translucent sphere and [he]9429-this lad is prepared to disclose it at [your]941-his highness bidding . "[397-heiligenstern] There was a moment 's silence ; but on [the magician]4659-the magician 's repeating [his]4659-the magician enquiry [the Duke]682-the duke said : " Let [the boy]839-the boy tell [me]682-the duke what [he]839-the boy sees . "[682-the duke] [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern at once laid [his]397-heiligenstern hands on [[his]397-heiligenstern acolyte]4671-his acolyte 's head and murmured a few words over [him]4671-his acolyte ; then [the boy]839-the boy advanced and bent devoutly above the crystal . Almost immediately the globe was seen to cloud , as though suffused with milk ; the cloud gradually faded and [the boy]839-the boy began to speak in a low hesitating tone . " [I]839-the boy see , "[839-the boy] [he]839-the boy said , " [I]839-the boy see a face ... a fair face ... "[839-the boy] [He]839-the boy faltered and glanced up almost apprehensively at [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern , whose gaze remained impenetrable . [The boy]839-the boy began to tremble . " [I]839-the boy see nothing , "[839-the boy] [he]839-the boy said in a whisper . " There is one here purer than [I]839-the boy ... the crystal will not speak for [me]839-the boy in that other 's presence ... "[839-the boy] " Who is that other ? "[397-heiligenstern] [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern asked . [The boy]839-the boy fixed [his]839-the boy eyes on [the little prince]3148-the little prince . " Will [[your]899-the duchess Highness]8397-your highness , "[397-heiligenstern] [he]397-heiligenstern asked , " permit [the prince]8981-the prince to look into the sacred sphere ? Instantly the former phenomenon was repeated , the globe clouding and then clearing itself like a pool after rain . " [I]397-heiligenstern see [a beautiful place]9436-a beautiful place , "[397-heiligenstern] [he]397-heiligenstern began , [his]397-heiligenstern small fluting voice rising like a bird 's pipe in the stillness , " a place a thousand times more beautiful than this ... like [a garden]4126-a garden ... full of [golden - haired children]9438-golden - haired children ... with beautiful strange toys in [their]9438-golden - haired children hands ... "[682-the duke] [The boy]839-the boy gazed in silence ; then [he]839-the boy broke out : " Ah , now [we]9453-we are in [the palace]768-the palace ... [I]839-the boy see [[your]839-the boy Highness]8397-your highness 's cabinet ... no , it is the bedchamber ... it is night ... and [I]839-the boy see [[your]839-the boy Highness]8397-your highness lying asleep ... very still ... very still ... [[your]839-the boy Highness]8397-your highness wears the scapular received last Easter from [his]8397-your highness Holiness ... It is very dark ... Oh , now a light begins to shine ... where does it come from ? Through the door ? No , there is no door on that side of [the room]782-the room ...
