[I]839-the boy see"--his[839-the boy] voice mounted to a cry--"The old picture at the foot of the bed ... the picture with [the wicked people]9459-the wicked people burning in it ... has opened like a door ... the light is shining through it ... and now [a lady]695-a lady steps out from the wall behind the picture ... oh , so beautiful ... [she]695-a lady has yellow hair , as yellow as [my]839-the boy mother's ... but longer ... oh , much longer ... [she]695-a lady carries a rose in [her]695-a lady hand ... and there are white doves flying about [her]695-a lady shoulders ... "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke stammered . " The fever is on [the child]686-the child ... this agitation is ... most pernicious ... Cover the crystal , [I]682-the duke say ! "[682-the duke] [He]682-the duke sank back , [his]682-the duke forehead damp with perspiration . In an instant the crystal had been removed , and [Prince Ferrante]414-prince ferrante carried back to [[his]414-prince ferrante mother]664-his mother 's side . [The boy]839-the boy seemed in nowise affected by [[his]414-prince ferrante father]667-his father 's commotion . [His]682-the duke eyes burned with excitement , and [he]682-the duke sat up eagerly , as though not to miss a detail of what was going forward . " [I]682-the duke want to see some more beautiful things ! "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke insisted . [The Duke]682-the duke sat speechless , a fallen heap in [his]682-the duke chair , and [the courtiers]3715-the courtiers looked at [each other]3086-each other , [their]3715-the courtiers faces shifting spectrally in the faint light , like phantom travellers waiting to be ferried across [some mysterious river]4702-some mysterious river . At length [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern advanced and with every mark of deference addressed [himself]397-heiligenstern to [the Duke]682-the duke . " [[Your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness , "[397-heiligenstern] said [he]397-heiligenstern quietly , " need be under no apprehension as to the effect produced upon [the prince]8981-the prince . The magic crystal , as [[your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness is aware , is under the protection of the blessed spirits , and its revelations can not harm [those who are pure - minded enough to receive [them]9468-them]9467-those who are pure - minded enough to receive them . But the chief purpose of [this assemblage]9469-this assemblage was to witness the communication of vital force to [the prince]8981-the prince , by means of the electrical current . The crystal , by revealing its secrets to [the prince]8981-the prince , has testified to [his]8981-the prince perfect purity of mind , and thus declared [him]8981-the prince to be in a peculiarly fit state to receive what may be designated as the Sacrament of the new faith . "[397-heiligenstern] A murmur ran through [the room]782-the room , but [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern continued without wavering : " [I]397-heiligenstern mean thereby to describe that natural religion which , by instructing [its adepts in the use of the hidden potencies of earth and air]9472-its adepts in the use of the hidden potencies of earth and air , testifies afresh to the power of [the unseen Maker of the Universe]9473-the unseen maker of the universe . "[397-heiligenstern] The murmur subsided , and [the Duke]682-the duke , regaining [his]682-the duke voice , said with an assumption of authority : " Let the treatment begin . "[682-the duke] [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern immediately spoke a word to [the Oriental]4648-the oriental , who bent over the metal bed which had been set up in the middle of [the room]782-the room . As [he]397-heiligenstern did so the air again darkened and the figures of [the magician]4659-the magician and [[his]4659-the magician assistants]4709-his assistants were discernible only as flitting shades in the obscurity . Suddenly a soft pure light overflowed [the room]782-the room , the perfume of flowers filled the air , and music seemed to steal out of the very walls . [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern whispered to [the governor]4711-the governor and between [them]4712-them [they]4712-them lifted [the little prince]3148-the little prince from [his]3148-the little prince chair and laid [him]3148-the little prince gently on the bed . [The magician]4659-the magician then leaned over [the boy]839-the boy with a slow weaving motion of the hands . "[4659-the magician] [The boy]839-the boy smiled back at [him]4659-the magician and [he]3148-the little prince continued to bend above the bed with flitting hands . " A prickling ... such a soft warm prickling ... as if [my]4659-the magician blood were sunshine with motes dancing in it ... or as if that sparkling wine of [France]22-france were running all over [my]4659-the magician body . "[4659-the magician] " It is an agreeable sensation , [[your]839-the boy Highness]8397-your highness ? "[839-the boy] [The boy]839-the boy nodded . " It is well with [[your]839-the boy Highness]8397-your highness ? "[839-the boy] " Very well . "[397-heiligenstern] [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern began a loud rhythmic chant , and gradually the air darkened , but with the mild dimness of a summer twilight , through which sparks could be seen flickering like fire - flies about [the reclining prince]4720-the reclining prince . The hush grew deeper ; but in the stillness [Odo]234-odo became aware of some unseen influence that seemed to envelope [him]234-odo in waves of exquisite sensation . It was as though the vast silence of the night had poured into [the room]782-the room and , like a dark tepid sea , was lapping about [his]234-odo body and rising to [his]234-odo lips . [His]234-odo thoughts , dissolved into emotion , seemed to waver and float on the stillness like sea - weed on the lift of the tide . [He]234-odo stood spell - bound , lulled , yielding [himself]234-odo to a blissful dissolution . Suddenly [he]234-odo became aware that the hush was too intense , too complete ; and a moment later , as though stretched to the cracking - point , it burst terrifically into sound . A huge uproar shook [the room]782-the room , crashing through [it]782-the room like a tangible mass . The sparks whirled in a menacing dance round [the little prince]3148-the little prince 's body , and , abruptly blotted , left a deeper darkness , in which the confused herding movements of [startled figures]4724-startled figures were indistinguishably merged . A flash of silence followed ; then the liberated forces of the night broke in rain and thunder on the rocking walls of [the room]782-the room . " Light -- light ! "[1607-some one] [some one]1607-some one stammered ; and at the same moment a door was flung open , admitting a burst of candle - light and [a group of figures in ecclesiastical dress]4727-a group of figures in ecclesiastical dress , against which the white gown and black hood of [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio detached [themselves]4727-a group of figures in ecclesiastical dress . "[3738-the dominican] Even in that moment of profound disarray the name sent a deeper shudder through [[his]3738-the dominican hearers]4730-his hearers . " It has been [my]4746-an ecclesiastic who had entered the room in his train duty to track [this man]4205-this man 's career from its ignoble beginning to its infamous culmination , and [I]4746-an ecclesiastic who had entered the room in his train have been able to place in the hands of [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office the most complete proofs of [his]4205-this man guilt . [The so - called Count Heiligenstern]9495-the so - called count heiligenstern is [the son of [a tailor in [a small village of]9498-a small village of [Pomerania]116-pomerania]9497-a tailor in a small village of pomerania]9496-the son of a tailor in a small village of pomerania . That [they]9501-this precious couple preach atheism and tyrannicide [I]4746-an ecclesiastic who had entered the room in his train need not tell [[your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness ; but it is less generally known that [they]9501-this precious couple have made these infamous doctrines the cloak of private vices from which even paganism would have recoiled . [The man now before [me]4746-an ecclesiastic who had entered the room in his train]9503-the man now before me , among other open offences against society , is known to have seduced [a young girl of [noble family in [Ratisbon]117-ratisbon]9505-noble family in ratisbon and to have murdered [[her]9504-a young girl of noble family in ratisbon and to have murdered her child child]9171-her child]9504-a young girl of noble family in ratisbon and to have murdered her child . "[4746-an ecclesiastic who had entered the room in his train] This indictment , pronounced with an absence of emotion which made each word cut the air like the separate stroke of a lash , was followed by a prolonged silence ; then [one of [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's ladies]9038-the duchess 's ladies]4753-one of the duchess 's ladies cried out suddenly and burst into tears . This was the signal for a general outbreak . [The room]782-the room was filled with a confusion of voices , and among the groups surging about [him]4757-him [Odo]234-odo noticed [a number of [the Duke]682-the duke 's sbirri]4758-a number of the duke 's sbirri making [their]4758-a number of the duke 's sbirri way quietly through [the crowd]1568-the crowd . [The notary of the Holy Office]4761-the notary of the holy office advanced toward [Heiligenstern]397-heiligenstern , who had placed [himself]4757-him against the wall , with one arm flung about [[his]4757-him trembling acolyte]4762-his trembling acolyte . [The Duchess]899-the duchess , [[her]899-the duchess boy]4764-her boy still clasped against [her]899-the duchess , remained proudly seated ; but [her]899-the duchess eyes met [Odo]234-odo 's in a glance of terrified entreaty , and at the same instant [he]234-odo felt a clutch on [his]234-odo sleeve and heard [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's whisper . " [Cavaliere]234-odo , [a boat]9515-a boat waits at [the landing below [the tanners ' lane]9517-the tanners ' lane]9516-the landing below the tanners ' lane .
