[The young French gentleman ( whom [he]234-odo named as [the Marquis de Coeur - Volant]473-the marquis de coeur - volant ) had come to [Italy]5-italy some months previously on the grand tour , and having fallen a victim to the charms of [Venice]41-venice]5217-the young french gentleman ( whom he named as the marquis de coeur - volant ) had come to italy some months previously on the grand tour , and having fallen a victim to the charms of venice , had declared that , instead of continuing on [his]234-odo travels , [he]234-odo meant to complete [his]234-odo education in [that famous school of pleasure]5218-that famous school of pleasure . [Miranda]384-miranda was of course selected as [prima amorosa]5230-prima amorosa ; and [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , under [Castelrovinato]391-coeur - volant 's guidance , had then set out to collect the rest of [the company]1753-the company . This [he]1107-the marquess had succeeded in doing , and was now returning to [Bellocchio]156-bellocchio , where [Miranda]384-miranda was to meet [them]5233-them . Meanwhile supper was succeeded by music and dancing , and [the company]1753-the company broke up only in time to proceed to the landing - place where [[their]1753-the company barge]5242-their barge awaited [them]1753-the company . This was [a private burchiello of [the Procuratore 's]5244-the procuratore 's with [a commodious antechamber for [the servants]755-the servants]5245-a commodious antechamber for the servants , and [a cabin cushioned in damask]5247-a cabin cushioned in damask]5243-a private burchiello of the procuratore 's with a commodious antechamber for the servants , and a cabin cushioned in damask . Into [this agreeable retreat]5248-this agreeable retreat [the actresses]5249-the actresses were packed with all [their]5249-the actresses bags and band - boxes ; and [their]5249-the actresses travelling - cloaks being rolled into pillows , [they]5249-the actresses were soon asleep in a huddle of tumbled finery . [Odo]234-odo and [[his]234-odo host]4231-his host preferred to take the air on deck . The sun was rising above [the willow - clad banks of [the Brenta]149-the brenta]5251-the willow - clad banks of the brenta , and it was pleasant to glide in the clear early light past [sleeping gardens]5252-sleeping gardens and [villas]1871-villas , and vineyards where [the peasants]8472-the peasants were already at work . The wind setting from [the sea]5255-the sea , [they]1753-the company travelled slowly and had full leisure to view the succession of splendid seats interspersed with [gardens]858-gardens , [the thriving villages]5257-the thriving villages , and the poplar - groves festooned with vines . [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant spoke eloquently of the pleasures to be enjoyed in this delightful season of the villeggiatura . " Nowhere , "[391-coeur - volant] said [he]391-coeur - volant , " do [people]1578-people take [their]1578-people pleasures so easily and naturally as in [Venice]41-venice . [[My]5258-i countrymen]8773-my countrymen claim a superiority in this art , and it may be [they]8773-my countrymen possessed it a generation ago . But what [a morose place]9631-a morose place is [France]22-france become since philosophy has dethroned enjoyment ! If [you]9632-you go on a visit to one of [[[our]9633-our noblemen]9634-our noblemen 's seats]9635-our noblemen 's seats , what do [you]9632-you find [there]606-there , [I]5258-i ask ? Cards , comedies , music , the opportunity for an agreeable intrigue in the society of [[your]9632-you equals]9637-your equals ? No -- but [a hostess]9638-a hostess engaged in suckling and bathing [[her]9638-a hostess brats]9639-her brats , or in studying chemistry and optics with [some dirty school - master , who is given the seat of honour at table and [a pavilion in [the park]9642-the park to which [he]9640-some dirty school - master , who is given the seat of honour at table and a pavilion in the park to which he may retire when weary of the homage of the great may retire when weary of the homage of [the great]9643-the great]9641-a pavilion in the park to which he may retire when weary of the homage of the great]9640-some dirty school - master , who is given the seat of honour at table and a pavilion in the park to which he may retire when weary of the homage of the great ; while as for [the host]9644-the host , [he]9640-some dirty school - master , who is given the seat of honour at table and a pavilion in the park to which he may retire when weary of the homage of the great is busy discussing education or political economy with [[his]9640-some dirty school - master , who is given the seat of honour at table and a pavilion in the park to which he may retire when weary of the homage of the great unfortunate guests]9645-his unfortunate guests , if , indeed , [he]9640-some dirty school - master , who is given the seat of honour at table and a pavilion in the park to which he may retire when weary of the homage of the great is not dragging [them]9645-his unfortunate guests through leagues of mud and dust to inspect [his]9640-some dirty school - master , who is given the seat of honour at table and a pavilion in the park to which he may retire when weary of the homage of the great latest experiments in forestry and agriculture , or to hear [a pack of snuffling school - children]9646-a pack of snuffling school - children singing hymns to [the God of Nature]9647-the god of nature ! And what , "[5258-i] [he]5258-i continued , " is the result of it all ? [The peasants]8472-the peasants are starving , the taxes are increasing , [the virtuous landlords]9649-the virtuous landlords are ruining [themselves]9649-the virtuous landlords in farming on scientific principles , [the tradespeople]9650-the tradespeople are grumbling because [the nobility]1665-the nobility do not spend [their]1665-the nobility money in [Paris]27-paris , [the court]814-the court is dull , [the clergy]1929-the clergy are furious , [the Queen mopes]475-the queen mopes , [the King]658-the king is frightened , and [the whole French people]9655-the whole french people are yawning [themselves]9655-the whole french people to death from [Normandy]157-normandy to [Provence]158-provence . "[5258-i] " Yes , "[5258-i] said [Castelrovinato]391-coeur - volant with [his]5258-i melancholy smile , " the test of success is to have had one 's money 's worth ; but experience , which is dried pleasure , is at best a dusty diet , as [we]9656-we know . Yonder , in [a fold of [those hills]9658-those hills]9657-a fold of those hills , "[5258-i] [he]5258-i added , pointing to [the cluster of Euganean mountains just faintly pencilled above [the plain]1139-the plain]5259-the cluster of euganean mountains just faintly pencilled above the plain , " lies [the little fief from which [I]5258-i take [my]5258-i name]9659-the little fief from which i take my name . Acre by acre , tree by tree , it has gone to pay for [my]5258-i experiments , not in agriculture but in pleasure ; and whenever [I]5258-i look over at [it]9659-the little fief from which i take my name from [Venice]41-venice and reflect on what each rood of ground or trunk of tree has purchased , [I]5258-i wonder to see [my]5258-i life as bare as ever for all that [I]5258-i have spent on it . "[5258-i] [The young Marquess]3839-the young marquess shrugged [his]3839-the young marquess shoulders . " And would [your]3839-the young marquess life , "[3839-the young marquess] [he]3839-the young marquess exclaimed , " have been a whit less bare had [you]3839-the young marquess passed it in [[your]3839-the young marquess ancestral keep]9660-your ancestral keep among [those windy hills]9661-those windy hills , in the company of [swineherds and charcoal - burners]9662-swineherds and charcoal - burners , with [a milk - maid for [[your]3839-the young marquess mistress]9664-your mistress]9663-a milk - maid for your mistress and [the village priest for [[your]3839-the young marquess partner at picquet]9666-your partner at picquet]9665-the village priest for your partner at picquet ? "[3839-the young marquess] " Perhaps not , "[905-the other] [the other]905-the other agreed . " There is a tale of [a man who spent [his]9667-a man who spent his life in wishing he had lived differently life in wishing [he]9667-a man who spent his life in wishing he had lived differently had lived differently]9667-a man who spent his life in wishing he had lived differently ; and when [he]9667-a man who spent his life in wishing he had lived differently died [he]9667-a man who spent his life in wishing he had lived differently was surrounded by a throng of spectral shapes , [each one exactly like [the other]905-the other , who , on [his]391-coeur - volant asking what [they]9670-they were]9668-each one exactly like the other , who , on his asking what they were , replied : ' [We]9670-they are all the different lives [you]3839-the young marquess might have lived . ' "[905-the other] " If [you]3839-the young marquess are going to tell ghost - stories , "[391-coeur - volant] cried [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant , " [I]391-coeur - volant will call for a bottle of Canary ! "[391-coeur - volant] " And [I]813-the count , "[813-the count] rejoined [the Count]813-the count good - humouredly , " will try to coax [the ladies]1106-the ladies forth with a song ; "[813-the count] and picking up [his]813-the count lute , which always lay within reach , [he]813-the count began to sing in the Venetian dialect:-- There 's [a villa]5264-a villa on [the Brenta]149-the brenta Where the statues , white as snow , All along the water - terrace Perch like sea - gulls in a row . There 's [a garden]4126-a garden on [the Brenta Where]5266-the brenta where [the fairest ladies]5267-the fairest ladies meet , Picking roses from the trellis For [the gallants]5268-the gallants at [their]5267-the fairest ladies feet . There 's an arbour on [the Brenta Made of yews that screen the light]5269-the brenta made of yews that screen the light , Where [I]0-i kiss [[my]0-i girl]5270-my girl at midday Close as [lovers]5271-lovers kiss at night . [The players]5272-the players soon emerged at this call and presently [the deck]5273-the deck resounded with song and laughter . [All the company]5274-all the company were familiar with the Venetian bacaroles , and [Castelrovinato]391-coeur - volant 's lute was passed from hand to hand , as one after another , incited by [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's Canary , tried to recall some favourite measure--"La biondina in gondoleta "[391-coeur - volant] or " Guarda , che bella luna . "[391-coeur - volant] Meanwhile life was stirring in [the villages]5276-the villages and [gardens]858-gardens , and [groups of [people]1578-people appearing on [the terraces]5280-the terraces overhanging [the water]5281-the water]5278-groups of people appearing on the terraces overhanging the water . Never had [Odo]234-odo beheld a livelier scene . [The pillared houses with [their]5283-their rows of statues and vases , the flights of marble steps descending to the gilded river - gates , where [boats]5284-boats bobbed against the landings and [boatmen]5285-boatmen gasped in the shade of [their]5285-boatmen awnings]5282-the pillared houses with their rows of statues and vases , the flights of marble steps descending to the gilded river - gates , where boats bobbed against the landings and boatmen gasped in the shade of their awnings ; the marble trellises hung with grapes , [the gardens]8159-the gardens where parterres of flowers and parti - coloured gravel alternated with the dusk of tunnelled yew - walks ; [the company]1753-the company playing at bowls in [the long alleys]5288-the long alleys , or drinking chocolate in gazebos above [the river]2315-the river ; [the boats]5290-the boats darting hither and thither on [the stream]1496-the stream itself , the travelling - chaises , market - waggons and pannier - asses crowding the causeway along [the bank]5292-the bank -- all were unrolled before [him]234-odo with as little effect of reality as the episodes woven in some gaily - tinted tapestry . Even [the peasants in [the vineyards]5294-the vineyards]5293-the peasants in the vineyards seemed as merry and thoughtless as the quality in [[their]5293-the peasants in the vineyards gardens]5295-their gardens . The vintage - time is the holiday of the rural year and the day 's work was interspersed with frequent intervals of relaxation . At [the villages where [the burchiello]5297-the burchiello touched for refreshments]5296-the villages where the burchiello touched for refreshments , [handsome young women in scarlet bodices]5298-handsome young women in scarlet bodices came on board with baskets of melons , grapes , figs and peaches ; and under the trellises on [the landings]757-the landings , [lads]5300-lads and [girls with flowers in]5301-girls with flowers in [their]5301-girls with flowers in hair were dancing [the monferrina to the rattle of tambourines or the chant of some wandering ballad - singer]5302-the monferrina to the rattle of tambourines or the chant of some wandering ballad - singer . These scenes were so engaging to [the comedians]3085-the comedians that [they]3085-the comedians could not be restrained from going ashore and mingling in [the village]1028-the village diversions ; and [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , though impatient to rejoin [[his]1107-the marquess divinity]5306-his divinity , was too volatile not to be drawn into the adventure . [The whole party]5307-the whole party accordingly disembarked , and were presently giving an exhibition of [their]5307-the whole party talents to [the assembled idlers]5308-the assembled idlers , [the Pantaloon]5309-the pantaloon , [Harlequin]476-harlequin and [Doctor]477-doctor enacting a comical intermezzo which [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto had that morning composed for [them]5307-the whole party , while [Scaramouch]478-scaramouch and [Columbine]383-the columbine joined [the dancers]5310-the dancers , and [the rest of [the company]1753-the company]3281-the rest of the company , seizing on [a train of donkeys laden with vegetables]5313-a train of donkeys laden with vegetables for [the Venetian market]5314-the venetian market , stripped these patient animals of [their]5313-a train of donkeys laden with vegetables panniers , and mounting [them]5313-a train of donkeys laden with vegetables bareback started a Corso around [the village square]5315-the village square amid the invectives of [the drivers]5316-the drivers and the applause of [the crowd]1568-the crowd . Day was declining when [the Marquess]1107-the marquess at last succeeded in driving [[his]1107-the marquess flock]5319-his flock to [their]5319-his flock fold , and the moon sent a quiver of brightness across [the water]5281-the water as [the burchiello]5297-the burchiello touched at the landing of [a villa]5264-a villa set amid close - massed foliage high above [the river]2315-the river . [Gardens peopled with statues]5324-gardens peopled with statues descended from [the portico of [the villa]4954-the villa]5325-the portico of the villa to the marble platform on [the water]5281-the water 's edge , where [a throng of [boatmen in the Procuratore]5329-boatmen in the procuratore 's livery hurried forward to receive [the Marquess]1107-the marquess and [[his]1107-the marquess companions]2972-his companions]5328-a throng of boatmen in the procuratore 's livery hurried forward to receive the marquess and his companions . [The comedians]3085-the comedians , sobered by the magnificence of [their]3085-the comedians surroundings , followed [[their]3085-the comedians leader]5333-their leader like [awe - struck children]5334-awe - struck children . Light and music streamed from the long facade overhead , but [the lower gardens]5335-the lower gardens lay hushed and dark , the air fragrant with unseen flowers , the late moon just burnishing the edges of the laurel - thickets from which , now and again , a nightingale 's song gushed in a fountain of sound . [Odo]234-odo , spellbound , followed [the others]2506-the others without a thought of [his]234-odo own share in the adventure . Never before had beauty so ministered to every sense . [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo lost in [his]234-odo surroundings , absorbed in the scent and murmur of the night . 3.3 . On [the upper terrace]5337-the upper terrace a dozen lacqueys with wax lights hastened out to receive [the travellers]1059-the travellers . [A laughing group]5339-a laughing group followed , headed by [a tall vivacious woman covered with jewels]5340-a tall vivacious woman covered with jewels , whom [Odo]234-odo guessed to be [the Procuratessa Bra]479-the procuratessa . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess , hastening forward , kissed [the lady]660-the lady 's hand , and turned to summon [the actors , who hung back at the farther end of the terrace]5343-the actors , who hung back at the farther end of the terrace . The light from the windows and from the lacquey 's tapers fell full on [the motley band]5344-the motley band , and [Odo]234-odo , roused to the singularity of [his]234-odo position , was about to seek shelter behind the Pantaloon when [he]234-odo heard a cry of recognition , and [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto , darting out of the Procuratessa 's circle , fell at [that lady]3253-that lady 's feet with a whispered word . [The Procuratessa]479-the procuratessa at once advanced with a smile of surprise and bade [the Cavaliere Valsecca]8650-the cavaliere valsecca welcome . Seeing [Odo]234-odo 's embarrassment , [she]660-the lady added that [[his]234-odo Highness of [Monte Alloro]99-monte alloro]5347-his highness of monte alloro had already apprised [her]660-the lady of [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere 's coming , and that [she]660-the lady and [[her]660-the lady husband]1112-her husband had the day before despatched [a messenger to [Venice]41-venice]5350-a messenger to venice to enquire if [he]5347-his highness of monte alloro were already there to invite [him]5347-his highness of monte alloro to [the villa]4954-the villa . At the same moment [a middle - aged man with an air of careless kindly strength]5352-a middle - aged man with an air of careless kindly strength emerged from [the house]1917-the house and greeted [Odo]234-odo . " [I]5352-a middle - aged man with an air of careless kindly strength am happy , "[5352-a middle - aged man with an air of careless kindly strength] said [he]5352-a middle - aged man with an air of careless kindly strength bowing , " to receive at Bellocchio [a member of [the princely house of [Pianura]4-pianura]9673-the princely house of pianura]9672-a member of the princely house of pianura ; and [[your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency will no doubt be as well - pleased as [ourselves]9675-ourselves that accident enables [us]9675-ourselves to make acquaintance without the formalities of an introduction . "[5352-a middle - aged man with an air of careless kindly strength] This , then , was [the famous Procuratore Bra , whose house had given [three Doges]5355-three doges to [Venice]41-venice , and who was [himself]5354-the famous procuratore bra , whose house had given three doges to venice , and who was himself regarded as the most powerful if not the most scrupulous noble of his day regarded as the most powerful if not the most scrupulous noble of [his]5354-the famous procuratore bra , whose house had given three doges to venice , and who was himself regarded as the most powerful if not the most scrupulous noble of his day day]5354-the famous procuratore bra , whose house had given three doges to venice , and who was himself regarded as the most powerful if not the most scrupulous noble of his day . [Odo]234-odo had heard many tales of [his]234-odo singularities , for in a generation of [elegant triflers]5356-elegant triflers [his]234-odo figure stood out with the ruggedness of a granite boulder in [a clipped and gravelled garden]5357-a clipped and gravelled garden . To hereditary wealth and influence [he]234-odo added a love of power seconded by great political sagacity and an inflexible will . If [his]234-odo means were not always above suspicion they at least tended to statesmanlike ends , and in [his]234-odo public capacity [he]234-odo was faithful to the highest interests of the state . Reports differed as to [his]234-odo private use of [his]234-odo authority . [He]234-odo was noted for [his]234-odo lavish way of living , and for a hospitality which distinguished [him]234-odo from [the majority of [[his]234-odo class]2387-his class , who , however showy in [[their]5358-the majority of his class , who , however showy in their establishments , seldom received strangers , and entertained each other only on the most ceremonious occasions establishments]5360-their establishments , seldom received [strangers]3356-strangers , and entertained [each other]3086-each other only on the most ceremonious occasions]5358-the majority of his class , who , however showy in their establishments , seldom received strangers , and entertained each other only on the most ceremonious occasions . [The Procuratore]5227-the procuratore kept [open house both in [Venice]41-venice and on [the Brenta]149-the brenta]5364-open house both in venice and on the brenta , and in [[his]5227-the procuratore drawing - rooms]5365-his drawing - rooms [the foreign traveller]5366-the foreign traveller was welcomed as freely as in [Paris]27-paris or [London]159-london . Here , too , were to be met [the wits]5367-the wits , [musicians]1661-musicians and [literati whom [a traditional morgue]5370-a traditional morgue still excluded from [many aristocratic houses]5371-many aristocratic houses]5369-literati whom a traditional morgue still excluded from many aristocratic houses . Yet in spite of [his]5227-the procuratore hospitality ( or perhaps because of it ) [the Procuratore]5227-the procuratore , as [Odo]234-odo knew , was [the butt of [the very poets [he]5227-the procuratore entertained]5374-the very poets he entertained , and [the worst satirised man in [Venice]41-venice]5375-the worst satirised man in venice]5373-the butt of the very poets he entertained , and the worst satirised man in venice . It was [his]5227-the procuratore misfortune to be in love with [[his]5227-the procuratore wife]1713-his wife ; and this state of mind ( in itself sufficiently ridiculous ) and the shifts and compromises to which it reduced [him]5227-the procuratore , were a source of endless amusement to [the humorists]5377-the humorists . Nor were graver rumours wanting ; for it was known that [the Procuratore]5227-the procuratore , so proof against other persuasions , was helpless in [[his]5227-the procuratore wife]1713-his wife 's hands , and that [honest men]5380-honest men had been undone and [scoundrels]5381-scoundrels exalted at a nod of [the beautiful Procuratessa]5382-the beautiful procuratessa . [That lady]3253-that lady , as famous in [her]3253-that lady way as [[her]3253-that lady husband]1112-her husband , was noted for quite different qualities ; so that , according to [one satirist]5385-one satirist , [her]3253-that lady hospitality began where [his]5227-the procuratore ended , and [the Albergo Bra]160-the albergo bra ( the nickname [[their]5386-their palace]5387-their palace went by ) was advertised in the lampoons of the day as furnishing both bed and board . In some respects , however , the tastes of [the noble couple]5388-the noble couple agreed , both delighting in music , wit , good company , and all the adornments of life ; while , with regard to [their]5388-the noble couple private conduct , it doubtless suffered by being viewed through the eyes of [a narrow and trivial nobility]5389-a narrow and trivial nobility , apt to look with suspicion on any deviation from the customs of [[their]5388-the noble couple class]2116-their class . Such was [the household in which [Odo]234-odo found [himself]234-odo unexpectedly included]5391-the household in which odo found himself unexpectedly included . [He]234-odo learned that [[his]234-odo hosts]5392-his hosts were in the act of entertaining [the English Duke who had captured [[his]234-odo burchiello]5394-his burchiello that morning]5393-the english duke who had captured his burchiello that morning ; and having exchanged [his]234-odo travelling - dress for a more suitable toilet [he]234-odo was presently conducted to [the private theatre where [the company]1753-the company had gathered to witness an improvised performance by [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto and [the newly - arrived actors]5397-the newly - arrived actors]5395-the private theatre where the company had gathered to witness an improvised performance by mirandolina and the newly - arrived actors . [The Procuratessa]479-the procuratessa at once beckoned [him]234-odo to the row of gilt armchairs where [she]479-the procuratessa sat with [the noble Duke]5398-the noble duke and [several ladies of distinction]5399-several ladies of distinction . [The little theatre]5400-the little theatre sparkled with wax - lights reflected in the facets of glass chandeliers and in the jewels of the richly - habited company , and [Odo]234-odo was struck by the refined brilliancy of the scene . Before [he]234-odo had time to look about [him]234-odo the curtains of [the stage]8311-the stage were drawn back , and [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto flashed into view , daring and radiant as ever , and dressed with an elegance which spoke well for the liberality of [[her]479-the procuratessa new protector]5402-her new protector . [She]479-the procuratessa was as much at [her]479-the procuratessa ease as before [the vulgar audience of [Vercelli]472-vercelli]5403-the vulgar audience of vercelli , and spite of the distinguished eyes fixed upon [her]479-the procuratessa , [her]479-the procuratessa smiles and sallies were pointedly addressed to [Odo]234-odo . This made [him]234-odo the object of [the Procuratessa]479-the procuratessa 's banter , but had an opposite effect on [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , who fixed [him]234-odo with an irritated eye and fidgeted restlessly in [his]234-odo seat as the performance went on . When the curtain fell [the Procuratessa]479-the procuratessa led [the company]1753-the company to [the circular saloon which , as in [most villas of [the Venetian mainland]5408-the venetian mainland]5407-most villas of the venetian mainland]5406-the circular saloon which , as in most villas of the venetian mainland , formed [the central point of [the house]1917-the house]5409-the central point of the house . If [Odo]234-odo had been charmed by the graceful decorations of [the theatre]1559-the theatre , [he]234-odo was dazzled by the airy splendour of [this apartment]2474-this apartment . Dance - music was pouring from the arched recesses above the doorways , and chandeliers of coloured Murano glass diffused a soft brightness over the pilasters of the stuccoed walls , and the floor of inlaid marbles on which [couples]5413-couples were rapidly forming for the contradance . [His]234-odo eye , however , was soon drawn from these to the ceiling which overarched [the dancers with what seemed like an Olympian revel reflected in sunset clouds]5414-the dancers with what seemed like an olympian revel reflected in sunset clouds . Over the gilt balustrade surmounting the cornice lolled the figures of fauns , [bacchantes , nereids and tritons , hovered over by a cloud of amorini blown like rose - leaves]5415-bacchantes , nereids and tritons , hovered over by a cloud of amorini blown like rose - leaves across a rosy sky , while in the centre of the dome [Apollo]395-apollo burst in [his]395-apollo chariot through the mists of dawn , escorted by [a fantastic procession of the human races]5416-a fantastic procession of the human races . [These alien subjects of the sun]5417-these alien subjects of the sun -- [a fur - clad Laplander]5418-a fur - clad laplander , [a turbaned figure on a dromedary]5419-a turbaned figure on a dromedary , a blackamoor and [a plumed American Indian]5420-a plumed american indian -- were in turn surrounded by a rout of Maenads and Silenuses , whose flushed advance was checked by the breaking of cool green waves , through which [boys wreathed with coral and seaweed]5421-boys wreathed with coral and seaweed disported themselves among shoals of flashing dolphins . It was as though [the genius of Pleasure]5422-the genius of pleasure had poured all the riches of [[his]234-odo inexhaustible realm]5423-his inexhaustible realm on the heads of [the revellers below]5424-the revellers below . [The Procuratessa]5425-the procuratessa brought [Odo]234-odo to [earth]575-earth by remarking that it was a master - piece of the divine Tiepolo [he]234-odo was admiring . [She]5425-the procuratessa added that at [Bellocchio]156-bellocchio all formalities were dispensed with , and begged [him]234-odo to observe that , in [the rooms opening into [the saloon]4241-the saloon]5427-the rooms opening into the saloon , recreations were provided for every taste . In one of [these apartments]3627-these apartments silver trays were set out with sherbets , cakes , and fruit cooled in snow , while in another stood gaming - tables around which the greater number of [the company]1753-the company were already gathering for tresette . [A third room]5431-a third room was devoted to music ; and hither [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto , who was evidently allowed a familiarity of intercourse not accorded to [the other comedians]5432-the other comedians , had withdrawn with [the pacified Marquess]5433-the pacified marquess , and perched on the arm of a high gilt chair was pinching the strings of a guitar and humming the first notes of [a boatman]4797-a boatman 's song ... After completing the circuit of [the rooms]1157-the rooms [Odo]234-odo stepped out on [the terrace , which was now bathed in the whiteness of a soaring moon]5436-the terrace , which was now bathed in the whiteness of a soaring moon . The colonnades detached against silver - misted foliage , [the gardens]8159-the gardens spectrally outspread , seemed to enclose [him]234-odo in a magic circle of loveliness which the first ray of daylight must dispel . [He]234-odo wandered on , drawn to the depths of shade on [the lower terraces]5438-the lower terraces . The hush grew deeper , the murmur of [the river]2315-the river more mysterious . [A yew - arbour]5440-a yew - arbour invited [him]234-odo and [he]234-odo seated [himself]234-odo on the bench niched in [its]5440-a yew - arbour inmost dusk . Seen through the black arch of the arbour the moonlight lay like snow on parterres and statues . [He]234-odo thought of [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina , and of the delight [she]413-maria clementina would have felt in such a scene as [he]234-odo had just left . Then the remembrance of [Mirandolina]267-cantapresto 's blandishments stole over [him]234-odo and spite of [himself]234-odo [he]234-odo smiled at [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's discomfiture . Though [he]234-odo was in no humour for an intrigue [his]234-odo fancy was not proof against the romance of [his]234-odo surroundings , and it seemed to [him]234-odo that [Miranda]384-miranda 's eyes had never been so bright or [her]384-miranda smile so full of provocation . No wonder [Frattanto]480-frattanto followed [her]384-miranda like a lost soul and [the Marquess]1107-the marquess abandoned [Rome]11-rome and [Baalbec]481-baalbec to sit at the feet of [such a teacher]5443-such a teacher ! Had not [that light philosopher]5444-that light philosopher after all chosen the true way and guessed [the Sphinx]482-the sphinx 's riddle ? Why should today always be jilted for tomorrow , sensation sacrificed to thought ? As [he]234-odo sat revolving these questions the yew - branches seemed to stir , and from some deeper recess of shade a figure stole to [his]234-odo side . [He]234-odo started , but a hand was laid on [his]234-odo lips and [he]234-odo was gently forced back into [his]234-odo seat . Dazzled by the outer moonlight [he]234-odo could just guess the outline of the figure pressed against [his]234-odo own . [He]234-odo sat speechless , yielding to the charm of the moment , till suddenly [he]234-odo felt a rapid kiss and [the visitor]3880-the visitor vanished as mysteriously as [she]3880-the visitor had come . [He]234-odo sprang up to follow , but inclination failed with [his]234-odo first step . Let the spell of mystery remain unbroken ! [He]234-odo sank down on the seat again lulled by dreamy musings ... When [he]234-odo looked up the moonlight had faded and [he]234-odo felt a chill in the air . [He]234-odo walked out on [the terrace]4571-the terrace . The moon hung low and the tree - tops were beginning to tremble . [The villa - front]5447-the villa - front was grey , with oblongs of yellow light marking the windows of [the ball - room]5448-the ball - room . As [he]234-odo looked up at [it]5447-the villa - front , the dance - music ceased and not a sound was heard but the stir of the foliage and the murmur of [the river]2315-the river against [its]2315-the river banks . Then , from [a loggia above [the central portico]5451-the central portico]5450-a loggia above the central portico , [a woman]5452-a woman 's clear contralto notes took flight : Before the yellow dawn is up , With pomp of shield and shaft , Drink [we]5453-we of Night 's fast - ebbing cup One last delicious draught . The shadowy wine of Night is sweet , With subtle slumbrous fumes Crushed by the Hours ' melodious feet From bloodless elder - blooms ... The days at [Bellocchio]156-bellocchio passed in a series of festivities . The mornings were spent in drinking chocolate , strolling in [the gardens]8159-the gardens and visiting the fish - ponds , meanders and other wonders of [the villa]4954-the villa ; thence [the greater number of [guests]5457-guests]5456-the greater number of guests were soon drawn to the card - tables , from which [they]5456-the greater number of guests rose only to dine ; and after an elaborate dinner prepared by [a French cook]5458-a french cook [the whole company]3227-the whole company set out to explore [the country]818-the country or to exchange visits with [the hosts of [the adjoining villas]5462-the adjoining villas]5461-the hosts of the adjoining villas . Each evening brought some fresh diversion : a comedy or an operetta in [the miniature theatre]5463-the miniature theatre , an al fresco banquet on [the terrace]4571-the terrace or a ball attended by [the principal families of [the neighbourhood]5224-the neighbourhood]5465-the principal families of the neighbourhood . [Odo]234-odo soon contrived to reassure [the Marquess]1107-the marquess as to [his]1107-the marquess designs upon [Miranda]384-miranda , and when [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant was not at cards [the two young men]5468-the two young men spent much of [their]5468-the two young men time together . [The Marquess]394-cerveno was never tired of extolling the taste and ingenuity with which [the Venetians]5469-the venetians planned and carried out [their]5469-the venetians recreations . " Nature [herself]479-the procuratessa , "[394-cerveno] said [he]394-cerveno , " seems the accomplice of [their]5468-the two young men merry - making , and in no other surroundings could [man]2185-man 's natural craving for diversion find so graceful and poetic an expression . "[394-cerveno] The scene on which [they]5468-the two young men looked out seemed to confirm [his]394-cerveno words . It was the last evening of [their]5468-the two young men stay at [Bellocchio]156-bellocchio , and [the Procuratessa]479-the procuratessa had planned a musical festival on [the river]2315-the river . Festoons of coloured lanterns wound from [the portico]8180-the portico to [the water]5281-the water ; and opposite [the landing]5473-the landing lay [the Procuratore 's Bucentaur]5474-the procuratore 's bucentaur , [a great barge hung with crimson velvet]5475-a great barge hung with crimson velvet . In the prow were stationed [the comedians , in airy mythological dress]5476-the comedians , in airy mythological dress , and as [the guests]2672-the guests stepped on board [they]2672-the guests were received by [Miranda]384-miranda , a rosy Venus who , escorted by [Mars]483-mars and [Adonis]484-adonis , recited an ode composed by Cantapresto in the Procuratessa 's honour . A banquet was spread in [the deck - house]5478-the deck - house , which was hung with silk arras and Venetian mirrors , and , while [the guests]2672-the guests feasted , dozens of [little boats]5480-little boats hung with lights and filled with [musicians]1661-musicians flitted about [the Bucentaur]485-the bucentaur like a swarm of musical fireflies ... The next day [Odo]234-odo accompanied [the Procuratessa]5425-the procuratessa to [Venice]41-venice . Had [he]234-odo been [a traveller from beyond [the Alps]20-the alps]5483-a traveller from beyond the alps [he]234-odo could hardly have been more unprepared for the spectacle that awaited [him]234-odo . In aspect and customs [Venice]41-venice differed almost as much from [other Italian cities]5484-other italian cities as from those of [the rest of [Europe]40-europe]5485-the rest of europe . From the fanciful stone embroidery of [[her]41-venice churches and [palaces]1883-palaces]5486-her churches and palaces to a hundred singularities in dress and manners -- the full - bottomed wigs and long gowns of [the nobles]2190-the nobles , the black mantles and head - draperies of [the ladies]1106-the ladies , the white masks worn abroad by both sexes , the publicity of social life under [the arcades of [the Piazza]3114-the piazza]5490-the arcades of the piazza , the extraordinary freedom of intercourse in the casini , [gaming - rooms]5492-gaming - rooms and [theatres]2285-theatres -- [the city]2261-the city proclaimed , in every detail of life and architecture , [her]41-venice independence of any tradition but [her]41-venice own . This was the more singular as [Saint Mark 's square]161-saint mark 's square had for centuries been the meeting - place of [East and West]5495-east and west , and the goal of [artists]4163-artists , [scholars]5088-scholars and pleasure - seekers from [all parts of [the world]844-the world]5498-all parts of the world . Indeed , as [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant pointed out , the Venetian customs almost appeared to have been devised for the convenience of [strangers]3356-strangers . The privilege of going masked at almost all seasons and the enforced uniformity of dress , which in itself provided a kind of incognito , made [the place]1030-the place singularly favourable to every kind of intrigue and amusement ; while the mild temper of [the people]1003-the people and the watchfulness of [the police]8784-the police prevented the public disorders that such license might have occasioned . These seeming anomalies abounded on every side . From the gaming - table where [a tinker]5504-a tinker might set a ducat against [a prince]8186-a prince it was but a few steps to [the Broglio]162-the broglio , or arcade under [the ducal palace]3487-the ducal palace , into which [no plebeian]5507-no plebeian might intrude while [the nobility]1665-the nobility walked [there]606-there . [The great ladies]5510-the great ladies , who were subject to strict sumptuary laws , and might not display [their]5510-the great ladies jewels or try the new French fashions but on the sly , were yet privileged at all hours to go abroad alone in [[their]5510-the great ladies gondolas]5511-their gondolas . [No society]5512-no society was more haughty and exclusive in [its]5512-no society traditions , yet the mask leveled [all classes]5513-all classes and permitted , during the greater part of the year , an equality of intercourse undreamed of in [other cities]5514-other cities ; while [the nobles]2190-the nobles , though more magnificently housed than in [any other capital of Europe]5516-any other capital of europe , generally sought amusement at [the public casini]5517-the public casini or [assembly - rooms]5518-assembly - rooms instead of receiving company in [[their]2190-the nobles own palaces]5519-their own palaces . Such were but a few of the contradictions in [a city where [the theatres]8414-the theatres were named after [the neighbouring churches]5522-the neighbouring churches , where there were innumerable religious foundations but scarce an ecclesiastic to be met in company , and where [the ladies of [the laity]5524-the laity]5523-the ladies of the laity dressed like [nuns]5525-nuns , while [the nuns in [the aristocratic convents]5527-the aristocratic convents]5526-the nuns in the aristocratic convents]5520-a city where the theatres were named after the neighbouring churches , where there were innumerable religious foundations but scarce an ecclesiastic to be met in company , and where the ladies of the laity dressed like nuns , while the nuns in the aristocratic convents went in gala habits and with uncovered heads . No wonder that to [the bewildered stranger]5528-the bewildered stranger [the Venetians]5469-the venetians seemed to keep perpetual carnival and [Venice]41-venice [herself]41-venice to be as it were the mere stage of some huge comic interlude . To Odo the setting was even more astonishing than the performance . Never had [he]5530-he seen pleasure and grace so happily allied , all the arts of life so combined in the single effort after enjoyment . Here was not a mere tendency to linger on the surface , but the essence of superficiality itself ; not an ignoring of what lies beneath , but an elimination of it ; as though all human experience should be beaten thin and spread out before the eye like some brilliant tenuous plaque of Etruscan gold . And in this science of pleasure -- [mere jeweller]5531-mere jeweller 's work though it were -- [the greatest artists]5532-the greatest artists had collaborated , each contributing [his]5530-he page to the philosophy of enjoyment in the form of some radiant allegory flowering from palace wall or ceiling like the enlarged reflection of the life beneath it . Nowhere was the mind arrested by a question or an idea . Thought slunk away like [an unmasked guest]5533-an unmasked guest at [the ridotto]2406-the ridotto . Sensation ruled supreme , and each moment was an iridescent bubble fresh - blown from the lips of fancy . [Odo]234-odo brought to the spectacle the humour best fitted for its enjoyment . [His]234-odo weariness and discouragement sought refuge in the emotional satisfaction of the hour . Here at least the old problem of living had been solved , and from [the patrician]5535-the patrician taking the air in [[his]5535-the patrician gondola]5536-his gondola to [the gondolier]5537-the gondolier [himself]5537-the gondolier , gambling and singing on the water - steps of [[[his]5537-the gondolier master]2377-his master 's palace]5539-his master 's palace , all seemed equally satisfied with the solution . Now if ever was the time to cry " halt ! "[479-the procuratessa] to the present , to forget [the travelled road]5540-the travelled road and take no thought for the morrow ... The months passed rapidly and agreeably . [The Procuratessa]479-the procuratessa was the most amiable of [guides]5541-guides , and in [her]479-the procuratessa company [Odo]234-odo enjoyed the best that [Venice]41-venice had to offer , from the matchless music of [the churches]2240-the churches and [hospitals]5543-hospitals to [the petits soupers in [the private casini of [the nobility]1665-the nobility]5545-the private casini of the nobility]5544-the petits soupers in the private casini of the nobility ; while [Coeur - Volant and Castelrovinato]391-coeur - volant introduced [him]234-odo to scenes where even [a lady of the Procuratessa]5547-a lady of the procuratessa 's intrepidity might not venture . Such a life left little time for thoughtful pleasures ; nor did [Odo]234-odo find in the society about [him]234-odo any sympathy with [his]234-odo more personal tastes . At first [he]234-odo yielded willingly enough to the pressure of [his]234-odo surroundings , glad to escape from thoughts of the past and speculations about the future ; but it was impossible for [him]234-odo to lose [his]234-odo footing in such an element , and at times [he]234-odo felt the lack of such companionship as [de Crucis]462-de crucis had given [him]234-odo . There was [no society in [Venice]41-venice corresponding with [the polished circles of [Milan]14-milan]5549-the polished circles of milan or [Naples]59-naples , or with the academic class in [such University towns as [Padua]109-padua and [Pavia]12-pavia]5550-such university towns as padua and pavia]5548-no society in venice corresponding with the polished circles of milan or naples , or with the academic class in such university towns as padua and pavia . [The few Venetians destined to be remembered among those who had contributed to the intellectual advancement of [Italy]5-italy]5551-the few venetians destined to be remembered among those who had contributed to the intellectual advancement of italy vegetated in obscurity , suffering not so much from religious persecution -- for [the Inquisition]486-the inquisition had little power in [Venice]41-venice -- as from the incorrigible indifference of [a society which ignored all who did not contribute to its amusement]5552-a society which ignored all who did not contribute to its amusement . [Odo]234-odo indeed might have sought out [these unhonoured prophets]5553-these unhonoured prophets , but that all the influences about [him]234-odo set the other way , and that [he]234-odo was falling more and more into the habit of running with the tide . Now and then , however , [a vague ennui]5554-a vague ennui drove [him]234-odo to [one of [the bookshops which , throughout [Italy]5-italy were the chief meeting - places of [students]5084-students and [authors]5558-authors]5556-the bookshops which , throughout italy were the chief meeting - places of students and authors]5555-one of the bookshops which , throughout italy were the chief meeting - places of students and authors . On one of these occasions [the dealer]5559-the dealer invited [him]234-odo into [a private room]5560-a private room where [he]234-odo kept some rare volumes , and here [Odo]234-odo was surprised to meet [Andreoni]441-andreoni , [the liberal bookseller of [Pianura]4-pianura]5561-the liberal bookseller of pianura . [Andreoni]441-andreoni at first seemed somewhat disconcerted by the meeting ; but presently recovering [his]441-andreoni confidence , [he]441-andreoni told [Odo]234-odo that [he]441-andreoni had been recently banished from [Pianura]4-pianura , the cause of [his]441-andreoni banishment being the publication of a book on taxation that was supposed to reflect on the fiscal system of [the duchy]1310-the duchy . Though [he]234-odo did not name [the author]5563-the author , [Odo]234-odo at once suspected [Gamba]282-gamba ; but on [his]234-odo enquiring if [the latter]870-the latter had also been banished , [Andreoni]441-andreoni merely replied that [he]441-andreoni had been dismissed from [his]441-andreoni post , and had left [Pianura]4-pianura . [The bookseller]5565-the bookseller went on to say that [he]5565-the bookseller had come to [Venice]41-venice with the idea of setting up [[his]5565-the bookseller press]5566-his press either [there]606-there or in [Padua]109-padua , where [[[his]5565-the bookseller wife]1713-his wife 's family lived]5569-his wife 's family lived . [Odo]234-odo was eager to hear more ; but [Andreoni]441-andreoni courteously declined to wait on [him]234-odo at [[his]234-odo lodgings]2818-his lodgings , on the plea that it might harm [them]5571-them both to be seen together . [They]5571-them agreed , however , to meet in [San Zaccaria]163-san zaccaria after low mass the next morning , and here [Andreoni]441-andreoni gave [Odo]234-odo a fuller report of recent events in [the duchy]1310-the duchy . It appeared that in the incessant see - saw of party influences [the Church]72-the church had once more gained on [the liberals]9304-the liberals . [Trescorre]254-trescorre was out of favour , [the Dominican]3738-the dominican had begun to show [his]3738-the dominican hand more openly , and [the Duke]682-the duke , more than ever apprehensive about [his]682-the duke health , was seeking to conciliate heaven by [his]682-the duke renewed persecution of [the reformers]4388-the reformers . In the general upheaval even [Crescenti]234-odo had nearly lost [his]234-odo place ; and it was rumoured that [he]234-odo kept it only through the intervention of [the Pope]1248-the pope , who had represented to [the Duke]682-the duke that the persecution of [a scholar already famous throughout [Europe]40-europe]5579-a scholar already famous throughout europe would reflect little credit on [the Church]1212-the church . As for [Gamba]282-gamba , [Andreoni]441-andreoni , though unwilling to admit a knowledge of [his]282-gamba exact whereabouts , assured [Odo]234-odo that [he]282-gamba was well and had not lost courage . At court matters remained much as usual . [The Duchess]899-the duchess , surrounded by [[her]899-the duchess familiars]5582-her familiars , had entered on a new phase of mad expenditure , draining the exchequer to indulge [her]899-the duchess private whims , filling [[her]899-the duchess apartments]5583-her apartments with [mountebanks]5584-mountebanks and [players]5585-players , and borrowing from [courtiers]5586-courtiers and [servants]748-servants to keep [[her]899-the duchess creditors]1943-her creditors from the door . [Trescorre]254-trescorre was no longer able to check [her]899-the duchess extravagance , and [his]254-trescorre influence with [the Duke]682-the duke being on the wane , [the court]814-the court was once more the scene of unseemly scandals and disorders . [The only new figure to appear there]5591-the only new figure to appear there since [Odo]234-odo 's departure was that of [[the little prince]3148-the little prince 's governor , who had come from [Rome]11-rome a few months previously to superintend [the heir]2781-the heir 's education , which was found to have been grievously neglected under [[his]234-odo former masters]5595-his former masters]5593-the little prince 's governor , who had come from rome a few months previously to superintend the heir 's education , which was found to have been grievously neglected under his former masters . This was [an ecclesiastic]5596-an ecclesiastic , [an ex - Jesuit]5597-an ex - jesuit as some said , but without doubt [a man of parts]5598-a man of parts , and apparently of more tolerant views than [the other churchmen about the court]5599-the other churchmen about the court . " But , "[441-andreoni] [Andreoni]441-andreoni added , " [[your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency may chance to recall [him]234-odo ; for [he]234-odo is [the same abate [de Crucis]462-de crucis who was sent to [Pianura]4-pianura by [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office to arrest [the German astrologer]9680-the german astrologer]9678-the same abate de crucis who was sent to pianura by the holy office to arrest the german astrologer . "[441-andreoni] [Odo]234-odo heard [him]441-andreoni with surprise . [He]234-odo had had no news of [de Crucis]462-de crucis since [their]5600-their parting in [Rome]11-rome , where , as [he]234-odo supposed , [the latter]870-the latter was to remain for some years in the service of [Prince Bracciano]464-prince bracciano . [Odo]234-odo was at a loss to conceive how or why [the Jesuit]5602-the jesuit had come to [Pianura]4-pianura ; but , whatever [his]234-odo reasons for being [there]606-there , it was certain that [his]234-odo influence must make itself felt far beyond the range of [his]234-odo immediate duties . Whether this influence would be exerted for good or ill it was impossible to forecast ; but much as [Odo]234-odo admired [de Crucis]462-de crucis , [he]234-odo could not forget that [the Jesuit]5602-the jesuit , by [his]234-odo own avowal , was still [the servant of the greatest organised opposition to moral and intellectual freedom that]5605-the servant of the greatest organised opposition to moral and intellectual freedom that [the world]844-the world had ever known . That this opposition was not always actively manifested [Odo]234-odo was well aware . [He]234-odo knew that the Jesuit spirit moved in many directions and that its action was often more beneficial than that of [its opponents]5607-its opponents ; but it remained an incalculable element in the composition of human affairs , and one the more to be feared since , in ceasing to have a material existence , it had acquired the dread pervasiveness of an idea . With the Epiphany the wild carnival - season set in . Nothing could surpass the excesses of this mad time . [All classes]5513-all classes seemed bitten by the tarantula of mirth , every gondola hid an intrigue , [the patrician]5535-the patrician 's tabarro concealed [a noble lady]5610-a noble lady , the feminine hood and cloak [a young spark bent on mystification]5611-a young spark bent on mystification , [the friar]5612-the friar 's habit [a man of pleasure]2366-a man of pleasure and [the nun]5614-the nun 's veil [a lady of [the town]593-the town]5615-a lady of the town . [The Piazza]3114-the piazza swarmed with [merry - makers of all degrees]5618-merry - makers of all degrees . [The square]1592-the square itself was taken up by the booths of [hucksters]3004-hucksters , [rope - dancers]5621-rope - dancers and [astrologers]5622-astrologers , while [promenaders in travesty thronged [the arcades]2696-the arcades , and [the ladies of [the nobility]1665-the nobility]5625-the ladies of the nobility , in [their]5625-the ladies of the nobility white masks and black zendaletti , surveyed the scene from the windows of [the assembly - rooms in [the Procuratie]164-the procuratie]5627-the assembly - rooms in the procuratie , or , threading [the crowd]1568-the crowd on the arms of [[their]1568-the crowd gallants]5629-their gallants]5623-promenaders in travesty thronged the arcades , and the ladies of the nobility , in their white masks and black zendaletti , surveyed the scene from the windows of the assembly - rooms in the procuratie , or , threading the crowd on the arms of their gallants , visited the various peep - shows and flocked about the rhinoceros exhibited in [a great canvas tent in [the Piazzetta]165-the piazzetta]5630-a great canvas tent in the piazzetta . The characteristic contrasts of Venetian life seemed to be emphasised by the vagaries of the carnival , and [Odo]234-odo never ceased to be diverted by the sight of [a long line of [masqueraders in every kind of comic disguise]5632-masqueraders in every kind of comic disguise kneeling devoutly before [the brilliantly - lit shrine of [the Virgin under the arches of the Procuratie]5634-the virgin under the arches of the procuratie]5633-the brilliantly - lit shrine of the virgin under the arches of the procuratie]5631-a long line of masqueraders in every kind of comic disguise kneeling devoutly before the brilliantly - lit shrine of the virgin under the arches of the procuratie , while [the friar who led [their]5636-their devotions]5635-the friar who led their devotions interrupted [his]5635-the friar who led their devotions litany whenever the quack on [an adjoining platform]5637-an adjoining platform began to bawl through a tin trumpet the praise of [his]5635-the friar who led their devotions miraculous pills . The mounting madness culminated on [Giovedi Grasso]166-giovedi grasso , the last Thursday before Lent , when [the Piazzetta]165-the piazzetta became the scene of ceremonies in which [the Doge]5638-the doge [himself]5638-the doge took part . These opened with the decapitation of three bulls : a rite said to commemorate some long - forgotten dispute between [the inveterate enemies]5639-the inveterate enemies , [Venice]41-venice and [Aquileia]167-aquileia . The bulls , preceded by [halberdiers and trumpeters]5640-halberdiers and trumpeters , and surrounded by [armed attendants]5641-armed attendants , were led in state before [the ducal palace]3487-the ducal palace , and [the executioner]5643-the executioner , practised in [his]5643-the executioner bloody work , struck off each head with a single stroke of [his]5643-the executioner huge sword . This slaughter was succeeded by pleasanter sights , such as the famous Vola , or flight of [a boy]2854-a boy from [the bell - tower of [Saint Mark]161-saint mark 's square 's]5645-the bell - tower of saint mark 's to a window of [the palace]768-the palace , where [he]2854-a boy presented a nosegay to [his]2854-a boy Serenity and was caught up again to [his]2854-a boy airy vaulting - ground . After this ingenious feat came another called the " Force of [Hercules]488-hercules , "[161-saint mark 's square] given by [a band of youths who , building [themselves]5647-a band of youths who , building themselves into a kind of pyramid , shifted their postures with inexhaustible agility , while bursts of fireworks wove yellow arches through the midday light into a kind of pyramid , shifted [their]5647-a band of youths who , building themselves into a kind of pyramid , shifted their postures with inexhaustible agility , while bursts of fireworks wove yellow arches through the midday light postures with inexhaustible agility , while bursts of fireworks wove yellow arches through the midday light]5647-a band of youths who , building themselves into a kind of pyramid , shifted their postures with inexhaustible agility , while bursts of fireworks wove yellow arches through the midday light . Meanwhile [the crowds in [the streets]744-the streets]5648-the crowds in the streets fled this way and that as [a throng of [uproarious young fellows]5651-uproarious young fellows]5650-a throng of uproarious young fellows drove before [them]5650-a throng of uproarious young fellows the bulls that were to be baited in [the open squares]5652-the open squares ; and wherever a recessed doorway or the angle of [a building]5653-a building afforded shelter from the rout , [some posture - maker or ballad - singer]5654-some posture - maker or ballad - singer had gathered a crowd about [his]5654-some posture - maker or ballad - singer carpet . Ash Wednesday brought about a dramatic transformation . Every travesty laid aside , [every tent and stall]5655-every tent and stall swept away , [the people]1003-the people again gathered in [the Piazza]3114-the piazza to receive the ashes of penitence on [their]1003-the people heads , [the churches]2240-the churches now became the chief centres of interest . [Venice]41-venice was noted for [her]41-venice sacred music and for the lavish illumination of [[her]41-venice favourite shrines and [chapels]5660-chapels]5659-her favourite shrines and chapels ; and few religious spectacles were more impressive than the Forty Hours ' devotion in [the wealthier churches of [the city]2261-the city]5661-the wealthier churches of the city . All the magic of music , painting and sculpture were combined in the service of religion , and [Odo]234-odo 's sense of the dramatic quality of the Catholic rites found gratification in the moving scenes where , amid the imperishable splendours of [his]234-odo own creation , [man]2185-man owned [himself]234-odo but dust . Never before had [he]234-odo been so alive to the symbolism of the penitential season , so awed by the beauty and symmetry of that great structure of the Liturgical Year that leads the soul up , step by step , to [the awful heights of [Calvary]287-calvary]5664-the awful heights of calvary . The very carelessness of those about [him]234-odo seemed to deepen the solemnity of the scenes enacted -- as though [the Church]1212-the church , after all [her]1212-the church centuries of dominion , were still , as in those early days , but a voice crying in [the wilderness]4321-the wilderness . The Easter bells ushered in the reign of another spirit . If the carnival folly was spent , the joy of returning life replaced it . After the winter diversions of cards , concerts and [theatres]2285-theatres , came the excursions to [the island - gardens of [the lagoon]5669-the lagoon]5668-the island - gardens of the lagoon and [the evening promenade of the fresca on [the Grand Canal]153-the grand canal]5670-the evening promenade of the fresca on the grand canal . Now [the palace]768-the palace - windows were hung with awnings , the oleanders in the balconies grew rosy against the sea - worn marble , and yellow snap - dragons blossomed from the crumbling walls . [The market]5672-the market - boats brought early fruits and vegetables from [the Brenta]149-the brenta and roses and gilly - flowers from [the Paduan gardens]5673-the paduan gardens ; and when the wind set from [shore]5674-shore [it]5675-it carried with it the scent of lime - blossoms and flowering fields . Now also was the season when the great civic and religious processions took place , dyeing the water with sunset hues as [they]5676-they swept from the steps of [the Piazzetta]165-the piazzetta to [San Giorgio]170-san giorgio , [the Redentore]171-the redentore or [the Salute]172-the salute . In [the fashionable convents]5677-the fashionable convents [the nuns]5678-the nuns celebrated the festivals of [[their]5678-the nuns patron saints]5679-their patron saints with musical and dramatic entertainments to which [secular visitors]5680-secular visitors were invited . These entertainments were a noted feature of Venetian life , and the subject of much scandalous comment among visitors from beyond [the Alps]20-the alps . [The nuns of the stricter orders]5681-the nuns of the stricter orders were as closely cloistered as elsewhere ; but in [the convents of Santa Croce]5682-the convents of santa croce , [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara , and [a few others]5683-a few others , mostly filled by [the daughters of [the nobility]1665-the nobility]5684-the daughters of the nobility , an unusual liberty prevailed . It was known that [the inmates]5686-the inmates had taken the veil for family reasons , and to [the indulgent Venetian temper]5687-the indulgent venetian temper it seemed natural that [their]5686-the inmates seclusion should be made as little irksome as possible . As a rule the privileges accorded to [the nuns]5678-the nuns consisted merely in [their]5678-the nuns being allowed to receive visits in the presence of [a lay - sister]5689-a lay - sister , and to perform in concerts on the feast - days of [the order]9160-the order ; but [some few convents]5691-some few convents had a name for far greater license , and it was a common thing for [the noble libertine returned from [Italy]5-italy]5692-the noble libertine returned from italy to boast of [his]5692-the noble libertine returned from italy intrigue with [a Venetian nun]5693-a venetian nun . [Odo]234-odo , in [[the Procuratessa]5425-the procuratessa 's train]5695-the procuratessa 's train , had of course visited [many of [the principal convents]5697-the principal convents]5696-many of the principal convents . Whether it were owing to the malicious pleasure of contrasting [their]5696-many of the principal convents own state with that of [[their]5696-many of the principal convents cloistered sisters]5698-their cloistered sisters , or to the discreet shelter which the parlour afforded to [their]5696-many of the principal convents private intrigues , [the Venetian ladies]5699-the venetian ladies were exceedingly partial to these visits . [The Procuratessa]479-the procuratessa was no exception to the rule , and as was natural to one of [her]479-the procuratessa complexion , [she]479-the procuratessa preferred [the convents where the greatest freedom prevailed]5700-the convents where the greatest freedom prevailed . [Odo]234-odo , however , had hitherto found little to tempt [him]234-odo in these glimpses of forbidden fruit . [The nuns]5678-the nuns , though often young and pretty , had the insipidity of [women]771-women secluded from the passions and sorrows of life without being raised above [them]771-women ; and [he]234-odo preferred the frank coarseness of [[the Procuratessa]5425-the procuratessa 's circle]5704-the procuratessa 's circle to the simpering graces of [the cloister]1488-the cloister . Even [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant 's mysterious boast of a conquest [he]234-odo had made among [the sisters]5706-the sisters failed to excite [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend 's curiosity . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess , though still devoted to [Miranda]384-miranda , was too much [the child of [his]1107-the marquess race]4260-the child of his race not to seek variety in [his]1107-the marquess emotions ; indeed [he]1107-the marquess often declared that the one fault of [the Italian character]5710-the italian character was its unimaginative fidelity in love - affairs . " Does [a man]8112-a man , "[1107-the marquess] [he]1107-the marquess asked , " dine off one dish at a gourmet 's banquet ? And why should [I]1107-the marquess restrict [myself]1107-the marquess to one course at the most richly - spread table in [Europe]40-europe ? [One]8494-one must love at least [two women to appreciate either]9683-two women to appreciate either ; and , did [the silly creatures]9684-the silly creatures but know it , [a rival]9685-a rival becomes [them]9684-the silly creatures like a patch . "[1107-the marquess] [Sister Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary , [he]1107-the marquess went on to explain , possessed the very qualities that [Miranda]384-miranda lacked . [The daughter of [a rich nobleman of [Treviso]174-treviso]5712-a rich nobleman of treviso]5711-the daughter of a rich nobleman of treviso , [she]5711-the daughter of a rich nobleman of treviso was skilled in music , drawing and all the operations of the needle , and was early promised in marriage to [a young man whose estates adjoined [[her]5711-the daughter of a rich nobleman of treviso father]1415-her father 's]5713-a young man whose estates adjoined her father 's . The jealousy of [a younger sister]5715-a younger sister , who was secretly in love with [the suitor]5716-the suitor , caused [her]5715-a younger sister to accuse [[Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant 's mistress]5717-coeur - volant 's mistress of misconduct and thus broke off the marriage ; and [the unhappy girl]5718-the unhappy girl , repudiated by [[her]5718-the unhappy girl bridegroom]5719-her bridegroom , was at once despatched to [a convent in [Venice]41-venice]5720-a convent in venice . Enraged at [her]5718-the unhappy girl fate , [she]5718-the unhappy girl had repeatedly appealed to [the authorities]2448-the authorities to release [her]5718-the unhappy girl ; but [[her]5718-the unhappy girl father]1415-her father 's wealth and influence prevailed against all [her]5718-the unhappy girl efforts . [The abbess]5723-the abbess , however , felt such pity for [her]5718-the unhappy girl that [she]5718-the unhappy girl was allowed more freedom than [the other nuns , with whom [her]5718-the unhappy girl wit and beauty made [her]5718-the unhappy girl a favourite in spite of [her]5718-the unhappy girl exceptional privileges]5724-the other nuns , with whom her wit and beauty made her a favourite in spite of her exceptional privileges . These , as [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant hinted , included the liberty of leaving [the convent]3340-the convent after night - fall to visit [[her]5718-the unhappy girl friends]3119-her friends ; and [he]1415-her father professed to be [one of those whom [she]5718-the unhappy girl had thus honoured . Always eager to have [his]1415-her father good taste ratified by the envy of [[his]1415-her father friends]2637-his friends]5727-one of those whom she had thus honoured . always eager to have his good taste ratified by the envy of his friends , [he]1415-her father was urgent with [Odo]234-odo to make [the lady]660-the lady 's acquaintance , and it was agreed that , on the first favourable occasion , a meeting should take place at [[Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant 's casino]5730-coeur - volant 's casino . The weeks elapsed , however , without [Odo]234-odo 's hearing further of the matter , and it had nearly passed from [his]1415-her father mind when one August day [he]1415-her father received word that [the Marquess]1107-the marquess hoped for [his]1415-her father company that evening . [He]1415-her father was in that mood of careless acquiescence when any novelty invites , and the heavy warmth of the summer night seemed the accomplice of [his]1415-her father humour . Cloaked and masked , [he]1415-her father stepped into [his]1415-her father gondola and was swept rapidly along [the Grand Canal]5732-the grand canal and through winding channels to [the Giudecca]175-the giudecca . It was close on midnight and all [Venice]41-venice was abroad . Gondolas laden with [musicians and hung with coloured lamps]5733-musicians and hung with coloured lamps lay beneath [the palace]768-the palace windows or drifted out on [the oily reaches of [the lagoon]5669-the lagoon]5735-the oily reaches of the lagoon . There was no moon , and [the side - canals]5737-the side - canals were dark and noiseless but for the hundreds of caged nightingales that made every byway musical . As [his]1415-her father prow slipped past garden walls and under the blackness of [low - ached bridges]5738-low - ached bridges [Odo]234-odo felt the fathomless mystery of the Venetian night : not the open night of [the lagoons]5739-the lagoons , but the secret dusk of nameless waterways between blind windows and complaisant gates . At one of these [his]1415-her father gondola presently touched . The gate was cautiously unbarred and [Odo]234-odo found [himself]234-odo in a strip of [garden]5108-garden preceding [a low pavilion in which not a light was visible]5741-a low pavilion in which not a light was visible . [A woman - servant]5742-a woman - servant led [him]234-odo indoors and [the Marquess]1107-the marquess greeted [him]234-odo on the threshold . " [You]234-odo are late ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo exclaimed . " [I]234-odo began to fear [you]234-odo would not be here to receive [[our]9686-our guests]9687-our guests with [me]234-odo . "[234-odo] " [[Your]234-odo guests]9688-your guests ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo repeated . " [I]234-odo had fancied there was but one . "[234-odo] [The Marquess]1107-the marquess smiled . " [[My]234-odo dear]8444-my dear [Mary]268-sister mary of the Crucifix , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " is too well - born to venture out alone at this late hour , and has prevailed on [[her]268-sister mary bosom friend]9690-her bosom friend to accompany [her.--Besides]234-odo , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo added with [his]234-odo deprecating shrug , " [I]234-odo own [I]234-odo have had too recent an experience of [your]234-odo success to trust [you]234-odo alone with [[my]234-odo enchantress]9691-my enchantress ; and [she]9691-my enchantress has promised to bring [the most fascinating nun in [the convent]3340-the convent]9692-the most fascinating nun in the convent to protect [her]9691-my enchantress from [your]234-odo wiles . "[234-odo] As [he]234-odo spoke [he]234-odo led [Odo]234-odo into [a room furnished in the luxurious style of a French boudoir]5745-a room furnished in the luxurious style of a french boudoir . A Savonnerie carpet covered the floor , the lounges and easy - chairs were heaped with cushions , and the panels hung with pastel drawings of a lively or sentimental character . The windows toward [the garden]8185-the garden were close - shuttered , but those on the farther side of [the room]782-the room stood open on a starlit terrace whence the eye looked out over [the lagoon]5669-the lagoon to [the outer line of [islands]5750-islands]5749-the outer line of islands . " Confess , "[391-coeur - volant] cried [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant , pointing to a table set with delicacies and flanked by silver wine - coolers , " that [I]391-coeur - volant have spared no pains to do [my]391-coeur - volant goddess honour and that [this interior]4061-this interior must present an agreeable contrast to [the whitewashed cells and dismal refectory of [[her]9696-her convent]9697-her convent]9695-the whitewashed cells and dismal refectory of her convent ! No passion , "[391-coeur - volant] [he]391-coeur - volant continued , with [his]391-coeur - volant quaint didactic air , " is so susceptible as love to the influence of [its]9698-its surroundings ; and principles which might have held out against a horse - hair sofa and soupe a l'oignon have before now been known to succumb to silk cushions and champagne . "[391-coeur - volant] [He]391-coeur - volant received with perfect good - humour the retort that if [he]391-coeur - volant failed in [his]391-coeur - volant designs [[his]391-coeur - volant cook]5751-his cook and [[his]391-coeur - volant upholsterer]5752-his upholsterer would not be to blame ; and [the young men]2478-the young men were still engaged in such banter when [the servant]2349-the servant returned to say that a gondola was at the water - gate . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess hastened out and presently reappeared with [two masked and hooded figures]5756-two masked and hooded figures . The first of these , whom [he]1107-the marquess led by the hand , entered with the air of one not unaccustomed to [her]5757-her surroundings ; but the other hung back , and on [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's inviting [them]5756-two masked and hooded figures to unmask , hurriedly signed to [[her]5757-her friend]5759-her friend to refuse . " Very well , [fair strangers]9699-fair strangers , "[391-coeur - volant] said [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant with a laugh ; " if [you]9699-fair strangers insist on prolonging [our]2478-the young men suspense [we]2478-the young men shall avenge [ourselves]2478-the young men by prolonging [yours]9699-fair strangers , and neither [[my]391-coeur - volant friend]3178-my friend nor [I]391-coeur - volant will unmask till [you]9699-fair strangers are pleased to set [us]2478-the young men the example . "[391-coeur - volant] [The first lady]5760-the first lady echoed [his]1107-the marquess laugh . " Shall [I]5760-the first lady own , "[5760-the first lady] [she]5760-the first lady cried , " that [I]5760-the first lady suspect in this unflattering compliance a pretext to conceal [[your]9699-fair strangers friend]8799-your friend 's features from [me]5760-the first lady as long as possible ? For [my]5760-the first lady part , "[5760-the first lady] [she]5760-the first lady continued , throwing back [her]5760-the first lady hood , " the mask of hypocrisy [I]5760-the first lady am compelled to wear in [the convent]3340-the convent makes [me]5760-the first lady hate every form of disguise , and with all [my]5760-the first lady defects [I]5760-the first lady prefer to be known as [I]5760-the first lady am . "[5760-the first lady] And with that [she]5760-the first lady detached [her]5760-the first lady mask and dropped the cloak from [her]5760-the first lady shoulders . The gesture revealed [a beauty of the laughing sensuous type best suited to such surroundings]5761-a beauty of the laughing sensuous type best suited to such surroundings . [Sister Mary of the Crucifix , in [her]5760-the first lady sumptuous gown of shot - silk , with pearls wound through [her]5760-the first lady reddish hair and hanging on [her]5760-the first lady bare shoulders]268-sister mary , might have stepped from some festal canvas of [Bonifazio]489-bonifazio 's . [She]5760-the first lady had laid aside even the light gauze veil worn by [the nuns in gala habit]5762-the nuns in gala habit , and no vestige of [her]5760-the first lady calling showed itself in dress or bearing . " Do [you]1107-the marquess accept [my]5760-the first lady challenge , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere ? "[5760-the first lady] [she]5760-the first lady exclaimed , turning on [Odo]234-odo a glance confident of victory . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess meanwhile had approached [the other nun]5764-the other nun with the intention of inducing [her]5764-the other nun to unmask ; but as [Sister Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary advanced to perform the same service for [[his]1107-the marquess friend]2124-his friend , [his]1107-the marquess irrepressible jealousy made [him]1107-the marquess step hastily between [them]5766-them . " Come [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[1107-the marquess] [he]1107-the marquess cried , drawing [Odo]234-odo gaily toward [the unknown nun]5767-the unknown nun , " since [you]8111-cavaliere have induced [one of [[our]9706-our fair guests]9707-our fair guests]9705-one of our fair guests to unmask perhaps [you]8111-cavaliere may be equally successful with the other , who appears provokingly indifferent to [my]1107-the marquess advances . "[1107-the marquess] [The masked nun]5768-the masked nun had in fact retreated to a corner of [the room]782-the room and stood there , drawing [her]5768-the masked nun cloak about [her]5768-the masked nun , rather in the attitude of [a frightened child]5770-a frightened child than in that of [a lady bent on a gallant adventure]5771-a lady bent on a gallant adventure . [Sister Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary approached [her]1107-the marquess playfully . " [[My]268-sister mary dear]8444-my dear [Sister Veronica]490-sister veronica , "[268-sister mary] said [she]268-sister mary , throwing [her]268-sister mary arm about [the other]905-the other 's neck , " hesitates to reveal charms which [she]268-sister mary knows must cast mine in the shade ; but [I]268-sister mary am not to be outdone in generosity , and if [the Marquess]1107-the marquess will unmask [[his]1107-the marquess friend]2124-his friend [I]268-sister mary will do the same by [mine]268-sister mary . "[268-sister mary] As [she]268-sister mary spoke [she]268-sister mary deftly pinioned [the nun]5614-the nun 's hands and snatched off [her]268-sister mary mask with a malicious laugh . [The Marquess]1107-the marquess , entering into [her]268-sister mary humour , removed [Odo]234-odo 's at the same instant , and [the latter , turning with a laugh]5775-the latter , turning with a laugh , found [himself]5775-the latter , turning with a laugh face to face with [Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia . [He]5775-the latter , turning with a laugh grew white , and [Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary sprang forward to catch [[her]268-sister mary friend]5759-her friend . " [Good God]249-god ! What is this ? "[1107-the marquess] gasped [the Marquess]1107-the marquess , staring from one to [the other]905-the other . A glance of entreaty from [Fulvia]362-fulvia checked the answer on [Odo]234-odo 's lips , and for a moment there was silence in [the room]782-the room ; then [Fulvia]362-fulvia , breaking away from [[her]362-fulvia companion]2330-her companion , fled out on [the terrace]4571-the terrace . [The other]905-the other was about to follow ; but [Odo]234-odo , controlling [himself]234-odo , stepped between [them]5783-them . " [Madam]8129-madam , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo in a low voice , " [I]234-odo recognise in [[your]8129-madam companion]9712-your companion [a friend of whom [I]234-odo have long had no word]9713-a friend of whom i have long had no word . Will [you]8129-madam pardon [me]234-odo if [I]234-odo speak with [her]9712-your companion alone ? "[234-odo] [Sister Mary]268-sister mary drew back with a meaning sparkle in [her]268-sister mary handsome eyes .
