" Why , this , "[268-sister mary] [she]268-sister mary cried , not without a touch of resentment , " is the prettiest ending imaginable ; but what [a sly creature]9714-a sly creature , to be sure , to make [me]268-sister mary think it was [her]9712-your companion first assignation ! "[268-sister mary] [Odo]234-odo , without answering , hastened out on [the terrace]4571-the terrace . It was so dark after [the brightly lit room]5785-the brightly lit room that for a moment [he]234-odo did not distinguish the figure which had sprung to the low parapet above [the water]5281-the water ; and [he]234-odo stumbled forward just in time to snatch [Fulvia]362-fulvia back to safety . " This is madness ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , as [she]362-fulvia hung upon [him]234-odo trembling . " [The boat]9715-the boat , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia stammered in a strange sobbing voice--"the [boat]9716-boat should be somewhere below-- "[362-fulvia] " [The boat]9715-the boat lies at the water - gate on the other side , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo answered . [She]362-fulvia drew away from [him]234-odo with a gesture of despair . The struggle with [Sister Mary]268-sister mary had disordered [her]362-fulvia hair and it fell on [her]362-fulvia white neck in loosened strands . " [My]362-fulvia cloak -- [my]362-fulvia mask-- "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia faltered vaguely , clasping [her]362-fulvia hands across [her]362-fulvia bosom ; then suddenly dropped to a seat and burst into tears . Once before -- but in how different a case!--he had seen [her]362-fulvia thus thrilled with weeping . Then fate had thrown [him]234-odo humbled at [her]362-fulvia feet , now it was [she]362-fulvia who cried [him]234-odo mercy in every line of [her]362-fulvia bowed head and shaken breast ; and the thought of that other meeting flooded [his]234-odo heart with pity . [He]234-odo knelt before [her]362-fulvia , seeking [her]362-fulvia hands . " [Fulvia]362-fulvia , why do [you]362-fulvia shrink from [me]234-odo ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo whispered . But [she]362-fulvia shook [her]362-fulvia head and wept on . At last [her]362-fulvia sobs subsided and [she]362-fulvia rose to [her]362-fulvia feet . " [I]362-fulvia must go back , "[362-fulvia] said [she]362-fulvia in a low tone , and would have passed [him]234-odo . " Back ? To [the convent]3340-the convent ? "[362-fulvia] " To [the convent]3340-the convent , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said after [him]234-odo ; but [she]362-fulvia made no farther effort to move . The question that tortured [him]234-odo sprang forth . " [You]234-odo have taken the vows ? "[362-fulvia] " A month since , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia answered . [He]234-odo hid [his]234-odo face in [his]234-odo hands and for a moment both were silent . " And [you]234-odo have no other word for [me]234-odo -- none ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo faltered at last . [She]362-fulvia fixed [him]234-odo with a hard bright stare . " Yes -- one , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried ; " keep a place for [me]362-fulvia among [your]234-odo gallant recollections . "[362-fulvia] " [Fulvia]362-fulvia ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said with sudden strength , and caught [her]362-fulvia by the arm . " Let [me]362-fulvia pass ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried . " No , by heaven ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo retorted ; " not till [you]362-fulvia listen to [me]234-odo -- not till [you]362-fulvia tell [me]234-odo how it is that [I]234-odo come upon [you]362-fulvia here!--Ah , [child]8126-child , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo broke out , " do [you]362-fulvia fancy [I]234-odo do n't see how little [you]362-fulvia belong in such scenes ? That [I]234-odo do n't know [you]362-fulvia are here through some dreadful error ? [Fulvia]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo pleaded , " will [you]362-fulvia never trust [me]234-odo ? "[234-odo] And at the word [he]234-odo burned with blushes in the darkness . [His]234-odo voice , perhaps , rather than what [he]234-odo said , seemed to have struck a yielding fibre . [He]234-odo felt [her]5787-you arm tremble in [his]234-odo hold ; but after a moment [she]5787-you said with cruel distinctness : " There was no error . [I]5787-you came knowingly . It was [the company]1753-the company and not the place [I]5787-you was deceived in . "[5787-you] [Odo]234-odo drew back with a start ; then , as if in spite of [himself]234-odo , [he]234-odo broke into a laugh . " By [the saints]1218-the saints , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , almost joyously , " [I]234-odo am sorry to be where [I]234-odo am not wanted ; but since [no better company]9723-no better company offers , will [you]5787-you not make the best of [mine]234-odo and suffer [me]234-odo to hand [you]5787-you in to supper with [[our]9724-our friends]9725-our friends ? "[234-odo] And with a low bow [he]234-odo offered [her]5787-you [his]234-odo arm . The effect was instantaneous . [He]234-odo saw [her]5787-you catch at the balustrade for support . " Sancta simplicitas ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo exulted , " and did [you]5787-you think to play the part at such short notice ? "[234-odo] [He]234-odo fell at [her]5787-you feet and covered [her]5787-you hands with kisses . " [[My]234-odo Fulvia]8572-my fulvia ! [[My]234-odo poor child]9727-my poor child ! come with [me]234-odo , come away from here , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo entreated . " [I]234-odo know not what mad hazard has brought [us]9724-our thus together , but [I]234-odo thank [God]249-god on [my]234-odo knees for the encounter . [You]5787-you shall tell [me]234-odo all or nothing , as [you]5787-you please -- [you]5787-you shall presently dismiss [me]234-odo at [[your]5787-you convent]9728-your convent - gate , and never see [me]234-odo again if [you]5787-you so will it -- but till then , [I]234-odo swear , [you]5787-you are in [my]234-odo charge , and no human power shall come between [us]9729-us ! "[234-odo] As [he]234-odo ended [the Marquess]1107-the marquess 's voice called gaily through the open window : " [Friends]8255-friends , the burgundy is uncorked ! Will [you]5787-you not join [us]9729-us in a glass of good French wine ? "[1107-the marquess] [Fulvia]362-fulvia flung [herself]362-fulvia upon [Odo]234-odo . " Yes -- yes ; away -- take [me]362-fulvia away from here ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried , clinging to [him]234-odo . [She]362-fulvia had gathered [her]362-fulvia cloak about [her]362-fulvia and drawn the hood over [her]362-fulvia disordered hair . " Away ! Away ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia repeated . " [I]362-fulvia can not see [them]9731-them again . [Good God]249-god , is there no other way out ? "[362-fulvia] With a gesture [he]234-odo warned [her]362-fulvia to be silent and drew [her]362-fulvia along [the terrace]4571-the terrace in the shadow of [the house]1917-the house . The gravel creaked beneath [their]5791-their feet , and [she]362-fulvia shook at the least sound ; but [her]362-fulvia hand lay in [his]234-odo like [a child]1186-a child 's and [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo [[her]362-fulvia master]5793-her master . At the farther end of [the terrace]4571-the terrace a flight of steps led to a narrow strip of shore . [He]234-odo helped [her]362-fulvia down and after listening a moment gave a whistle . Presently [they]5791-their heard a low plash of oars and saw the prow of [a gondola]5795-a gondola cautiously rounding the angle of [the terrace]4571-the terrace . The water was shallow and [the boatmen]5797-the boatmen proceeded slowly and at length paused a few yards from [the land]8269-the land . " [We]5791-their can come no nearer , "[5797-the boatmen] one of [them]5797-the boatmen called ; " what is it ? "[5797-the boatmen] " [[Your]234-odo mistress]9664-your mistress is unwell and wishes to return , "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo answered ; and catching [Fulvia]362-fulvia in [his]234-odo arms [he]234-odo waded out with [her]362-fulvia to [the gondola]5799-the gondola and lifted [her]362-fulvia over the side . " To [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo ordered , as [he]234-odo laid [her]362-fulvia on the cushions beneath [the felze]5800-the felze ; and [the boatmen]5797-the boatmen , recognising [her]362-fulvia as one of [[their]5797-the boatmen late fares]5802-their late fares , without more ado began to row rapidly toward [the city]2261-the city . 3.4 . In the pitying darkness of [the gondola]5799-the gondola [she]362-fulvia lay beyond speech , [her]362-fulvia hand in [his]234-odo , [her]362-fulvia breath coming fitfully . [Odo]234-odo waited in suspense , not daring to question [her]362-fulvia , yet sure that if [she]362-fulvia did not speak then [she]362-fulvia would never do so . All doubt and perplexity of spirit had vanished in the simple sense of [her]362-fulvia nearness . The throb of [her]362-fulvia hand in [his]234-odo was like the heart - beat of hope . [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo no longer [a drifting spectator of life but a sharer in its gifts and renunciations]5805-a drifting spectator of life but a sharer in its gifts and renunciations . Which this meeting would bring [he]234-odo dared not yet surmise : it was enough that [he]234-odo was with [Fulvia]362-fulvia and that love had freed [his]234-odo spirit . At length [she]362-fulvia began to speak . [Her]362-fulvia agitation was so great that [he]234-odo had difficulty in piecing together the fragments of [her]362-fulvia story ; but for the moment [he]234-odo was more concerned in regaining [her]362-fulvia confidence than in seeking to obtain a clear picture of the past . Before [she]362-fulvia could end , [the gondola]5799-the gondola rounded the corner of the narrow canal skirting [the garden - wall of [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara]5807-the garden - wall of santa chiara . Alarmed lest [he]234-odo should lose [her]362-fulvia again [he]234-odo passionately urged [her]362-fulvia to receive [him]234-odo on the morrow ; and after some hesitation [she]362-fulvia consented . A moment later [their]5808-their prow touched the postern and [the boatman]4829-the boatman gave a low call which proved [him]234-odo no novice at the business . [Fulvia]362-fulvia signed to [Odo]234-odo not to speak or move ; and [they]5808-their sat listening intently for the opening of the gate . As soon as it was unbarred [she]362-fulvia sprang ashore and vanished in the darkness of [the garden]8185-the garden ; and with a cold sense of failure [Odo]234-odo heard the bolt slipping back and the stealthy fall of the oars as [the gondola]5799-the gondola slid away under the shadow of the convent - wall . Whither was [he]234-odo being carried and would that bolt ever be drawn for [him]234-odo again ? In the sultry dawn [the convent]3340-the convent loomed forbiddingly as [a prison]5813-a prison , and [he]234-odo could hardly believe that a few hours earlier the very doors now closed against [him]234-odo had stood open to all [the world]844-the world . [They]5815-they would open again ; but whether to [him]234-odo , who could conjecture ? [He]234-odo was resolved to see [Fulvia]362-fulvia again , but [he]234-odo shrank from the thought of forcing [himself]234-odo upon [her]362-fulvia . [She]362-fulvia had promised to receive [him]234-odo ; but what revulsion of feeling might not the morrow bring ? Unable to sleep , [he]234-odo bade [the boatmen]5797-the boatmen carry [him]234-odo to [the Lido]177-the lido . The sun was just rising above [the Friulian Alps]178-the friulian alps and [the lagoon]5669-the lagoon lay dull and smooth as a breathed - on mirror . As [he]234-odo paced [the lonely sands]5818-the lonely sands [he]234-odo tried to reconstruct [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's broken story , supplementing it with such details as [his]234-odo experience of Venetian life suggested . It appeared that after [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father 's death [she]362-fulvia had found [herself]362-fulvia possessed of a small sum of money which [he]234-odo had painfully accumulated for [her]362-fulvia during the two years [they]5820-they had spent in [Pavia]12-pavia . [Her]362-fulvia only thought was to employ this inheritance in publishing the great work on the origin of civilisation which [Vivaldi]362-fulvia had completed a few days before [his]234-odo last seizure . Through [one of [the professors of [the University]9247-the university]5822-the professors of the university , who had been [[her]362-fulvia father 's friend]5824-her father 's friend]5821-one of the professors of the university , who had been her father 's friend , [she]362-fulvia negotiated with [a printer of [Amsterdam]179-amsterdam]5825-a printer of amsterdam for the production of the book , and the terms being agreed on , despatched the money and the manuscript thither by a sure hand . Both were duly delivered and [the publisher]5826-the publisher had advanced so far in [his]5826-the publisher work as to send [Fulvia]362-fulvia the proof - sheets of the first chapters , when [he]5826-the publisher took alarm at the renewed activity of [the Holy Office in [France]22-france and [Italy]5-italy]5827-the holy office in france and italy , declared there would be no market for the book in the present state of affairs , and refused either to continue printing it , or to restore the money , which [he]5826-the publisher said had barely covered the setting - up of the type . [Fulvia]362-fulvia then attempted to recover the manuscript ; but [the publisher]5826-the publisher refusing to surrender it , [she]362-fulvia found [herself]362-fulvia doubly beggared at a stroke . In this extremity [she]362-fulvia turned to [a sister of [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father 's , who lived near [Treviso]174-treviso]5829-a sister of her father 's , who lived near treviso ; and [this excellent woman]5831-this excellent woman , though persuaded that [[her]5831-this excellent woman brother]3266-her brother 's heretical views had doomed [him]3266-her brother to everlasting torment , did not scruple to offer [[his]5826-the publisher child]5833-his child a [home]1346-home . Here [Fulvia]362-fulvia had lived for two years when [[her]362-fulvia aunt]5835-her aunt 's sudden death left [her]362-fulvia destitute ; for [the good lady]5836-the good lady , to atone for having given shelter to [a niece of doubtful orthodoxy]5837-a niece of doubtful orthodoxy , had left the whole of [[her]5836-the good lady small property]5838-her small property to [the Church]1212-the church . [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's only other relations were [certain distant cousins of [[her]362-fulvia mother]1416-her mother 's , [members of [the Venetian nobility]5183-the venetian nobility]5842-members of the venetian nobility , but of [the indigent class called [Barnabotti]492-barnabotti , who lived on the bounty of [the state]2921-the state]5844-the indigent class called barnabotti , who lived on the bounty of the state]5840-certain distant cousins of her mother 's , members of the venetian nobility , but of the indigent class called barnabotti , who lived on the bounty of the state . While in [Treviso]174-treviso [she]362-fulvia had made the acquaintance of [one of [these cousins]5847-these cousins]5846-one of these cousins , [a stirring noisy fellow involved in all the political agitations of]5848-a stirring noisy fellow involved in all the political agitations of [the state]2921-the state . It was among [the Barnabotti]492-barnabotti , [the class most indebted to [the government]2558-the government]5850-the class most indebted to the government , that these seditious movements generally arose ; and [[Fulvia]362-fulvia 's cousin]5852-fulvia 's cousin was [one of [the most notorious malcontents of [his]5855-his order]5854-the most notorious malcontents of his order]5853-one of the most notorious malcontents of his order . [She]362-fulvia had mistaken [his]5855-his revolutionary bluster for philosophic enlightenment ; and , persuaded that [he]5855-his shared in [her]362-fulvia views , [she]362-fulvia rashly appealed to [him]5855-his for help . With the most eloquent expressions of sympathy [he]5855-his offered [her]362-fulvia [a home under [his]5855-his own roof]5856-a home under his own roof ; but on reaching [Venice]41-venice [she]362-fulvia was but ill - received by [[his]5855-his wife]1713-his wife and [family]5858-family , who made no scruple of declaring that , being but [pensioners]5859-pensioners [themselves]5859-pensioners , [they]5859-pensioners were in no state to nourish [[their]5859-pensioners pauper relatives]5860-their pauper relatives . [Fulvia]362-fulvia could not but own that [they]5861-they were right ; for [they]5861-they lived in [the garret of [a half - ruined house]5863-a half - ruined house]5862-the garret of a half - ruined house , pawning [their]5861-they very beds to pay for ices in [the Piazza]3114-the piazza and sitting at [home]1346-home all the week in dirty shifts and night - caps that [they]5861-they might go to mass in silk and powder on a Sunday . After two months of wretchedness with [these unfriendly hosts , whom [she]362-fulvia vainly tried to conciliate by a hundred little services and attentions [the poor girl]3854-the poor girl]5866-these unfriendly hosts , whom she vainly tried to conciliate by a hundred little services and attentions the poor girl resolved to return to [Milan]14-milan , where [she]362-fulvia hoped to obtain some menial position in the household of [one of [[her]362-fulvia father 's friends]5869-her father 's friends]5868-one of her father 's friends . [[Her]362-fulvia cousins]5870-her cousins , at this , made a great outcry , protesting that none of [their]5870-her cousins blood should so demean [herself]362-fulvia , and that [they]5870-her cousins would spare no efforts to find some better way of providing for [her]362-fulvia . [Their]5870-her cousins noble connections gave [Fulvia]362-fulvia the hope that [they]5870-her cousins might obtain a small pension for [her]362-fulvia , and [she]362-fulvia unsuspiciously yielded to [their]5870-her cousins wishes ; but to [her]362-fulvia dismay [she]362-fulvia learned a few weeks later , that , thanks to [their]5870-her cousins exertions , [she]362-fulvia was to be admitted as [a novice]5871-a novice to [the convent of [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara]5872-the convent of santa chiara . Though it was the common way of disposing of [portionless girls]5873-portionless girls , the liberal views of [[her]362-fulvia cousins]5870-her cousins had reassured [Fulvia]362-fulvia , and [she]362-fulvia woke to [her]362-fulvia fate too late to escape it . [She]362-fulvia was to enter on [her]362-fulvia novitiate on the morrow ; but even had delay been possible [she]362-fulvia knew that both the civil and religious authorities would sustain [[her]362-fulvia family]5875-her family in [their]5875-her family course . [[Her]362-fulvia cousins]5870-her cousins , knowing [her]362-fulvia independent spirit , and perhaps fearing an outcry if [they]5870-her cousins sequestered [her]362-fulvia too closely , had thought to soften [her]362-fulvia resistance by placing [her]362-fulvia in [a convent noted for [its]5877-a convent noted for its leniencies leniencies]5877-a convent noted for its leniencies ; but to [Fulvia]362-fulvia [such surroundings]5878-such surroundings were more repugnant than the strictest monastic discipline . The corruption of [the religious orders]5879-the religious orders was a favourite topic with [[her]362-fulvia father 's friends]5869-her father 's friends , and [the Venetian nuns]5881-the venetian nuns were noted throughout [Italy]5-italy for [their]5881-the venetian nuns frivolous and dissipated lives ; but nothing that [Fulvia]362-fulvia had heard or imagined approached the realities that awaited [her]362-fulvia . At first the mere sense of imprisonment , of being cut off forever from the world of free thought and action which had been [her]362-fulvia native element , overwhelmed every other feeling , and [she]362-fulvia lay numb in the clutch of fate . But [she]362-fulvia was too young for this merciful torpor to last , and with the returning consciousness of [her]362-fulvia situation came the instinctive effort to amend it . How [she]362-fulvia longed then to have been buried in some strict order , where [she]362-fulvia might have spent [her]362-fulvia days in solitary work and meditation ! How [she]362-fulvia loathed the petty gossip of [the nuns]5678-the nuns , [their]5678-the nuns furtive reaching after forbidden pleasures ! The blindest bigotry would have been less insufferable than this clandestine commerce with [the world]844-the world , the strictest sequestration than this open parody of the monastic calling . [She]362-fulvia sought in vain among [[her]362-fulvia companions]5884-her companions for an answering mind . Many , like [herself]362-fulvia , were in open rebellion against [their]5884-her companions lot ; but for reasons so different that the feeling was an added estrangement . At last the longing to escape over - mastered every other sensation . It became a fixed idea , a devouring passion . [She]362-fulvia did not trust [herself]362-fulvia to think of what must follow , but centred every faculty on the effort of evasion . At this point in [her]362-fulvia story [her]362-fulvia growing distress had made it hard for [Odo]234-odo to gather more than a general hint of [her]362-fulvia meaning . It was clear , however , that [she]362-fulvia had found [her]362-fulvia sole hope of escape lay in gaining the friendship of [one of [the more favoured nuns]5886-the more favoured nuns]5885-one of the more favoured nuns . [Her]362-fulvia own position in [the community]5887-the community was of the humblest , for [she]362-fulvia had neither rank nor wealth to commend [her]362-fulvia ; but [her]362-fulvia skill on the harpsichord had attracted the notice of [the music - mistress]5888-the music - mistress and [she]362-fulvia had been enrolled in [the convent]3340-the convent orchestra before [her]362-fulvia novitiate was over . This had brought [her]362-fulvia into contact with [a few of [the more favoured sisters]5891-the more favoured sisters]5890-a few of the more favoured sisters , and among [them]5890-a few of the more favoured sisters [she]362-fulvia had recognised in [Sister Mary of the Crucifix the daughter of the nobleman who had been [[her]362-fulvia aunt 's landlord at [Treviso]174-treviso]5893-her aunt 's landlord at treviso]5892-sister mary of the crucifix the daughter of the nobleman who had been her aunt 's landlord at treviso . [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's name was not unknown to [the handsome nun]5894-the handsome nun , and the coincidence was enough to draw [them]5895-them together in a community where such trivial affinities must replace the ties of nature . [Fulvia]362-fulvia soon learned that [Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary was [the spoiled darling of [the convent]3340-the convent]5896-the spoiled darling of the convent . [Her]362-fulvia beauty and spirit , as much perhaps as [[her]362-fulvia family]5875-her family connections , had given [her]362-fulvia this predominance ; and no scruples interfered with [her]362-fulvia use of it . Finding [herself]362-fulvia , as [she]362-fulvia declared , on the wrong side of [the grate]5899-the grate , [she]362-fulvia determined to gather in all the pleasures [she]362-fulvia could reach through [it]5899-the grate ; and [her]362-fulvia reach was certainly prodigious . Here [Odo]234-odo had been obliged to fall back on [his]234-odo knowledge of [Venetian]180-venetian customs to conjecture the incidents leading up to the scene of the previous night . [He]234-odo divined that [Fulvia]362-fulvia , maddened by having had to pronounce the irrevocable vows , had resolved to fly at all hazards ; that [Sister Mary]268-sister mary , unconscious of [her]268-sister mary designs , had proposed to take [her]362-fulvia on a party of pleasure , and that [the rash girl , blind to every risk but that of delay]5900-the rash girl , blind to every risk but that of delay , had seized on this desperate means of escape . What must have followed had [she]362-fulvia not chanced on [Odo]234-odo , [she]362-fulvia had clearly neither the courage nor the experience to picture ; but [she]362-fulvia seemed to have had some confused idea of throwing [herself]362-fulvia on the mercy of [the foreign nobleman [she]362-fulvia believed [she]362-fulvia was to meet]5901-the foreign nobleman she believed she was to meet . So much [Odo]234-odo had gathered ; and [her]362-fulvia voice , [her]362-fulvia gesture , the disorder of [her]362-fulvia spirit , supplied what [her]362-fulvia words omitted . Not for a moment , either in listening to [her]362-fulvia or in the soberer period of revision , did [he]234-odo question the exact truth of [her]362-fulvia narrative . It was the second time that [they]5902-they had met under strange circumstances ; yet now as before the sense of [her]362-fulvia candour was [his]234-odo ruling thought . [He]234-odo concluded that , whatever plight [she]362-fulvia found [herself]362-fulvia in , [she]362-fulvia would be its immediate justification ; and felt sure [he]234-odo must have reached this conclusion though love had not had a stake in the verdict . This perhaps but proved [him]234-odo the more deeply taken ; for it is when passion tightens the net that reason flaps [her]362-fulvia wings most loudly . Day was high when [he]234-odo returned to [[his]234-odo lodgings]2818-his lodgings , impatient for a word from [Fulvia]362-fulvia . None had come ; and as the hours passed [he]234-odo yielded to the most disheartening fancies . [His]234-odo wretchedness was increased by the thought that [he]234-odo had once inflicted on [her]362-fulvia such suspense [he]234-odo was now enduring ; and [he]234-odo went so far as to wonder if this were [her]362-fulvia revenge for [Vercelli]472-vercelli . But if the past was intolerable to consider the future was all baffling fears . [His]234-odo immediate study was how to see [her]362-fulvia ; and this [her]362-fulvia continued silence seemed to refuse [him]234-odo . The extremity of [her]362-fulvia plight was [[his]234-odo best ally]5904-his best ally ; yet here again anxiety suggested that [his]234-odo having been the witness of [her]362-fulvia humiliation must insensibly turn [her]362-fulvia against [him]234-odo . Never perhaps does [a man]8112-a man show less knowledge of human nature than in speculating on the conduct of [[his]8112-a man beloved]5906-his beloved ; and every step in the labyrinth of [his]234-odo conjectures carried [Odo]234-odo farther from the truth . This rose on [him]234-odo at nightfall , in the shape of a letter slipped in [his]234-odo hand by [a lay - sister]5689-a lay - sister as [he]234-odo crossed [the square]1592-the square before [[his]234-odo lodgings]2818-his lodgings . [He]234-odo stepped to the light of [the nearest shrine]5910-the nearest shrine and read the few words in a tumult . " This being Friday , [no visitors]9733-no visitors are admitted to [the convent]3340-the convent ; but [I]234-odo entreat [you]5689-a lay - sister to come to [me]234-odo tomorrow an hour before benediction . "[234-odo] A postcript added : " It is the hour when [visitors]9735-visitors are most frequent . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo saw [her]5689-a lay - sister meaning in a flash : [his]234-odo best chance of speaking with [her]5689-a lay - sister was in a crowd , and [his]234-odo heart bounded at the significance of [her]5689-a lay - sister admission . Now indeed [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo lord of the future . Nothing counted but that [he]234-odo was to see [her]5689-a lay - sister . [His]234-odo horizon was narrowed to the bars through which [her]5689-a lay - sister hand would greet [him]234-odo ; yet never had [the world]844-the world appeared so vast . Long before the hour appointed [he]234-odo was at the gate of [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara . [He]234-odo asked to speak with [Sister Veronica]490-sister veronica and [the portress]5912-the portress led [him]234-odo to [the parlour]1679-the parlour . [Several nuns]5914-several nuns were already behind [the grate]5899-the grate , chatting with [a group of [fashionable ladies]5917-fashionable ladies]5916-a group of fashionable ladies and [[their]5916-a group of fashionable ladies gallants]5629-their gallants ; but [Fulvia]362-fulvia was not among [them]5914-several nuns . In a few moments [the portress]5912-the portress returned and informed [Odo]234-odo that [Sister Veronica]490-sister veronica was indisposed and unable to leave [[her]490-sister veronica cell]5920-her cell . [His]234-odo heart sank , and [he]234-odo asked if [she]490-sister veronica had sent no message . [The portress]5912-the portress answered in the negative , but added that [the abbess]5723-the abbess begged [him]234-odo to come to [[her]5723-the abbess parlour]5923-her parlour ; and at this [his]234-odo hopes took wing again . [[The abbess]5723-the abbess 's parlour]5925-the abbess 's parlour was preceded by [a handsome antechamber]5926-a handsome antechamber , where [Odo]234-odo was bidden to wait . It was doubtless [the Reverend Mother]5927-the reverend mother 's hour for receiving company , for through the door beyond [he]234-odo heard laughter and music and the sound of lively talk . Presently this door opened and [[Mary]268-sister mary of [the Crucifix]5929-the crucifix]5928-mary of the crucifix entered . In [her]268-sister mary monastic habit [she]268-sister mary looked coarse and overblown : the severe lines and sober tints of the dress did not become [her]268-sister mary . [Odo]234-odo felt an insurmountable repugnance at seeing [her]268-sister mary . [He]234-odo could not conceive why [Fulvia]362-fulvia had chosen such [an intermediary]5930-an intermediary , and for the first time a stealing doubt tainted [his]234-odo thoughts of [her]268-sister mary . [Sister Mary]268-sister mary seemed to read [his]234-odo mind . " [You]234-odo bear [me]268-sister mary a grudge , "[268-sister mary] said [she]268-sister mary gaily ; " but [I]268-sister mary think [you]234-odo will live to own that [I]268-sister mary do not return it . Come with [me]268-sister mary if [you]234-odo wish to speak with [Sister Veronica]490-sister veronica . "[268-sister mary] [Odo]234-odo flushed with surprise . " [She]490-sister veronica is not too unwell to receive [me]234-odo ? "[234-odo] [Sister Mary]268-sister mary raised [her]268-sister mary eyebrows in astonishment . " To receive [[her]490-sister veronica cousin]3116-her cousin ? [[Her]490-sister veronica nearest male relative]9737-her nearest male relative , come from [Treviso]174-treviso purposely to visit [her]490-sister veronica ? [The saints]1218-the saints forbid ! "[268-sister mary] [she]268-sister mary cried . " [The poor child]9739-the poor child is indeed dying -- but only to see [[her]490-sister veronica cousin]3116-her cousin ! "[268-sister mary] And with that [she]268-sister mary seized [his]234-odo hand and hurried [him]234-odo down [the corridor]5931-the corridor to a door on which [she]268-sister mary tapped three times . It opened at once , and catching [Odo]234-odo by the shoulder [she]268-sister mary pushed [him]234-odo laughingly over the threshold and cried out as [she]268-sister mary vanished : " Be careful not to agitate [the sufferer]1627-the sufferer ! "[268-sister mary] [Odo]234-odo found [himself]234-odo in [a neat plain cell]5932-a neat plain cell ; but [he]234-odo had no eyes for [his]234-odo surroundings . All that [he]234-odo saw was [Fulvia]362-fulvia , dressed in [[her]362-fulvia nun]5933-her nun 's habit and seated near the window , through which the afternoon light fell softly on [her]362-fulvia white coif and the austere folds of [her]362-fulvia dress . [She]362-fulvia rose and greeted [him]234-odo with a smile . " [You]234-odo are not ill , then ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , stupidly , and the colour rose to [her]362-fulvia pale face . " No , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , " [I]362-fulvia am not ill , and at first [I]362-fulvia was reluctant to make use of such a subterfuge ; but to feign an indisposition was the only way of speaking with [you]234-odo privately , and , alas , in [this school]9742-this school [one]8494-one soon becomes a proficient in deceit . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia paused a moment and then added with an effort : " Even this favour [I]362-fulvia could not have obtained save through [Sister Mary]268-sister mary of the Crucifix ; but [she]362-fulvia now understands that [you]234-odo are [an old friend of [[my]362-fulvia father]8146-my father 's]9744-an old friend of my father 's , and that [my]362-fulvia motive for wishing to see [you]234-odo is not what [she]362-fulvia at first supposed . "[362-fulvia] This was said with such noble simplicity and so direct a glance , that [Odo]234-odo , confused by the sense of [his]234-odo own doubts , could only murmur as [he]234-odo bent over [her]362-fulvia hand : " Fuoco di quest ' incendio non v ' assale . "[234-odo] [She]362-fulvia drew back gently and signed [him]234-odo to a seat . " [I]362-fulvia trust not , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , answering [his]234-odo citation ; " but [I]362-fulvia think the flame through which [Beatrice]493-beatrice walked must have been less contaminating than this morass in which [I]362-fulvia flounder . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia was silent a moment and [he]234-odo had leisure to steal a closer look at [her]362-fulvia . It was the first time since [their]5934-them meeting that [he]234-odo had really seen [her]362-fulvia face ; and [he]234-odo was struck by the touch of awe that had come upon [her]362-fulvia beauty . Perhaps [her]362-fulvia recent suffering had spiritualised a countenance already pure and lofty ; for as [he]234-odo looked at [her]362-fulvia it seemed to [him]234-odo that [she]362-fulvia was transformed into a being beyond earthly contact , and [his]234-odo heart sank with the sense of [her]362-fulvia remoteness . Presently [she]362-fulvia began to speak and [his]234-odo consciousness of the distance between [them]5934-them was increased by the composure of [her]362-fulvia manner . All signs of confusion and distress had vanished . [She]362-fulvia faced [him]234-odo with the same innocent freedom as under [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father 's roof , and all that had since passed between [them]5934-them seemed to have slipped from [her]362-fulvia without a trace . [She]362-fulvia began by thanking [him]234-odo for coming , and then at once reverted to [her]362-fulvia desperate situation and to [her]362-fulvia determination to escape . " [I]362-fulvia am alone and friendless , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , " and though the length of [our]5934-them past acquaintance "[362-fulvia] ( and here indeed [she]362-fulvia blushed ) " scarce warrants such a presumption , yet [I]362-fulvia believe that in [[my]362-fulvia father]8146-my father 's name [I]362-fulvia may appeal to [you]234-odo . It may be that with the best will to help [me]362-fulvia [you]234-odo can discover no way of doing so , but at least [I]362-fulvia shall have the benefit of [your]234-odo advice . [I]362-fulvia now see , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia added , again deeply blushing , but keeping [her]362-fulvia eyes on [his]234-odo , " the madness of [my]362-fulvia late attempt , and the depth of the abyss from which [you]234-odo rescued [me]362-fulvia . Death were indeed preferable to such chances ; but [I]362-fulvia do not mean to die while life holds out a hope of liberation . "[362-fulvia] As [she]362-fulvia spoke there flashed on [Odo]234-odo the reason of [her]362-fulvia remoteness and composure . [He]234-odo had come to [her]362-fulvia as [a lover]5936-a lover : [she]362-fulvia received [him]234-odo as [a friend]8895-a friend . [His]234-odo longing to aid [her]362-fulvia was inspired by passion : [she]362-fulvia saw in it only the natural impulse of benevolence . So mortifying was the discovery that [he]234-odo hardly followed [her]362-fulvia words . All [his]234-odo thoughts were engaged in reviewing the past ; and [he]234-odo now saw that if , as [she]362-fulvia said , [their]5938-their acquaintance scarce warranted [her]362-fulvia appealing to [him]234-odo as [a friend]8895-a friend , it still less justified [his]234-odo addressing [her]362-fulvia as [a lover]5936-a lover . Only once before had [he]234-odo spoken to [her]362-fulvia of love , and that under circumstances which almost forbade a return to the subject , or at least compelled an added prudence in approaching it . Once again [he]234-odo found [himself]234-odo [the prisoner of [his]234-odo folly]5941-the prisoner of his folly , and stood aghast at the ingenuity of the punishment . To play the part [she]362-fulvia ascribed to [him]234-odo was [his]234-odo only portion ; and [he]234-odo resolved at least to play it like [a man]8112-a man . With what composure [he]234-odo might , [he]234-odo assured [Fulvia]362-fulvia of [his]234-odo desire to serve [her]362-fulvia , and asked if [she]362-fulvia had no hope of obtaining [her]362-fulvia release from [the Holy See]2918-the holy see . [She]362-fulvia answered : none , since enquiry must reveal that [she]362-fulvia was [the daughter of [a man who had been prosecuted for heresy , and that after [his]234-odo death [she]362-fulvia had devoted the small sum [he]234-odo had left [her]362-fulvia to the publication of [his]234-odo writings]5945-a man who had been prosecuted for heresy , and that after his death she had devoted the small sum he had left her to the publication of his writings]5944-the daughter of a man who had been prosecuted for heresy , and that after his death she had devoted the small sum he had left her to the publication of his writings . [She]362-fulvia added that [[his]234-odo Holiness]4851-his holiness , resolved to counteract the effects of [the late Pope]9217-the late pope 's leniency , had greatly enlarged the powers of [the Inquisition]5948-the inquisition , and had taken special measures to prevent [those who entered the religious life]5949-those who entered the religious life from renouncing [their]5949-those who entered the religious life calling . " Since [I]362-fulvia have been [here]8091-here , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , " [three nuns]9748-three nuns have tried to obtain [their]9748-three nuns release , and [one]8494-one has conclusively proved that [she]8494-one was forced to take the vows by fraud ; but [their]9748-three nuns pleas have been rejected , and [mine]362-fulvia would meet the same fate . Indeed , the only result would be to deprive [me]362-fulvia of what little liberty [I]362-fulvia am allowed ; for [the three nuns [I]362-fulvia speak of]9750-the three nuns i speak of are now [the most closely watched in [the convent]3340-the convent]9751-the most closely watched in the convent . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia went on to explain that , thanks to the connivance of [Sister Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary , [her]362-fulvia actual escape might be effected without much difficulty ; but that [she]362-fulvia was now awake to the madness of taking so desperate a step without knowing whither it would lead [her]362-fulvia . " To be safe , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , " [I]362-fulvia must cross [the borders of [Switzerland]181-switzerland]9753-the borders of switzerland . If [I]362-fulvia could reach [Geneva]182-geneva [I]362-fulvia should be beyond the arm of [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office , and at [the University]102-the university [there]606-there [I]362-fulvia should find [friends of [[my]362-fulvia father]8146-my father who would surely take pity on [my]362-fulvia situation and help [me]362-fulvia to a living . But the journey is long and difficult , and not to be safely attempted without some assurance of shelter on the way]9756-friends of my father who would surely take pity on my situation and help me to a living . but the journey is long and difficult , and not to be safely attempted without some assurance of shelter on the way . "[362-fulvia] It was on [Odo]234-odo 's lips to declare that [he]234-odo would provide [her]362-fulvia with shelter and escort ; but at this moment three warning taps announced the return of [Sister Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary . [She]362-fulvia entered merrily and at once laid one hand on [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's brow and caught [her]362-fulvia wrist in the other . " [The patient]9758-the patient 's pulse has risen , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia declared , " and rest and a lowering treatment are essential . [I]362-fulvia must ask [the cavaliere]8130-the cavaliere to withdraw . "[362-fulvia] [Fulvia]362-fulvia , with an air of constraint , held out [her]362-fulvia hand to [Odo]234-odo . " [I]234-odo shall see [you]362-fulvia soon again ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo whispered ; and [Sister Mary]268-sister mary , as though [she]268-sister mary had guessed [his]234-odo words , cried out , " [I]268-sister mary think [[your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency may count on a recurrence of the seizure two days hence at the same hour ! "[268-sister mary] 3.5 . With this [Odo]234-odo was forced to be content ; and [he]234-odo passed the intervening time in devising the means of [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's rescue . [He]234-odo was resolved to let no rashness or negligence hinder the attempt , and to prove , by the discretion of [his]234-odo course , that [he]234-odo was no longer [the light fool who had once hazarded [her]362-fulvia safety]5950-the light fool who had once hazarded her safety . [He]234-odo went about [his]234-odo preparations as one that had no private stake in the venture ; but [he]234-odo was therefore the more punctilious to show [himself]234-odo worthy of [her]362-fulvia trust and sensible of the charge it laid upon [him]234-odo . At [their]5951-their next meeting [he]234-odo found [her]362-fulvia in the same open and friendly mood , and [she]362-fulvia listened gratefully as [he]234-odo set forth [his]234-odo plan . This was that [she]362-fulvia should first write to [a doctor of the University in [Geneva]182-geneva , who had been [[her]362-fulvia father 's friend]5824-her father 's friend , stating [her]362-fulvia plight and asking if [he]234-odo could help [her]362-fulvia to a living should [she]362-fulvia contrive to reach [Geneva]182-geneva]5952-a doctor of the university in geneva , who had been her father 's friend , stating her plight and asking if he could help her to a living should she contrive to reach geneva . Pending the reply , [Odo]234-odo was to plan the stages of the journey in such fashion that [she]362-fulvia might count on concealment in case of pursuit ; and [she]362-fulvia was not to attempt [her]362-fulvia escape till these details were decided . [Fulvia]362-fulvia was the more ready to acquiesce in this postponement as [she]362-fulvia did not wish to involve [Sister Mary]268-sister mary in [her]362-fulvia adventure , but hoped to escape unassisted during an entertainment which was to take place in [the convent]3340-the convent on the feast of [Saint Michael]494-saint michael , some six weeks later . To [Odo]234-odo the delay was still more welcome ; for it gave [him]234-odo what [he]234-odo must needs regard as [his]234-odo last opportunity of being in [the girl]2319-the girl 's company . [She]362-fulvia had accepted [his]234-odo companionship on the journey with a readiness in which [he]234-odo saw only the magnanimity of pardon ; but in [Geneva]182-geneva [they]5956-they must part , and what hope had [he]234-odo of seeing [her]362-fulvia again ? The first smart of vanity allayed , [he]234-odo was glad [she]362-fulvia chose to treat [him]234-odo as [a friend]8895-a friend . It was in this character that [he]234-odo could best prove [his]234-odo disinterestedness , [his]234-odo resolve to make amends for the past ; and in this character only -- as [he]234-odo now felt -- would it be possible for [him]234-odo to part from [her]362-fulvia . On [his]234-odo second visit [he]234-odo ventured to discharge [his]234-odo mind of its heaviest burden by enquiring what had befallen [her]362-fulvia and [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father after [he]234-odo had lost trace of [them]5956-they at [Vercelli]13-vercelli . [She]362-fulvia told [him]234-odo quite simply that , failing to meet [him]234-odo at [the appointed place]5959-the appointed place , [they]5956-they at once guessed that [his]234-odo plan had been winded by [the abate who travelled with [him]234-odo]5960-the abate who travelled with him ; and that after a few hours ' delay [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father had succeeded in securing a chaise which had taken [them]5956-they safely across [the border]2189-the border . [She]362-fulvia went on to speak of the hardships [they]5956-they had suffered after reaching [Milan]14-milan . Even under a comparatively liberal government it was small advantage to be marked by the Holy Office ; and though [he]234-odo received much kindness , and even material aid , from those of [his]234-odo way of thinking , [Vivaldi]362-fulvia was unable to obtain the professorship [he]234-odo had hoped for . From [Milan]14-milan [they]5956-they went to [Pavia]12-pavia ; but in [this University]5963-this university , [the most liberal in [Italy]5-italy]5964-the most liberal in italy , the chairs were so sought after that there was no hope of [his]234-odo receiving a charge worthy of [his]234-odo talents . Here , however , [his]234-odo spirit breathed its natural air , and reluctant to lose the privileges of such intercourse [he]234-odo decided to accept the post of [librarian]5965-librarian to [an eccentric nobleman of [the town]593-the town]5966-an eccentric nobleman of the town . If [his]234-odo pay was modest [his]234-odo duties left [him]234-odo leisure for the work which was [his]234-odo chief concern ; for [[his]234-odo patron , who had houses in [Milan]14-milan and [Brescia]184-brescia]5968-his patron , who had houses in milan and brescia , came seldom to [Pavia]12-pavia , and [Fulvia]362-fulvia and [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father had [the vast palace]5970-the vast palace to [themselves]5971-their . [They]5971-their lodged in a corner adjoining [the library]2154-the library , spending [their]5971-their days in studious seclusion , [their]5971-their evenings in conversation with [some of the first scholars of [Europe]40-europe]5973-some of the first scholars of europe : [the learned botanist Scopoli]5974-the learned botanist scopoli , [Spallanzani]495-spallanzani , [Volta]496-volta , and [Father Fontana]497-father fontana , [the famous mathematician]5975-the famous mathematician . In such surroundings [Vivaldi]362-fulvia might have pursued [his]1415-her father task contentedly enough , but for the thought of [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's future . This , [[his]1415-her father daughter]1475-his daughter said , continually preyed on [him]1415-her father , driving [him]1415-her father to labours beyond [his]1415-her father strength ; for [he]1415-her father hoped by the publication of [his]1415-her father book to make good , at least in part , the loss of the small property which [the Sardinian government]2179-the sardinian government had confiscated . All [her]1475-his daughter entreaties could not dissuade [him]1415-her father from over - exertion ; and in addition to [his]1415-her father regular duties [he]1415-her father took on [himself]1415-her father ( as [she]1475-his daughter afterward learned ) the tedious work of revising proofs and copying manuscripts for [the professors]5978-the professors . This drudgery , combined with severe intellectual effort , exceeded [his]1415-her father flagging powers ; and the book was hardly completed when [[his]1415-her father patron]4869-his patron , apprised of its contents , abruptly removed [him]1415-her father from [his]1415-her father post . From that day [Vivaldi]362-fulvia sank in health ; but [he]1415-her father ended as became [a sage]5980-a sage , content to have discharged the task for which [he]1415-her father had given up [home]1346-home and substance , and dying with the great Stoic 's words upon [his]1415-her father lips:-- Lex non poena mors . [[Vivaldi]362-fulvia 's friends in [Milan]14-milan]5982-vivaldi 's friends in milan came generously to [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's aid , and [she]362-fulvia would gladly have remained among [them]5982-vivaldi 's friends in milan ; but after the loss of [her]362-fulvia small inheritance and of [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father 's manuscript [she]362-fulvia was without means of repaying [their]5982-vivaldi 's friends in milan kindness , and nothing remained but to turn to [[her]362-fulvia own kin]5984-her own kin . As [Odo]234-odo sat in [the quiet cell]5985-the quiet cell , listening to [her]362-fulvia story , and hearing again the great names [his]234-odo youth had reverenced , [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo an exile returning to [his]234-odo own , mounting the familiar heights and breathing the air that was [his]234-odo birthright . Looking back from this recovered standpoint [he]234-odo saw how far behind [his]234-odo early hopes had been left . Since [his]234-odo departure from [Naples]59-naples there had been nothing to remind [him]234-odo of that vast noiseless labour of the spirit going on everywhere beneath the social surface : that baffled but undiscouraged endeavour in which [he]234-odo had once so impatiently claimed [his]234-odo share . Now every word of [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's smote the bones of some dead purpose , till [his]234-odo bosom seemed a very valley of [Ezekiel]498-ezekiel . [Her]362-fulvia own trials had fanned [her]362-fulvia love of freedom , and the near hope of release lent an exaltation to [her]362-fulvia words . Of bitterness , of resentment [she]362-fulvia gave no sign ; and [he]234-odo was awed by the same serenity of spirit which had struck [him]234-odo in [the imprisoned doctor]5986-the imprisoned doctor . But perhaps the strongest impression [she]362-fulvia produced was that of increasing [his]234-odo points of contact with life . [His]234-odo other sentimental ties had been a barrier between [himself]234-odo and [the outer world]5987-the outer world ; but the feeling which drew [him]234-odo to [Fulvia]362-fulvia had the effect of levelling the bounds of egoism , of letting into the circle of [his]234-odo nearest emotions that great tide of human longing and effort that had always faintly sounded on the shores of self . Perhaps it was [her]362-fulvia power of evoking this wider life that gave a sense of permanence , of security almost , to the stolen moments of [their]5988-their intercourse , lulling [the lover]5989-the lover 's impatience of actual conditions with the sense of something that must survive the accidents of fortune . Only in some such way could [he]234-odo explain , in looking back , the completeness of each moment spent with [her]362-fulvia . [He]234-odo was conscious even at the time of a suspension of the emotional laws , a charmed surrender to the limitations of [his]234-odo fate . When [he]234-odo was away [his]234-odo impatience reasserted itself ; but [her]362-fulvia presence was like a soothing hand on [his]234-odo spirit , and [he]234-odo knew that [his]234-odo quiet hours with [her]362-fulvia would count among those intervals between the crises of life that flower in memory when the crises themselves have faded . It was natural that in the course of these visits [she]362-fulvia in turn should question [him]234-odo ; and as [his]234-odo past rearranged itself beneath [her]362-fulvia scrutiny [he]234-odo seemed once more to trace the thread of purpose on which its fragments hung . [He]234-odo told [her]362-fulvia of [his]234-odo connection with [the liberals of [Pianura]4-pianura]5990-the liberals of pianura , of the situation at [court]8243-court , and of the reason for [his]234-odo prolonged travels . As [he]234-odo talked [her]362-fulvia eyes conveyed the exquisite sense of [her]362-fulvia complete comprehension . [She]362-fulvia saw , before [he]234-odo could justify [himself]234-odo , how the uncertainty of [his]234-odo future , and [his]234-odo inability to act , had cast [him]234-odo adrift upon a life of superficial enjoyment ; and how [his]234-odo latent dissatisfaction with this life had inevitably resulted in self - distrust and vacillation . " [You]234-odo wait [your]234-odo hour , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said of [him]234-odo ; and [he]234-odo seized on the phrase as a justification of [his]234-odo inactivity and , when chance should offer , a spur to fresh endeavour . [Her]362-fulvia interest in the liberal cause had been intensified and exalted by [[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father 's death -- [his]234-odo martyrdom , as [she]362-fulvia described it . Like [most women]5993-most women possessed of an abstract idea [she]362-fulvia had unconsciously personified the idea and made a religion of it ; but it was a religion of charity and not of vindictiveness . " [I]362-fulvia should like [[my]362-fulvia father]8146-my father 's death avenged by love and not by hate , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said ; " [I]362-fulvia would have it bring peace , not a sword . "[362-fulvia] On one point only [she]362-fulvia remained , if not hostile yet unresponsive . This was when [he]234-odo spoke of [de Crucis]462-de crucis . [Her]362-fulvia manner hardened instantly , and [he]234-odo perceived that , though [he]234-odo dwelt on [the Jesuit]5602-the jesuit 's tolerant view and cultivated tastes , [she]362-fulvia beheld only [the priest]1732-the priest and not [the man]1626-the man . [She]362-fulvia had been eager to hear of [Crescenti]234-odo , whom [she]362-fulvia knew by name as [a student of European repute]5997-a student of european repute , and to the praise of whose parochial charities [she]362-fulvia listened with outspoken sympathy ; but [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits stood for the Holy Office , and [she]362-fulvia had suffered too deeply at the hands of [the Holy Office]3229-the holy office to regard with an open mind any who might be supposed to represent its principles . It was impossible for [Odo]234-odo to make [her]362-fulvia understand how distinctly , in [de Crucis]462-de crucis 's case , [the man]1626-the man predominated over the order ; and conscious of the painfulness of the subject , [he]234-odo gave up the attempt to interest [her]362-fulvia in [[his]234-odo friend]2124-his friend . Three or four times [he]234-odo was permitted to visit [her]362-fulvia in [[her]362-fulvia cell]5920-her cell : after that [they]6003-they met almost daily in [the parlour]1679-the parlour , where , about the hour of benediction , [they]6003-they could talk almost as privately under cover of the general chatter . In due time [Fulvia]362-fulvia received an answer from [the Calvinist professor]6005-the calvinist professor , who assured [her]362-fulvia of a welcome in [Geneva]182-geneva and shelter under [his]6005-the calvinist professor roof . [Odo]234-odo , meanwhile , had perfected the plan of [their]6003-they journey ; but as [Michaelmas]499-michaelmas approached [he]234-odo began to fear [Cantapresto]267-cantapresto 's observation . [He]234-odo now bitterly regretted that [he]234-odo had not held to [his]234-odo purpose of sending [the soprano]1599-the soprano back to [Pianura]4-pianura ; but to do so at this point would be to challenge observation and [he]234-odo resolved instead on despatching [him]267-cantapresto to [Monte Alloro]99-monte alloro with a letter to [the old Duke]4864-the old duke . As the way to [Geneva]182-geneva lay in the opposite direction this would at least give [the fugitives]6008-the fugitives a three days ' lead ; and [they]6008-the fugitives had little cause to fear pursuit from any other quarter . [The convent]3340-the convent indeed might raise a hue and cry ; but [the nuns of [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara]6010-the nuns of santa chiara had lately given [the devout]6011-the devout so much cause for scandal that [the abbess]5723-the abbess would probably be disposed to hush up any fresh delinquency . The time too was well - chosen ; for [the sisters]5706-the sisters had prevailed on [the Reverend Mother]5927-the reverend mother to celebrate the saint 's day by a masked ball , and [the whole convent]6015-the whole convent was engrossed in the invention of whimsical disguises . [The nuns]5678-the nuns indeed were not to take part in the ball ; but a number of [them]5678-the nuns were to appear in an allegorical entertainment with which the evening was to open . [The new Papal Nuncio , who was lately arrived in [Venice]41-venice]6017-the new papal nuncio , who was lately arrived in venice , had promised to be present ; and as [he]6017-the new papal nuncio , who was lately arrived in venice was known to be [a man of pleasure]2366-a man of pleasure there was scarce [a sister]6019-a sister in [the convent]3340-the convent but had an eye to [his]6017-the new papal nuncio , who was lately arrived in venice conquest . These circumstances gave to [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's plans the shelter of indifference ; for in the delightful effort of surpassing [the other nuns]6021-the other nuns even [Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary lost interest in [[her]268-sister mary friend]5759-her friend 's affairs . [Odo]234-odo , to preserve the secrecy of [his]234-odo designs , had been obliged to keep up a pretence of [his]234-odo former habits , showing [himself]234-odo abroad with [Coeur - Volant]6023-coeur - volant and [Castelrovinato]391-coeur - volant and frequenting the Procuratessa 's routs and card - parties . [This lady]6024-this lady , though lately returned to [the Brenta]149-the brenta , had announced [her]6024-this lady intention of coming to [Venice]41-venice for the ball at [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara ; and [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant was mightily preoccupied with the entertainment , at which [he]391-coeur - volant purposed [[his]391-coeur - volant mistress]8825-his mistress should outshine all [[her]6024-this lady companions]5884-her companions . The evening came at last , and [Odo]234-odo found [himself]234-odo entering [the gates of [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara]6027-the gates of santa chiara with [a throng of merry - makers]6028-a throng of merry - makers . [The convent]3340-the convent was noted for [its]3340-the convent splendid hospitality , and unwonted preparations had been made to honour [the saint]573-the saint . [The brightly - illuminated bridge leading to [the square of [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara]6032-the square of santa chiara]6031-the brightly - illuminated bridge leading to the square of santa chiara was decked with a colonnade of pasteboard and stiffened linen cunningly painted , and a classical portico masked the entrance gate . A flourish of trumpets and hautboys , and the firing of miniature cannon , greeted the arrival of [the guests]2672-the guests , who were escorted to [the parlour , which was hung with tapestries and glowing with lights like a Lady Chapel]6034-the parlour , which was hung with tapestries and glowing with lights like a lady chapel . Here [they]2672-the guests were received by [the abbess]5723-the abbess , who , on the arrival of [the Nuncio]6036-the nuncio , led the way to [the garden]8185-the garden , where a stage had been erected . [The nuns who were not to take part in the play]6038-the nuns who were not to take part in the play had been seated directly under [the stage]8311-the stage , divided from the rest of [the company by a low screen of foliage]6040-the company by a low screen of foliage . Ranged beneath the footlights , which shone on [their]6038-the nuns who were not to take part in the play bare shoulders and white gowns , and on the gauze veils replacing [their]6038-the nuns who were not to take part in the play monastic coifs , [they]6038-the nuns who were not to take part in the play seemed a choir of [pagan virgins]6041-pagan virgins grouped in the proscenium of [an antique theatre]6042-an antique theatre . Everything indeed combined to produce the impression of some classic festival : the setting of motionless foliage , the mild autumnal sky in which the stars hung near and vivid , and the foreground thronged with [a motley company lit by the shifting brightness of torches]6043-a motley company lit by the shifting brightness of torches . As [Odo]234-odo , in mask and travesty , stood observing [the fantastically - dressed audience]6044-the fantastically - dressed audience , the pasteboard theatre adorned with statuary , and [the nuns]5678-the nuns flitting across [the stage]8311-the stage , [his]234-odo imagination , strung to the highest pitch by [his]234-odo own impending venture , was thrilled by the contrast between the outward appearance of the scene and its underlying reality . From where [he]234-odo stood [he]234-odo looked directly at [the abbess]5723-the abbess , who was seated with [the Nuncio]6036-the nuncio and [his]6036-the nuncio suite under the tall crucifix in [the centre of [the garden]8185-the garden]6049-the centre of the garden . As if to emphasise the irony of the situation , the torch fixed behind [this noble group]6051-this noble group cast an enlarged shadow of the cross over [the abbess]5723-the abbess 's white gown and the splendid robes of [[her]5723-the abbess companions]5884-her companions , who , though [they]5884-her companions wore the mask , had not laid aside [their]5884-her companions clerical dress . To [Odo]234-odo the juxtaposition had the effect of some supernatural warning , the shadow of the divine wrath projected on [its heedless ministers]6054-its heedless ministers ; an impression heightened by the fact that , just opposite the cross , a lively figure of [Pan]500-pan , surmounting the pediment of [the theatre]1559-the theatre , seemed to fling defiance at [the Galilean intruder]6056-the galilean intruder . [The nuns]5678-the nuns , like [the rest of [the company]1753-the company]3281-the rest of the company , were masked ; and it had been agreed between [Odo]234-odo and [Fulvia]362-fulvia that [the latter]870-the latter should wear a wreath of myrtle above [her]870-the latter veil . As almost all [[her]5723-the abbess companions]5884-her companions had chosen brightly - coloured flowers this dark green chaplet was easily distinguished among the clustered heads beneath the stage , and [Odo]234-odo had no doubt of being able to rejoin [Fulvia]362-fulvia in the moment of dispersal that should follow the conclusion of the play . [He]234-odo knew that [the sisters]5706-the sisters were to precede [[their]5706-the sisters guests]6063-their guests and be locked behind the grate before the ball began ; but as [they]1753-the company passed through [the garden and cloisters]6064-the garden and cloisters the barrier between [nuns]5525-nuns and [visitors]9735-visitors would probably not be too strictly maintained . As [he]234-odo had foreseen , [the company , attracted by the graceful procession]6067-the company , attracted by the graceful procession , pressed forward regardless of [the assistant mistresses]6068-the assistant mistresses ' protests , and [the shadowy arcades]6069-the shadowy arcades were full of laughter and whispered snatches of talk as [the white flock]6070-the white flock was driven back to its fold . [Odo]234-odo had withdrawn to the darkest angle of [the cloister]1488-the cloister , close to a door leading to [the pharmacy]6072-the pharmacy . It was here that [Fulvia]362-fulvia had told [him]234-odo to wait ; and though [he]234-odo had lost sight of [her]362-fulvia when [the audience]4657-the audience rose , [he]234-odo stood confidently watching for the reappearance of the myrtle - wreath . Presently [he]234-odo saw it close at hand ; and just then the line of [sisters]8196-sisters flowed toward [him]234-odo , driven forward by [a group of lively masqueraders , among whom [he]234-odo seemed to recognise [Coeur - Volant]391-coeur - volant 's voice and figure]6075-a group of lively masqueraders , among whom he seemed to recognise coeur - volant 's voice and figure . Nothing could have been more opportune , for the pressure swept [the wearer of the myrtle - wreath]6076-the wearer of the myrtle - wreath almost into [his]234-odo arms ; and as [the intruders]4732-the intruders were dispersed and [the nuns]5678-the nuns laughingly reformed [their]5678-the nuns lines , [her]362-fulvia hand lingered in [his]234-odo and [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo drawn toward the door . [It]6079-it yielded to [her]362-fulvia touch and [Odo]234-odo followed [her]362-fulvia down [a dark passageway]6080-a dark passageway to the empty room where rows of old Faenza jars and quaintly - shaped flagons glimmered in the dusk . Beyond [the pharmacy]6072-the pharmacy was another door , the key of which hung on the wall with [the portress]5912-the portress 's hood and cloak . Without a word [the girl]2319-the girl wrapped [herself]2319-the girl in the cloak and , fitting the key to the lock , softly opened the door . All this was done with a rapidity and assurance for which [Odo]234-odo was unprepared ; but , reflecting that [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's whole future hung on the promptness with which each detail of [her]362-fulvia plan was executed , [he]234-odo concluded that [her]362-fulvia natural force of character enabled [her]362-fulvia to assume an ease [she]362-fulvia could hardly feel . The door opened on the [kitchen - garden]6084-kitchen - garden , and brushing the lavender - hedges with [her]362-fulvia flying skirts [she]362-fulvia sped on ahead of [Odo]234-odo to [the postern which [the nuns]5678-the nuns were accustomed to use for [their]5678-the nuns nocturnal escapades]6085-the postern which the nuns were accustomed to use for their nocturnal escapades . Only the thickness of an oaken gate stood between [Fulvia]362-fulvia and [the outer world]5987-the outer world . To [her]362-fulvia the opening of the gate meant the first step toward freedom , but to [Odo]234-odo the passing from [their]6088-their enchanted weeks of fellowship to the inner loneliness of [his]234-odo former life . [He]234-odo hung back silent while [she]362-fulvia drew the bolt . A moment later [they]6088-their had crossed the threshold and [[his]234-odo gondola]5536-his gondola was slipping toward [them]6088-their out of the shadow of the wall . [Fulvia]362-fulvia sprang on board and [he]234-odo followed [her]362-fulvia under [the felze]5800-the felze . The warm darkness enclosing [them]6088-their stirred impulses which [their]6088-their daily intercourse had subdued , and in the sense of [her]362-fulvia nearness [he]234-odo lost sight of the conditions which had brought [them]6088-their together . The feeling seemed to communicate itself ; for as the gondola rounded the angle of [the convent]3340-the convent - wall and swung out on the open , [she]362-fulvia drooped toward [him]234-odo with the turn of [the boat]9715-the boat and [their]6088-their lips met under the loosened masks . At the same instant the light of [[the Virgin]3925-the virgin 's shrine in the corner of [the convent]3340-the convent - wall]6094-the virgin 's shrine in the corner of the convent - wall fell through the window of the felze on the face lifted to [Odo]234-odo 's ; and [he]234-odo found [himself]234-odo suddenly confronted by the tender eyes and malicious smile of [Sister Mary of the Crucifix]268-sister mary . " By [Diana]436-diana , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried as [he]234-odo started back , " [I]362-fulvia did but claim [my]362-fulvia pay in advance ; nor do [I]362-fulvia think that , when [she]362-fulvia knows all , [Sister Veronica]490-sister veronica will grudge [me]362-fulvia [my]362-fulvia reward ! "[362-fulvia] [He]234-odo continued to stare at [her]362-fulvia in speechless bewilderment , and [she]362-fulvia went on with a kind of tender impatience : " [[You]234-odo simpleton]9762-you simpleton , can [you]234-odo not guess that [you]234-odo were watched , and that but for [me]362-fulvia [[your]234-odo Veronica]9763-your veronica would at this moment be lying under lock and key in [[her]490-sister veronica cell]5920-her cell ? Instead of which , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia continued , speaking more slowly , and leaning back as though to enjoy the full savour of [his]234-odo suspense , " instead of which [she]490-sister veronica now awaits [you]234-odo in [a safe nook of [my]362-fulvia choosing]9765-a safe nook of my choosing , where , within half an hour 's time , [you]234-odo may atone to [her]490-sister veronica with interest for the infidelity into which [I]362-fulvia have betrayed [you]234-odo . "[362-fulvia] " [She]490-sister veronica knows , then ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo faltered , not daring to say more in [his]234-odo ignorance of [Sister Mary]268-sister mary 's share in the secret . [Sister Mary]268-sister mary shook [her]268-sister mary head with a tantalising laugh . " That [you]234-odo are coming ? Alas , no , [poor angel]9766-poor angel ! [She]490-sister veronica fancies that [she]490-sister veronica has been sent from [the convent]3340-the convent to avoid [you]234-odo -- as indeed [she]490-sister veronica was , and by [the Reverend Mother 's own order]9768-the reverend mother 's own order , who , it seems , had wind of the intrigue this morning . But , [the saints]1218-the saints be praised , [the excellent sister who was ordered to attend [her]490-sister veronica]9770-the excellent sister who was ordered to attend her is in [my]268-sister mary pay and instead of conducting [her]490-sister veronica to [[her]490-sister veronica relatives]9771-her relatives of [San Barnado]501-san barnado , who were to keep [her]490-sister veronica locked up over night , has , if [I]268-sister mary mistake not , taken [her]490-sister veronica to [a good woman of [my]268-sister mary acquaintance]9772-a good woman of my acquaintance -- [an old servant]9773-an old servant , in fact -- who will guard [her]490-sister veronica as jealously as [the family]9774-the family plate till [you]9775-you and [I]268-sister mary come to [her]490-sister veronica release . "[268-sister mary] As [she]6096-she spoke [she]6096-she put out [her]6096-she head and gave a whispered order to [the gondolier]5537-the gondolier ; and at the word [the boat]9715-the boat swung round and headed for [the city]2261-the city . In the violent reaction which this strange encounter produced , [Odo]234-odo was for the moment incapable of taking any clear note of [his]234-odo surroundings . Uncertain if [he]234-odo were not once more [the victim of some such mischance]6100-the victim of some such mischance as seemed to attend all [his]234-odo efforts to succour [Fulvia]362-fulvia , [he]234-odo sat in silent apprehension as [the gondola]5799-the gondola shot across [the Grand Canal]5732-the grand canal and entered the labyrinth of water - ways behind [San Moise]187-san moise . [Sister Mary]268-sister mary took [his]234-odo silence philosophically . " [You]234-odo dare not speak to [me]268-sister mary , for fear of betraying [yourself]234-odo , "[268-sister mary] [she]268-sister mary said , " and [I]268-sister mary scarce wonder at [your]234-odo distrust ; for [your]234-odo plans were so well laid that [I]268-sister mary had no notion of what was on foot , and must have remained in ignorance if [Veronica]490-sister veronica had not been put in [Sister Martha]502-sister martha 's charge . But [you]234-odo will both live to thank [me]268-sister mary , and [I]268-sister mary hope , "[268-sister mary] [she]268-sister mary added , laughing , " to own that [you]234-odo would have done better to take [me]268-sister mary into [your]234-odo confidence from the first . "[268-sister mary] As [she]268-sister mary spoke the gondola touched at the head of [a narrow passage which lost itself in the blackness of [the overhanging houses]6104-the overhanging houses]6103-a narrow passage which lost itself in the blackness of the overhanging houses . [Sister Mary]268-sister mary sprang out and drew [Odo]234-odo after [her]268-sister mary . A few yards down [the alley]6105-the alley [she]268-sister mary entered [a plain low - storied house somewhat withdrawn behind [its]6106-a plain low - storied house somewhat withdrawn behind its neighbours neighbours]6106-a plain low - storied house somewhat withdrawn behind its neighbours . Followed by [Odo]234-odo [she]268-sister mary groped [her]268-sister mary way up [a dark flight of stairs]6107-a dark flight of stairs and knocked at a door on [the upper landing]6108-the upper landing . A vague flutter within , indicative of whispers and uncertain movements , was followed by the slipping of the bolt , and [a middle - aged woman]6109-a middle - aged woman looked out . [She]268-sister mary drew back with an exclamation of welcome , and [Sister Mary]268-sister mary , seizing [Odo]234-odo by the shoulders , pushed [him]234-odo across the threshold of [a small dimly - lit kitchen]6110-a small dimly - lit kitchen . [Fulvia]362-fulvia , in [[her]362-fulvia nun]5933-her nun 's habit , cowered in the darkest corner ; but at sight of [Odo]234-odo [she]362-fulvia sprang up , and ran toward [him]234-odo with a happy cry . 3.6 . An hour later [the two]812-the two were well on [their]812-the two way toward [Mestre]188-mestre , where a travelling - chaise awaited [them]812-the two . [Odo]234-odo , having learned that [Andreoni]441-andreoni was settled in [Padua]109-padua , had asked [him]441-andreoni to receive [Fulvia]362-fulvia in [[his]441-andreoni house]1355-his house till the next night - fall ; and [the bookseller]5565-the bookseller , whom [he]441-andreoni had taken into [his]441-andreoni confidence , was eager to welcome [the daughter of [the revered Vivaldi]362-fulvia]6115-the daughter of the revered vivaldi . The extremes of hope and apprehension had left [Fulvia]362-fulvia too exhausted for many words , and [Odo]234-odo , after [she]362-fulvia had confirmed every particular of [Sister Mary]268-sister mary 's story , refrained from questioning [her]362-fulvia farther . Thanks to [[her]362-fulvia friend]5759-her friend 's resources [she]362-fulvia had been able to exchange [[her]362-fulvia nun]5933-her nun 's dress for the plain gown and travelling - cloak of [a young woman of the middle class]6118-a young woman of the middle class ; and this dress painfully recalled to [Odo]234-odo the day when [he]234-odo had found [her]362-fulvia standing beside the broken - down chaise on [the road]726-the road to [Vercelli]13-vercelli . The recollection was not calculated to put [him]234-odo at [his]234-odo ease ; and indeed it was only now that [he]234-odo began to feel the peculiar constraint of [his]234-odo position . To [Andreoni]441-andreoni [his]441-andreoni explanation of [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's flight had seemed natural enough ; but on the subsequent stages of [their]6120-their journey [she]362-fulvia must pass for [[his]441-andreoni mistress]8825-his mistress or [[his]441-andreoni wife]1713-his wife , and [he]441-andreoni hardly knew in what spirit [she]362-fulvia would take the misapprehensions that must inevitably arise . At [Mestre]188-mestre [[their]6120-their carriage]1000-their carriage waited , and [they]6120-their drove rapidly toward [Padua]109-padua through the waning night . [Andreoni]441-andreoni , in [his]441-andreoni concern for [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's safety , had prepared for [her]362-fulvia reception [a little farm - house of [[his]441-andreoni wife]1713-his wife 's]6124-a little farm - house of his wife 's , in [a vineyard beyond [the town]593-the town]6126-a vineyard beyond the town ; and here at daybreak it was almost a relief to [Odo]234-odo to commit [his]234-odo charge to the Signora [Andreoni]441-andreoni 's care . The day was spent indoors , and [Andreoni]441-andreoni having thought it more prudent to bring [no servant]6128-no servant from [Padua]109-padua , [[his]441-andreoni wife]1713-his wife prepared the meals for [[their]6120-their guests]6063-their guests and [the bookseller]5565-the bookseller drew a jar of [his]441-andreoni own wine from [the cellar]6132-the cellar . [Fulvia]362-fulvia kept to [herself]362-fulvia during the day ; but at dusk [she]362-fulvia surprised [Odo]234-odo by entering [the room]782-the room with a trayful of plates and glasses , and helping [[their]6120-their hostess]6134-their hostess to set out the supper - table . The few hours of rest had restored to [her]362-fulvia not only the serenity of [the convent]3340-the convent , but a lightness of step and glance that [Odo]234-odo had not seen in [her]362-fulvia since the early days of [their]6120-their friendship . [He]234-odo marvelled to see how the first breath of freedom had set [her]362-fulvia blood in motion and fanned [her]362-fulvia languid eye ; but [he]234-odo could not suppress the accompanying thought that [his]234-odo own presence had failed to work such miracles . [They]6120-their had planned to ride that night to [a little village in [the hills beyond [Vicenza]150-vicenza]6137-the hills beyond vicenza , where [[Fulvia]362-fulvia 's foster - mother]6138-fulvia 's foster - mother]6136-a little village in the hills beyond vicenza , where fulvia 's foster - mother , [a peasant of [the Vicentine]6140-the vicentine]6139-a peasant of the vicentine , lived with [[her]6138-fulvia 's foster - mother son]1486-her son , who was [a vine - dresser]6142-a vine - dresser ; and supper was hardly over when [they]6120-their were told that [their]6120-their horses waited . [[Their]6120-their kind hosts]6143-their kind hosts dared not urge [them]6120-their to linger ; and after a hurried farewell [they]6120-their rode forth into the fresh darkness of the September night . The new moon was down and [they]6120-their had to thread [their]6120-their way slowly through [the stony lanes between [the vineyards]5294-the vineyards]6144-the stony lanes between the vineyards . At length [they]6120-their gained [the open country]6146-the open country , and growing more accustomed to the darkness put [their]6120-their horses to a trot . The change of pace , and the exhilaration of traversing [an unknown country]6147-an unknown country in the hush and mystery of night , combined to free [their]6120-their spirits , and [Odo]234-odo began to be aware that the barrier between [them]6120-their was lifted . To the charm of [their]6120-their intercourse at [Santa Chiara]176-santa chiara was added that closer sympathy produced by the sense of isolation . [They]6120-their were enclosed in [their]6120-their common risk as in some secret meeting - place where no consciousness of [the outer world]5987-the outer world intruded ; and though [their]6120-their talk kept the safe level of [their]6120-their immediate concerns [he]234-odo felt the change in every inflection of [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's voice and in the subtler emphasis of [her]362-fulvia silences . The way was long , and [he]234-odo had feared that [she]362-fulvia would be taxed beyond [her]362-fulvia strength ; but the miles seemed to fly beneath [their]6120-their horses ' feet , and [they]6120-their could scarcely believe that [the dark hills which rose ahead of [them]6120-their]6149-the dark hills which rose ahead of them against a whitening sky marked the limit of [their]6120-their journey . With some difficulty [they]6120-their found [their]6120-their way to [[the vine - dresser]6150-the vine - dresser 's house]6151-the vine - dresser 's house , [a mere hut in [a remote fold of [the hills]1079-the hills]6153-a remote fold of the hills]6152-a mere hut in a remote fold of the hills .
