From motives of prudence [they]6120-their had not warned [the nurse]6155-the nurse of [their]6120-their coming ; but [they]6120-their found [the old woman]6156-the old woman already at work in [her]6156-the old woman melon - patch and learned from [her]6156-the old woman that [[her]6156-the old woman son]1486-her son had gone down to [his]1486-her son day 's labour in [the valley]1132-the valley . [She]6156-the old woman received [Fulvia]362-fulvia with a tender wonder , as at some supernatural presence descending into [her]6156-the old woman life , too much awed , till the first embraces were over , to risk any conjecture as to [Odo]234-odo 's presence . But with the returning sense of familiarity -- the fancied recovery of [the nurseling]6159-the nurseling 's features in [the girl]2319-the girl 's definite outline -- came the inevitable reaction of curiosity , and [the fugitives]6008-the fugitives felt [themselves]6008-the fugitives coupled in [the old woman]6156-the old woman 's meaning smiles . To [Odo]234-odo 's surprise [Fulvia]362-fulvia received these innuendoes with baffling composure , parrying the questions [she]362-fulvia seemed to answer , and finally taking refuge in a plea for rest . But the accord of the previous night was broken ; and when [the travellers]1059-the travellers set out again , starting a little before sunset to avoid [the vine - dresser]6150-the vine - dresser 's return , the constraint of the day began to weigh upon [them]1059-the travellers . In [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's case physical weariness perhaps had a share in the change ; but whatever the cause , its effect was to make this stage of the journey strangely tedious to both . [Their]1059-the travellers way lay through [the country north of [Vicenza]150-vicenza]6165-the country north of vicenza , whence [they]1059-the travellers hoped by dawn to gain [Peschiera]189-peschiera on [the lake of [Garda]190-garda]6166-the lake of garda , and hire a chaise which should take [them]1059-the travellers across [the border]2189-the border . For the first hour or two [they]1059-the travellers had the new moon to light [them]1059-the travellers ; but as it set the sky clouded and drops of rain began to fall . [Fulvia]362-fulvia had hitherto shown a gay indifference to the discomforts of the journey ; but [she]362-fulvia presently began to complain of the cold and to question [Odo]234-odo anxiously as to the length of the way . [The hilliness of [the country]818-the country]6168-the hilliness of the country forced [them]1059-the travellers to travel slowly , and it seemed to [Odo]234-odo that hours had elapsed before [they]1059-the travellers saw lights in [the valley below]6170-the valley below [them]1059-the travellers . [Their]1059-the travellers plan had been to avoid [the towns on [their]1059-the travellers way]6171-the towns on their way , and [Fulvia]362-fulvia , the night before , had contented [herself]362-fulvia with a half - hour 's rest by [the roadside]1772-the roadside ; but a heavy rain was now falling , and [she]362-fulvia at once assented to [Odo]234-odo 's tentative proposal that [they]1059-the travellers should take shelter till the storm was over . [They]1059-the travellers dismounted at [an inn on [the outskirts of [the village]1028-the village]6174-the outskirts of the village]6173-an inn on the outskirts of the village . [The sleepy landlord]6176-the sleepy landlord stared as [he]234-odo unbarred the door and led [them]1059-the travellers into [the kitchen]569-the kitchen ; but [he]234-odo offered no comment beyond remarking that it was a good night to be under cover . [Fulvia]362-fulvia sank down on the wooden settle near the chimney , where a fire had been hastily kindled . [She]362-fulvia took no notice of [Odo]234-odo when [he]234-odo removed the dripping cloak from [her]362-fulvia shoulders , but sat gazing before [her]362-fulvia in a kind of apathy . " [I]362-fulvia can not eat , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , as [Odo]234-odo pressed [her]362-fulvia to take [her]362-fulvia place at the table . [The innkeeper]3135-the innkeeper turned to [him]234-odo with a confidential nod . " [[Your]234-odo lady]9776-your lady looks fairly beaten , "[3135-the innkeeper] [he]3135-the innkeeper said . " [I]3135-the innkeeper 've a notion that one of [my]3135-the innkeeper good beds would be more to [her]9776-your lady taste than the best supper in [the land]8269-the land . Shall [I]3135-the innkeeper have [a room made ready for [your]234-odo excellencies]9778-a room made ready for your excellencies ? "[3135-the innkeeper] " No , no , "[362-fulvia] said [Fulvia]362-fulvia , starting up . " [We]9779-we must set out again as soon as [we]9779-we have supped . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia approached the table and hastily emptied the glass of country wine that [Odo]234-odo had poured out for [her]362-fulvia . [The innkeeper]3135-the innkeeper seemed [a simple unsuspicious fellow]6180-a simple unsuspicious fellow , but at this [he]3135-the innkeeper put down the plate of cheese [he]3135-the innkeeper was carrying and looked at [her]362-fulvia curiously . " Start out again at this hour of the night ? "[3135-the innkeeper] [he]3135-the innkeeper exclaimed . " By the saints , [[your]234-odo excellencies]9780-your excellencies must be running a race with the sun ! Or do [you]362-fulvia doubt [my]3135-the innkeeper being able to provide [you]362-fulvia with decent lodgings , that [you]362-fulvia prefer mud and rain to [my]3135-the innkeeper good sheets and pillows ? "[3135-the innkeeper] " Indeed , no , "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo amicably interposed ; " but [we]9781-we are hurrying to meet [a friend who is to rejoin [us]9781-we tomorrow at [Peschiera]189-peschiera]9782-a friend who is to rejoin us tomorrow at peschiera . "[234-odo] " Ah -- at [Peschiera]189-peschiera , "[905-the other] said [the other]905-the other , as though the name had struck [him]905-the other . [He]905-the other took a dish of eggs from the fire and set it before [Fulvia]362-fulvia . " Well , "[905-the other] [he]905-the other went on with a shrug , " it is written that [none of [my]905-the other beds]9783-none of my beds shall be slept in tonight . Not two hours since [I]905-the other had [a gentleman here that gave the very same excuse for hurrying forward]9784-a gentleman here that gave the very same excuse for hurrying forward ; though [his]9784-a gentleman here that gave the very same excuse for hurrying forward horses were so spent that [I]905-the other had to provide [him]9784-a gentleman here that gave the very same excuse for hurrying forward with another pair before [he]9784-a gentleman here that gave the very same excuse for hurrying forward could continue [his]9784-a gentleman here that gave the very same excuse for hurrying forward journey . "[905-the other] [He]905-the other laughed and uncorked a second bottle . " That reminds [me]905-the other , "[905-the other] [he]905-the other went on , pausing suddenly before [Fulvia]362-fulvia , " that [the other gentleman]9785-the other gentleman was travelling to meet [a friend]8895-a friend too ; [a lady]695-a lady , [he]9785-the other gentleman said -- [a young lady]9788-a young lady . [He]9785-the other gentleman fancied [she]695-a lady might have passed this way and questioned [me]905-the other closely ; but as it happened there had been no petticoat under [my]905-the other roof for three days.--I wonder , now , if [he]9785-the other gentleman could have been looking for [your]362-fulvia excellencies ? "[905-the other] [Fulvia]362-fulvia flushed high at this , but a sign from [Odo]234-odo checked the denial on [her]362-fulvia lips . " Why , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " it is not unlikely , though [I]234-odo had fancied [[our]9789-our friend]9790-our friend would come from another direction . What was [this gentleman]8523-this gentleman like ? "[234-odo] [The landlord]3104-the landlord hesitated , evidently not so much from any reluctance to impart what [he]3104-the landlord knew as from the inability to express it . " Well , "[3104-the landlord] said [he]3104-the landlord , trying to supplement [his]3104-the landlord words by a vaguely descriptive gesture , " [he]8523-this gentleman was [a handsome personable - looking man]9792-a handsome personable - looking man -- smallish built , but with a fine manner , and dressed not unlike [[your]362-fulvia excellency]8157-your excellency . "[3104-the landlord] " Ah , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo carelessly , " [[our]9789-our friend]9790-our friend is an ecclesiastic.--And which way did [this gentleman]8523-this gentleman travel ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo went on , pouring [himself]234-odo another glass . [The landlord]3104-the landlord assumed an air of country cunning . " There 's the fishy part of it , "[3104-the landlord] said [he]3104-the landlord . " [He]8523-this gentleman gave orders to go toward [Verona]191-verona ; but [[my]3104-the landlord boy]9796-my boy , who chased [the carriage]8109-the carriage down [the road]726-the road , as [lads]5300-lads will , says that at the cross - ways below [the old mill]9800-the old mill [the driver]9801-the driver took the turn for [Peschiera]189-peschiera . "[3104-the landlord] [Fulvia]362-fulvia at this seemed no longer able to control [herself]362-fulvia . [She]362-fulvia came close to [Odo]234-odo and said in a low urgent tone : " For heaven 's sake , let [us]9802-we set forward ! "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo again signed to [her]362-fulvia to keep silent , and with an effort [she]362-fulvia resumed [her]362-fulvia seat and made a pretence of eating . A moment later [he]234-odo despatched [the landlord]3104-the landlord to [the stable]687-the stable , to see that the horses had been rubbed down ; and as soon as the door closed [she]362-fulvia broke out passionately . " It is [my]362-fulvia fault , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried , " it is all [my]362-fulvia fault for coming [here]8091-here . If [I]362-fulvia had had the courage to keep on this would never have happened ! "[362-fulvia] " No , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo quietly , " and [we]9802-we should have gone straight to [Peschiera]189-peschiera and landed in the arms of [[our]9802-we pursuer]9804-our pursuer -- if [this mysterious traveller]9805-this mysterious traveller is in pursuit of [us]9802-we . "[234-odo] [His]234-odo tone seemed to steady [her]362-fulvia . " Oh , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , and the colour flickered out of [her]362-fulvia face . " As it happens , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo went on , " nothing could have been more fortunate than [our]9802-we coming here . "[234-odo] " [I]362-fulvia see -- [I]362-fulvia see-- ; but now [we]9802-we must go on at once , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia persisted . [He]234-odo looked at [her]362-fulvia gravely . " This is [your]362-fulvia wish ? "[234-odo] [She]362-fulvia seemed seized with a panic fear . " [I]362-fulvia can not stay here ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia repeated . " Which way shall [we]9802-we go , then ? If [we]9802-we continue to [Peschiera]189-peschiera , and [this man]4205-this man is after [us]9802-we , [we]9802-we are lost . "[362-fulvia] " But if [he]4205-this man does not find [us]9802-we [he]4205-this man may return here -- [he]4205-this man will surely return here ! "[234-odo] " [He]4205-this man can not return before morning . It is close on midnight already . Meanwhile [you]6186-you can take a few hours ' rest while [I]362-fulvia devise means of reaching [the lake]9807-the lake by [some mule - track across [the mountain]1271-the mountain]9808-some mule - track across the mountain . "[362-fulvia] It cost [him]6186-you an effort to take this tone with [her]362-fulvia ; but [he]6186-you saw that in [her]362-fulvia high - strung mood any other would have been less effective . [She]362-fulvia rose slowly , keeping [her]362-fulvia eyes on [him]6186-you with the look of [a frightened child]5770-a frightened child . " [I]362-fulvia will do as [you]6186-you wish , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said . " Let [the landlord]3104-the landlord prepare a bed for [you]6186-you , then . [I]362-fulvia will keep watch down here and the horses shall be saddled at daylight . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia stood silent while [he]6186-you went to the door to call [the innkeeper]3135-the innkeeper ; but when the order was given , and the door closed again , [she]362-fulvia disconcerted [him]6186-you by a sudden sob . " What a burden [I]362-fulvia am ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia cried . " [I]362-fulvia had no right to accept this of [you]6186-you . "[362-fulvia] And [she]362-fulvia turned and fled up [the dark stairs]6189-the dark stairs . The night passed and toward dawn the rain ceased . [Odo]234-odo rose from [his]234-odo dreary vigil in [the kitchen]569-the kitchen , and called to [the innkeeper]3135-the innkeeper to carry up bread and wine to [[Fulvia]362-fulvia 's room]6192-fulvia 's room . Then [he]234-odo went out to see that the horses were fed and watered . [He]234-odo had not dared to question [the landlord]3104-the landlord as to [the roads]2942-the roads , lest [his]234-odo doing so should excite suspicion ; but [he]234-odo hoped to find [an ostler who would give [him]234-odo the information [he]234-odo needed]6195-an ostler who would give him the information he needed . [The stable]687-the stable was empty , however ; and [he]234-odo prepared to bait the horses [himself]234-odo . As [he]234-odo stooped to place [his]234-odo lantern on the floor [he]234-odo caught the gleam of a small polished object at [his]234-odo feet . [He]234-odo picked it up and found that it was a silver coat - of - arms , such as are attached to the blinders and saddles of a carriage - harness . [His]234-odo curiosity was aroused , and holding the light closer [he]234-odo recognised the ducal crown of [Pianura]4-pianura surmounting the " Humilitas "[6197-the valseccas] of [the Valseccas]6197-the valseccas . The discovery was so startling that for some moments [he]234-odo stood gazing at the small object in [his]234-odo hand without being able to steady [his]234-odo confused ideas . Gradually they took shape , and [he]234-odo saw that , if the ornament had fallen from the harness of [the traveller who had just preceded [them]6199-them]6198-the traveller who had just preceded them , it was not [Fulvia]362-fulvia but [he]234-odo [himself]234-odo who was being pursued . But who was it who sought [him]234-odo and to what purpose ? One fact alone was clear : [the traveller]5115-the traveller , whoever [he]5115-the traveller was , rode in one of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's carriages]6202-the duke 's carriages , and therefore presumably upon [[his]5115-the traveller sovereign]928-his sovereign 's business . [Odo]234-odo was still trying to thread a way through these conjectures when [a yawning ostler]6204-a yawning ostler pushed open the stable - door . " [[Your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency is in a hurry to be gone , "[6204-a yawning ostler] [he]6204-a yawning ostler said , with a surprised glance . [Odo]234-odo handed [him]6204-a yawning ostler the coat - of - arms . " Can [you]6204-a yawning ostler tell [me]234-odo what this is ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo asked carelessly . " [I]905-the other picked it up here a moment ago . "[905-the other] [The other]905-the other turned it over and stared . " Why , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , " that 's off the harness of [the gentleman that supped here last night]9812-the gentleman that supped here last night -- the same that went on later to [Peschiera]189-peschiera . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo proceeded to question [him]234-odo about the mule - tracks over [Monte Baldo]503-monte baldo , and having bidden [him]234-odo saddle the horses in half an hour , crossed [the courtyard]1745-the courtyard and re - entered [the inn]1050-the inn . A grey light was already falling through the windows , and [he]234-odo mounted the stairs and knocked on the door which [he]234-odo thought must be [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's . [Her]362-fulvia voice bade [him]234-odo enter and [he]234-odo found [her]362-fulvia seated fully dressed beside the window . [She]362-fulvia rose with a smile and [he]234-odo saw that [she]362-fulvia had regained [her]362-fulvia usual self - possession . " Do [we]9813-we set out at once ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia asked . " There is no great haste , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo answered . " [You]362-fulvia must eat first , and by that time the horses will be saddled . "[234-odo] " As [you]234-odo please , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia returned , with a readiness in which [he]234-odo divined the wish to make amends for [her]362-fulvia wilfulness the previous night . [Her]362-fulvia eyes and cheeks glowed with an excitement which counterfeited the effects of a night 's rest , and [he]234-odo thought [he]234-odo had never seen [her]362-fulvia more radiant . [She]362-fulvia approached the table on which the wine and bread had been placed , and drew another chair beside [her]362-fulvia own . " Will [you]234-odo not share with [me]362-fulvia ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia asked , filling a glass for [him]234-odo . [He]234-odo took it from [her]362-fulvia with a smile . " [I]234-odo have good news for [you]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , holding out the bit of silver which [he]234-odo had brought from [the stable]687-the stable . [She]362-fulvia examined it wonderingly . " What does this mean ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia asked , looking up at [him]234-odo . " That it is [I]362-fulvia who am being followed -- and not [you]234-odo . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia started and the ornament slipped from [her]362-fulvia hand . " [You]234-odo ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia faltered with a quick change of colour . " This coat - of - arms , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo explained , " dropped from the harness of [the traveller who left [the inn]1050-the inn just before [our]9816-our arrival last night]9814-the traveller who left the inn just before our arrival last night . "[234-odo] " Well-- "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , still without understanding ; " and do [you]234-odo know the coat ? "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo smiled . " It is [mine]234-odo , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo answered ; " and the crown is [[my]234-odo cousin]9817-my cousin 's . [The traveller]5115-the traveller must have been [a messenger of [the Duke]682-the duke 's]9819-a messenger of the duke 's . "[234-odo] [She]362-fulvia stood leaning against the seat from which [she]362-fulvia had risen , one hand still grasping it while the other hung inert . [Her]362-fulvia lips parted but [she]362-fulvia did not speak . [Her]362-fulvia pallor troubled [Odo]234-odo and [he]234-odo went up to [her]362-fulvia and took [her]362-fulvia hand . " Do [you]362-fulvia not understand , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said gently , " that there is no farther cause for alarm ? [I]234-odo have no reason to think that [[the Duke]682-the duke 's messenger]9822-the duke 's messenger is in pursuit of [me]234-odo ; but should [he]9822-the duke 's messenger be so , and should [he]9822-the duke 's messenger overtake [us]9823-us , [he]9822-the duke 's messenger has no authority over [you]362-fulvia and no reason for betraying [you]362-fulvia to [[your]362-fulvia enemies]9352-your enemies . "[234-odo] The blood poured back to [her]362-fulvia face . " [Me]362-fulvia ! [[My]362-fulvia enemies]9282-my enemies ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia stammered . " It is not of [them]9282-my enemies [I]362-fulvia think . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia raised [her]362-fulvia head and faced [him]6209-he in a glow . For a moment [he]6209-he stood stupidly gazing at [her]362-fulvia ; then the mist lifted and through it [he]6209-he saw a great light . * * * * * [[The landlord]3104-the landlord 's knock]6211-the landlord 's knock warned [them]6212-them that [their]6212-them horses waited , and [they]6212-them rode out in the grey morning . [The world about [them]6212-them]6213-the world about them still lay in shade , and as [they]6212-them climbed [the wooded defile above [the valley]1132-the valley]6214-the wooded defile above the valley [Odo]234-odo was reminded of the days at [Donnaz]7-donnaz when [he]234-odo had ridden up [the mountain]1271-the mountain in the same early light . Never since then had [he]234-odo felt , as [he]234-odo did now , [the boy]839-the boy 's easy kinship with the unexpected , the sense that no encounter could be too wonderful to fit in with the mere wonder of living . To avoid [the road to [Peschiera]189-peschiera]6218-the road to peschiera [they]6212-them had resolved to cross [the Monte Baldo]503-monte baldo by a mule - track which should bring [them]6212-them out at [one of [the villages]5276-the villages on [the eastern shore of [Garda]190-garda]6221-the eastern shore of garda]6219-one of the villages on the eastern shore of garda ; and the search for this path led [them]6212-them up through steep rain - scented woods where [they]6212-them had to part the wet boughs as [they]6212-them passed . From time to time [they]6212-them regained [the highway]2945-the highway and rode abreast , almost silent at first with the weight of [their]6212-them new nearness , and then breaking into talk that was the mere overflow of what [they]6212-them were thinking . There was in truth more to be felt between [them]6212-them than to be said ; since , as [each]6223-each was aware , the new light that suffused the present left the future as obscure as before . But what mattered , when the hour was [theirs]6212-them ? [The narrow kingdom of today]6224-the narrow kingdom of today is better worth ruling over than the widest past or future ; but not more than once does [a man]8112-a man hold its fugitive sceptre . The past , however , was theirs also : a past so transformed that [he]8112-a man must revisit it with [her]6226-her , joyously confronting [her]6226-her new self with the image of [her]6226-her that met [them]6212-them at each turn . Then [he]8112-a man had [himself]8112-a man to trace in [her]6226-her memories , [his]8112-a man transfigured likeness to linger over in the Narcissus - mirror of [her]6226-her faith in [him]8112-a man . This interchange of recollections served [them]6212-them as well as any outspoken expression of feeling , and the most commonplace allusion was charged with happy meanings . [Arabia Petraea]193-arabia petraea had been [an Eden to [such travellers]6228-such travellers]6227-an eden to such travellers ; how much more the happy slopes [they]6228-such travellers were now descending ! All the afternoon [their]6228-such travellers path wound down [the western incline of [Monte Baldo]503-monte baldo]6229-the western incline of monte baldo , first under huge olives , then through thickets of laurel and acacia , to emerge on [a lower level of lemon and orange groves]6230-a lower level of lemon and orange groves , with [the blue lake showing through a diaper of golden - fruited boughs]6231-the blue lake showing through a diaper of golden - fruited boughs . [Fulvia , to whom this clear - cut southern foliage was as new as the pure intensity of light that bathed it]6232-fulvia , to whom this clear - cut southern foliage was as new as the pure intensity of light that bathed it , seemed to [herself]6232-fulvia , to whom this clear - cut southern foliage was as new as the pure intensity of light that bathed it to be moving through the landscape of a dream . It was as though nature had been remodelled , transformed almost , under the touch of [their]6228-such travellers love : as though [they]6228-such travellers had found [their]6228-such travellers way to the Hesperian glades in which [poets]6233-poets and [painters]6234-painters placed [the legendary lovers of antiquity]6235-the legendary lovers of antiquity . Such feelings were intensified by the strangeness of the situation . In [Italy]5-italy [the young girls of the middle class]6236-the young girls of the middle class , though seemingly allowed a greater freedom of intercourse than [the daughters of [noblemen]1962-noblemen]6237-the daughters of noblemen , were in reality as strictly guarded . Though , like [Fulvia]362-fulvia , [they]6236-the young girls of the middle class might converse with [the elderly merchants]6239-the elderly merchants or [scholars frequenting the family]6240-scholars frequenting the family table , [they]6236-the young girls of the middle class were never alone in the company of [men]8356-men , and the high standard of conduct prevailing in [the bourgeoisie]6242-the bourgeoisie forbade all thought of clandestine intercourse . This was especially true of [the families of [men of letters]6244-men of letters , where the liberal education of [the young girls]6245-the young girls]6243-the families of men of letters , where the liberal education of the young girls , and [their]6245-the young girls habit of associating as equals with [men of serious and cultivated minds]6246-men of serious and cultivated minds , gave [them]6245-the young girls a self - possession disconcerting to the young blood accustomed to conquer with a glance . [These girls]6247-these girls as a rule , were married early to [men of [their]6247-these girls own standing]6248-men of their own standing , and though [the cicisbeo]1990-the cicisbeo was not unknown after marriage [he]1990-the cicisbeo was not [an authorised member of the household]6250-an authorised member of the household . [Fulvia]362-fulvia , indeed , belonged to [the class most inaccessible to [men of Odo]6252-men of odo 's rank]6251-the class most inaccessible to men of odo 's rank : [the only class in [Italy]5-italy in which [the wife]6254-the wife 's fidelity was as much esteemed as the innocence of [the girl]2319-the girl]6253-the only class in italy in which the wife 's fidelity was as much esteemed as the innocence of the girl . Such principles had long been ridiculed by [persons of quality and satirised by poets]6256-persons of quality and satirised by poets and [playwrights]6257-playwrights . From [Aristophanes]504-aristophanes to [Beaumarchais]195-beaumarchais [the cheated husband]6258-the cheated husband and [the outwitted guardian]6259-the outwitted guardian had been the figures on which [the dramatist]6260-the dramatist relied for [his]6260-the dramatist comic effects . Even [the miser tricked out of [his]6261-the miser tricked out of his savings savings]6261-the miser tricked out of his savings was a shade less ridiculous , less grotesquely deserving of [his]6261-the miser tricked out of his savings fate , than [the husband]6262-the husband defrauded of [[his]6262-the husband wife]1713-his wife 's affection . [The plausible adulteress]6264-the plausible adulteress and [the adroit seducer]6265-the adroit seducer had a recognised claim on the sympathy of [the public]4018-the public . But the inevitable reaction was at hand ; and [the new teachers to whom [Odo]234-odo 's contemporaries]6267-the new teachers to whom odo 's contemporaries were beginning to listen had thrown a strangely poetic light over the dull figures of the domestic virtues . Faithfulness to the family sanctities , reverence for the marriage tie , courage to sacrifice the loftiest passion to the most plodding duty : these were qualities to touch the fancy of [a generation sated with derision]6268-a generation sated with derision . If love as a sentiment was the discovery of [the medieval poets]6269-the medieval poets , love as a moral emotion might be called that of [the eighteenth - century philosophers , who , for all [their]6270-the eighteenth - century philosophers , who , for all their celebration of free unions and fatal passions , were really on the side of the angels , were fighting the battle of the spiritual against the sensual , of conscience against appetite celebration of free unions and fatal passions , were really on the side of [the angels , were fighting the battle of the spiritual against the sensual , of conscience against appetite]6271-the angels , were fighting the battle of the spiritual against the sensual , of conscience against appetite]6270-the eighteenth - century philosophers , who , for all their celebration of free unions and fatal passions , were really on the side of the angels , were fighting the battle of the spiritual against the sensual , of conscience against appetite . The imperceptible action of these new influences formed the real barrier between [Odo]234-odo and [Fulvia]362-fulvia . [The girl]2319-the girl stood for the embodiment of the purifying emotions that were to renew [the world]844-the world . [Her]362-fulvia candour , [her]362-fulvia unapproachableness , [her]362-fulvia simple trust in [him]6262-the husband , were a part of the magic light which the new idealism had shed over the old social structure . [His]6262-the husband was , in short , a love large enough to include other emotions : a widening rather than a contraction of the emotional range . [Youth]341-youth and propinquity have before now broken down stronger defences ; but [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's situation was an unspoken appeal to [[her]362-fulvia lover]2846-her lover 's forbearance . The sense that [her]362-fulvia safety depended on [him]6262-the husband kept [his]6262-the husband sentimental impulses in check and made the happiness of the moment seem , in its exquisite unreality , a mere dreamlike interlude between the facts of life . Toward sunset [they]6275-they rested in [an olive - orchard]6276-an olive - orchard , tethering [their]6275-they horses to the low boughs . Overhead , through the thin foliage of tarnished silver , the sky , as the moon suffused it , melted from steel blue to a clearer silver . [A peasant - woman whose hut stood close by]6277-a peasant - woman whose hut stood close by brought [them]6275-they a goat 's cheese on a vine - leaf and a jug of spring - water ; and as [they]6275-they supped , a little goat - herd , driving [his]6262-the husband flock down [the hill]2340-the hill , paused to watch [them]6275-they with furtive woodland eyes . [Odo]234-odo , questioning [him]6262-the husband , learned that at [[the village]1028-the village on [the shore below]6281-the shore below]6280-the village on the shore below [they]6275-they could obtain [a boat]9515-a boat to carry [them]6275-they across [the lake]9807-the lake . [Fulvia]362-fulvia , for lack of a passport , dared not set foot on [Austrian soil]6284-austrian soil ; but [the Swiss authorities]6285-the swiss authorities were less exacting and [Odo]234-odo had hopes of crossing [the border]2189-the border without difficulty . [They]6275-they set out again presently , descending through the grey dusk of the olives till the path became too steep for riding ; then [Odo]234-odo lifted [Fulvia]362-fulvia from the saddle and led the two horses after [her]362-fulvia . Here and there , between the trees , [they]6275-they caught a momentary glimpse of lights on [the shore]4906-the shore and the pale gleam of [the lake]9807-the lake enclosed in black foliage . From [the village]1028-the village below came snatches of song and the shrill wail of a pipe ; and as the night deepened [they]6275-they saw , far out on [the water]5281-the water , the wild flare of [the fish - spearers]6291-the fish - spearers ' torches , like comets in an inverted sky . With nightfall [the spirits of both]6292-the spirits of both had sunk . [Fulvia]362-fulvia walked ahead in silence and [Odo]234-odo read a mute apprehension in [her]362-fulvia drooping outline . Every step brought [them]6275-they nearer to the point [they]6275-they both feared to face , and though [each]6223-each knew what lay in [the other]905-the other 's thoughts neither dared break the silence . [Odo]234-odo 's mind turned anxiously to the incidents of the morning , to the finding of the ducal coat - of - arms , and to all the possibilities it suggested . What errand save one could have carried an envoy from [Pianura]4-pianura to [that remote hamlet among [the hills]1079-the hills]6295-that remote hamlet among the hills ? [He]234-odo could scarcely doubt that it was in pursuit of [himself]234-odo that [the ducal messenger]6297-the ducal messenger travelled ; but with what object was the journey undertaken ? Was [he]234-odo to be recalled in obedience to some new whim of [the Duke]682-the duke 's ? Or had some unforeseen change -- [he]234-odo dared not let [his]234-odo thoughts define it -- suddenly made [his]234-odo presence needful in [Pianura]4-pianura ? It was more probable that the possibility of [his]234-odo flight with [Fulvia]362-fulvia had been suggested to [the Duke]682-the duke by [the ecclesiastical authorities]6300-the ecclesiastical authorities , and that the same hand which had parted [them]6275-they before was again secretly at work . In any case , it was [Odo]234-odo 's first business to see [[his]234-odo companion]840-his companion safely across [the border]2189-the border ; and in that endeavour [he]234-odo had now little fear of being thwarted . If [[the Duke]682-the duke 's messenger]9822-the duke 's messenger awaited [them]6275-they at [Peschiera]189-peschiera [he]234-odo waited in vain ; and though [their]6275-they flight across [the lake]9807-the lake might be known before dawn it would then be no easy matter to overtake [them]6275-they . In an hour 's time , as [Odo]234-odo had hoped , [they]6275-they were putting off from [the shore]4906-the shore in [a blunt - nosed fishing - boat]6307-a blunt - nosed fishing - boat which was the lightest craft [the village]1028-the village could provide . [The lake]9807-the lake was stark calm , and [the two boatmen , silhouetted against the moonlight]6310-the two boatmen , silhouetted against the moonlight , drove [the boat]9715-the boat forward with even vigorous strokes . [Fulvia]362-fulvia , shivering in the autumnal chill , had drawn [her]362-fulvia hood close about [her]362-fulvia and sat silent , [her]362-fulvia face in shade . Measured by [their]6275-they secret apprehensions [the boat]9715-the boat 's progress seemed at first indescribably slow ; but gradually the sounds from [the shore]4906-the shore grew fainter , and [the fugitives]6008-the fugitives felt [themselves]6008-the fugitives alone in a world enclosed by [the moonlit circle of the waters]6315-the moonlit circle of the waters . As [they]6275-they advanced this sense of isolation and security grew deeper and more impressive . [The motionless surface of [the lake]9807-the lake]6316-the motionless surface of the lake was enclosed in a wall of mountains which the moonlight seemed to vein with marble . A sky in which the stars were dissolved in white radiance curved high above [their]6275-they heads ; and not a sail flecked [the lake]9807-the lake or a cloud the sky . [The boat]9715-the boat seemed suspended alone in some ethereal medium . Presently [one of [the boatmen]5797-the boatmen]6320-one of the boatmen spoke to [the other]905-the other and glanced toward [the north]4916-the north . Then [the second]6324-the second silently shipped [his]6324-the second oar and hoisted the sail . Hardly had [he]6324-the second made it fast when a fresh of wind came down [the lake]9807-the lake and [they]6275-they began to stretch across [the bay]6326-the bay with spreading canvas . The wind was contrary , but [Odo]234-odo welcomed it , for [he]234-odo saw at once that it would be quicker work to tack to [the other shore]6327-the other shore than to depend on the oars . The scene underwent a sudden change . The silver mirror over which [they]6275-they had appeared to glide was shivered into sparkling fragments , and in the enveloping rush and murmur of the night [the boat]9715-the boat woke to a creaking straining activity . [The man at the rudder]6329-the man at the rudder suddenly pointed to a huddle of lights to the south . " [Peschiera]189-peschiera . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo laughed . " [We]6275-they shall soon show it [our]6275-they heels , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo . [The other boatman]6330-the other boatman shrugged [his]6330-the other boatman shoulders . " Even [an enemy]9826-an enemy 's roof may serve to keep out the storm , "[6330-the other boatman] [he]6330-the other boatman observed philosophically . " The storm ? What storm ? "[1626-the man] [The man]1626-the man pointed to [the north]4916-the north . Against the sky hung a little black cloud , the merest flaw in the perfect curve of the night . " [The lake]9807-the lake is shrewish at this season , "[4829-the boatman] [the boatman]4829-the boatman continued . " Did [[your]234-odo excellencies]9780-your excellencies burn a candle before starting ? "[4829-the boatman] [Odo]234-odo sat silent , [his]234-odo eyes fixed on the cloud . It was growing visibly now . With every moment its outline seemed to shift and spread , till its black menace dilated to the zenith . The bright water still broke about [them]6275-they in diamond spray ; but as the shadow travelled [the lake beneath]6334-the lake beneath [it]6335-it turned to lead . Then the storm dropped on [them]6275-they . It fell suddenly out of mid - heaven . Sky and water grew black and a long shudder ran through [the boat]9715-the boat . For a moment [she]9715-the boat hung back , staggering under a white fury of blows ; then the gale seemed to lift and swing [her]9715-the boat about and [she]9715-the boat shot forward through a long tunnel of glistening blackness , bows on for [Peschiera]189-peschiera . " [[The enemy]4398-the enemy 's roof]9830-the enemy 's roof ! "[234-odo] thought [Odo]234-odo . [He]234-odo reached for [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's hand and found it in the darkness . The rain was driving against [them]6275-they now and [he]234-odo drew [her]362-fulvia close and wrapped [his]234-odo cloak about [her]362-fulvia . [She]362-fulvia lay still , without a tremor , as though in that shelter no fears could reach [her]362-fulvia . The night roared about [them]6275-they and the waters seemed to divide beneath [their]6275-they keel . Through the tumult [Odo]234-odo shouted to [the boatmen]5797-the boatmen to try to make [some harbour north of [Peschiera]189-peschiera]6338-some harbour north of peschiera . [They]5797-the boatmen shouted back that [they]5797-the boatmen must go where the wind willed and bless [the saints]1218-the saints if [they]5797-the boatmen made any harbour at all ; and [Odo]234-odo saw that [Peschiera]189-peschiera was [their]5797-the boatmen destiny . It was past midnight when [they]5797-the boatmen set foot on [shore]5674-shore . The rain still fell in torrents and [they]5797-the boatmen could hardly grope [their]5797-the boatmen way up the steps of [the landing - stage]6341-the landing - stage . [Odo]234-odo 's first concern was to avoid [the inn]1050-the inn ; but [the boatmen]5797-the boatmen , exhausted by [their]5797-the boatmen efforts and impatient to be under shelter , could not be bribed to seek out at that hour another lodging for [the travellers]1059-the travellers . [Odo]234-odo dared not expose [Fulvia]362-fulvia longer to the storm , and reluctantly [they]5797-the boatmen turned toward [the inn]1050-the inn , trusting that at that hour [their]5797-the boatmen coming would attract little notice . [A travelling - carriage]8680-a travelling - carriage stood in [the courtyard]1745-the courtyard , and somewhat to [Odo]234-odo 's surprise [the landlord]3104-the landlord was still afoot . [He]3104-the landlord led [them]5797-the boatmen into [the public parlour]6349-the public parlour , which was alight , with a good fire on the hearth . [A gentleman in travelling - dress]6350-a gentleman in travelling - dress sat near this fire , [his]6350-a gentleman in travelling - dress back to the door , reading by a shaded candle . [He]6350-a gentleman in travelling - dress rose as [the travellers]1059-the travellers entered , and [Odo]234-odo recognised the abate [de Crucis]462-de crucis . [The latter]870-the latter advanced with a smile in which pleasure was more visible than surprise . [He]234-odo bowed slightly to [Fulvia]362-fulvia , who had shrunk back into the shadow of the doorway ; then [he]234-odo turned to [Odo]234-odo and said : " [Cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , [I]234-odo have travelled six days to overtake [you]8111-cavaliere . [The Duke of [Pianura]4-pianura]9832-the duke of pianura is dying and has named [you]8111-cavaliere [regent]9833-regent . "[234-odo] 3.7 . [Odo]234-odo heard a slight movement behind [him]234-odo . [He]234-odo turned and saw that [Fulvia]362-fulvia had vanished . [He]234-odo understood [her]362-fulvia wish for concealment , but its futility was written in the glance with which [de Crucis]462-de crucis followed [her]362-fulvia flight . [The abate]624-the abate continued to speak in urgent tones . " [I]234-odo implore [you]8111-cavaliere , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " to lose no time in accompanying [me]234-odo to [Pianura]4-pianura . The situation there is critical and before now [[his]234-odo Highness]941-his highness 's death may have placed the reins in [your]8111-cavaliere hands . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo glanced at [his]234-odo watch . " If [[your]8111-cavaliere excellency]8157-your excellency is not too tired to set out at once , [my]234-odo horses can be harnessed within the half hour . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo 's heart sank . To have let [his]234-odo thoughts dwell on such a possibility seemed to have done little to prepare [him]234-odo for its realisation . [He]234-odo hardly understood what [de Crucis]462-de crucis was saying : [he]234-odo knew only that an hour before [he]234-odo had fancied [himself]234-odo master of [his]234-odo fate and that now [he]234-odo was again in bonds . [His]234-odo first clear thought was that nothing should part [him]234-odo from [Fulvia]362-fulvia . [De Crucis]462-de crucis seemed to read the thought . " [Cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " at a moment when time is so valuable [you]8111-cavaliere will pardon [my]234-odo directness . [You]8111-cavaliere are accompanying to Switzerland [a lady who has placed [herself]9837-a lady who has placed herself in your charge-- in [your]8111-cavaliere charge--]9837-a lady who has placed herself in your charge-- "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo made no reply , and [the other]905-the other went on in the same firm but courteous tone : " Foreseeing that it would be difficult for [you]8111-cavaliere to leave [her]9837-a lady who has placed herself in your charge-- so abruptly [I]234-odo provided [myself]234-odo , in [Venice]41-venice , with a passport which will take [her]9837-a lady who has placed herself in your charge-- safely across [the border]2189-the border . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo drew a paper from [his]234-odo coat . " This , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo , handing it to [Odo]234-odo , " is [the Papal Nuncio]9523-the papal nuncio 's authorisation to [the Signorina Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia , known in religion as [Sister Veronica]490-sister veronica , to absent [herself]362-fulvia from [Italy]5-italy for an indefinite period . With this passport and a good escort [[your]234-odo companion]9712-your companion will have no difficulty in joining [[her]362-fulvia friends]3119-her friends . "[234-odo] Excess of astonishment kept [Odo]234-odo silent for a moment ; and in that moment [he]234-odo had as it were a fugitive glimpse into the workings of the great power which still strove for predominance in [Italy]5-italy . A safe - conduct from [the Papal Nuncio to [Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia]6355-the papal nuncio to fulvia vivaldi was equivalent to [her]6355-the papal nuncio to fulvia vivaldi release from [her]6355-the papal nuncio to fulvia vivaldi vows ; and this in turn implied that , for the moment , religious discipline had been frankly sacrificed to the pressure of political necessities . How the invisible hands made and unmade the destinies of [those who came in [their]6356-those who came in their way way]6356-those who came in their way ! How boldly [the Church]1212-the church swept aside [her]1212-the church own defences when [they]6356-those who came in their way obstructed [her]1212-the church course ! [He]234-odo was conscious , even at the moment , of all that [men like [de Crucis]462-de crucis]6358-men like de crucis had to say in defence of this higher expediency , this avowed discrimination between the factors in each fresh combination of circumstances . [He]234-odo had [himself]234-odo felt the complex wonder of thoughtful minds before [the Church]72-the church 's perpetual miracle of change disguised in immutability ; but now [he]234-odo saw only the meaner side of the game , its elements of cruelty and falseness ; and [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo no more than a frail bark on the dark and tossing seas of ecclesiastical intrigue . For a moment [his]234-odo heart shuddered back from its fate . " No passport , no safe - conduct , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said at length , " can release [me]234-odo from [my]234-odo duty to [the lady who has placed [herself]9842-the lady who has placed herself in my care in [my]234-odo care]9842-the lady who has placed herself in my care . "[234-odo] [De Crucis]462-de crucis bowed . " This is the answer [I]234-odo expected , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , not without sadness . [Odo]234-odo glanced at [him]234-odo in surprise . [The two men]6359-the two men , hitherto , had addressed [each other]3086-each other as [strangers]3356-strangers ; but now something in [the abate]624-the abate 's tone recalled to [Odo]234-odo the familiarity of [their]6359-the two men former intercourse , [their]6359-the two men deep community of thought , the significance of the days [they]6359-the two men had spent together in [the monastery of [Monte Cassino]142-monte cassino]5087-the monastery of monte cassino . The association of ideas brought before [him]234-odo the profound sense of responsibility with which , at that time , [he]234-odo had looked forward to such an hour as this . [The abate]624-the abate was watching [him]234-odo gravely . " [Cavaliere]234-odo , "[624-the abate] [he]624-the abate said , " every instant counts , all [you]234-odo had once hoped to do for [Pianura]4-pianura is now [yours]234-odo to accomplish . But in [your]234-odo absence [[your]234-odo enemies]9352-your enemies are not idle . [[His]624-the abate Highness]941-his highness may revoke [your]234-odo appointment at any hour . Of late [I]624-the abate have had [his]624-the abate ear , but [I]624-the abate have now been near a week absent , and [you]234-odo know [the Duke]682-the duke is not long constant to one purpose.--Cavaliere , "[624-the abate] [he]624-the abate exclaimed , " [I]624-the abate appeal to [you]234-odo not in the name of [the God whom [you]234-odo have come to doubt , but in that of [[your]234-odo fellow - men]9848-your fellow - men , whom [you]234-odo have wished to serve]9847-the god whom you have come to doubt , but in that of your fellow - men , whom you have wished to serve . "[624-the abate] [Odo]234-odo looked at [him]234-odo , not without a confused sense of the irony of such an appeal on such lips , yet with the distinct consciousness that it was uttered in all sincerity , and that , whatever [their]6365-their superficial diversity of view , [he]234-odo and [de Crucis]462-de crucis were at one on those deeper questions that gave the moment its real significance . " It is impossible , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo repeated , " that [I]234-odo should go with [you]234-odo . "[234-odo] [De Crucis]462-de crucis was again silent , and [Odo]234-odo was aware of the renewed intentness of [his]234-odo scrutiny . " If [the lady--]9849-the lady-- "[234-odo] broke from [him]234-odo once ; but [he]234-odo checked [himself]234-odo and took a turn in [the room]782-the room . Meanwhile a resolve was slowly forming itself in [Odo]234-odo . [He]234-odo would not be false to the call which , since [his]234-odo boyhood , had so often made itself heard before the voice of pleasure and self - interest ; but [he]234-odo would at least reserve the right to obey it in [his]234-odo own fashion and under conditions which left [his]234-odo private inclination free . " There may be more than one way of serving [one 's fellows]9850-one 's fellows , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said quietly . " Go back without [me]234-odo , [abate]8142-abate . Tell [[my]234-odo cousin]9817-my cousin that [I]234-odo resign [my]234-odo rights to the succession . [I]234-odo shall live [my]234-odo own life elsewhere , not unworthily , [I]234-odo hope , but as [a private person]9853-a private person . "[234-odo] [De Crucis]462-de crucis had turned pale . For a moment [his]462-de crucis habitual self - command seemed about to fail [him]462-de crucis ; and [Odo]234-odo could not but see that a sincere personal regret was mingled with [the political agent]6367-the political agent 's consciousness of failure . [He]234-odo [himself]234-odo was chiefly aware of a sense of relief , of self - recovery , as though [he]234-odo had at last solved a baffling enigma and found [himself]234-odo once more at one with [his]234-odo fate . Suddenly [he]234-odo heard a step behind [him]234-odo . [Fulvia]362-fulvia had re - entered [the room]782-the room . [She]362-fulvia moved across [the room]782-the room , carrying [her]362-fulvia head high and advancing tranquilly to [Odo]234-odo 's side . [She]362-fulvia turned to [de Crucis]462-de crucis , and [Odo]234-odo had the immediate intuition that [she]362-fulvia had recognised [him]462-de crucis . " Will [you]234-odo let [me]362-fulvia speak a word privately to [the cavaliere Valsecca]8650-the cavaliere valsecca ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said . " [You]234-odo still believe [him]462-de crucis to be [[your]234-odo friend]8799-your friend ? "[362-fulvia] " Yes , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo answered frankly , " [I]234-odo still believe [him]462-de crucis to be [[my]234-odo friend]3178-my friend , and , spite of [his]462-de crucis cloth , [the friend of justice and humanity]9857-the friend of justice and humanity . "[234-odo] " [I]362-fulvia knew , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia murmured , " [I]362-fulvia knew-- "[362-fulvia] [He]234-odo went up to [her]362-fulvia and caught [her]362-fulvia hands . "[234-odo] [She]362-fulvia drew back , gently releasing [herself]362-fulvia . " [Free--]505-free-- ? "[362-fulvia] " [My]362-fulvia choice is made . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia continued to stare at [him]234-odo , leaning against the chair from which [de Crucis]462-de crucis had risen . " [Your]234-odo choice is made ! [Your]234-odo choice is made ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia repeated . " And [you]234-odo have chosen-- "[362-fulvia] " [You]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said simply . " Will [you]362-fulvia go to [France]22-france with [me]234-odo , [Fulvia]362-fulvia ? Will [you]362-fulvia be [[my]234-odo wife]9391-my wife and work with [me]234-odo at a distance for the cause that , in [Italy]5-italy , [we]9864-we may not serve together ? [I]234-odo have never abandoned the aims [[your]362-fulvia father]8631-your father taught [me]234-odo to strive for ; they are dearer , more sacred to [me]234-odo than ever ; but [I]234-odo can not strive for [them]9866-them alone . [I]234-odo must feel [your]362-fulvia hand in mine , [I]234-odo must know that [your]362-fulvia heart beats with [mine]234-odo , [I]234-odo must hear the voice of liberty speak to [me]234-odo in [your]362-fulvia voice-- "[234-odo] [He]6371-he broke off suddenly and went up to [her]6372-her . " All this is nothing , "[6371-he] [he]6371-he said . " [I]6371-he love [you]6372-her . [I]6371-he can not give [you]6372-her up . That is all . "[6371-he] For a moment , as [he]6371-he spoke , [her]6372-her face shone with an extraordinary light . [She]6372-her looked at [him]6371-he intently , as one who seemed to gaze beyond and through [him]6371-he , at some mystic vision that [his]6371-he words evoked . Then the brightness faded . " The picture [you]6371-he draw is a beautiful one , "[6372-her] [she]6372-her said , speaking slowly , in sweet deliberate tones , " but it is not for [me]6372-her to look on . What [you]6371-he said last is not true . If [you]6371-he love [me]6372-her it is because [we]9867-we have thought the same thoughts , dreamed the same dream , heard the same voice -- in each other 's voices , perhaps , as [you]6371-he say , but none the less a real voice , apart from [us]9867-we and above [us]9867-we , and one which would speak to [us]9867-we as loudly if [we]9867-we were apart -- one which both of [us]9867-we must follow to the end . "[6372-her] [He]6371-he gazed at [her]6372-her eagerly as [she]6372-her spoke ; and while [he]6371-he gazed there came to [him]6371-he , perversely enough , a vision of the life [he]6371-he was renouncing , not as it concerned the public welfare but in its merely personal aspect : a vision of the power , the luxury , the sumptuous background of traditional state and prerogative in which [his]6371-he artistic and intellectual tastes , as well as [his]6371-he easy impulses of benevolence , would find unchecked and immediate gratification . It was the first time that [he]6371-he had been aware of such lurking influences under [his]6371-he most generous aspirations ; but even as [Fulvia]362-fulvia ceased to speak the vision faded , leaving only an intenser longing to bend [her]6372-her will to [his]6371-he . " [You]6372-her are right , "[6371-he] [he]6371-he rejoined ; " [we]9867-we must follow that voice to the end ; but why not together ? [[Your]6372-her father]8631-your father [himself]8631-your father often questioned whether [the patriot]9869-the patriot could not serve [[his]8631-your father people]1264-his people better at a distance than in [their]1264-his people midst . In [France]22-france , where the new ideas are not only tolerated but put in practice , [we]9867-we shall be able to study their effects and to learn how they may best be applied to the relief of [[our]9867-we own unhappy people]9871-our own unhappy people ; and as [a private person , independent of party and patronage]9872-a private person , independent of party and patronage , could [I]6371-he not do more than as [the nominal head of [a narrow priest - ridden government]9874-a narrow priest - ridden government , where every act and word would be used by [[my]6371-he enemies]9282-my enemies to injure [me]6371-he and the cause [I]6371-he represent]9873-the nominal head of a narrow priest - ridden government , where every act and word would be used by my enemies to injure me and the cause i represent ? "[6371-he] The vigour and rapidity of the attack , and the promptness with which [he]6373-you converted [her]6374-her argument to [his]6373-you own use , were not without visible effect . [Odo]234-odo saw [his]6373-you words reflected in the wavering glow of [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's cheek ; but almost at once [she]362-fulvia regained control of [her]362-fulvia pulses and faced [him]6373-you with that serenity which seemed to come to [her]362-fulvia at such moments . " What [you]6373-you say might be true , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia answered , " were [your]6373-you opportunities indeed restricted to [the regency]9876-the regency . But [the little prince]3148-the little prince 's life is known to hang on a thread : at any moment [you]6373-you may be [Duke]290-pianura . And [you]6373-you will not deny that as [Duke of [Pianura]4-pianura]8392-duke of pianura [you]6373-you can serve [[your]6373-you people]9879-your people better than as [an obscure pamphleteer in [Paris]27-paris]9880-an obscure pamphleteer in paris . "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo made an impatient gesture . " Are [you]362-fulvia so sure ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " Even as [Duke]290-pianura [I]234-odo must be [the puppet of powers greater than [myself]234-odo -- of [Austria]100-austria , of [Rome]11-rome]9881-the puppet of powers greater than myself -- of austria , of rome , nay , of [the wealthy nobles who will always league [themselves]9882-the wealthy nobles who will always league themselves with their sovereign 's enemies rather than suffer a hand upon their privileges . and even if i were fortunate enough to outwit my masters and rule indeed , over what a toy kingdom should i reign with [[their]9882-the wealthy nobles who will always league themselves with their sovereign 's enemies rather than suffer a hand upon their privileges . and even if i were fortunate enough to outwit my masters and rule indeed , over what a toy kingdom should i reign sovereign 's enemies]9883-their sovereign 's enemies rather than suffer a hand upon [their]9882-the wealthy nobles who will always league themselves with their sovereign 's enemies rather than suffer a hand upon their privileges . and even if i were fortunate enough to outwit my masters and rule indeed , over what a toy kingdom should i reign privileges . And even if [I]234-odo were fortunate enough to outwit [[my]234-odo masters]9884-my masters and rule indeed , over what [a toy kingdom]9885-a toy kingdom should [I]234-odo reign]9882-the wealthy nobles who will always league themselves with their sovereign 's enemies rather than suffer a hand upon their privileges . and even if i were fortunate enough to outwit my masters and rule indeed , over what a toy kingdom should i reign ! How small a number would be benefited ! How little the cause would be helped by [my]234-odo example ! As an obscure pamphleteer [I]234-odo might reach the hearts of [thousands]9886-thousands and speak to [great kings]9887-great kings on [their]9887-great kings thrones ; as [Duke of [Pianura]4-pianura]8392-duke of pianura , fighting single - handed to reform the laws of [[my]234-odo little state]9889-my little state , [I]234-odo should rank at best with [the other petty sovereigns who are amusing [themselves]9890-the other petty sovereigns who are amusing themselves all over italy all over [Italy]5-italy]9890-the other petty sovereigns who are amusing themselves all over italy with agricultural experiments and improved methods of cheese - making . "[234-odo] Again the brightness shone in [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's face . " How [you]6375-you love [me]362-fulvia ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said as [he]6375-you paused ; and went on , restraining [him]6375-you with a gesture of the gentlest dignity : " For it is love that speaks thus in [you]6375-you and not reason ; and [you]6375-you know as [I]362-fulvia do that the duty to which [a man]8112-a man is born comes before any of [his]8112-a man own choosing . [You]6375-you are called to serve liberty on a throne , [I]362-fulvia in some obscure corner of the private life . [We]9892-our can no more exchange [our]9892-our duties than [our]9892-our stations ; but if [our]9892-our lives divide , [our]9892-our purpose remains one , and as [pious persons]9893-pious persons recall each other in the mystery of the Sacrament , so [we]9892-our shall meet in spirit in the new religion [we]9892-our profess . "[362-fulvia] [Her]362-fulvia voice gained strength and measure as [she]362-fulvia spoke , and [Odo]234-odo felt that all that passion could urge must spend itself in vain against such high security of spirit . " Go , [cavaliere]8111-cavaliere , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia continued , " [I]362-fulvia implore [you]6375-you to lose no time in reaching [Pianura]4-pianura . Occasion is short - lived , and an hour 's lingering may cost [you]6375-you the regency , and with it the chance of gaining a hold on [[your]6375-you people]9879-your people . [I]362-fulvia will not expatiate , as some might , on the power and dignities that await [you]6375-you . [You]6375-you are [no adventurer]9896-no adventurer plotting to steal a throne , but [a soldier pledged to [his]9897-a soldier pledged to his post post]9897-a soldier pledged to his post . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia moved close to [him]234-odo and suddenly caught [his]234-odo hand and raised it to [her]362-fulvia lips . " [[Your]234-odo excellency]8157-your excellency , "[362-fulvia] said [she]362-fulvia , " has deigned to look for a moment on [a poor girl that crossed [your]6375-you path]9899-a poor girl that crossed your path . Now [your]6375-you eyes must be on [[your]6375-you people]9879-your people , who will yet have cause to love and bless [you]6375-you as [she]9899-a poor girl that crossed your path does . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia shone on [him]234-odo with a weeping brightness that dissolved [his]234-odo very soul . " Ah , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried , " [you]362-fulvia have indeed learned [your]362-fulvia lesson well ! [I]234-odo admire with what stoic calmness [you]362-fulvia pronounce [my]234-odo doom , with what readiness [you]362-fulvia dispose of [my]234-odo future ! "[234-odo] " It is not [mine]362-fulvia to dispose of , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia caught [him]234-odo up , " nor [yours]234-odo ; but belongs , as much as [any slave]9901-any slave 's to [[his]9901-any slave master]2377-his master , to [the people [you]362-fulvia are called to rule]9903-the people you are called to rule . Think for how many generations [their]9903-the people you are called to rule unheeded sufferings , [their]9903-the people you are called to rule unrewarded toil , have paid for the pomp and pleasure of [[your]234-odo house]3834-your house ! That is the debt [you]234-odo are called on to acquit , the wrong [you]234-odo are pledged to set right . "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo was silent . [She]362-fulvia had found the unanswerable word . Yes , [he]234-odo was called on to acquit the accumulated debt of that long unrighteous rule : it was [he]234-odo who must pay , if need be with the last drop of [his]234-odo blood , for the savage victories of [Bracciaforte]398-bracciaforte , the rapacity of [Guidobaldo]428-duke guidobaldo , the magnificence of [Ascanio]399-ascanio , the religious terrors and secret vices of [the poor Duke]3921-the poor duke now nearing [his]234-odo end . All these passions had preyed on [the people]1003-the people , on [the tillers]6378-the tillers and [weavers]6379-weavers and [vine - dressers]6380-vine - dressers , [obscure servants of a wasteful greatness]6381-obscure servants of a wasteful greatness : [theirs]6382-theirs had been the blood that renewed the exhausted veins of [[their]6382-theirs rulers]6383-their rulers , through generation after generation of dumb labour and privation . And the noblest passions , as well as the basest , had been nourished at the same cost . Every flower in [the ducal gardens]856-the ducal gardens , every picture on [the palace]768-the palace walls , every honour in the ancient annals of [the house]1917-the house , had been planted , paid for , fought for by [the people]1003-the people . With mute inconscient irony [the two powers]6388-the two powers had faced [each other]3086-each other for generations : [the subjects]6390-the subjects never guessing that [[their]6390-the subjects sovereigns]6391-their sovereigns were puppets of [their]6390-the subjects own making , [the Dukes]6392-the dukes that all [their]6392-the dukes pomp and circumstance were but a borrowed motley . Now the evil wrought in ignorance remained to be undone in the light of [the world]844-the world 's new knowledge : the discovery of that universal brotherhood which [Christ]264-christ had long ago proclaimed , and which , after so many centuries , [those who denied [Christ]264-christ]6394-those who denied christ were the first to put in practice . Hour by hour , day by day , at the cost of every personal inclination , of all that endears life and ennobles failure , [Odo]234-odo must set [himself]234-odo to redeem the credit of [[his]234-odo house]1355-his house . [He]234-odo saw [his]234-odo way straight before [him]234-odo ; but in that hour of insight [his]234-odo heart 's instinct of self - preservation made one last effort against fate . [He]234-odo turned to [Fulvia]362-fulvia . " [You]362-fulvia are right , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said ; " [I]234-odo have no choice . [You]362-fulvia have shown [me]234-odo the way ; but must [I]234-odo travel it alone ? [You]362-fulvia ask [me]234-odo to give up at a stroke all that makes life desirable : to set forth , without a backward glance , on [the very road that leads [me]234-odo farthest from [you]362-fulvia]9905-the very road that leads me farthest from you ! Yesterday [I]234-odo might have obeyed ; but how can [I]234-odo turn today from this near view of [my]234-odo happiness ? "[234-odo] [He]234-odo paused a moment and [she]362-fulvia seemed about to answer ; but [he]234-odo hurried on without giving [her]362-fulvia time . " [Fulvia]362-fulvia , if [you]362-fulvia ask this sacrifice of [me]234-odo , is there none [you]362-fulvia will make in return ? If [you]362-fulvia bid [me]234-odo go forth and work for [[my]234-odo people]9013-my people , will [you]362-fulvia not come with [me]234-odo and work for [them]9013-my people too ? "[234-odo] [He]234-odo stretched out [his]234-odo hands , in a gesture that seemed to sum up [his]234-odo infinite need of [her]362-fulvia , and for a moment [they]6396-they faced each other , silenced by the nearness of great issues . [She]362-fulvia knew well enough what [he]234-odo offered . According to the code of the day there was no dishonour in the offer and it did not occur to [her]362-fulvia to resent it . But [she]362-fulvia looked at [him]234-odo sadly and [he]234-odo read [her]362-fulvia refusal in the look . " [[The Regent]9907-the regent 's mistress]9908-the regent 's mistress ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said slowly . " The key to the treasury , the back - door to preferment , [the secret trafficker]9909-the secret trafficker in titles and appointments ? That is what [I]362-fulvia should stand for -- and it is not to such services that [you]362-fulvia must even appear to owe [your]362-fulvia power . [I]362-fulvia will not say that [I]362-fulvia have [my]362-fulvia own work to do ; for the dearest service [I]362-fulvia could perform would be to help [you]362-fulvia in [yours]362-fulvia . But to do this [I]362-fulvia must stand aside . To be near [you]362-fulvia [I]362-fulvia must go from [you]362-fulvia . To love [you]362-fulvia [I]362-fulvia must give [you]362-fulvia up . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia looked [him]6397-him full in the eyes as [she]362-fulvia spoke ; then [she]362-fulvia went up to [him]6397-him and kissed [him]6397-him . It was the first kiss [she]362-fulvia had given [him]6397-him since [she]362-fulvia had thrown [herself]362-fulvia in [his]6397-him arms in [[[her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father 's garden]6399-her father 's garden ; but now [he]6397-him felt [her]362-fulvia whole being on [her]362-fulvia lips . [He]6397-him would have held [her]362-fulvia fast , forgetting everything in the sweetness of [her]362-fulvia surrender ; but [she]362-fulvia drew back quickly and , before [he]6397-him could guess [her]362-fulvia intention , throw open the door of [the room to which [de Crucis]462-de crucis had withdrawn]6400-the room to which de crucis had withdrawn . " [Signor abate]8341-signor abate ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said . [The Jesuit]5602-the jesuit came forward . [Odo]234-odo was dimly aware that , for an instant , [the two]812-the two measured [each other]3086-each other ; then [Fulvia]362-fulvia said quietly : " [[His]6397-him excellency]8647-his excellency goes with [you]234-odo to [Pianura]4-pianura . "[362-fulvia] What more [she]362-fulvia said , or what [de Crucis]462-de crucis answered , [he]234-odo could never afterward recall . [He]234-odo had a confused sense of having cried out a last unavailing protest , faintly , inarticulately , like [a man]8112-a man struggling to make [himself]234-odo heard in a dream ; then [the room]782-the room grew dark about [him]234-odo , and in [its]782-the room stead [he]234-odo saw [the old chapel at [Donnaz]7-donnaz]6406-the old chapel at donnaz , with [[its]6406-the old chapel at donnaz dimly - gleaming shrine]6407-its dimly - gleaming shrine , and heard the voice of [the chaplain]8222-the chaplain , harsh and yet strangely shaken:--"My chief prayer for [you]234-odo is that , should [you]234-odo be raised to this eminence , it may be at a moment when such advancement seems to thrust [you]234-odo in the dust . "[8222-the chaplain] [Odo]234-odo lifted [his]234-odo head and saw [de Crucis]462-de crucis standing alone before [him]234-odo . " [I]234-odo am ready , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . BOOK IV . THE REWARD . Where are the portraits of [those who have perished in spite of [their]6409-those who have perished in spite of their vows vows]6409-those who have perished in spite of their vows ? 4.1 . One bright March day in the year 1783 the bells of [Pianura]4-pianura began to ring at sunrise , and with [their]6410-their first peal [the townsfolk]6411-the townsfolk were abroad . [The city]2261-the city was already dressed for a festival . A canopy of crimson velvet , surmounted by the ducal crown and by the " Humilitas "[421-the valseccas] of [the Valseccas]421-the valseccas , concealed the columns of the Cathedral porch and fell in royal folds about the featureless porphyry lions who had seen [so many successive rulers]6413-so many successive rulers ascend the steps between [their]6413-so many successive rulers outstretched paws . The frieze of ramping and running animals around [the ancient baptistery]6414-the ancient baptistery was concealed by heavy green garlands alternating with religious banners ; and [every church]6415-every church and [chapel]6416-chapel had draped [its]6415-every church doorway with crimson and placed above the image of [[its]6415-every church patron saint]6417-its patron saint the ducal crown of [Pianura]4-pianura . No less sumptuous was the adornment of [the private dwellings]6418-the private dwellings . [The great families]6419-the great families -- [the Trescorri]506-the trescorri , [the Belverdi]507-the belverdi , [the Pievepelaghi]6420-the pievepelaghi -- had outdone each other in the display of golden - threaded tapestries and Genoese velvets emblazoned with armorial bearings ; and even the sombre facade of [the Boscofolto palace]6421-the boscofolto palace showed a rich drapery surmounted by the quarterings of [the new Marchioness]6422-the new marchioness . But it was not only [the palace - fronts]6423-the palace - fronts that had put on a holiday dress . The contagion had spread to [the poorer quarters]6424-the poorer quarters , and in [many [a narrow street]6426-a narrow street and [crooked lane]6427-crooked lane , where surely no part of the coming pageant might be expected to pass]6425-many a narrow street and crooked lane , where surely no part of the coming pageant might be expected to pass , the crazy balconies and unglazed windows were decked out with scraps of finery : a yard or two of velvet filched from the state hangings of [some noble house]6428-some noble house , a torn and discoloured church banner , even a cast - off sacque of brocade or [a peasant]6429-a peasant 's holiday kerchief , skilfully draped about the rusty iron and held in place by pots of clove - pink and sweet basil . [The half - ruined palace which had once housed [Gamba]282-gamba and [Momola]241-momola]6430-the half - ruined palace which had once housed gamba and momola showed a few shreds of colour on [its]6430-the half - ruined palace which had once housed gamba and momola sullen front , and [the abate Crescenti 's modest house , wedged in a corner of the city walls]6431-the abate crescenti 's modest house , wedged in a corner of the city walls , was dressed like the altar of [a Lady Chapel]6432-a lady chapel ; while even [[the tanners]6433-the tanners ' quarter by [the river]2315-the river]4790-the tanners ' quarter by the river displayed [its]4790-the tanners ' quarter by the river festoons of coloured paper and tinsel , ingeniously twisted into the semblance of a crown . For [the new Duke , who was about to enter [[his]6436-the new duke , who was about to enter his capital in state capital in state]6437-his capital in state]6436-the new duke , who was about to enter his capital in state , was extraordinarily popular with [all classes]5513-all classes . [His]6436-the new duke , who was about to enter his capital in state popularity , as yet , was mainly due to a general detestation of the rule [he]6436-the new duke , who was about to enter his capital in state had replaced ; but such a sentiment gives to [a new sovereign]6439-a new sovereign an impetus which , if [he]6439-a new sovereign knows how to use it , will carry [him]6439-a new sovereign a long way toward success ; and among those in [the Duke]682-the duke 's confidence it was rumoured that [he]6436-the new duke , who was about to enter his capital in state was qualified not only to profit by the expectations [he]6436-the new duke , who was about to enter his capital in state had raised but to fulfil them . The last months of [the late Duke]4180-the late duke 's life had plunged [the duchy]1310-the duchy into such political and financial disorder that [all parties]6443-all parties were agreed in welcoming a change . Even [those that had most to lose]6444-those that had most to lose by the accession of [the new sovereign]6445-the new sovereign , or most to fear from the policy [he]6436-the new duke , who was about to enter his capital in state was known to favour , preferred the possibility of new evils to a continuance of present conditions . [The expertest angler in [troubled waters]6447-troubled waters]6446-the expertest angler in troubled waters may find waters too troubled for [his]6446-the expertest angler in troubled waters sport ; and under a government where power is passed from hand to hand like the handkerchief in [a children]6448-a children 's game , [the most adroit time - server]6449-the most adroit time - server may find [himself]6449-the most adroit time - server grasping the empty air . It would indeed have been difficult to say who had ruled during the year preceding [the Duke]682-the duke 's death . [Prime ministers]6451-prime ministers had succeeded each other like [the clowns]6452-the clowns in a harlequinade . Just as [the Church]1212-the church seemed to have gained the upper hand some mysterious revulsion of feeling would fling [the Duke]682-the duke toward [Trescorre]254-trescorre and [the liberals]9304-the liberals ; and when these had attempted , by some trifling concession to popular feeling , to restore the credit of [the government]2558-the government , [[their]2558-the government sovereign]6457-their sovereign , seized by religious scruples , would hastily recall [the clerical party]6458-the clerical party . So [the administration]6459-the administration staggered on , reeling from one policy to another , clutching now at this support and now at that , while [Austria]100-austria and [the Holy See]2918-the holy see hung on its steps , awaiting the inevitable fall . A cruel winter and a fresh outbreak of the silkworm disease had aggravated the misery of [the people]1003-the people , while the mounting extravagance of [the Duchess]899-the duchess had put a last strain on the exhausted treasury . The consequent increase of the salt - tax roused such popular fury that [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio , who was responsible for the measure , was dismissed by [the panic - stricken Duke]6463-the panic - stricken duke , and [Trescorre]254-trescorre , as usual , called in to repair [[his]254-trescorre rival]6464-his rival 's mistake . But it would have taken [a greater statesman]6465-a greater statesman than [Trescorre]254-trescorre to reach the root of such evils ; and [the new minister]6466-the new minister succeeded neither in pacifying [the people]1003-the people nor in reassuring [[his]6466-the new minister sovereign]928-his sovereign . Meanwhile [the Duke]682-the duke was sinking under the mysterious disease which had hung upon [him]682-the duke since [his]682-the duke birth . It was hinted that [his]682-the duke last hours were darkened by hallucinations , and [the pious]8331-the pious pictured [him]682-the duke as haunted by profligate visions , while [the free - thinkers]6471-the free - thinkers maintained that [he]682-the duke was [the dupe of priestly jugglery]6472-the dupe of priestly jugglery . Toward the end there was the inevitable rumour of acqua tofana , and [the populace]2736-the populace cried out that [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits were at work again . It seems more probable , however , that [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness , who had assisted at the annual festival of [the Madonna del Monte]418-the madonna del monte , and had mingled on foot with the swarm of [devotees thronging thither]6476-devotees thronging thither from all parts , had contracted a pestilent disorder from [one of [the pilgrims]1588-the pilgrims]6477-one of the pilgrims . Certain it is that death came in a dreadful form . [The Duchess]899-the duchess , alarmed for the health of [Prince Ferrante]414-prince ferrante , fled with [him]414-prince ferrante to [the dower - house]6480-the dower - house by [the Piana]94-the piana ; and the strange nature of [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness 's distemper caused [many]3899-many to follow [her]899-the duchess example . Even [[the Duke]682-the duke 's servants]3453-the duke 's servants , and the quacks that lived on [his]682-the duke bounty , were said to have abandoned the death - chamber ; and [an English traveller]6485-an english traveller passing through [Pianura]4-pianura boasted that , by the payment of a small fee to [[the palace]768-the palace porter]6487-the palace porter , [he]6485-an english traveller had obtained leave to enter [[[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness 's closet]3733-his highness 's closet and peer through the doorway at [the dying man]6490-the dying man . However this may be , it would appear that [[the Duke]682-the duke 's confessor]3205-the duke 's confessor -- [a monk of the Barnabite order]6493-a monk of the barnabite order -- was not to be found when [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness called for [him]3205-the duke 's confessor ; and [the servant sent forth in haste to fetch [a priest]592-a priest returned , strangely enough , with the abate Crescenti , whose suspected orthodoxy had so long made [him]3205-the duke 's confessor the object of [the Duke]682-the duke 's detestation]6495-the servant sent forth in haste to fetch a priest returned , strangely enough , with the abate crescenti , whose suspected orthodoxy had so long made him the object of the duke 's detestation . [He]3205-the duke 's confessor it was [who alone witnessed the end of that tormented life , and knew upon what hopes or fears it]6498-who alone witnessed the end of that tormented life , and knew upon what hopes or fears it closed . Meanwhile it appeared that [the Duchess]899-the duchess 's precautions were not unfounded ; for [Prince Ferrante]414-prince ferrante presently sickened of the same malady which had cut off [[his]414-prince ferrante father]667-his father , and when [the Regent]9907-the regent , travelling post - haste , arrived in [Pianura]4-pianura , [he]9907-the regent had barely time to pass from [the Duke]682-the duke 's obsequies to the death - bed of [the heir]2781-the heir . Etiquette required that a year of mourning should elapse between the accession of [the new sovereign]6445-the new sovereign and [his]6445-the new sovereign state entry into [[his]6445-the new sovereign capital]6505-his capital ; so that if [Duke Odo]234-odo 's character and intentions were still matter of conjecture to [[his]234-odo subjects]8419-his subjects , [his]234-odo appearance was already familiar to [them]8419-his subjects .
