[He]234-odo dreaded the inevitable break with [the clergy]1929-the clergy , not so much because of the consequent danger to [his]234-odo own authority , as because [he]234-odo was increasingly conscious of the newness and clumsiness of the instrument with which [he]234-odo proposed to replace [their]1929-the clergy tried and complex system . [He]234-odo mentioned to [Fulvia]362-fulvia the rumours of popular disaffection ; but [she]362-fulvia swept them aside with a smile . " [The people]1003-the people mistrust [you]234-odo , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said . " And what does that mean ? That [you]234-odo have given [[your]234-odo enemies]9352-your enemies time to work on [their]9352-your enemies credulity . The longer [you]234-odo delay the more opposition [you]234-odo will encounter . [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio would rather destroy [the state]2921-the state than let it be saved by any hand but [his]406-father ignazio . "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo reflected . " Of all [[my]234-odo enemies]9282-my enemies , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " [Father Ignazio]406-father ignazio is the one [I]234-odo most respect , because [he]406-father ignazio is the most sincere . "[234-odo] " [He]406-father ignazio is the most dangerous , then , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia returned . " [A fanatic]10007-a fanatic is always more powerful than [a knave]10008-a knave . "[362-fulvia] [He]234-odo was struck with [her]362-fulvia undiminished faith in the sufficiency of such generalisations . Did [she]362-fulvia really think that to solve such a problem it was only necessary to define it ? The contact with [her]362-fulvia unfaltering assurance would once have given [him]234-odo a momentary glow ; but now it left [him]234-odo cold . [She]362-fulvia was speaking more urgently . " Surely , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia said , " the noblest use [a man]8112-a man can make of [his]8112-a man own freedom is to set [others]1388-others free . [[My]362-fulvia father]8146-my father said it was the only justification of kingship . "[362-fulvia] [He]234-odo glanced at [her]362-fulvia half - sadly . " Do [you]362-fulvia still fancy that [kings]8962-kings are free ? [I]234-odo am bound hand and foot . "[234-odo] " So was [[my]362-fulvia father]8146-my father , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia flashed back at [him]234-odo ; " but [he]8146-my father had the Promethean spirit . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia coloured at [her]362-fulvia own quickness , but [Odo]234-odo took the thrust tranquilly . " Yes , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " [[your]362-fulvia father]8631-your father had the Promethean spirit : [I]234-odo have not . The flesh that is daily torn from [me]234-odo does not grow again . "[234-odo] " [Your]234-odo courage is as great as [his]8146-my father , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia exclaimed , [her]362-fulvia tenderness in arms . " No , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo answered , " for [his]8146-my father was hopeful . "[234-odo] There was a pause , and then [he]234-odo began to speak of the day 's work . All the afternoon [he]234-odo had been in consultation with [Crescenti]234-odo , whose vast historical knowledge was of service in determining many disputed points in the tenure of land . [The librarian]4053-the librarian was in sympathy with any measures tending to relieve the condition of [the peasantry]8358-the peasantry ; yet [he]4053-the librarian was almost as strongly opposed as [Trescorre]254-trescorre to any reproduction of the [Tuscan]76-tuscan constitution . " [He]234-odo is afraid ! "[362-fulvia] broke from [Fulvia]362-fulvia . [She]362-fulvia admired and respected [Crescenti]234-odo , yet [she]362-fulvia had never fully trusted [him]234-odo . The taint of ecclesiasticism was on [him]234-odo . [Odo]234-odo smiled . " [He]234-odo has never been afraid of facing the charge of Jansenism , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo replied . " All [his]234-odo life [he]234-odo has stood in open opposition to [the Church party]8954-the church party . "[234-odo] " It is one thing to criticise [their]8954-the church party dogmas , another to attack [their]8954-the church party privileges . At such a time [he]234-odo is bound to remember that [he]234-odo is [a priest]592-a priest -- that [he]234-odo is one of [them]8954-the church party . "[234-odo] " Yet , as [you]234-odo have often pointed out , it is to [the clergy]1929-the clergy that [France]22-france in great measure owes [her]22-france release from feudalism . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia smiled coldly . " [France]22-france would have won [her]22-france cause without [the clergy]1929-the clergy ! "[362-fulvia] " This is not [France]22-france , then , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said with a sigh . After a moment [he]234-odo began again : " Can [you]234-odo not see that any reform which aims at reducing the power of [the clergy]1929-the clergy must be more easily and successfully carried out if [they]8954-the church party can be induced to take part in it ? That , in short , [we]10020-we need [them]8954-the church party at this moment as [we]10020-we have never needed [them]8954-the church party before ? The example of [France]22-france ought at least to show [you]234-odo that . "[234-odo] " The example of [France]22-france shows [me]234-odo that , to gain a point in such a struggle , any means must be used ! In [France]22-france , as [you]234-odo say , [the clergy]1929-the clergy were with [the people]1003-the people -- here [they]1929-the clergy are against [them]1929-the clergy . Where persuasion fails coercion must be used ! "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo smiled faintly . " [You]234-odo might have borrowed that from [[their]1003-the people own armoury]10023-their own armoury , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . [She]7467-she coloured at the sarcasm . " Why not ? "[7467-she] [she]7467-she retorted . " Let [them]1003-the people have a taste of [their]1003-the people own methods ! [They]1003-the people know the kind of pressure that makes [men]8356-men yield -- when [they]1003-the people feel it [they]1003-the people will know what to do . "[7467-she] [He]234-odo looked at [her]7467-she with astonishment . " This is [Gamba]282-gamba 's tone , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " [I]234-odo have never heard [you]7467-she speak in this way before . "[234-odo] [She]7467-she coloured again ; and now with a profound emotion . " Yes , "[7467-she] [she]7467-she said , " it is [Gamba]282-gamba 's tone . [He]282-gamba and [I]7468-her speak for the same cause and with the same voice . [We]10025-we are of [the people]1003-the people and [we]10025-we speak for [the people]1003-the people . Who are [[your]234-odo other counsellors]10028-your other counsellors ? [Priests]3779-priests and [noblemen]1962-noblemen ! It is natural enough that [they]10028-your other counsellors should wish to make [their]10028-your other counsellors side of the question heard . Listen to [them]10028-your other counsellors , if [you]234-odo will -- conciliate [them]10028-your other counsellors , if [you]234-odo can ! [We]10025-we need [all the allies [we]10025-we can win]10031-all the allies we can win . Only do not fancy [they]10028-your other counsellors are really speaking for [the people]1003-the people . Do not think it is [the people]1003-the people 's voice [you]234-odo hear . [The people]1003-the people do not ask [you]234-odo to weigh this claim against that , to look too curiously into the defects and merits of every clause in [their]1003-the people charter . All [they]1003-the people ask is that the charter should be given [them]1003-the people ! "[7468-her] [She]7468-her spoke with the low - voiced passion that possessed [her]7468-her at such moments . All acrimony had vanished from [her]7468-her tone . The expression of a great conviction had swept aside every personal animosity , and cleared the sources of [her]7468-her deepest feeling . [Odo]234-odo felt the pressure of [her]7468-her emotion . [He]234-odo leaned to [her]7468-her and [their]7469-their hands met . " It shall be given [them]1003-the people , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . [She]7468-her lifted [her]7468-her face to [his]234-odo . It shone with a great light . Once before [he]234-odo had seen it so illumined , but with how different a brightness ! The remembrance stirred in [him]234-odo some old habit of the senses . [He]234-odo bent over and kissed [her]7468-her . 4.7 . Never before had [Odo]234-odo so keenly felt the difference between theoretical visions of liberty and their practical application . [His]234-odo deepest heart - searchings showed [him]234-odo as sincerely devoted as ever to the cause which had enlisted [his]234-odo youth . [He]234-odo still longed above all things to serve [[his]234-odo fellows]4492-his fellows ; but the conditions of such service were not what [he]234-odo had dreamed . How different a calling it had been in [Saint Francis]239-saint francis 's day , when hearts inflamed with the new sense of brotherhood had but to set forth on [their]7471-their simple mission of almsgiving and admonition ! To love [[one]8494-one 's neighbour]7473-one 's neighbour had become a much more complex business , one that taxed the intelligence as much as the heart , and in the course of which feeling must be held in firm subjection to reason . [He]234-odo was discouraged by [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's inability to understand the change . [Hers]362-fulvia was the missionary spirit ; and [he]234-odo could not but reflect how much happier [she]362-fulvia would have been as [a nun in a charitable order]7474-a nun in a charitable order , a unit in some organised system of beneficence . [He]234-odo too would have been happier to serve than to command ! But it is not given to [the lovers of [the Lady Poverty]438-the lady poverty]7475-the lovers of the lady poverty to choose [their]7475-the lovers of the lady poverty special rank in [[her]362-fulvia household]1162-her household . [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso 's words came back to [him]234-odo with deepening significance , and [he]234-odo thought how truly [the old chaplain]7477-the old chaplain 's prayer had been fulfilled . Honour and power had come to [him]234-odo , and [they]7478-they had abased [him]234-odo to the dust . [The " Humilitas "[7479-the " humilitas " of his fathers] of [[his]234-odo fathers]3992-his fathers]7479-the " humilitas " of his fathers , woven , carved and painted on every side , pursued [him]234-odo with an ironical reminder of [his]234-odo impotence . [Fulvia]362-fulvia had not been mistaken in attributing [his]234-odo depression of spirit to [de Crucis]462-de crucis 's visit . It was the first time that [de Crucis]462-de crucis had returned to [Pianura]4-pianura since [the new Duke]6510-the new duke 's accession . [Odo]234-odo had welcomed [him]234-odo eagerly , had again pressed [him]234-odo to remain ; but [de Crucis]462-de crucis was on [his]462-de crucis way to [Germany]131-germany , bound on some business which could not be deferred . [Odo]234-odo , aware of the renewed activity of [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits , supposed that this business was connected with the flight of [the French refugees]7483-the french refugees , [many of whom were gone to [Coblentz]219-coblentz]7484-many of whom were gone to coblentz ; but on this point the abate was silent . Of the state of affairs in [France]22-france [he]234-odo spoke openly and despondently . The immoderate haste with which the reforms had been granted filled [him]234-odo with fears for the future . [Odo]234-odo knew that [Crescenti]234-odo shared these fears , and the judgment of [these two men]7485-these two men , with whom [he]234-odo differed on fundamental principles , weighed with [him]234-odo far more than the opinions of [the party [he]234-odo was supposed to represent]7486-the party he was supposed to represent . But [he]234-odo was in the case of [many greater sovereigns of [his]234-odo day]7487-many greater sovereigns of his day . [He]234-odo had set free the waters of reform , and the frail bark of [his]234-odo authority had been torn from its moorings and swept headlong into the central current . The next morning , to [his]234-odo surprise , [the Duchess]899-the duchess sent [one of [[her]899-the duchess gentlemen]4457-her gentlemen]4601-one of her gentlemen to ask an audience . [Odo]234-odo at once replied that [he]234-odo would wait on [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness ; and a few moments later [he]234-odo was ushered into [[[his]234-odo wife]1713-his wife 's closet]7493-his wife 's closet . [She]1713-his wife had just left [her]1713-his wife toilet , and was still in the morning negligee worn during that prolonged and public ceremonial . Freshly perfumed and powdered , [her]1713-his wife eyes bright , [her]1713-his wife lips set in a nervous smile , [she]1713-his wife curiously recalled [the arrogant child who had snatched [her]1713-his wife spaniel away from [him]234-odo years ago in [that same room]7495-that same room]7494-the arrogant child who had snatched her spaniel away from him years ago in that same room . And was [she]1713-his wife not [that child]7496-that child , after all ? Had [she]1713-his wife ever grown beyond the imperious instincts of [her]1713-his wife youth ? It seemed to [him]234-odo now that [he]234-odo had judged [her]1713-his wife harshly in the first months of [their]7497-their marriage . [He]234-odo had felt a momentary impatience when [he]234-odo had tried to force [her]1713-his wife roving impulses into the line of [his]234-odo own endeavour : it was easier to view [her]1713-his wife leniently now that [she]1713-his wife had almost passed out of [his]234-odo life . [He]234-odo wondered why [she]1713-his wife had sent for [him]234-odo . Some dispute with [[her]1713-his wife household]1162-her household , doubtless ; a quarrel with [a servant]4735-a servant , even -- or perhaps some sordid difficulty with [[her]1713-his wife creditors]1943-her creditors . But [she]1713-his wife began in a new key . " [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness , "[1713-his wife] [she]1713-his wife said , " is not given to taking [my]1713-his wife advice . "[1713-his wife] [Odo]234-odo looked at [her]1713-his wife in surprise . " The opportunity is not often accorded [me]234-odo , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo replied with a smile . [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina made an impatient gesture ; then [her]413-maria clementina face softened . Contradictory emotions flitted over it like the reflections cast by a hurrying sky . [She]413-maria clementina came close to [him]234-odo and then drew away and seated [herself]413-maria clementina in the high - backed chair where [she]413-maria clementina had throned when [he]234-odo first saw [her]413-maria clementina . Suddenly [she]413-maria clementina blushed and began to speak . " Once , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina said in a low , almost inaudible voice , " [I]413-maria clementina was able to give [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness warning of an impending danger-- "[413-maria clementina] [She]413-maria clementina paused and [her]413-maria clementina eyes rested full on [Odo]234-odo . [He]234-odo felt [his]234-odo colour rise as [he]234-odo returned [her]413-maria clementina gaze . It was [her]413-maria clementina first allusion to the past . [He]234-odo had supposed [she]413-maria clementina had forgotten . For a moment [he]234-odo remained awkwardly silent . " Do [you]234-odo remember ? "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina asked . " [I]413-maria clementina remember . "[413-maria clementina] " The danger was a grave one . [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness may recall that but for [my]413-maria clementina warning [you]234-odo would not have been advised of it . "[413-maria clementina] " [I]234-odo remember , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said again . [She]413-maria clementina paused a moment . " The danger , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina repeated , " was a grave one ; but it threatened only [[[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness 's person]10039-your highness 's person . [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness listened to [me]413-maria clementina then ; will [you]234-odo listen again if [I]413-maria clementina advise [you]234-odo of a greater -- a peril threatening not only [[your]234-odo person]10041-your person but [your]234-odo throne ? "[413-maria clementina] [Odo]234-odo smiled . [He]234-odo could guess now what was coming . [She]413-maria clementina had been drilled to act as [the mouthpiece of [the opposition]4285-the opposition]7501-the mouthpiece of the opposition . [He]234-odo composed [his]234-odo features and said quietly : " These are grave words , [madam]8129-madam . [I]234-odo know of no such peril -- but [I]234-odo am always ready to listen to [[your]8129-madam Highness]8397-your highness . "[234-odo] [His]234-odo smile had betrayed [him]234-odo , and a quick flame of anger passed over [her]413-maria clementina face . " Why should [you]413-maria clementina listen to [me]234-odo , since [you]413-maria clementina never heed what [I]234-odo say ? "[234-odo] " [[Your]8129-madam Highness]8397-your highness has just reminded [me]413-maria clementina that [I]413-maria clementina did so once-- "[413-maria clementina] " Once ! "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina repeated bitterly . " [You]8129-madam were younger then -- and so was [I]413-maria clementina ! "[413-maria clementina] [She]413-maria clementina glanced at [herself]413-maria clementina in the mirror with a dissatisfied laugh . Something in [her]413-maria clementina look and movement touched the springs of compassion . " Try [me]234-odo again , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said gently . " If [I]234-odo am older , perhaps [I]234-odo am also wiser , and therefore even more willing to be guided -- [we]10045-we all knew that . "[234-odo] [She]413-maria clementina broke off , as though [she]413-maria clementina felt [her]413-maria clementina mistake and wished to make a fresh beginning . Again [her]413-maria clementina face was full of fluctuating meaning ; and [he]234-odo saw , beneath its shallow surface , the eddy of incoherent impulses . When [she]413-maria clementina spoke , it was with a noble gravity . " [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina said , " does not take [me]413-maria clementina into [your]234-odo counsels ; but it is no secret at court and in [the town]593-the town that [you]234-odo have in contemplation a grave political measure . "[413-maria clementina] " [I]234-odo have made no secret of it , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo replied . " No -- or [I]413-maria clementina should be the last to know it ! "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina exclaimed , with one of [her]413-maria clementina sudden lapses into petulance . [Odo]234-odo made no reply . [Her]413-maria clementina futility was beginning to weary [him]234-odo . [She]413-maria clementina saw it and again attempted an impersonal dignity of manner . " It has been [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness 's choice , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina said , " to exclude [me]413-maria clementina from public affairs . Perhaps [I]413-maria clementina was not fitted by education or intelligence to share in the cares of government . [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness will at least bear witness that [I]413-maria clementina have scrupulously respected [your]234-odo decision , and have never attempted to intrude upon [your]234-odo counsels . "[413-maria clementina] [Odo]234-odo bowed . It would have been useless to remind [her]413-maria clementina that [he]234-odo had sought [her]413-maria clementina help and failed to obtain it . " [I]413-maria clementina have accepted [my]413-maria clementina position , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina continued . " [I]413-maria clementina have led the life to which it has pleased [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness to restrict [me]413-maria clementina . But [I]413-maria clementina have not been able to detach [my]413-maria clementina heart as well as [my]413-maria clementina thoughts from [your]234-odo Highness 's interests . [I]413-maria clementina have not learned to be indifferent to [your]234-odo danger . "[413-maria clementina] [Odo]234-odo looked up quickly . " [You]413-maria clementina spoke of danger before , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " What danger ? "[234-odo] " That of forcing on [[your]234-odo subjects]10051-your subjects liberties which [they]10051-your subjects do not desire ! "[413-maria clementina] " Ah , "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo thoughtfully . That was all , then . What a poor tool [she]413-maria clementina made ! [He]234-odo marvelled that , in all these years , [Trescorre]254-trescorre 's skilful hands should not have fashioned [her]413-maria clementina to better purpose . " [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " has reminded [me]234-odo that since [our]10053-our marriage [you]8397-your highness had lived withdrawn from public affairs . [I]234-odo will not pause to dispute by whose choice this has been ; [I]234-odo will in turn merely remind [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness that such a life does not afford much opportunity of gauging public opinion . "[234-odo] In spite of [himself]234-odo a note of sarcasm had again crept into [his]234-odo voice ; but to [his]234-odo surprise [she]413-maria clementina did not seem to resent it . " Ah , "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina exclaimed , with more feeling than [she]413-maria clementina had hitherto shown , " [you]234-odo fancy that , because [I]413-maria clementina am kept in ignorance of what [you]234-odo think , [I]413-maria clementina am ignorant also of what [others]1388-others think of [you]234-odo ! "[413-maria clementina] " What [others]1388-others ? "[413-maria clementina] The question did not disconcert [her]413-maria clementina . "[413-maria clementina] " All are of one class in resenting this charter . [I]7503-she am told [you]234-odo intend to proclaim it within a few days . [I]7503-she entreat [you]234-odo at least to delay , to reconsider [your]234-odo course . Oh , believe [me]7503-she when [I]7503-she say [you]234-odo are in danger ! Of what use to offer a crown to [[our]10061-our Lady]9112-our lady , when [you]234-odo have it in [your]234-odo heart to slight [[her]9112-our lady servants]1612-her servants ? But [I]7503-she will not speak of [the clergy]1929-the clergy , since [you]234-odo despise [them]1929-the clergy -- nor of [the nobles]2190-the nobles , since [you]234-odo ignore [their]2190-the nobles claims . [I]7503-she will speak only of [the people]1003-the people -- [the people]1003-the people , in whose interest [you]234-odo profess to act . Believe [me]7503-she , in striking at [the Church]1212-the church [you]234-odo wound [the poor]8713-the poor . It is not [their]8713-the poor bodily welfare [I]7503-she mean -- though Heaven knows how many sources of bounty must now run dry ! It is [their]8713-the poor faith [you]234-odo insult . [They]8713-the poor may acclaim [you]234-odo for it now -- but [I]7503-she tell [you]234-odo [they]8713-the poor will hate [you]234-odo for it in the end ! "[7503-she] [She]7503-she paused , flushed with the vehemence of [her]7503-she argument , and eager to press it farther . But [her]7503-she last words had touched an unexpected fibre in [Odo]234-odo . [He]234-odo looked at [her]7503-she with [his]234-odo unseeing visionary gaze . " The end ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo murmured . " Who knows what the end will be ? "[234-odo] " Do [you]234-odo still need to be told ? "[7503-she] [she]7503-she exclaimed . [The state]2921-the state exists for [the people]1003-the people ; if [they]1003-the people do not need it , it has ceased to serve its purpose . "[7503-she] [She]7503-she clasped [her]7503-she hands in an ecstasy of wonder . " Oh , [fool]10075-fool , [madman]9375-madman -- but it is not of [the state]2921-the state [I]7503-she speak ! It is [you]234-odo who are in danger -- [you]234-odo -- [you]234-odo -- you-- "[7503-she] [He]234-odo raised [his]234-odo head with an impatient gesture . " [I]234-odo ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " [I]234-odo had thought [you]7503-she meant a graver peril . "[234-odo] [She]7503-she looked at [him]234-odo in silence . [Her]7503-she pride met [his]234-odo and thrilled with it ; and for a moment [the two]812-the two were one . " [Odo]234-odo ! "[7503-she] [she]7503-she cried . " [I]7503-she am not ashamed of them , "[7503-she] [she]7503-she said . [Her]7503-she hand clung to [him]234-odo and [she]7503-she lifted [her]7503-she eyes to [his]234-odo face . " [You]234-odo will listen to [me]7503-she ? "[7503-she] [she]7503-she whispered in a glow . [He]234-odo drew back chilled . " And [I]234-odo thank [you]7503-she . "[234-odo] " But [you]234-odo will not be counselled ? "[7503-she] " In the last issue one must be [[one]8494-one 's own counsellor]10079-one 's own counsellor . "[7503-she] [Her]7503-she face flamed . " If [you]234-odo were but that ! "[7503-she] [she]7503-she tossed back at [him]234-odo . The taunt struck [him]234-odo full . [He]234-odo knew that [he]234-odo should have let it lie ; but [he]234-odo caught it up in spite of [himself]234-odo . " [Madam]8129-madam ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " [I]7503-she should have appealed to [[our]10081-our sovereign]10082-our sovereign , not to [[her]10082-our sovereign servant]10083-her servant ! "[7503-she] [she]7503-she cried , dashing into the breach [she]7503-she had made . [He]234-odo stood motionless , stunned almost . For what [she]7503-she had said was true . [He]234-odo was no longer [the sovereign]1435-the sovereign : the rule had passed out of [his]234-odo hands . [His]234-odo silence frightened [her]7503-she . With an instinctive jealousy [she]7503-she saw that [her]7503-she words had started a train of thought in which [she]7503-she had no part . [She]7503-she felt [herself]7503-she ignored , abandoned ; and all [her]7503-she passions rushed to the defence of [her]7503-she wounded vanity . " Oh , believe [me]7503-she , "[7503-she] [she]7503-she cried , " [I]7503-she speak as [[your]234-odo Duchess]10084-your duchess , not as [[your]234-odo wife]10085-your wife . That is a name in which [I]7503-she should never dream of appealing to [you]234-odo . [I]7503-she have ever stood apart from [your]234-odo private pleasures , as became [a woman of [[my]7503-she house]8535-my house]10086-a woman of my house . "[7503-she] [She]7503-she faced [him]7507-him with a flash of the Austrian insolence . " But when [I]7503-she see [the state]2921-the state drifting to ruin as the result of [your]234-odo caprice , when [I]7503-she see [your]234-odo own life endangered , [[your]234-odo people]9879-your people turned against [you]234-odo , religion openly insulted , law and authority made the plaything of this -- [this -- false atheistical creature]10090-this -- false atheistical creature , that has robbed [me]7503-she -- robbed [me]7503-she of all-- "[7503-she] [She]7503-she broke off helplessly and hid [her]7503-she face with a sob . [Odo]234-odo stood speechless , spell - bound . [He]234-odo could not mistake what had happened . [The woman]8976-the woman had surged to the surface at last -- [the real woman]7509-the real woman , passionate , self - centred , undisciplined , but so piteous , after all , in this sudden subjection to the one tenderness that survived in [her]8976-the woman . [She]7503-she loved [him]7507-him and was jealous of [[her]7503-she rival]4303-her rival . That was the instinct which had swept all others aside . At that moment [she]7503-she cared nothing for [her]7503-she safety or [his]7507-him . The state might perish if [they]7511-they but fell together . It was the distance between [them]7511-they that maddened [her]7503-she . The tragic simplicity of the revelation left [Odo]234-odo silent . For a fantastic moment [he]234-odo yielded to the vision of what that waste power might have accomplished . Life seemed to [him]234-odo a confusion of roving force that met only to crash in ruins . [His]234-odo silence drew [her]7503-she to [her]7503-she feet . [She]7503-she repossessed [herself]7503-she , throbbing but valiant . " [My]7503-she fears for [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness 's safety have led [my]7503-she speech astray . [I]7503-she have given [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness the warning it was [my]7503-she duty to give . Beyond that [I]7503-she had no thought of trespassing . "[7503-she] And still [Odo]234-odo was silent . A dozen answers struggled to [his]234-odo lips ; but they were checked by the stealing sense of duality that so often paralysed [his]234-odo action . [He]234-odo had recovered [his]234-odo lucidity of vision , and [his]234-odo impulses faded before it like mist . [He]234-odo saw life again as it was , an incomplete and shabby business , a patchwork of torn and ravelled effort . Everywhere the shears of [Atropos]220-atropos were busy , and never could the cut threads be joined again . [He]234-odo took [[his]234-odo wife]1713-his wife 's hand and bent over it ceremoniously . It lay in [his]234-odo like a stone . 4.8 . The jubilee of [the Mountain Madonna]434-the mountain madonna fell on the feast of [the Purification]534-the purification . It was mid - November , but with a sky of June . The autumn rains had ceased for the moment , and [fields]721-fields and orchards glistened with a late verdure . Never had [the faithful]8704-the faithful gathered in such numbers to do honour to [the wonder - working Virgin]7515-the wonder - working virgin . A widespread resistance to the influences of free thought and [Jansenism]535-jansenism was pouring fresh life into the old formulas of devotion . Though many motives combined to strengthen this movement , it was still mainly a simple expression of loyalty to old ideals , an instinctive rallying around a threatened cause . It is the honest conviction underlying all great popular impulses that gives [them]7516-them [their]7516-them real strength ; and in this case [the thousands of [pilgrims]6751-pilgrims flocking on foot to [the mountain shrine]7519-the mountain shrine]7517-the thousands of pilgrims flocking on foot to the mountain shrine embodied a greater moral force than [the powerful ecclesiastics at whose call [they]7517-the thousands of pilgrims flocking on foot to the mountain shrine had gathered]7520-the powerful ecclesiastics at whose call they had gathered . [The clergy]1929-the clergy [themselves]1929-the clergy were come from all sides ; while [those that were unable to attend]7522-those that were unable to attend had sent costly gifts to [the miraculous Virgin]1585-the miraculous virgin . [The Bishops of [Mantua]3-mantua , [Modena]90-modena , [Vercelli]13-vercelli and [Cremona]222-cremona]472-vercelli had travelled to [Pianura]4-pianura in state , [the people]1003-the people flocking out beyond the gates to welcome [them]1929-the clergy . [Four mitred Abbots]7525-four mitred abbots , [several Monsignori]7526-several monsignori , and [Priors]7527-priors , [Rectors]7528-rectors , [Vicars - general]7529-vicars - general and [canons innumerable]7530-canons innumerable rode in the procession , followed on foot by [the humble army of [parish priests]7532-parish priests]7531-the humble army of parish priests and by [interminable confraternities of all orders]7533-interminable confraternities of all orders . The approach of [the great dignitaries]7534-the great dignitaries was hailed with enthusiasm by [the crowds lining [the roads]2942-the roads]7535-the crowds lining the roads . Even [the Bishop of [Pianura]4-pianura , never popular with [the people]1003-the people]536-pianura , received an unwonted measure of applause , and [the white - cowled Prior of [the Dominicans]7539-the dominicans , riding by stern and close - lipped as [a monk of Zurbaran]7540-a monk of zurbaran 's]7538-the white - cowled prior of the dominicans , riding by stern and close - lipped as a monk of zurbaran 's , was greeted with frenzied acclamations . The report that [the Bishop]1234-the bishop and [the heads of [the religious houses in [Pianura]4-pianura]7543-the religious houses in pianura]7542-the heads of the religious houses in pianura were to set free suppers for [the pilgrims]1588-the pilgrims had doubtless quickened this outburst of piety ; yet it was perhaps chiefly due to the sense of coming peril that had gradually permeated the dim consciousness of [the crowd]1568-the crowd . In [the church]1212-the church , the glow of lights , the thrilling beauty of the music and the glitter of the priestly vestments were blent in a melting harmony of sound and colour . The shrine of [the Madonna]6665-the madonna shone with unearthly radiance . Hundreds of candles formed an elongated nimbus about [her]6665-the madonna hieratic figure , which was surmounted by the canopy of cloth - of - gold presented by [the Duke of [Modena]90-modena]7548-the duke of modena . [The Bishops of [Vercelli]13-vercelli and [Cremona]222-cremona]7549-the bishops of vercelli and cremona had offered a robe of silver brocade studded with coral and turquoises , [the devout Princess Clotilda of [Savoy]16-savoy]537-the devout princess clotilda of savoy an emerald necklace , [the Bishop of [Pianura]4-pianura]8318-the bishop of pianura a marvellous veil of rose - point made in [a Flemish convent]7551-a flemish convent ; while on the statue 's brow rested [the Duke]682-the duke 's jewelled diadem . [The Duke]682-the duke [himself]682-the duke , seated in [his]682-the duke tribune above [the choir]1637-the choir , observed the scene with a renewed appreciation of the Church 's unfailing dramatic instinct . At first [he]682-the duke saw in the spectacle only this outer and symbolic side , of which the mere sensuous beauty had always deeply moved [him]682-the duke ; but as [he]682-the duke watched the effect produced on the great throng filling [the aisles]7555-the aisles , [he]682-the duke began to see that this external splendour was but the veil before [the sanctuary]9552-the sanctuary , and to realise what [de Crucis]462-de crucis meant when [he]682-the duke spoke of the deep hold of the Church upon [the people]1003-the people . Every colour , every gesture , every word and note of music that made up the texture of the gorgeous ceremonial might indeed seem part of a long - studied and astutely - planned effect . Yet each had its root in some instinct of the heart , some natural development of the inner life , so that they were in fact not the cunningly - adjusted fragments of an arbitrary pattern but the inseparable fibres of [a living organism]7558-a living organism . It was [Odo]234-odo 's misfortune to see too far ahead on [the road along which [his]234-odo destiny was urging [him]234-odo]7559-the road along which his destiny was urging him . As [he]682-the duke sat there , face to face with [the people [he]682-the duke was trying to lead]7560-the people he was trying to lead , [he]682-the duke heard above the music of the mass and the chant of [the kneeling throng]7561-the kneeling throng an echo of the question that [Don Gervaso]261-don gervaso had once put to him:--"If [you]682-the duke take [Christ]264-christ from [the people]1003-the people , what have [you]682-the duke to give [them]1003-the people instead ? "[7561-the kneeling throng] [He]682-the duke was roused by a burst of silver clarions . The mass was over , and [the Duke]682-the duke and [Duchess]419-duchess were to descend from [[their]7563-their tribune]7564-their tribune and venerate the holy image before it was carried through [the church]1212-the church . [Odo]234-odo rose and gave [his]234-odo hand to [[his]234-odo wife]1713-his wife . [They]7567-they had not seen [each other]3086-each other , save in public , since [their]7567-they last conversation in [[her]1713-his wife closet]7569-her closet . [The Duchess]899-the duchess walked with set lips and head erect , keeping [her]899-the duchess profile turned to [him]234-odo as [they]7567-they descended the steps and advanced to [the choir]1637-the choir . [None]1118-none knew better how to take [her]899-the duchess part in such a pageant . [She]899-the duchess had the gift of drawing upon [herself]899-the duchess the undivided attention of any assemblage in which [she]899-the duchess moved ; and the consciousness of this power lent a kind of Olympian buoyancy to [her]899-the duchess gait . The richness of [her]899-the duchess dress and [her]899-the duchess extravagant display of jewels seemed almost a challenge to the sacred image blazing like a rainbow beneath its golden canopy ; and [Odo]234-odo smiled to think that [his]234-odo childish fancy had once compared the brilliant being at [his]234-odo side to [the humble tinsel - decked Virgin of [the church at [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]7574-the church at pontesordo]7573-the humble tinsel - decked virgin of the church at pontesordo . As [the couple]3307-the couple advanced , stillness fell on [the church]1212-the church . The air was full of the lingering haze of incense , through which the sunlight from the clerestory poured in prismatic splendours on the statue of [the Virgin]3925-the virgin . Rigid , superhuman , a molten flamboyancy of gold and gems , [the wonder - working Madonna]7578-the wonder - working madonna shone out above [[her]899-the duchess worshippers]7579-her worshippers . [The Duke]682-the duke and [Duchess]419-duchess paused , bowing deeply , below [the choir]1637-the choir . Then [they]3307-the couple mounted the steps and knelt before [the shrine]7582-the shrine . As [they]3307-the couple did so a crash broke the silence , and [the startled devotees]7583-the startled devotees saw that the ducal diadem had fallen from [the Madonna]6665-the madonna 's head . The hush prolonged itself a moment ; then [a canon]7585-a canon sprang forward to pick up the crown , and with the movement a murmur rose and spread through [the church]1212-the church . [The Duke]682-the duke 's offering had fallen to the ground as [he]682-the duke approached to venerate the blessed image . That this was an omen [no man]7588-no man could doubt . It needed no augur to interpret it . The murmur , gathering force as it swept through [the packed aisles]7589-the packed aisles , passed from surprise to fear , from fear to a deep hum of anger;--for [the people]1003-the people understood , as plainly as though [she]6665-the madonna had spoken , that [the Virgin of the Valseccas]7591-the virgin of the valseccas had cast from [her]6665-the madonna the gift of [an unbeliever]7592-an unbeliever ... * * * * * The ceremonies over , the long procession was formed again and set out toward [the city]2261-the city . [The crowd]1568-the crowd had surged ahead , and when [the Duke]682-the duke rode through the gates [the streets]744-the streets were already thronged . Moving slowly between the compact mass of [people]1578-people [he]682-the duke felt [himself]682-the duke as closely observed as on the day of [his]682-the duke state entry ; but with far different effect . Enthusiasm had given way to a cold curiosity . The excitement of [the spectators]1642-the spectators had spent itself in the morning , and the sight of [[their]1642-the spectators sovereign]6457-their sovereign failed to rouse [their]1642-the spectators flagging ardour . Now and then a cheer broke out , but it died again without kindling another in the uninflammable mass . [Odo]234-odo could not tell how much of this indifference was due to a natural reaction from the emotions of the morning , how much to [his]234-odo personal unpopularity , how much to the ominous impression produced by the falling of [the Virgin]3925-the virgin 's crown . [He]234-odo rode between [[his]234-odo people]1264-his people oppressed by a sense of estrangement such as [he]234-odo had never known . [He]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo shut off from [them]1264-his people by an impassable barrier of superstition and ignorance ; and every effort to reach [them]1264-his people was like the wrong turn in a labyrinth , drawing [him]234-odo farther away from the issue to which it seemed to lead . As [he]234-odo advanced under this indifferent or hostile scrutiny , [he]234-odo thought how much easier it would be to face a rain of bullets than this withering glare of criticism . A sudden longing to escape , to be done with it all , came over [him]234-odo with sickening force . [His]234-odo nerves ached with the physical strain of holding [himself]234-odo upright on [his]234-odo horse , of preserving the statuesque erectness proper to the occasion . [He]234-odo felt like one of [his]234-odo own ancestral effigies , of which the wooden framework had rotted under the splendid robes . A congestion at [the head of [a narrow street]6426-a narrow street]7602-the head of a narrow street had checked [the procession]7604-the procession , and [he]234-odo was obliged to rein in [his]234-odo horse . [He]234-odo looked about and found [himself]234-odo in [the centre of [the square]1592-the square near [the Baptistery]7607-the baptistery]7605-the centre of the square near the baptistery . A few feet off , directly in a line with [him]234-odo , was the weather - worn front of [the Royal Printing - Press]7608-the royal printing - press . [He]234-odo raised [his]234-odo head and saw [a group of people on [the balcony]7034-the balcony]7609-a group of people on the balcony . Though [they]7609-a group of people on the balcony were close at hand , [he]234-odo saw [them]7609-a group of people on the balcony in a blur , against which [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's figure suddenly detached [itself]7611-itself . [She]362-fulvia had told [him]234-odo that [she]362-fulvia was to view the procession with [the Andreonis]538-the andreonis ; but through the mental haze which enveloped [him]234-odo [her]362-fulvia apparition struck a vague surprise . [He]234-odo looked at [her]362-fulvia intently , and [their]7612-their eyes met . A faint happiness stole over [her]362-fulvia face , but no recognition was possible , and [she]362-fulvia continued to gaze out steadily upon the throng below [the balcony]7034-the balcony . Involuntarily [his]234-odo glance followed [hers]362-fulvia , and [he]234-odo saw that [she]362-fulvia was [herself]362-fulvia the centre of [the crowd]1568-the crowd 's attention . [Her]362-fulvia plain , almost Quakerish habit , and the tranquil dignity of [[her]362-fulvia carriage]7615-her carriage , made [her]362-fulvia a conspicuous figure among [the animated groups in the adjoining windows]7616-the animated groups in the adjoining windows , and [Odo]234-odo , with the acuteness of perception which a public life develops , was instantly aware that [her]362-fulvia name was on every lip . At the same moment [he]234-odo saw [a woman close to [his]234-odo horse 's feet snatch up [[her]362-fulvia child]9171-her child]7617-a woman close to his horse 's feet snatch up her child and make the sign against the evil eye . [A boy who stood staring open - mouthed at [Fulvia]362-fulvia]7619-a boy who stood staring open - mouthed at fulvia caught the gesture and repeated it ; [a barefoot friar]1586-a barefoot friar imitated [the boy]839-the boy , and it seemed to [Odo]234-odo that the familiar sign was spreading with malignant rapidity to the furthest limits of [the crowd]1568-the crowd . The impression was only momentary ; for the cavalcade was again in motion , and without raising [his]234-odo eyes [he]234-odo rode on , sick at heart ... * * * * * At nightfall [a man]8112-a man opened the gate of [the ducal gardens]856-the ducal gardens below [the Chinese pavilion]874-the chinese pavilion and stepped out into [the deserted lane]7626-the deserted lane . [He]8112-a man locked the gate and slipped the key into [his]8112-a man pocket ; then [he]8112-a man turned and walked toward [the centre of [the town]593-the town]3488-the centre of the town . As [he]8112-a man reached [the more populous quarters]7629-the more populous quarters [his]8112-a man walk slackened to a stroll ; and now and then [he]8112-a man paused to observe a knot of [merry - makers]7031-merry - makers or look through the curtains of the tents set up in [the squares]7631-the squares . [The man]1626-the man was plainly but decently dressed , like [a petty tradesman]7633-a petty tradesman or [a lawyer 's clerk]7634-a lawyer 's clerk , and the night being chill [he]1626-the man wore a cloak , and had drawn [his]1626-the man hat - brim over [his]1626-the man forehead . [He]1626-the man sauntered on , letting [the crowd]1568-the crowd carry [him]1626-the man , with the air of [one who has an hour to kill , and whose holiday - making takes the form of an amused spectatorship]7636-one who has an hour to kill , and whose holiday - making takes the form of an amused spectatorship . To [such an observer]7637-such an observer [the streets]744-the streets offered ample entertainment . The shrewd air discouraged lounging and kept [the crowd]1568-the crowd in motion ; but [the open platforms built for dancing]7640-the open platforms built for dancing were thronged with [couples]5413-couples , and every peep - show , wine - shop and [astrologer]7642-astrologer 's booth was packed to the doors . [The shrines]7643-the shrines and street - lamps being all alight , and [booths and platforms hung with countless lanterns]7644-booths and platforms hung with countless lanterns , the scene was as bright as day ; but in the ever - shifting medley of peasant - dresses , liveries , monkish cowls and carnival disguises , [a soberly - clad man]7645-a soberly - clad man might easily go unremarked . Reaching [the square before [the Cathedral]3023-the cathedral]7646-the square before the cathedral , [the solitary observer]7648-the solitary observer pushed [his]1626-the man way through [the idlers gathered about a dais with a curtain at the back]7649-the idlers gathered about a dais with a curtain at the back . " Reform , [reform]10138-reform ! "[7667-the listener] cried one , who appeared by [his]7667-the listener dress and manner to be the weightiest of the company--"it 's all very well to cry reform ; but what [I]7667-the listener say is that most of [those that are howling for it]10139-those that are howling for it no more know what [they]10139-those that are howling for it 're asking than [a parrot that 's been taught the litany]10140-a parrot that 's been taught the litany . " [Father]1441-father and [son]10163-son , for four generations , [[my]7684-a cautious flaccid - looking man family]10164-my family have served [Pianura]536-pianura with Church candles , and [I]7684-a cautious flaccid - looking man can tell [you]10159-you that since these new atheistical notions came in , [the nobility]1665-the nobility are not [the good patrons [they]1665-the nobility used to be]10166-the good patrons they used to be . But as for [the friars]1652-the friars , [I]7684-a cautious flaccid - looking man should be sorry to see [them]1652-the friars meddled with . It 's true [they]1652-the friars may get the best morsel in the pot and the warmest seat on the hearth -- and one of [them]1652-the friars , now and then , may take too long to teach [a pretty girl]1841-a pretty girl [her]1841-a pretty girl Pater Noster -- but [I]7684-a cautious flaccid - looking man 'm not sure [we]10169-we shall be better off when [they]1652-the friars 're gone . Formerly , if [a child too many]10170-a child too many came to [poor folk]8088-poor folk [they]8088-poor folk could always comfort [themselves]8088-poor folk with the thought that , if there was no room for [him]10170-a child too many at [home]1346-home , [the Church]1212-the church was there to provide for [him]10170-a child too many . But if [we]10169-we drive out [the good friars]10174-the good friars , [a man]8112-a man will have to count [mouths]10176-mouths before [he]8112-a man dares look at [[his]8112-a man wife]1713-his wife too lovingly . "[7684-a cautious flaccid - looking man] " Well , "[7685-the scribe] said [the scribe]7685-the scribe with a dry smile , " [I]7685-the scribe 've a notion [the good friars]10174-the good friars have always taken more than [they]10174-the good friars gave ; and if it were not for the gaping mouths under the cowl even [a poor man]10179-a poor man might have victuals enough for [his]10179-a poor man own . "[7685-the scribe] [The first speaker]2520-the first speaker turned on [him]7685-the scribe contentiously . " Do [I]2520-the first speaker understand [you]7685-the scribe are for this new charter , then ? "[2520-the first speaker] [he]2520-the first speaker asked . " No , no , "[905-the other] said [the other]905-the other . " Better hot polenta than a cold ortolan . Things are none too good as they are , but [I]905-the other never care to taste first of a new dish . And in this case [I]905-the other do n't fancy [the cook]10180-the cook . "[905-the other] " Ah , that 's it , "[7688-the soft man] said [the soft man]7688-the soft man . " It 's too much like [[the apothecary]1624-the apothecary 's wife]10182-the apothecary 's wife mixing [his]1624-the apothecary drugs for [him]1624-the apothecary . "[7685-the scribe] [He]7685-the scribe puffed [himself]7685-the scribe out and thrust a hand in [his]7685-the scribe bosom . "[7690-a lean visionary - looking youth who had been drinking and listening] " H'm , "[2380-the young man] said [the young man]2380-the young man flippantly , " what became of [the Bambino meanwhile]10200-the bambino meanwhile , [I]2380-the young man wonder ? " [We]10201-we all know , "[7685-the scribe] said [he]7685-the scribe , " that [Cino]544-cino [the barber]3323-the barber lies like [a christened Jew]10203-a christened jew ; but [I]7685-the scribe 'm not surprised the thing was known in advance , for [I]7685-the scribe make no doubt [the priests]8974-the priests pulled the wires that brought down the crown . "[7685-the scribe] [The fat man]7693-the fat man looked scandalised , and [the first speaker]2520-the first speaker waved the subject aside as unworthy of attention . " Such tales are for [women]771-women and [monks]10206-monks , "[2520-the first speaker] [he]2520-the first speaker said impatiently . " But the business has its serious side . [Who]10208-who 's to pay for that ? [The class that profits by it]10209-the class that profits by it ? Not by a long way . "[905-the other] cried [the other]905-the other . " [I]905-the other 'd have [you]7693-the fat man know , [[my]905-the other young master]10217-my young master , that [I]905-the other come of [a long and honourable line of cloth - merchants]10218-a long and honourable line of cloth - merchants , that have had [their]10218-a long and honourable line of cloth - merchants names on [the Guild]10219-the guild for two hundred years and over . "[2087-the youth] [He]2087-the youth burst into tears and began to quote [Alfieri]306-alfieri . " Well , "[7693-the fat man] said [the fat man]7693-the fat man , turning a disgusted shoulder on this display of emotion , " to [my]7693-the fat man mind this business of draining [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo is too much like telling [the Almighty]546-the almighty what to do . If [God]249-god made [the land]8269-the land wet , what right have [we]10225-we to dry it ? Those that begin by meddling with [the Creator]9297-the creator 's works may end by laying hands on [the Creator]9297-the creator . "[7693-the fat man] " [You]9912-another 're right , "[9912-another] said [another]9912-another . " There 's no knowing where these new - fangled notions may land [us]10225-we . For [my]9912-another part , [I]9912-another was rather taken by [them]10228-them at first ; but since [I]9912-another find that [[his]9297-the creator Highness]941-his highness , to pay for all [his]9297-the creator good works , is cutting down [[his]9297-the creator household]1173-his household and throwing [decent people]10231-decent people out of a job -- like [[my]9912-another own son]10232-my own son , for instance , that was [one of [the under - steward]10234-the under - steward 's boys at [the palace]768-the palace]10233-one of the under - steward 's boys at the palace -- why , since then , [I]9912-another begin to see a little farther into the game . "[9912-another] [A shabby shrewd - looking fellow in a dirty coat and snuff - stained stock]7700-a shabby shrewd - looking fellow in a dirty coat and snuff - stained stock had sauntered up to the table and stood listening with an amused smile . " Ah , "[7685-the scribe] said [the scribe]7685-the scribe , glancing up , " here 's [a thoroughgoing reformer]10236-a thoroughgoing reformer , who 'll be asking [us]10237-us all to throw up [our]10237-us hats for the new charter . "[7685-the scribe] [The new - comer]7702-the new - comer laughed contemptuously . " [I]7702-the new - comer ? "[7702-the new - comer] [he]7702-the new - comer said . " God forbid ! The new charter 's none of [my]7702-the new - comer making . It 's only another dodge for getting round [the populace]2736-the populace -- for appearing to give [them]2736-the populace what [they]2736-the populace would rise up and take if it were denied [them]2736-the populace any longer . "[7702-the new - comer] " Why , [I]7693-the fat man thought [you]7693-the fat man were hot for these reforms ? "[7693-the fat man] exclaimed [the fat man]7693-the fat man with surprise . [The other]905-the other shrugged . " [You]7693-the fat man might as well say [I]905-the other was in favour of having the sun rise tomorrow . It would probably rise at the same hour if [I]905-the other voted against it . Reform is bound to come , whether [[your]7693-the fat man Dukes]10239-your dukes and [Princes]2145-princes are for it or against it ; and those that grant constitutions instead of refusing [them]2736-the populace are like [men who tie a string to [their]10241-men who tie a string to their hats before going out in a gale hats before going out in a gale]10241-men who tie a string to their hats before going out in a gale . The string may hold for a while -- but if it blows hard enough the hats will all come off in the end . "[905-the other] " Ay , ay ; and meanwhile [we]10242-we furnish the string from [our]10242-we own pockets , "[7685-the scribe] said [the scribe]7685-the scribe with a chuckle . [The shabby man]7706-the shabby man grinned . " It wo n't be the last thing to come out of [your]7706-the shabby man pockets , "[7706-the shabby man] said [he]7706-the shabby man , turning to push [his]7706-the shabby man way toward another table . [The others]2506-the others rose and called for [their]2506-the others reckoning ; and [the listener on the cask]7680-the listener on the cask slipped out of [his]7680-the listener on the cask corner , elbowed a passage to the door and stepped forth into [the square]1592-the square . It was after midnight , a thin drizzle was falling , and [the crowd]1568-the crowd had scattered . The rain was beginning to extinguish the paper lanterns and the torches , and the canvas sides of [the tents]3029-the tents flapped dismally , like wet sheets on a clothes - line . [The man]1626-the man drew [his]1626-the man cloak closer , and avoiding [the stragglers who crossed [his]1626-the man path]7713-the stragglers who crossed his path , turned into [the first street that led to [the palace]768-the palace]7714-the first street that led to the palace . [He]1626-the man walked fast over the slippery cobble - stones , buffeted by a rising wind and threading [his]1626-the man way between dark walls and [sleeping house - fronts]7716-sleeping house - fronts till [he]1626-the man reached [the lane]8522-the lane below [the ducal gardens]856-the ducal gardens . [He]1626-the man unlocked the door by which [he]1626-the man had come forth , entered [the gardens]8159-the gardens , and paused a moment on [the terrace above [the lane]8522-the lane]7720-the terrace above the lane . Behind [him]1626-the man rose [the palace]768-the palace , a dark irregular bulk , with a lighted window showing here and there . Before [him]1626-the man lay [the city]2261-the city , an indistinguishable huddle of [roofs and towers]7724-roofs and towers under the rainy night . [He]1626-the man stood awhile gazing out over [it]2261-the city ; then [he]1626-the man turned and walked toward [the palace]768-the palace . [The garden alleys]7726-the garden alleys were deserted , [the pleached walks]3530-the pleached walks dark as [subterranean passages]7728-subterranean passages , with the wet gleam of statues starting spectrally out of the blackness . [The man]1626-the man walked rapidly , leaving [the Borromini wing on [his]1626-the man left]7730-the borromini wing on his left , and skirting [the outstanding mass of [the older buildings]7732-the older buildings]7731-the outstanding mass of the older buildings . Behind the marble buttresses of [the chapel]578-the chapel , [he]1626-the man crossed the dense obscurity of [a court between high walls]7734-a court between high walls , found a door under an archway , turned a key in the lock , and gained a spiral stairway as dark as [the court]814-the court . [He]1626-the man groped [his]1626-the man way up the stairs and paused a moment on the landing to listen . Then [he]1626-the man opened another door , lifted a heavy hanging of tapestry , and stepped into [[the Duke]682-the duke 's closet]4542-the duke 's closet . It stood empty , with a lamp burning low on the desk . [The man]1626-the man threw off [his]1626-the man cloak and hat , dropped into a chair beside the desk , and hid [his]1626-the man face in [his]1626-the man hands . 4.9 . It was the eve of [the Duke]682-the duke 's birthday . [A cabinet council]7740-a cabinet council had been called in the morning , and [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness 's ministers had submitted to [him]1626-the man the revised draft of the constitution which was to be proclaimed on the morrow . Throughout the conference , which was brief and formal , [Odo]234-odo had been conscious of a subtle change in the ministerial atmosphere . Instead of the current of resistance against which [he]234-odo had grown used to forcing [his]234-odo way , [he]234-odo became aware of a tacit yielding to [his]234-odo will . [Trescorre]254-trescorre had apparently withdrawn [his]254-trescorre opposition to the charter , and [the other ministers]7742-the other ministers had followed suit . To [Odo]234-odo 's overwrought imagination there was something ominous in the change . [He]234-odo had counted on the goad of opposition to fight off the fatal languor which [he]234-odo had learned to expect at such crises . Now that [he]234-odo found there was to be no struggle [he]234-odo understood how largely [his]234-odo zeal had of late depended on such factitious incentives . [He]234-odo felt an irrational longing to throw [himself]234-odo on the other side of the conflict , to tear in bits the paper awaiting [his]234-odo signature , and disown the policy which had dictated it . But the tide of acquiescence on which [he]234-odo was afloat was no stagnant back - water of indifference , but [the glassy reach just above the fall of [a river]1639-a river]7743-the glassy reach just above the fall of a river . The current was as swift as it was smooth , and [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo hurried forward to an end [he]234-odo could no longer escape . [He]234-odo took the pen which [Trescorre]254-trescorre handed [him]234-odo , and signed the constitution . The meeting over , [he]234-odo summoned [Gamba]282-gamba . [He]234-odo felt the need of such encouragement as the hunchback alone could give . [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's enthusiasms were too unreal , too abstract . [She]362-fulvia lived in [a region of ideals]7745-a region of ideals , whence ugly facts were swept out by some process of mental housewifery which kept [her]362-fulvia world perpetually smiling and immaculate . [Gamba]282-gamba at least fed [his]282-gamba convictions on facts . If [his]282-gamba outlook was narrow it was direct : no roseate medium of fancy was interposed between [his]282-gamba vision and the truth . [He]282-gamba stood listening thoughtfully while [Odo]234-odo poured forth [his]234-odo doubts . " [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness may well hesitate , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said at last . " There are always more good reasons against a new state of things than for it . [I]234-odo am not surprised that [Count Trescorre]254-trescorre appears to have withdrawn [his]254-trescorre opposition . [I]234-odo believe [he]254-trescorre now honestly wishes [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness to proclaim the constitution . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo looked up in surprise . " [You]234-odo do not mean that [he]254-trescorre has come to believe in it ? "[234-odo] [Gamba]282-gamba smiled . " Probably not in [your]234-odo Highness 's sense ; but [he]254-trescorre may have found a use of [his]254-trescorre own for it . "[282-gamba] " What do [you]234-odo mean ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo asked . " If [he]254-trescorre does not believe it will benefit [the state]2921-the state [he]254-trescorre may think it will injure [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness . "[234-odo] " Ah-- "[682-the duke] said [the Duke]682-the duke slowly . There was a pause , during which [he]682-the duke was possessed by the same shuddering reluctance to fix [his]682-the duke mind on the facts before [him]682-the duke as when [he]682-the duke had questioned the hunchback about [Momola]241-momola 's death . [He]682-the duke longed to cast the whole business aside , to be up and away from it , drawing breath in a new world where every air was not tainted with corruption . [He]682-the duke raised [his]682-the duke head with an effort . " [You]234-odo think , then , that [the liberals]9304-the liberals are secretly acting against [me]682-the duke in this matter ? "[682-the duke] " [I]234-odo am persuaded of it , [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo hesitated . " [You]234-odo have always told [me]234-odo , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo began again , " that the love of dominion was [[your]234-odo brother]10249-your brother 's ruling passion . If [he]10249-your brother really believes this movement will be popular with [the people]1003-the people , why should [he]10249-your brother secretly oppose it , instead of making the most of [his]10249-your brother own share in it as [the minister of [a popular sovereign]10252-a popular sovereign]10251-the minister of a popular sovereign ? "[234-odo] " For several reasons , "[682-the duke] [Gamba]282-gamba answered promptly . " In the first place , the reforms [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness has introduced are not of [his]10249-your brother own choosing , and [Trescorre]254-trescorre has little sympathy with any policy [he]10249-your brother has not dictated . In the second place , the powers and opportunities of [a constitutional minister]10254-a constitutional minister are too restricted to satisfy [his]254-trescorre appetite for rule ; and thirdly-- "[234-odo] [he]234-odo paused a moment , as though doubtful how [his]234-odo words would be received--"I suspect [Trescorre]254-trescorre of having a private score against [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness , which [he]254-trescorre would be glad to pay off publicly . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo fell silent , yielding [himself]234-odo to a fresh current of thought . " [I]234-odo know not what score [he]254-trescorre may have against [me]234-odo , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said at length ; " but what injures [me]234-odo must injure [the state]2921-the state , and if [Trescorre]254-trescorre has any such motive for withdrawing [his]254-trescorre opposition , it must be because [he]254-trescorre believes the constitution will defeat its own ends . "[234-odo] " [He]254-trescorre does believe that , assuredly ; but [he]254-trescorre is not [the only one of [[your]234-odo Highness 's ministers]10258-your highness 's ministers that would ruin [the state]2921-the state on the chance of finding an opportunity among the ruins]10257-the only one of your highness 's ministers that would ruin the state on the chance of finding an opportunity among the ruins . "[234-odo] " That is as it may be , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo with a touch of weariness . " [I]234-odo have seen enough of human ambition to learn how limited and unimaginative a passion it is . If [it]10260-it saw farther [I]234-odo should fear it more . But if it is short - sighted it sees clearly at close range ; and the motive [you]234-odo ascribe to [Trescorre]254-trescorre would imply that [he]254-trescorre believes the constitution will be a failure . "[234-odo] " Without doubt , [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness . [I]234-odo am convinced that [[your]234-odo ministers]9922-your ministers have done all [they]9922-your ministers could to prevent the proclamation of the charter , and failing that , to thwart its workings if it be proclaimed . In this [they]9922-your ministers have gone hand in hand with [the clergy]1929-the clergy , and [their]9922-your ministers measures have been well taken . But [I]234-odo do not believe that any state of mind produced by external influences can long withstand the natural drift of opinion ; and [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness may be sure that , though [the talkers]10265-the talkers and [writers]10266-writers are mostly against [you]234-odo in this matter , the mass of [the people]1003-the people are with [you]234-odo . "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo answered with a despairing gesture . " How can [I]234-odo be sure , when [the people]1003-the people have no means of expressing [their]1003-the people needs ? It is like trying to guess the wants of [a deaf and dumb man]10269-a deaf and dumb man ! "[234-odo] [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback flushed suddenly . " [The people]1003-the people will not always be deaf and dumb , "[8158-the hunchback] [he]8158-the hunchback said . " Some day [they]1003-the people will speak . "[8158-the hunchback] " Not in [my]234-odo day , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo wearily . " And meanwhile [we]10271-we blunder on , without ever really knowing what incalculable instincts and prejudices are pitted against [us]10271-we . [You]234-odo and [[your]234-odo party]10272-your party tell [me]282-gamba [the people]1003-the people are sick of the burdens [the clergy]1929-the clergy lay on [them]1003-the people -- yet [their]1003-the people blind devotion to [the Church]1212-the church is manifest at every turn , and it did not need the business of [the Virgin]3925-the virgin 's crown to show [me]282-gamba how little reason and justice can avail against such influences . "[282-gamba] [Gamba]282-gamba replied by an impatient gesture . " As to [the Virgin]3925-the virgin 's crown , "[282-gamba] [he]282-gamba said , " [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness must have guessed it was one of [the friars]1652-the friars ' tricks : a last expedient to turn [the people]1003-the people against [you]234-odo . [I]282-gamba was not bred up by [a priest]592-a priest for nothing ; [I]282-gamba know what [past masters those gentry]10282-past masters those gentry are in raising ghosts and reading portents . [They]1003-the people know the minds of [the poor folk]8862-the poor folk as [the herdsman]10284-the herdsman knows the habits of [his]10284-the herdsman cattle ; and for generations [they]1003-the people have used that knowledge to bring [the people]1003-the people more completely under [their]1003-the people control . "[282-gamba] " And what have [we]10286-we to oppose to such a power ? "[234-odo] [Odo]234-odo exclaimed . " [We]10286-we are fighting the battle of ideas against passions , of reflection against instinct ; and [you]234-odo have but to look in the human heart to guess which side will win in such a struggle . [We]10286-we have science and truth and common - sense with [us]10286-we , [you]234-odo say -- yes , but [the Church]72-the church has love and fear and tradition , and the solidarity of nigh two thousand years of dominion . "[234-odo] [Gamba]282-gamba listened in respectful silence ; then [he]282-gamba replied with a faint smile : " All that [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness says is true ; but [I]282-gamba beg leave to relate to [[your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness a tale which [I]282-gamba read lately in an old book of [[your]234-odo library]10289-your library . According to this story it appears that when [the early Christians of [Alexandria]146-alexandria]10290-the early christians of alexandria set out to destroy the pagan idols in [the temples]10291-the temples [they]10290-the early christians of alexandria were seized with great dread at sight of the god [Serapis]547-serapis ; for even [those that did not believe in the old gods]10292-those that did not believe in the old gods feared [them]10290-the early christians of alexandria , and [none]1118-none dared raise a hand against the sacred image . But suddenly [a soldier who was bolder than the rest flung [his]682-the duke battle - axe at the figure -- and when it broke in pieces , there rushed out nothing worse than a great company of rats]10294-a soldier who was bolder than the rest flung his battle - axe at the figure -- and when it broke in pieces , there rushed out nothing worse than a great company of rats . "[282-gamba] ... * * * * * [The Duke]682-the duke had promised to visit [Fulvia]362-fulvia that evening . For several days [his]682-the duke state of indecision had made [him]682-the duke find pretexts for avoiding [her]362-fulvia ; but now that the charter was signed and [he]682-the duke had ordered its proclamation , [he]682-the duke craved the contact of [her]362-fulvia unwavering faith . [He]682-the duke found [her]362-fulvia alone in [the dusk of [the convent parlour]7750-the convent parlour]7749-the dusk of the convent parlour ; but [he]682-the duke had hardly crossed the threshold before [he]682-the duke was aware of an indefinable change in [his]682-the duke surroundings . [She]362-fulvia advanced with an impulsiveness out of harmony with the usual tranquillity of [their]7751-their meetings , and [he]682-the duke felt [her]362-fulvia hand tremble and burn in [his]682-the duke . In the twilight it seemed to [him]682-the duke that [her]362-fulvia very dress had a warmer rustle and glimmer , that there emanated from [her]362-fulvia glance and movements some heady fragrance of a long - past summer . [He]682-the duke smiled to think that this phantom coquetry should have risen at the summons of an academic degree ; but some deeper sense in [him]682-the duke was stirred as by a vision of waste riches adrift on [the dim seas of chance]7752-the dim seas of chance . For a moment [she]362-fulvia sat silent , as in the days when [they]7751-their had been too near [each other]3086-each other for many words ; and there was something indescribably soothing in this dreamlike return to the past . It was [he]682-the duke who roused [himself]682-the duke first . " How young [you]362-fulvia look ! "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke said , giving involuntary utterance to [his]682-the duke thought . " Do [I]362-fulvia ? "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia answered gaily . " [I]362-fulvia am glad of that , for [I]362-fulvia feel extraordinarily young tonight . Perhaps it is because [I]362-fulvia have been thinking a great deal of the old days -- of [Venice]41-venice and [Turin]17-turin -- and of [the high - road to [Vercelli]13-vercelli]10295-the high - road to vercelli , for instance . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia glanced at [him]682-the duke with a smile . " Do [you]682-the duke know , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia went on , moving to a seat at [his]682-the duke side , and laying a hand on the arm of [his]682-the duke chair , " that there is one secret of [mine]362-fulvia [you]682-the duke have never guessed in all these years ? "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo returned [her]362-fulvia smile . " What is it , [I]682-the duke wonder ? "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke said . [She]362-fulvia fixed [him]682-the duke with bright bantering eyes . " [I]362-fulvia knew why [you]682-the duke deserted [us]10296-us at [Vercelli]13-vercelli . "[362-fulvia] [He]682-the duke uttered an exclamation , but [she]362-fulvia lifted a hand to [his]682-the duke lips . " Ah , how angry [I]362-fulvia was then -- but why be angry now ? It all happened so long ago ; and if it had not happened -- who knows?--perhaps [you]682-the duke would never have pitied [me]362-fulvia enough to love [me]362-fulvia as [you]682-the duke did . "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia laughed softly , reminiscently , leaning back as if to let the tide of memories ripple over [her]362-fulvia . Then [she]362-fulvia raised [her]362-fulvia head suddenly , and said in a changed voice : " Are [your]682-the duke plans fixed for tomorrow ? "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo glanced at [her]362-fulvia in surprise . [Her]362-fulvia mind seemed to move as capriciously as [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina 's . " The constitution is signed , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke answered , " and [[my]682-the duke ministers]9384-my ministers proclaim it tomorrow morning . "[682-the duke] [He]682-the duke looked at [her]362-fulvia a moment , and lifted [her]362-fulvia hand to [his]682-the duke lips . " Everything has been done according to [your]362-fulvia wishes , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke said . [She]362-fulvia drew away with a start , and [he]682-the duke saw that [she]362-fulvia had turned pale . " No , no -- not as [I]362-fulvia wish , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia murmured . " It must not be because _ [I]362-fulvia _ wish-- "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia broke off and [her]362-fulvia hand slipped from [his]682-the duke . " [You]362-fulvia have taught [me]682-the duke to wish as [you]362-fulvia wish , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke answered gently . " Surely [you]362-fulvia would not disown [[your]362-fulvia pupil]8128-your pupil now ? "[682-the duke] [Her]362-fulvia agitation increased . " Do not call [yourself]682-the duke that ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia exclaimed . " Not even in jest . What [you]682-the duke have done has been done of [your]682-the duke own choice -- because [you]682-the duke thought it best for [[your]682-the duke people]9879-your people . [My]362-fulvia nearness or absence could have made no difference . "[362-fulvia] [He]682-the duke looked at [her]362-fulvia with growing wonder . " Why this sudden modesty ? "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke said with a smile . " [I]682-the duke thought [you]362-fulvia prided [yourself]362-fulvia on [your]362-fulvia share in the great work . "[682-the duke] [She]362-fulvia tried to force an answering smile , but the curve broke into a quiver of distress , and [she]362-fulvia came close to [him]682-the duke , with a gesture that seemed to take flight from [herself]362-fulvia . " Do n't say it , do n't say it ! "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia broke out . " What right have [they]9879-your people to call it [my]362-fulvia doing ? [I]362-fulvia but stood aside and watched [you]362-fulvia and gloried in [you]362-fulvia -- is there any guilt to [a woman]5452-a woman in THAT ? "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia clung to [him]682-the duke a moment , hiding [her]362-fulvia face in [his]682-the duke breast . [He]682-the duke loosened [her]362-fulvia arms gently , that [he]682-the duke might draw back and look at [her]362-fulvia . " Fulvia , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke asked , " what ails [you]362-fulvia ? [You]362-fulvia are not [yourself]362-fulvia tonight . Has anything happened to distress [you]362-fulvia ? Have [you]362-fulvia been annoyed or alarmed in any way?--It is not possible , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke broke off , " that [Trescorre]254-trescorre has been here-- ? "[682-the duke] [She]362-fulvia drew away , flushed and protesting . " No , no , "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia exclaimed . " Why should [Trescorre]254-trescorre come [here]8091-here ? Why should [you]682-the duke fancy that [any one]797-any one has been [here]8091-here ? [I]362-fulvia am excited , [I]362-fulvia know ; [I]362-fulvia talk idly ; but it is because [I]362-fulvia have been thinking too long of these things-- "[362-fulvia] " Of what things ? "[682-the duke] " Of what [people]1578-people say -- how can one help hearing that ? [I]682-the duke sometimes fancy that [the more withdrawn one]10305-the more withdrawn one lives the more distinctly [one]8494-one hears the outer noises . "[682-the duke] " But why should [you]682-the duke heed the outer noises ? [You]682-the duke have never done so before . "[362-fulvia] " Perhaps [I]362-fulvia was wrong not to do so before . Perhaps [I]362-fulvia should have listened sooner . Perhaps [others]1388-others have seen -- understood -- sooner than [I]362-fulvia -- oh , the thought is intolerable ! "[362-fulvia] [She]362-fulvia moved a pace or two away , and then , regaining the mastery of [her]362-fulvia lips and eyes , turned to [him]7754-you with a show of calmness . " [Your]7754-you heart was never in this charter-- "[362-fulvia] [she]362-fulvia began . " Fulvia ! "[7754-you] [he]7754-you cried protestingly ; but [she]362-fulvia lifted a silencing hand . " Ah , [I]362-fulvia have seen it -- [I]362-fulvia have felt it -- but [I]362-fulvia was never willing to own that [you]7754-you were right . [My]362-fulvia pride in [you]7754-you blinded [me]362-fulvia , [I]362-fulvia suppose . [I]362-fulvia could not bear to dream any fate for [you]7754-you but the greatest . [I]362-fulvia saw [you]7754-you always leading events , rather than waiting on them . But true greatness lies in [the man]1626-the man , not in [his]1626-the man actions . Compromise , delay , renunciation -- these may be as heroic as conflict . [A woman]5452-a woman 's vision is so narrow that [I]362-fulvia did not see this at first . [You]7754-you have always told [me]362-fulvia that [I]362-fulvia looked only at one side of the question ; but [I]362-fulvia see the other side now -- [I]362-fulvia see that [you]7754-you were right . "[362-fulvia] [Odo]234-odo stood silent . [He]234-odo had followed [her]7755-she with growing wonder . [A volte - face]7756-a volte - face so little in keeping with [her]7755-she mental habits immediately struck [him]234-odo as a feint ; yet so strangely did it accord with [his]234-odo own secret reluctances that these inclined [him]234-odo to let it pass unquestioned . Some instinctive loyalty to [his]234-odo past checked the temptation . " [I]234-odo am not sure that [I]234-odo understand [you]7755-she , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said slowly . " Have [you]7755-she lost faith in the ideas [we]10310-we have worked for ? "[234-odo] [She]7755-she hesitated , and [he]234-odo saw the struggle beneath [her]7755-she surface calmness . " No , no , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she exclaimed quickly , " [I]7755-she have not lost faith in them-- "[7755-she] " In [me]7755-she , then ? "[7755-she] [She]7755-she smiled with a disarming sadness . " That would be so much simpler ! "[7755-she] [she]7755-she murmured . " What do [you]7755-she mean , then ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo urged . " [We]10310-we must understand [each other]3086-each other . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo paused , and measured [his]234-odo words out slowly . " Do [you]7755-she think it a mistake to proclaim the constitution tomorrow ? "[234-odo] Again [her]7755-she face was full of shadowy contradictions . " [I]7755-she entreat [you]234-odo not to proclaim it tomorrow , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she said in a low voice . [Odo]234-odo felt the blood drum in [his]234-odo ears . Was not this the word for which [he]234-odo had waited ?
