But still some deeper instinct held [him]234-odo back , warning [him]234-odo , as it seemed , that to fall below [his]234-odo purpose at such a juncture was the only measurable failure . [He]234-odo must know more before [he]234-odo yielded , see deeper into [her]7755-she heart and [his]234-odo ; and each moment brought the clearer conviction that there was more to know and see . " This is unlike [you]7755-she , [Fulvia]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " [You]7755-she can not make such a request on impulse . [You]7755-she must have a reason . "[234-odo] [She]7755-she smiled . " [You]234-odo told [me]7755-she once that [a woman]5452-a woman 's reasons are only impulses in [men]8356-men 's clothes . "[7755-she] But [he]234-odo was not to be diverted by this thrust . " [I]234-odo shall think so now , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " unless [you]7755-she can give [me]234-odo some better account of [yours]7755-she ! "[234-odo] [She]7755-she was silent , and [he]234-odo pressed on with a persistency for which [he]234-odo [himself]234-odo could hardly account : " [You]7755-she must have a reason for this request . "[234-odo] " [I]7755-she have one , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she said , dropping [her]7755-she attempts at evasion . " And it is-- ? "[7755-she] [She]7755-she paused again , with a look of appeal against which [he]234-odo had to stiffen [himself]234-odo . " [I]7755-she do not believe the time has come , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she said at length . " [You]234-odo think [the people]1003-the people are not ready for the constitution ? "[7755-she] [She]7755-she answered with an effort : " [I]7755-she think [the people]1003-the people are not ready for it . "[7755-she] [He]234-odo fell silent , and [they]7757-we sat facing [each other]3086-each other , but with eyes apart . " [You]7755-she have received this impression from [Gamba]282-gamba , from [Andreoni]441-andreoni -- from [the members of [[our]7757-we party]10317-our party]10316-the members of our party ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo asked . [She]7755-she made no reply . " Remember , [Fulvia]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo went on almost sternly , " that this is the end for which [we]7757-we have worked together all these years -- the end for which [we]7757-we renounced [each other]3086-each other and went forth in [our]7757-we youth , [you]362-fulvia to exile and [I]234-odo to an unwilling sovereignty . It was because [we]7757-we loved this cause better than [ourselves]7757-we that [we]7757-we had strength to give up for it [our]7757-we personal hopes of happiness . If [we]7757-we betray the cause from any merely personal motive [we]7757-we shall have fallen below [our]7757-we earlier selves . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo waited again , but [she]7755-she was still silent . " Can [you]7755-she swear to [me]234-odo , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo went on , " that no such motive influences [you]7755-she now ? That [you]7755-she honestly believe [we]7757-we have been deceived and mistaken ? That [our]7757-we years of faith and labour have been wasted , and that , if [mankind]2662-mankind is to be helped , it is to be in other ways and by other efforts than [ours]7757-we ? "[234-odo] [He]234-odo stood before [her]7755-she accusingly , almost , the passion of the long fight surging up in [him]234-odo as [he]234-odo felt the weapon drop from [his]234-odo hand . [Fulvia]362-fulvia had sat motionless under [his]234-odo appeal ; but as [he]234-odo paused [she]7755-she rose with an impulsive gesture . " Oh , why do [you]234-odo torment [me]7755-she with questions ? "[7755-she] [she]7755-she cried , half - sobbing . " [I]7755-she venture to counsel a delay , and [you]234-odo arraign [me]7755-she as though [I]7755-she stood at the day of judgment ! "[7755-she] " It IS [our]10320-our day of judgment , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo retorted . " It is the day on which life confronts [us]10320-our with [our]10320-our own actions , and [we]10320-our must justify them or own [ourselves]10320-our deluded . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo went up to [her]7755-she and caught [her]7755-she hands entreatingly . " [Fulvia]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " [I]234-odo too have doubted , wavered -- and if [you]7755-she will give [me]234-odo one honest reason that is worthy of [us]10320-our both-- "[234-odo] [She]7755-she broke from [him]234-odo to hide [her]7755-she weeping . " Reasons ! reasons ! "[7755-she] [she]7755-she stammered . " What does the heart know of reasons ? [I]7755-she ask a favour -- the first [I]7755-she ever asked of [you]7755-she -- and [you]7755-she answer it by haggling with [me]7755-she for reasons ! "[7755-she] Something in [her]7755-she voice and gesture was like a lightning - flash over [a dark landscape]7759-a dark landscape . In an instant [he]234-odo saw the pit at [his]234-odo feet . " [Some one]1607-some one has been with [you]7755-she . Those words were not [yours]7755-she , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo cried . [She]7755-she rallied instantly . " That is a pretext for not heeding them ! "[7755-she] [she]7755-she returned . The lightning glared again . [He]234-odo stepped close and faced [her]7755-she . " [The Duchess]899-the duchess has been [here]8091-here , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . [She]7755-she dropped into a chair and hid [her]7755-she face from [him]234-odo . A wave of anger mounted from [his]234-odo heart , choking back [his]234-odo words and filling [his]234-odo brain with its fumes . But as it subsided [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo suddenly cool , firm , attempered . There could be no wavering , no self - questioning now . " When did this happen ? "[234-odo] [he]234-odo asked . [She]7755-she shook [her]7755-she head despairingly . " [Fulvia]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " if [you]7755-she will not speak [I]234-odo will speak for [you]7755-she . [I]234-odo can guess what arguments were used -- what threats , even . Were there threats ? "[234-odo] burst from [him]234-odo in a fresh leap of anger . [She]7755-she raised [her]7755-she head slowly . " Threats would not have mattered , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she said . " But [your]7755-she fears were played on -- [your]7755-she fears for [my]234-odo safety?--Fulvia , answer [me]234-odo ! "[234-odo] [he]234-odo insisted . [She]7755-she rose suddenly and laid [her]7755-she arms about [his]234-odo shoulders , with a gesture half - tender , half - maternal . " Oh , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she said , " why will [you]234-odo torture [me]7755-she ? [I]7755-she have borne much for [our]10324-our love 's sake , and would have borne this too -- in silence , like the rest -- but to speak of it is to relieve it ; and [my]7755-she strength fails [me]7755-she ! "[7755-she] [He]234-odo held [her]7755-she hands fast , keeping [his]234-odo eyes on [hers]7755-she . " No , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , " for [your]7755-she strength never failed [you]7755-she when there was any call on it ; and [our]10324-our whole past calls on it now . Rouse [yourself]7755-she , [Fulvia]362-fulvia : look life in the face ! [You]7755-she were told there might be troubles tomorrow -- that [I]234-odo was in danger , perhaps ? "[234-odo] " There was worse -- there was worse , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she shuddered . " Worse ? "[7755-she] " The blame was laid on [me]7755-she -- the responsibility . [Your]7755-she love for [me]7755-she , [my]7755-she power over [you]7755-she , were accused . [The people]1003-the people hate [me]7755-she -- [they]1003-the people hate [you]234-odo for loving [me]7755-she ! Oh , [I]7755-she have destroyed [you]234-odo ! "[7755-she] [she]7755-she cried . [Odo]234-odo felt a slow cold strength pouring into all [his]234-odo veins . It was as though [[his]234-odo enemies]7760-his enemies , in thinking to mix a mortal poison , had rendered [him]234-odo invulnerable . [He]234-odo bent over [her]7755-she with great gentleness . " [Fulvia]362-fulvia , this is madness , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " A moment 's thought must show [you]362-fulvia what passions are here at work . Can [you]362-fulvia not rise above such fears ? [No one]725-no one can judge between [us]10327-us but [ourselves]10327-us . "[234-odo] " Ah , but [you]362-fulvia do not know -- [you]362-fulvia will not understand . [Your]362-fulvia life may be in danger ! "[7755-she] [she]7755-she cried . " [I]234-odo have been told that before , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said contemptuously . " It is a common trick of the political game . "[234-odo] " This is no trick , "[7755-she] [she]7755-she exclaimed . " [I]7755-she was made to see -- to understand -- and [I]7755-she swear to [you]234-odo that the danger is real . "[7755-she] " And what if it were ? Is [the Church]72-the church to have [all the martyrs]10328-all the martyrs ? "[234-odo] said [he]234-odo gaily . " Come , [Fulvia]362-fulvia , shake off such fancies . [My]234-odo life is as safe as [yours]234-odo . At worst there may be a little hissing to be faced . That is easy enough compared to facing [one]8494-one 's own doubts . And [I]234-odo have no doubts now -- that is all past , thank heaven ! [I]234-odo see [the road]726-the road straight before [me]234-odo -- as straight as when [you]234-odo showed it to [me]234-odo once before , years ago , in [the inn - parlour at [Peschiera]189-peschiera]10331-the inn - parlour at peschiera . [You]234-odo pointed the way to it then ; surely [you]234-odo would not hold [me]234-odo back from it now ? "[234-odo] [He]234-odo took [her]7761-your in [his]234-odo arms and kissed [her]7761-your lips to silence . " When [we]10332-we meet tomorrow , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , releasing [her]7761-your , " [It]10333-it will be as [teacher]10334-teacher and [pupil]10335-pupil , [you]7761-your in [[your]7761-your doctor]10336-your doctor 's gown and [I]234-odo a learner at [your]7761-your feet . Put [your]7761-your old faith in [me]234-odo into [your]7761-your argument , and [we]10337-we shall have all [Pianura]536-pianura converted . "[234-odo] [He]234-odo hastened away through [the dim gardens]7762-the dim gardens , carrying [a boy]2854-a boy 's heart in [his]234-odo breast . 4.10 . [The University of [Pianura]4-pianura]7764-the university of pianura was lodged in [the ancient Signoria]7765-the ancient signoria or [Town Hall of [the free city]3801-the free city]7766-town hall of the free city ; and here , on the afternoon of [the Duke]682-the duke 's birthday , [the civic dignitaries]7769-the civic dignitaries and [the leading men of the learned professions]7770-the leading men of the learned professions had assembled to see the doctorate conferred on [the Signorina Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia and on [several less conspicuous candidates of the other sex]7771-several less conspicuous candidates of the other sex . [The city]2261-the city was again in gala dress . Early that morning the new constitution had been proclaimed , with much firing of cannon and display of official fireworks ; but even these great news , and [their]7773-their attendant manifestations , had failed to enliven [the populace]2736-the populace , who , instead of filling [the streets]744-the streets with [their]2736-the populace usual stir , hung massed at certain points , as though curiously waiting on events . There are few sights more ominous than that of a crowd thus observing [itself]7776-itself , watching in inconscient suspense for the unknown crisis which its own passions have engendered . It was known that [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness , after the public banquet at [the palace]768-the palace , was to proceed in state to [the University]9247-the university ; and [the throng]1596-the throng was thick about the palace gates and in [the streets betwixt [it]7782-it and [the Signoria]223-the signoria]7781-the streets betwixt it and the signoria . Here [the square]1592-the square was close - packed , and every window choked with [gazers]7784-gazers , as [[the Duke]682-the duke 's coach]7786-the duke 's coach came in sight , escorted meagrely by [[his]682-the duke equerries]7787-his equerries and the half - dozen light - horse that preceded [him]682-the duke . The small escort , and the marked absence of military display , perhaps disappointed [the splendour - loving crowd]7788-the splendour - loving crowd ; and from this cause or another , scarce a cheer was heard as [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness descended from [[his]941-his highness coach]7790-his coach , and walked up the steps to the porch of ancient carved stone where [the faculty]6983-the faculty awaited [him]941-his highness . [The hall]7792-the hall was already filled with [students]5084-students and [graduates]7794-graduates , and with [the guests of [the University]9247-the university]7795-the guests of the university . Through [this grave assemblage]7797-this grave assemblage [the Duke]682-the duke passed up to the row of armchairs beneath the dais at the farther end of [the room]782-the room . [Trescorre]254-trescorre , who was to have attended [[his]682-the duke Highness]941-his highness , had excused [himself]254-trescorre on the plea of indisposition , and [only a few gentlemen - in - waiting]7801-only a few gentlemen - in - waiting accompanied [the Duke]682-the duke ; but in the brown half - light of [the old Gothic hall]7803-the old gothic hall [their]7801-only a few gentlemen - in - waiting glittering uniforms contrasted brilliantly with the black gowns of [the students]7804-the students , and the sober broadcloth of [the learned professions]7805-the learned professions . A discreet murmur of enthusiasm rose at [their]7801-only a few gentlemen - in - waiting approach , mounting almost to a cheer as [the Duke]682-the duke bowed before taking [his]682-the duke seat ; for [the audience]4657-the audience represented the class most in sympathy with [his]682-the duke policy and most confident of its success . The meetings of [the faculty]6983-the faculty were held in [the great council - chamber where [the Rectors of [the old free city]7811-the old free city had assembled]7810-the rectors of the old free city had assembled]7809-the great council - chamber where the rectors of the old free city had assembled ; and such a setting was regarded as peculiarly appropriate to the present occasion . The fact was alluded to , with much wealth of historical and mythological analogy , by [the President]7812-the president , who opened the ceremonies with a polysyllabic Latin oration , in which [the Duke]682-the duke was compared to [Apollo]395-apollo , Hercules and [Jason]548-jason , as well as to the flower of [sublunary heroes]7814-sublunary heroes . This feat of rhetoric over , [the candidates]7815-the candidates were called on to advance and receive [their]7815-the candidates degrees . [The men]6838-the men came first , profiting by the momentary advantage of sex , but clearly aware of its inability to confer even momentary importance in the eyes of [the impatient audience]7817-the impatient audience . A pause followed , and then [Fulvia]362-fulvia appeared . Against the red - robed faculty at the back of the dais , [she]362-fulvia stood tall and slender in [her]362-fulvia black cap and gown . The high windows of painted glass shed a paleness on [her]362-fulvia face , but [her]362-fulvia carriage was light and assured as [she]362-fulvia advanced to [the President]7812-the president and knelt to receive [her]362-fulvia degree . The parchment was placed in [her]362-fulvia hand , the furred hood laid on [her]362-fulvia shoulders ; then , after another flourish of rhetoric , [she]362-fulvia was led to the lectern from which [her]362-fulvia discourse was to be delivered . [Odo]234-odo sat just below [her]362-fulvia , and as [she]362-fulvia took [her]362-fulvia place [their]7819-their eyes met for an instant . [He]234-odo was caught up in the serene exaltation of [her]362-fulvia look , as though [she]362-fulvia soared with [him]234-odo above wind and cloud to a region of unshadowed calm ; then [her]362-fulvia eyes fell and [she]362-fulvia began to speak . [She]362-fulvia had a pretty mastery of Latin , and though [she]362-fulvia had never before spoken in public , [her]362-fulvia poetical recitations , and the early habit of intercourse with [[her]362-fulvia father 's friends]5869-her father 's friends , had given [her]362-fulvia a fair measure of fluency and self - possession . These qualities were raised to eloquence by the sweetness of [her]362-fulvia voice , and by the grave beauty which made the academic gown seem [her]362-fulvia natural wear , rather than a travesty of learning . [Odo]234-odo at first had some difficulty in fixing [his]234-odo attention on what [she]362-fulvia said ; and when [he]234-odo controlled [his]234-odo thoughts [she]362-fulvia was in the height of [her]362-fulvia panegyric of constitutional liberty . [She]362-fulvia had begun slowly , almost coldly ; but now [her]362-fulvia theme possessed [her]362-fulvia . One by one [she]362-fulvia evoked the familiar formulas with which [his]234-odo mind had once reverberated . They woke no echo in [him]234-odo now ; but [he]234-odo saw that [she]362-fulvia could still set them ringing through the sensibilities of [[her]362-fulvia hearers]7821-her hearers . As [she]362-fulvia stood there , a slight impassioned figure , warming to [her]362-fulvia high argument , [his]234-odo sense of irony was touched by the incongruity of [her]362-fulvia background . The wall behind [her]362-fulvia was covered by an ancient fresco , fast fading under its touches of renewed gilding , and representing [the patron scholars of [the mediaeval world]7823-the mediaeval world]7822-the patron scholars of the mediaeval world : [the theologians]7824-the theologians , [law - givers]7825-law - givers and [logicians under whose protection [the free city]3801-the free city had placed [its]3801-the free city budding liberties]7826-logicians under whose protection the free city had placed its budding liberties . There [they]7822-the patron scholars of the mediaeval world sat , rigid and sumptuous on [their]7822-the patron scholars of the mediaeval world Gothic thrones : [Origen]549-origen , [Zeno]550-zeno , [David]551-david , [Lycurgus]552-lycurgus , [Aristotle]431-aristotle ; listening in a kind of cataleptic helplessness to a confession of faith that scattered [their]7822-the patron scholars of the mediaeval world doctrines to the winds . As [he]234-odo looked and listened , a weary sense of the reiterance of things came over [him]234-odo . For what were [these ancient manipulators of ideas]7828-these ancient manipulators of ideas , [prestidigitators of a vanished world of thought]7829-prestidigitators of a vanished world of thought , but [the forbears of the long line of theorists of whom [Fulvia]362-fulvia]7830-the forbears of the long line of theorists of whom fulvia was the last inconscient mouthpiece ? The new game was still played with the old counters , [the new jugglers]7831-the new jugglers repeated the old tricks ; and the very words now poured out in defence of the new cause were but [mercenaries scarred in the service of [its]3801-the free city enemies]7832-mercenaries scarred in the service of its enemies . For generations , for centuries , [man]2185-man had fought on ; crying for liberty , dreaming it was won , waking to find [himself]234-odo [the slave of the new forces [he]234-odo had generated]7834-the slave of the new forces he had generated , burning and being burnt for the same beliefs under different guises , calling [his]234-odo instinct ideas and [his]234-odo ideas revelations ; destroying , rebuilding , falling , rising , mending broken weapons , championing extinct illusions , mistaking [his]234-odo failures for achievements and planting [his]234-odo flag on [the ramparts]7835-the ramparts as they fell . And as the vision of this inveterate conflict rose before [him]234-odo , [Odo]234-odo saw that the beauty , the power , the immortality , dwelt not in the idea but in the struggle for it . [His]234-odo resistance yielded as this sense stole over [him]234-odo , and with an almost physical relief [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo drawn once more into the familiar current of emotion . Yes , it was better after all to be one of that great unconquerable army , though , like [the Trojans]553-the trojans fighting for a phantom [Helen]554-helen , [they]553-the trojans might be doing battle for the shadow of a shade ; better to march in [their]553-the trojans ranks , endure with [them]553-the trojans , fight with [them]553-the trojans , fall with [them]553-the trojans , than to miss the great enveloping sense of brotherhood that turned defeat to victory . As the conviction grew in [him]234-odo , [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's words regained their lost significance . Through the set mask of language the living thoughts looked forth , old indeed as [the world]844-the world , but renewed with the new life of every heart that bore [them]7837-them . [She]362-fulvia had left the abstract and dropped to concrete issues : to the gift of the constitution , the benefits and obligations it implied , the new relations it established between [ruler]7838-ruler and [subject]7839-subject and between [man]2185-man and [man]2185-man . [Odo]234-odo saw that [she]362-fulvia approached the question without flinching . No trace remained of [the trembling woman who had clung to [him]234-odo the night before]7842-the trembling woman who had clung to him the night before . [Her]362-fulvia old convictions repossessed [her]362-fulvia and [she]362-fulvia soared above human fears . So engrossed was [he]234-odo that [he]234-odo had been unaware of a growing murmur of sound which seemed to be forcing its way from without through the walls of [the ancient building]7843-the ancient building . As [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's oration neared its end the murmur rose to a roar . Startled faces were turned toward the doors of [the council - chamber]7844-the council - chamber , and [one of [[the Duke]682-the duke 's gentlemen]911-the duke 's gentlemen]3558-one of the duke 's gentlemen left [his]3558-one of the duke 's gentlemen seat and made [his]3558-one of the duke 's gentlemen way through [the audience]4657-the audience . [Odo]234-odo sat motionless , [his]234-odo eyes on [Fulvia]362-fulvia . [He]234-odo noticed that [her]362-fulvia face paled as the sound reached [her]362-fulvia , but there was no break in the voice with which [she]362-fulvia uttered the closing words of [her]362-fulvia peroration . As [she]362-fulvia ended , the noise was momentarily drowned under a loud burst of clapping ; but this died in a hush of apprehension through which the outer tumult became more ominously audible . [The equerry]7849-the equerry reentered [the hall]7792-the hall with a disordered countenance . [He]7849-the equerry hastened to [the Duke]682-the duke and addressed [him]682-the duke urgently . " [[Your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness , "[7849-the equerry] [he]7849-the equerry said , " [the crowd]1568-the crowd has thickened and wears an ugly look . There are many friars abroad , and images of [the Mountain Virgin]3961-the mountain virgin are being carried in procession . Will [[your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness be pleased to remain [here]8091-here while [I]7849-the equerry summon [an escort]10343-an escort from [the barracks]10344-the barracks ? "[7849-the equerry] [Odo]234-odo was still watching [Fulvia]362-fulvia . [She]362-fulvia had received the applause of [the audience]4657-the audience with a deep reverence , and was now in the act of withdrawing to [the inner room at the back of [the dais]7854-the dais]7853-the inner room at the back of the dais . [Her]362-fulvia eyes met [Odo]234-odo 's ; [she]362-fulvia smiled and the door closed on [her]362-fulvia . [He]234-odo turned to [the equerry]7849-the equerry . " There is no need of [an escort]10343-an escort , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . " [I]234-odo trust [[my]234-odo people]9013-my people if [they]9013-my people do not trust [me]234-odo . "[234-odo] " But , [[your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness , [the streets]744-the streets are full of demagogues who have been haranguing [the people]1003-the people since morning . [The crowd]1568-the crowd is shouting against the constitution and against [the Signorina Vivaldi]362-fulvia . "[234-odo] A flame of anger passed over [the Duke]682-the duke 's face ; but [he]234-odo subdued it instantly . " Go to [the Signorina Vivaldi]362-fulvia , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said , pointing to the door by which [Fulvia]362-fulvia had left [the hall]7792-the hall . " Assure [her]362-fulvia that there is no danger , but ask [her]362-fulvia to remain where [she]362-fulvia is till [the crowd]1568-the crowd disperses , and request the faculty in [my]234-odo name to remain with [her]362-fulvia . "[234-odo] [The equerry]7849-the equerry bowed , and hurried up the steps of [the dais]7854-the dais , while [the Duke]682-the duke signed to [[his]682-the duke other companions]7861-his other companions to precede [him]234-odo to the door of [the hall]7792-the hall . As [they]7863-they walked down [the long room]7864-the long room , between the close - packed ranks of [the audience]4657-the audience , the outer tumult surged threateningly toward [them]7863-they . Near the doorway , another of [the gentlemen - in - waiting]7866-the gentlemen - in - waiting was seen to speak with [the Duke]682-the duke . " [[Your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness , "[7868-he] [he]7868-he said , " there is a private way at the back by which [you]682-the duke may yet leave [the building]3122-the building unobserved . "[7868-he] " [You]682-the duke appear to forget that [I]234-odo entered [it]3122-the building publicly , "[234-odo] said [Odo]234-odo . " But , [[your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness , [we]10355-we can not answer for the consequences-- "[234-odo] [The Duke]682-the duke signed to [the ushers]7870-the ushers to throw open the doors . [They]7870-the ushers obeyed , and [he]682-the duke stepped out into [the stone vestibule preceding [the porch]6627-the porch]7871-the stone vestibule preceding the porch . The iron - barred outer doors of [this vestibule]7873-this vestibule were securely bolted , and [the porter]1374-the porter hung back in affright at the order to unlock [them]7875-them . " [[Your]682-the duke Highness]8397-your highness , [the people]1003-the people are raving mad , "[682-the duke] [he]682-the duke said , flinging [himself]682-the duke on [his]682-the duke knees . [Odo]234-odo turned impatiently to [[his]234-odo escort]7876-his escort . " Unbar the doors , [gentlemen]1901-gentlemen , "[234-odo] [he]234-odo said . The blood was drumming in [his]682-the duke ears , but [his]682-the duke eye was clear and steady , and [he]682-the duke noted with curious detachment the comic agony of [the fat porter]7877-the fat porter 's face , and the strain and swell of [the equerry]7849-the equerry 's muscles as [he]682-the duke dragged back the ponderous bolts . The doors swung open , and [the Duke]682-the duke emerged . Below [him]682-the duke , still with that unimpaired distinctness of vision which seemed a part of [his]682-the duke heightened vitality , [he]682-the duke saw a great gesticulating mass of [people]1578-people . [They]7881-their packed [the square]1592-the square so closely that [their]7881-their own numbers held [them]7881-their immovable , save for [their]7881-their swaying arms and heads ; and [those whom [the square]1592-the square could not contain]7883-those whom the square could not contain had climbed to porticoes , balconies and cornices , and massed [themselves]7883-those whom the square could not contain in [the neck of [the adjoining streets]7886-the adjoining streets]7885-the neck of the adjoining streets . [The handful of light - horse who had escorted [[the Duke]682-the duke 's carriage]8894-the duke 's carriage]7887-the handful of light - horse who had escorted the duke 's carriage formed a single line at the foot of the steps , so that the approach to [the porch]6627-the porch was still clear ; but it was plain that [the crowd]1568-the crowd , with its next movement , would break through this slender barrier and hem in [the Duke]290-pianura . At [Odo]234-odo 's appearance the shouting had ceased and every eye was turned on [him]234-odo . [He]234-odo stood there , a brilliant target , in [his]234-odo laced coat of peach - coloured velvet , [his]234-odo breast covered with orders , a hand on [his]234-odo jewelled sword - hilt . For a moment [sovereign and subjects]7892-sovereign and subjects measured [each other]3086-each other ; and in that moment [Odo]234-odo drank [his]234-odo deepest draught of life . [He]234-odo was not thinking now of the constitution or [its opponents]5607-its opponents . [His]234-odo present business was to get down the steps and into [the carriage]8109-the carriage , returning to [the palace]768-the palace as openly as [he]234-odo had come . [He]234-odo was conscious of neither pity nor hatred for [the throng in [his]234-odo path]7897-the throng in his path . For the moment [he]234-odo regarded [them]7897-the throng in his path merely as a natural force , to be fought against like storm or flood . [His]234-odo clearest sensation was one of relief at having at last some material obstacle to spend [his]234-odo strength against , instead of the impalpable powers which had so long beset [him]234-odo . [He]234-odo felt , too , a boyish satisfaction at [his]234-odo own steadiness of pulse and eye , at the absence of that fatal inertia which [he]234-odo had come to dread . So clear was [his]234-odo mental horizon that it embraced not only the present crisis , but a dozen incidents leading up to it . [He]234-odo remembered that [Trescorre]254-trescorre had urged [him]234-odo to take [a larger escort]7898-a larger escort , and that [he]234-odo had refused on the ground that any military display might imply a doubt of [[his]234-odo people]1264-his people . [He]234-odo was glad now that [he]234-odo had done so . [He]234-odo would have hated to slink to [[his]234-odo carriage]2969-his carriage behind a barrier of drawn swords . [He]234-odo wanted no help to see [him]234-odo through this business . The blood sang in [his]234-odo veins at the thought of facing it alone . The silence lasted but a moment ; then an image of [the Mountain Virgin]3961-the mountain virgin was suddenly thrust in air , and a voice cried out : " Down with [[our]10359-we Lady 's enemies]10360-our lady 's enemies ! [We]10359-we want no laws against [the friars]1652-the friars ! "[3925-the virgin] A howl caught up the words and tossed them to and fro above the seething heads . Images of [the Virgin]3925-the virgin , religious banners , the blue - and - white of the Madonna 's colours , suddenly canopied [the crowd]1568-the crowd . " [We]10359-we want [the Barnabites]4313-the barnabites back ! "[1568-the crowd] sang out another voice . " Down with [the free - thinkers]6471-the free - thinkers ! "[7904-a hundred angry throats] yelled [a hundred angry throats]7904-a hundred angry throats . A stone or two sped through the air and struck the sculptures of [the porch]6627-the porch . " [[Your]234-odo Highness]8397-your highness ! "[7904-a hundred angry throats] cried the equerry who stood nearest , and would have snatched [the Duke]682-the duke back within doors . For all answer , [Odo]234-odo stepped clear of [the porch]6627-the porch and advanced to the edge of the steps . As [he]234-odo did so , a shower of missiles hummed about [him]234-odo , and a stone struck [him]234-odo on the lip . The blood rushed to [his]234-odo head , and [he]234-odo swayed in the sudden grip of anger ; but [he]234-odo mastered [himself]234-odo and raised [his]234-odo lace handkerchief to the cut . [[His]234-odo gentlemen]6649-his gentlemen had drawn [their]6649-his gentlemen swords ; but [he]234-odo signed to [them]6649-his gentlemen to sheathe again . [His]234-odo first thought was that [he]234-odo must somehow make [the people]1003-the people hear [him]234-odo . [He]234-odo lifted [his]234-odo hand and advanced a step ; but as [he]234-odo did so a shot rang out , followed by a loud cry . [The lieutenant of the light - horse]7910-the lieutenant of the light - horse , infuriated by the insult to [[his]7910-the lieutenant of the light - horse master]2377-his master , had drawn the pistol from [his]7910-the lieutenant of the light - horse holster and fired blindly into [the crowd]1568-the crowd . [His]7910-the lieutenant of the light - horse bullet had found a mark , and [the throng]1596-the throng hissed and seethed about the spot where [a man]8112-a man had fallen . At the same instant [Odo]234-odo was aware of a commotion in [the group behind [him]234-odo]7915-the group behind him , and with a great plunge of the heart [he]234-odo saw [Fulvia]362-fulvia at [his]234-odo side . [She]362-fulvia still wore the academic dress , and [her]362-fulvia black gown detached itself sharply against the bright colours of the ducal uniforms . Groans and hisses received [her]362-fulvia , but [the mob]3500-the mob hung back , as though [her]362-fulvia look had checked [them]3500-the mob . Then a voice shrieked out : " Down with [the atheist]10365-the atheist ! [We]10366-we want [no foreign witches]10367-no foreign witches ! "[1568-the crowd] and another caught it up with the yell : " [She]362-fulvia poisoned [[the weaver]10368-the weaver 's boy]10369-the weaver 's boy ! [[Her]362-fulvia father]1415-her father was hanged for murdering [Christian children]10371-christian children ! "[1568-the crowd] The cry set [the crowd]1568-the crowd in motion again , and it rolled toward the line of [mounted soldiers at the foot of the steps]7918-mounted soldiers at the foot of the steps . [The men]6838-the men had [their]6838-the men hands on [their]6838-the men holsters ; but [the Duke]682-the duke 's call rang out : " No firing ! "[682-the duke] and drawing [their]6838-the men blades , [they]6838-the men sat motionless to receive the shock . It came , dashed against [them]6838-the men and dispersed [them]6838-the men . Only a few yards lay now between [the people]1003-the people and [[their]1003-the people sovereign]6457-their sovereign . But at that moment another shot was fired . This time it came from the thick of [the crowd]1568-the crowd . [The equerries]7924-the equerries ' swords leapt forth again , and [they]7924-the equerries closed around [the Duke]682-the duke and [Fulvia]362-fulvia . " Save [yourself]234-odo , [sir]8257-sir ! Back into [the building]3122-the building ! "[7926-one of the gentlemen] [one of [the gentlemen]1449-the gentlemen]7926-one of the gentlemen shouted ; but [Odo]234-odo had no eyes for what was coming . For as the shot was heard [he]234-odo had seen a change in [Fulvia]362-fulvia . A moment [they]7928-they had stood together , smiling , undaunted , hands locked and wedded eyes , then [he]234-odo felt [her]362-fulvia dissolve against [him]234-odo and drop between [his]234-odo arms . A cry had gone out that [the Duke]682-the duke was wounded , and a leaden silence fell on [the crowd]1568-the crowd . In that silence [Odo]234-odo knelt , lifting [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's head to [his]234-odo breast . No wound showed through [her]362-fulvia black gown . [She]362-fulvia lay as though smitten by some invisible hand . So deep was the hush that [her]362-fulvia least whisper must have reached [him]234-odo ; but though [he]234-odo bent close no whisper came . The invisible hand had struck the very source of life ; and to [these two]7931-these two , in [their]7931-these two moment of final reunion , with so much unsaid between [them]7931-these two that now at last [they]7931-these two longed to say , there was left only the dumb communion of fast - clouding eyes ... A clatter of cavalry was heard down [the streets]744-the streets that led to [the square]1592-the square . [The equerry sent to warn [Fulvia]362-fulvia]7934-the equerry sent to warn fulvia had escaped from the back of [the building]3122-the building and hastened to [the barracks]10344-the barracks to summon [a regiment]7937-a regiment . But [the soldiery]7938-the soldiery were no longer needed . The blind fury of [the mob]3500-the mob had died of its own excess . The rumour that [the Duke]682-the duke was hurt brought a chill reaction of dismay , and [the rioters]7941-the rioters were already scattering when [the cavalry]7942-the cavalry came in sight . [Their]7942-the cavalry approach turned the slow dispersal to a stampede . A few arrests were made , [the remaining groups]7943-the remaining groups were charged by [the soldiers]7944-the soldiers , and presently [the square]1592-the square lay bare as [a storm - swept plain]7946-a storm - swept plain , though [the people]1003-the people still hung on [its]1592-the square outskirts , ready to disband at the first threat of [the troops]7948-the troops . It was on [this solitude]7949-this solitude that [the Duke]682-the duke looked out as [he]682-the duke regained a sense of [his]682-the duke surroundings . [Fulvia]362-fulvia had been carried into [the audience - chamber]7951-the audience - chamber and laid on the dais , [her]362-fulvia head resting on the velvet cushions of the ducal chair . [She]362-fulvia had died instantly , shot through the heart , and the surgeons summoned in haste had soon ceased from [their]7942-the cavalry ineffectual efforts . For a long time [Odo]234-odo knelt beside [her]362-fulvia , unconscious of all but that one wild moment when life at its highest had been dashed into the gulf of death . Thought had ceased , and neither rage nor grief moved as yet across the chaos of [his]234-odo being . All [his]234-odo life was in [his]234-odo eyes , as they drew up , drop by drop , the precious essence of [her]362-fulvia loveliness . For [she]362-fulvia had grown , beneath the simplifying hand of death , strangely yet most humanly beautiful . Life had fallen from [her]362-fulvia like the husk from the flower , and [she]362-fulvia wore the face of [her]362-fulvia first hopes . The transition had been too swift for any backward look , any anguished rending of the fibres , and [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo , not detached by the stroke , but caught up with [her]362-fulvia into some great calm within the heart of change . [He]234-odo knew not how [he]234-odo found [himself]234-odo once more on [the steps above [the square]1592-the square]7952-the steps above the square . Below [him]234-odo [[his]234-odo state carriage]7954-his state carriage stood in the same place , flanked by [the regiment of cavalry]7955-the regiment of cavalry . Down [the narrow streets]7956-the narrow streets [he]234-odo saw the brooding cloud of [people]1578-people , and the sight roused [his]234-odo blood . [They]7958-they were [[his]234-odo enemies]7760-his enemies now -- [he]234-odo felt the warm hate in [his]234-odo veins . [They]7958-they were [[his]234-odo enemies]7760-his enemies , and [he]234-odo would face [them]7958-they openly . [No closed chariot guarded by [troops]7962-troops]7961-no closed chariot guarded by troops -- [he]234-odo would not have so much as a pane of glass between [himself]234-odo and [[his]234-odo subjects]8419-his subjects . [He]234-odo descended [the steps]7964-the steps , bade [the colonel of the regiment]7965-the colonel of the regiment dismount , and sprang into [his]234-odo saddle . Then , at the head of [[his]234-odo soldiers]7966-his soldiers , at a foot - pace , [he]234-odo rode back through [the packed streets]7967-the packed streets to [the palace]768-the palace . In [the palace]768-the palace , [courtyard]7970-courtyard and [vestibule]7971-vestibule were thronged with [courtiers]5586-courtiers and [lacqueys]7973-lacqueys . [He]234-odo walked through [them]7966-his soldiers with [his]234-odo head high , the cut on [his]234-odo lip like the mark of a hot iron in the dead whiteness of [his]234-odo face . At the head of the great staircase [Maria Clementina]413-maria clementina waited . [She]413-maria clementina sprang forward , distraught and trembling , [her]413-maria clementina face as blanched as [his]234-odo . " [You]234-odo are safe -- [you]234-odo are safe -- [you]234-odo are not hurt-- "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina stammered , catching at [his]234-odo hands . A shudder seized [him]234-odo as [he]234-odo put [her]413-maria clementina aside . " [Odo]234-odo ! [Odo]234-odo ! "[413-maria clementina] [she]413-maria clementina cried passionately , and made as though to bar [his]234-odo way . [He]234-odo gave [her]413-maria clementina a blind look and passed on down [the long gallery]7974-the long gallery to [[his]234-odo closet]3521-his closet . 4.11 . The joy of reprisals lasted no longer than a summer storm . To hurt , to silence , to destroy , was too easy to be satisfying . The passions of [[his]234-odo ancestors]1224-his ancestors burned low in [Odo]234-odo 's breast : though [he]234-odo felt [Bracciaforte]398-bracciaforte 's fury in [his]234-odo veins [he]234-odo could taste no answering gratification of revenge . And the spirit on which [he]234-odo would have spent [his]234-odo hatred was not here or there , as an embodied faction , but everywhere as an intangible influence . [The acqua tofana of [[his]234-odo enemies]7760-his enemies]7977-the acqua tofana of his enemies had pervaded every fibre of [the state]2921-the state . The mist of anguish lifted , [he]234-odo saw [himself]234-odo alone among [ruins]7980-ruins . For a moment [Fulvia]362-fulvia 's glowing faith had hung between [him]234-odo and a final vision of the truth ; and as [his]234-odo convictions weakened [he]234-odo had replaced them with an immense pity , an all - sufficing hope . Sentimental verbiage : [he]234-odo saw it clearly now . [He]234-odo had been the dupe of the old word - jugglery which was forever confounding fact and fancy in [men]8356-men 's minds . For it was essentially an age of words : [the world]844-the world was drunk with them , as it had once been drunk with action ; and the former was the deadlier drug of the two . [He]234-odo looked about [him]234-odo languidly , letting the facts of life filter slowly through [his]234-odo faculties . The sources of energy were so benumbed in [him]234-odo that [he]234-odo felt like [a man whom long disease had reduced to helplessness]7983-a man whom long disease had reduced to helplessness and who must laboriously begin [his]234-odo bodily education again . Hate was the only passion which survived , and that was but a deaf intransitive emotion coiled in [his]234-odo nature 's depths . Sickness at last brought its obliteration . [He]234-odo sank into gulfs of weakness and oblivion , and when the rise of the tide floated [him]234-odo back to life , it was to a life as faint and colourless as infancy . Colourless too were the boundaries on which [he]234-odo looked out : the narrow enclosure of white walls , opening on a slit of pale spring landscape . [His]234-odo hands lay before [him]234-odo , white and helpless on the white coverlet of [his]234-odo bed . [He]234-odo raised [his]234-odo eyes and saw [de Crucis]462-de crucis at [his]234-odo side . Then [he]234-odo began to remember . There had been preceding intervals of consciousness , and in one of them , in answer perhaps to some vaguely - uttered wish for light and air , [he]234-odo had been carried out of [the palace]768-the palace and [the city]2261-the city to [the Benedictine monastery on [[its]7986-the benedictine monastery on its wooded knoll beyond the piana wooded knoll beyond [the Piana]94-the piana]7987-its wooded knoll beyond the piana]7986-the benedictine monastery on its wooded knoll beyond the piana . Then the veil had dropped again , and [his]234-odo spirit had wandered in a dim place of shades . There was a faint sweetness in coming back at last to familiar sights and sounds . They no longer hurt like pressure on an aching nerve : they seemed rather , now , the touch of a reassuring hand . As the contact with life became closer and more sustained [he]234-odo began to watch [himself]234-odo curiously , wondering what instincts and habits of thought would survive [his]234-odo long mental death . It was with a bitter , almost pitiable disappointment that [he]234-odo found [the old man]1195-the old man growing again in [him]234-odo . Life , with a mocking hand , brought [him]234-odo the cast - off vesture of [his]234-odo past , and [he]234-odo felt [himself]234-odo gradually compressed again into the old passions and prejudices . Yet [he]234-odo wore them with a difference -- they were a cramping garment rather than a living sheath . [He]234-odo had brought back from [his]234-odo lonely voyagings a sense of estrangement deeper than any surface - affinity with things . As [his]234-odo physical strength returned , and [he]234-odo was able to leave [[his]234-odo room]7989-his room and walk through [the long corridors]847-the long corridors to the outer air , [he]234-odo felt the old spell which the life of [Monte Cassino]142-monte cassino had cast on [him]234-odo . [The quiet garden]7991-the quiet garden , with [its]7991-the quiet garden clumps of box and lavender between paths converging to the statue of [Saint Benedict]556-saint benedict ; [the cloisters]7992-the cloisters paved with [the monks]1356-the monks ' nameless graves ; the traces of devotional painting left here and there on the weather - beaten walls , like fragments of prayer in a world - worn mind : these formed a circle of tranquillising influences in which [he]234-odo could gradually reacquire the habit of living . [He]234-odo had never deceived [himself]234-odo as to the cause of the riots . [He]234-odo knew from [Gamba]282-gamba and [Andreoni]441-andreoni that [the liberals]9304-the liberals and [the court]814-the court , for once working in unison , had provoked the blind outburst of fanaticism which a rasher judgment might have ascribed to [the clergy]1929-the clergy . [The Dominicans]422-the dominicans , bigoted and eager for power , had been ready enough to serve such an end , and some of [the begging orders]7997-the begging orders had furnished the necessary points of contact with [the people]1003-the people ; but the movement was at bottom purely political , and represented the resistance of [the privileged classes]7130-the privileged classes to any attack on [their]7130-the privileged classes inherited rights . As such , [he]234-odo could no longer regard it as completely unreasonable . [He]234-odo was beginning to feel the social and political significance of those old restrictions and barriers against which [his]234-odo early zeal had tilted . Certainly in the ideal state the rights and obligations of [the different classes]8000-the different classes would be more evenly adjusted . But the ideal state was a figment of the brain . The real one , as [Crescenti]234-odo had long ago pointed out , was the gradual and heterogeneous product of remote social conditions , wherein every seeming inconsistency had its roots in some bygone need , and the character of [each class , with its special passions , ignorances and prejudices]8001-each class , with its special passions , ignorances and prejudices , was the sum total of influences so ingrown and inveterate that they had become a law of thought . All this , however , seemed rather matter for philosophic musing than for definite action . [His]234-odo predominant feeling was still that of remoteness from the immediate issues of life : the soeva indignatio had been succeeded by a great calm . The soothing influences of the monastic life had doubtless helped to tide [him]234-odo over the stormy passage of returning consciousness . [His]234-odo sensitiveness to these influences inclined [him]234-odo for the first time to consider them analytically . Hitherto [he]234-odo had regarded [the Church]72-the church as a skilfully - adjusted engine , the product of human passions scientifically combined to obtain the greatest sum of tangible results . Now [he]234-odo saw that [he]234-odo had never penetrated beneath the surface . For [the Church which grasped , contrived , calculated , struggled for temporal possessions and used material weapons against [spiritual foes]8003-spiritual foes]8002-the church which grasped , contrived , calculated , struggled for temporal possessions and used material weapons against spiritual foes -- [this outer Church]8004-this outer church was nothing more than the body , which , like any other animal body , had to care for [its]8002-the church which grasped , contrived , calculated , struggled for temporal possessions and used material weapons against spiritual foes own gross needs , nourish , clothe , defend itself , fight for a footing among the material resistances of life -- while the soul , the inner animating principle , might dwell aloof from all these things , in a clear medium of its own . To this soul of [the Church]1212-the church [his]234-odo daily life now brought [him]234-odo close . [He]234-odo felt it in the ordered beneficence of [the great community]8006-the great community , in the simplicity of [its]8006-the great community external life and the richness and suavity of its inner relations . [No alliance based on material interests]8007-no alliance based on material interests , no love of power working toward a common end , could have created that harmony of thought and act which was reflected in every face about [him]234-odo . [Each of [these men]6733-these men]8008-each of these men seemed to have FOUND OUT SOMETHING of which [he]234-odo was still ignorant . What it was , [de Crucis]462-de crucis tried to tell [him]234-odo as [they]8010-they paced [the cloisters]7992-the cloisters together or sat in the warm stillness of [the budding garden]8012-the budding garden . At the first news of [the Duke]682-the duke 's illness [the Jesuit]5602-the jesuit had hastened to [Pianura]290-pianura . No companionship could have been so satisfying to [Odo]234-odo . [De Crucis]462-de crucis 's mental attitude toward [mankind]2662-mankind might have been defined as an illuminated charity . To love [men]8356-men , or to understand [them]8356-men , is not as unusual as to do both together ; and it was the intellectual acuteness of [[his]5602-the jesuit friend]2124-his friend 's judgments that made [their]8010-they Christian amenity so seductive to [Odo]234-odo . " The highest claim of Christianity , "[5602-the jesuit] [the Jesuit]5602-the jesuit said one morning , as [they]8010-they sat on a worn stone bench at the end of [the sunny vine - walk]8019-the sunny vine - walk , " is that it has come nearer to solving the problem of [men]8356-men 's relations to [each other]3086-each other than any system invented by [themselves]8356-men . This , after all , is the secret principle of [the Church]1212-the church 's vitality . [She]10377-she gave a spiritual charter of equality to [mankind]2662-mankind long before [the philosophers]8362-the philosophers thought of giving [them]2662-mankind a material one . If , all the while , [she]10377-she has been fighting for dominion , arrogating to [herself]10377-she special privileges , struggling to preserve the old lines of social and legal demarcation , it has been because for nigh two thousand years [she]10377-she has cherished in [her]10377-she breast [the one free city of the spirit]10380-the one free city of the spirit , because to guard [its]10380-the one free city of the spirit liberties [she]10377-she has had to defend and strengthen [her]10377-she own position . [I]5602-the jesuit do not ask [you]10381-you to consider whence comes this insight into the needs of [man]2185-man , this mysterious power over [him]2185-man ; [I]5602-the jesuit ask [you]10381-you simply to confess [them]2662-mankind in [their]2662-mankind results . [I]5602-the jesuit am not of those who believe that [God]249-god permits good to come to mankind through one channel only , and [I]5602-the jesuit doubt not that now and in times past [the thinkers whom [[your]10381-you Highness follows]10384-your highness follows have done much to raise the condition of [[their]10383-the thinkers whom your highness follows have done much to raise the condition of their fellows fellows]10385-their fellows]10383-the thinkers whom your highness follows have done much to raise the condition of their fellows ; but [I]5602-the jesuit would have [you]10381-you observe that , where [they]10383-the thinkers whom your highness follows have done much to raise the condition of their fellows have done so , it has been because , at bottom , [their]10383-the thinkers whom your highness follows have done much to raise the condition of their fellows aims coincided with [the Church]72-the church 's . The deeper [you]10381-you probe into [her]10386-her secret sources of power , the more [you]10381-you find there , in the germ if [you]10381-you will , but still potentially active , all those humanising energies which work together for the lifting of the race . In [her]10386-her wisdom and [her]10386-her patience [she]10386-her may have seen fit to withhold [their]10383-the thinkers whom your highness follows have done much to raise the condition of their fellows expression , to let [them]10383-the thinkers whom your highness follows have done much to raise the condition of their fellows seek another outlet ; but they are there , stored in [her]10386-her consciousness like the archetypes of [the Platonists]10387-the platonists in the Universal Mind . It is the knowledge of this , the sure knowledge of it , which creates the atmosphere of serenity that [you]10381-you feel about [you]10381-you . From the tilling of [the vineyards]5294-the vineyards , or the dressing of [a beggar]2730-a beggar 's sores , to the loftiest and most complicated intellectual labour imposed on [him]2730-a beggar , [each brother]10390-each brother knows that [his]2730-a beggar daily task is part of a great scheme of action , working ever from imperfection to perfection , from human incompleteness to the divine completion . This sense of being , not straws on a blind wind of chance , but units in an ordered force , gives to [the humblest Christian an individual]10391-the humblest christian an individual security and dignity which kings on [their]10391-the humblest christian an individual thrones might envy . "[5602-the jesuit] But not only does [the Church]1212-the church anticipate every tendency of [mankind]2662-mankind ; alone of all powers [she]1212-the church knows how to control and direct the passions [she]1212-the church excites . This it is which makes [her]1212-the church an auxiliary that [no temporal prince]8022-no temporal prince can well despise . It is in this aspect that [I]0-i would have [[your]8023-your Highness]8397-your highness consider [her]1212-the church . Do not underrate [her]1212-the church power because it seems based on the commoner instincts rather than on the higher faculties of [man]2185-man . That is one of the sources of [her]1212-the church strength . [She]1212-the church can support [her]1212-the church claims by reason and argument , but it is because [her]1212-the church work , like that of [[her]1212-the church divine Founder]8026-her divine founder , lies chiefly among [those who can neither reason nor argue]8027-those who can neither reason nor argue , that [she]1212-the church chooses to rest [her]1212-the church appeal on the simplest and most universal emotions . As , in [[our]8028-our towns]8029-our towns , [the streets]744-the streets are lit mainly by the tapers before the shrines of [the saints]1218-the saints , so the way of life would be dark to [the great multitude of [men]8356-men]8032-the great multitude of men but for the light of faith burning within [them]8032-the great multitude of men ... " Meanwhile the shufflings of destiny had brought to [Trescorre]254-trescorre the prize for which [he]254-trescorre waited . During [the Duke]682-the duke 's illness [he]254-trescorre had been appointed [regent of [Pianura]4-pianura]10393-regent of pianura , and [[his]254-trescorre sovereign]928-his sovereign 's reluctance to take up the cares of government had now left [him]254-trescorre for six months in authority . The day after the proclaiming of the constitution [Odo]234-odo had withdrawn [his]234-odo signature from it , on the ground that the concessions it contained were inopportune . The functions of government went on again in the old way . The old abuses persisted , the old offences were condoned : it was as though the apathy of [the sovereign]1435-the sovereign had been communicated to [[his]1435-the sovereign people]1264-his people . Centuries of submission were in [their]1264-his people blood , and for two generations there had been no warfare south of [the Alps]20-the alps . For the moment [men]8356-men 's minds were turned to the great events going forward in [France]22-france . It had not yet occurred to [the Italians]557-the italians that the recoil of these events might be felt among [themselves]557-the italians . [They]557-the italians were simply [amused spectators , roused at last to the significance of the show]10398-amused spectators , roused at last to the significance of the show , but never dreaming that [they]557-the italians might soon be called from the wings to the footlights . To [de Crucis]462-de crucis , however , the possibility of such a call was already present , and it was [he]234-odo who pressed [the Duke]682-the duke to return to [his]682-the duke post . A deep reluctance held [Odo]234-odo back . [He]234-odo would have liked to linger on in [the monastery]1571-the monastery , leading the tranquil yet busy life of [the monks]1356-the monks , and trying to read the baffling riddle of its completeness . At that moment it seemed to [him]234-odo of vastly more importance to discover the exact nature of the soul -- whether it was in fact a metaphysical entity , as [these men]6733-these men believed , or a mere secretion of the brain , as [he]234-odo had been taught to think -- than to go back and govern [[his]234-odo people]1264-his people . For what mattered the rest , if [he]234-odo had been mistaken about the soul ? With a start [he]234-odo realised that [he]234-odo was going as [[his]234-odo cousin]670-his cousin had gone -- that this was but another form of the fatal lethargy that hung upon [his]234-odo race . An effort of the will drew [him]234-odo back to [Pianura]4-pianura , and made [him]234-odo resume the semblance of authority ; but it carried [him]234-odo no farther . [Trescorre]254-trescorre ostensibly became [prime minister]10405-prime minister , and in reality remained [the head of [the state]2921-the state]10406-the head of the state . [The Duke]290-pianura was present at the cabinet meetings but took no part in the direction of affairs . [His]290-pianura mind was lost in a maze of metaphysical speculations ; and even these served [him]290-pianura merely as some cunningly - contrived toy with which to trick [his]290-pianura leisure . [His]290-pianura revocation of the charter had necessarily separated [him]290-pianura from [Gamba]282-gamba and [the advanced liberals]10408-the advanced liberals . [He]290-pianura knew that [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback , ever scornful of expediency , charged [him]290-pianura with disloyalty to [the people]1003-the people ; but such charges could no longer wound . The events following [the Duke]290-pianura 's birthday had served to crystallise the schemes of [the little liberal group]10411-the little liberal group , and [they]10411-the little liberal group now formed a campaign of active opposition to [the government]2558-the government , attacking [it]2558-the government by means of pamphlets and lampoons , and by such public speaking as [the police]8784-the police allowed . [The new professors of [the University , ardently in sympathy with the constitutional movement]10415-the university , ardently in sympathy with the constitutional movement]10414-the new professors of the university , ardently in sympathy with the constitutional movement , used [their]10414-the new professors of the university , ardently in sympathy with the constitutional movement lectures as means of political teaching , and [the old stronghold of dogma]10416-the old stronghold of dogma became the centre of destructive criticism . But as yet these ideas formed but a single live point in the general numbness . Two years passed in this way . [North of [the Alps]20-the alps]10417-north of the alps , [all Europe]10418-all europe was convulsed , while [Italy]5-italy was still but [a sleeper who tosses in [his]10419-a sleeper who tosses in his sleep sleep]10419-a sleeper who tosses in his sleep . In the two Sicilies , the arrogance and perfidy of [the government]2558-the government gave a few martyrs to the cause , and in [Bologna]79-bologna there was a brief revolutionary outbreak ; but for the most part [the Italian states]8941-the italian states were sinking into inanition . [Venice]41-venice , by recalling [her]41-venice fleet from [Greece]155-greece , let fall [the dominion of [the sea]5255-the sea]10422-the dominion of the sea . Twenty years earlier [Genoa]23-genoa had basely yielded [Corsica]224-corsica to [France]22-france . [The Pope]1248-the pope condemned [the French]558-the french for [their]558-the french outrages on religion , and [[his]1248-the pope subjects]8419-his subjects murdered [Basseville]559-basseville , [the agent of [the new republic]10427-the new republic]10426-the agent of the new republic . The sympathies and impulses of [the various states]10428-the various states were as contradictory as they were ineffectual . Meanwhile , in [France]22-france , [Europe]40-europe was trying to solve at a stroke the problems of a thousand years . All the repressed passions which civilisation had sought , however imperfectly , to curb , stalked abroad destructive as flood and fire . [The great generation of the Encyclopaedists]10429-the great generation of the encyclopaedists had passed away , and the teachings of [Rousseau]340-rousseau had prevailed over those of [Montesquieu]417-the marquis de montesquieu and [Voltaire]310-voltaire . The sober sense of [the economists]10430-the economists was swept aside by the sound and fury of the demagogues , and [France]22-france was become a very Babel of tongues . The old malady of words had swept over [the world]844-the world like a pestilence . To [the little Italian courts]10432-the little italian courts , still dozing in fancied security under the wing of [Bourbon]225-bourbon and [Hapsburg]226-hapsburg suzerains , these rumours were borne by the wild flight of [emigres -- dead leaves loosened by the first blast of the storm]10433-emigres -- dead leaves loosened by the first blast of the storm . Month by month [they]10433-emigres -- dead leaves loosened by the first blast of the storm poured across [the Alps]20-the alps in ever - increasing numbers , bringing confused contradictory tales of anarchy and outrage . Among those whom chance thus carried to [Pianura]4-pianura were [certain familiars of [the Duke]682-the duke 's earlier life]10434-certain familiars of the duke 's earlier life -- [the Count Alfieri]306-alfieri and [[his]306-alfieri royal mistress]10436-his royal mistress , flying from [Paris]27-paris , and arriving breathless with the tale of [their]10434-certain familiars of the duke 's earlier life private injuries . To [the poet of revolt]10437-the poet of revolt this sudden realisation of [his]306-alfieri doctrines seemed in fact a purely personal outrage . It was as though [a man writing an epic poem on an earthquake]10438-a man writing an epic poem on an earthquake should suddenly find [himself]10438-a man writing an epic poem on an earthquake engulphed . To [Alfieri]306-alfieri the downfall of the French monarchy and the triumph of democratic ideas meant simply that [his]306-alfieri French investments had shrunk to nothing , and that [he]306-alfieri , [the greatest poet of the age]10439-the greatest poet of the age , had been obliged , at an immense sacrifice of personal dignity , to plead with [a drunken mob]10440-a drunken mob for leave to escape from [Paris]27-paris . To the wider aspect of the "[8034-instigators of false liberty] tragic farce , " as [he]306-alfieri called it , [his]306-alfieri eyes remained obstinately closed . [He]306-alfieri viewed the whole revolutionary movement as a conspiracy against [his]306-alfieri comfort , and boasted that during [his]306-alfieri enforced residence in [France]22-france [he]306-alfieri had not so much as exchanged a word with [one of [the "[8034-instigators of false liberty] French slaves]10442-the " french slaves]10441-one of the " french slaves , [instigators of false liberty]8034-instigators of false liberty , " who , by trying to put into action the principles taught in [his]306-alfieri previous works , had so grievously interfered with the composition of fresh masterpieces . The royal pretensions of [the Countess of [Albany]148-albany]5166-the countess of albany -- pretentions affirmed rather than abated as the tide of revolution rose -- made it impossible that [she]5166-the countess of albany should be received at [the court of [Pianura]4-pianura]10444-the court of pianura ; but [the Duke]682-the duke found a mild entertainment in [[Alfieri]306-alfieri 's company]10446-alfieri 's company . [The poet]2275-the poet 's revulsion of feeling seemed to Odo like the ironic laughter of the fates . [His]306-alfieri thoughts returned to the midnight meetings of [the Honey Bees]357-the honey - bees , and to the first vision of that face which [men]8356-men had lain down [their]8356-men lives to see . [Men]8356-men had looked on that face since then , and its horror was reflected in [their]8356-men own . [Other fugitives to [Pianura]4-pianura]10450-other fugitives to pianura brought another impression of events -- that comic note which life , [the supreme dramatic artist]10451-the supreme dramatic artist , never omits from [her]10451-the supreme dramatic artist tragedies . These were [[the Duke]682-the duke 's old friend]10453-the duke 's old friend [the Marquis de Coeur - Volant]473-the marquis de coeur - volant , fleeing from [[his]473-the marquis de coeur - volant chateau]10454-his chateau as [the peasants]8472-the peasants put the torch to it , and arriving in [Pianura]4-pianura destitute , gouty and middle - aged , but imperturbable and epigrammatic as ever . With [him]306-alfieri came [[his]306-alfieri Marquise]10456-his marquise , [a dark - eyed lady , stout to unwieldiness and much given to devotion]10457-a dark - eyed lady , stout to unwieldiness and much given to devotion , in whom it was whispered ( though [he]306-alfieri introduced [her]10456-his marquise as [the daughter of [a Venetian Senator]10459-a venetian senator]10458-the daughter of a venetian senator ) that a reminiscent eye might still detect the outline of [the gracefullest Columbine who had ever flitted across [the Italian stage]10461-the italian stage]10460-the gracefullest columbine who had ever flitted across the italian stage . [These visitors]10462-these visitors were lodged by [the Duke]682-the duke 's kindness in [the Palazzo Cerveno]10464-the palazzo cerveno , near [the ducal residence]10465-the ducal residence ; and though [the ladies of [Pianura]4-pianura]10466-the ladies of pianura were inclined to look askance on [the Marquise]10467-the marquise 's genealogy , yet [[his]306-alfieri Highness]941-his highness 's condescension , and [her]941-his highness own edifying piety , had soon allayed these scruples , and [the salon of [Madame de Coeur - Volant]560-madame de coeur - volant]10469-the salon of madame de coeur - volant became the rival of [Madame d'Albany]10470-madame d'albany 's . It was , in fact , the more entertaining of [the two]812-the two ; for , in spite of [[his]306-alfieri lady]1996-his lady 's austere views , [the Marquis]10473-the marquis retained that gift of social flexibility that was already becoming the tradition of a happier day . To [the Marquis]10473-the marquis , indeed , the revolution was execrable not so much because of the hardships it inflicted , as because it was the forerunner of social dissolution -- the breaking - up of the regime which had made manners the highest morality , and conversation the chief end of [man]2185-man . [He]10473-the marquis could have lived gaily on a crust in good company and amid smiling faces ; but the social deficiencies of [Pianura]290-pianura were more difficult to endure than any material privation . In [Italy]5-italy , as [the Marquis]10473-the marquis had more than once remarked , [people]1578-people loved , gambled , wrote poetry , and patronised the arts ; but , alas , [they]1578-people did not converse . [Coeur - Volant]560-madame de coeur - volant could not conceal from [[his]306-alfieri Highness]941-his highness that there was no conversation in [Pianura]4-pianura ; but [he]306-alfieri did [his]306-alfieri best to fill the void by the constant exercise of [his]306-alfieri own gift in that direction , and to [Odo]234-odo at least [his]306-alfieri talk seemed as good as it was copious . Misfortune had given a finer savour to [the Marquis]10473-the marquis 's philosophy , and there was a kind of heroic grace in [his]10473-the marquis undisturbed cultivation of the amenities . While [the Marquis]10473-the marquis was struggling to preserve the conversational art , and [Alfieri]306-alfieri planning the savage revenge of [the Misogallo]561-the misogallo , the course of affairs in [France]22-france had gained a wilder impetus . The abolition of [the nobility]1665-the nobility , the flight and capture of [the King]658-the king , [his]10473-the marquis enforced declaration of war against [Austria]100-austria , the massacres of [Avignon]227-avignon , the sack of [the Tuileries]10483-the tuileries -- such events seemed incredible enough till the next had crowded [them]10484-them out of mind . The new year rose in blood and mounted to a bloodier noon . All the old defences were falling . Religion , monarchy , law , were sucked down into the whirlpool of liberated passions . Across that sanguinary scene passed , like a mocking ghost , [the philosophers]8362-the philosophers ' vision of the perfectibility of [man]2185-man . [Man]2185-man was free at last -- freer than [[his]2185-man would - be liberators]10488-his would - be liberators had ever dreamed of making [him]2185-man -- and [he]2185-man used [his]2185-man freedom like a beast . For [the multitude]10489-the multitude had risen -- that multitude which [no man]7588-no man could number , which even [the demagogues who ranted in its name had never seriously reckoned with]10491-the demagogues who ranted in its name had never seriously reckoned with -- [that dim , grovelling indistinguishable mass on which the whole social structure]10492-that dim , grovelling indistinguishable mass on which the whole social structure rested . It was as though the very soil moved , rising in mountains or yawning in chasms about the feet of [those who had so long securely battened on it]10493-those who had so long securely battened on it . [The earth]1750-the earth shook , the sun and moon were darkened , and [the people]1003-the people , [the terrible unknown people]10496-the terrible unknown people , had put in the sickle to the harvest . [Italy]5-italy roused [herself]5-italy at last . [The emissaries of [the new France]10498-the new france]10497-the emissaries of the new france were swarming across [the Alps]10499-the alps , pervading [the peninsula]10500-the peninsula as [the Jesuits]2221-the jesuits had once pervaded [Europe]40-europe ; and in the mind of [a young general of the republican army visions of Italian conquest]10502-a young general of the republican army visions of italian conquest were already forming . In [Pianura]4-pianura [the revolutionary agents]10503-the revolutionary agents found [a strong republican party headed by [Gamba]282-gamba and [[his]282-gamba friends]2637-his friends]10504-a strong republican party headed by gamba and his friends , and [a government weakened by debt and dissensions]10506-a government weakened by debt and dissensions . The air was thick with intrigue . [The little army]10507-the little army could no longer be counted on , and a prolonged bread - riot had driven [Trescorre]254-trescorre out of [the ministry]10508-the ministry and compelled [the Duke]682-the duke to appoint [Andreoni]441-andreoni in [his]254-trescorre place . Behind [Andreoni]441-andreoni stood [Gamba]282-gamba and [the radicals]10510-the radicals . There could be no doubt which way the fortunes of [the duchy]1310-the duchy tended . [[The Duke]682-the duke 's would - be protectors]10513-the duke 's would - be protectors , [Austria]100-austria and [the Holy See]2918-the holy see , were too busy organising the hasty coalition of the powers to come to [his]682-the duke aid , had [he]682-the duke cared to call on [them]10513-the duke 's would - be protectors . But to do so would have been but another way of annihilation . To preserve the individuality of [[his]682-the duke state]7150-his state , or to merge it in the vision of [a United Italy]6933-a united italy , seemed to [him]682-the duke the only alternatives worth fighting for . The former was a futile dream , the latter seemed for a brief moment possible . [Piedmont]60-piedmont , ever loyal to the monarchical principle , was calling on [[her]60-piedmont sister states]10517-her sister states to arm [themselves]10517-her sister states against the French invasion . But the response was reluctant and uncertain . Private ambitions and petty jealousies hampered every attempt at union . [Austria]100-austria , [the Bourbons]562-the bourbons and [the Holy See]2918-the holy see held the Italian principalities in a network of conflicting interests and obligations that rendered free action impossible . [Sadly Victor Amadeus]563-sadly victor amadeus armed [himself]682-the duke alone against [the enemy]4398-the enemy . Under such conditions [Odo]234-odo could do little to direct the course of events . [They]10513-the duke 's would - be protectors had passed into more powerful hands than [his]234-odo . But [he]234-odo could at least declare [himself]234-odo for or against the mighty impulse which was behind [them]10513-the duke 's would - be protectors . The ideas [he]234-odo had striven for had triumphed at last , and [his]234-odo surest hold on authority was to share openly in [their]10513-the duke 's would - be protectors triumph . A profound horror dragged [him]234-odo back . The new principles were not those for which [he]234-odo had striven . [The goddess of the new worship]10520-the goddess of the new worship was but [a bloody Maenad who had borrowed the attributes of freedom]10521-a bloody maenad who had borrowed the attributes of freedom . [He]234-odo could not bow the knee in [such a charnel - house]10522-such a charnel - house . Tranquilly , resolutely , [he]234-odo took up the policy of repression . [He]234-odo knew the attempt was foredoomed to failure , but that made no difference now : [he]234-odo was simply acting out the inevitable . The last act came with unexpected suddenness . [The Duke]682-the duke woke one morning to find [the citadel]10524-the citadel in the possession of [the people]1003-the people . [The impregnable stronghold of [Bracciaforte]398-bracciaforte]10526-the impregnable stronghold of bracciaforte was in the hands of [the serfs whose fathers had toiled to build [it]10526-the impregnable stronghold of bracciaforte]10527-the serfs whose fathers had toiled to build it , and [the last descendant of [Bracciaforte]398-bracciaforte]10528-the last descendant of bracciaforte was virtually [a prisoner in [[his]10528-the last descendant of bracciaforte palace]853-his palace]10529-a prisoner in his palace . The revolution took place quietly , without violence or bloodshed . [Andreoni]441-andreoni waited on [the Duke]682-the duke , and [a cabinet - council]10532-a cabinet - council was summoned . [The ministers]10533-the ministers affected to have yielded reluctantly to popular pressure . All [they]10533-the ministers asked was a constitution and the assurance that no resistance would be offered to [the French]558-the french . [The Duke]682-the duke requested a few hours for deliberation . Left alone , [he]682-the duke summoned [[the Duchess]899-the duchess 's chamberlain]10536-the duchess 's chamberlain . [The ducal pair]10537-the ducal pair no longer met save on occasions of state : [they]10537-the ducal pair had not exchanged a word since the death of [Fulvia Vivaldi]362-fulvia . [Odo]234-odo sent word to [[her]899-the duchess Highness]8209-her highness that [he]234-odo could no longer answer for [her]899-the duchess security while [she]899-the duchess remained in [the duchy]1310-the duchy , and that [he]234-odo begged [her]899-the duchess to leave immediately for [Vienna]73-vienna . [She]899-the duchess replied that [she]899-the duchess was obliged for [his]234-odo warning , but that while [he]234-odo remained in [Pianura]4-pianura [her]899-the duchess place was at [his]234-odo side . It was the answer [he]234-odo had expected -- [he]234-odo had never doubted [her]899-the duchess courage -- but it was essential to [his]234-odo course that [she]899-the duchess should leave [the duchy]1310-the duchy without delay , and after a moment 's reflection [he]234-odo wrote a letter in which [he]234-odo informed [her]899-the duchess that [he]234-odo must insist on [her]899-the duchess obedience . No answer was returned , but [he]234-odo learned that [she]899-the duchess had turned white , and tearing the letter in shreds had called for [her]899-the duchess travelling - carriage within the hour . [He]234-odo sent to enquire when [he]234-odo might take leave of [her]899-the duchess , but [she]899-the duchess excused [herself]899-the duchess on the plea of indisposition , and before nightfall [he]234-odo heard the departing rattle of [her]899-the duchess wheels . [He]234-odo immediately summoned [Andreoni]441-andreoni and announced [his]441-andreoni unconditional refusal of the terms proposed to [him]441-andreoni . [He]441-andreoni would not give a constitution or promise allegiance to [the French]558-the french . [The minister]4767-the minister withdrew , and [Odo]234-odo was left alone . [He]234-odo had dismissed [[his]234-odo gentlemen]6649-his gentlemen , and as [he]234-odo sat in [his]234-odo closet a sense of deathlike isolation came over [him]234-odo . Never had [the palace]768-the palace seemed so silent or so vast . [He]234-odo had not [a friend]8895-a friend to turn to . [De Crucis]462-de crucis was in [Germany]131-germany , and [Trescorre]254-trescorre , it was reported , had privately attended [the Duchess]899-the duchess in [her]899-the duchess flight . The waves of destiny seemed closing over [Odo]234-odo , and the circumstances of [his]234-odo past rose , poignant and vivid , before [his]234-odo drowning sight . And suddenly , in that moment of failure and abandonment , it seemed to [him]234-odo again that life was worth the living . [His]234-odo indifference fell from [him]234-odo like a garment . The old passion of action awoke and [he]234-odo felt a new warmth in [his]234-odo breast . After all , the struggle was not yet over : though [Piedmont]60-piedmont had called in vain on [the Italian states]8941-the italian states , an Italian sword might still be drawn in [her]899-the duchess service .
