If [[his]234-odo people]1264-his people would not follow [him]234-odo against [France]22-france [he]234-odo could still march against [her]899-the duchess alone . Old memories hummed in [him]234-odo at the thought . [He]234-odo recalled how [[his]234-odo Piedmontese ancestors]10548-his piedmontese ancestors had gone forth against [the same foe]10549-the same foe , and the stout [Donnaz]255-donnaz blood began to bubble in [his]234-odo veins . A knock roused [him]234-odo and [Gamba]282-gamba entered by the private way . [His]282-gamba appearance was not unexpected to [Odo]234-odo , and served only to reinforce [his]282-gamba new - found energy . [He]234-odo felt that the issue was at hand . As [he]234-odo expected , [Gamba]282-gamba had been sent to put before [him]234-odo more forcibly and unceremoniously the veiled threat of [the ministers]10533-the ministers . But [the hunchback]8158-the hunchback had come also to plead with [[his]8158-the hunchback master]2377-his master in [his]8158-the hunchback own name , and in the name of the ideas for which [they]10553-they had once laboured together . [He]234-odo could not believe that [the Duke]682-the duke 's reaction was more than momentary . [He]234-odo could not calculate the strength of the old associations which , now that the tide had set the other way , were dragging [Odo]234-odo back to the beliefs and traditions of [[his]8158-the hunchback caste]10555-his caste . [The Duke]682-the duke listened in silence ; then [he]0-i said : "[8034-instigators of false liberty] Discussion is idle . [I]0-i have no answer to give but that which [I]0-i have already given . " [He]0-i rose from [his]0-i seat in token of dismissal . The moment was painful to [both men]10557-both men . [Gamba]282-gamba drew nearer and fell at [the Duke]682-the duke 's feet . "[8035-you] [[Your]8035-you Highness]8397-your highness , " [he]282-gamba said , "[8035-you] consider what this means . [We]8037-we hold [the state]2921-the state in [our]8037-we hands . If [you]8035-you are against [us]8037-we [you]8035-you are powerless . If [you]8035-you are with [us]8037-we [we]8037-we can promise [you]8035-you more power than [you]8035-you ever dreamed of possessing . " [The Duke]682-the duke looked at [him]8035-you with a musing smile . "[8035-you] It is as though [you]8035-you offered [me]0-i gold in [a desert island]8039-a desert island , " [he]0-i said . "[8035-you] Do not waste such poor bribes on [me]0-i . [I]0-i care for no power but the power to wipe out the work of these last years . Failing that , [I]0-i want nothing that [you]8035-you or [any other man]8040-any other man can give . " [Gamba]282-gamba was silent a moment . [He]282-gamba turned aside into the embrasure of the window , and when [he]282-gamba spoke again it was in a voice broken with grief . "[8035-you] [[Your]8035-you Highness]8397-your highness , " [he]282-gamba said , "[8035-you] if [your]8035-you choice is made , [ours]8042-we is made also . It is a hard choice , but these are fratricidal hours . [We]8042-we have come to the parting of the ways . " [The Duke]682-the duke made no sign , and [Gamba]282-gamba went on with gathering anguish : "[8042-we] [We]8042-we would have gone to [the world]844-the world 's end with [[your]8035-you Highness]8397-your highness for [[our]8042-we leader]8045-our leader ! " "[8397-your highness] With [a leader whom [you]8035-you could lead]8046-a leader whom you could lead , " [Odo]234-odo interposed . [He]234-odo went up to [Gamba]282-gamba and laid a hand on [his]282-gamba shoulder . "[8397-your highness] Speak out , [man]2185-man , " [he]234-odo said . "[2185-man] Say what [you]8035-you were sent to say . Am [I]0-i [a prisoner]8048-a prisoner ? " [The hunchback]8158-the hunchback burst into tears . [Odo]234-odo , with [his]234-odo arms crossed , stood leaning against the window . The other 's anguish seemed to deepen [his]234-odo detachment . "[8397-your highness] [[Your]8035-you Highness]8397-your highness -- [your]8035-you Highness-- " [Gamba]282-gamba stammered . [The Duke]682-the duke made an impatient gesture . "[8035-you] Come , make an end , " [he]682-the duke said . [Gamba]282-gamba fell back with a profound bow . "[8050-we] [We]8050-we do not ask the surrender of [[your]8035-you Highness 's person]10039-your highness 's person , " [he]8035-you said . "[8050-we] Not even that ? " [Odo]234-odo returned with a faint sneer . [Gamba]282-gamba flushed to the temples , but the retort died on [his]282-gamba lips . "[8397-your highness] [[Your]8035-you Highness]8397-your highness , " [he]8035-you said , scarce above a whisper , "[8397-your highness] the gates are guarded ; but the word for tonight is ' Humilitas . ' " [He]8035-you knelt and kissed [Odo]234-odo 's hand . Then [he]8035-you rose and passed out of [the room]782-the room ... * * * * * Before dawn [the Duke]682-the duke left [the palace]768-the palace . The high emotions of the night had ebbed . [He]682-the duke saw [himself]682-the duke now , in the ironic light of morning , as [a fugitive too harmless to be worth pursuing]8056-a fugitive too harmless to be worth pursuing . [[His]682-the duke enemies]7760-his enemies had let [him]682-the duke keep [his]682-the duke sword because [they]7760-his enemies had no cause to fear it . Alone [he]682-the duke passed through [[the gardens]8159-the gardens of [the palace]768-the palace]9442-the gardens of the palace , and out into the desert darkness of [the streets]744-the streets . Skirting the wall of [the Benedictine convent where [Fulvia]362-fulvia had lodged]8062-the benedictine convent where fulvia had lodged , [he]682-the duke gained [a street]8063-a street leading to [the marketplace]8064-the marketplace . In the pallor of the waning night the ancient monuments of [his]682-the duke race stood up mournful and deserted as a line of [tombs]8065-tombs . [The city]2261-the city seemed [a grave - yard]8067-a grave - yard and [he]682-the duke the ineffectual ghost of [its]2261-the city dead past . [He]682-the duke reached the gates and gave the watchword . The gates were guarded , as [he]682-the duke had been advised ; but [the captain of the watch]8068-the captain of the watch let [him]682-the duke pass without show of hesitation or curiosity . Though [he]682-the duke made no effort at disguise [he]682-the duke went forth unrecognised , and [the city]2261-the city closed [her]2261-the city doors on [him]682-the duke as carelessly as on [any passing wanderer]8070-any passing wanderer . Beyond the gates [a lad from [the ducal stables]8072-the ducal stables]8071-a lad from the ducal stables waited with a horse . [Odo]234-odo sprang into the saddle and rode on toward [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo . The darkness was growing thinner , and the meagre details of the landscape , with [its]2261-the city huddled [farm - houses and mulberry - orchards]8073-farm - houses and mulberry - orchards , began to define themselves as [he]234-odo advanced . To [his]234-odo left [the field]8074-the field stretched , grey and sodden ; ahead , on [his]234-odo right , hung the dark woods of [the ducal chase]8075-the ducal chase . Presently a bend of [the road]726-the road brought [him]234-odo within sight of [the keep of [Pontesordo]2-pontesordo]8077-the keep of pontesordo . [His]234-odo way led past [it]8077-the keep of pontesordo , toward [Valsecca]234-odo ; but some obscure instinct laid a detaining hand on [him]234-odo , and at [the cross - roads]8078-the cross - roads [he]234-odo bent to the right and rode across [the marshland]8079-the marshland to [the old manor - house]8080-the old manor - house . [The farmyard]719-the farmyard lay hushed and deserted . [The peasants who lived there]8082-the peasants who lived there would soon be afoot ; but for the moment [Odo]234-odo had the place to [himself]234-odo . [He]234-odo tethered [his]234-odo horse to a gate - post and walked across the rough cobble - stones to [the chapel]578-the chapel . [Its]578-the chapel floor was still heaped with farm - tools and dried vegetables , and in the dimness a heavier veil of dust seemed to obscure the painted walls . [Odo]234-odo advanced , picking [his]234-odo way among broken ploughshares and stacks of maize , till [he]234-odo stood near the old marble altar , with its sea - gods and [acanthus volutes]8084-acanthus volutes . [The place]1030-the place laid its tranquillising hush on [him]234-odo , and [he]234-odo knelt on the step beneath the altar . Something stirred in [him]234-odo as [he]234-odo knelt there -- a prayer , yet not a prayer -- a reaching out , obscure and inarticulate , toward all that had survived of [his]234-odo early hopes and faiths , a loosening of old founts of pity , a longing to be somehow , somewhere reunited to [his]234-odo old belief in life . How long [he]234-odo knelt [he]234-odo knew not ; but when [he]234-odo looked up [the chapel]578-the chapel was full of a pale light , and in the first shaft of the sunrise the face of [Saint Francis]239-saint francis shone out on [him]234-odo ... [He]234-odo went forth into the daybreak and rode away toward [Piedmont]60-piedmont . * * *
